4.review_text: The park is much simpler than the same park in California. However, the prices in this park are quite high. 76 Singapore dollars per adult (56usd). But to enter with such a ticket is tantamount to throwing away money. It is simply necessary to take a Fast Pass to visit the attractions without queuing, which costs another 80 spd (60usd). Otherwise, you will stand in line for an hour in the heat for each attraction, even if it is a weekday. It is advisable to be light, because you cannot even take your phone with you to many attractions. In some places there are free storage lockers for a short time, but many are paid. Food and souvenirs are much more expensive than in other places. But this place is certainly very beautiful and worth a visit.

It's impossible to leave the souvenir shops in each area. Magnetic souvenirs are graded to determine how much for three and how much for two, which leads to overconsumption. There's no magnet with just Shrek's face on it...

The rides are not from the last century, but even from the century before last, and after standing in line for an hour or more, it can close for an unknown reason because it is broken. There is only fast food, and the most expensive in the world, no choice, only chicken and incomprehensible potato balls. Everything is spicy, unacceptable for Europeans. I do not even consider local food like noodles. In 6 hours spent on this Sentosa we visited only 2 rides, and as I said earlier we left one because it was broken. Money wasted. One of the places you must visit in Singapore. The place is very beautiful, large, and provides luxury for all family members, from small to large. You can finish all games on the same day provided you have an Express Card with you. Its price is approximately 200 riyals, which means that with admission, it is 400 riyals per person. Possessing the card does not mean that you will enter the game at all times, but you will be transferred to a second queue that is shorter than the main one (it saves approximately half the waiting time). Some games are not worth the wait at all. The place is very hot and there are no air conditioners, fans or water sprinklers. Drinking water is available for free through taps, but unfortunately it is not cold (I am surprised, given the high cost of tickets, that there is no cold water), which is of course a way to force you to buy from the kiosks (whose prices are astronomical). Everything is overpriced (imagine a picture for 35). The biggest bad thing about it is that it closes completely at seven oclock (when the weather starts to get mild). In general, it is a must-visit place to complete your trip in Singapore.

I've been to this Universal Studios and the one in Australia. Disappointed that this one didn't have more rides, it felt like there wasn't much variety to choose from. Very small, was only there for 2-ish hours and shops are WAY too overpriced.

1.review_text: For the Transformers project, I queued for an hour and then the facility broke down and I had to go out to play other projects. The park only apologized verbally but did not compensate tourists for their sunk time cost! For the other three roller coasters, you have to rent lockers to store all your belongings before you can ride them. The price is SGD 4 per hour, which is a gangster charge! Other projects are either not fun at first glance, or they have to wait in a long line to enter and find that they are not fun at all...the food is also expensive and tastes terrible! Among the tourist attractions in Singapore, Universal Studios is the one with the lowest value for money and the worst experience; compared to famous amusement parks in other countries, it also ranks last! I am really disappointed and angry before I rate this. I hope it can be improved in the future, but I will never come again!

Theme park is too over rated in terms of price. It was highly crowdy and they should limit the number of customers to a capacity that they can manage. Vegeterian food is not easily available. I have visited at least 5-6 other theme parks. Other national and international theme parks are much more value for money.

5.review_text: Best place in Singapore. Food and beverages sold in the theme park are insanely overpriced though.

I'm thrilled to share a fantastic review of the 2023 Halloween Horror Night, now in its 11th year! This spine-tingling event features five haunted houses, each with its own unique theme. From the chilling "Weekend" with a clubbing vibe to the haunting "All of Us Dead" inspired by Netflix, and even a school-themed experience, there's something else for everyone to explore. In addition to the haunted houses, there are three scare zones that provide perfect opportunities for video capture. Explore the eerie Hindu and Chinese themes, and discover the mysterious XXX theme as shown in my video. For the regular admission (peak times), it's 89 dollar per person. But for an unforgettable experience, consider the Halloween Horror Night RIP Tour at 349 dollar per person. This VIP package includes fine dining, express access to all haunted houses and facilities, even the rollercoaster with unlimited rides! Moreover, you'll get the 6D photos printed during a private meet and greet with the selected ghosts, and a tour guide will accompany you for 3 hours, explaining all the chilling themes. With the RIP tour, you won't miss any haunted house, and you'll finish early, making it well worth it. I've already attended for 2 years! This year's Halloween Horror Night deserves a solid 4.5/5 rating. Don't miss this thrilling event it's a scream!

The price is 82 dollars. We took it from the hotel for 80 dollars, a small amount other than in America. The problem is that it is not worth the amount for those who take the Fast Pass, but when you are a family that is separated, if you are thinking about going, the weather must be clear. The second thing is to wait. May God help you with the smell of sweat because it is hot, and take the fast path.

3.review_text: Overrated and over priced in our opinion. While there is much to see, we truly did not feel that it was worth the price we paid. It's a relatively small place and if you are not someone who enjoys rides or shows, this would be a waste of time and money. The rollercoasters and rides we tried were good. We do recommend going for Transformers and Revenge of the Mummy. Please expect long wait times for most rides unless you have a express or unlimited pass, for which of course, you shell out more. The show at WaterWorld was the highlight of our trip to USS. Definitely one of the best, if not the only thing we felt was worth going for. The prices for food and drinks are simply exorbitant inside. So prepare accordingly. There are lockers conveniently provided outside every ride to keep your bags. We also recommend going on weekdays. Even though we went on a Monday, there was still quite a crowd. So weekends are likely to be worse. All in all, it is probably worth a one time visit to see what the fuss is all about, but it is unlikely we will return.
Not great, massively crowded and overpriced, poor food choices. Friendly staff however

Step 2 you will be advised to buy a raincoat for about 4-5 to avoid getting wet. If you still don't buy it, you will be wet after playing and there will be a drying service for 5. 2.review_text: Unfortunately I have to agree with the rather negative reviews. I expected more for the price of admission. As a family of three, we also paid another 121SPD entry fee for the aquarium and for the photo that you were allowed to take at the entrance (free), you would of course have paid 65SPD at the end of the tour, packaged as a souvenir. The aquarium was ok, I've seen bigger ones. The jellyfish were the most impressive thing for me. We would also have liked to visit Delphine Island, but we would have had to pay the entrance fee there too. All in all, in my opinion it wasn't worth the price we paid. I am very disappointed. The photos that can be seen in the reviews show pretty much the entire size of the park.

4.review_text: Spending 6 hours at Universal Studios in Singapore was an interesting experience. If you purchase the Express Pass for over 7 million VND, you wont need to wait in lines everywhere. However, if you opt for regular tickets, be prepared to queue for each ride, which can take anywhere from 20 to 50 minutes, sometimes even with 100 people ahead of you! The term rides here doesnt necessarily mean actual games; it often refers to attractions where you sit and enjoy the experience. Universal Studios offers various themed areas, including NYC, Transformers, Ancient Egypt, Jurassic Park, and Far Far Away (soon to have a Minion land). However, there arent too many games. If you visit, prioritize the Jurassic Park ride (remember to bring a raincoat from homeit costs 10,000 VNDbecause the 6 SGD per person fee here will leave you as wet as a soaked mouse! ). Next, try the Transformer ride (it felt so real that it made my heart skip a beat). Theres also an impressive show that recreates an action scene from JAWS, directed by Steven Spielberg. Its fantastic, although experiencing 2-3 scenes instead of just 1 would be even more satisfying! For younger visitors, the other attractions are more relaxed. Universal Studios has several roller coasters, but unfortunately, my digestion and heart arent up to the task, so I couldnt review them. Overall, the 1.4 million VND per person price tag for an experience comparable to what youd find in the United States didnt leave me completely satisfied. Id rate it a 7 out of 10. Heres hoping for a Disneyland visit someday to add to my reviews!
The food inside is really too expensive, and its really hot. There are few places to hide from the sun, and every ride has to wait for more than an hour.

3.review_text: All theme parks have an air that someone else is in control of your wallet, but this one feels particularly Iike you're being fleeced. It's overpriced for the number and length of the rides and impossible to enjoy without the express pass. The rides themselves are mostly entertaining, but extremely short. The park was also quite well managed with enthusiastic staff to help at every turn. Speaking of the express pass. We purchased ours in advance expecting to be able to take all rides using it. Unfortunately, the freshly opened Minions section of the park required yet another upgraded express pass on arrival. Looking at the attractions in that section, we decided we'd spent enough at this park. In addition to that, transport to the island is completely inadequate for the number of visitors. Given the cost of any of the attractions, I don't expect to be shoved into a two-car monorail and covered in the sweat of others before I even arrive. This needs a serious upgrade. Take a quick look at the Disney parks in Hong Kong or Tokyo for inspiration. The rides to those parks are comfortable and inspire you to have fun with its decor. This one just feels like it's squeezing your wallet open by packing you into the train. On a final note, the food was some of the best we've had at a theme park. Typically parks like these serve scraps at best, but it was actual restaurant food here. Well done on that!

3.review_text: We came all way here from New York to Singapore. Universal is known for its great rollercoasters and amazing entertainment. Unfortunately, Universal Singapore doesn't have enough rides or even shows to be entertained. There were a few rides out of comision which didn't help the lack of rides. That said, we did enjoy ourselves, but we wanted for more. We paid for express plus tickets at entry. Do not waste your time or money. We did not feel that it was worth it. The park was too short, and lines were short, and we found that we didn't really save time by getting in the express line.

Some of the rides were fantabulous especially Transformers, meet and greet sessions were real life experiences where small kids enjoyed it along with the adults. Every corner is filled with enormous joy and overwhelming experience which can be easily covered within a days time. You need to really eat well or might carry food before entering into the different zones of Universal Studio as food cost is on a higher end. Souvenirs, toys and other essentials are also expensive. Reaching Universal studio using Sentosa express is easier than a cable car, however if you would like to experience the cable car it is up to your budget.

1.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore has been facing growing criticism around value for money, especially when: 1. Ticket Prices Are High A one-day adult ticket can cost SGD 8298 (around USD 6072), and express passes add another SGD 40100. For that price, visitors expect more fully functioning attractions and smoother operations. 2. Multiple Ride Closures or Technical Issues Key attractions like WaterWorld and Amber Rock Climb are closed. Others like Transformers and Canopy Flyer have frequent delays or breakdowns. With only about 78 major rides, even 23 closed significantly reduces the value. 3. Food Is Exorbitantly Priced Basic vegetarian meals (like rice with vegetables or noodles) can cost SGD 1520 per person. Snacks like popcorn, ice cream, or drinks are overpriced, especially with no outside food allowed. Limited budget or vegetarian options add to the difficulty. 4. Comparisons with Other Parks Parks like Universal Studios Japan or Universal Orlando offer more attractions, better-maintained rides, and often better guest serviceat a similar or slightly higher cost. Even Disneyland Hong Kong or Legoland Malaysia are seen by some as better value, especially for families.

1.review_text: Very disappointing day today at Universal. Queued for 'The Mummy' for over 40 minutes only for it to develop a technical fault. We had the option to stay in line but they couldn't provide a timescale for the fix. We tried to go back later in the day but we heard an announcement from outside that there was a 'short delay due to a fault'. That was the same message we heard repeatedly in the morning which had turned into an extended delay. We tried 'Battlestar Galactica' but that was closed for the entire day due another fault. As a result the queues for the other major rides where in excess of 2 hours each. As a family we decided to try the queues as 'single riders', where available, in the hope of getting on quicker. For the Transformer 3D ride we were warned that we'd have to wait 30 minutes. It ended up being 55 minuted. As a result we only went on about 5-6 rides all day. I felt robbed given how much we'd paid to get in. It's easy to identify ways that this park could shorten the queues. An extra member of staff on each ride would make the changeover a lot quicker. Also on the drink stalls, my wife queued for 15 minutes to get a slush because there was 1 person taking the money and preparing the drinks. If one person sorted the payment and a 2nd person prepared the drinks the queues would be a fraction of the size. It annoys me that these places charge the earth and provide such poor service.

Very bad ... 80-90 min waiting for each main ride, no problem, but at 2 main rola coaster, we stood in line so long , and then due to some technical problem, they cancelled rides ... and when it stated working we stood again for same inline for 80-90 min ... problems happens , but then they shd have handed over have priority tickets to come again after some time to save time .... we spend 288 -- only tickets--- travelling, food extra , so almost 350- 400 and in whole day we were able to take only 2 rides .... one before lunch and one after lunch... bcos lunch also had 30 min que ... what a waste of money and time Dubai IMG is the best

Very small for a Universal park; only five main attractions, and two of them were closed, which was a huge letdown. This left the line for each of the remaining rides pushing past two hours each. Staff are not genuine and unhelpful. When asking which way an attraction is, staff pointed out over there, check the sign board instead of simply pointing which direction it would be in. Luckily, there are other things to do and see on Sentosa island, such as the cable car ride.

I don't share the enthusiasm of previous reviews. Very long queues (minimum 100 minutes for the main attractions, 30 for the games for the little ones) even to eat. I was there on a Monday, I can't imagine what happens at the weekend. The park is small and welcomes too many visitors. In my opinion absolutely not up to the standard of other international parks in the USA and Europe. The tallest roller coaster in the world? It doesn't seem like it to me... those from EuropaPark so what are they? If you read carefully, these are the tallest twin rollercoasters in the world, a category evidently invented specifically for this park given that it doesn't add an extra centimeter of fun. Go around Singapore and Sentosa for an extra day or if you really can't, arm yourself with a lot of patience and bring some good work for the wait or write the review like I'm doing...

Was extremely disappointed. Small park with few rides. Except for the Waterworld Show, the attractions are absolutely nothing special. Extremely long lines and waiting times that could be observed. Luckily we were spared this thanks to the Express Pass. For me it was a wasted day that could have been spent much better in this great city of Singapore.

2.review_text: Nobody wants to visit and wait 2 hrs in line for rides..they need to fix it ASAP...else people might stop visiting
Too crowded. Bad food. Very expensive. No single line to expedite the use of attractions. Express pass unaffordable. Crazy experience
Very bad experience. Had to wait 2-3 hours for the best rides. Twice the time that was written outside.

Its too small, and the rides are easily full. The queues for fun rides take more than an hour, and the park closes very early, so you cant play a few games. However, the exciting rides are regularly maintained, so you cant pass the level quickly and have no rights.
Some of the rides are closed due to technical problem, like transformers and many more

3.review_text: I hung up the express and went in. The most popular ride was the Transformers ride. The waiting time was 100 minutes. But when you ride it, its worse than you think. I'm so dizzy. I recommend riding MUMMY or another ride instead. And the food prices are quite expensive, so I recommend going out and eating and then coming back. One exit is free. I recommend going out to a dumpling place called Din Tai Fung.
Long queues at almost all popular attractions. Tip for first timers a - be there by opening time 10am. Run for your favourite show.
Very busy with queues for rides over 2 hours until about 6pm. Not a big enough park or enough rides for all the people. Improved in the evening when it got quieter

Not sure if it's because of the heat or the crowd, the service crews are rather impatient with the tourists. For a while I'm lucky to be local coz their attitude change rather drastically. The one we enjoyed most is the show at the lost world, they did a great job. And kudos to the mascots putting on the thick custom in such a weather!

The queue is too long and the time to play with the equipment is short. I queued for two and a half people. I only played for two minutes in an hour. Compared with other places I went before, the experience was really not that good.

4.review_text: We visited this place for the second time (the first time was 3 years ago) and this time the impressions were worse due to the huge number of people. Although we went on a weekday, apparently we ended up at some kind of holiday for the locals. I dont know how else to explain such a number of people. We really regretted that we did not take a priority pass (although 3 years ago it was not needed, there were almost no queues). During the day, at the peak of the influx of people, we were saved by a show, a 4D cartoon (in the Shrek zone). After 17.00 there were fewer people, the queues for the attractions decreased significantly and we were able to ride without a long wait.
Fantastic theme park in Singapore, super crowd in the weekend. I have to wait 3 hour just for The Lost World.
Lots of fun and thril. Crowded.. Should restrict entry as even express card takes waiting of 30 minutes. Normal queue waiting for certain rides was 2 hours plus.

You can expect great experience from a such a contemporary amusement park. Yet, the queue was devastating. Averagely 1 hour for every most famous rides such as Transformer, Revenge of the Mummy, Jurrasic Park Rapid Adventure. If you're willing to cut the queue, you need to buy USS express which is twice of your admission fare. OUTRAGEOUS!

Lines were very long in the morning, but were much better in the evening. We went on a weekday hoping that the crowds would be manageable, but with schools on vacation there were many young kids there. We didn't really watch any shows as we were in lines most of the time. The transformers ride, cylon and human rollercoasters were all excellent. Repeated those several times. Do not waste your time with the Madagascar ride. Boring.

5.review_text: Great theme park. Avoid going there on the weekends and try to go reach by 10am else you will have to wait in long queues.

Large theme park in Singapore. The place is so big and spacious that you get tired walking around there. Avoid coming here on weekends if you don't want to be queued for rides for hours. They sell express queues for extra dollars. Food here is relatively expensive. It's natural because this is a tourist location in Singapore. The Transformer ride is good, very suitable for bringing children and teenagers here. There are lots of places for instagrammable photo objects. Entrance ticket around 60sgd. Adults and children have different prices
One day is not enough to complete all the rides. You have to stand in long queues for each ride. Must visit.

Its an Universal studios and what more can i tell you about it. Let me try to explain it. It is theme park with plenty of dedicated ones like separate theme park for jurassic park, Madagascar, mummy returns, transformers, star wars, shrek. There are rides to experience every theme park. And the queue for each rides are really really long. There are three types of queues for each ride, single, family and express entry. Usually wait time for single rides are less compared to family rides. For express rides you have to buy a ticket which costs somehwhere around 80-100Singapore dollars. And wait time for express entry is somewhere from 15-20 mins for each rides.

It's a very enjoyable place for enjoy the movie in real life but there are several problems they are there is so many people and we have to wait lot a time and there is a vip group and other have to wait for them. However its the most enjoyable place in the Singapore therefor you have to get that experience whatever it cost if you went to Singapore.

1.review_text: Pretty disapointing experience... the queue was too slow in every game. Not like in United states. 1 hour and a half waiting to get into the atractions. We had to pay the double to get an express ticket an be able to move faster. Moreover, the park clossed 4 hours before, and we didn't get an explanation. Definitely I am not coming back!! Just a time waister. In Singapur they don't know how to do an amusement park.

4 hours one ride (includes 45 min que at food stall). They have no 'fair system' to manage VIP vs normal questions at rides. They simply let all VIP (fast track) on without allowing a few normal on the rides, so while waiting for the next vehicle to arrive, they simply fill it again with VIP. Poor show Universal! Also had to wait in a very slow moving que with my 2 year old, for a baby ride, yet the three were so many adults without kids in the que. Should have family dedicated rides only, poor show Universal!
Food and drinks are a complete ripoff! Way too crowded you waste soo much time waiting for a ride like 45 min each. We just gave up and walked away after about 3 rides.

2.review_text: Despite the fun rides and accommodations provided, the welcoming staffs are quite rude in terms of greeting customers and impatient. If you're tryna have a fun time at USS, you'll definitely start off moody cause of the welcoming staff. Very disappointed.

Huge crowds and the waiting time for rides was mentioned to be 70 minutes, or 150 minutes or 200 minutes. That was just ridiculous, so we left soon. Felt it was a waste, I wouldn't have gone had I known about waiting times.

In my opinion too much commercial with u.s movies, each atration was a kind of story of each movie. The waiting lines were absoutly insane. Even you can wait more than 2 hours. It should be regulated the number of persons to access per day. All decoration and shows were authentic and nice. The best thing was the transformers attraction. However we could only see 3 things due to the never ending lines... definitively someone should fix this. It cannot be that the client pay such huge amount of money for waiting 90% of the time and without the possibility to finish everything... its non sense
Few attractions that deserve attention. The settings are beautiful. Transformer and ancient Egypt above all. Long waiting queues. Entrance ticket is not worth what is available
Too much tiring... U will unnecessarily waste a lot time just by standing in queues. For a less than 2 min ride I ended up Waite for 2 hours...

3.review_text: Average park average rides. Paying for the brand more so than the rides and park. Think 3 rides were not working. Otherwise it's an alright experience. Moreso for kids and families opposed to thrill seekers.
Few thrilling rides. Unfriendly staff.
Not comparable to US site, not too many attractions, mostly the Rollercoasters and souvenir stores. Queue time for some are more than an hour (in the heat).
It's crowd every rides.It cost 60 mins of average rides.In the other side, many famous rides are broken.I don't understand why the theme park didn't pay any compensation.
Pay attention to the opening hours of the park Last time we went it was only open until 18:00 The popular rides inside take about 1.5 hours to queue up

4.review_text: Long queue , a lot of tourist cutting queue but the staff wasn't taking any serious action against it. Express pass was too expensive to purchase.
Due to the long wait time the working hours is too short. It's normal get 1-2 hours at each attraction.
You have to queue up for many rides during the holidays. Some lockers cost money. The park is quite small and not very big.
nice theme park but queuing too long

It is a good entertainment centre in Sentosa Island, Singapore. Make qulity time with your family or beloved one here. Complete. Many restaurants and cafes too around here. Ticketing counter should be enlarged and improved. Better to come in weekday, and since morning to get more pleasure. So crowded on the weekend.

5.review_text: Rides are awesome. 70 Second time but queue waiting for normal day pass is 45 minutes in weekend.
You have to come early in the morning to be able to enjoy all the rides... avoid the holiday season because it will be too busy and lengthen the queue for each ride...

Transformers was disappointing than I expected. But since people are going to ride it first, I recommend riding Transformer as soon as it opens. Then a roller coaster! In the case of CYLON, where you have to leave your luggage because people are crowded at the beginning due to the transformer, the waiting time is short (only at the beginning). If it rains, the service will be temporarily suspended, so I recommend getting on this as soon as possible! You also have to leave your luggage at Mummy, but in my case, I went to Transformer as soon as it opened and had to wait for about 30 minutes to ride it, and I boarded the roller coaster CYLON and Mummy in less than 10 minutes. After finishing the ride, I had a meal, but after eating, the waiting times for all the attractions became ridiculously long, perhaps because there were a lot of Chinese visitors. And there is time to take pictures with the characters in between, so make sure you line up quickly and take them haha. Even after a while, they stopped me from taking pictures.

We took the 10AM to 6PM ticket and the package includes a bus, a driver and a guide that will pick you up at the hotel and drop you back later. There's so many rides and if you go at the weekend or Malaysian public holidays, the queues could lasts up to 2 hours. The rides all are so fun and during the 8 hours there I could only go on about 3 rides and Underworld Live Show. I enjoyed all rides but my favourite would be the Transformer and it really doesn't matter if you take the single ride queue. Besides, it way faster.

I entered around 9/18 pm1:30. I was wondering what if I couldn't ride much because the wait was so bad. I didn't wait for a single thing and blamed all the rides 3:30 PM: Halfway through the map before watching the Water World Show. I watched the Water World Show and then watched the other half. The souvenir shops keep overlapping and it's just so-so. It was small compared to Osaka, good

1.review_text: A place for children, families, and couples to play. There is a lot of waiting even on weekdays. Not worth the price. Korean amusement parks are better. Totally not recommended for those who don't like amusement rides. It's a good thing that Universal Studios isn't built in Korea.

I can only say that this is an amusement park that is very discriminatory against Taiwanese people. Most shows ask visitors where they are from They only make fun of Taiwans country name I keep hearing Taiwan and Taitwo jokes over and over again Not funny at all While playing, you have to endure all kinds of strange body odors mixed with perfume from all directions. No wonder there are so few Taiwanese tourists here It seems that there is no shortage of Taiwanese business, so I dare to insult Taiwan. Its better to go to Japan and travel around the world!
The wait is horrible.. I've had better experiences... Minimum 1 hour wait for a 45 second ride...sometimes you may have to wait for 2 hours...
Not worth the money, not much attractions, long waiting times.

2.review_text: Very fun park, but staffs are very impatient, when asking them question, they just answered us like we should know the answer, and rude, saw a staff talk to an India tourist like almost scolding them as the tourist asking for how to unlock the lockers at the mummy ride, the staffs just shout at them.... please improve, cause it really killed mood when we trying to be happy, and someone showing attitube

It was good overall, but of course the queues can be quite long. The reason for a low review though is the locker situaron, particularly on the Battlestar ride. Every time I have ridden this, the free locker period has exceeded the advertised ride queue time by a good amount (20mins or so) and yet it's taken longer than this for me to get through the ride therefore making me liable for a 4 payment each time. The advertised ride queue times are clearly systematically low and I think the cost of the ticket is enough without being repeatedly made to pay for lockers due to what I would suggest is an error in their system.

Went to the Jurassic rapids adventure. After a long wait, just when we finally got onto the raft, we were told that there was some kind of malfunction and we had to get off. The staff there were not very helpful, we were simply told either you wait (they weren't able to tell you for how long) or you leave. We ended up waiting for 30 more minutes

Good rides but ridiculously busy on a Monday with ride queues 60-90 minutes. Would think that at some stage they'd cap the number of entries perhaps (full park?). Ruined it, will not return. 2 stars not at the ride quality but the inability to ride due to queues
Limited choice of riding and most staffs services are very bad

3.review_text: Typical theme park. Expensive and long queues.

Some of the rides were good fun such as transformers and galactica most of the others were tame in the extreme.we booked the tickets online with klook but if you can afford the extra dollars get the express lane ticket or you will spend most of your day stood in queues. We had lunch at jurrassic whatever it was and it was awful lollipop chicken a few potato wedges and fish balls for 30 dollars and if that wasnt bad enough 13 dollars for 2 bottles of water you gotta be kidding me

It is an interesting place with rides and shows. However it pales in comparison to Disneyland Paris. The lines for each of these rides seemed to take forever and I had to miss the most exciting ones because the lines never seem to end for these. It was really hot and sweaty in July. I think it would be a good idea to have sunshades near the rides. I did not find anything exceptional or unique here. Children would probably enjoy the stunt shows and the rides. Anyway it would be worth a visit when you are in Singapore especially if you have children.
Studio was fine. The queue tho, unbelievable. 2 hours average waiting for every horror house. Takes less than 10mins to finish.

Most of the rides are enjoyable but waiting times are 30mins on average. So you don't have a chance to cover all attractions in a day. Instead of going for all the rides, select a few important ones and stand in their queues only. Revenge of the mummy and Transformers rides are very very good. Shrek 4d show is most enjoyed by kids.

4.review_text: Lots of rides, staff are nice, the worse thing about this place is the line. The lines are absolutely ridiculous, without a skip the line pass, you are looking at an hour a ride.

Because it was a rainy day, there was less of a line than when I went before. It was well divided by theme, so there was a variety of things to see, but it may feel a bit disappointing for those who want extreme rides. Smoking areas/drinking fountains/restrooms are a bit worn out here and there, but there were no inconveniences in using them. On days when the weather is nice, it seems to be physically and mentally beneficial to buy an express ticket. Unlike in Korea, there is a mindset that if you pay a premium price, you will naturally receive preferential treatment. The taste of the restaurants here and there was average, and the facilities were also so-so. I think it's a place worth visiting at least once when you visit Singapore.

Awesome theme park, If you are only going for one day then fast passes are a must as some wait times for regular queues were 80 minutes. Fast pass 10 minutes tops ! Food and drink is the typical overpriced theme park variety with an asian twist. Street merchants take cash only so unless you want to queue in the restraunts dont forget to hit an atm. The transformers ride, jurassic park rapids and waterworld are highlights.

Visited on Sunday 10.7... It was good because it wasn't crowded as it was exam period in Singapore. I saw the Water World show twice. Transformer required. Madagascar disappointment. Other attractions were less than 30 minutes away, so I experienced them all without purchasing the express. If you leave at the 18:00 deadline, you will have a hard time because the line for the monorail will be long. I recommend getting out a little early.

Fun! Good experience there besides the long queue ( up to 2hours!) Even with the express pass the queue would still have been quite a long wait m expensive food so bring your own snacks The rides were enjoyable but do come early

5.review_text: If you come here, I recommend the premium one. If it's not premium, you'll end up queuing. The queue is really long, no matter what day it is, the queue is really long. Didn't even get it. You only get 4 rides a day because of queuing. Even though it's Monday
There will be a long Queue of min 1hour for getting into each ride

What a great experience with park. lot of funny and dangerous rides have. if you are planing to go to this place, please visit very early in the morning weekday. if you go weekends, there are lot of crowds and you have to waiting 1 or 2 hours in the ques. foods prices are little bit expensive and don't forget to bring a water bottle. it is also very expensive in the park. when you booked tickets via online, please print a copy of booking conformation. it is easy to check in to park.

Most of the attractions are rides. Best is transformers. Try to go for transformers either around 10am or after 4 pm. Never go after 10:30, there will be huge queue and need to stand around one hour in queue
Great experience... But it is better if the close time extend to 7.00pm - 7.30pm on weekend since we had to face long queue due to lot of people on weekend

1.review_text: I never had such disappointing experience in a theme park like universal studios Singapore. the attraction was good. but what destroyed all these was the WAIT TIME. To WAIT 90 to 120 minutes just for 2 minutes of fun is nonsense. The management should have crowd control and STOP issuing/selling tickets when the park is running full house. not to mention your rides closes at 6pm Sharp. there is simply not enough time to try it all. BTW, Halloween Nights 2018 was a REAL nightmare. The queue was scarier than anything else. thanks USS for the scary experience !
It's just disgusting how long it takes them to process a train. No comparison to Europa-Park . The attractions are okay. But the inefficiency of this park is really a no go

Lack of signages and info. They should close during rainy season. They let people buy ticket but prevent people from using all the outdoor games due to bad weather. End up visitors will stuck inside until closing time waiting for their luck for rain to stop. Should increase more indoor games for adult.
Overcrowded place. If you want to spend all day in hour queues to get to poor rides and pay money for that, come here.

We are still waiting for TRANSFORMERS show for last two and half house - from 10. 45 am. They only announce LITTLE delay but don't mention how long it will take. This is not first time as my friend also had same issues few days back. We just had 2 rides so far and entire studio needs to be covered in barely 4 hours only. They deliberately do it so that tourists don't get time to complete the entire studies. Hence spend Amount again to revisit Very cheap mentality. Not worth giving any ratings.

2.review_text: My visit in USS wasnt the best. Waiting in Transformers line for about 1h, to find out that there was a technical issue. Had to quit the line from emergency exit. Not only the Transformers, Galactica, and the Lost World was also under maintenance. I spent about 2h in total waiting for nothing! The place is also not really big, not worth the entrance ticket price.
Long lines , its consume your time and only until 6pm. Be able to avail express lane you need to pay more. Other Parks are better thank this, ist not worth the hype.
Closing time 6pm is too early.. Reason: - long queue - other theme park close at 8pm with very good closing ceremony (fire work) and also excelebt parade
too many people....have to wait hours for one ride
Too many people during summer months. Lack of attractions

3.review_text: Long queues and quite small with very little to offer outside of the rides :( 210 minute wait for a ride is seriously not worth the time when you can do other things. Pay the extra money for skip the queues!
general is ok, but queue too long around 45 minutes above for roller coaster......

The first few times when going on a normal day is fine, but after awhile the attractions will start to feel boring. During HHN, there isn't any proper queue, so some people cut the queue when trying to merge queue, which in turn causes a larger human traffic jam.
Decent rides and attractions. Avoid this place on weekends as it is extremely crowded. You may be in queue for upto 1hr for every attraction.
Waiting times for rides and rides need to be longer

4.review_text: Went there for my brother's company event in a rainy evening. Most of the food stalls weren't open, thus there's very long queue everywhere in those food stalls that opened. Not sure if it's only like this for that day or what... but I'd suggest people who like to visit USS in the evening to take their dinner elsewhere before going... The rides were fun, thus I didn't take that many photos... probably some rides should clean up abit. Some rides (the holding part) are sticky! And some less popular rides have dust.. Other than that, I highly recommend people to go there and have fun!!! )

The experience is obviously amazing, but certain things are there that they can improve like the huge queues for rides which take up all the time! And if you are closing earlier than usual time for any reason, please compensate for that.

It's a fun place but the staff that handle the guest need to be trained better. They seems grumpy and not as friendly as USLA or USFL. Even the stuff in US Japan, they are better trained than the one in Singapore. USS staff act like they are working at MRT or some busy public transport place. I've seen MRT staff a lot friendlier than some in USS. It's a shame

My second visit to USS wasn't as nice as the first one. Very long queue from 40 mins until 95mins in most rides (I came on monday, non holiday) And while waiting in line, there were some major problem in transformers ride (happened twice) so we had to deal with some extra delays while waiting in line. And it was raining, so they closed most rides. But, all in all. I would still go there again. Mummy rides is the best!!! PS: bring changing clothes / a good rain poncho / small umbrella with you, some rides are definitely gonna make you wet.

Coooooooool place! Pay an extra 40 for an express ticket to avoid the long queues of up to and over an hour. Also eat outside at the various food outlets and resturants. The food at USS is attrocious.

5.review_text: We really enjoyed our time in there.Try to get there early ib the morning and dont waste watch sesame street and Madagascar trips.Nothings wrongs with those shows.but other shows are much more exciting and the time is limited because of the long queues
Great rides.. The long queues spoil the fun sometimes.. So, depends on your luck if it is 4star or 5star experience for you...
Too expensive for one day. You can never enjoy all the rides in one day. Too long queues. Waiting time is usually an hour and rides last just 4/5 minutes. Too bad and too commercial

Out of all the awesome experiences you can get, here's something all the visitors need to be careful. When you want to ride the extreme roller coasters, the staff will push you to leave all your belongings including cash on free lockers given. On busy days unless you have an express pass (50-75 SGD extra), waiting time will be more than 45 mins. By the time you return to lockers, the free time will be exceeded and you will have no money to pay for lockers. While you're going behind few available monitoring staff to open lockers manually, the time will continue and you'll end up paying more. So when you're keeping your belongings on lockers, remember to keep some changes with you to pay for lockers.
Nice park with long queues

1.review_text: Most pathetic park ever seen. I do appreciate the rides and the ambience but the staff is just lathargic very slow. Person spends around 75 SGD and then he gets a wait time of minimun 60 min to 85 min per ride. So irrespective of what u r offering but you have to wait so long for each ride. Most pathetic experience and lack of management. Staff or crew at each ride is just slowest in the world. I will never visit the place again
Poor service rendered by staff at the snack store near waterworld and jurrasic park. Poor attitude and still want challenge me. Very arrogant attitude and not the right place for him to work there.
No water rides, long waiting times if holidays. Suggested to buy universal express
Too much crowded.... waiting time for ride 120 mins ...
tremendous waiting times, inefficient handling ! As long this does not change we can definetely not recommend to spend time and money there.

2.review_text: Its a lovely place to go with your kids. But not in the high season (holiday season) coz its crowded and the queueing is killing you and your kids. If you are not singaporean who is used to queue, you better buy the vip ticket so that you wont have to queue that long (but you make others grumble in their heart) I dont know why but everytime i go here all the resto n food court is always full and you have to queue again and again. Kids wont have that patient. Its oke for me to queue to play, but dont make us queue that long just for coffee or drinks! Universal should put more people when a holiday. We want to have fun, not to queue all day long!
Waiting time is not good. 1hr to 2hr. 30mins minimum waiting time for a ride.
Too many people and not enough rides... LA is better. All rides also close during the pretty regular storms
Service is very slow.
Long queues, expensive and bland hotdogs, waste of time.

3.review_text: Rides are good. We had time wastage after waiting on long queues; due certain rides closed down suddenly due to technical problems. Outdoor rides were closed at sight of rain clouds!
Poor management of immediate problems In the case of broken equipment, long queues, and lockers

It's a medium sized park that can be covered in a day. The place is very crowded and you have to spend a lot of time waiting for each ride. A lot of effort is spent either waiting in queues or walking to the next location. There are lot many food options available. I would suggest people to have a good look at the map and identify priority of rides that have to be taken.

Waiting time far too long at attractions and fairly limited commercial practices (locker rental obligatory due to the impossibility of taking bags with you). Furthermore, the express pass costs between 110 and 140 more for the queue skipper... Quite a deterrent. In short, there are much better elsewhere...

Small park. Most of the rides have long queue and extremely hot having kid waiting in the outdoor. If you have never been to Universal Studio this is a place worth to take a look other then that it's just a typical tourist spot if you visit Singapore.

4.review_text: Thoroughly enjoyed the rides, Need to shortlist the rides upfront to maximize the coverage of the various rides . Long queues are a dampner especially due to the humid weather of Singapore

Went for HHN2018. It was amazing except for the queue. I went in expecting long queues, which i'm fine with. But the lack of ventilation was horrible, causing the place to be extremely humid. And the 5 retail voucher was too restrictive. We ended up not using it and having it go to waste.
One of the best places to be in Singapore.....but only hated the long queues in almost all the rides

I was there on Saturday, thinking that the park would close at 18:00. I arrived at 9:45 and there was already a line to enter. It turned out that the park closes the entrance at 18:00 and everything is open until 22:00. If I had known I would have arrived at 16-17 o'clock. After 18, all the slides are almost without queues. Only a fool would buy a ticket with skip-the-line access. There are rides for some rides, but all of these rides have 3 entrances. Regular, express for suckers who paid more and for one person. So, even if you come with a group, you approach the entrance one by one and walk through as if on an express train. But even standing in line, I rode all the rides until 18:00. Also, if it rains, all outdoor attractions are closed.
There is just plentiful rides and many exciting activites. 3 problems:many people and long queues,ExPeNsIvE prices,and the wifi is dead. It is still very good

5.review_text: Enjoyable but not a good idea to visit during the holidays. All the rides had at least 1 hour queue times and some had tech difficulties halfway which caused disappointment. Only managed to take 3 rides in the end. Do plan on visiting the park at least twice to enjoy all the attractions during the holiday period.
Awesome thrilling rides and long long queue for each ride :(

The place is not big, and the queue for each item only lasts about 20 minutes on non-working days. The roller coasters (two types, Mecha Sentai and Human Sentai), Transformers, and the Future Water World show are the most recommended and must be experienced.

Best to enjoy it during late afternoon until before they close on weekdays! We went on Friday and queue was heavy until around 4PM. After that, most people are gone and waiting time for the rides are just 5-15 mins.

Universal studios without express pass is cumbersome. Staying in line is a waste of time. Do not buy candies from there, they are expensive. Toys are also expensive but it's upto you. Can't buy same toys from anywhere what in Singapore outside universal studios

1.review_text: The water show is quite good. The queue notice is 50 minutes. Waiting for two hours is a minute of fun. Its very helpless.

Worst Universal Studios ever The queue is marked with 5 points or 15 points The actual queue was over 1 hour Then add the locker fee Standard fraud group There is a huge difference compared to the United States and Japan.
It is a theme park and name doesn't matter. It is a total disappointment. Rides aren't unique. You can go to any amusement park in India to enjoy these rides

The future water world was closed, the special effects of the movie broke down halfway, and the treasure exploration also encountered a glitch for 10 minutes. It is recommended to come in the afternoon as the waiting time in line will be much shorter.
Queues too long and got food poisoning

2.review_text: It's no Disneyland. Perhaps other Universals globally may be better. Food overpriced as expected; staff fall into one of 2 categories - upbeat and happy to see you or have an extremely apathetic attitude, no in between; shows are hit or miss (as are rides); gift store staff are rude.

We were only able to do 2 major attractions and 4 smaller attractions due to excessively long wait times. It seems you are penalized for not upgrading to an express ticket. For every 8 express riders, they allow 1 regular ticket holder. Which means at least a 2 hour wait! Then to top it off you must rent single use lockers for your personal belongings in order to ride. :(

Queues are incredibly long. And if you want to cut them you have to pay the express ticket, that costs double the already hefty price. You have to have a lot of patience for a couple of rides. I don't recommend it

Cyborg and transformer rides the standout rides but set off against poor estimates on ride wait times (one ride advised a 30 minute wait which ended up being 70 minutes) and some very average rides. Express queues at times can be very long which somewhat negates the point and also means the non express queue does not move for prolonged spells.

Big, beautiful... But unlivable. Kilometer-long queues lasting even over an hour for each attraction, 4D cinema, or carousel which instead lasts a few minutes. Specifically, a queue lasting an hour and a half at the Transformers which wasn't even signposted at the entrance, so you stay in the big snake inside the building for 90/100 minutes stuck together with other people.

3.review_text: To be honest, I'm a little disappointed. It feels a bit worse than Japan. There are not many small hardware facilities in the park and there is no excitement. There are quite a few kindergarten-level ones. There are really no facilities that should impress me. I don't think the service attitude is very good. Although many of them can communicate in Chinese, they don't smile much and their answers are not very patient. I also feel that the staff's adaptability (or work attitude) is not up to par. I queued for nearly 90 minutes for Transformers and when I got there (about 10 people left in front), I had already seen the car. At this time, the facility actually broke down (sorry)! The announcement kept saying that they didn't know when it would be repaired, so I had to wait for nearly 30 minutes. During this period, a bunch of impatient customers kept trying to leave from the back, but the staff on the scene didn't know where to go, causing the scene to be chaotic. This made people have a bad impression and really needs to be improved.
Almost one hour queue time for few minutes of fun. It was a fun experience overall but most probably will never visit again due to the expensive entrance fees and long waiting time

Sure the rides are mostly fun but unsurprisingly, its extremely crowded with some ride queues lasting up to an hour. The toilets were decent and food at the retro americas restaurant were just ok relative to price. I really like the transformers ride and my sisters and parents really enjoyed the mummy one. But seriously if not for the queues you will be able to finish the place in less than half a day.

Nice place, the rides are great, especially Transformers. BUT the Express entry needs a better system, it's prone to human error where the gatekeeper at the top of the queue line could neglect to re-check the visitors' Express Pass. I saw a family of four jumped the fence into the express line right in front of me but got away with it because the gatekeeper didn't ask for their Express Pass, but then he asked for ours and the people behind us.

Nice place with few fun rides, waiting time can get to 90 mins for one ride, but if you buy an express ticket you skip the queue, really? All people should queue up at the same queue universal studio instead of trying to make more money by letting people buy the express ticket!!!

4.review_text: The rides are interesting. Most of the staffs are not very friendly. The queues were quite long without buying the express pass. The foods were so-so. Not reccommended going during weekend or holidays.
There are long queues for each facility. It is recommended to buy a fast-pass ticket. The one with SGD 70 is very useful.

This is a nice place for all the elders... I wish they had few more for kids below 4 years... One thing I never understood is the announcement they make in the mike, it's never clear. Is it the speaker problem it is it a generic accent problem. The staff are generally very friendly, but the moment there is a issue and you try to talk to them, I feel they being a bit rude. For example. I had a express pass and during one of the ride, the ride was cancelled and so as a compensation they gave everyone a free express pass for one of the ride. I explained that I already have a Express pass, so give me probably a good coupon. The staff told me.. "Just take it or leave it and keep going" There were other similar incidents also. But not interested to discuss further. In overall the rides are good enjoy, if we ignore such incidents
Queues are longer ..1 hour wait time for most of the rides
It's a good tourist spot. Need lot of time to cover everything peacefully. One full day wasn't sufficient as waiting time for various rides itself consumes so much time.

5.review_text: Very nice place to have a fun. But too much rush when we visited in end of December. We missed many attractions due to lengthy queues. We had spent more than 2hrs in the queue at water boat in Jurassic park. Authorities must do some easy arrangements even for normal ticketed customers too.
USS Singapore - everyone visits this place and queues can get really long and you may sometimes need to wait an hour for your turn, depending on time of visit and choice of ride.

The theme park was world class standard. Totally worth the money and time. Outside food is not allowed and everything sold inside is double the cost. Waiting time for each ride was like 1-2hours even on a weekday.

One of the must visit places in Singapore, many rides to enthrall, Transformers, Egypt and roller coasters are not be missed, it can get very crowded in the vacations season when one may spend more time in the queues than enjoying the rides
Queues can be super long but a great selection of rides and attractions. If you stay into the evening the crowds die away and the queues lessen considerably

1.review_text: They should only allow a certain amout of people to enter the park. The lines were too long. Regular lines had a 2 hour wait, even the express line had a 40 minute wait. The tranformer ride wasn't working and it cost between 100 to 140 singapore dollars for an express pass. It's daylight robbery.

Very poorly managed system. Tourists pay 79/day for their precious time, yet the waiting times are around 40-70 minutes for attractions. Despite this high daily rate, day visitors are not given priority service (annual unlimited pass is around 150). The attitude is "You're here for one day. Who cares about you. You won't come here again anyway."
worst amusement park in the world. shows are good as other universal studios. ineffiecient operation and rude and insincere staffs. mad at making money and not consider to make this better.
Super long queues not worth that kind of money
Overcrowded and long waiting times of up to 1.5 hours per ride.

2.review_text: We probably came at a bad day but the lines are horrendous! It took us 90min to 2hrs to get to most rides!
Too many people and the waiting time is quite long. Not suitable for children as well. Disappointing.
It says 50min for a ride but we waited nearly 2 hours for the transformer rides, the Q is much longer than u think.
Less good than europapark in Europe and smaller

3.review_text: The experience would be successful if you didn't have to wait 60 to 80 minutes for the major attractions (which are rather very successful)! Time difficult to explain when seeing the waiting space occupied at 20-30% or even less!!! Time worsened by the extreme nonchalance of the staff who take their time and poorly manage the express line which annoys even more (or how to exasperate 99% of customers who have not opted for an Express Pass at a prohibitive price of 90-120 dollars! ) . Here too the commercial policy is more than doubtful and ineffective. As if by miracle, the addition of car in the roller coasters reduces the waiting time, but very late in the day! It is therefore either incompetence or deliberate will. In both cases this makes the experience execrable. The lockers are free for a period that depends on the waiting time for each attraction and that's the good news. In the end, a nice and successful park but ruined by particularly incompetent operating and sales staff!

We went on a Monday. Lines were still long. Lots of Mainland China & Indian subcontinent tourists who doesn't understand English nor care for rules. Rides were good when they are open however the queue estimates were way off. Battlestar line sign said 20minutes but it was more like 60 minutes. The jurassic flyer said 50 minutes but it was only 20 minutes wait. Overall kids had fun. Food was exorbitant and everyone had a great time.

Lots of waiting time. Locker must for few rides. Locker free for 50 mins but when you overshoot time the cost is exponential. I shot 40 min over free time as the ride took 90 min and I ended up paying 8 for that. Its a trap.1 desirable ride roller coster was shut due to technical reasons . Require lots of walking. Food is very expensive if you are an Indian .
Quite crowded and hot. Need to improve the cooling system. Advice is to buy express ticket to play. Long queue will make you tired

I had pretty high expectations of the theme park, unfortunately it doesn't come close to the theme parks in Germany. The gray roller coaster was the best thing about the park. It's a shame that you're not allowed to take your backpack in anywhere. You have to pay extra for lockers. What's the problem with simply putting the backpacks next to the glasses/shoes rack? The park is more for kids than for people looking for adrenaline. But the ambience was beautiful!

4.review_text: Love the theme park but i wish there would be more staff available. There were some chinese tourists cutting the line and the staff do nothing about it because they were too busy to take care of the line. The toilet smell bad with tons of tourists visiting the theme park. Also, when we purchased the express card for all the rides, the staff actually gave us the single ride card instead which was the waste of time. Other than that, the theme park itself was good with the mostly good queue system.
Good park. Queues on some attractions too long

Theme park is nice, what you would expect but the website is horrible. Expect to wrestle with the 1990s online forms for a good 20 minutes before you (maybe) get tickets which you are told to print out as hard copies to present at the entrance. Because tourists always carry printers with them. You don't need hard copies. Wait times at the park are 120 minutes for some rides which seems crazy long, and often there are events or parades that suddenly start without any warning that you are likely to miss. There does not seem to be a central timetable of events for each day. If you miss the great Waterworld show you have wasted your trip; cancel your holidays immediately and return home.

I went on Monday because I thought there would be fewer people, but there were still a lot of people. I recommend that you ride the attractions during lunch time (11:5013:30) and around closing time (17:0018:40) and spend the rest of the time shopping or enjoying parades and other attractions. Even if there are a lot of people, it gets a little quiet around the above times. I'm a complete coward, but I enjoyed riding all the Singapore Universal attractions.

Major attraction in Singapore . Need a full day to enjoy. If you wish to do Aquarium same day then reach at 10 am & leave by 3 pm latest. Long queues & consumes 60-75 minute per ride. Express is expensive but worth if want to avoid queue. Need to rent lockers for many rides so go empty hands. Lockers are free for 50 minute then charged exorbitantly. So beware. Must do Transformer ride, Galactica & airway ride. Book tickets on Klook app for good discounts . Food is expensive

5.review_text: No words needed! Definitely visit when you come to Singapore! In my case, the roller coaster CYLON underwent maintenance for a long time, so the waiting time was long. Because there are a lot of people, the express is a must, and you have to pay attention to the free time to find the locker. If you are even a little late, you will have to pay, so be sure to take a few 2 bills or a credit card with you when you pack your luggage.

First of all, I have to compare it with USJ. Incomparable waiting time Although it was a weekday, it was during Lunar New Year, so I was worried, but after experiencing the ridiculous wait time at USJ, I guess I don't need the Express. I felt that. Well, it would probably be smoother if that were the case. Also, the site area is small and there aren't many attractions, but I personally prefer the USS because you can roam around leisurely.
Great park, lots of nice roller coasters, ok gastronomy, long queues, the best place in Singapore

Great place. Lots of rides. Best to arrive at opening to avoid waiting for all the rides. Rides for all ages. Good information available. Lots of food outlets and drinks stalls. Can do the whole park in a day. Easy to get to by taxi, cable car, mono rail or walk from mrt. Well signposted. A great experience for children. If it rains there are plenty of sheltered areas, rides may close but soon open after. The waiting time on rides is displayed in lots of areas and particularly well at start of wait. Hotels there also.
Great theme park but if possible avoid going during peak season as the long queue can go up to 120 minutes per ride!

1.review_text: Great attraction centers. But the staff in the most of the places (Sesame Street attraction, Sci fi city roller coaster Gate keeper, Ancient Egypt photography lady _ all Singaporeans) were super rude, impolite and ill-mannered. They need a training in how to interact with their customers. It's only Singapore where I came across such indecent staff even after paying a great cost!

Well, it is worst managed universal studios. A very tourist place. Long queues everywhere. When i say long, it is really long, upto 2 hours for some rides. And there is no place to sit while u wait. U ll have to keep standing for 2 hours for every other ride. It is a very compact place. I would say tourists to stay away from this if u hv already been to other theme park.

Our experience was quite disappointing. To begin with, the price for an adult ticket -74 is too expensive simply because not all the rides are made for adult. There was nothing an adult could do in Hollywood, Madagascar or New York.. that leaves us with just a few more parks to go and not all has exhilarating outdoor rides, some just have boring indoor rides, only parent with kids would go there. To top it up it was raining and due to the lightning alert, they closed the outdoor rides from 3pm to 5.30pm. The entire place shuts at 7pm which gave us less time to complete our outdoor rides. And when the rides finally opened up, of course everyone rushed to the queue, we waited 40 minutes for each ride and only managed 2 roller coaster rides. I think when such safety hazards surface (which is of course out of their hands) its only fair that they allow an extra hour for the park to be open, for us who paid full fare to at least make use of the ticket and have a good experience. Also, the staff were completely uninterested from the entrance onwards. A fun park is usually expected to have some motivation, fun faces, fun pitch intonations, enthusiastic participation etc..to create a hype among the visitors there.. but most of them were just mundane, bored with their job, not even a hi when we entered a ride. I could count the numbers of staff who were enthusiastic and sadly that was only about 10%. Its a shame that Universal Studio Singapore doesnt stand up to other Universal Studios around the world, and its one of the most global countries in South East Asia.
I don't like it very much. The weather is hot. Almost every ride is broken. Waiting in line for 3 hours. Finally, the announcement said that the ride was broken.....Ocean Park in Hong Kong is better.

2.review_text: The staff here is very arrogant. I was doing Rock climbing on artificial wall (dinosaur)and The staff person spoke very rudely to me for no reason. Other than that my experience was good. But please value your paying customers. There was just too much crowd.
NBC needs to revisit their theme park. This theme park is about to go bankrupt with IPs that don't resonate with the audience anymore.
Too little variety of attractions rides get reslly boring after a while

3.review_text: I went there for an attraction that USJ doesn't have, but due to a system glitch I had to wait about 2 hours before I finally got to ride it. The displays in the aisles were also covered in dust, making me keenly aware of the difference from Japan. There were also people doing business in the aisle, and I was slightly dizzy... The two roller coaster attractions didn't work, so I just went to Transformers and Starbucks... Too bad(_)
Very huge park can't covered due to rush and Many rides not working with lable of Technical issue by Ride captain

Attractions are short and sometimes not interesting, distribution of people is not smart, sometimes the boats starts with 3-4 free places when people are waiting for it 20 min in a queque. Disneyland is much better!

Super super crowded. Extreme hot weather and have to stand in the queue. If u need to skip the queue in most of the rides buy express pass. Drinking water facility available inside. Get ur own bottle n keep refilling wherever I see water dispenser because we feel totally dehydrated. If u have young children not much rides to enjoy. Check height requirement online in universal studios Singapore website. Transformers ride was the best. Get a stroller if u have young kids. It's very difficult for them to walk. Lights camera action show was excellent.
On weekdays, the crowds are okay, and the ticket price is okay. For must-see rides, it is recommended to buy express passes, otherwise the queue time will be about an hour.

4.review_text: As a Singaporean, I've only been here 3 -4 times. As the rides are always the same, honestly, after you've been here before and played all of it, it gets old. Unlike USJ, we do not have any interesting themes introduced to the attractions. The only time USS has events is during halloween. And the first halloween event i went to was mainly queuing queuing and more queuing. Understandably, it was the first halloween event so there's definitely more people who are curious bout it and hence the queue lines exploded. (I have never went back for the halloween events so I can't review anythin bout that) However, I guess it's also because there's no new rides, so when you re-visit the park (off- peak days) to maybe show some foreign friends around, the wait time can be really short or even no wait time. Food is definitely way overpriced. I ate at JP's discovery restaurant, every item on the menu were 13 (Fish bee hoon soup, chicken rice, 8 piece chicken drum sticks and fish bites..if my memory serves me) Sodas were 5 each. Kid's meal was 14. So yea, I would recommend to eat outside if you can because the food was just mediocre. Overall, it's still one attraction that's worth visiting once in a while..

My friend had a problem with the many thrilling rides, but I enjoyed it. The reviews said it was empty, but the wait time was quite long, and although I was able to ride most of the thrilling rides, I wasn't able to ride all of them. I waited for an hour and a half on the way, but the ride stopped working due to some trouble.After waiting without any announcements, I decided to give up (crying). I realized that I should not compare the service with Japan.

Much smaller than the original, perhaps it suffers from some rides, the lines are long as in Orlando, there is not much to order in terms of food, it is more focused on Asian tourism but the locations are full of places for photographs. You must go early to cover everything

My advice, before coming here, have breakfast and eat enough so you don't catch a cold while playing the rides hehe. It's really a bit more extreme than the theme park next door. The atmosphere at the arena is exciting and the traffic is really bad (even though I didn't go there on a weekend), maybe for those on a budget it's better to use the fast track to save time. The food and drinks are also varied. The souvenir prices are also reasonable. Don't forget to take photos with the characters.

Visit on 30 Mar. All ok and enjoyed the rides. Except the last minute Hollywood dream parade 7.30pm cancelled. Everyone had gathered and anxiously waiting only to be told event is delayed. Then 10 min later was told by the staff event cancelled.

5.review_text: An interesting amusement park, although there are long queues for the rides. It is better to visit on weekdays; on weekends there are a lot of people. It is better to order tickets online to avoid standing in line at the box office. There are smoking areas. The prices in the cafe are very high.

Worth giving a visit. Some ride are too good but other are very bad. To take a ride of 2 minutes, it take 40 to 50 mins to stand in a queue. One time visit is must but not the place to be viisted again.
Family favorite place, spacious, lots of attractions but if it's busy the queues are terrible.....

Very tiring but a must visit. Must buy express pass otherwise it will be devastating because waiting times are sometimes more than 120 mins. Must do transformers, cyclone vs human and revenge of mummy.
Everything is Good except the USS Ticket Prices... Food inside the theme park not so cheap... You cannot bring food from outside except you have babies...

1.review_text: Overcrowded, for one ride one has to wait for 95 minute's, apart from that Express entry was also taking 45 min waiting time. It was just a tag universal studio. Else whole universe was there. Overcrowded overwhelmed, just wasted money and TIME.

Its just full of shops and restaurants and few 2 minute rides. And it's such a huge queue for all those 2 minute rides, if you go there on a busy day, you just can't see everyone of them. We couldn't complete all the rides and shows even though we went there on Monday. It's just too costly for very little entertainment. It's just fantastically built, you could very well use the money and time to visit many other attractions at Sentosa island. The staffs are very poor, they are too slow and really don't care about the people visiting this place. Everywhere else in Singapore, I only had met courteous staff. Btw... The water world stunt show was fantastic.
Too many rides that had system issues. Resulting in long ques of 1-2hrs.
28 attractions seems to be impossible to accomplish for 1 day visit.each attraction had 150 mins or more waiting time. Spent the whole day for just 3 - 4 attraction

Underwhelming at best! Maybe a great place for people with children but not the case for people looking for some adrenalin rush. Of all the rides, we found only three to be worthwhile. So we paid for Express Tickets for three people and only rode on three rides and left! Had I known that the place has only three worthwhile rides, I would have given it a miss . The Express queue is hardly express. We had to wait 40 minutes per ride even in the Express Queue .Overall experience left much to be desired for, I certainly felt it was a waste of a day and my . I would not go back...or recommend it to people who are looking for slightly more exciting experiences and turbulent rides.

2.review_text: We visited on sunday, and many of the attraction got sudden closed. Never informed visitor what to will re-open. So we have to keep checking them. Tiring and not happy.
Few attractions and long queues. Small compared to other Universal parks
This is a con game... waiting 1hour for every ride. The only reason to go is to see the joy on our children's face.

It is possible, but only with a quick pass. Relatively few attractions and many (too many) people. If you wait the whole dinner for 5 seconds of anything, it's a patience simulator (try the waiting room at the dentist). At some of the attractions, you could almost finish watching the movie, Krery inspired the attraction. At least you can practice the bars, there's plenty of time for that
Rip off City, get the speedy entrance ticket or wait around all day for rides.

3.review_text: The place is good rides like transformers and cyclone are value for money but they have very poor transport. There is a long line for entry as well as exit (santosa express).Monorail has only 2 coaches. By this time they should have increased them by now. Weekdays Park closes at 7pm that should have been increased by 2hrs. If you have a choice go for Disney land. It's a much better experience.

This is an excellent place to spend the full day. However it falls short on account of management/administration. The wait times for every ride are painfully long. If you have to wait 40-50 min for each ride, you can hardly take 3-4 rides in 3 hours. The staff on the rides are super slow and don't bother too much about the long que of people waiting. The only way to get the best experience is to get the express pass.

A mixed bag really. Most of the rides had long waiting times so we didn't bother going on them. I'm not sure what it was called but the theme was simulating a hurricane. We queued for 30 mins for the 2 minute experience.. Same for waltzes. Queued for 30 mins for a 1 minute 40 secs ride. Madagascar was just as disappointing. Don't get me started on the Donkey (shrek) show which was cringeworthy. The 4d Shrek story was very good. Overall USS failed to deliver on what i expected
Great park in the past but need serious shake up now - needs to brush up and change attractions, is getting old. Not happy of the overpriced low quality food choices (even by theme park standards).

Like many other posts here on yelp...if you have been to a universal studios anywhere else in the world this one will feel small and cramped to you. Overall it's a fun day, but the lines were absolutely awful...and I was there at opening on a Wednesday. The express pass would have been amazing to have...expect they wanted 160SPD for each one (family of 4, that's 640 dollars!!!!). Get f****g real. I could go on a week vacation for the price of that. And without the pass every single ride was an hour all the way up to 2 hours waiting time. Absolutely terrible to wait in line for that long for every ride. We were there 10 hours and got about 10 rides in, and 3 of them came in the last 30 minutes where there was zero wait time. Overall I was disappointed in the park, it's too small and the price of the express pass is absolutely unreasonable.

4.review_text: As usual, lots of people, lines to attraction are minimum 30 minutes even to the easiest ones. Better buy tickets for priority lane.
Nice place, but some rides were cancelled for safety reason, we understand this but still frustrating for someone miles away from Singapore ;)
Good, cool place, but the queue is quite bad

It's a good theme park. The right size for one day fun. I do recommend express pass especially if coming on a busy seasons. I did find 3 big rides closed temporarily which seems "technical" problems are common. It kind of ruins your flow as you have to walk back and forth.

Nice attractions and shows. On a weekday was not too crowded and I also went right from the start. If you are a solo traveler many attractions allow you to skip the queue. Rollercoasters were ok, but I've been to faster ones in other amusement parks.

5.review_text: Nice theme park, but why is everyday always crowded with people ? I visited it on tuesday but it felt like its saturday or sunday, very crowded and long long queue

Nice place to have fun with the family. Do note that queues can stretch really long for the main attractions during certain seasons. Quite advisable to get an express pass if that's the case. In the event of bad weather, the outdoor rides will be closed as well.

One of the best amusement parks ever. Loved every ride, especially the cyclone, Transformers and The Mummy. If i visit Singapore again I will definitely visit Universal Studios again. Try going on a weekday and during off season for lesser crowd or you can always pay more and get an express ticket for a shorter queue.

Grezt fun for family but everything is about merchandising and we had thunder storms comung they said so closed all rides aftet we arrived but we could not come back another day so paid big money for entrance and express passes for ride and onoy used for lesz than 1 hour it is a rip off should have passout or similar for bad weath if park can not give service it sold tickets for

Pretty small theme park compared to the other counterparts in Japan and US but it does have a mix of thrill rides and slow kiddie rides. Try to come off peak and on a weekday to avoid the crushing crowds. On those days, rides can go up to 1-1.5 h waiting times.

1.review_text: Today I had the worst experience ever in Asia (I am traveling here for 6 months now). We came here on Monday to avoid crowds but there was too much people almost all the day.
