We were standing in the lines for 1,5 hour to have 1 minute ride. It was terrible! We spend all day and it was not enough to try all the attractions. Also, only 4 or 5 were interesting, others were only for children. The funny thing was that almost all the time we were obligated to leave our stuff in lockers and these lockers were for free only for 30-40minutes. After that there was 4 dollars fee for every 20 minutes. But almost all the time we had to wait for the attraction for more that 1 hour, so it was so unfair. It is not worth to pay so much money for this experience!!!
Nightmare! There are queues all around, for each attraction, for at least an hour (and this is with the express pass purchased, for an additional 110 per person!) I do not recommend it to anyone.

They told me to remove the microphone from my camera and store it in a locker outside the park (15 SGD/day) , else cannot enter. Apparently the terms and conditions says photography and videography is not allowed inside Universal Studios. With such rules in place I will not visit Universal Studios again!! Very few rides that our 2 year daughter was allowed to ride. She was not even allowed to ride Sesame Street, can you imagine?? Massive queues to the attractions, which is a challenge for young kids like our daughter. Thank you and good bye forever Universal Studios Singapore!
Very worst experience

2.review_text: Kind of disappointing experience. Been here on a Friday and totally crowded. I don't like the Express queue option. Overall it's a quite small theme park and to make it more enjoyable for the people they should let less people inside. Then you can have some more fun. Mostly you wait more than 2 hours in the queue for one attraction. Even you pay extra for Express lane, you usually wait quite long. Mostly Chinese and Indian, who mainly don't show civilized behavior. Not again here.

Staff is not trained to manage huge crowd ..also they need to do something for parents with infants...fans installed in queue area not working...do a capping on the no of visitors in order to enhance customer experience...worst place to visit in weekends

The queues are not well planned and the attractions are too far away from each other. there are very little sitting places. The souvenirs inside are way too expensive as compared to the same ones sold outside the park. Lack of 4D shows.

It was a bad experience for me .. visiting Sentosa and universal studios during May .. heavily too crowded .. spent few hours of waiting in queue for all major attractions.. totally a bad idea to visit this place during peak seasons ..if you happened to visit during peak times, use the single rider queue in major attractions which was way faster ..
Thick queues, unfriendly staff...

3.review_text: Waiting times are not clear or reliable, attractions stop working for no apparent reason and it's not communicated clearly or transparently. Express queues make normal ones not move at all for minutes during peak times.

We had a fun day out on a Thursday however lines were a minimum of 1 hour wait time for the rollercoasters, cant imagine what it would be like on a weekend. We bought 70 fast pass tickets as a result. Food options were good, chilli cheese dog from Jurassic Park area was great. Rides could do with an upgrade, the main attractions are not really in keeping with the latest movies, Transformers are probably the latest attraction. Also what made the day less enjoyable was there were lots of people who stunk of BO. It was so bad at times I could almost taste it. Disgusting!

Universal studio staff , some are very arrogant and rude. To be honest, some are double standard. they treat Asians poorly. The attractions and rides are amazing. Few rude staff spoilt my mood. I paid so high and yet treated poorly. Universal studio should train their staff to be polite because that's their core job being in tourism place. To be resourceful and helpful.

***expect to spend almost double the entry fee*** Everything else is paid and expensive...and very very long waiting times in exhausting heat and humidity.......seems to be just a money-making machine for the management..... almost damps the thrill of the rides

I took two adults and two 8yr olds on a busy day so we bought unlimited express tickets (additional 140.00 AUD, but we still had to wait 30-45 minutes for most rides, but normal tickets waiting up to 80-100 minutes ,and some rides didnt have express lanes, which was very disappointing after the cost of the tickets. Went too KTs grill for dinner, it was ok, but overpriced for what it was worth. Overall it was ok as we all enjoyed it but its expensive, no change out 800 once you bought food too. The transformer ride was a good!!

4.review_text: I went in at 10 o'clock when it opens on weekdays with regular tickets, saw Transformers and Mummy first, and gave up on the Battlestar Galactica roller coaster because it was shortened to 80 minutes. If it suddenly rains, all outdoor rides will stop. The day I went was a market day, so it rained in the middle of the day, so a huge crowd gathered indoors. There are too many people even on weekdays. Half Indian, half Chinese. There are people in India and China who openly cut in line. Truly disorderly. It will be dirty because it is disorderly. Since the population is large, there are bound to be many people like that. Wherever you go in Singapore, you will find Indians and Chinese everywhere. So I dont really have any intention of going back. Half of the people on Earth are Chinese and Indian, so there seems to be no place on Earth where they can go to avoid these two races. Transformers and Mummy are decent. The others are just for babies. The weather seems to be unpredictable, with rain coming and going. Directions to Universal Studios are poor. It is best to ask at the information desk or ticket office. Universal Studios is very small. Is there an attraction worth taking up an entire day? For speedy rides, bags and luggage must be stored in lockers. #SingaporeUniversalStudio #Transformers #Mummy

The place is huge and lot of people came but not crowded, if you don't like queuing 1 hour for the ride, consider buying express pass. The place was very clean, so beautiful, but unfortunately when i came, there was thunder/lightning issue, so they stop the outdoor ride for it, you should consider the weather before coming

Only visited the Aquarium at Sentosa which was evidently the only queue for any attraction. It looks like Universal Studios does attract a lot of people though there were no queues to enter which is a bonus for anyone no doubt.
Good visit although very long queues for the rides and attractions

Rides are beautiful. If it's crowded then you'll be annoyed but it's got a great vibe of happiness and freedom as you see people enjoy which makes you want to enjoy and you inevitably enjoy then. Don't stress it. Wait the lines. Enjoying is on you.

5.review_text: Good amusement park But the system for managing queues for rides is very poor.
Simply fabulous... One must visit universal at Singapore with express tickets to avoid long queues...

A must visit plc on ur trip. Transformers ride a must go.. Mummy ride a must experience.. Roller coasters never to be missed ... Would expect more water areas. Strollers given on rent must have more storage area.... SOME RIDES DONT HAVE EXPRESS PASS.. NOT KNOWN Y ! Jurassic Park needs upgrade now.. Veg food options need to be more ! They should introduce soda and popcorn refills.
A lovely place. Only problem is the freakishly long queues for rides. So you end up waiting for an hour for a 5 minute ride.

This was the best location at Singapore. Reach by 9.00 am when it opens. Buy an express ticket. Itsaves a lot of time. It cuts the waiting time by at least to 1/3. Jurassic park, rollercoaster rides are too good. Transformers is icing on the cake

1.review_text: We have been here several times throughout the past 4 years, kids... Lines are very bad on many rides - especially Jurassic. Queue times are not accurate. The Express Lane customers are a major reason for the long lines as they are very many, a significant percentage, and often times result in the line standing still for extended periods. Not worth 1/4 of the entry cost. Poorly run park.

Very bad Experience...Overcrowded...very rude staff specially at the Revenge of the Mummy ride. There is waiting time of 90 mins in each ride. Whats the point of giving tickets and admission to so many people that no one can enjoy the day out. Have been to many other theme parks and never had such bad experience.
Big queue in each ride is very much boaring..And time killing..Need to do something to avoid this
1. Need new improvement 2. The queuing is killing
Money minded giving unlimited tickets then actual capacity you have to wait more than two hours for most of the rides

2.review_text: I simply don't think it's worth the wait time. We visited on a Friday and were in shortly after 11. Pretty much any attention, even if only fun for small kids had a 45min or more wait time. We tried to pick the rides with the shortest queues but when the advertised wait time was 20min it was closer to 1h. Advertised 5min was really 15min. To be fair on one ride advertised time was 45mins and the wait was really only 20mins. Also, yes the queue is shorter with express tickets but that's another 100 per person, these are not available for all rides, there was still quite a queue so I'm not sure it makes a big difference. Several times during the day we were very close to leaving the park with hundreds of spent and having only done a couple of kids rides.. Then after 6pm queues started to become more acceptable and the evening was enjoyable. I just wish we would not have wasted most of our day waiting around in the heat as we could have done nearly as many rides if we would have just come at 6pm. Bad organization also did not help: Unclear signage led to people wasting time waiting in the wrong queue (happened to us and several other people I observed) or e.g. flighting over seats in the cinema.

They have few good rides , most of the rides are exciting for children. Its very commercialised , you can find more restaurants than rides and shows . Crowded all the time including weekdays , we gotta stand for 90 mins for each ride , rides are normally 2 mins to 5 mins . Only 3 rides are worth waiting ! If you have a lot of patience and can manage the annoying voice over for 90 mins till you get your ride , then yeah you may like this place ! For first timers even disappointments will be a good experience! But people who have visited other universal studios, this is not the place !

We went on Friday and I was very badly crowded. Each ride had nearly 60-90 waiting time Through normal ticket. We could manage only 4 rides from 10:30AM to 5PM. Better to go for express pass to enjoy more rides.

Not well managed. Most of the rides were called off due to bad weather. Recommended to get express pass. Not much variety of food hub. Avoid Saturday and Sunday. Get tickets online you may save 5 dollars.
Not a great place unless you get there express pass. The wait time for some of these rides spike upto 2-3 hours on busy days m just a handful of good rides. Good place for the kids to enjoy though.

3.review_text: The infrastructure is very good BUT the queues are very long and BIGGEST CON is the very rude staffs on multiple rides.

Staff at battlestar Galactica being rude and impatient to visitor. An Indian male staff rudely asking queuing visitor to leave the gantry door even the previous ride visitor havent get off from her seat. He can rather asking visitors politely to move away as he want to close the door. Very rude of him. If hate to work please quit as well. (Visited at 5 April 2019)

The rides are awesome. The q may get really long.. requiring 1 to 11l2hrs sometimes. Full stats for the rides. But the studio part... Steven Spielberg show, short but good one. On the day of our visit, Shrek 4D was cancelled. Meeting the transformers was cancelled and water world show was cancelled after a wait of 1 hr in hot sun!!! This kind of last minute cancellation may happen on any day and it was totally disappointing. Those who are not interested in rides, had nothing else to do, bcoz most of the shows were cancelled. I suggest to those not interested in rides to have an alternate plan. Or use that time to see bird show etc that are free of cost at Sentosa

The small facilities and disorderliness were the worst.. Compared to Osaka Universal, there is nothing to see and not many interesting attractions. It is a good place for parents with children to visit with their children. Since there is no food available, it is best to eat lunch outside. Re-entry is allowed once. Not recommended for those looking for thrills or fun. I think Luji or the beach tour are better. However, I recommend that you visit if you are a woman who likes characters and if you have children in your group. You should not risk being frowned upon by Indian people who have no sense of order.
After being to the one in the US , this is not a patch . Even after buying the expensive express pass, some of the rides , would not accept it .

4.review_text: Too much of queue. Few rides are really good, but u have to wait really long for every rides. Average queue time is 30 mins.

Though you purchase online ticket directly with Resort World to avoid long queue the online ticket/voucher issued do not entitles you for entry unless you redeemed the voucher to Ticket at nearest counter. Saw many people standing in queue & finally at the time of entry denied access due to lack of this info. If you are visiting on weekdays pls do not spend any extra money for express direct entry to rides without any queue as there won't be that much rush, can do with 10-20 min of waiting. Water world show, Transformer, Mummy's, Jurassic Park ride & 3D shows are must.
You need to spare 1 whole day to completely enjoy this place.most of the rides 20-30minutes waiting and one even had 1 hr waiting.they need to do something about it.

Too much crowdy, waiting for almost all rides... Even with express pass you need to wait.. Some of good rides are Transformers & The mummy.. Must go place for all visitors.. Lifetime experience.. Try to go before 10am to finish all rides in a day

The entertainment area is very good, it's a shame it comes during peak season so you can't enjoy the rides, it's recommended for those who want to come here during peak season, you should increase your budget by buying an express card spy Don't queue at the rides.

5.review_text: This place is really crazy... It's the queue that wastes time... If you want to enter the ride, you have to have a long spare time... Because the queue is sadeees...

We went here on a weekday- Friday, hoping to avoid the crowds but for some reason, there were groups of children wearing school uniforms in groups, must be an excursion or something. We were here as soon as the park opened and headed straight to the most popular rides, Transformers- had to wait for atleast 30 mins even if the park just opened. The Mummy- waited for 5-10 mins, this was the shortest time we had to wait for a popular ride. There's a starbucks here if you like starbucks. There are other shops and food stalls, and some decent restaurants too. After riding the mummy, most of the queues were about 45 mins - 1 hr. The Jurassic park was the longest one, around 2 hrs. We went to sea world instead and came back when most of the crowds were going home. Rode the roller coasters twice with no queue and jurassic park too. This was after 5pm, the park closes at 10 pm. So we had plently of time to take photos around the park, eat and relax while everyone was on the queue. Or you can purchase the express pass 3x the standard price if you can't be bothered.

Saturdays are extremely crowded, all games have to queue for 30-1 hours, especially TRANSFORMER queues for over 1 hour without knowing what the content is, many people drop out!!! Service prices are extremely expensive (food, drinks, raincoats, clothes drying,...). Regular tickets are 40, priority tickets must be added 57, train station pick-up tickets 10, priority ticket prices change by day, season...highly recommend booking tickets online and bringing your own drinks and snacks, because food is prohibited here)
Nice place, tempat bermainnya juga seru, but queue is really long, I suggest if you don't want to queue too long just buy express ticket

The place is nice... the rides are also quite good. But it's too commercial.. everything is paid, not like Disneyland. The queue is long for favorite rides. In Disneyland, fast pass is free.. in USS you have to pay again

1.review_text: Long queues everywhere. The rides, Washroom, Taxi, for Drinks and Food. You will literally get tired just by queuing. Some of the rides were having technical issues so that's another bummer. Very very expensive not just the ticket to go in but everything else too. A slim can beer is 11, a thin slice pizza is 11 and it was not nice at all. Didn't enjoy it and most probably won't go back.

Been here many times on an annual pass. Seems everytime I visit at least one ride breaks down after a long wait in the line. Given the unusually long wait times for their rides in general I cannot recommend this theme park. Poor maintenance, filthy toilet facilities, and food that tastes like it was prepared in the filthy toilets only subtract further from this low value for money attraction. By the way, I'm sitting on the floor waiting for the Mummy ride to start (its been delayed for technical difficulties).

It is open until 22:00 on Saturday July 6th, but the business hours have to be changed because other companies have booked the venue. At 18 o'clock, other ticket-buying tourists were kicked out, and the Saturday parade and fireworks that I was looking forward to were also cancelled. The way the staff dealt with it was also very rude and they rushed tourists away, which was very bad! Since tickets bought in advance cannot be changed, we can only accept Universal's statement that "the company has the right to change the time." Although Japan Global is more expensive, the service is much better than in Singapore. Singapore Global's service and handling methods are really terrible. For a large global company, Singapore Global's handling is very poor!

If you love queuing cumulatively for 5hrs with 2 small children to ride for 30 mins total then this is definitely the place for you! If not, then save your holiday, your money, your family's time and go somewhere else. Honestly this was one of the worst paid for 'experiences' we've ever had anywhere in the world. 1.5hrs of queuing for a ride which said it was a 45 min wait at the start. The ride took 7.5 mins. Another one was a 45min wait for a 35 sec ride. Hot, stinky, crowded queues. Two of the family rides weren't even working when the park opened because of what the staff said were technical problems. The kicker is when you do decide to pay the extra 70SGD pp for an 'Express' ticket to jump the queue, they then use surge pricing and say it will cost 140SGD pp (no discount for kids). Even those with Express tickets had to wait 45mins to ride the Jurassic Park Rapids when the average ticket holder had to wait 2hrs. In the midst of this self-punishment I tried to get a beer. Waited in line for 5 mins to get to the front only to be told the 11SGD beer had sold out. I guess there were other desperate adults who'd got there quicker. As well as that when the kids wanted photos with the characters they were told no, only photos taken by professional photographers. Like I said, if you like to wait in line sweating while having your pockets emptied by Universal then you'll love it.

There were too many people. I only played 3 facilities all day. I had to wait for tourists with fast passes to play first. The regular tickets were already very expensive, and they also sold fast passes, which was basically a disguised increase in price. I spent so much money to play only 3 facilities, and most of them were in queues. The CP value is too low. I will not come again

2.review_text: Attractions such as roller coasters often stopped operating, and there were several times when we were left waiting without adequate explanation. It took about 40 minutes at most, but I had to wait in line for that long. There are many attractions where you have to leave your luggage in a locker, but if you go longer than 45 minutes you have to pay for it, so I think there is a problem with the setup and management in the first place. It's a shame because it's a theme park with so many fun attractions. There are many other places to enjoy in Singapore, so unless you have a really good reason to come, I think you can leave it off your tourist list.

As an international tourist and in direct comparison to universal studios LA which I rate 5/5, Singapore is a 2/5. Regular tickets are 80 and express tickets (which can only be used once on each Applicable ride is 189. Unlimited express more than 200. Single riders option closed whenever the staff feel the wait time is too long overall - which is always. Wait time off peak on a Monday even at 30 minutes before the park was closing was 45 minutes for some rides. During the day wait times were up to 120 minutes for all major attractions. Way too many people are allowed in the park, perhaps more than should be. Due to the huge crowds (not even school holidays when I went) it takes twice as long to even walk from point a to point b. It rained three times and the entire crowd ran for cover, leaving each store and water crowded as though on a busy train. Minimal facilities for Rain cover except for the entrance way street. The Jurassic park ride was a huge let down. Its more of a float boat. Doesnt have Harry Potter world, the Simpsons, the living dead and a few other attractions as in LA. Overall though, If not comparing to other universal studios internationally, the theme park is much better than anything else around. Some bathrooms well maintained while others in a very poor state. park needs some major improvements.

The park itself is good (rides, attractions, food selection, cleanliness), but is it worth visiting? In my opinon, No. Going on monday morning, mid-july, the queue for the gentle rides can go up to 30 minutes...for coasters it was 60, for a ride that goes for about 2 minutes or less. I imagine during their peak seasons you might need to queue for walking

Unnecessary very long queue.. no exceptions for people who have health issues.. they have to buy extra VIP tickets which is equivalent to the normal ticket or triple than normal ticket. We have already spent a lot for coming to Singapore.... with normal ticket you wait for around 2 hrs to just to enjoy 10 mins ride.. not at all satisfied

Mixed views about Universal Singapore, some good but mainly bad unfortunately. We really enjoyed most of the rides & although some queue times were an hour or more we managed to do pretty much everything in a day. I'd really liked Universals attention to detail & we decided to go to Singapore this year after visiting Japan Universal Studios last year (which was amazing). I can't fault the attention to detail on the rides or the special effects shows but unfortunately this park lacks a wow factor like Harry Potter or similar. It just doesn't feel as magical. But what unfortunately let the whole experience down & spoilt the day for us was the lack of customer service, unclean restaurants & awful food. We'd had great food in Japan so were expecting a similar experience. Unfortunately it left a lot to be desired. We went to Mel's diner for lunch & had chicken burgers. When we ordered we were told not to expect them hot because the cold lettuce & tomato cools down the chicken. I asked were they fresh (of course) as alarm bells started to ring, I should have walked away at this point. We'd had these burgers before in the Japan equivalent so were expecting good things. These were unfortunately the most disgusting chicken burgers we had ever eaten. It was chicken leg bits & skin re formed together & deep fried but when you took a bite it was a grey slimey mush. See picture. All were the same so we didn't bother complaining as it looked like that's just how they come. Quite embarrassing given its an American Diner. I've never seen a chicken burger look like this. Cold limp chips & own brand awful ketchup. The restaurant was also filthy, greasy tables not wiped after multiple guests & food all over the floors with tables crammed together to pack people in. Burger Cost S16 plus S5 for drink so daylight robbery for what you get. I could only manage 1 bite of mine, almost sick, so went about half an hour later to another Universal fast food joint in Far Far Away for a pizza to fill the gap left by the burger/fries. No better, most were burnt so I sent the one I was given back. I would describe this as a child's value supermarket pizza, with a cheap bread base (even with the little pin holes you get on those pre manufactured frozen pizza bases). Disgraceful for the money S13 & as if they found the cheapest pizza they could to palm off on unsuspecting tourists. Customer service at most points during the day was bad, from being told we have to leave the park to get ladies sanitary products when urgently required, to rude, condescending & unhelpful staff. There didn't seem that many staff around either & there certainly wasn't the usual happy smiley US customer service experience. Disappointing!

3.review_text: Too long waiting times for too few attractions compared to e.g. European parks
Most of the rides are good but there is too much wait. If you are a small group, ask for single entry and move in.. It will save time and boredom of waiting..
Nice rides but too long queue. Express too expensive. Just not worthit for me.

Queues just too long for the more popular rides. If you're even a little prone to motion sickness...may not enjoy the place as much. Food and drinks are quite expensive. Bring along your own water bottles as water coolers are everywhere and can save you some money.

We visited the park with our two kids (3 and 5 years old). It was a good thing that we could buy the tickets online in advance. The highlights during the day was to meet the Minions and to take pictures together with Bumblebee. :) The selection of food in the park was quite poor. There was only junk food and it was very expensive. Be sure to bring your own food and water, lots of water. Another annoying thing was all the noise. There was loud music playing everywhere and the attractions were very loud.

4.review_text: Queueing, queueing, and more queueing. 30 mins or less can possibly be considered fast, 45 to 60 mins normal, and 90 mins (particularly at the rollercoasters!) long. We visited on a Monday, outside of school holidays or public holidays. Imagine what it will be like on the weekend. Food, drinks and gifts are expensive, as you could expect (tetra pak "bottle" of drinking water S 4). Do as the locals and use the queueing time for playing around on your smartphone (or writing this review, in fact). Attractions, shows and rides are quite spectacular.

Good place. Ticket is a bit expensive compared to the amusement parks of dubai, hongkong and malaysia. I enjoyed the transformer rides. That's the only ride that I enjoyed actually. The others I feel like are too extreme for an almost 50 year old man. The friends that I am with are not enjoying the place like I do and I don't know why. The food are really expensive inside like very expensive. We ended up eating the kids meal.

The best theme park in South-East Asia at the moment. However, the queue times can get ridiculously long during weekends. Thankfully, the official app has live queue times for all the attractions so I know which rides to go on first.

It is the iconic tourist spot to visit. But don't visit the place on weekends cause long waiting cues for the specific theme rides. The tickets area is well organized and service with smile, also provided the meal voucher as a token of appreciation along with the tickets but you'll just grab fries or drink in that amount. Its the second version of the original US Universal Studio.
The only things I don't like is queue. Don't ever visit on July due to China Holiday. There are much more visitors from China during that period

5.review_text: An excellent amusement park for children and adults. 6 zones of different themes. Souvenir shops, cafes. Disadvantages - long queues for the rides, in order to have time you need to come to the park early. Expensive entrance. On some attractions you cannot take bags or phones; you must leave them in a locker for a fee.
Beautiful place but really busy with long queues for upto an hour and not many rides disappointed was expecting more but a nice place to visit and not forgetting the entry is quite expensive

Amazing place, look like long queues but go really fast, most queues have fans so are cool and always stay until the very point of closure as almost all rides have no queues around 45 mins before closing time. Another tip is getting in a queue 5 minutes before closing time. As closing time is the closing of the queues, if you are in a queue at closing time you won't be kicked out of the queue and will be able to ride the ride.
Good place to go but waiting time of every ride is more it irritate us

It wasn't crowded late on a weekday afternoon. Transformers, Jurassic World, Battlestar Galactica, etc. are highly recommended, but there are a lot of people waiting, so if you need to tour Singapore briefly, it would be better to arrive around 4 o'clock and not wait until 8 o'clock. Using a universal app that tells the time can help you optimize your waiting time. As a show, the Water World show was okay, but I personally wasn't very impressed because it was the same content I saw in the US 12 years ago. It has an American feel because it was invested with American capital, but the place is small, so it feels more like Lotte World than Everland.

1.review_text: Most of the rides having 'technical difficulties' without explanation. The weather is fine. And all visitors queueing up and wasting a lot of time!! It's not worth the money to come in. Unless you want spend another 110 for express pass. They ripping off money by surge the price based on the crowd. Given the 'trick' of 'technical difficulties', the crowd is overwhelming and it doesn't spark joy at all. Waiting time for one ride is 90 to 120mins. Not recommended to visit here.

USS is a hit or miss, and most of the time it's a miss. The park is great and fun when there isn't too much people, albeit a bit small. Sadly, the park is always super crowded. We went on a monday at the opening, queued for 2h30 for the transformer ride, and it broke down while we were still in the queue. The mummy ride was close for the day (of course they couldn't mention it on the website or infront of the park before buying tickets) The whole park is a money grab. It's unacceptable to pay 79 (which is so expensive even for Singapore standards??) and have two rides broke down, especially with a park that small. Of course they do not accept refund, but a compensation would have been appreciated. We stayed for 5 hours in the park, and we did one ride after queuing for 2h45 before leaving. We literally payed 79 per person to stay in a line. Even the express queue was full. Imagine paying 80 to skip the queue and still have to wait an hour. I've been there a few times, and the few last ones were a waste of time and money. Go once to say that you've been there, but that's it. The only time I had a similar experience in another park was years ago, where one ride broke down and we got new tickets sent as an apology without asking. I'm not saying USS should start accepting refund or whatever, but you could say it's a bit annoying when you leave the queue after queuing for almost 3 hours, and the only thing they say is 'hope you guys come again!' Trust me, I try to give this park a chance, because I think it's a very pretty park with great rides, but I can't. Too crowded.

The worst experience in a theme Park in my whole life. Large queues to enter and without any organization so many people dont respect the queues. Inside the Park again Large queues and terrible organization(I think they need more personal inside the atractions to organize the people) .One of the atractions (shrek in 4d)didnt work correctly.

This is diffidently not the experience we expected, The rudest and unhelpful staff I have ever seen, we wished to see a smiling staff. Management need to teach staff how to welcome visitors or best to send them to USA US to see the amazing g staff and to learn from them. Also The most ill managed place. We visited Universal Studio on a Friday morning and could manage to take only 4 rides in the whole day. The reason being Universal Studios management does not cap the number of visitors to the park. Each ride has an average waiting time of 120 minutes. Even the waiting area was devoid of any sitting arena causing immense stress on our feet. The management must limit the selling of tickets per day so that all can enjoy the park. It needs to address the issue of seating for the elderly and children.

Too small and lack of responsibilities... There are few roller coasters that they proud of, but it is just their proud and no fear and just waiting. Universal Studios Singapore is just focusing to sell Express tickets, but it is reduce two hours to one hour, sometimes waiting time is same compare to normal line(expamle, Shrek 4D) In addition, I complained this meaningless ticket with 1hour the waiting but I can receive just thank you for your feedback mail that they used to. I will recommend waterpark in Sentosa rather than this stupid Universal Studios Singapore. Fxxxing Universal Studios Singapore forever!! It was worst amusement park in my life!!

2.review_text: Worst experience ever. I visited a lot of amusement parks, but never faced this. Big lines, everything is very very slow. We waited 2 hours for one ride. Ticket is 110 SGD for one ride per attraction plus USS entrance. It's crazy.
Strictly for children. You spend more time in queue than enjoying the rides. Rides frequently going under maintenance

HONEST REVIEW: I booked two tickets for my girlfriend and I to go on a Tuesday morning. It was the worst decision I ever made. First of all you pay soo much for entry which is useless without paying the extra cash for the skip-the-line ticket. Every ride was over 60 minutes wait and some even had 130 minutes! And keep in mind that you have to store your belongings in lockers which give a free charge for only 80 minutes and after that you pay 4 dollars every 20 min. So imagine you have a ride with a waiting time of 130 minutes and then have to pay because of this. There was even a ride which had a technical error and was delayed longer which forced us to pay for the locker for their own fault! In addition prices for food were very expensive and nothing was served fresh. Everything tasted like it was left there for days outside. Moreover, the park is VERY small and you can walk around it in 7 minutes. Other than that the attractions are very fun and well thought of and there are a couple of free events and shows which were nice. But it is not worth the money as you have to buy an express pass including the normal ticket to not have that long waiting line.

I went on a weekday in August, and there were a lot of tourists (especially Chinese and Indians) during summer vacation. I waited for 2 hours even though the wait time was displayed as 40 minutes. Some vehicles do not allow luggage storage, The explanation from the staff is unclear as to whether this is compulsory or voluntary. The guidance was random and there didn't seem to be any strict rules. The level of staff is very low compared to Japan. Everything in the park is expensive. You can bring your own food, so we recommend bringing your own lunch and drinks. Mainly souvenirs, dolls, and accessories. They don't sell many sweets that can be taken as souvenirs like they do in Japan. Jurassic Park gets your feet very wet. My shoes get soaked.

This was my 2nd time here, the first time was awesome, compare to the 35 yrs old theme park in my city, the uss was a thrill highball.. but then i went to usj, on december. For twice the price, usj was way more. Some complaint: 1. singapore is very very very hot, please install A LOT OF LARGE MIST FANS on the main road, especially at the shrek kingdom, its much way hotter than the other areas. 2. Install fans, exhaust fans and deodorizer on the restroom. Most toilet was very hot and smelt really bad, found some toilet have left over excrement (which was not the management fault) and i almost threw up. PLEASE REPLACE ALL TOILET WITH WASHLET, its better and way faster and cleaner than wiping!!! Cmon step up ur toilet game 3. In usj, the smoking area are fewer than in uss but they are secluded! In uss the smoking area are placed too close to the main road and the crowd.. 4. Probably only me,i was hungry and dizzy from the heat, but i cant find any indoor restaurant that not have overbearing food odor.. idk maybe install better air circulation?

3.review_text: Sooooo crowded in the holiday. I've queued for 2 hours and then the attraction announced that this attraction have "short delay". Overall, i think the management should upgrade the capacity and improve the system to be able to serve guests. Waiting for 15 minutes is ok. More than 30 minutes, not ok.
Great rides but queues are very long since there aren't really a lot of choices. Wait times went up to as much as 2 hours for some of the rides. Food isn't very good inside either.

The place is too much crowded as the space is very confined and few rides are always under construction. They should Improve on the rides. The queue is too long, it almost takes an hour to get a ride which in turn means there'll be around 10 to 12 rides that's it. I consider that as waste! The locker system is all very good. You will get Indian food our here!
Long queues in the morning. Make sure you check the locker times in relation to the ride you're attending. You can easily get your belongings ransomed at some not so fair prices.

They are promoting for priority pass and hence too many general tickets are being sold. Consequently waiting period is increased at every show and public are left for struggling and end up with just 3 to 4 shows instead of 20 shows.

4.review_text: 1- It is preferable not to go there on the two days off (Saturday and Sunday). The place will be crowded. 2- If you find the place crowded, which is what you will see at the entrance to the park, it is preferable to buy the Express which will make you cross the line without waiting, which usually extends to 90 minutes. - Working hours are from 10 am to 7 pm 3- The locker for storing things is free for the first hour, then its price is 2, 4, 6, etc. 4- The games for adults are numbered: 2 roll coasters, 1 closed roller coaster, 1 hanging roller coaster, and a water game, which will not require you to buy a coat for 5 S5, given that the water spray is not loud at all times, but the waiting lines will make you feel bored. 5- There are many beautiful and interesting restaurants, cafes, and souvenir shops. I wish you a happy and good time in the land of childhood and beauty note 2019 The price of a ticket is 32 Singapore dollars Express I expect 50 For me, it was a very nice experience, but the only drawback was the smell of the bathrooms. May God bless you
Some of the rides stopped working suddenly after we waited for them, for more than an hour, in line. The operators weren't cooperative and even rude in answering us about it.

Rides are good but not all are worthy. And it's too crowded even on weekdays. Mind your bag and baggeses as they are not allowed to be carried along. Though there are locker facility which are free for 100 minutes as per the staffs (120 min free as per the machine), no ride/activities can be completed without paying good amount of rent due to huge queue.

A recreation area that feels like you are in Sentosa, a busy tourist spot. Many tourists come here. Food from outside is prohibited from being brought in. All rides require an average queue of 30 minutes. But overall it's good to visit.
There are so many tourists that you have to queue for 70 to 90 minutes to get to each of the rides. You have to leave after playing only a few things in a whole day.

5.review_text: Is a must to come here when u visit singapore. A theme park attraction was enjoyable. but take note, long queue for waiting time during saturdays & sundays. I suggest go on weekdays or go for extra mile with express pass, so that no queue needed!

Most of the rides were with long lines, more than 30 minutes of wait time. If planning to ride most all them, either come early with opening time, or buy express pass. There a lot of shops and restaurants with good halal options. Lockers are available all across the park.
Awesome as always but the long queues sap your energy than anything else. Take the express ticket if possible. Don't miss transformers ride and lost World.

The place was small but awesome. There's something for everybody (even those who doesn't like scary rides) We went there on a weekend so it was pretty packed. But something I noticed was that by 4pm, people started thinning out. The rides that had long lines in the morning, we were able to ride by 5pm easily. And it helps if you're willing to split up since there were a lot of times that they're looking to just fill a cart with 1/2 people.
Great experience overall. The park is pretty small. So dont get hung up over queueing. Move to another ride. Come back later!

1.review_text: Third rate staff. Not helpful at all. The transformers ride the queue just goes on and on through a maze and there is no one who can guide visitors. It is designed just to get people to waste their money.
I only got 3 rides. waiting in line for 120 mins for transformer was horrible experience ever and had to leave after 7pm so only stayed 3 hours and couldn't even get night pass .

I will update this fully later. At the park now and unable to be allowed yes I mean allowed to access the attractions as I am an electric wheelchair user. Despite signs saying if able to transfer rides are allowed. I am having to leave the park with my family now. I strongly advise staying away if you are in the same situation as me and dont waste a day or allow a day to be ruined. Like today has.

Last tuesday we visit the Universal Studio here in Singapore we choose this country because it was known to be one of the safest country for its very low crime rate.Me and my family was feeling fortunate and full of excitement that day.Lunch time came and all of us are so hungry so we rush to enter in this resto since this is the 1st resto we saw that offers rice. The receiving area was small so my wife and my kids sat beside the counter together with my sister in law and father in law while I was the one who approach the counter and make order. One of my son was playing with our GO PRO camera,afterward he placed the said camera on the couch beside her mom then one of the staff called us to enter and approach the table they preparedfor us,unknowingly they left the Camera outside but we did not notice it at first, after eating we went out of KT's grill, a few min. And meters away from the resto me and my wife was rushing to go back to get the Camera.As we enter we approach the crew of the resto and they said they haven't seen any camera was left so we call on the manager to ask help if we could review the CCTV cameras of their resto and they said we have to follow the protocol of the eatablishment to report it to the Lost and Found Section and so we follow everything they told us to do. The Lost and found section took our contact # and told us to wait for their call as so we did.By around 5pm one of the staff of the Lost and Found Section called us just to tell us that they could not see the footage in that area where we alleged that the camera was left becauae the camera is in focus to the resto's reception counter only and the full area is not visible. We are so fraustrated with the KT's Grill as you can imagine the people entering there is not safe they cannot protect their customers from those theives around the area of their resto..if you visit the place you can clearly see what i realy ment that their cctv camera could not capture the area of their receiving where they took orders for the mere fact that the area was too small.i am very disappointed!
Time wait ridiculous on rides.made for a horribly uncomfortable day.

2.review_text: Transformers very long queue sets expectations very high but the ride is just alright - not as spectular as I hoped. We had to wait for 30 to 45 minutes more than advertised due to technical problems as well.
Rides are awesome. But waiting time is too long even if we bought express tickets and rides are shut off for maintenance these things make us disappointed
Its better not to come on a public holiday. After queuing for 3 hours, I only used 2 facilities. Although they are popular facilities, they were too long.

Universal studios buying and entertainment experience is fantastic. But their service staff on the ground itself needs a lot of improvement. Unfortunately you get the few that ruin the remaining level of service. We understand its exhausting and tiring but we too are paying guests. And universal studios is an international company. Hopefully universal studios would invest a little more money to Ensure the right training for the service staff to match the level of service provided by the sales and entertainment team.
Nice place but crowded in the weekend so not to recommend to go in the weekend

3.review_text: Average rated.. Big area but lacks of rides.. Hot weather.. Not mascots for meet & greet as advertised.. Too bad they didnt noticed visitors..visitors has not been mentioned by staff about to close earlier than normal time due to some preparation of their next event. Closed time shown at 7:00pm but they closed an hour earlier..food stall closed at 5.30pm..didnt informed to visitors at all..

Been there on a weekday, it was a complete rush. Had to wait for 4 hrs in line to get into Battlestar galactica(including time taken for them to rectify a technical issue). Also, revenge of mummy was closed due to maintenance. Rest of the rides were too crowded. Water rides were housefull. Couldn't do much. All i can advice people who are going there is to buy an express pass! Otherwise it's a total waste standing in line for many hours

It's just an average experience. Rides & shows are good but waiting time ruins everything. On some rides waiting time can reach 120 min with customers paying extra given preference over normal visitors. Food was good with Oasis having good Indian options with great taste.

This theme park has many rides (including 3d rides) , 3d movies and you can find good locations for take photo's. There is three negative factors that saw. The first thing is they don't allow guest to bring food or water. Inside universal studio food is expensive. Other fact is the given time duration is not inuff to visit all the rides . We got a fun pass according to that we got one day to US and one day to others. We went there on Saturday and we had to waited on long queue's for the rides. Last one is for some rides we cannot go with our phones and there was lockers. There are only free for few minites. Becouse of the long queue we exceed the time and had to pay for the lockers. End of the day we didn't feel it as a holiday we felt it as another busy day. If your to visit US 1. Get a fun pass 2.Go on a week day ( avoid weekends) 3. There is a movie in shreke's place. Try to go there early and find the time . 4. For the rides try to stay in front seats.

Universal Studios, just a bad day for us! Those who have been to the Hollywood universal won't be having as much fun as you did there! It's a good one time experience here at Singapore. Do take the express tickets ( Highly recommended! ) The lines are long even on weekdays, all day! One of the rides we went to broke down ( Egypt/The Mummy ride) and we were stuck in line for more than 2 hours! not a very good experience at Universal! Please do check the Timings of shows and attend all of them! they're amazing! Because of the delay we faced we missed the waterworld show. You can pickup the Map after you have entered the gate after ticket checking on the right side.

4.review_text: Yeah, well... Read all my tips below to make most of your visit here. Before I tell you the good, the tough message: You pay loads of money for some 5 min rides in a fake environment after waiting hours. That's the more critical view of it. On the bright side you see lots of happy faces having a once in a life experience. Some of the rides are stunning (Transformer ride, Cylon Battlestar Galactica Rollercoaster, Mummy, Jurassic Park Rapids, Canopy Flyer), others are soso and some, well, it's for kids, you know?! Restaurants are all quite expensive, but the Indian food opposite the Mummy ride is decent and not too expensive. Some more tips: 1. Don't do weekends. We did a Tuesday and had rather short lines. 2. Invest and take the Express ticket (take the 1 time express on each ride ticket, not unlimited - you won't have time for unlimited rides anyway). The express ticket helped to cut hours off our waiting times. Hours! And that was on a Tuesday. I can't begin to imagine the frustration on a weekend with a normal ticket... 3. Download the Universal Studio Singapore app from Google Play / Apple store. It shows the waiting times at each attraction and you can plan ahead. Times are not super accurate, but give you an idea what to expect. 4. Start at the back of the park and work your way forward to the attractions in the front. Coz everyone goes the other way and you beat the crowds and waiting lines this way. 5. Avoid going on school holidays. 6. Bring a water bottle to refill, they only sell paper cartons with water which are hard to refill. There is drinking water fountains at each waiting line and you can use that to refill. 7. Bring a shirt to change coz the Jurassic Rapids will most likely get you wet. If you found it helpful feel free give it a like so it shows on top and more people get helped with the tips.

AMAZING! Rides are fantastic BUT missing last star as wait times signs are not realistic especially when posting 30 mins and it's more like 60-70 mins and some queues definitely need fans or air conditioning turned on. We didn't purchase priority express (an extra SGD40 on top of ticket price) but this may be worthwhile as most of the popular rides have express lanes. If you LOVE roller coaster - DEFINITELY recommend Mummy ride as nd Galatica rides but the waiting in queues is a killer...
You have to be patient to queue at the main attraction

Went on a Monday, but there were still a lot of people The queue for the Lost World ride that gets wet lasted 80 minutes. The end result was disappointing, not worth queuing up to do this. But the Lost World show is really wonderful

Great theme destination and amazing rides. However, they have very long waiting time for standard pass people (average 50-60 minutes per ride). And if there are too many express pass people in the queue, then they will only take 2-3 people from standard queue at a time,even if there are more than hundred behind. One announcement I heard was that in Cylon roller-coaster, expected waiting time for last person in standard queue was 2 hours..! So, if you don't buy express pass, you end up standing and waiting in queue for hours, to enjoy 2-5 minute rides. So, the bottom line is that it's an amazing destination but you have to spend double bucks to enjoy.

5.review_text: It is must visit place in Singapore, it require a whole day to cover, lots of rides and show are there, some rides you need to wait for 1 hour too, because of rush, you may buy express pass also for express entry which reduce the wait time.

Wbt here with a large family group. So much fun. The trouble with all these places is the queues! If only there were something that could be done about that, but it seems to be like this whichever theme park you go to.

Very vibrant and colorful. Be there before 10AM to enjoy as many rides, queues will take your time away. Avoid weekends when it is really crowd-packed. Bring with you a bottled water which you can refill at the drinking fountains located by the comfort rooms. Generally, it was really tiring but all fun.

There's a lot of rides to choose from. We espicially loved the transformers, the mummy and jurassic park but please do note that the lines here takes about 1-2 hours waiting so buying the express ticket (although its really expensive and costs almost twice the amount of ticket price) is really worth it for you to enjoy a lot of rides. There are food stalls as well but really pricey.

Very good theme park but lots of walking required keeping in mind heat...must try revenge of mummy, transformers, Jurassic park rapids...very swift management in entry but waiting times can be up to an hour in rides....food is very expensive..no outside food allowed...if u have kids n patients with diabetes...things can be helped if u have prescription..

1.review_text: Visited USS today. The place had very large crowd and we had to wait for at least an hour for each ride. Some of the popular ride had wait time of 2 hours (Jurrasic Rapid Adventure, both roller coasters, Transformers ride etc). Worst of all is that on two occasions after waiting for an hour the rides encountered technical glitch due to which we were asked to leave the ride. I saw couple of people stuck in the ride...... This was very annoying. To top it they close the park 5 before the official closing time of 6pm denying children right at the front of the ride.... Very unfriendly staff, even towards kids. Never seen anything like this in other parks in rest of the world.

Many rides closed for technical reasins. Long queues Most rides only last a couple of minutes For rollercoasters have to leave bags in lockers and because of long waiting times you have to pay sgd4 each time... a ripoff in obe full day only accomplished 7 rides in 8 hours UGH!!!!

The service efficiency was very poor. The locker system was out of order for more than two hours. The park did not take any contingency measures. We were queuing up all day long and couldn't enjoy many facilities. It was better to go to Universal Studios Japan.

Paid 400SGD for front of line passes. Spent half an hour getting into the park.(Friday) All Good Rides have a 20-35minute wait time even with front of line passes.2 hours on some of the normal passes. Jurrasic Park canopy flyer has no front of line lane. Over an hour wait plus. Battlestar Galactica Human.. Made 4 attempts to ride with front of line passes. Usually a 20-30 Minute Wait. Either technical issues or possible storms scamper any chance of riding it all day. You pay for front of line passes and have all day.. line up before 10am and you will struggle to ride everything once. Worst fake American food in all of Singapore. Maybe if they capped crowds or told patrons beforehand to move days for less crowd...it would be better. Universal LA is hands down better. (Mind you, the mummy and transformers rides graphics are looking well dated now)

We went to Universal on 4th Oct 2019 and had the worst experience ever. Far too many people the park can accommodate. Each place waiting for at least 2 to 2.5 hrs. We could only take 3 rides. Getting in itself took us 45 minutes. With so many people it a serious violation of safety and security. Kids cried out of suffocation and tiredness in tight lanes. Too much greed and selfish state of affairs. Sadly no one seem to regulate the number of people allowed at the park and sadly Singapore govt is not keeping a watch of it.

2.review_text: Very poor organization, staff is Not enough. Queues are too long and staff is not organized to fill the attraction. Time for queue is not right at all. Show 10min when we wait 50min. Good things of Universal SGP : the shows!

Very badly managed studio in terms of crowd management and staff cooperation. Some of the rides were shut stating technical error after waiting for 2 hrs in the queue . Try to visit this on weekdays to avoid over crowd
Worst crowd management. Huge waiting time for most of the rides. Standing in queues will take up half of the time.

While the place is well set up...the crowd is too much and you spend over one hour waiting in long queues for each ride... You are most likely too exhausted to enjoy any ride as such... That said, good choice of rides including water themes etc. The express pass costs you too much as well. Stay away during weekends and holidays. Target going to this place only during off seasons. Value for money then. Finally, buy tickets online and use the 123 Bus for a free entry inside Sentosa.
15/10/19 There are 3 non-service raiders. Moreover, some shows are canceled. I regret spending money on going to this themepark.

3.review_text: Typical theme park. Great attractions, long queues, awful food. Some incredibly rude, pushy visitors made it worse than average.

Rides are fun and enjoyable but queues are looooooooooooooong loooong looooongg with even looooonger waiting times. Normal operating hours is till 10pm.We went on 4th of October on which there is a special event for Halloween, while purchasing the tickets from official sentosa site we were nt informed that we will be kicked out at 6pm of have to pay additional 50 to stay after 6pm and attend the event.

Some great rides and theme park atmosphere, but the Universal standard vs express queuing system is completely broken. The wait times are near meaningless (add at least 50%). The queues need to be renamed: standby & regular. 'Standby' - you pay for park entry but good luck getting onto more than a couple of rides all day as everyone in the "express" line will get priority; and 'regular' - where you pay a large ticket surplus so you can actually queue with everyone else who bought an express ticket and get onto several rides.

Slightly overhyped, not gonna lie. They have GOT to do sth about the longass queues because the duration of the rides is definitely not worth 3 hours of waiting AND the price. I remember waiting 45 min for a ride that lasted less than 1 min.

I liked very much Universal studios Singapore. I just think is not necessary to be so expensive just because is a tourist attraction. Horror nights is very nice and creative. But the queue is tooooo much. If youre patient then is recommended.... or go during weekdays

4.review_text: I had a great day here at Universal! Went on a quiet day and I am glad I had been to a universal so I had a general idea of how things were operated. I Found it strange how 100% of the seats for a ride is filled with Express pass holders and then the next round would be a mix of 'Express' and the 'Ordinary'. This made the 'Ordinary' queue not move at all at times.. That, plus the Singapore heat, would make you feel like you've been waiting for ages!

Do I need to say this!! But I'd like to point out one thing, you need more than a day and a lots n lots of patience. It took me 2.5hrs waiting in queue which said 70mins waiting time for a ride which lasted 5mins. Another, I had to wait for 90mins for a ride which lasts 1 minute.
Crowded..Waiting time is more for rides..Mummy theme ride person are cheater..They will tell you wrong waiting time..So you have to pay for lockers which they provide

Beautiful and adrenaline-filled. But the visit should be planned only for the whole day. Nothing else. Even 8 hours is barely enough here. The queues for 2 out of 3 were twice as long as what was written at the entrances to the attractions ((minus point for this..
Transformers, mummy is must do. A bit not fair for the lockers. Free 45 mins for mummy, but queue is long. Almost need to pay. 70 mins for inhuman, but we need to pay 6 sgd since very long Q.

5.review_text: The scenic spots are small and beautiful, and the restaurants are also unique, which is convenient whether in the park or out. The service attitude needs to be improved. It seems that Singaporeans dont even smile or say hello.
Waited in line for at most 30 minutes. Most of the rides we only queued for 5 minutes or less

I purchased admission and tickets in Korea. You can purchase it at Resort World Sentosas official website. Those who liked the rides bought the unlimited rides, and those who hated the rides bought only the admission tickets or the limited rides. For popular rides, even the Express had to wait about 15 minutes. I think you have to wait 3-4 times longer if you don't have an express ticket. The kids (6th graders) said the roller coaster was the most fun. I liked Transformers. If you have kids, go there in the morning and play all day. We went there around 11 and played until closing time, but the kids were disappointed and said they wanted to play more.
Do reach early to visit all the attractions. Lines get really long if late. One of the best attractions in Singapore

It is an amusement and tourist attraction in Singapore. The famous Universal Studios!! However, the area is small and there are a lot of tourists, so the waiting time for each ride is very long. It starts at 10 a.m. and closes at 6 p.m., so even if you go early on weekends, you won't be able to ride all the popular items unless you take the express.

1.review_text: I wouldn't waste my time or money on this place.The rides we did get on were good and I understand the long wait when the park is busy. But after lining up for 3 different rides for close to an hour to be told that each of these rides was then closed when we got to the very front of the line due to technical reasons (for two of the rides) and finally "inclement weather" on the third ride ruined our day. The "inclement weather" was not a cyclone but just a typical storm that seems to pass through Singapore every afternoon. The apparently "severe" weather then shut down almost all of the rides in the park leaving us feeling that we had wasted our money since we couldn't go on most of the rides that we had paid to use. The weather really was no worse than the usual daily rains in Singapore. Absolute waste of money.

It is pathetic experience as they usually open it around 8 pm night but god knows the ridiculous reasons for closing it at 6 pm eveyday. It should be made mandatory n make responsible to all the workers to inform if it is closing early with proper excuse they are opening n closing it on their whims and phancies which is immoral bcz as tourist it feels like cheated n yes it is the cheating. A warning make sure of the timing before coming to this place otherwise go to another more professional country or amusement parks to visit.

Disappointed, not enough shade. Overpriced and too many people paying to queue jump therefore making queues longer. We spent 5 hours there and only got to go on 4 rides due to the queue wait. Would not recommend.

If you enter your birthday month, you will receive a magnet pin. If you have this, you don't have to queue up when playing some games. When they see it's my birthday on you, they will put you in the priority area. Fortunately, there is a priority area, otherwise the queue would have been so long. The toilet was very smelly, and there was no water to wash in the toilet, which was very inconvenient.
It's too bad that it's so far away from Osaka that many key project failures cannot be dealt with immediately. Tourists are stuck in queues with no way to evacuate

2.review_text: I was really excited to go here while on vacation in Singapore. If you want to have an enjoyable experience you need to purchase an express pass. The first two rises I went on were enjoyable and the lines were reasonable and efficient. Then I queued for the Battlestar Galactica roller coaster. You have to store your stuff in a locker before entering the queue. The lockwrs are free for the first 100 min. Then cost money. Estimate for the line was 60 min. After waiting 85 min and getting near the front, there was an indeterminable delay and we just left in frustration. This was the second delay while in queue and no information was given regarding how long these would last. If we had stayed we would have exceeded 100min and been charged for the lockers. We had such a negative experience off this one ride alone we did a quick circuit of the park afterwards to see the sights and then left early. Wouldn't recommend.

Not many attractions compare to the park in Florida. Horrendous waiting times despite Monday outside of the main season waiting times not shown correctly (displayed 25 min, reality over an hour). If you want to come here spend the 40 SGD more for the express pass. Overall impression, not worth the money spent, there are better things to do in Singapore.

This place is completely disorganized. Onboarding and offbaording causes massive delays even though lines are NOT so long. Also don't believe in waiting times appearing in the Universal app, they're much longer. Equipment must be worn off as "technical breakes" happen quite often (causing even bigger delays). Food is awful (mostly really low quality junk food). All in all - not worth your time and . Go some place else on Sentosa or just enjoy your time by the pool in a hotel.

Place was good but they need to do something about the long qeue but i guess if they will do something about it they don't have much rides and people will not come again but if you can do something about it please do..... And some of the staffs were rude kindly do something about it too.. Peace

The Madagascar ride was horrible due the extreme foul odour coming from the restrainer bar from the boat ride, the stench was horrid and my feedback was greeted with a lackadaisical grin. Next is the Madagascar Carousel and again the safety belt emitted an pungent and repulsive stench that was apalling for such a theme park. Indeed a horrendous and smelly experience. Regret becoming a season pass holder.

3.review_text: The park and anything is fine, lost of perfection, great stuff for the children etc, just make sure you pay 50 extra to cut the line. We waited often up to an hour in line for a 30 second ride. And the staff there, if you ever wonder how national socialism became to such great power, watch the teenager who work there. Give them only the slightest power to tell customers off, and they will abuse it every given moment. No common sense or assessing individual situations, just blindly following retarded rules.

Not so big theme park as expected. Only two good rollercoasters - Human and Cylon (best in park). Also not so bad - Revenge of the Mummy. All others rides are poor. Transformers rides were under maintenance, so no opinion. What we liked most - Waterworld show. Really good one, must see. Better buy express passes, overcrowded even at weekdays. Overall - average theme park.

They have a separate express entry for all the rides n all who have express band can access all rides without a queue and others have to wait 40 to 60 min for 2 min ride thats so unfair and other people also have paid a good amount to the unversal studio so this is it rest all is good
Avoid going during holidays season otherwise you will end up wasting your time in queues only. Roller coaster will not be operational if it rains.
Service could be better, and they really need to update the rides

4.review_text: Singapore's alternative to Disneyland which is in some ways better due to the themes being more mature. This is another one of the must-visit attractions whenever you come to SG and 1 day might actually NOT be enough to go around this place since it's located on Sentosa Island (Resorts World SG) and there are a ton of things to do here. I've been here a lot of times as well and although the norm is waiting in line for 20-30mins per ride/attraction, I've been here maybe a couple of times when I could ride all i can due to the visitors being just a handful. Try to come when it's not peak season so that you can make the most of your visit but still, even if there are a lot of people in the park, it's still worth it.

This is my 4th visit. Universal pass? I paid to get fast-line entry because of Transformers, but it was closed that day. I'm not sure if notices are posted in advance, but if you can, check in advance. There were a lot of boys crying in front of the Transformer hall. Haha.

Visited USS on 4th Nov. Transformer ride was closed due to maintenance and my target spot- Elmo TV show was not available as well. Didnt see any minion and Elmo characters throughout the whole day Recommend tourist to get an express pass if you cannot bear the long queue. Get yourself a mini cooling fan too as the weather in Singapore is just way too hot! I tried Cylon, Mummy and Human rides and the rides were okay-okay and not so thrilling as described on the web. USJ would be much better than USS. Nevertheless, twas a great experience as the staffs and characters were really friendly and helpful. Worth a visit!
Great attractions, but the queues should be better organized

I heard that the specialty here is that the queue is very fast. But the more popular ones still had to queue for more than an hour. The Water World show is quite exciting and very attentive! Be careful, those sitting in the front may really get wet

5.review_text: Nice place but have to wait long in queue for every rides.....
Good place to enjoy, especially with family, but some rides were very long queue
Great experience but even longer the wait at almost all the attractions! If someone can, it might be worth paying a little more and getting priority access to the shows that have long waits!

Must visit.Plan ahead before visiting as you will save a lot of time if you plan properly. If possible avoid weekends and holiday as it will be too much crowded and u will have to spend most of time waiting in long queues. Do carry something to eat. Bags are not checked at gate. Food inside is expensive. Carry empty water bottle their are many tap to refill the same. Wear comfortable footwear as u have to walk a lot. Must check fireworks after 10 pm. Check for shows and plan accordingly. If possible see waterworld show in night. Must check attractions; Transformer,cyclone,jurassic park rapid adventure,waterworld,mummy,light camera action. For kids: All rides of Shrek and Madagascar. Worst attraction: Treasure hunter wait time is too much and not worth at all

Not sure, if I can add thats not said about the place. Has heck of rides and shows to blow your mind. The cyclone and Human is my personal favourite. But you really can't put your finger on anything thats not enjoyable here.

1.review_text: SERVICE After trying various paid attractions and also 5 star hospitality services in various different places in Singapore, I got the impression that the workers who served us in various places did not understand how to serve customers. Of course the customer is not king, but customers pay money to get their service. So customers hope to receive the service they have purchased like customers, not just receive their money and then ignore it. The staff (especially young people) at various rides on the USS are generally reluctant to provide even the slightest information and are rude even when answering basic questions from customers. For example, when I and other guests approached the entrance to the Cyclon (roller coaster), the staff spoke quickly and their English pronunciation was far from standard so it was difficult to understand, it was only natural for customers to ask "Excuse me, what do you mean by this is the last hour?" the staff even got angry and shouted in response while looking away "10 minutes" he said. It turned out that the ride was taking a break for 10 minutes and there was no announcement, so many customers continued to come to the ride because they didn't know. Instead of conveying information about the break and when it would reopen, the staff immediately rejected customers curtly. It's not surprising that if other customers asked when it would reopen, the staff answered by shouting, rudely, curtly and angrily while turning around. Interestingly, in contrast to the attraction staff found on the streets in Universal Studios who are warm and smiling. These non-vehicle staff try to greet and smile at every customer passing by and don't even hesitate to ask them to take a group photo. OVERALLS The place is not big. Likewise with the number of rides, it is quite small. The only advantage or attraction of the USS is the roller coaster. If Dufan had a roller coaster that was better or at least the same as USS, of course the experience at USS would be even less memorable. The service from the workers at the rides is bitchy, rude, angry, degrading people who can't understand what they are saying as a sign that the tourists don't speak English, even though the tourists are fluent in English. Even though the experience offered by USS can be enjoyed and some of it is enjoyable, it all disappears or becomes less impressive because of the service provided by the staff who are rude, uninformative, lazy, angry, rude, etc.

overcrowded - there should be a limit of people entering, at least 3-4 times less than are here right now (but you know: ) 2,5h waiting for the rides - it is not a fun, all people around are frustrated and angry and this is on Monday!!!!

Worst experience ever. Let in so many visitors for the day where every ride's waiting time is at least 90mins and yet there are a few rides that are down with technical issues.... wonder why we pay so much for such an experience
Rides are getting delayed and the theme park needs intensive maintenance

Universal express pricing method is way too greedy of the park. The rides queuing time is horrendous, but the rides are good quality. Food is horrible and very much overpriced. They recently changed the drinks so normal drinking water is no longer sold (WTF?) instead replaced by a disgusting alkaline water.

2.review_text: Two major attractions are not operating and still charged the same price. The restaurant food is 3x more expensive and quality is horrible. Express pass should be helpful but who wants to buy express pass when two major attractions are not operating?? Very bad experience.

There are better experiences in other locations in Singapore. I enjoy theme parks and have visited many across four continents, and this is the first major park where I left early, disappointed. Wait times were eye wateringly long 2-3 hours for the major attractions, and there were a few breakdowns. Food prices were even further above the normally inflated prices. Anyway, if you still need to go, their are a few good things to know- * bring a water bottle, there are plenty of refill stations * staff are really friendly and helpful * fast passes will get your wait times back to tolerable if you have the extra coin. I'm not sure if paying the extra just encouraged the park not to fix wait times though * food in the Lost World area is more local style, and the best priced option, or there are options nearby outside the park

The workers were not helpful, I asked one of the workers where to go and he pointed in the wrong direction. I found it using the map provided. Most of the rides were closed due to weather conditions but it had stopped raining. Most of the customers were walking around because most rides were closed so it was really crowded. During the ride Treasure Hunters, they kept making announcements saying that their machine wasnt working and that there would be a short delay, which nothing looked wrong with the machine nor was it raining.
Pretty average place. Over hyped. We visited this on a weekday still some rides had 1.5 to 2hrs of wait time in queue. You can't cover all rides. Food, souvenirs are extremely over priced.

I have been to various parks around the world but hated this one. We did not enjoy ourselves. It was overcrowded and the waiting time was unbearable. Everything is overpriced and designed to sell you stuff including express passes. The 4d show used old effects, camera lights is just too short although very interesting. After waiting over 2 hours at the Jurassic park we couldn't stand it anymore and decided to leave. The food is also just cheap fastfood for prices of a restaurant.

3.review_text: Overcrowded. Most rides are closed and the ones that are open are at least an hour's queue but they are at least decent if you are willing to stand in lines all day. A/C not working in many places. The park attendants are rude.
Too many queues and you can't enjoy the rides
Make a time pass system. For some attractions. People have to queue up to 3 hours. The queue starts at 10.45... The gate has just opened... The other attractions are all old but still fun...

The sign outside the rides doesn't show correct waiting time. We were queuing on Transformers 3D. The sign showed 90 minutes but we waited for more than 2 hours. Also, Universal Studio should put better sign within the queue area so we know how far away we are from the rides. We were going from 1 room to another room without knowing how far away we are from the rides. There are not so many rides for older children. My daughter was 11 when we went there. She only found Rapid River, Galatica (Human and Cylone) and transformers interesting. The rest of the rides are meant for younger children.

The park is rather small with more food and souvenir booths than actual attractions. It is very crowded and the waiting times are nowhere below 60 minutes which really took the fun out. I wouldn't come here again.

4.review_text: The place is good with some great rides and roller coasters, plus characters from Universal Studios. The downside is it is crowded most of the time and you need to queue up from 30 mins to 1 hour for each ride. It would be good if they set a daily quota for visitors so everyone can enjoy rides without having to queue for very long. They do have a special pass/express pass to avoid long queues however it is quite expensive and isn't worth the number of rides available there. Overall the place is good but crowded and long queues.
Wait times were very high for all rides same was the case with express pass holders. Could only do 4 rides properly.

Kiddos paradise. All outdoor activities closed when there's thunder (regardless its sunny day or rainy day). Normal queue takes about 1-2 hours for the ride, I went in school holiday (weekday, SG school orientation day). Things Must Do: WaterWorld Show, Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure (min. height for ride approx. 110cm), Enchanted Airways (min. height for ride approx. 100cm)
The amusement facilities are very exciting, so there are so many people that I have to queue up. I feel envious when I look at the priority lanes. This place taught me the truth of "Time is money"

Great attractions, but there are long waiting times, especially on weekends. A FastPass is recommended. Unfortunately, as is often the case in amusement parks, the food is fast food without any special features.
