5.review_text: Great rides, good atmosphere and I went on a weekday when it finally didn't rain in Singapore after very long. So basically, even with a standard ticket, I had maximum 20 mins of waiting time on an average per ride.

I was worried about visiting Universal Studios Singapore, as my partner is not one for roller coasters or theme parks. In fact he hadn't been on a rollercoaster in nearly 20 years, but I was about to change all that with our trip here. In preparation for our day out at USS, we bought the fast-track passes which more than earned their keep as the wait times for some rides were around forty minutes plus. And this was on a Thursday, too! It also meant that my partner didn't have too much time to stop and think before we found ourselves strapped in. Thanks to the fast-track pass (and my powers of persuasion) my partner and I managed to go on nearly every ride, which given his earlier hesitation I found incredible. We worked our way from the Madagascar rides all the way to the dueling Battlestar Galactica roller coasters, and I couldn't have been more proud. Whether it was the magic of being on holiday or a special something about USS, I can't say for certain, but what I do know is that he can't wait to go to another theme park. Seriously, however, I cannot stress the importance of the fast-track pass. Im a annual pass holder, and visiting USS every months. On 1st Dec around 14:50hrs, we were queuing for the ride CYLON, and met an extremely rude & unprofessional staff for the first time. I couldnt get her name since she just walked away but she was wearing yellow color jacket & Chinese looks, wearing a spec, and a ponytail hair. Just because of we are Japanese, she said several Japanese words towards us such as; mendokusai which means troublesome! Thank you so much for your kind words ya. Totally disappointed and we immediately left USS after the ride.

It was crowded and the all ride waiting time was between the range of 70-120mins.. so please reach early to experience your favourite rides. There are a lot of street performances so you can enjoy that. Food inside is quite on the expensive side. You can only carry water bottles containing water inside and you can refill at the filling stations so please don't carry prepacked food as you will have to throw them away
Amazing theme park but too crowded. Have to queue more than 2 hours during weekend for a game
Friendly place, Id recommend purchasing the fast track tickets before entry due to long queue times. Rides were brilliant!

1.review_text: Its a theme park and yeah its always busy and crowded. So the long wait for each ride is understandable. But what makes the situation worse are the staff. 1. They never smile. If I give a dollar for each staff that I see smile, I would never finish 10 for the entire day. 2. They act like police officers. I have seen a number of staff scolding visitors or raising their voice because they (visitors) dont understand them. 3. Very low frustration tolerance. Staff must understand that some of the visitors are first time theme park goers. Staff have no patience and would even talk to them in a very condescending tone. Im a season pass holder to save money whenever I need to bring some friends who are visiting Singapore. So what I mentioned above are recurring observations.

The service attitude is extremely poor. It is probably a place I would not want to visit again in an Asian paradise. "Each" service staff of the park definitely needs more than 6 months of education and training. Shrek 4D Cinema, when we first entered the theater, the service staff explained that he shushed the guest three times in a row, which was very rude. Then he shushed the guest two more times. Can you not speak? During the 55-minute wait in line for Treasure Hunt, the instrument completely stopped twice. Of course, it is necessary under safety conditions, but the service staff looked indifferent to the guests and did not explain it. Even when the machine stopped for the second time, they looked at each other and laughed, and the guests in line were so sad that they wanted to cry. It ended by picking up an empty can under a game vehicle. Not only did the guests have no interest in playing at this time, but the service staff were still completely stupid, as if the only thing that was interesting was when the machine was down. All of these happened on January 25, 2020. Compared to Hong Kong, which I have visited more than a dozen times, the Japanese Disney service staff are full of smiling professionalism, allowing guests to feel a full atmosphere of joy as soon as they enter the park. "Universal Studios Singapore is really disappointing."

Appalling queue management. The estimated times provides by the app and also at the attraction entrances were simply outrageously underestimated. We queued 2 hrs 20 min for a purported 50 min queue ride. Food price is also outrageously expensive.
bad experience a long wait for one ride but at the end of the queue the ride was stopped and the locker officer at the rapid adventure ride was not friendly and did not provide a solution jani**
Bad customer service. Lack of management. Tranaformer ride does not work. Lot of guests wait more than 1 hour and have to exit. No crew members to direct guests. There was no apology to guests.

2.review_text: It was the worst part of my trip to singapore. Heavily crowded. Have to wait 50-80 mins in long queues to het into the ride. Was a waste of time and energy. Please take express ticket if u go there as the people with express tickets has priority in queue. It costs around 150-210 additional to normal ticket. Highly disappointed
Long lines . Expensive food and overpriced merchandise. Breakdowns and glitches. Some good stuff I guess but mostly mediocre rides. A long day. Kids wont mind it though.

Could be better managed. Slow ride transitions on Madagascar carousel due to only 1 staff member. Mannerisms of staff leave room for improvement - some rude attitudes. English language announcements are barely understandable. Suggest using Tky Disneylands fast pass system which is fairer.

1. This place is small compared to its other establishments in say osaka, japan; hollywood, california. 2. It's been almost 3 years since they did a last refresh. Attractions are pretty outdated. 3. Of course, my evaluation shall be based on cost effectiveness: hell expensive ticket and little attractions. 4. Do not bother coming

5 years I awaited to enter USS again,Each year I tormented myself to waiting due to Certain circumstances. Today on the 6th of Jan 2020 when I finally got a season pass for myself and my fiance, I was happy with the Service of the staff but you know what made it terrible experience? I remembered USS for the amazing food and I wouldn't mind paying A certain price for it but 5 YEARS, 5 YEARS I waited since the last time I went and what I got was mediocrity for food. I remembered Friar good food had this Fish and Chips that was Amazing,n had anything like it. I had the Cheeseburger at Mel's, new York street and I'm shocked at the fact that there wasn't even any actual cheese in it. Not cheese sauce. Please rethink the menu as although it's a good portion, it is not satisfactory. Even McDonald's or any high end restaurant would have a decency to place actual cheese in a CHEESEburger. You want people to come back? It's not about the rides but it's the good food and service as well.

3.review_text: Highly variable theme park that has clearly seen better days. The transformers ride is simply amazing and almost worth the entry fee alone but the rest is very poor. Insanely long queues often well over an hour for sub standard rides- sure you can buy an accelerator pass, which was 110 per person the day we went for one fast pass per ride or 140 for unlimited. So youre looking at 1k for a family of 4 to actually stand a chance of enjoying the place and this was on a week day in Singapore school term time. The Penguins ride quoted 10 minute queue, was actually 45 minutes with awful blaring music the whole time playing different things from multiple speakers. In fact, most of the quoted queue times were half of what they really took. One big plus was the cleanliness and number of bathroom facilities and ease to get around generally. If you can tolerate the queues or find a quiet time then at least the infrastructure is very good.

Rides are good. But lot of rush. Have to wait for 100 minutes for some rides. It wastes lot of time and energy.Suggestion is to limit number of persons entering per day. Disney land Hongkong better managed

Unparalleled experience, with most of the excitement gone with the toooo long queues! The waiting time spans from 30-100 minute per attraction. Attraction time is just a few minutes! They are overselling tickets too much, almost ruining the experience. Kids go mad in long and hot queues.
Mediocre in general. The employees need to improve seriously the attention quality to the guests/clients. They don't know what amiability means, as most of the people in the city.

I was pretty disappointed with Universal in Singapore. I have been to Japan previously and was excited to see Singapores take. Unfortunately, my partner and I found it more suited to kids in terms of a lot of attractions and rides. The rides that were not so kid friendly were wait times of about 45 minutes even on a week day. When an express pass costs an extra 40 on top of your approx 80 ticket, it becomes a bit much for a day out. Its a large park but I think that you can get your fill in one day provided you arent fussed about trying every ride in there. Personally would recommend Sentosa over this if you had to choose between the two and arent fussed about theme parks.

4.review_text: Long queues without a modern queuing system means that you will spend 70% of your time in queues and 20% walking between attractions with a remaining maximum 10% on the attractions themselves. Not really worth the money considering Disney offers more for the same amount.

It was our first time in such a large amusement park. This is probably why, overall, we liked it. The queues are unreal, especially in the first half of the day. Often the waiting time indicated at the entrance does not correspond to reality; sometimes we waited longer. Google maps at the park indicates that it is open until 20:00 on Friday, all the swings were closed at 19:00 - we did not count on this. If you want to have a good ride, its better to come late in the evening - probably 16:00. At other times there are hourly queues( It is better to ride only on the top swings - the rest are not worth your time. Dragons are no fun - you constantly think about how not to get wet, the attraction itself is uninteresting. The swing in the jungle is also useless. Better than roller coasters, Egypt and transformers. Another cool special effects show. We didn't like the rest.

Well to be honest i didn't like it much. It's not that they have given me bad service it's because the place is not friendly for people who has motion sickness. Its all about rollercoaster rides and if you are a guy who hates rollercoasters then this place is not for you. Apart from that the waiting time for the rides are too long. We had like 2 to 3hr waiting time.i still gave 4 stars because they are doing a great job of keeping the place clean and tidy. Even though they get 8000 to 10000 guests per day the place looks neat. Character visits are also not enough when the park is busy. And the food inside is expensive.

Awesome theme park, great for family, group of friends. Try to avoid enter in peak season, since the average waiting time can be reach 1.5hrs (normal queue). Express pass is so expensive (200 SGD compared to 81 normal pass)

Fun day trip with the kids to this really high quality theme park. There is a good mix of attractions for both small and large children. There are plenty of places to eat, although it is quite expensive to eat there (even for being in Singapore). Unfortunately, the waiting times for the attractions are quite long (and we were there on a Wednesday). Each attraction has a sign showing how long the waiting time is but unfortunately these are often wrong and the actual waiting time is often much longer than stated. Also advises downloading the app which has a good overview of the park with associated information.

5.review_text: If you have a chance to come to Singapore, you must come! If there are not many people, half a day is enough. Queues for popular facilities take about an hour at most. Tickets are relatively cheap compared to other neighboring countries. It is an amusement park for adults.

Super place in Sigapore, Rides are crowded during weekend, food is ok stunt show is good but management/arrangement was not proper, every one has to rush to get the place no proper queue management, all hussel and bussel, no one bothering about kids and aged.

We caught up with the last wave of Christmas performances in 2019, and everyone was mobilizedThe amusement park is not big and it is easy to walk the children! There are many interactive points, but the time is limited and the number of people is limited. The most regrettable thing is that the Transformers game has been queued for almost an hour before we finally got there. It said there was a machine failure... I dont know how long we have to wait! Why dont we all take the time to prepare for the next quick pass and feel more balanced Where to eat, you can go out to eat at the food court, which is much cheaper! A little bit of mashed potatoes and two sausages and a drink costing 12 Singapore dollars is too drunk
Wonderful experiences yesterday. From the membership counter to the rides, the attendants are friendly and patience. Best to go for an Express tickets if you want to skip the queue.
You cant visit often if you are a tourist. Take express pass to see all attractions without wasting time in queue.

1.review_text: Check out my photos for current studio information and like this review if it has been helpful to you! I was unable to negotiate even a small discount at the entry gate. I would have loved to go in but to attract more tourists perhaps a weekday/half day discount ticket should be made available. It was very empty here today, absolutely no lines and very few people even wandering around outside the gates. I would have happily paid 40 SGD to enter for the 4 hours I would have been able to enjoy the park. Tough luck USS, see ya next time!
They are very strict with absurd rules, very poorly organized, a very small park and collapsed due to the excess of express passes that they sell without control. I don't recommend it.
The 55 that has been excessively for what they offer, after opening from 10:00 to 17:00. It should be at most 15 for what they offer. Unacceptable.

It's so small and there isn't much to ride, but there are so many people. Is the indoor size of Lotte World the same? In terms of rides alone, Everland and Lotte World are much more fun. There is no Harry Potter and the souvenirs are poor and expensive. I went there with the intention of staying all day, but I just left around 3:30 PM. I was curious about Universal so I went there once, but I don't think I'll ever come here again.
We were able to ride three rides from 10:30 in the morning to 16:30 in the evening. This was the only event that made me regret the money we paid. Try not to coincide with holidays.

2.review_text: I decided to go for Battlestar Galactica for my first ride and had to put my bag in the nearby locker with a time limit expiry. The ride broke down halfway through my queue. In the end, the waiting time which was supposed to be 45 mins came up to be nearly 2 hours as they keep letting express pass holders through instead of clearing those who were stuck during the breakdown. Upon returning to the locker immediately after the ride, it was locked up due to expiry of time limit and I was forced to pay a fine to retrieve my belongings despite trying to explain the situation to the locker crew. There weren't any staff that could redress such issues at the BSG. There weren't any staff available along the way as well and I have to make my way all the way back to the ticket entrance customer service. And there was such a long queue that the usher outside the office advised me to come back later. Basically, it is compulsory to place all your belongings in lockers located near the entrance of thrilling rides. I have seen more than a few riders being sent off because they have stuff inside their pockets just before their turn for the ride. You will definitely be bored to death while queuing more than 60 minutes without your mobile phone and stuff, especially if you are a single rider. So be mentally prepared.
ok place, do not go on weekends since lot of rush and for every ride there is a queue for 1 and half hour minimum
I am extremely disappointed when I visited that most of the fun rides are under repair. There should have been a warning prior to the purchase of my tickets.
Dissapointed that the park had to be closed earlier than expected

3.review_text: - most rides are using outdated technologies, same ones as in the LA universal studios i visited in year 2000. No rides with more recent technologies as i enjoyed in Disney Orlando in 2015. - not much interesting rides, results in a very long wait time on those rides. Maybe only 4 from the total of 28 rides are great, the others are standard and mostly can be found in any other amusement park. Even for the 'standard' rides the wait could be long as well; thus not worth it if you're on the regular lines. - overpriced, and the pricey express pass is not worthed considering the limited choices of interesting rides they have. - better to be a single rider instead to beat the very long and tiring queue. More likely you will be assigned on different vehicles, but for me it is acceptable compared to waiting on the very long regular line. - closes too early at 7:00 PM on weekdays, on weekends they closes at 8:00 PM but the queue is longer as well. they also easily closed the rides for safety reasons when there's just a little rain, which adds up the frustration. Don't come on a rainy day anyway. - for those reasons, i think coming here just once is enough. better to go to trans studio bali instead... It is way cheaper, less than half the price, and has more recent technology rides.

It was pretty ok, some fun rides. Park is not that big and some rides are a waste of time. Staff dosn't really care and seems bored. We were visiting in off season so it was kinda empty. If the park was filled with people it honestly could be a 2 star rating.
Long wait bad food hour and a half wait per ride
By Orlando standards park is outdated. No Dragon alley or Harry Potter rides in Singapore. In general park is clean , accessible and located in very nice island Sentosa.

It is more compact than USJ. I wonder if there is an additional charge for lockers where you can leave your luggage when riding thrilling attractions for more than 40 minutes. I waited in line for 2 hours so I paid double the price

4.review_text: A rather small yet nicely themed theme park with some outstanding attractions. Namely: Battlestar Galactica, Transformers the Ride and Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. The queue times varied between a max of 50 minutes to litterly empty queues. The average wait time during my visit was /- 5 minutes per ride. Looking at the parks history they are adding new attractions regularly. With Battlestar Galactica now reaching an age of 10 years the park is in need of a new thrill-ride to stay relevant for thrillseekers. In my opinion a Spinning-coaster would be a grate addition to the already grate lineup. A rather compact spinning-coaster could fit just perfectly in the upcoming "Minion Park". Universal Studios Singapore is worth visiting during a Singapore stay.

First time visited universal studio singapore. Great vibes and lot of stalls and souvenir shops before the entrance gate. Sadly I can't really give 5 rates to Universal Studio Singapore because some reasons : 1. I arrived at Sentosa Island around 10 am, and for I know the gate is open at 10am ( sorry if i'm wrong ). but after a loooooonggggggg queue, the gate was opened at 11am. I'm not really sure what was the cause. Oh, and I was used the regular ticket, not the express pass. But it was okay. we were passed the entrance gate around 11.30 am. 2. Second problem, in the morning the attractions were mostly closed. I just got into maybe 1 or 2 attractions at the first round. Because we already finished circling the theme park around at 1pm, we decided to go around one more time. And in second around, we notice some of the attraction started to opened. It's kinda sad because they didn't give us a good reason why the attraction was closed. 3. My girlfriend said, its a little bit small for a theme park because she already visited disney land in Hongkong last year. But I can said, for the first timer, I have so much fun, especially in transformers attraction. it's really cool tho. So for me 4/5 stars i think ;)

I always bring visiting friends and family to USS and have a good time here. I visit a few times a year for a few years now. The only thing is there are no new rides and Ive been to almost all the rides already so it gets rather boring. And I notice there is lesser and lesser queue now too. Which is good cos I dont have to wait 2 hours to ride transformer now but I honestly dont think each entry worth 60-70 anymore. Their Annual pass costs 200 too. With stewp price and same old show/ride I dont think I will come back
Clearly the Universal parks in Orlando and those in California are much better. But if you are in Singapore it is an option to spend a pleasant afternoon. It's small. There are not too many people.
Queuing requires patience

5.review_text: Good theme park in Singapore. You should go on weekdays and go in the opposite direction that people usually go to avoid wasting time queuing. Everyone should keep time to play all the games and participate in all the shows.
Some rides are really worth the wait time. General Wait time is 20-30 mins per ride. The key to avoid it is to start with Mummys Rides. TIA!

Want to experience Universal Studios theme park in Southeast Asia? This is definitely the perfect place for you. One thing I didn't like about it was a very long queue getting on the train to get there or to get back home. And also the heat during dry season. Bring your umbrella!

It opens at 10am, but the place gets crowded right after opening. Fastpasses were expensive, but I'm glad I bought them and was able to go around a lot. I recommend Transformers because you can ride it easily in the single-person lane. *We don't have time to talk anyway, so even if there are multiple people, it's better to line up here.

Due to a technical fault, it started an hour late and ended at 5 PM. The two roller-coasters here - Human and Cyclon are amazing. I also liked the Transformers ride. Locker facilities are provided where required. The queues can be really long. Sometimes some rides are unavailable throughout the day. The park has a lot of Halal food options and also a dedicated prayer space.

1.review_text: The rides are average but customer service has plenty of room for improvement. The staff have poor manners and they are clearly not trained. I didn't walk in to expect a Disneyland experience but I certainly didn't expect to walk out feeling like I had been just another chore, another person in the queue to the theme park staff, considering the fact that I had paid 80 to get in. At the raptor meet and greet, a random officer interrupted and snarled "no more!" when I was just telling my husband about the queue for photo. At the Goldilocks eatery, we were given a buzzer for our waffles that never buzzed. 30 minutes later, we went back to the counter and they told us either somebody else took our food or they forgot about our order. So we had to wait another 30 minutes as our 16-month-old toddler grew impatient. At Treasure Hunters, our attempt to take a photo was met with a crass "no photo!" I saw them using similar tone on other visitors, too.
A lot of queue in Universal Studios. Don't recommend this attraction. For now, don't think that there are tourists there anymore.
No hand sanitizer for use. Not all rides are cleaned after use....pls bring your own hand sanitizer and wet wipes.

Today I tried calling to universal studio to ask if they are open before making my way there. No one answers the phone and plays only recording of unrelated information. No option to speak to someone, hangs up automatically. Very Poor customer service.

3.review_text: We had a baby with us so my perspective will be different to most. Plenty of rides available. The food was good. Very busy and crowded but people looked like they were enjoying themselves. Note all the hotels seem to provide buses at the same time resulting in everyone converging at the same time at the Studios. Meaning long queues if one has not pre-booked. Arrive an hour later and no real queuing problems. Check out the aquarium it's great.

We didn't like it that much. Were there on Monday and still had to wait up to 80 minutes. And if there are people with express passes, it can take longer. The shows were fine. What we liked best was the show in Waterworld (12:30 and 3:00 p.m.). Phantasialand in Germany is, in our opinion, much better.

4.review_text: A main attraction in Singapore which boasts a number of different areas, each with its own theme. Very much like all other theme parks around the world. Expect queues, especially during peak periods!

One of the biggest advantages of universal studios Singapore is it's well planned design of the entire place. All the attractions are situated at the right distance so that it's easy to get around the attractions. The only caveat is the waiting time for each attractions especially the popular ones like the transformers and roller coaster which has one of longest waiting time. My advice would be to go to these attractions right after the park opens or go after the rush hours. Also try not to miss the Waterworld show. I hope my review was helpful to you. Thank you for reading and have a nice day!

The park is not big, but it is quite fun. There are many people on holidays, so you have to wait for more than 40 minutes for each facility. If finances permit, it is recommended to buy a fast pass ticket.

I left a little early, but waited in line before entering. Because of the heavy rain, I couldn't go on many rides, but there weren't many people, so the waiting time for the rides was short. However, Universal Studios Osaka seems to be bigger and have more fun rides.
Best place for Adventure rides but for vegetarian this place is nightmare.. Nothing to eat except nonveg..

5.review_text: I went today! It was empty, probably due to the influence of Corona. There is almost no waiting time for rides. I conquered the attraction. There are no food-related souvenirs, so the only souvenirs available are things like stuffed animals and keychains. I think I would have enjoyed it more if I could speak English, so I would like to study a little more.

Even though the virus is spreading wildly, this means less people go out, which means lesser queues! Either way, at this time, you should get the free 6 month season pass with a one-day ticket! The rides overall are fun, especially my favourite being Battlestar Galactica. It's fun, and both for adults and kids. Definitely recommend a Express pass though. Overall, great and fun, but the things there are a little expensive, so bring your own food and drinks (There are water coolers). Bring a poncho, in case of rain and if you want to ride the Jurassic Rapids Adventure. :)
Great rides, but you spend more time queueing up than enjoying the rides.

Like what people says, it's a must place to visit when you're at Singapore or specially at Sentosa Island. Easy to access from everywhere. It needs a full day to enjoy all the playground. You can start queue from 10 AM 'cause it's always full even in the low season. If you have more cash you can buy the VIP ticket.
Crowded, take the klook early entry pass in case you don't have money for the skip the queue pass! Worth a visit! One whole day would be gone to relax and enjoy this place

2.review_text: The queues are really long and tiring. Rides were nothing really great, the day was awful with waiting in queues with kids under the hot sun.

3.review_text: Not enough rides. Waiting time was too long. Nothing to do while waiting except your phone (if you have one, which you probably have because your using one right now). Only three, four rides were fun. Rest were quite boring unless you arechicken -hearted

5.review_text: That's really cool, in Indonesia there are no ceunah You have to use a map of the USS area so you don't get lost and don't go around, it's easy to get to the ride quickly. But just be prepared when you hold a map while walking, there will definitely be lots of strangers who will ask us questions One day is not enough to explore and ride all the rides. One ride can take more than an hour alone, the queue is really big, wow! Even at that time, the queue for Transformers could take 2 hours and Jurassic World 1.5 hours If you have more money, my advice is to use fast track. BTW, there are lots of photo spots guys, for those who prefer to immortalize the moment, don't forget to wear cool ootds and the most important thing is to wear clothes that aren't hot, if possible, bring a hat/umbrella.
Staff maintained smile and service standard even during Covid-19 situation. The offers for the 6 months ticket is hard to beat but too bad the circuit breaker kicked in.

really.... It was so much fun! Be sure to go. I went there 3 months ago, and there was an express, but because of COVID-19, there were so few people, so I didn't wait and got on it almost right away! I didn't wait right away and got on the popular one where I went to Mummy and Transformers. But there were two downsides! It was hot. It was humid because of the mask... I ended up skipping the express because there weren't too many people

Transformer is very good... Although I waited in line for about an hour, there was not enough time to play more times. There were many people in the park, so I couldn't play the entire park. If I have a chance, I will go to the park again and have a great time.

4.review_text: It's a great time to bring your kids here. The only problem is that the famous roller coaster is under maintenance.

I think there cannot be a review left for this place. This is an amazing amusement park, wonderland and best rides ever. I would suggest take a full day to spend and do the rides. Reach here as soon as the park opens. I love the mummy ride. The queue in ride share usually very long. Enjoy your time here.

5.review_text: Its fun, but some facilities have to wait in line for a long time

Great place. Very beautiful and worthy. The park is not very big. And, unfortunately, we didnt get on any of the attractions due to long queues. I was impressed by the musical or theater on the water, it was cool! The guys are professionals.

Arriving at Universal studios it was late, and we were in a hurry because we had to continue our journey to Johor, Malaysia. Maybe it would be better if the photos were during the day/evening and not too late/dark. Don't forget to buy popcorn...thank you see next time
lots of things to see. need more than one day for see full park

1.review_text: Playing major amusement facilities requires you to store all your belongings in lockers, and you will have to pay extra to store them, which is quite expensive. The attitude of the service staff is poor, the rides are old, and when the roller coaster is broken, they actually announce that tourists can continue to wait. I dont know when it will be repaired. I spent money and didnt have fun. I wont go to the place I want to go again. Its a waste of money.

They are encouraging you to get tickets but as soon as you get in, youre not allowed entry to any attraction because they say its fully booked- which it is not. Had to convince them that theres no line (which they should be able to see) before they let us in.. such a bad experience

Went first Saturday after re-opening after CB. Complete joke. Werent told when we got our tickets it only opens 2pm onwards (unlike 10am normally). So already had to came back at 2pm. Immediately long queues for every ride. 45min to get on Transformer ride, 40min for Madagascar. They left 2/3rds the seats empty for social distances, which I understand but even within family groups? The worse was the carousel... where they onto used 1 out of 6 seats... !! So families with small kids queuing 30-50min in the hot just to watch an empty carousel going around and around... see the photo I just uploaded... of a MOVIE carousel and a 40min queue... ! In the end we only managed 3 rides in total before coming home for dinner. So unhappy, and really disappointed kids.

3.review_text: I wouldnt come with a normal pass during Covid time. Either get express pass or rather not come. Waiting times are just crazy for main attractions. (1.5h each) Most rides run with reduced capacity (at least 50% lower), and main attractions are constantly busy with people having express pass running several times. (I have seen same family of 4 people at least 4 times) Queuing system gives absolute priority to express lane which makes waiting times for regular lanes significantly increase. The park is open for shorter hours and you would feel lucky if you can just do 3-4 major attractions. Safe distancing measures seem to be well respected, and staff also clean the handles, seats after each ride.
Well managed covid processes. But some rides had very long wait times.
Too crowded. Queue always gets cut by people with premium pass.
Every ride has such long queues. Waiting under the hot sun is agonising.
Came during post CB. I appreciate that staff are cleaning the seats after every rider but the same cloth has been used the entire day without wash

4.review_text: Fun but long waiting time for some rides food is overpriced
Bubble Bee line up like years, it just too long (more than 2 hours) n there is no way to let people rest their feet. The design of line up so crazy, please make a better arrangement for visitors.

Great place to be with family and friends. Its full of fun, great rides. Very crowded place even in weekdays. You can spend an entire day and would still want to come back the next day. For few rides, be prepared to stand in a queue for an hour or more. Not many restaurants though. Very limited food available.
The rides are very fun. The Q management could be done better. Restaurant prices are Abit too high

Went there at the beginning of the year in January 2020. The weather is hot and stuffy. It rains regularly The place is very wide. Even if you come on a weekday, you have to queue to enter each point. It is recommended that if you want to play quickly, buy a VIP pass come on weekdays.

5.review_text: A very good tourist attraction as there are many rides but not as many as other universal studios E.G. USJ,USH. But for me personally I have went there many many times so its kind of boring for me but maybe if its your first time it would be fun hopefully and also it has the tallest duelling roller coaster

1.review_text: RW resorts world is incredibly difficult to deal with and good luck if you need any assistance. Their website is only useful if you're there to drop money. No way to contact any of the hotels. Requested a quote and heard nothing back. Issues with your ticket for a theme park? You'll need to jump through multiple hoops before you can talk to a person on chat to get any assistance. And even them most of the people on the chat are barely helpful or friendly. For a company that boasts first class vacation experience this really falls short.

2.review_text: Just a suggestion,Maybe they should revise their entry fee charges for those below 1.2meter, because they a unable to play most of the ride.. Pay full payment for the tix but can't take the ride. Sad..
Same stuffs and rides.

3.review_text: Beautiful place but the queue tho especially during the phase 2 season is ridiculous. 70/80 mins queue to enjoy a ride that lasts 1-2 mins definitely aint worth it.

A lot attractions are closed and there is safe distancing in all rides. This means reduced capacity and looooong Q. Say wait 30min... I wait 50min. Cannot read clock Universal Studio? Also no shows and not many street performances. I think best wait phase 3 or go weekday.

I went on 8/10. I was told that I could enter the park with a ticket that would allow me to enter the park from 12:00, and that I could ride the rides from 2:00 pm, but some of them actually started operating from around 1:30 pm. Although there are quite a few people inside the park, the number of people who can ride the attractions is strictly limited, so when popular attractions like Revenge of the Mummy get a little crowded, the wait times can get much longer. Since there are only a limited number of attractions in operation, I finished most of the rides and returned home around 4pm, but I think it's the only time there aren't many people, so that was a good thing.

The latest opening hours are 2pm - 9pm. (General admission ticket/annual ticket/Season pass) Early admission requires an additional 9SGD (admission is available at 12pm) Therefore, the advantage of buying tickets before (you can enter early at 10 o'clock) is gone. Many entertainment facilities are closed The waiting time is very long On average, you need to wait in line for more than 1 hour and 20 minutes for each ride. Amusement measures issues The water play project in Jurassic park was closed for a long time due to technical problems. We who bought the tickets felt it was not worth it. Because this amusement measure is a key amusement project. Ps. Reservations are required to enter the park! If the number of people entering the park on that day is full, you will not be able to enter. Ps. Currently only open Thursday - Sunday. Please check the official website for other updates
Its fun but you have to wait till 12.00p.m to go in and have to wait for another 2h to go on the rides other that that it was hot and the food was AMAZING

4.review_text: Most of the rides are closed. Most of the restaurants also closed. The foodcourt offered local food which I'm local. And they charge almost 60 per adult ticket, I find it overpriced. But kudos to the staff, trying to make this work in the hot sunny humid weather.

Theme park with nice environment and set pieces. Not too crowded early on a Thursday with social distancing (1200-1430; some rides open before 1400), but got more crowded after (1430-1700). Was disappointed that all watercoolers closed (COVID measures) and some technical issues in rides (apparently not a normal occurrence), but customer service rep apologised after email in (1 star). Waiting time for popular rides during social distancing around 50-70 mins, kids rides maybe 20-40 mins.

Despite the strict measures of Covid 19, still this place is a fun & memorable place to be. Need to be more patience in the queue & longer waiting time. The place is not crowded even though during weekend. Best to visit during weekdays. Fyi, during this period, opening hours is from 2pm to 9pm. Thursday till Sunday only.
Very nice to walk around especially since there is lesser people now. Pro tip, some stalls have unwritten promo like 2 drinks for 10 instead of 1 for 7.

5.review_text: Back again after a few months because I bought the half season pass. Playing pretend to be tourist in own country on a weekday has its perks as crowd is much thinner, mostly due to COVID-19. Interestingly, where we didnt see a lot of people, the rides are chock full of them as the waiting time stretches up to 1.5 hrs to 2 hrs, notably due to social distancing and limited number of people can get on the rides due to enforcement of distancing. It is a good thing actually. Kudos to the staff for diligently wiping down every seat and cabin whenever each ride is completed. Timed tickets have to be issued for certain rides as they are overwhelmingly popular. Good idea though as it spaced out the crowd but at the same time created additional long queues to get the tickets.

Went during COVID PHASE II, no queue at most of the attractions during the early openning hours (2pm-4pm), average waiting time around 5-10mins. Btw some places are closed, please do double confirm on the USS app on the attractions available before purchase your tickets :). And cos of the heat, please do bring enough water to hydrate yourself if you dont want to pay too much inside. (Water cooler out of service due to COVID or some other reason)
As usual a wonderful place. Disinfection of the rides after passengers disembarked but safe distancing not on every ride, guess they have to keep the queue short.

a very exciting entertainment place, it could even be an alternative tourist destination for all ages.... lots of interesting places with good views... I highly recommend taking the Transformers ride even though the queue will be long.... for food, friends, you can buy it inside the USS, some of the prices are quite high but there are also many that are delicious and comparable to the price at the food court and some even have themes...

I was impressed by how they will sanitize the seats and safety bar and belt after every use. Theres gap in between the ride. Social Distancing ambassador was everywhere, the food place has crowd controlled. Theres sanitizer everywhere. Awesome job to the workers there! Even with the longer waiting time but id rather be safe!

1.review_text: Waiting time is very high. They will tell 40 mins, but take at least one and half hour for each ride and later they will announce due to technical difficulty ride is closed, after we wait so long in queue...Waste of money...

Long queues with at least waiting time of 1hr and more for most adult rides. Despite the high cost for entry tickets, you have to force yourself to top up to get the express pass to enter another queue around half the waiting time for the rides. You will know what i mean when you dont want to disappoint your kids or when you are trying to impress your new gf on a trip to this place...

Lady at the entrance forced me to use pdf instead of my screen shots. Photo of the bar code can also scan. But she will not allow me. Instead I must go to my email to find the pdf. All that unnecessary trouble. Since already use my phone to check in my kids also, am a bit flustered to be forced to search email confirmation while holding up the line. Please train your staff in IT. Images on phone can also zoom in. Image and pdf of bar code makes no difference to scanner. Sincerely, not a good start to fun.

2.review_text: Practically half the attractions are closed. Extremely inaccurate queue time estimation. The sign shows 70 minutes for The Mummy, placed bags in a locker with 120 minutes grace period but the queue eventually took 135 minutes. This cost us 6 per locker. Huge waste of our day and money overall. Spending 59/pax to queue 1-2hrs per ride.

3.review_text: Such a long line for each attraction with unreliable weather. For one day pass without the Express pass, you will be lucky if you can make more than half of the attractions.
Age of place shows. Some rides and shops not open.
Not as worth it anymore. Lots of the attractions closed due to the restrictions. Especially as an annual pass holder with the express pass add-on.
Just okay. When we went there some of the rides was not working
Not bad at all, great thrilling attractions! Beautiful decorations. Be careful with the price, they sold us a ticket for 3 days, so we only wanted one! So 3x the price.

4.review_text: Exciting theme park with 5 different sectors to explore, food is pretty expensive which is normal. Got tickets to go in at a discount too! I love the human and cyclone roller coasters! Could take them 3-4 times in a row without getting sick Great for first and second timers, thereafter it will get boring as the rides are the same
I loved it. Although it's little crowded but it's worth waiting the most irritating part is few of the rides are closed for ever. Overall good experience..

It was raining the whole day, some of the rides are not operating due to the weather condition, but overall, the hospitality with the fully safety measurement it makes me more confident to enjoy the rides and gives me a different experience.
Great place. Fun rides almost no lines. Some shows no happening because of Covid but still fun
They are not allowing to convert one day ticket into season pass due to COVID, their website also doesn't have notice of unavailability of season pass.

5.review_text: Here by accident! But it was fun and relieving during these times of no travel. Many of the attractions were closed due to government restrictions, however the queue times are much shorter compared to peak period. Enjoy!
Not very crowded now due to covid.. but stay safe if you go plssss Ps, Take photo need wear mask!
Enjoyable moment with friends if you don't mind killing your legs for a day and exchanging your soul for the rest of the night. Some rides are unavailable like the cylon roller coaster.

1.review_text: 0 Stars if possible terrible experience, too many people crammed into this park. Seems like the park does this deliberately so they can upsell express tickets which go for 80 extra per person on top of entrance fees. Everyride you have to wait 1 to 2 hrs not worth time and money. Food is sub par for price because of so many people everthing premade and left on food counter everything cold before you eat. All food court everthing is well worn and dirty needs update soon. Forever fighting crowds impossible to take photos. Worst place in Singapore, don't recommend.
such a disappointed management. as during phase 2 uss should limited amount of visitor so that queuing are not more that 20 min. 2 pm reach there only 3 game ..so bad management

2.review_text: The waiting time is too long. Almost every attraction has to queue for more than an hour. Especially for Ancient Egypt, the queue alone takes more than an hour and a half. I dont know if I spent 81 just to play or to queue. It is recommended that those who dont like queuing can buy fast-pass tickets. Even if they are expensive, they are worth it. At least the queuing time for playing facilities will be reduced a lot, and it will not be impossible to finish the entire ride in a whole day. This is a waste of money and time. Ordinary ticket. In the current situation, some amusement facilities are also closed, so it is really not worth the price.

3.review_text: After several visits, the theme park has visibly aged. Equipments are run down and paints were peeling. The charm is still there however, with visitors pouring in especially during weekends. During covid-19 period park opens only from thursday to sunday, 2pm-9pm. There is also early admission for the mascots greet and meet from 12pm to 2pm. Make sure you take necessary precaution to distance yourselves as queues for rides are still like tuna in the can. Some pricing guide: a big soda (in plastic container) from the road side stall costs about S13 (free water coolers are non-operational at the moment), sausage S4/pc, disposable poncho 10/2pc.

If u came here 10 years before, it should be the best experience and best technology. But 10 years past everything is the same, the screen shows spots and seems to be blur, even thousands of people still come here for some reasons, it's far more worse than the Universal Studio in other countries.

4.review_text: Went there a few times. The Halloween show was not that great only seat outside the floor and given some candies and biscuits, not much shop open and no need to queue at all. Very quiet, the hotel Equarius wasn't that great either. Prefer to go back to hard rock next time.
Universal Studios in Singapore consider a well maintained theme park. Clean, and friendly crew. But the restaurants and food can be more selection and the souvenirs deaign can be improved.

it was cool! wish I cud tell you guys dat it was fantastic, but sadly it wasnt... its still so fun to be there though, with limited attractions, hot weather, and long queue The Mummy, Transformer, and Jurassic Park are somehow worth to queue for the food also wasnt bad. I had lunch at Mel's Drive In, ordered Burgers, Float, and Softdrink (bottles included). the portion was huge and taste good wouldnt mind to be back, but need to wait promos

During the epidemic prevention period, ticket prices are discounted, and there will not be too many holiday crowds. Although it is Halloween, activities that will gather crowds have been cancelled, and there is not much festive atmosphere. The facilities will start at 2 p.m., and people will queue up to keep distance. Even during the facility period, the epidemic prevention situation is good. At the end of the day, we can leisurely explore all the facilities (Shrek Theater and Water World are not open)

Lots of people but a great place to hang out. It is best to go as close to opening time as possible. Re-entry is possible. When you leave, if you say you're coming back, a separate sign is provided, and you check the sign when entering.

5.review_text: Always a joy. Queues weren't exactly long, but because of covid measures, waiting time was longer than expected. Rides were seating at half capacity or less. Food was overpriced as expected, but the Halloween free treats that were being given out generously was a nice touch. Definitely a must to go at least once.
Always FUN! FUN! FUN! @ USS. Now due to pandemic, it's more organised and lesser people so you'll be able to spend more time on rides than queues.
Just visited 3 weeks ago while having a staycation at Michel hotel. Due to COVID, all shows were canceled but the queue was very light especially after 7pm.

not crowded at all on a sunday, probably due to the advanced reservation required. we didn't have to wait for more than 25 mins for each ride. no shows and no parades though. the kids did manage to get many packets of ribena pastilles as part of meet and greet sessions for halloween.
Missing USS!! with COVID around family doesn't want to go :(

1.review_text: long queue, staffs lack of enthusiasm to operate rides which further lengthen the waiting time

3.review_text: Due to social distancing, expect to queue at least 45mins for all rides.. There are no live shows and food cart in operations. Be prepared for the minimal food choices and merchandise stores!

I think its time they revamp and change the concept. Its been years alrdy. The first time i went was before i got married. Now i have 3 kids its still the same rides and themes. I dunno its worth going anymore. Dun get me wrong, the kids still loves it. Probably can add more mascots or clowns wandering around. There is plenty of room for inprovement but unfortunately they didnt.
Performances are still closed, most of the restaurants are not operating. However the only good thing is that they had repaired the little things happening during the rides.

A bit small for a theme park, as you can walk one round within 30 mins. Very long queue for the rides even though there wouldn't be any tourist and queued for the Transformer for more than 90mins already killed me to queue for other popular rides. The most memorable was the Mr Frankenstein, as I didn't want to queue up for photos, so I took a photo from far, but being a true professional, he spotted my intention and waived at me. 5 stars for that!
Lots of the attractions & restaurants are closed due to covid, creating crowds at the available restaurants.

4.review_text: Long but moving queues that require some time to get to the rides. Good to make a couple of return trips to experience all rides. Not advisable to rush for all rides.

I took my niece for her first trip to universal studios yesterday and she enjoyed herself throughly and I felt that the overall experience was pleasant but it could be better to lower the volume of the special effects for rides as she did mention that it was too loud. I do agree with her regarding this and even as an adult it was too loud for me and therefore it could have been overwhelming for young children who are more sensitive to sounds. We look forward to visiting it again.

Very nice park, universal style. Very friendly staff and free lockers during the queue period. The park is not particularly large and the attraction in front of the mummy is definitely not up to par. Transformer and the mummy absolutely at the top. We hope for future expansions. Definitely worth visiting

Currently the place is only opened from Thursday to Sunday possibly due to Covid. There are proper safe distancing measures in place. Visited during the Halloween themed and could see many people dressing up. The food and drinks inside is rather pricey so would recommend to eat outside first. Went on a Saturday and it was quite crowded! Didn't get finish all the rides. Queue for the rides can take up to 2 hours, possibly cause of recent safe distancing measures where the rides have limited seatings. Overall it was really fun and interesting experience!
Can't compare to the parks overseas, but definitely a great place to be to escape what's been a rollercoaster of a year in 2020. Hopefully an upgrade is happening in the near future.

5.review_text: The place is a wonderful experience for all types of people. I went there with my family and joyed all the rides specially rollercoasters , sisimpur ride, transformer show. This is a must visit place if you visit Singapore. Try to enter in such a way so that you also can spend the evening time here. There are long queue for some of the rides, so please keep some buffer time. If you have children with you you may get some priority line and some rides/shows are not allowed for the children below specific age.
Well managed even during the pandemic. Queue times are usually less than an hour for most rides

No more face cast, for now. Lots of mascot photo taking opportunities. Not much people during weekdays. Rides waiting less than 30mins. Many stores are closed, except for the main stores near the entrance. Feels less festive, though it is still fun.
The rides here are cool, especially the transformers one, but it usually has a long queue.
Friendly and responsible staff, well-maintained rides

1.review_text: Bad logistics: running out of masks (when the number of reservations is known as specific-day reservation is required), and rides that break down near opening (the 2 rides I specifically came for, whee). Pretty sure the frustration this experience entails isn't worth the ticket price.

Very bad experience as the queue times for normal tickets on end of December is literally 2 rides within 4.5hours. Adding on there is always technical difficulties which can last for 30minutes to an hour. Not for one ride but for the majority of rides there is always technical difficulties. Worst part is they never suggest customers to go for Universal Express tickets during holidays. Which then after booking normal tickets you cant upgrade it if you want to.

horrible experience. went to human roller coaster, and was told at 5 separate times there was a BRIEF delay. the was told twice that the ride has resumed. they got everyone on the ride and i was at the front of the line. once agin was told that there was a brief delay. after waiting for an hour, it was finally announced that there was a problem, and that we were welcomed to wait longer. 1, why did they have to wait for so long before announcing? why have us sit on the floor, the tell us that there was a problem only after so long. 2, why was more info not given? it was announced that there would only be a brief delay. im sorry, but one hour is not a brief delay. after i left, i realised that all the more exciting rides were closed as there were issues. even small rides like the elmo ride, or the madagascar crate adventure had a 30-45 minute queue. in the four hours i was here, i could only ride two rides, both being rides meant for 5 year olds. save your money. dont come.

Almost 90% of the rides, the waiting time is between 60 to min to 80min and play time is less than 1 min. In my opinion, the queuing system could be further improve (e.g. online queuing system, go for the ride when it'syour turn, many restaurants is doing that now especially during covid period.) , secondly, since there is limited seat per ride, USS should control the numbers of tickets selling everyday to avoid the queue and crowd. Lastly, most of the restaurants and show are not operating at this period. Every small stall selling drinks come with long queue. Pretty disappointing experience

Waited approximately 1.5-2hrs for 1 ride. Not worth it. Should have control capacity of the park so everyone can enjoy conveniently without waiting for so long. If minimum waiting time is 60 mins, there must be something wrong with the number of crowd allow in the park. This include rides suspended after a thunderstorm. Bad experience for me and family. Understand there are safe distancing measures and all. But total visitors are not controlled after these measures are applied. Turned out wasting a lot of time waiting but get little fun.

2.review_text: Giving them an extra star as Singapore is still in "Phase 2." Place needs help. This is my Nth time visiting the place and I can see that the colors are literally fading, I know it's been raining for days, but you can see dust marks all over the place! Long queues (min hour wait per ride) as there's a limit on the number of people per attraction. Drinking water cannot be used and they're still selling bottled water at S4 each! A lot of restaurants are also closed. Also lack of resting areas inside the park!
Queues too slow. And long. Even on Covid scenario. And even not interesting rides..Park relatively smaller than even HK Disneyland. A few attractions not opened.

Reduced capacity of rides due to phase 2 should mean reduced number of tickets released. Instead they offer way more tickets than what the park can handle, resulting in long queues and overcrowding. All shows are cancelled, waterpark is closed, many restaurants and food booths are closed, and ticket prices are still the same. No wet weather plans after so many years and people are forced to crowd in limited shelters. There're so many problems caused by greed and poor administration.

Wait times are just too long. More than an hour. Some rides are too short. About 1 min long. Express pass too expensive. Not family friendly for the wallet. My third time here and the same experience over and over again.

Visited on Christmas day. Place was crowded as expected. Waiting time for most attractions are around 2 hrs due to safety measures which is understandable. However most of the restaurants and all of the food courts are closed (not mentioned by Universal Studio), meaning you have to queue for 2 hrs for food as well. You would be better of bringing own snacks in. Staff are edgy and not too friendly like last time. Actually got a scolding from a staff when I used a wipe on a handle. Please put out warning signs if you do not want people to use wipes especially during this covid period! All in all, not a pleasant visit.

3.review_text: The place was crowed probably due to the Singapore Rediscover Voucher. Heavy downpour in the middle of our visit and not many shelters around. Many people flocked into Mummy attractions and end up queuing 2 hours in wet cloth. No stuff to monitor the social distancing on the extended queue. People were literally standing toe to toe. I was too navie to put my phone in the locker as instructed. Could not recall how I survived 4 hrs queuing without a phone. Many other experienced folks just have their phone with them and still were allowed to ride. Why do they have such instructions in the first place? Or can't they adjust the process to be more reasonable? All the attractions were pretty crowded even we visited on a weekday. Enjoyed a few rides but could not conclude as a pleasant trip overall.

I was there last week with my nieces and nephew. Its been 3 to 4 years since I last visited the theme park. Sadly to say, there isn't much changes or anything new/fascinating except new hello kitty merchandise and trolls performance which excites my nieces. Perhaps it was due to Covid, the waiting time for each ride takes estimated 40 - 80 mins. And it was with disappointment that 3 of the rides we encountered with a temporary closure due to technical difficulties. Thus, kids were really disappointed that eventually they did not get a chance on the transformer ride even we return on 3 different timings. Pardon me and my expectations wasn't high but the food was horrible. The corndog was hard and not fresh, pizza was oily and dessert was just tasteless cream with some oreo biscuit.

The kids attractions are wonderful but very long queues. Unless you have Express pass you'll spend all your day in a queue. Seems they allow too many people inside. In case of thunderstorm all outdoor attractions are closed and there're very few indoor ones so even with Express Pass you'll queue for about 40 min. During my visit all good cafes inside were closed with only fast food left. That was very disappointing. Not many attractions for adults. Literally a few rollercoasters. But for kids the park is great!
The queues ruin the experience quite a bit. Waiting 2 hours in the hot sun for rides less than 5 mins? No thank you. The express queue would be a good option if you had the money to blow.

Rides and park overall are very nice and impressive. However, (on a Sunday) the park was extremely over crowded. Queue times were 2-3 hours long and 1 hour long for express queues. However, I later realised that this was mainly due to rides being subject to safe distancing measures. As such, I appreciate the hard work that has gone into keeping the park open during a global pandemic while keeping everyone safe. Rides, also, get less busy after 7pm.

4.review_text: It's said to have crowd control but in all honesty it was still very very very very packed. Queued up twice for the Human Rollercoaster (red) got turned away at the very last point (before boarding) due to 1) technical difficulties, 2) wet weather. We tried going to transformers ride and they also mentioned they were doing 'checks'. At the very least they gave us 2 express tickets to make up for our fruitless queueing. Even with the express tickets, it was still quite some wait, that just goes to show how crowded it was :// The staff there didn't seem too jolly, it's probably my 4th or so time visiting, but this was most likely one of the worse visits. They did try their best to keep guest socially distanced. All in all, fun place, but just waaaaay too crowded, the staff could use a little more joy.

The queue takes forever, I spent an hour lining at one, and another hour at another site. Don't go on a rainy day as many outdoor activities won't open, and indoor activities has too many people waiting in the line. And the queue walk doesn't have any place to rest or sit... too tiresome... except if you really want to go. However, the roller coasters are super fun. The cylon and human are the best.

Many interesting rides offered at USS. I recommend the Mummy's revenge, Battlestar Galactica and the Transformers ride. However, wait times are still pretty long ranging from 1-2hours and as such I was not able to enjoy all the rides offered at USS. Rides are also very susceptible to sudden weather changes as outdoor rides will be cancelled during rain. Would advice to check the weather forcast and to bring poncho for your visit. A fault occured when I was on the Human ride and hence I had to sit in the hot sun for 15 minutes straight in the rollercoaster. Other than this mishap, my experience there was generally pleasant, due to the sunny weather.
Great rides. Long queue. One of the rides broke down mid way. Otherwise wouldve been a perfect trip. Still pretty awesome

It was quite crowded when I went on weekends so the queue for rides were extremely long but it was a great experience. Very suitable for families or just small group gatherings. I would suggest to arrive as early as possible if u were to go on weekends and didn't buy the express pass ticket as you won't be able to finish playing all the attractions if you reach at like afternoon 1-2pm

5.review_text: the place i been to USS is okay. need to buy express ticket to access faster because is very long queue

Went to USS with my family on 10th Dec 2020 but it wasn't a straight forward entry into the park. As I had purchased the tickets on Klook, I had thought that the entry was guaranteed. However, when the USS Ticket Inspector checked my pass, he mentioned that I had to make a reservation on the RWS website prior to visiting and I was advised to return another day as the park was full. As I had made bookings on Klook for the USS tickets before, this came as a surprise. (Discovered later that Klook's booking system is not live and not linked to USS's ticketing system. Anyone can book tickets on the actual day even though the park is full but when you try to register with RWS, you will not be able to obtain the ticket. So beware when you purchase from Klook. Purchase from the main USS website instead). Fortunately, a bespectacled Customer Service Officer named Vincent who was checking the tickets in the queue came to our assistance. He rendered great service and managed to let us into the park and we are grateful to him for that. Thank you for letting my two daughters have a wonderful day at USS.

Due to the epidemic, the business hours have been changed to 2pm-9pm. Closed on Tuesday/Wednesday. Before arriving, it is recommended to check the weather forecast for the day (many roller coasters will be closed on rainy days). On major holidays, remember to go to any gift shop inside to buy a fast-pass pass (Priority Pass 70 each can be used once/Priority Pass unlimited times 100). Admission tickets are not included. The priority card is much faster. For example, people need to wait in line for 60-120 minutes, while the priority card only takes 5-10 minutes for your turn. Because not many people buy priority certificates. In fact, what you use money to buy is not a fast-track ticket, but the purchase time does not require you to wait in line for too long. (Each game requires an average of 60-120 minutes of waiting) Pay attention to the performance time to watch the show and take photos. You can download the universal studio map from Google Play to check the queue time and location to see where you are to avoid getting lost. If you dont buy a priority pass, it is recommended to arrive early on weekdays. Except for some game shows that are closed, water stations are prohibited at every intersection and you need to spend money to buy drinks/water.
Underwater World, Shrek and a few others are closed for now. The roller coasters are still in operation so its not too bad, with lesser crowd to deal with.

Great rides for kids. Too long for the queue. 1 thing that frustrates me is that we queued for the mummy ride for almost 2hrs in the end didnt get to ride it as my child is abit shorter. Didnt mind that my child is short for the ride as it is for the child safety but would appreciate the staff to measure the height of the child before we start to queue like other rides. Needed to pay extra for the locker as i exceeded the timing to collect my bags when i was queueing. That part really frustates me. Overall great atmosphere and a fun day with great and friendly staff.

1.review_text: The rides kept breaking down and they recommend guests to try and explore other rides. However, upon queueing for the other rides, they also broke down. These left us riding only 3-4 rides and we were here for 7 hours. Only one of which is the popular one. This is rather disappointing. If only the rides can be as efficient as other countries. Jiayou singapore!

2.review_text: Safe distancing measures are okay. But some people still dont follow especially when lining up. Rides have 30-40 mins waiting time. Most of the attractions are closed and they did not provide any info on which attractions will be closed while buying the ticket and not even indicated on the ticket itself. Yes the ticket is 66 only but they should've informed that most of the attractions are closed. F&Bs are closed! Only Mels diner is open and the italian resto near the sesame street area the rest are closed. Snack bar booths are open. Air purifiers are visible in Human and Transformers line area. Had two 5 retail voucher as well but we are not allowed to combine it so you need to have two separate receipts and can only be used with a mastercard.

Been coming here off and on since 2013. They are not even showing the waiting room pre-show entertainment anymore, at Lights Camera Action and Shrek 4D. So disappointing. At least Transformers the Ride is still as good as before, but you can really see the whole place needs some maintenance.
Waited more than an hour for 4D Shrek experience. USS also stopped showing preview of the show. Overall experience is very mich reduced
The roller coaster is broken

4.review_text: I love theme parks and I had USS season pass awhile back. I visited the park often and had so much fun! Definitely eat before going so youll have full energy for the rides. The prices at Sentosa in general is high for bring your own water too. Sometimes, the waiting time might be a little long so stock up on entertainment. Whether be it your mobile phone or friends, a little entertainment could make the wait more tolerable. The only bad thing is that its small. I would love to be able to experience more but for a small country like Singapore, its good enough :)

Some rides were crazily crowded, 2 of the rides for is took nearly 100 mins of wait time each. The mobile app is good app, it provides ride/show details, wait time for each ride etc. I think they should have more signboards for directions inside the park. Few points: restaruants do not have vegan options carry u r waterbottles , else have to buy water, S4 /bottle do not underestimate the waiting time in the app or the time board outside each ride. From outside it may look small queue, but in reality its "trick eye museum" in live play i did not explore to buy fastpass , it is best way to jump queue Overall had good family time :)
Rides are interesting, exhilarating. However, the wait times are really a drag. Food and drinks are exorbitant!

Visited before my season pass expires, not much changes. All outdoor rides was closed when thunder/rain was forecasted for safety reasons. And it seems like Transformers ride was the only one being affected by an extremely large crowd, they had to stop people from queuing. But there isn't much indoor activities in the area for us, it is either too crowded or activities that seems to be for kids instead. Fortunately outdoor rides opened not too long later.
There are many interesting areas. The queues take a lot of time, maybe up to several hours, you need to buy an Express Pass Ticket if you want to have enough time for 5-6 games/visit.

5.review_text: Ive been here so many times, its always been a 5-star rated attraction. I dont get it why many people complain or give a bad rating. I went USS on 29 dec and it was super peak. U cant expect the park on that day to be very loose and a 5 min waiting time on attractions(?). if u cant wait, get an express! & its super understandable that some rides are closed down or the hours is cut short. I am still grateful that we are still able to enjoy whilst in the midst of Pandemic. i understand the hassle of having to buy the ticket first, then to book time slot online before entering. I understand the need to have Safe Distancing Ambassadors making sure we wear masks and maintaining our distancing. Its hard for them to manage on that day but i can see how hard they are working! I was only able to get on 2 rides BUT it was worth it. Because with the vouchers,i get to finally enjoy after months of staying home
Fantastical place. Transformers ride has the longest queue. The Shrek 4D ride has reopened

It's a very great place!!! This theme park features movie-themed rollercoasters, rides and attractions. You can meet some of your favourite cartoon, movies characters. It has many zones and each zone have their own themed rides, shows, shops, restaurants and street entertainment. The staff are very nice. I have a lot of fun and Im glad to have an experience in this place. But its a pity that I cant try every rides because of the crowded. The park get very busy especially at peak times. If you go to Singapore, dont miss a chance to visit Universal Studios Singapore!

It's a good time to go now as the capacity currently cap at 65% so the crowd will be less than usual. Dun cancel yr plan of it's rain cause it might be good for u cause when I go all queue just take about 15 to 20 minutes while Normal queue could take hours and all ride is open even though it's raining as long dun have thunder if not mistaken..
Superb place for kids and adults. Fun for everyone. The wait for the ride depends. For Transformers ride you can wait for 80mins! Food is pricey but overall it is worth it.

1.review_text: Was in the queue for 2 rides for more than 1 hour. Ended up the rides had technical difficulties and was told to queue for other rides instead. Wasted 2 hours queuing.
Having twice interruptions in one day due to technical issue for 2 different facilities, wasting to queue for nothing. Had a bad experience.
Queued for more than two hours, equipment was broken, terrible experience

2.review_text: It's one of the few places you can go to in Singapore. I wish they would consider the customers perspective in their operation method. do. I visited on January 1st and it rained historically. Although there were many on the day, cancellations were not made on the same day. I came because I had pre-purchased admission tickets. I returned home after 2 hours. If you can't cancel, at least a plastic raincoat. It had to be provided, but it was also paid. Light rain made it difficult to operate. I wish they could manage the rain separately.

3.review_text: The food inside the theme park can be rather pricey so best be advised to bring you own snacks (or even meals) and water bottles. Rides are def a must-try although the waiting time can be quite long for some of the more popular rides.
If you Don't have a VIP pass, you will spend the day only on long queues.
Too short openning hours

4.review_text: With Covid-19, there is a limited no of visitors admitted to the park. For this I was happy as it was not so crowded despite some popular rides having long queuing time eg 1 hr or more. Many of the shows were closed and we were able to finished most of the rides. Downside is .. I hope there is one pure vegetarian restaurant to cater for strict vegetarians.

A lifetime experience you could get here in Singapore. Bookings could be made online so you could not wait in queue. Be prepared to enjoy your day and rest another day following the rides. Long queues in most of the rides though.

With distancing measures in place and reduced capacity, there is barely a crowd. The longest I need to wait for a ride is about 30 mins. With no parade, you don't feel the magic as much, look forward to having things back to normal soon !

Fun place to be for all ages. Beautiful architectures and themes for photography. Depending on what day you plan to go, because the queue can get crazy. I waited 2 hours for the Mummy ride, 1 hour for Madagascar, an hour and a half for Jurassic Rapids ride. Almost all rides average about an hour of waiting time. The rides are fun, if you are willing to spend more on Universal Express Pass aka No Waiting Time.
Less people to go in this period. The BSG Human and Cylon is the best ride in this park. The cons is quite pricy for the food inside the park. You can reentry after get food outside of park.

5.review_text: Went to Universal Studios Singapore last weekend. Despite the rides only starting from 2pm onwards, we managed to get onto all the rides we want and the good thing was the very short waiting time. Most rides, even the popular ones, only needed at most 10 minutes of queue. USS did a good job in maintaining safe distancing during the queuing process.
Crowd controlled. Long queue waiting time cos some rides are seated 1 metre apart or max capacity. Nevertheless we still had fun!

We went on the eve of chinese year (11th Feb). I was really worried about having to queue but fortunately the place was almost empty. We didn't have to wait for more than 5 minutes for any ride. We went on a few rides multiple times. I think due to Covid/safe distancing measures, they are limiting the number of people who could come in per day - thanks to that, there's no long queues. We used the Rediscover vouchers, bought the tickets from Klook which offers an early entry (12am) at 66, and had to make an online reservation after buying the ticket. You do that, you are good to go, have fun! P.S. Make sure you carry an umbrella!

During the covid recovery period, all shows are closed. All the rides are still open though! There's also lots of character interactions! Do take note that there are no water dispensers working so its probably better to bring your own drinks. Might be better than buying soft drinks for the whole day. There's also re-entry allowed so you can go out to have a meal before coming in if the food inside is not to your liking. Do inform the exit staff you will be re-entering. Bring umbrellas if its the rainy season. Rain coats not recommended as you will still need to take it off when going for rides. Taking it off and putting it on repeatedly when going for rides is a hassle. It opens until pretty late at night, but basically during dinner time the crowds almost dissipate. If going during peak periods, it is recommended to get express pass. 5 mins per ride is very different from 1-2hrs per ride! You can even take the same ride 6-7 times if so desired. But since you can always buy passes on the spot, you can use your normal ticket, look at the crowd condition on the actual day, then decide if you want to buy express. Hope the above tips helps everyone have a great time there!

We had a lot of fun! Beautiful designed theme park showcasing our childhood movies/shows. Mascots performance were fun to watch. It wasn't crowded; we queued 5-10min for most rides except mummy ride (20-30min queue time). Sadly, jurassic water ride and many shows including waterworld were closed. For roller-coaster rides like battlestar galactica, bags and pocket items are not allow on the ride, there is a 45min free rental locker nearby for your bags.

1.review_text: Not a good idea to visit in this period. too crowded. rides only open 1.30pm and waiting time is 90minutes
The ride waiting time is very long... it takes 2 hrs for a ride.. and the USS open at 2pm - 9pm.. cnt cover the whole ride in USS... Hopefully the management do something in future...
Poor services
Too crowded at one time and poor service?
