Overselling of tickets than capacity. Average 80 minutes of waiting for every rides, and popular ride like Transformers have over 160 mins waiting. Long queuing for buying drinks, snacks and meal. Drinking water not available on tap, and 30 mins waiting for buying water. Also, only selling Alkaline Ph8 water at ridiculously high price. Popular rides breakdowns after long waiting in queue. Long wait required even for express pass.

2.review_text: This place seriously need a queueing system like some other theme parks

3.review_text: Not so good to go esp wk ends n school holidays.Some of the rides have to queue quite long.

Overall this isn't a bad theme park. But it's so small compared to those overseas, tickets are overpriced, and the app that tells you the wait time for rides is not accurate. Food options are really not healthy and pretty expensive. But that's what you'd expect for all theme parks I guess.

Went on a thursday . Practically a boring place . People ( mostly youngsters ) went for the rides . Other than the rides , there isnt much to see . Only those merchandise stores . Food outlets are not open . Except for small stalls . Even the rides are not as well-designed as compared to Disneyland .
Waiting time for station is terrible

4.review_text: Everything is fun except their decision to assign staff at the entrance of two sci-fi rides to not let anyone enter if they have phones, instead of telling everyone to place their belongings in the shelf beside the ride (which we put our other items in the shelf for our ride anyways). This forces the guests to pay for lockers even if they already paid for the outside of main entrance lockers. The positive side to this is the used to be over an hour waiting line was only 20 minutes because of all the guests they denied.

Fun, entertaining and exciting rides to choose from. Really nice staffs and queue management there. The crowd there was tremendous, I would suppose it's due to the March School Holidays period and furthermore people are utilizing their Singaporr Rediscover Vouchers which caused the overwhelming crowd within the facility. Overall I would day they managed the queue well with proper SDM in place to ensure minimal breach.
Nice rides but long queues. The wait is longer than the ride.
Good, long queuing though probably due to covid so can be expected. Was actually not that busy but still had to queue 40mins on average.
Able to enter at 1pm but the queue to the rides are still long.. waiting time for transformer is 2hrs long :(

5.review_text: How I wanted to come here, not even for the attractions, but in general to see what interesting things the Singaporeans had put up here. But alas, the rain ruined all plans, although the first half of the day was a success - we took a ride on a megazip and just walked around Sentosa, it was hot and the sky was clear) but as soon as we crossed the turnstile of the park, thunder struck) the rain continued for 3 hours, it just got dark, and there was nothing to see) so as not to completely waste our time sitting in the shelter, we reached the transformers in small dashes, stood for about 40 minutes in queue to play around in virtual reality glasses for 5 minutes, then bought raincoats and went out into the rain to look for what else works) Jurassic Park was open, dinosaurs are even more spectacular in the dark) in general, plan your time correctly! And dont worry about the priority pass, youll save a lot of time!
Nice and Enjoyable. Wear comfy shoes and avoid coming on Sch holidays. Coz each queue is at least 50-75min waiting time.
What an amazing place! We visited before Covid era. There were long queues for almost all rides. We were lucky enough to experience the Terminator ride. It was awesome

During the pandemic, there are restricted guests allowed and also mandatory social distancing enforced. Felt that the overall waiting time is better. Remember to download universal studio app for easy navigation and updates on waiting time
Fun place..Must Go! Get on all the rides. Must also be patient waiting time could be more than 20 mins

1.review_text: Why only open at 2pm when the sun is blazing, and only Thursdays through Sundays. It seems to me to create artificial demand so the park and rides operate at a certain capacity always. I wish it was like lesser known theme parks overseas where rides are walk up and wait for the next turn. Not a queue of minimum 40min. With ticket prices like this already, why cant one make a beeline for Battlestar roller coasters, do 5 consecutive runs, and be out of USS within 1.5hours? Instead, every ride has a queue of at least 30min, and the ride lasts all of 5min. And the lack of drinks station is unbelievable. To buy drinking water, the queue is the same as those ordering food(?!) very long. Why not place vending machines throughout the park, or drinks-only stands. Made worse by the opening time of 2pm, possible heat injury is a real danger! I know this is an attraction, so would pay up to 10 for a 500ml bottle of drinking water, if only there were more stands selling them to ensure no queue for drinks.

Very crowded. Long queue for each attracton. Terribly long time to wait, 1(one) hour for each attracton and this is not weekend or holiday. Waste of time. No sitting arrangements. Aircon and COVID restrictions well arranged.
Cylon ride stopped and had to pay 6 extra for locker services that was minutes overdue... disappointing service and rides
No point coming early. Had to wait till 2pm to go for the attractions/rides.

2.review_text: Place is not so crowded due to COVID but queues are not short. Many attractions are closed -- it's typically queuing for an hour for 5 mins of fun.
Too crowded, very long lines and waiting time
No performances and shows only rides are available, felt short changed for paying 66...

3.review_text: Queue was extremely long. Average waiting time was 60 mins to 80mins. The reason for long waiting time was because, all rides had to abide by the safe distancing measures. So if you went to a 12 seater ride, you can only have 4-8 people on it. Most food stall inside the theme park were down, only snacks and finger food shops are available. Other than that, it's a great theme park to reminisce your childhood and relive it all over again.

Food and drinks are very expensive. Drinks cost 5 per cup and 3 for refills. Pl do not throw away the cup for refills. Food cost at least 15 and above..only 70% of the rides are opened. A bit disappointed though as USS is v small and the staff there doesn't carry the vibes that can be found in other countries such as USJ. Hope they can improve on that as I see the staff yawning and gesturing to guests unwillingly. Crowded on Fridays and rides r still the same when I visited 6 years ago. My reviews on Klook got deleted hence, I thought that it's good to leave my honest opinion here.
I didn't go much of the ride and the waiting time for some is ridiculously long. The shrek pancake within also quite disappointing. Overall, a little disappointing.
Not a great experience. Half the rides were closed.

4.review_text: Quick queues, free lockers but required renewing, some rides getting abit old and jerkyish. Sadly not many family friendly rides, multiple fast rides instead. Food was decent, but somewhat expensive. Roadside stalls not open, but its expensive as well.

Spend almost whole day there and still couldn't finish all of it. Queuing from 5 mins to 90 mins just to get on a ride. The more exotic rides will take longer time to queue while those kiddy rides will take only 5 to 20 mins to get on.

We had great time at USS on my boy's birthday. Collected shall gift from the Guest Services upon arrival. Very happy with their SMM, the waiting time is acceptable, we manage to take all the rides we want. The only thing I'm not so happy about is the locker service where I feel like being cheated. I'm more than happy to pay for the service as we are not able to carry along our belongings for the Mummy ride. Upon renting the locker, the system showing free rental for 1st 90 mins and overtime will be charge at 2 per 20mins block if I'm not wrong. We queued for 60 mins for the Mummy ride, once done and went to collect our belongings, we are asked to pay 6 due to 45mins over time.. I'm a bit curious how the computer timing run, double the speed?

I used to come here to play here when I was a kid. It was really fun. It was fun and beautiful. But two years ago, I noticed that it had changed. Some of the dinosaurs in the dinosaur theme were broken. I went to play and he was broken. I went to play again next month, but it still wasnt repaired. When I went to play again, he was still not repaired. Its true. I play every month (two years ago), Autobot theme. Some screens were broken. When I went to play alone, I found that the screen was black. I was a VLP at the time, but I was just helpless. If I were an ordinary tourist, I believe he would have refunded the ticket directly. In short, there are many equipments that are broken, some are broken, some are broken, some are broken, and some are broken.

Standard Entry with a one-day ticket (in 2021) is 66, but Singapore Rediscovers vouchers can be used to offset most of it. I went on a drizzly Thursday afternoon in April, which meant that there was little or no queues for many of the rides. The longest queue I experienced was around 30 minutes for the Transformers ride, which I visited around 3pm. The wait was alright because the queue passed through various chambers with exhibits & panels before the ride itself. I revisited the Transformers ride at 7pm, and this time there was no queue. A small part of the Universal Studios complex is sheltered (the New York and Sci-Fi sections) in case of rain. There are also numerous indoor rides around. The most thrilling rides are both outdoor Battlestar Galactica rides, and the Mummy indoor ride. There are some other relaxing rides that are more suitable for young children, or those not inclined for thrills. Food & drink is extremely expensive within USS. Do note that ALL the water coolers are not operating (as at April 2021). To get around this, you can consider stashing your own food & drink in your bag to bring into the park. Alternatively, exit the park and ask for a hand stamp for re-entry, before heading out to a 7-11 store or similar places for a quick drink. All in all, not too bad an experience to temporarily feel like you are outside Singapore.

5.review_text: Booked tickets using the singapore discover voucher and am got to Enjoy free treat when you use the voucher. I redeemed a cup of nuggets for the treat. Safe distancing measures were enforced, queue time was relatively faster than non covid time due to lesser crowd. Enjoy greater peace and comfort cos usually theres a row left empty for safe distancing. Be prepared for rain during this season as it rained when I was there, thus many rides were suspended. During the rain / lightning warning Alert can only queue for indoor rides which mostly was the mummy ride or transformer ride and the queue then can be 40-60min. Only thing is have to wear a mask all the time which can be pretty stuffy and uncomfortable so i suggest prepare extra mask for your visit. Also, all water cooler refill stations are not in service so be sure to bring your own water otherwise drinking water going at 4.

Went on a Saturday, crowd was manageable. Supposed to get in at 2pm but they let us in earlier at 1.30pm. Rides started at 1.45pm, managed to get on 4-5 rides before the waiting time increased to 30 mins on average. The longest wait was Mummy, 60 mins. Transformers was 90 mins during peak but wait out the crowd, around 6pm the waiting time was only 5 mins. Around 8pm, there's practically no waiting time for most rides since it's almost closing.

It's a good place to either release stress with friends or enjoy a family time together. Most of the attractions is great as the theme of each ride corresponds with each area. Lines are not long if you wait till the evening. It is also surprisingly empty as most people do adhere to social distancing measures. It's best to wait after covid ends as most if not all the attractions will be operating. With my review, I hope that it will help you in planning your day for your trip.
Love roller coasters!! transformer n mummy rides!! so fun!! Sad many restaurants are closed. Water world also closed.
miss some theme park due to late arrive, nice place, will visit again

1.review_text: Most of the place close at 5pm lousy

3.review_text: Not really my environment but it's an interesting experience for once. Some of the rides are great, such as the Mummy and the Transformers. If you don't like queuing, just walk around and board on the rides with less waiting.
Most rides were closed and each ride has an estimated waiting time of 60 mins. Food is terrible and overpriced.
Facilities very good ,clean but the entertainment ride got alot been out..afew rides . should have more rides Water cooler is closed.buy bottle water only.

Are the park photographers paid per quota? They waited for us then told us they will take pictures with no obligations and we could take a look at the pictures at the end of the day at the shop. We also decided to take photos with Optimus Prime during the day. At the end of our day we went to the shop to look at our photos. The barcode had the wrong photos. The staff was helpful to find our photos. When we finally saw our photos we were shocked. The first photographer told us the Hollywood sign was the main attraction of the shot BUT HE CUT THE SIGN OFF IN THE PICTURE. For the photographer taking the pictures with Optimua Prime, it was crooked and really disappointing. I hope the park gets better photographers or dont bother with the service as it was a waste of time.
Disappointed that all the shows are cancelled, including outdoor ones. Many of the food courts are closed too

4.review_text: good experience! went on a saturday and queues were very manageable 5mins for human and cyclone, max i waited was 45mins for rapid adventures (which was closed until evening time due to technical faults) downsides: water coolers turned off so either bring several bottles or buy a 200ml water carton from them for 4 dollars food options were also limited, on the expensive side and not that nice

I was there on my birthday in August and loved it despite the (sometimes long) waiting times. The staff is friendly, it's designed super cool and the rides are fun. If you're not a roller coaster fan, there's still a lot to see. For example, if you are waiting for people, you can also go to the beach nearby.

Went last Friday. Early entry from 12:00-14:00 was a photo taking and dining session only. All the rides opened at 2pm. Have to wear masks all the time even for photo taking and staffs will not help you to take photos because of the Covid. Only selfie is allowed if you want a group photos. But all the characters are cute they know how to make you laugh. The rides are practicing social distance too. They will separated groups in different cars in the car. Like transformer ride, only the first row and last row of the car are allowed to be seated. All the performance has been suspended due to the Covid measures. No shows and performance. On the other hands, its not as much people compared to before Covid. Not like we have to queue a long time for the rides.

If you go during a weekday, you'll find that it's not too crowded these days. And even during the peak hours the average wait time for the most popular rides is 30/40minutes. The downside is that many of the restraunts are shut within because of the reduced footfall.

Came here on Saturday with my girlfriend and some friends. It's a pity that after playing two indoor sports, it started to rain. Overall, the experience was very good. Of course, it would have been better if it hadn't rained (rain would make queuing tiring). However, the food inside Universal Studios was expensive and not delicious, so I thought it would be better to go to Vivacity outside, and then praise a certain hot noodle soup restaurant on the second basement floor!

5.review_text: Pros - reduced venue capacity makes it easy to get onto rides on the weekends. Cons - a minority of staff and/or safe distance ambassadors here shout at guests to "remind" them.

I had been here multiple times over the years. First time since this whole Covid situation. Some attractions were closed. Was quite disappointed that the Donkey show was not on and a couple of food places are closed too. Food and drinks are still easily purchased around the park. Majority of the rides were open and there were not much queue. Everyone had their mask on and practiced safe distancing around the park. In general the place was not as packed as before covid. Still had a fantastic time though. Took pictures with the mascots, can't stand next to them anymore, so just had to angle the camera. Appreciate the staff for keeping the ambiance lively and happy despite this whole covid restrictions.

Universal Studios is a theme park with many rides many attractions and many food choices, but usually very crowded before COVID. ticket prices are fine unless paying for whole family, which will be expensive. It is nice place, should come here and enjoy the fun
Had fun with my friends. This is the kind of theme park Ill visit once every decade. No change at all.

1.review_text: Bad experience after all. Queuing time is just extremely long. Can take up to 2.5 hours. We hated for Transformers rider for 100 minutes then they announced that they experience some technical difficulties and foresee an extended time delay. Since everyone in the queue already waited for quite some time, people are naturally reluctant to leave the queue and miss the other rides as well. Then we queue for another ride and here we go again. The same technical difficulties! We pay for a ticket for admission yet we get hard time to redeem the service. I'd like to get a refund for this malfunctioned rides and overcrowded facility.

absolutely terrible experience. minimum 1h queue for most rides when the park claims to have 50% capacity. queued 1.5h for transformers ride until the park started announcing technical difficulties, end up the ride had to close leaving so many people disappointed. will not visit again until the situation improves.

Very bad experience, queuing for almost three hours for a ride. If they have had controlled numbers, this won't happen. Wasted a whole afternoon as we view other rides of minimum 70mins. This is definitely unworthy.

Going to USS is such a disappointment. Most of the food stores were closed, and many of the attractions too. They dont inform you that certain rides have different operating times. Mummy till 5PM Transformers till 7PM Human & Cylone ride is under maintenance. Waterworld is closed, the Steven Spielberg show is closed as well. My friends & I didnt know that the rides were only operating till certain schedules. As it wasnt stated anywhere on the brochure or notice board. We did not know and we blindly went to the other rides, spending a long time queuing up. We missed out on the good stuff. Lets face it, only the Mummy Human & Cylone ride are the best rides in USS. Yet we couldnt get on them. Its really disappointing. There was a free snack which are just chicken nuggets. My friends boyfriend couldnt eat it as hes a vegan so he was really hungry for the entire period of time. We felt really bad as well since there wasnt any vegetarian food for him. The water dispensers were all turned off as well. So youd be forced to buy the 5 water. There should be a sign on the USS website stating what rides are closed, and the other rides that are still operating, their schedules. So people can plan their trip appropriately and instead we just slowly strolled around without knowing all the crucial information. Only go if youre ok with the kiddy rides, Long queues, watered down experience, hot weather & mask wearing for the whole time.

Honestly I am disappointed, so many of the major rides/attraction were close!! What a waste of time. Some of the rides queue were long nvm understandable BUT the opening hours of some rides is damn short, so hard to squeeze within the time frame. Based on info from friends and family, it seems like always got at least 1 ride under maintenance when we visit. It was nice that there was free nuggets that came with my klook voucher, but I hope that USS will consider having vegetarian option for the free snacks, Thank you.

2.review_text: Came here expecting crowd to be thinner than usual due to phase 2 HA. Big mistake. June holidays will always be crowded no matter what. Most of eateries are closed, resulting in crazy long queues at food kiosk. Just to buy a drink , you have to stand in line for 30mins. Bring your own water when you visit. Lots of it so you won't waste time queuing buying like I did. Waiting time for rides are about 45 mins, popular ones like transformers, the mummy and jurassic rapids water ride is 110-130 mins (I skipped all). Battlestar galactica is closed , no live shows. Only a few handful roving mascots. Overall experience is just meh.

3.review_text: Few rides not open. Waiting times is around 1hr for a rides don't recommend visiting during school holidays or public holidays

4.review_text: Cylon and human were closed but it wasnt explicit during booking.. Wouldnt have gone if i had known.. Many rides closed and/or have staggered opening times
Couldn't play some rides due to maintenance,maybe let we know before we buy the tickets
Visited on 13 May 2021 before Phase 2 Heighten Alert. Queue was manageable ranging at about 30 to 60 minutes for popular rides. I spent 6 hours there and we took about 8 rides.

When I went there in December around New Year Festival, it's crowded with many tourists. It's many rides there and need to wait too much time to reach your turn. One of my favourite ride is Transformers and mummy rides. It's so real and feels so good. If you want to go there, please check weather. If it will rain, it is better not to go there. Some rides stop due to weather condition. Please bring umbrellas or extra clothes.
Human/Cyclone rides were closed

5.review_text: As for covid period, this place is great to visit. Every ride requires less than 15min of wait and there arent many people around. However alot of food shops and souvenir shops were closed. The human and cyclone ride was closed as well. Indoor shows were also closed. So if you don't mind not going for those, go on and visit!

The social distancing ambassadors were good at reminding people for the safety measures. We got caught taking picture with no mask on, but we were having chicken nuggets at that time Overall, we had fun at Universal Studios Singapore with lesser crowd

I came in early pandemic, before circuit breaker in Singapore...and it's so very quiet...I can play almost all attraction and games, without queue.... I hope this pandemic ended faster, so I can come again to this place.....really missed Singapore...

I was near the end of the line before the show opened, but the show opened a little early. It was a weekday, so there weren't many people, so it was perfect. There is no waiting for Hamunaptra in the deep attack. I had to wait 60 minutes for Transformers, but I think I got it in about 45 minutes. I also got Shregg 4D easily. Is the restaurant also a popular bakery? There was a long line, but everything else was fine. UNIVA is small and easy to get around, and there are attractions that you can enjoy that are not found in Japan.

1.review_text: Too crowded. Lots of kiosk restaurants and rides are closed. You pay for queuing hours and hours

02/07 I went USS but I'm very disappointed about the roller coaster was closed for maintenance, If before covid USS is open for 365 days never closed I can understand the maintenance is needed, but due to covid USS operation for 3 days a week then why the roller coaster still under maintenance. This is really unacceptable and I feel the ticket is not worth without the roller coaster

3.review_text: Due to covid 19 capacity rules, many shops and shows were closed. The tickets shouldve been half off, if only half of the attractions were available. It was very tough on the elderly in our family group visit since the theatre shows were unavailable, so you may wish to postpone such visits until the park opens fully. Staff were top notch - super helpful and knowledgeable. We had a great day, but felt that it lacked value.
Most attraction were closed...

4.review_text: With safe distancing implemented it may look like there is a lot of people visiting the park but its actually due to the 1m safe distancing that make the queue look long. Take note of the different timing for each specific ride. I think The Mummy ride could be until 7pm as its the most anticipated ride. As of 9th July 2021 the Battlestar Galactic ride has been on maintenance check their website for their latest update! Do catch the appearance of Megatron as he is interactive which means you are able to talked to him like an actual person and he does respond sarcastically which is amusing to hear.

An absolute great place in Singapore. Nice services and staffs but it would be more interesting when you visit it in fewer-tourist months cause it is pretty crowded. A recommend place you should try even though you have to line up for such long time is the Jurassic Park River Adventure. It won't let you down, so, be patient and enjoy every moment!!!
Long waiting times for most rides. Pretty Overpriced food. Rides are fun though. Pleasant experience with the few times I have been there.
Most of the fun ride not open. Very little people this period and so no need to queue..
Loves the aesthetic vibes of USS. Battlestar Galactica is closed and was quite disappointed, really wanted to ride it. Heard that its closed quite often and for a long time.

5.review_text: Beat place to hang around for entire day . Don't miss these rides : transformers 4D, the mummy returns, Jurassic Park ride , 4D Shrek show, and many more

1.review_text: Terrible service for customers, the best attractions are closed for renovations and it is not even reflected in price
If raining whole day my ticket would be a waste as i cant take rides...bad experience...really bad experience!!!

3.review_text: Worth a visit if you have kids, but ready to spend a lot of time waiting in lines. Even if you pay extra for the pass to "cut the line" and take the express line, you may end up waiting over an hour for some rides. A few of the rides are more geared towards kids, so that's why this may be worth a visit if you are entertaining children. Overall, it was nice experience to visit Singaporean Universal Studios, but wouldn't come a second time.

4.review_text: A number of rides and restaurants are closed but waiting time is less than 20 mins.

Visited USS yesterday. A lot of rides / shows closed, including the battlestar galactica. I knew about this as they do indicate on the website, but thrill seekers may find it boring (rides more suitable for families / kids). Still fun as its one of the few fun things you can do during the heightened alert lockdown!
A tad small compared to other theme parks in the region. Cant be helped due to Singapores land shortage I guess. Other than that, its a nice place to visit.
Great place to go. Even with covid, just one thing disappointing is the frequent break down of transformers.

1.review_text: Very disappointed as more than half the rides were closed and we were not even informed. Shrek 4D, Steven Spielberg show, battlestar galatica, water world show, multiple shops and food courts. If I knew so many rides and shops were going to be closed, would not even waste my time going. No characters on the streets at all. Halloween theme food was also terrible. Asked for NO BREAST MEAT, given ALL BREAST MEAT. 76 in total for a lousy meal. Would not recommend this park to anyone I know. Horrid. Boring.

2.review_text: The top three rollercoasters were closed and everything was not open until 2pm. Considering that the park is only open 3 days a week, that is pretty poor. Not a great day out, really. There are much better theme parks out there, and 81 is quite expensive for what you get.
It's not fun at all, many restaurants are not open, and it takes an hour to even queue. Friends who dont know how to ask distant relatives to come here are really unforgettable.
Best rides of the place was closed for maintenance

3.review_text: it's not USS without Battlestar Galactica... Overall still fun due to the company. Do note water dispensers are off for hygiene reasons. Water can be purchased inside the shops at 4. Personally feel that tickets should be priced based on rides that are opened...
Lot of F&B are close. Ride need to wait for too long. Not worth of money. Most ride start at 2pm. Tired of waiting for the ride.
Really its a very nice place to spent some time with friends and family but nowadays A lot of rides / shows are closed due to Covid-19

4.review_text: Some rides were closed during this covid period
Good to go to explore once, don't expect much shelter from the rain and heat. Wait time for rides can be hell.
Went for night event, not too many rides are open , but the we get to go for transformer ride twice because there is no queue.
Not so full of people during covid period

5.review_text: Due to Covid 19 restrictions, there were not many people here. The attractions were fun and satisfactory. Some rides are less suitable for children however so keep that in mind. As for restrooms and such, they were amazingly clean with a cool aesthetic. Unfortunately for my Muslim brethren, not a lot of halal food options. Some of the juices are actually spiked with alcohol, though the staff will inform you. Overall very enjoyable.
Very nice and interesting place! The queue takes a long time but it's worth it! The queue is much faster now due to covid!

Safe distancing measures are in place thus many facilities and rides are closed. Meet & greet can only be done at a distance. However, due to the crowd control, Q for rides takes no more than 30min, can even be as short as 10min. Overall, the place is still worth the visit.
It was quite empty but then again we are in a pandemic. Not complaining I'm glad they are still open first time I ever visit USS and had fun.

1.review_text: 2019/12 #visit once There was a company booking the venue that day, but there was no warning at the counter or on the official website in advance, which was a bad impression.
Almost all the rides are closed.... What a waste of money
The USS Hawellon Horror Nights is so bad for year 2021. Nothing scary about it

2.review_text: Not worth the price. Few rides not open. Cannot refill water. Coz of covid I think it's not worth at all.
A bit disappointed. A lot of facilities , shows and theather are close and not worth for visit this period

3.review_text: Overall the rides are fun, understably and unfortunately some of them are shut, but what lets the park down is lack of Covid-19 safety management and enforcement of safe distancing... Too many patrons blatantly ignoring the obvious 1 metre waiting markings but there's no staff to check. We try to show and educate other patrons directly around us all day, but unreasonable to need to for our own safety. Govt officers would be busy if they were present

Came here during covid. Unfortunately a lot of the attractions were either closed for maintenance of affected by the ongoing pandemic restrictions. The ticket price isn't worth it with all of the restrictions.

Usually much more fun, but as of October 2021: - two best rides are not working due to maintenance; - only 4 people per one ride car instead of 16 due to social distancing leading to lengthy queues; - many rides close at 6 pm, so "night" experience is underwhelming; - "free" snack and drink that is included in the ticket price are HORRIBLE: this is the scariest experience you will have there during Halloween. Seriously, don't even think consuming that stuff... The only new good attraction worth attention was Halloween horror movies exhibition: excellent one indeed!

Used to be a smashing experience, but this year's Halloween horror Nights was an extremely underwhelming experience. Understandably, the pandemic has watered down everything to the extent that there is barely any feel of Halloween. They chose to pipe in loud club music instead of scary music, there are no 'scarers' except the social distancing ambassadors that will appear randomly to say '2 in a group ah'. The 'scare alley' was over in 20 seconds? The exhibition was OK and actually quite informative but because there was just so many people I felt pressured to keep walking instead of reading every single infopanel like I usually do (am a museum buff). So many rides were closed, which meant that queues were long (even though kids are having their Os and A levels and on paper there should be less of a crowd). We got the express pass but I shudder to think what would happen if we didn't. We probably get to queue for 2 rides and that's it. I guess that's a scare too. Save your money and catch a horror movie, you'll get more of a kick than coming here ...for now (at least till after the pandemic)
Most of the rides were closed. Disappointing.

4.review_text: Unfortunately a fair bit of rides and food stalls are closed.. The small numbers of visitors does not help

Bias: I took a small child who loves dinosaurs. Never been to an amusement park before. Great environment. One ride was disabled but was quickly fixed and returned to service. Went on a weekday so queues were short. Actual time on ride were short but since waits weren't bad, this was acceptable. Rides were high quality and nothing was scary for small child. Cons: heat was high and closed water access means buying lots of water/drinks from food stands. Prices are extortionate, 15 for a fountain drink is near criminal. But you're stuck and have no other options. I'd give 5 stars but this is particularly awful and unforgivable.
This year USS Halloween opening hours is shorter. Free snacks vouchers, shorter ride queue... its not too bad. As we get to take rides.

5.review_text: Went last thursday and there is really less people. Probably all locals due to COVID. I went in from opening to close and within that short time, i am able to get onboard for all rides, some even able to ride twice. Average waiting time for rides is around 10min. Some even do not have people so can directly get onboard. However, better to get drinks and food outside before going in. Overall experience is still EXCELLENT
Almost perfect, just some times certain attraction goes into maintenance. Do check out if they are operating before going!

It is my fifth time here and Universal Studios Singapore never fail to amaze me! The staffs are really helpful and have great hospitality! The rides are well-maintained even after so many years. It was also the Halloween season, so there was the Halloween Horror Night exhibition and also the scream alley and extended opening hours. Even though it was a toned down version of Halloween Horror Night, it was a great job done by the USS team! Cant wait to be back for my next visit!
Went multiple time, good experience but same old thing
Cannot believe the amount of visitors there, they probably had more staff than them! All the ride queues were like express lanes! Love it!

1.review_text: Very disappointed. Many attractions were not available, in particular the live shows and many of the restaurants except on main street were closed. Yet the ticket price remained the same... I'm guessing because Afterall most were using the sg govt issued vouchers and the park enjoys full value on it
Not even open daily..... Especially now after exams and many people go there for staycation etc....
Clos rollercoaster too early

2.review_text: Lack of organization and zero safe distancing in many facilities. But still broadly fun experience
Not the right time to visit during this pandemic. Most performance was cancelled and park closed at 7pm.

3.review_text: it's all a little run down and some queue times were really crazy haha sometimes they don't correspond to the queue times shown outside lol so just give or take 20 min? I rode Revenge of the Mummy and the queue time said 40 min but it ended up being over an hour long :( Park closes at 9 but rides close at 8, just take note! Enjoy your trip!

Rapid ride had technical difficulties, Canopy ride not valid for Universal Express tickets, overall unsatisfactory experience spending 345 for only only having tried some of the rides due to the queues and closing at 7pm. However I have to commend on ticket counter staff Claire, who is exemplary in helping customers waiting in line to purchase tickets and was a tremendous help to me.

4.review_text: Long queue at most rides. A few eating places closed.

This was actually my first time to USS. Took this as an opportunity to visit with the family. Reached around 1pm, crowd was moderate. Didnt had to wait long while queueing up. I would say we managed to try 80% of the rides available. Most waiting time for the rides are 20 to 70mins long. I was quite surprised that the queue for the cyclon rollar coaster ride was only 20mins. Came during the school holidays, otherwise, i think the place would be more quieter.

Fun place, but food and drinks are pricey so do come prepared! Queues do stretch to over an hour during peak periods like holidays so it would be good to buy an Express pass although those are very expensive to fully expend your day there

Less crowds during this covid situation. Waiting for rides were not more than 20 min long. Some rides are not open and were stopped during this raining seasons. Advice is to go for outdoor rides first when the weather is good
Great place for family but we went there on eve of Halloween and the waiting time was way too long and there were not any safety distancing being monitored. Will be good to go on non peak days.

5.review_text: Fun but some of the attractions are not open. Queue is long but waiting time is okay i guess

This place is still great even though some of the rides were down / suspended due to Covid-19 social distancing requirements. I missed visiting 1 of my favourite attractions in the park- the Shrek 4D as it was closed due to social distancing. Had a fun time riding the roller coasters, transformers, merry-go-rounds etc. The park was pretty crowded and we had to queue up to an hour or more for some of the rides despite the park not operating at 100% capacity. The highlights of the visit was supposed to be the Halloween horror nights but this year was quite a disappointment. There were no scare zones/haunted attractions to visit but instead, a Halloween Horror Exhibition of previous years fest was being showcased. Walking through the exhibition brought back wonderful/scary memories of the pre-covid days in USS during the Halloween Horrors. Nevertheless, it had been an enjoyable day spent there.

Really quite sad that the whole place is so empty. Just hoping that everything is safe again so that everything can go back to normal and the themed festivities can resume in full force once again. That said, if you want to skip the queues, go now during this season. Everything has a waiting time of about 30 min max.
The place is clean. During the week end it is crowded. Avoid weekend to avoid crowds.
One day is never enough to cover the entire theme park. Theme park is open from 10 am. If you need to see more, be there before 10 am.

1.review_text: Some rides closed. Longer waiting time ( an hour) compared to pre covid. Frequent long breakdown like the mummies ride even with Express pass. Even restaurant has to queue for an hour or two. Better feed urself first before entering especially with kid and nowadays cannot enjoy light food on the street because must mask on. USJ experience was much better. I feel that quality time can be spent somewhere else like beach/zoo/other sg attractions where much less queue typically.

USS is getting from bad to worse .if you want full enjoyment, need to buy express lane tickets,which cost alot more.this COVID time I understand they need to safe distance most ride,ride normally can take 16 people become take 8 people ,therefore waiting time is longer..but the USS park daily allow people I don't think they reduce much,this causing all ride have to wait over 2 hours,it's really ridiculous..and the price is still the same no discount at all..somemore some ride are close.for me i really had a feeling like being cheated..total only 3 ride I take.all spending on waiting,not very worth buying the 1 day tickets.

Such a terrible admission policy. They said that the number of people in the park was limited due to the pandemic, but I couldnt believe it because people are everywhere and the average time of waiting for rides is around an hour. A lot of restaurants and food carts are also closed so you should wait for at least 10minutes in a queue for just a can of drink.

Reached 12, managed to rode 3 rides only till its closing time. My personal opinion, I think they sold the tickets more than what it was supposed to be. 16th Dec 2021 was the worst day to go to USS. Spend almost Sgd300 for the tickets and managed to rode 3 rides only. USS should control the numbers of tickets being sold to ensure visitors enjoy and have fun especially children. It should be open at least 6 days a week during the school holiday

It was very disappointing. Due to the rain,a lot of the rides were not operational. Those that were operational had waiting times usually beyond 100mins. Only 2 rides had waiting time of less than 1 hr (30min & 40min). Apart from the rides there didnt seem to be any other attractions. Game booths were closed. If u have younger,active kids not advisable to go cos of the queues & lack of other activities to participate in. Also very limited halal food. A lot of eateries/restaurants were closed. Only 2 places were halal. There were several push carts but none seemed to have halal food. We went on a Sat,during school holiday. I guess if you wait till maybe middle of 2022,or 2023, during off peak period, it might be a more worthwhile experience. Hopefully more things to see and experience.

2.review_text: Generally unhappy. Good sights and sounds, but being trapped in incredible long queues (60-90 mins for 5-10 min rides), spending on overpriced food and generally tolerating staff not trained in the hospitality business is really not worth it.
Lonq queue and waiting time.Managed to visit only 3 station. Not worth the high entrance fees paid.

Total Rip-off and dangerous!!! 1. The park only open for 9 hours, compared to Disneyland 14 hrs. 2. Some rides and food courts are closed. 3. Wet and slippery floor inside Shrek's. My son fell down and wet his pants.
Waiting 2 hours for a 5 minute ride. What a waste of time!

3.review_text: I was at USS on 27 Dec 2021. Been there many times before covid as we had the annual pass. I must say, the experience was not as good as in the past. While the rides themselves were just as good, there were several things that should be taken note of. I believe these are as a result of safe distance measures that have to be put in place but there should still be room for improvement. 1. Many many kiosks were closed which resulted in long queues at the other kiosks. 2. Again, many restaurants were closed too which also resulted in long queues elsewhere. 3. All water dispensers were shut off. I understand that its likely due to hygiene issue as a result of covid. 4. Expect very long queue at rides as they cannot be fully utilised due to safe distancing. Thats expected. 5. Several places were closed such as Waterworld, the theatre. Do check the website for more details. Overall, it seems like there was a shortage of staff. In some rides, I see only 1 staff that cause the queues to move slower. The same staff has to manage the queue, operate the ride and ensure safety before the ride begins. During peak hours, more staff should be hired to operate the food/drinks kiosk. Its expected that more people will be getting drinks since all water dispensers are not working. In short, avoid going during peak periods.

A very dissapointing experience. Most food establishments were not opened (discovery food court seems to be forever closed and the food court near the Mummy ride was closed during visit) Rides were severely understaffed with boarding and disembarking processes taking longer than usual. Rides like the carousell had longer wait times than stated due to only one person manning both the lines and the ride itself and this is on a Sunday just after Christmas. I understand that there are safety distancing guidelines to follow but no proper measure is actually implemented. Water points are all disabled which makes it mandatory to either bring your own water or purchase water from the park at an exorbitant price. Stalls selling drinks like slushies had a long wait as well. Ambience wise was nice overall but there were plenty damages that were visible to the eye like potholes in the ground to dusts in the ceilings of the rides which showed very little maintenance is carried out. Operators manning the rides often talk too fast on the mic which makes their voice barely audible to be heard clearly. Overall the entire process could have been managed better. I really hope that future experiences can be better.

Overall fun experience in the park. The rides are still in pretty good shape and due to covid, not too crowded. Still one must expect queuing times to be min 30 mins to an hour at least for the more popular rides. Also almost half of the eateries in the park is not open. So expect extreme long queue and waiting times for a table to have a proper meal in the remainder of the restaurants that are still open. Waiting times are even longer when it rains. Everyone will just want to stay inside and not move. Christmas decorations are totally disappointing. Apart from a few Christmas Trees, and some sort of promotion going on at the main plaza area, there isn't a hint of Christmas elsewhere. Recommend to go on weekdays to avoid crowd and especially very full eateries both inside and outside USS.

Third visit to USS. Got reminded again why i dislike going here. The park is supposedly at 50% capacity because of Covid. However, the ride queues were still around 50-130 minutes. I can't imagine how it is at 100% capacity. Booked time slots but apparently no one checks when you enter so that was a waste of time. Not sure visiting during Covid period is a good idea. It's already hot enough on normal days, but wearing the mask was a torture.

It is time for USS to look into revamping the place, it is starting to look like a run down theme park. We experience a breakdown during transformer. Luckily it was not the roller coasters. Imagine being stuck up there upside down? Should really look into providing better maintenance and upgrading of facilities.

4.review_text: went uss since my last visit 10 yrs back. was on Monday there's still some queue in front most rides.well, think bcos local ppl use their Sg Rediscovery Vouchers before close to expiry. The park staffs seems short handed...the complimentary set meal inclusive in the 100 package ticket turns out a turkey leg priced up to 25 perhaps worths 10 bucks max. what to do? the park's been struggling for 2yrs n till now not seeing any tourists on the island. it's like drown up to her neck.

I went 20dec monday. The crowd is indeed as much as pre covid, queues looked super long too with over an hour for most attractions. Hope they could reduce the amount of people as the people load is crazy. I bought the express unlimited and my average queue time was about minutes per attraction. Today the human was not operating ( technical issues) The transformers also had some technical issues and was suspended quite frequently.
Long queues every where. Rides, food places and toilets

About 10 rides are open! No fireworks, no shows, no water coolers/fountains open, no photos that you can buy from your ride. Bring your own water, because bottled water is 4 per bottle (same price as canned drinks). Park was open 9 hours. My partner and I queued 1 hour for the mummy ride before it broke down and we had to leave without riding. No customer retention action taken (e.g. in Disney you might get a fast pass to come back later to take the ride in express queue). So we left disappointedly. Realised that with the normal lines being at least 1 hour long (mummy ride was 2.5 hours long at some point), we would only be able to fit in 5 rides at most, without resting. Buying express ticket for 60 per person was a worthy investment and the best choice we made!! Took 5 rides within 2 hours, had time to eat and rest. The whole park is obviously understaffed but that is understandable. Food took 45 min to queue for but we had 10% discount, turkey leg was a special experience, all in all good theme park food for 2 ppl less than 30 bucks! Water is in serious shortage, had to refill our bottles at the bathroom taps. Saw many teenagers looking very dehydrated as they are not wealthy enough to be purchasing 4 for water. Shops aren't really open, only some food open. Nothing fancy at this theme park and I will probably choose other countries if I could for universal studios, but no choice now haha. I hope all the staff stay well and it is good to see a healthy sized crowd still coming into the attraction. Only thing that bothered me was the lack of social distancing and blatant breaking of nationwide rules. As people realised throughout the day that they could get away with it, they stopped pretending they're in separate groups. Many groups of more than 5. Even saw 10. No social distancing in lines. SDAs here are USS internal staff so they also don't enforce (mainly they protect their own staff by keeping us at a distance). Many teenagers unaccompanied by parents, so nobody is telling them what they can or cannot do. Some even take off mask in line.

Need maintenance, quite some rides were suspended, and quite crowded especially during this festive season, each ride prepare to wait for 30-120 mins or more.. overall still good fun for families in Singapore.

5.review_text: Probably its time for universal studio Singapore to upgrade, as the rides is getting old. need a refresher for new rides.

I made a reservation, but it was very crowded. From 12:00 to 20:00, I had to wait for an hour three times, so I was only able to ride 6.7 attractions in total, including the 30-minute wait for a food break. Mummy was thrilling, and Puss in Boots was also exhilarating. I want to go again.

USS is one of my favourite attractions in SG, I've been there quite a few times, its fun and worth your money. However, some rides and attractions are closed due to the current pandemic which makes USS less fun now.

Haven't been here for last 5 years! It is still as orderly and clean as I remember it to be. Although covid is still haunting us, the crowd is there largely due to year end school holiday. Queue time for the popular rides still stands at minimum 1 hour. It helps to download the USS app to help you plan which ride to go on first. Otherwise an express ticket is a wise choice if you intend to take every single ride. We didn't get into any restuarant for a meal here as everywhere was crowded. It didn't affect us though, we had a full breakfast before we hit USS. Note: do allow 2 hours for food to be digested if you plan to go on the rides lol.
Wan & Anna of USS Guest Services are very friendly and helpful. Very positive and provide solution to resolve my tickets issue. They are assets to USS

1.review_text: Only manage to ride 2 attraction cause the queue is so freaking long. Waited 3 hours for a 3 mins rollercoaster. Recommend getting express pass if you want to get the fullest experience of USS

Two thirds of the park is closed due to covid, so what would usually be a whole day experience can easily be done in 3 hours. They don't tell you that all of this is closed and they do not tell you that more than half the food places are closed, so you go in blind, and end up hungry. The whole park looks like it needs a makeover, I get that it's tough times and they have fewer money than usually, but it looks like the park is not maintained at all. The entire water world is closed, you can even get in to see the - run down- decorations. They are practically the wish version of Disney land. So disappointed.
Not worth the money to visit USS as many shows are not available probably due to covid

2.review_text: Lacking entertainers and all restaurants and etateries are closed for business.Not too many visitors or tourists. Looks deserted at some venues and not much fun to spend your time there.I guest you can blame convid situation for that

No musollah. Pathetic, on our land. A tourist place yet not 1 musollah. Choose your dates carefully or be prepared to wait 1 hours for each ride. Limited halal options and are always full. Good amount of seats. More water rides would be great but of course, no space.
Dissapointing... 10years ago still same attractions and many were closed. Even the theatre and character parade were not experienced.

3.review_text: Opening is from 12 to 9. But rides close at 8. Most of the rides have 60 minutes waiting time. Express costs 70 per person. So essentially, you will never completely go through all the attraction if you don't have express. That's the frustrating part

Every other ride was down every hour for 15-30 minutes. Seems like more of a crowd dispersion technique rather than real technical issues. Otherwise I would be concerned that broken rides can be fixed and certified in 20mins...also, very small compared to other countries and almost half the stores were closed.

Universal studio Singapore, it is a technical marvel and all the attractions are exceptionally good. However even with express pass you will have to wait up to 30 minutes in some of the rides And for the standard ticket it may take up to 2 to 2 1/2 hours for one attraction. The management need to do something otherwise one person with a standard ticket can only visit up to 2 or 3 attractions in one day. Dont mind me saying it is a complete rip off.
Super long queue during weekends! Christmas theme not that nice this time, still many are not operating.. hope it will be lively, happy place to be again soon. More power!
Alot of rides are closed or long queue due to ongoing covid pandemic. Not reccomended to visit.

4.review_text: Crowd was not too bad at the various rides. Other than the mummy ride which states requiring of 120 minutes, the rest varies from 10-50 minutes. Reduce by 1 star since almost half the park rides was not open. Queues at the restaurants were long as well as some are not opened.

Good place to chill but if you are trying to shun crowds, don't go.. best and only place in sg to satisfy your theme park and intense rides cravings but have to plan your rides :) the "minutes" waiting time signage outside each ride is merely for an approximate only, add another 0.5 times at least to the wait time...

Universal Studios Singapore was not as good as I remembered back in 2013, being in the mist of a pandemic as expected A LOT of things were closed, including restaurants, shops, attractions and even one world. The Human and Cyclone were closed on the day I went (Thursday) for maintenance, literally the sole reason I wanted to go in the first place. Overall a very good trip to take, still very enjoyable!

Haha, there are too many people! However, there were surprisingly few people on the roller coaster, and the queue lasted for five minutes! The upside down roller coaster is the most fun! The feeling of weightlessness is not strong, mainly because I like it, it is more exciting Transformers carefully considered... The queue queue is super long... After queuing for two and a half hours, I might as well go on a few roller coasters. The turkey legs taste good, but the smoothie has a lot of pigment. When I go home and go to the toilet, it's always blue...

Queues were very short on the Sunday we visited - even the big name coasters only had 5 minute waiting time. We bought the express pass but honestly it probably saved us less than 20 minutes of queuing throughout the whole day. The big negative is that many of the indoor shows (and some rides) are shut due to covid. You can probably visit every attraction within 4 or 5 hours, so dont necessarily plan to spend a whole day here.

5.review_text: It was crowded, wait time was too long for most of the rides. Overall the place is good. Please include wait times in your planning before visit.
Went on the 20th of Jan, was quite a good day as all rides had a max of 20mins wait time for us! A pity that battlestar wasnt open though:(
My 2nd time visitation. Overall observation is a fun place especially the roller coasters but not for old folks. But there are other attractions for them too. I like shopping there too.

Fun place to be at, but kind of expensive. Hopefully they have more water rides like the Jurassic park water ride, and the transformer indoor ride. When it rains, the queue in the transformers is about 2 hour. I wouldn't want to pay 70 to go in and queue for half the day. The best ride is the human and cylon roller coasters if you dare to sit. Otherwise, try out the transformers and Jurassic park water ride then the Jurassic park flying ride to dry yourself off. Shops has adorable items if you want to buy some as souvenirs.
Great place for the family.... If only they like rides. Food are expensive there, bring more water, water coolers are all not in service anymore.

1.review_text: Worst experience Park opens from 12 to 7. Rides are open from 2 to 6. In between you will have to walk in open park, and wait in queue for 60 minutes for each ride , which leaves you no time for even 3 rides , to board the ride and get pulled off, giving weather and maintenance as a reason, then what abt the 60 minutes I was in queue, cant you even issue a one time express pass for that ride because We sat on the boat and got pulled off and yet you want us to exit and re enter the 60 minute wait queue. They force you to buy the express pass indirectly. The staffs are racists and arrogant. They are not approachable. Not friendly. Would ruin your fun mood with their arrogant attitude. If your ethnicity is non Chinese or European or Australian, you better stay away from this park. You can see that in the meet and greets simply want to drive some ethnicities away.

Disappointed that most of the rides and shows are closed. Understand that the pandemic is ongoing and there's a drop in park visitors. However if a magical experience is what USS Singapore is trying to provide. They have greatly missed the point. Whilst operating cost Is an issue, I'm sure they have enough experience to think out of the box and create lower cost experiences. Not coming back for a very long time.

Open 12pm,the best rides are all after 2pm,had to queue mummy ride for 1 and half hr, ended up paying fine for locker which has given us 75 minutes, transformers ride, had no audio, had to take again, wasted time

Started the day off happy and enjoying myself but eventually turned into a horrible day. Some staff were rude, not helpful and most important made me feel uncomfortable being there. I was taking a sip of water in 30* heat when a staff member told me off for putting my mask down, how the hell do I drink my water then... Transformers meet and greet was honestly rude, with speeches being a bit too sensitive to guests and tourists as I was walking by and stopped. Don't think I'll ever be coming back.

Opening times for the rides are staggered. Human at 12-3pm, Cyclon at 4-7pm, Mummy and Transformers at 2pm onward. Even though the capacity to enter USS is reduced, the queues are still long, around 60-90mins.

2.review_text: Got some free tickets to Universal Studios Singapore (USS) from Red Cross Singapore in celebration of World Blood Donor Day 2021 for the blood donation did back in 2020. USS is currently open only for 4 days a week (Thu-Sun) and there is a need to go online to book the entry slot timing of 12pm or 3pm as it is now the requirement due to COVID-19 Safe Management Measures. Entered at 12pm and the park was still relatively empty as most humans have not headed in yet. Some rides and shows are currently closed such as Shrek 4D, Lights Camera Action and Waterworld. Some rides started at 12pm such as the Cylons Vs Humans Roller Coaster, Particle Accelerator, Treasure Hunt, Jurassic World Rapids Ride and Madagascar Boat Ride. Some rides starts at 1pm such as Elmo's Spaghetti Adventure and Transformers. Some rides start at 2pm such as Revenge of the Mummy. Much planning is required to ensure the golden hour of 12pm to 1pm is not wasted waiting for rides to open. It was fun trying the different rides and glad that most are not undersized. Going through the rides brought much joy and laughter. Only bad part of going to a theme park, stuck in lines and the poor air circulation. More fans are needed for the long queues. Enjoyed a meal at Louis NY Pizza Parlor bringing back memories of pizza at Julianna's over in DUMBO. Really miss good pizza. Drinks are crazy expensive too at SG5 a cup. Glad that the free tickets came with 2 x 5 meal voucher and 2 x 5 off with min spend of SG25 meal voucher to help offset the cost of the food and drinks. All in a great day of fun and reminder why theme parks are not in my travel plans. Just do not like dealing with long queues for 1 to 2 mins of mirth. Not a place for bigger sized persons as all theme parks are loathe to do.

Paying expensive entrance fee but not having the freedom to take any ride at any time during the opening hours. The official opening hour from 12pm-7pm but why does most of the ride not opened at 12pm especially the cyclone ride that open at 4pm during the official opening time. Very disappointing and upsetting to see it's standard have dropped over the years.

3.review_text: A lot of stalls (small carts) were closed owing to Covid. Not 100% of the rides were operating. That led to overcrowding on the remaining limited rides. Well, the timing wasn't great. CNY plus Covid restrictions. I am sure but can only imagine for now, this is a great place with kids. But, go for the express pass if you want to make most out of the visit.

Too many rides closed and reduced hours, no shows on the day I visited and barely any restaurants open. Hours were 12pm - 7pm and the rides that were open were awesome!!! If you can, wait to visit when covid restrictions end. If you can't, you will still have a good afternoon.

4.review_text: Singapore's one and only theme park. It has Hollywood glamour and showbiz appeal. Rides are awesome. Only drawback is once you've been through the entire park you will quickly realize that it doesn't have as many rides as a true international quality theme park should have. So, due to the ongoing pandemic, many food outlets were closed and also many attractions like the Lights Camera Action one, the Shrek 4D and the shows. And there was a lack of street side entertainment. So no Disney-style parades. Meet and Greets are also fairly detached and impersonal, you can't hug any of their characters for example. Hope to see this park get up from the doldrums and start shining bright like it once did, soon!
Some rides shut down and slow lines due to covid. Still worth a visit.
It's a bit quiet because there's still Covid. But when walking in, the atmosphere still reminded me of an amusement park that was fun and cheerful.

5.review_text: Came on a Sunday and it was raining very heavily in the morning and early afternoon and was worried we wont be able to play any games at all However thankfully some rides were open (merry go round and other indoor ones like the MUMMY ride that are not affected by thunder or weather ) And later in the afternoon the weather cleared up and we got to try all the others Favourites are: the mummy ( long queue) , CYLON rollercoaster (also long queue) Dislikes: the transformer 3d ride, very shaky and makes you dizzy, I felt I was close to throwing up. Overall a nice day out to explore USS sg again, its not a big USS at all compared to others like in Japan but still worth coming once a while

Was here a couple years ago and thoroughly enjoyed myself. Lots of rides weren't open at that time so hopefully will be back again soon! One thing for sure though is that I prefer this universal studios to the one in Japan as it was just filled with shops and hardly any rides. Which really was a shame.
Super fun! Long waiting times for some rides though..

1.review_text: Park operating on limited time slots hence extremely crowded. Alot or rides and shows are not opened therefore remaining rides have long waiting time, u can hardly get on more than 3 rides if meal times included. Snaking queues at restaurants so u can't utilise the meal vouchers if u want to get on more rides. Overall unsatisfactory experience, definitely won't be back till its operating on full capacity and time slot.

In the park right now. Starving. Dehydrated. Zero efficiency. 1H line to get water. Food and drinks not separated so dehydrated people have to wait forever for something to drink. Attraction lines are worse. Zero efficiency.

Worst USS experience ever - beware before you buy tickets. Read this review first: We paid 4 tickets plus 4 express tickets at full price and went on Thursday 24 March 2022. This was our sons birthday present and their first ever USS experience going on rides. When we got there however we discovered that all the shows are closed (all incl. Waterworld, Shrek, ALL of them). Lights, Camera, Action ride is also closed. The food court is closed. Some of the restaurants were closed. Half the food trucks are closed. All water fountains are turned off. One has to walk half-way across the park to buy overpriced water. We queued for 15mins to buy 1 slush beverage even though we were just third in line. We waited another half hour to order pizza at one of the few restaurants that are open...and mind you, it was NOT crowded and there were just 4 guests in front of us, max. Finally, the website advertises a Madagaskar parade. Beware, that was not a parade. They were just a couple of dancers and 3 Madagaskar characters dancing at one spot. There is no parade as advertised. They also do not inform on their website that all the shows are closed. Also 2 rides were closed temporarily due to technical issues. And they also halted the outdoor rides for about 30mins due to lightning risk (we never heard any lightning nor did it ever rain). Overall the rides are still great but paying full price for getting just half the experience is very, very poor, and very disappointing. Ive been to the Universal Studios park many times in the US and in Singapore and THIS was the worst experience Ive ever had. I highly believe that this lack of service goes against the culture of the real Universal Studios corporation (they would never allow that). Like another user puts it, this is a complete rip-off. Just take peoples money and dont care to deliver. Shameful.

Every ride had a queue of 50-60 min. This means you get to do 6 rides if you are lucky. The lines are too long and the wait time written outside is always wrong. I saw many that had '15' mins wait time written when the reality was one hour. The rides inside the park also start at different timings. This is the first time I've witnessed this at an amusement. Why can't all the rides start at the same time? Some rides are only open for 3 hours and the queues are 1.5 hours long. You are standing quite close to each in the queues due to covid restrictions they make people sit in only 2 rows to maintain social distance. Really need to do something about the long waiting time. What's even more ridiculous is that all outdoor rides were temporarily closed because of thunderstorm in an area close by. It wasn't even drizzling.

Our trip to Universal Studios as a family of 4 was fine. My 6 year old and 2 year old enjoyed the rides. The queues were not too long. However, the 1 star review is to reflect: 1. All water dispensers are shut off, which according to customer services, is due to covid-19. However, given that I have been able to use water taps to fill water bottles at gyms and other attractions in Singapore, this is clearly not a legitimate reason. It's just because resort just wants its customers to spend more money (min 4/bottle) on buying water. Even the restaurants are not allowed to provide tap water, which clearly has nothing to do with covid. Having already spent 70 - 80 per person on tickets. It is not fair to expect a family of 4 to spend 20 - 40 extra on water during the day.The extra waste generated is also terrible for the environment. 2. The 'farewell' show at the end of the day was cancelled due to 'heavy rain' (it was barely drizzling), yet the resort failed to even remove the sign advertising the event, meaning we stayed around an extra hour just to be disappointed.

2.review_text: Understaffed. Sometimes only one unmotivated staff holding the fort to check/clear park goers, check safety and operate the rides. So many youngsters queuing in the express lanes without tickets and were let through, while honest people queue for an hour or more in long snaking queues. The eateries, with reduced capacity, also had long queues just to get in. Even the slushee cart had an hour long queue. Only to be told the machine couldnt cope and only 2 unpopular flavour, and even then it had to be made with ice from one machine, and syrup from another. Overall, was there at 11:30 till closing time. Total ride time was no more than 30mins. The rest was spent queuing and walking from point to point. The attraction did not put in any effort to handle capacity crowd while letting in as many people as they possibly could. Waterworld was closed but not boarded up. Looks desolated. Madagascar will also be closed for refresh. Best to avoid until management does a better job at planning.

The problem is at the souvenir (USS main merch store). Poor planning and improper crowd management. There were 3/4 lines of queues just for one cashier booth. Spent around 45 minutes queuing at one of those lines just to be informed that it was the wrong queue. The staffs at the counter are patient despite being understaffed. The main problem is with the management. Some queues are also in a loop.

First time back after many years. The capacity is limited but queues were still super long on a weekday. We went in at opening and came out at closing and still we couldn't take a third of the rides! Some were closed for no stated reason (then maybe refund a part of my ticket?), some couldn't operate due to the rain and some simply had super long queues. And this was my experience even though we followed the staggered timing and planned our route accordingly. The safe distancing measures also don't make any sense at all. Eg. We had to queue for 80mins INDOORS for the 5mins Mummy Returns ride, no social distancing was observed at all in the tunnel. And phones were supposedly not allowed so for that 80mins we just had to entertain ourselves by staring at the wall! Some experienced folks did bring their phones into the queue despite the constant reminders. And then at the end of the queue we saw that the rides could only take 4 passengers each time. That's why we had to breathe down each other's necks for 80mins??? Maybe it's better to just wait till everything goes back to normal...

Rides were good, but we went during a hot day. Nearly all the concession stands/water fountains are closed with only one store open that had a huge line in the sun. Not appropriate for elder people/children. They need some vending machines dotted around. Also, way too expensive when youre only able to get on 2-4 rides in a day.
Should open 7 days a week on school holiday not 4 days! I missed most of the rides due to long queue! Sorry to say Legoland Malaysia much better!

3.review_text: 1, ride open hours are not same as USS website (some like Treasure Hunt closed, some opened earlier), and some rides suspended intraday with unknown reason (weather was good) 2, super long queues in F&B and gift shops 3, reduced opening hour closed rides vs same ticket price seems strange

Not a very nice experience as compared to the last time we visited in 2015. The rides were the only good thing. All food courts closed.. How can you spend a whole day's outing with little to no food options? Also the park is not being maintained well. Overall experience was just about ok

Too crowded due to the school holidays... better to get express pass if possible because minimum wait time is 60 min for all rides. Pack your own food as I stood for 1 hr in the queue to buy food and another 30 min to be seated. All shows like, Shrek, Waterworld, Steven Spielberg, etc. are suspended. 60% very tiring, 40% fun.

Please consider before buying USS tickets it is reduced operating(12-7) time and many shows/attractions are closed. The cost of a ticket is same as before not in discounted rate. In case no other alternative option please consider USS.
Alot of rides are closed due to the pandemic, which is unfortunate.

4.review_text: The pandemic has really taken a bit of the fun out of USS. Different opening timings for the rides was a bit frustrating. One of the coolest part of the Battlestar Rides was being able to have both rides running at the same time as they're meant to duel each other, so really was unfortunate that isn't happening now. But hey, the pandemic has taken the fun out of a lot of things so to be able to still have rides going amidst these times was still fun. Kudos to the staff that work long hours to manage the long queues and sometimes impatient crowd. :))

No shelter so it's a huge bummer if it rains. Otherwise fantastic place that gives the feel of being outside of Singapore. Try not to go on weekend and holidays unless you want to queue over an hour for rides

The crowd is crazy. The rides required mostly 60min waited. The treasure hunter not open for no reason and my son is sad about it, it was his first choice to go. I wish all stores for food and drink are open so the crowds will not jam on a single store. The staff are extremely helpful on phototaking. Overall, I wish I had purchased express pass unlimited to maximise my visit. Still I have a great day with my family

It took quite a while to get in (maybe it depends on the time) There are attractions and rides that are different from Japan, and the buildings are quite elaborate. It's a highly recommended place to see, experience, and play! You cannot ride some rides unless you put all your belongings in a locker. Sunglasses, cell phones, and even wallets are out and will be checked by a detector at the entrance. If you get caught, you will have to go back and forth between the locker and the entrance many times. By the way, there is a fee for the lockers, and you will be told not to bring coins when checking in. Please be careful as you will be in trouble if you do not make sure to have several bills with you. It's a minus 1 star because of how troublesome it is.
Loved it! Except for the long queue. Each ride was 1h waiting time. Even for the drinks, have to queue for more than an hr.

5.review_text: I've been here once before, pre-COVID. Was great both times. I originally wasn't going to go again because due to COVID, not all rides are open, most of the restaurants are closed, no shows and yet the prices are still full price(rude!). But we decided last minute, because 'when in Singapore'. Luckily all my favourite rides were still open so it was worth it for me. I would only recommend going if you have Express tickets though, because it sucks to wait in line in the heat and you lose out on so much fun ride time. If you're weighing up whether to go, I'd recommend installing their app and checking which rides are open and the wait times (if you're not getting Express tickets) a couple days before. This might help you make your decision.

It's a small theme park where if you walk fast throughout the park, it would take you only 10 mins. If you have to queue up for your rides and shop around, it would take you the whole day. They don't light up fireworks everyday so it's better for you to call them or look at their calendar to see if they may have fireworks. Since it's the only happening theme park in Singapore, it wins hands down. Food is pretty expensive but delicious. It would be great if you have an annual pass so that you could save lots of money and skip the ticket queue.

-As others say it's one of the best places in Singapore that you don't want to miss. -Not all activities are always open. but don't worry you get repeat access on what's open to compensate on what's closed. - Don't forget to get the physical ticket from the counter by showing the e-ticket. e-tickets are not accepted in most of the roller coaster rides. - Go early as possible ,they have unannounced closing time for few rides you would miss if you are late(example one of the roller coaster ride was closed at 3pm ) - Mummy ride,transformers ride, white roller coaster ride are the best. - Most of the rides have limitation based on height. so small kids may not be able to ride any of them. - Express tickets come in hand but with a cost of 40 or something. you get to go through the express queue with less waiting time. - Normal tickets: get ready to expect looong queue on famous rides. - You get free lockers for 45mins-60 mins (vary) keep most of your things as they are not allowed in roller coaster rides. - Finally,don't try to cover exploring Sentosa on the same day of visiting Universal Studios. Universal Studio is a whole day experience.

Always fun to go. Sad that Madagascar is being replaced :( Also, the park opens at 12noon and closes at 7pm during this period. It was very hot queueing under the hot sun, but grateful for the free ice cream!
It's a nice place to visit... But because now have the pandemic virus so nos of games are not functional.... Maybe have to wait till end of the year if the situation get better..

1.review_text: Im unhappy with the express tickets. I bought 3 express tickets on Good Friday.. At the end, i realised alot of ppl are getting express queue as well.. To my horror, there are many rides that even normal queue got lesser ppl than express queue.. Really waste money

Wrong waiting time estimation, it wrote 20mins but we stood in line for more than 90mins, super annoying. Also they gave too much privilege to Express guests, as if regular guests didnt pay their ticket and can be put in line forever.

Very over crowded . Very badly shortage of stuff . Open late Nd close early . The best u can get is 4 rides in a day including all the queueing . Even getting a drink need to queue for at least 30 mins .
Many things are closed, and the rides have time limits. Some rides close at 5pm. Paying extra to play is a double waste. So annoying.

Honestly super disappointed compared to last time. All the rides have timings like 12-3pm or 4-7pm and it makes people crowd to a ride more causing the queue to be longer. You also can't refill your bottles and are just forced to buy overpriced drinks there if you did not bring water or ran out of water.
