With all the timings it's just not fun I don't get to enjoy myself I have to take note of which ride opens first and what time do they operate it honestly feels like the timing's there just to annnoy and chase ppl out lol. Compared to when I went last year, the experience this time is a 2/10 it's just really not worth the money. The tickets were more expensive compared to last year but there were lesser things to enjoy. I recommend not going during this period.

2.review_text: Many attractions are closed, understaffed therefore long lines for everything, many food places closed and the very few opened have long long lines. Drinking water fountains ALL with a sign not in order so you HAVE to buy water and get in long lines... too expensive for half the park not in operation

Charged at full price, the park not even completely open. Many stores are closed, me, my wife and kids, and my parents had difficulties finding restaurant. Discovery food court is closed, many restaurant were closed. Madagascar area are upgrading so that section are completely closed. So out of 100%, rides are only 65% open, restaurant 30% open, stores are 40% open. Wont going back again for full price. It shpuld be 50% price for the condition they have.

I use to love this place but it's not the same anymore. Iconic rides are closed. Others are now too old. The burger place is the worst to eat anywhere in Singapore. The saviour of this place is the rollercoasters.

High entrance fee and not all attractions are open...also you actually have to buy the additional Express ticket for almost the same amount as the normal ticket, otherwise you won't be able to ride the rides because of the waiting time.

If you parked here, I strongly encourage you to take a picture of your car and pillar. You will likely forget where your car is after a fun filled (or pocket bursting) day. Enjoy yourselves. USS however has changed a lot since I visited it when it first opened. The rides are all the same, except every other ride is closed for one or another reason. After queuing over an hour and half, for BSG Human ride, it closed for technical issue (BSG Cyclon ride stuck midway). The dragon ride was also closed for another technical issue. It was alas a disappointing experience overall.

3.review_text: Long queues on every attraction. At least one hour waiting time. If you want to avoid or plan to do an attraction twice you need the express pass. Roller coaster are average. Transformers 3D is really good. Worst food I ate in Singapore.

The rides were all good, but many rides are now closed along with many indoor shows. The hefty price tag of 130 SGD(including express pass) for these few attractions didn't feel worth it for me. The lines were super long on some rides, but as I took the express entry I got to save on a lot of time for just them. Overall I felt the express pass wasn't worth getting on the day I went. Rides were good, especially the roller coaster. All in all a good experience.

Impressive scenery and several thrilling roller coasters! The really good thing about visiting now is the lack of tourists due to the pandemic. Almost no queuing! Great souvenir shops! Fun seeing some characters from movies on the street! The constant music everywhere is annoying because it is difficult to have a conversation. The staff was not very welcoming. They did not seem to enjoy their jobs unfortunately.

Universal Studios tries very hard to provide an awesome experience for families. While it's a great place for family time, they fall short of making it 100% memorable. The queues for food, ice-cream and rides can be rather unbearable in the sweltering heat. Perhaps some kiosks and more personnel to cater with quickly selling food may help. Or having prepaid cards to quickly deduct money, while merely passing over food. For the ice-cream and waffles sales counter, perhaps separate them as waiting for waffles always takes longer, while selling ice-cream is faster. Street vendors or vending machines for selling cold drinks will definitely improve the experience too.

We had a very nice time at universal. Not so many long queues. However, a lot of stuff was close. For example the 4D cinema in Shreks world. The water world was closed completely and Madagaskar was only one kids ride open and you could not enter the area. Also almost all restaurants were closed. For keeping the same price as usually it is quite disappointing. However, it was still a lot of fun and I would recommend it.

4.review_text: Refreshing for me, since it has been quite a few years since I visited. For a weekday, the queue for the rides, like HUMAN and CYLON rides, were crazy. Didn't manage to get on the HUMAN ride since it closes at 2 pm (didn't expect the ride to close so early) while the CYLON ride was about an hour queue.

Express pass was still kinda slow especially for the Jurassic Park ride. Some restaurants were closed and the lockers are so expensive. The pizzeria's food was decent but pricey if there weren't vouchers included imo.

This is my first visit after the two years pandemic. All the rides are exciting and thrilling, various rides catered for the age groups. All the staffs very nice and friendly to help for any enquiries. However, food standard have dropped. Pizza not as big and as nice compared to my previous visits. Chicken drumlets were dry and hard. Maybe should try other restaurants in the next visit. Due to the pandemic, operating hours have shortened to 7pm. This was a slight waste as I could spend more time to play other rides again. Waiting time for rides still quite fast. Overall still a enjoyable and fun visit!

Clean and fun ! Will recommend for the thrill rides. F&B outlets could have open on the dot like 12pm since the crowd is quite a lot. Place is clean but queue is horrible. Will recommend express ticket!

A wonderful place, although visiting in April is a guaranteed sweltering experience lol, the sun was not kind that day. Rides were very fun; the Revenge of the Mummy ride was by far my favourite, and I had a blast. Just as a heads up, expect the usual long lines: I waited roughly 40 mins for Jurassic Park Rapids, and 20-30 minutes for the Canopy Flyer, both on a Fast Track Pass (or whatever its called I forgot). Please please have a bottle of water at the ready, because it is bloody hot waiting in line and you will get a headache if you dont stay hydrated. Still an immensely fun experience after having not been to a theme park since COVID.

5.review_text: Went on a Sunday and it was super duper crowded. Long queues to enter USS but it was fast. Waiting time was actually pretty short but for the rides, had to wait for more than 15mins.Wanted to eat at 1 of the restaurants there but we had to wait for very long which was abit annoying but neverthless we manage to grab some food from the booths.Even though it was a pretty hot day,I still enjoyed myself.

I went there on Sunday 3 April 2022 at 01.30pm. Very quiet at the entrance zone until mummy ride. Not very very crowded even though it is weekends. It might be because it was hard raining in the morning period. Some rides are closed temporarily (Shrek and Water World). Transformer is still be the best for me. Very fun and exciting. The ticket for adult is SGD 81. Accept card and scan payment only.

The first time I came, I was tricked into making a mummy minecart! I don't even dare to play a pirate ship... My mothers heart is about to burst out of my chest. I really need to buy a quick pass, otherwise Ill have to wait in line to death. Each item starts at an hour!
Had a great time, rides and shows were really nice. Some of the shows like Sherk 4D, Lights, camera Action, were closed due to covid restrictions but otherwise we enjoyed rest of the rides/shows.
Official timing is 12pm- 7pm. We were lucky they open the gates out of goodwill at 11.30pm. Love the rides.

1.review_text: This was a real crowd puller in the past when it opened. I remember the welcoming roses and all the bells and whistles. However when I revisited today I was sorely disappointed. I understand that we are still transiting out of recent Covid restrictions however I could see that rides were understaffed, and queues were ridiculously long despite having express passes. A few rides and shows were still closed, but the number of visitors didnt limited. There were also corporate customers/ groups who were stopping by at certain rides to take photos to fulfil some game requirements. The general decor and rides were also looking tired and old, and things like King Juliens carousel was old and jerky. A pretty disappointing visit, and while Im still proud of Singapore having a Universal Studios, I wouldnt advise my visiting friends from visiting this place especially if they have been to other Universal Studios overseas.

I went this place 25th of May, 2022. First of all, more than half of things are under maintance and the rest of things are suspended due to rain. Food is terrible and yacky and expensive. like really horrible taste redang burger cost you 16 dollars and 3.50 for drink so almost 20 dollars. secondly, they made an express line which you have to pay 80 dollars on top of basic admin so the basic ticket holder got to wait rediculously long so ended up you are wasting your time on queuing and QQQQQQQQQQ. it oepns 12 to 7pm. each ride and movies will be like 5 to 10 mins but you will be Queuing for each of them an hour. I really don't thing it is worth

Singapore already open up. Sadly the ride not fully open. Paid for express yet I waiting 25mins to ride my roller Coaster. You pay for the full price but you only get to access 60-70% of Universal Studio Singapore. Toilet is horrible, no toilet paper. Even Bangkok Chatuchak toilet is cleaner than USS. Very disappointed.

Never ending queues for food. It's vacation time and huge rush in universal studios. 2 hours to pass through food lines here. This has become an absolute scam. Lots of restaurants are closed. And rides to. So the ride opened are too crowded.
Long lines, very disorganized and understaffed. Bad food, bad experience, dont recommend.

2.review_text: Compared to the US Universal studios, Singapore was quite boring. The rides had the longest waiting time and we're not worth it at all.

Park took full price admission, even though half of the park's rides, shows and stores were closed. Quite disappointing.. should have been mentioned somewhere so we wouldn't find out only after we got in.

Save yourself some money and don't visit until it opens up fully. Hardly 30% rides are working. All other shows and rides are shut. They are saying its due to covid but doesnt seem so. Tried all the rides almost twice, had food and still got done in 3 hours lol. No cleanliness and housekeeping and there is litter everywhere. What a waste of time and money. Had flown from India for this and very disappointed. They are charging full ticket for hardly anything.

I was expecting the same quality as Universal Florida and Japan. Turns out this park is much smaller, has two areas that were shut down, lots of rides/ shows and shops are closed and its severely understaffed. Not to mention it opens at 12!!! Seems like covid is now an excuse for mediocrity. Save your money and go to Universal Studios Japan; this park is not good enough.

i went there on 3/03/22 and most of rider was unavailable and closed before usual time. plan carefully if really want to go there at this moment bc i couldnt play all riders (no express) but i could in CA. i waited for an hour to play the Transformer and turned out was broke down (so wasted my time)

3.review_text: It's okay not so great. Maybe because I have been to Ocean Park HK and Imagica India. Cleanliness 5/5 Queue management 5/5 Price 3/5

It's ok for a one time experience only. This place is actually pretty small without that many rides, and a lot of shows are closed properly due to Covid. Also the opening time is adjusted to 12pm (only Sunday is 10AM) so it doesn't feel very value for money The queues are crazy, popular rides can goes upto 1hr, so you should try to go early and later around 4pm in the day We're a young couple so the best rides for me: 1. Transformers: The Ride 3D (a lot of flashing lights beware) 2. Revenge of the Mummy (the drop is crazy so probably not suitable for small childrens)

Just for three or four rides , its just ok can't compare it to the WARNER BROTHERS Studios in ABU DHABI. Vegetarians beware pack your own meal before you venture out here. Strictly no Veg food stalls here or none of them selling pure veg food. I had a terrible time trying to find something to eat since even the fries are fried in the same oil as chicken or non ceg dishes. I had to register a complaint with the Studios for overlooking Vegetarian food. Most of the rides were closed. So not worth spending for only half the rides.

Nice theme park with some good rides and nicely decorated, but compared to other universal studios around the world this one is disappointing. I expected it to be smaller than the others just not with fewer thrilling rides. The mummy and Jurassic park rides are good along with some other rides but none are amazing. There's only 2 big roller coasters, of which when I was one closed so I didn't get to ride them. The human rollercoaster closed 3pm which, when the park was only open 12pm - 7pm was very disappointing and the other one battlestar Galactica had a technical problem which meant it was shut.
Just the amazing place to be but sad some of the rides were not operating that day.

4.review_text: Good rides. Everyone took express pass and that lane also had queues. Lack of staff. Restaurants had a long queue. Lack of sitting benches on both sides on the park. I was outside the Egyptian rides and sun was blazing where the benches were installed but no benches on the shadow areas. Park management need to have a look

Considering other Universal studios, the one in Singapore is pretty small. On the day that we went there, the weather was bad and hence, a lot of the outdoor rides were closed. There were a lot of people despite it being a weekday. The lines for some of the rides were long and in the end, over the course of 5 hours we got on only 4 (though to be fair we did have dinner and walked pretty slow in addition to the on and off rain) The souvenir shops were kinda overpriced with 19 for a headband but this is the usual with theme parks. However, the place is beautifully decorated and every location is insta worthy and we took a looooot of pictures. The snacks were also pretty good. The corn dogs and fried chicken were some of my favourites. For a good visit, plan ahead for the weather and the order to visit things. Research on the rides and see which ones you definitely want to do and what you could dk with . You could rush at 6:59 to the more popular rides to skip the queue but the moment the clock turns 7:01 they no longer allow more people. Furthermore, by booking with Kkday (which I did) you get a 10% retail discount voucher, a free ice cream with set meals voucher and a 5 off any individual meal voucher (min 10) . Note: shreks swamp was also removed, which is sad

Tickets are too expensive for the size of amusement parks and the number of rides! In addition, if there are many people, the waiting time for Express tickets takes about 40 minutes. The internal restaurant is very expensive, so it is recommended to buy water or drinks from outside.

It was fun but wasn't very pleasant too as not all rides were functioning at the same time. This is not the usual, probably due to Covid safety measures. Opening hour has been shifted to 12 pm and closing time has also been adjusted to 7pm instead of 9pm. This forced visitors to leave the park and miss the opportunity to take photos of the night scene and also to enjoy dinner at the park. Kind of disappointing actually.

It's a small universal. Entry Saturday, May 21st. There aren't many people and the maximum waiting time for the attraction is 1 hour, but most are between 10 and 30 minutes. Fs are not needed. The opening time was 12-19 o'clock, but it was so hot that everyone quickly turned around and left a little after 5 o'clock. I think there is no single rider other than Transformers. The two roller coasters in the center are short, but they are still worth riding. Most of the rest seem like rides for children. I purchased a package with a 5 free ice cream voucher, but I had to order ice cream with my meal, but there was no explanation, so I only used the meal voucher and couldn't eat the ice cream. The items in the gift shop are of good quality.

5.review_text: It's super fun place , lot of rides there and few rides has long queues. Express pass is must specially on weekends Food is an issue for Indian veg eaters, they can carry their own food if they wish.
Amazing experience. Waiting in long 80 min / 40 min / 45 min. So must go for Human vs Cylone first and thn Shrek 4 D show. And Avengers ride is must visit too
Came here at the start of the pandemic... on May 27... Unfortunately, there are several attractions that are not operating, such as: Waterworld Even though I came here to watch Waterworld
We enjoyed the visit but many zones and rides ate closed. Bad timing during post-covid.

Loved the rollercoasters (if you enjoy rollercoasters, the Revenge of the Mummy and Battlestar Galactica are not to be missed), loved the food(although it's pricier but c'mon what else would you expect here), loved the rides at Jurassic Park (although the Canopy Flyer was closed at the time of my visit) all in all, it's guaranteed you'll have a good time (whether you come here alone or in a group doesn't matter). The only downside? The waiting time and the queue for the rides (of which, there aren't that many to begin with, so if you come here expecting to ride 10 rollercoasters, nuh uh, not happening). If you arrive early and choose the sequence of your rides carefully, you can avoid long waits and complete your tour around the place within 3-4 hours (cue a cumulative sigh of relief, we all dread the Singapore heat).

1.review_text: Extremely poor customer experience. One the park is closed on Monday and Tuesday and the hours of operation are limited from 1200 to 1900 on the working days with limited staff. Eg One staff does all the work - checking for tickets, operating, cleaning for a ride and that leads to long queues. If one is keen on covering all the rides please go for an express pass. Also long queues at all F&B counters.This is one of the worst experiences for any attraction in Singapore currently. Please think twice before going till the situation improves

Ther queues at the only few eateries were extremely long. Many of those off-street drink stalls or food courts werent open. This is the worst experience I have had in amusement park. USS seriously need to work on your issue. Short opening hours is already a minus point and this F&B only make it worse!

The last time I visited this place was 2 yrs ago, before covid. Things have changed a lot at this place. Staff are friendly. This did not change though. 1. Cleanliness: leaves at many places/corners. It really look like theres no cleaning regime or the frequency has been reduced. Dirty. an ugly sight. Really. 2. Show, places for visit, attractions: many are closed. U can see from the photo, the food court is closed, the carts are closed mostly, the attractions are closed, some show are cancelled. Really, wonder why they still charged 98 sgd for an adult for this. Things that can be done in uss, reduced tremendously. Not worth the price. 3. Renovation: part of the theme park is closed. As such, the route is a mess. Sign put up for guiding visitors are..... not sure is for confusing the visitors or to help.... They are pointing to... dont know where. Really. I spent a lot of time walking here and there just to go to one place to another. Bad planning. Really. Again, why uss still charge so high if part of the park is renovating...? Puzzled... 4. Generally condition: the place is run down. Attractions, sign, boards.... Many of the Color faded. Need a revamp. 5. Ride experience: feels like the park is design to let visitors wait. For example, the dino flying ride. The poor lady 1 pax need to: (1) start stop the ride, (2) check and scan the express pass (which actually should be checked at the entrance to the queue, but it was done at the entrance to the ride. Waste time), (3) check the visitors exit correctly (waste time), (4) remind visitors to wear mask, cannot split ride... many of these steps can be done parallel, but not possible if it is just 1 staff. Management really need to think what they want the visitors to experience. If the objection is to stall the visitor by letting them queue more, they had succeeded. 6. On covid effort: signs are put up by uss to remind visitors to wear mask when in ride areas. But many visitors did not wear, no staff enforcing this. I guess the sign is for show. The site stated that uss put in enhanced smm, but.... Never implement. The whole afternoon while I was there, I did not see any disinfection done (against what was claimed on the website stating increased cleaning and disinfection. Not sure where did they disinfect. Side track, my recent visit to river safari, the staff disinfect the ride every round. Difficult, but they do what they said. Seriously, after my visit to uss, instead of full peace of mind.. I have full worry of mind. We are living with covid. But it doesnt mean the park can relax to a point that say one thing (Sg clean?), but do another ... Generally, instead of a park that is worth 98sgd per visit, feels more like 18sgd... Can see the staff are friendly. Trying their best. But... gosh, the management need to support the park man..... Sad. Disappointed.

Lots of rides closed....Madagascar, Treasure Hunt, Waterworld, Humans Rollercoaster opens only after 2.30pm and Cylon closes at 2pm... Lot of food stalls are closed Staff also getting impatient All this at same ticket price..... Very poor experience

The idea of opening half of the food venues with half the staff was a great idea, which required nearly an hour to order food and then another 45 mins for food to come out. The food quality was average at best. Not running both roller-coaster at the same time was annoying as caused well over a hour delay for the 1 Min ride. There was an extreme lack of staff working whilst the park was completely full, management should have egg on their face for getting in this situation. I have been to the park many times but will not making another trip whilst under the current management.

2.review_text: Avoid it these days. They have closed not only a few rides but also the main food court and many places to eat so you have to make a looong queue not only for the rides but also to get some food at any time of the day, which btw ends super early

People who rate this park highly haven't been to another theme park. I get that space is limited in Singapore, but this park is microscopic & the service doesn't match the price tag. Aside from the lack of rides none of the restaurants were open and the few that were open were absolute bedlam, and this was a Saturday! If they had a few more places to eat open it would have surely alleviated the strain on the other venues. The ride time estimates were completely off, going from 5 minutes to 30 then 60 in a matter of three minutes! If you do decide to go, get the express pass or whatever they call it. While waiting for the Battlestar Galactica ride the wait was 75 minutes for normal park passes while express pass wait was 10 minutes (per the loud speaker time announcements). I've been to other Universal Studios properties and this was the worst experience. Follow Universal Studios Japan's lead, that's the park to emulate. 16 for a cold burger and fries at Mel's. The menu showed other food varieties but they were constantly out of stock. I'd go on but you get the point. If I had a chance to go back I'd pass.

Some lines are very long even when using the Express ticket. The food is very small, there are few restaurants and some restaurants are still closed. The lines for the restaurants were over 1 hour long. The attractions are very good and fun. Transformers is amazing!

Going on a Sunday is a bad idea. We spent most of the time queuing. Queuing for just 3 rides in a span of 6 hours. Queuing for drinks. Didn't even manage to queue for a proper lunch. Not to mention having to tolerate the bad queuing behaviours of uncouth tourists...

Many indoor dining venues are closed. There are only a few places selling food and drinks and this causes long queues. Surprisingly, universally selling tickets with a 10 dollar meal package, but many restaurants are closed. Finally the voucher was not used

3.review_text: Rides are fun but service is not. I brought 2 kids for this day of fun. The merry go around has no queue, yet it took 15mins to get ready. The merry go around itself is just one minute. It makes no sense. This franchisee does little to make improvements. 80% of the food kiosks are closed, but it was a pretty crowded day. Where they are opened, there is always just one queue with one staff and of course a long queue just to get a drink. Throughout the park, you dont see any management people around. Only service staff, which are quite friendly. And 1/3 of the park is closed. Those opened has their own opening hours. I guess theyre cutting cost.

rides and mascot were fun. however, there is not enough staff to handle the crowd at the F&B and retail outlets we patronized. Every shop we go is a minimum 30 minutes wait /queue. Then the shops become more n more crowded since the queue is very slow moving. USS should improve on this. It becomes increasingly frustrating when the queue is barely moving and more people enter the shops. We went to Goldilocks, Mel's Drive, Minion shop, Pops popcorn stall, Universal Studio Shop. Even the queue at the counter ( near the entrance) just to change to a valid entrance ticket is unbelievable.

Many rides/restaurants were non functional/closed but the ticket price remains the same. Please follow some ethical practices. You should have reduced the ticket price or close it until everything is ready for operation. Transformers ride was very good, we went twice just for the sheer pleasure of experiencing it.

This is the second time I've been here but I'm really disappointed that the price has gone up because of the special school holiday so the price has gone up and a lot of the rides are closed so it feels small and some of the extreme rides only operate until 15.00 so it's a bit disappointing and a lot of food and drink outlets are closed so it's a bit difficult to find food and drink.

Other than the fact that there was no wait for the Mummy, it's a hot, lightly maintained and overpriced theme park. Half the rides are closed, the opening hours baffles but the children live for minions and sesame Street. So you will end up at USS if you have young children. I mean. I guess if you buy the promo tickets you also get vouchers? Nice that I could get a minions outfit for my son for "free"

4.review_text: Universal Singapore is a decent theme park. Much smaller than most other theme parks in the world, but they still manage to pack a decent amount into such a tiny place. We purchased the express pass unlimited - Id say its definitely worth it with such limited opening hours at this park. The longest time we waited was 15 minutes, as opposed to the regular queues which went up to as much as 115 minutes. If you can afford it then it will definitely enhance your experience. There was only half of the food and beverage outlets open - which resulted in probably the longest wait Id experienced all day. Took me about 15 minutes to place my order and another 20 to receive it. There are other food/drink carts around the park but these only sell snacks or drinks. Pretty much all shows are still cancelled, including Waterworld. Its obvious the park is not fully operational (pre-covid) yet, but hopefully it gets back to this soon. Looking forward to my next visit at Universal Studios Singapore.

I think a bit overhyped..as everytime there are at least 5 experiences which are shut. If they have such situations they should modify ticket pricing. Also the express pass is just too heavy on the wallet...

A good place for an entertainment day. They have a few thrilling rides (not for the faint hearted) The place is expensive which is understandable since it caters to tourists. Few of the rides summarised below are a must-do Human Cyclone Transformers Mummy Others cater to the kids. Better to have an express pass if one wants to quit the long queues. Average adult ticket costs around 80 and an express pass costs 20 . We did get a few redeemable vouchers for food , popcorn and souvenirs. Opens at 12 and closes at 7pm. If one doesnt want to do each and every zone( since some are solely for kids) one can easily cover it in one day.

Most of the restaurants are closed but one causing huge lines for food (had to wait longer for food than rides), and whats worse universal doesnt tell you which are open and there are no signs so you spend half the time searching for food. The rides are nice, but they enforce stupid mask rules for outdoor rides and queues in Singapore weather which was not fun. There are no signs at the door if a place is closed, and I spent a long time walking all the way to a door to try it open when they could have just put a sign on the door to save everyone the steps. Madagascar section is all closed as well and so is waterworld, so limited attraction at the moment. At the end of the day the rides were worth it and thats why I give it a 4/5 star, though things definitely could be better.
Hopefully universal studio can open full time hours. Madagascar was not open which is one of my favourite ride. Minion event could be better. But overall fun for kids

5.review_text: This is my 5th time for Universal Studios Singapore. I enjoyed spending time with my family in USS. Btw, there are too many people on the day I went and I had to waited for playing everything about 30-70 minutes. Even the lunch, the queue was really long and I had to wait for ordering my food about 30 minutes.
Popular Attraction, Long queues. Do Buy the express tickets. FUN!
Very busy must get an express pass for 60 dollars or you need to line up for 1-2 hours for some rides Must try transformers, mummy and human v cyclops rides

I was happy... .! I thought I was going to die from the heat, but I was happy... !!!Its really cool inside, but the waiting time is hell. I visited on a Sunday and thought about buying an early entry pass, but it seems like I made a good decision not to buy it. I was able to get in right away without waiting due to COVID-19. I rode almost all the rides. There aren't many places to eat, so eating takes the most time.

The water area we went to this time was not open, so I bought a fast pass, but there were actually not many people there. The water facilities in Jurassic were more fun than the ride at Universal, but the whole body was very wet. It was a sunny day when I went there, and I was dry in no time! Overall it's pretty good

1.review_text: Third time to USS Singapore. My last visit was in 2019 (precovid), and I remember vividly how exciting the rides were. This time around waiting time was awfully long, rides were cut short prolly due to the crowd, no proper ventilation to meet the demand of the crowd in the waiting area. Certain rides require you to wait in the scorching heat. Some of the staffs were also rude. Please improve your service as per your price.

Bought 2 express passes and the waiting times where still anywhere between 30-45 minutes. Many of the food vendors are closed and so we waited over 70 minutes to order food. Spent more time queuing in lines than actually seeing attractions & rides. Would need to re-login into WiFi every 10 minutes which is quite frustrating typing your details every time. I wouldnt come again if charging an extra 100 for express pass and Universal management know that they are understaffed (I really feel for the staff dealing with so many frustrated people). I have been to theme parks all over the world and would have to be the worst customer experience.

Went in June 2022. Some rides are closed even though they charge the same ticket. But more importantly , most food joints are closed. There are small carts with snack ( with no vegetarian options) Drinks and junk. Only one restaurant was opened and had a 1 hour line for food. Rides I can understand waiting for ..but food?? and no outside food allowed..huh... Also no proper information on closed rides or restaurants. All in all ..very bad experience. Think twice before going..especially if you are vegetarian. Waiting time was also not accurate in the universal studio app.

Went on a Friday. The waiting times were terrible. They treat people without express tickets as peasants by letting them wait longer than the expected ride times on the board stated outside each rides. Stay away from USS.

Brought the kids there on a weekday after the school holidays so as to avoid the crowds. But the wait times for the rides are unbelievable. A number of rides are not available. Or they rotate the rides, as in some available earlier half and others in the later half. Each rides a min. of 45min to 1hr 15min. Trying to find a place to feed the kids were also a nightmare cause only limited outlets are open. The que is super long. I enter when the place opened. And left around 6.30pm.. only managed to do about 5 different rides. The last time I went was before covid19 and was a weekend. The experience was definitely better. I won't advice visiting anytime soon.

2.review_text: Some of the rides are closed as well as people are rude

Rides and shows are definitely fantastic in University Studio Singapore but here comes the management. USS is closed on Monday and Tuesday and the operating hours on rest of days are just from 12pm-7pm. We went on weekdays with no any public or school holidays both in Singapore and Malaysia. We were expecting 15min waiting time for each ride but guess what. 130 minutes is the waiting time for both Human and cyclone and 90 minutes for Transformers and minimum 50 minutes for other rides. Imagine going in school holidays..!!! Why the management need to close the park two days in a week and the operating hour also delayed to 12pm when the amount of visitors to the park is still huge???? Is that a strategy to push visitors to buy express pass and multi days pass?? Please do also note that those who purchased the express pass also ended up waiting in queue as hell lot of visitors purchased express pass. Besides, too many eatery outlets are remained closed and visitors needed to wait another long queue to buy foods tooo. All these above said are during extremely non peak and in weekday visit. I can't imagine what it would look like during peak time. Management should look into this matter immediately otherwise they are gonna loose frequent/regular visitors and the good impression towards the park. Wish they would resume operation hours like pre covid where everything went smooth as the number of visitors are high during even non peak weekdays.

First thing, Univeral Studios! What is up with your opening hours? Closed on Monday and Tuesday. Open 10, closing at 6 pm. 70 minutes of waiting in line for Human and another 70 minutes in line for Jurassic Park, we had barely enough time for a third ride. The two main attractions, Human and Cylone, are not really worth it either. Cylone closes at 1 pm, by the way. We went there on a Sunday. Half of everything was closed. Couldn't get a drink within reach. Had to leave family and friends for 15 minutes to get some water. Most rides require that you leave all your belongings in a locker. All. Standing outside for 80 minutes without sunglasses is brutal. You can't even buy a drink because your wallet is locked away. The lockers are free for about 60 minutes. If your line is longer than that, you will have to pay. Some lockers cost about 4 dollars from the start. Why? The ticket money wasn't enough? Not a lot of rides for adults. I would recommend the transformers ride and the one at Jurassic Park. Other than that, there's just a lot of restaurants. It's two stars from me. If you're in Singapore, there are plenty of other great places to go!
This place is overrated, I have been to better theme parks. Approx 1 to 1.5 hour queue per ride for most rides. We would not come back here considering the amount of money we spent here as a family.

Visited on July 28, 2022. There are so many people, but because of the coronavirus, it opens at 12 o'clock. The scorching sun is very hot. I didn't buy the express ticket in Korea because I wanted to check the situation later, but if I hesitate, it's too late. It's so hot that you can't see it unless you buy an express ticket. It takes about 40 minutes for one machine. Sometimes luggage storage is free for an hour, but sometimes it costs 4.00. I thought I would leave it there for an hour and then went on one of the rides, but they told me I had to pay again because the time had expired... Is there a card in the machine? It's full of really embarrassing memories. During peak season, you have to shell out a lot of money. Still, Jurassic Park was fun It was fun, but annoying...

3.review_text: The crowd can be well managed. Food is very expensive. The express entry at 81 70 is crony as hell. Some rides like Mummy Returns took 1 hour to reach. Must do Rides 1. Mummy Returns ***** 2. Transformers **** 3. Battlestar Galactica **** 4. Jurassic Park (Water) *** Rest all is worthless especially Treasure Hunt, Enchanted Airways and Canopy Flyer. Don't waste time in waiting line. I found that by end of day.. Like 5-6 every ride has very less crowd. Ok experience. Could be well managed.

Some of the rides are closed now so the queues for open rides were much longer than usual. The locker system also seems like a scam, you will be charged more money for having to queue longer. Double loss.

Went this time for the 2nd time. feel very disappointed Had to queue for a very long time to get tickets that were purchased in advance. Conditions inside the amusement park look old. It's like it hasn't been updated at all. There are so few restaurants open that there aren't enough people to enter the theme park.
Some of rides were closed suddenly for maintenance due to technical issues when we were standing in the queue. Compared to USS Tokyo, the express pass were quite expensive.

Lots of people in this amusement park even though it is the middle of the week (a Wednesday). Many attractions, shops and restaurants closed. However, the price has not changed... Apart from these inconveniences, the park is nice to visit once with the children but a second time would certainly be too much. The attractions are rather successful (big plus for the Transformers attraction) even if the waiting times are worthy of Disneyland. You have to buy the fastpass for the day to be profitable but this makes for a very expensive entry for rather limited content. I only tried one fast restaurant there. I was extremely disappointed. The nuggets were of low quality, and the "hotdog" that was served to me did not deserve to end its life in my stomach but rather in a trash can. When you visit a culinary city like Singapore, it must be said that you fall from a very high place. It's best to bring your own food or eat at one of the restaurants outside the park. I was entitled to a voucher for popcorns but I was never able to use it... People are so hungry that there are always a lot of people in front of the only popcorn truck in the park. In short, do it once and then move on. Life is too short :)

4.review_text: Would be better if they increase the capacity of attractions as there are many tourists already and the queue is very long (approx 2 hrs) for some attractions.
Already go to USS 4 times. Alot of good attraction close now. Not alot of food, even food court close

Great fun day enjoyed the rides that we managed to get to. So many people arrived so really unfortunate to spend so much time just to stand in queues. My advice will just purchase the higher price tickets in advance to avoid the queues and use the fast lanes. Also the studio does not open until 12:00 which is ashame as 6 hours was not enough considering most of that time was spent waiting.
Everything was fine but problem was need to wait 60to 80 minutes for every ride. And all of us know wating for something creat bore for people. But enjoied enough.

They changed the opening hours to 12pm-7pm on weekdays. Even on a weekday it was packeddddd. We didn't get the fast pass however managed to get on cyclone, transformers, mummy rides. The waiting was crazzyyyy. If you have money to spend then I suggest do get the fast pass. Even with that the waiting time for fast pass can go up to 1hr plus plus. I suggest pick the ride you wanna ride first (cyclone was insane , but waited 2hrs for 50s of the ride haha) so you'll have the shortest waiting time for it. Then continue on with the rest. 1. Cyclone/human (human opens only at 4pm onwards) 2. Mummy 3. Transformer Remaining time can go explore the park. Have fun !

5.review_text: Had a lot of fun during my visit to USS. All the rides were very enjoyable that caters to all ages from chill to thrill rides. Queued for up to 45minutes for one of the roller coaster and they announced that the ride is suspended due to a lighting warning. However the ride was reopened not long after and managed to try it with relatively shorter queue. I would suggest to go for express ticket for a better experience

Nice place to play with my family... unfortunately the queue is more than 30 minutes, even though I came on Monday. The opening hours at 12. my vacation should be longer so I can enjoy every places in singapore

If you come in a group, go to the fartest attraction first. That way you queue up faster. Or you could do single rider. The last option is you buy the premium (?) ticket (More expensive but you still have to queue with the premium ticket holders.) There is locker rental here and there so you shouldnt worry about your bellongings. There are also food tenants and food court.

Beautiful and huge place. It was very crowded when I visited yesterday during school holiday. Managed to go on 5 rides during the visit without express. If you plan to visit during peak season, buy express, it would safe a lot of time. 1 time express side is 70 and unlimited is 100. Each of the ride queue was 40-90 minutes and with express I think it would take 5 minutes queue time only. Ride only open from 2pm but park is opened from 12pm. Not all the facilities open during the time. Most of restaurants and shops are opened already. With safety measure in place, they would leave a gap in between every seat row. Even for carousel ride which I notice it was already at least 1m apart. This contributed to a longer queue time. The timing was not really accurate. One ride, I saw 35 minutes but took me 60 minutes to get on the ride. Also if the queue is longer than the line formed, they would have people there to advice to go back again to visit on another time. Do plan on the visit for the rides, the longest queue is Transformers, it was 90 minutes at all time. The queue started building up around 1pm for 2pm operation, however I think they opened earlier 20 minutes the time I visited. The rest of ride queue will start getting less in the evening time. Restaurants and small shops for redeeming freebies along with the tickets were a long queue. But redemption was quite ok but don't expect to get the same as in the ticket. For me, it was corn dog but I got 5 pcs of nuggets instead. None of the water drinking fountain was on the operation, make sure bring one or buy there. Photo taking with queue and safety distance as well but the queue was formed neatly. Overall, it was quite fun but expect longer queue on the rides due to safety distance measure.
Try going on a weekday or a non holiday. Lots of crowd for the rides. Waiting time is way too much.

1.review_text: Rude staff. That's my pet peeve. Poor poor service. When USS opened, I remember we used it as a shining example for wonderful user experience and customer service. Today? It would be a fine example of what not to do. Restaurant staff doesn't even say hello. Just immediately rattles on about what's not available. Staff in the queue at guests services was also rude. Even though I was interrupted by someone who was NOT in the queue, I was told to wait for my turn and that she was seeing to another customer. Hey if you guys can't handle the crowd, then close up. Staff in the guests service area INSIDE the park just after the gantries were really really polite though. Kudos to the 3 of them on duty at 1230hr on 17 aug 2022. 2 chinese guys and an indian lady. Well done.

DO NOT COME!!! Ive been to every universal studio except Beijing, and I can confidently say Singapore one so far is the worst. Not sure if its the product of COVID, but 1) all the restaurants and street setting shops are closed except one, as a result the line to order is long and there is no place to sit down at all; 2) there is no interactive characters in the park, all you get is a few rides, thats it. There is no Spider-Man or Harry Potter, Madagascar is being demolished and Minions is yet to be built 3) service people are horrible, we had the order person shout at us when we were deciding what to order and after the order, she waved her arm at us suggesting us to move out of the way from the counter, while she still held our credit card to process the payment.

Brand like USS needs more than just hype, its very unorganized, not kids friendly many attractions closed, and for the once thats open wait time is like 40 min, they need to better organize the attractions by age groups so visitors know what attractions they want to pay for, I feel I wasted lot of money just to wait in the queue

RIPPED OFF!!! Went there on Wednesday, it was so freaking crowded! Lots of rides are UNDER MAINTENANCE!! like WTH!!??? Madagascar area was fully closed except the mary go round ride. 2 of the Jurassic rides WERE CLOSED AS WELL!! For the sake of my daughter happiness, I decided to buy the "one time ride each ride - express ticket" that costs freaking 70/person. Moreover, NOT ALL RIDES HAVE EXPRESS ACCESS!!!! I suggest u guys, DO NOT COME TO UNIVERSAL STUDIOS SINGAPORE!!! I repeat, DO NOT COME TO UNIVERSAL STUDIOS SINGAPORE!!!

80% of your time will be on waiting, queuing, people with express tickets will spend 50% of their time waiting queuing. Pay and wait under hot weather. Food is extremely expensive. What a regret!!! I should have go somewhere else

2.review_text: Lack of management before opening There was a lot of lining up, passing each other, but again, the market doesn't belong to buyers. I have to accept it... / The bathrooms outside are dirty, smelly, and PTT's is a total waste... / Regarding waiting in line, there are few outside, hundreds inside... / Consumer rights What you need to know in essence is the waiting time, the number of people waiting for the rides. If you come to Thailand and remove them, you probably won't have to come... / Regarding the fire escape door, while waiting in line, I saw it, but there were a lot of railings. will be used in time or will be carried out Well, it depends on the theme of the ride...

Visiting again after 10 years and can see how bad it has turned now!! Many rides are closed and the overall park has become shabby, worn out and in a dire need of renovations! It might be an attraction for a first time visitor but for returnees it is an absolute disaster! Need better up-keep and new attractions ASAP! Staff are a gem however the overall emphasis simply is on racking more monies and not offering value against it now!

Unbearable queues. Ride queues were 60-80 minutes. Can you withstand that in the heat? What's worse is that the park profits from the queues by offering queue-jumping tickets, so they have no incentive to lessen the queues. But even those who paid for the 'express' lane were faced with long queues, just a bit less long. I won't go back to Universal Studios. It's not enjoyable to be waiting in line for so long.

Parts of the park were shut down including many of the dining shops and food stalls so getting lunch was impossible..... Super frustrating to be unable to get food to your starving family, we ended up leaving the park and eating outside. In addition obligating you to rent a locker for 4 an hour is outrageous. Quite disappointing overall experience of

Went on Wednesday and got stuck in the crowd since Monday and Tuesdays are closed. Scorching sun and serpentine queues made us cut short our visit.No volunteers for guidance. Well maintained but highly expensive. I got frustrated and so only 2 stars for poor guidance inside. Poor support staff strength will leave you wondering where you are and make you run from pillar to post. Horrible climate. Not at all happy

3.review_text: This is my 4th time going there. Frankly speaking, it is not as good as before. Some restaurants are a bit old and some entertainment facilities are under maintenance, which is a bit disappointing... When there are a lot of people, some facilities usually require more than an hour of waiting (tiring). If you dont want to wait, I suggest you buy a priority pass (money means willfulness). I want to emphasize that if it is your first time going there, it is still worth it! !

The place was clean as expected, but quite a few eating stalls with drinks were closed. The queues for rides were incorrect, as 1 ride we did said 40minutes, we didn't get on the ride for a further 100minutes.

We were a bit disappointed since the park only opened at 12:00 and already closed at 19:00. Unfortunately it rained for 2 hours and the attractions were mostly closed during that time. If you consider that for some rides you have to wait 90 minutes to get in, there is hardly enough time to see everything.

Don't get me wrong, I did enjoy the park in general but it's far from perfect. Few things here to note, 1. It's a relatively small park, but not like super super crowded on Sunday. 2. Most popular rides will take 30-60mins of queueing time on average. Sometimes you may have to wait longer than 1 hour. So it can be really frustrating to spend half the time in the park waiting. 3. We got the unlimited ride express pass, and it cut the queueing time down to 10-20mins on average. But yes, you still need to queue up despite spending 90 extra per pax. All rides are shared among regular and express lane ticket holders, it's just that the express lane usually has a shorter queue. 4. You may not actually play all the rides more than once or twice due to time constraints and exhaustion. So it's probably difficult to fully utilize the unlimited express pass. 5. Most of the rides are unexciting and catered for kids and family except Human and Cyclon, the Mummy indoor ride, Transformer... Most experiential attractions are not bad as well, but may not be worth the queue. Hence the 3 stars

- Maximum rides are roller coaster with theme story. - Bags are not allowed in few rides due to which we need to keep the bags inside the locker which you need to rent for 2 to 4 SGD per hour or you can use locker near the Mummy returns ride. It has 1 hour free and later it will be 2 SGD. - Jurasic Park boating has an upsell of raincoat of 5 SGD. If you are from India you get it alaong with you. It is for Rs. 10 in India - Free Wifi - The Application of Universal studios helped a lot to quickly complete rides which have less waiting. - Complete the main attraction like transformer and mummy returns as they have higher wait time. Better to do it either in the start of the day or end of the day. It will have lesser wait time. - No Veg food options except for Margarita pizza, coffee onion rings and pasta. Soft drinks are 4 times thn regular local Singapore prices.

4.review_text: Exceept the long queue and shutting down all the rides for some private event or so, is not acceptable.. Other than that, 5* for the place.

Giving 2 stars for the rides, 2 stars for the food. I feel the restaurants there(inside USS) are just a rip off. Eventhough the staffs in the Shrek restaurant is friendly and nice despite the very long queues, but the price of the food is not worth it.

Good without being outstanding. We visited on a relatively quiet day, outside of peak season making the express pass an unnecessary expense. The longest queue we waited in was 40 minutes, but we came back later for some rides - Transformers was 10 minutes at the same time Jurassic Park was 80. This is a key tip, the site isnt that big so carrying on to something else is easy (if the heat doesnt bother you). Many of the food halls were closed when we visited, and what was open was expensive however there were plenty of drinking water fountains. We managed everything in a day, youd be repeating rides if you went for two days.

The place was crowded during my visit.. maybe because of the weekend.. They do provide a SMALL locker at a few ride entrances that are free for 40 or 60 minutes (can't really remember).. I mistakenly brought my big bag pack as I was a backpacker that time.. A big locker is available at the main entrance ya.. The queue was too long and tiring.. doesn't really worth the ride duration .. btw, can bought a ticket online first for smooth entry.. btw, if want to use public transport, do ride MRT from vivo mall ya.. It's free..

This was my second visit to Universal Singapore after 9 years. It's still the same and hardly anything new has been added in almost a decade. As an adult, the rides which will offer thrill are very limited. I rode everything and I can say with surity that Battlestar Galactica, Transformers, and Revenge of the Mummy are the only rides which offers thrill. You can expect queue time of around 1 hr for each of these rides. The queue time will be lesser during evenings. Otherwise you can spend extra to get an express pass to skip the queue. These attractions are the first ones which come up as we walk through Universal Studios and so the queues are also long during the first half of the day. Apart from the above three, canopy flyer was also okay but the duration was too less I felt. The Shrek 4D show (15 mins duration) was some of the best effects I have seen in a 3d movie and worth watching. Food is pretty expensive here and I could find only one restaurant out of all the eateries here which was serving coffee.

5.review_text: Get tickets online from klook website/app. Try going on weekdays. I went at sharp 12 pm and straight away went to tiller coaster ride, gallentia battle humans, followed by mummy ride and transformers. Wait time for these was around 10 minutes. Then went on to jurasic world ride with super long wait time of 1.5 hours in queue.. Not worth.. Is good for kids though

this is one of the most dreamlands in singapore. located on sentosa island at the south of the mainland and connected with it with cable trams, sentosa express monorail and bus lanes. on most days this is very crowded, with average 30 to 60 minutes waiting time for individual sites in the theme parks, while some popular sites such as roller coaster may require more than 90 mins in busy days the theme park is not a large one, so i recommend you to go for those smaller sites in busy time such as morning and early afternoon, and come back to those big site after peak hours (i.e after about 4pm) and surely you will enjoy every site in a single day after sunset sometimes there are special activities such as theme dinner and parade, you can check out details on the seasonal map also, there are a lot of retail outlets selling themed souvenirs
We love amusement park. But we're quite disappointed with their opening hour (12to7pm). N they closed during monday n tuesday.

Went on a Friday. Crowded. My tips is to opt Express lane whenever you go there. The tickets are already pricey, just go all the way, dont let the queues ruin your fun. The park only opens 6-7 hours daily, if you're already wasting nearly an hour lining up, you wont be able to enjoy all the rides. Overall, still exciting

Closed at Monday and Tuesday, not worth it for visited, the queue too long with open hours too short..it opens at 12.00 pm and closed at 7pm..you have to pay more for express price if you want to skip the queue

1.review_text: Had a worst experience visiting . All you can experience 3-4 good rides that too 1.5-2 min each . No GoPro or any such devices allowed to film while in rides . Over expensive food inside . Racist staffs . You have some better places to visit in Singapore.

Really poor since Covid. We attended a halloween event, we did not see any halloween performers as promised. A large proportion of the rides were closed such as the Madagascar portion of the park, waterworld area and arguably one of the best rides in the park the Jurassic park rapids. The entry was still highly priced for such a lacklustre offering. Very poor show. For anyone visiting in 2022 or early 2023 I suggest you avoid as they are nowhere near ready to getting back to normal. Additionally many restaurants were closed, creating queues of 30 minutes even for drinks. One highlight however was the exceptional member of staff (Azhar) in the gift shop who gave a fantastic service!

Transformers ride took 90minutes.they dont show how much time is left.also they dont have any toilets in between.also they dont have any token system or any system to sit in queue.the ride is good but they need to upgrade on this points.so only 1star .

Visited on 16th Sept 2022. So not worth it. Open late and close early. Many attractions were closed. F&B options were also very limited. Long queue at one of the food courts because that was the only one operating. Staff were all wearing a long face. Some of them dont even check your express pass properly. Honestly don't waste time getting the unlimited express pass. Not only that many of them dont check, they also dont scan. You still get "unlimited" rides with normal express pass. If you plan to visit, i would strongly suggest that you don't waste your time and money here until they are operating like pre-covid. waste of time and money.

Don't waste your money or time. Half of the attractions are closed and huge ques for the rides and food . Very slow service and stone cold expensive food. We went to the diner at 3 thinking the rush is over. 1 hour wait for cold rubbish burger and chips.

2.review_text: Parc is great, but most interesting main attractions are closed for maintenance, like Jurrasic Park, Water world and Madagascar are simply closed and also technical difficulties with Transformers. So rest of attractions of course large queues. We understand the need from r maintenance and safety, but not fair that ticket price is the same all over (78 at counter) Btw dan d file a complaint only to receive more explanation and no compensation

Visited on a Friday super crowded , long queue, too much waiting time.food stalls were full and ran out of food. Rides were ok . Can skip this place if you have fewer days to move around in Singapore.
We spend 5 hrs here and was able to experience only 4 rides. The waiting time was ridiculously high. So rather than enjoying & relaxing, it felt tiring & frustrated.

Some attractions closed, definitely a park for children and families (for whom it's fine) and for teenagers or adults. Small, I expected it to be bigger, Gardaland is huge in comparison. It didn't excite me at all, in 2 hours and a little more I did everything (no Human and the other one, the 2 rollercoasters with over 1 hour of waiting, for the rest super slim and well organized lines). However clean and tidy and very kind staff.
Too long wait time for rides which are not that great (despite going in off season on a weekday). Food is too overpriced.

3.review_text: Very small amusement park and most of restaurants and snack places are closed. Therefore there a huge lines in front of the few open ones. We were in line for an hour for lunch. (On the other hand there was tons of restaurants and snacks on the outside of the park) Some of the rides really needs paint and some craftsmen attention- the look worn down. Very few rides for small children. Weird that there isnt some kind of shade over the walking paths. Singapore is hot! You can do the whole thing in 3-4 hours.
Long waiting times which ease towards the afternoon. A few rides were closed. Prices were ok, staff was friendly.

Some rides were closed when we visited (ie. the water rides) but most were open. Recommended to come late morning as queues get worse from afternoon onwards. Expect to queue up to 2 - 3h for a single ride but then get rejected due to technical difficulties. Not all rides have indoor queueing areas so do bring water and a portable fan if needed. Rides like "The Revenge of The Mummy" were quite good and worth the queueing time in our opinion. Food and drinks within USS are also quite expensive so do bring your own snacks and drinks if you wish. Most rides have free lockers at the side for you to put your bags. One thing is that some staff working within the rides are quite impatient. I understand some visitors may be quite unreasonable, but some level of professionalism is expected and the tone which a few used to shout at visitors were quite aggressive and could scare kids.
Park is getting down on experience. 50 % of park was closed. Tickets were full although Not done
Lots of maintenance and upgradation work ongoing. Se water-based rides are also closed since Covid. Overall, quite an average experience this time.

4.review_text: Lots of rides and places closed due to maintenance. I feel for the price charged, the experience was not up to the level Felt a bit disappointed

The rides are great! But a timing of 11am to 6pm ,with 30-90min wait time for a single ride, is not great!! When charging a fair amount for the ticket, they should seriously reconsider increasing the visiting hours!

Much lower than the Universal ones in the United States. Good things: - The park is relatively small and you won't die walking - Everything is well indicated - Setting Bad things: - Most shops and restaurants closed (I don't know if it is due to dates or renovations) - Upon arrival there may be attractions closed - In our case the entire area of Madagascar is under renovation and it does not say until when it will remain closed - It's full of Chinese people who don't speak English and don't know anything at all and don't respect anything.

Rides here are alright, but the park is a bit small. Went on a Saturday morning, and could have be done by about 8 hours or so including queueing and so forth. Most rides are for kids, with only few rides being exciting. However, Mel's burger is really good, though it may be more pricey due to it being in the park. Tip: bring in your food and drinks as no one seems to be checking for it. Can save you a whole lot of money as food isn't cheap. Note: if you have visited any other Universal Studios before, this place is probably worth only a 3 stars, and is definitely not worth your time going to in Singapore.
Ticket price is 81SD. There aren't many rides. Plus you have to wait in line for quite a long time. Compared to the amusement parks at Disneyland HK and Everland Korea, they are still very far apart.

5.review_text: Need longer hours! Only 7 hours in a theme park that has long lines, not enough time. Should open at 8am, close at 11pm. Early morning hours needed
Some of the attractions is closed due to maintenance. Need to come again.
Transformers, mummy rides are must go. Waiting time is almost an hour for these rides. Buy express entry pass if possible.
One of the must visit place in singapore, visited at a weekday to avoid long queue. Btw transformers still has a long queue since the last time i visit this place at 2012

We went on a Thursday and the average wait time for rides was 20-30 mins. We bought the Express pass in advance just in case so we basically didn't have to wait for any of the rides. We did some rides like the Mummy one for like 4 times, still the first one in the queue every time. So my recommendation is to go on a weekday and try to enter by the time they open! Was a fantastic experience overall.

1.review_text: My second time at USS, Singapore. The queue wait times are minimum of 1-2 hours. Make sure to get the skip the line if youre looking to take each ride. The disappointing thing was that most things were not open and the entire place has lost its sheen. The main roller coaster , Cylon stopped working just when we got to the front of the queue after waiting for 1hour. Pathetic experience, overall. Plan accordingly.

The rides are less than 3 mins, but the waiting times are horrendous. I waited 1.5 hours for a ride (3D Transformer) that lasted probably about 3-4 mins. Then while I was waiting for the Human Vs Cylone ride, it was announced the ride had closed. Also, I'm certain there was an "accident" on the line, and it had not been cleaned up properly. It smelled foul, and I even saw traces of it in the pathway. The waiting time is awful. Don't think about coming here without an express ticket. (However, even that is only limited to some of the rides.) Also, other rides and attraction sites have been closed. Universal Studios was one of biggest reason I came to the Singapore. It's been a total let down. I wouldn't recommend it. I won't be coming here again unless there's been major changes.

Went on a wed in Oct.. long waiting time for all the rides makes the experience less pleasant. It looks like USS wants to push the revenue by express pass. Wish they can increase the operating time ( 11 to 6) to easy the waiting time. Also.. many of the rides were closed which makes the less worth for money paid
Half of the park closed, nearly impossible to get drinks or food. Even when, food is horrible and overpriced. For the good rides you wait 45 min at least. No fun.

Long queue, long waiting time at Treasury Hunter, Dinosaur etc due to the guards were talking to each other, mood less, very slow in getting passengers in and out of the rides. Probably tired and bored doing the same routine every day.

2.review_text: A very large and entertaining attraction. Don't get me wrong, I am all for discipline and complying with guest instructions, but these people here are very much borderline Rude. Maybe it's a culture thing? You can ask my 7 year old to "Please stand behind the yellow line for your safety" in a kind tone, but you don't have to yell at them and me rudely to do the same. Enjoyable place but if this is the culture of how employees deal with guests, you have a big issue. Strongly suggest culture and comms sensitivity and training. It's a competitive post-covid world! G3t on the train or stay left behind! Learn from how the UAE does it!

Too crowded and with numerous rides not operating including the water world show, a nightmare with waiting time over 90 mins in most cases. Staffing appeared inadequate and many food and drink venues were not open . Perhaps universal studios SG should cap the numbers in the park and make it more worthwhile for the people paying 74 per person. Not recommended under these current conditions

Today we went ,great place but alot of rides closed or extremely long queue 2hrs for the transformer ride 4min ride, great ,then roller coaster, mummy ride faulty so queue had to exit. Horrible day at universal ,lots of rides closed and extremely long queues. Expensive food. Disappointed. COVID has certainly effected the place. Shame

Relatively disappointing. It's a relatively small park anyway. Several of these shows were closed. For what you get, it is far too expensive (80 Singapore dollars). At the few good attractions you have to wait in line for a long time.

Pros: a good place to go for family (especially with kid) or couple. Cons: super crowded on weekends, some ride might take 120 mins to wait, other ride take 30-60 minutes. What is it mean, you have to wait that time for a show 5-10 mins. Can not wait, buy express tickets (costly) but even with express ticket, you also need to wait 10-15 mins. I travelled many park like this in SEA but this time feel not much good experience about waiting line. Note: buy online in offical website for good deal. Bring empty bottles, it have water inside to fill. Portable fan would be good recommendation. Have lunch at Vivo city before trip.

3.review_text: A lot of attractions closed and limited opening hours. But still same cost. Long queues even with Express pass. Hopefully better next time.

8 Oct 22 , enteted 11:30 am, we left 2:30pm. We bought the Express rides , so base fee Express with 1 ride each. However, to avoid queue, some rides allows Single Person lane which means you won't be with your group so you just be allocated to any random seat in the ride, the queue is very fast. There are some room for improvements: 1. The ticket counter , last lady on the utmost left ( when facing the counters) super short hair, her attitude ?? she rolled her eyes when I asked abt mask wearing, if this is optional, USS should have put a poster to indicate , mask wearing is optional. I am sure there are many people would have asked. She should however be professional to says it's optional, rather than giving me a vague answer. Then when I probed further, she rolled her eyes. 2. The Korean Corn Dog is a cheat, no sight of any protein or meat or mentioned its vegeterian snack . it's crumbed thick Korean rice cake 6 . 3. Lockers , free for first 45mins, I left bag for more than 45mins ,total 10, but I left my bag inside and didn't took my credit card with me.

It's much smaller than I thought. There were attractions closed and others that suffered breakdowns. They should control the capacity, because the park is open very few hours and the lines are too long!

Had a slot for the 27th of May, which was the first Thursday after the reinstatement of phase 2. Universal had changed their opening hours to Fri to Sun only but neglected to inform ticket holders, so there was a crowd at the gate on Thursday, including a couple with a little boy whose birthday was on that day. It was heartbreaking to see him look so disappointed. The rest of us were angry but remained polite to staff who were explaining how we can change our reservation dates. We had taken days off from work and had come all the way to Sentosa just for the day, only to be let down. Anyway, we changed our date and arrived well and early on our new chosen date. The park opened at 12pm but basically no rides were open except the kiddy Sesame Street ride. They staggered the timings for the opening hours for rides "due to the pandemic" but I feel that this is completely stupid because if you only open 1 or 2 rides at 1pm, then everyone in the park will flock to those because there in nothing else to do in the insane heat. Then when the next one opens at 2pm, everyone will go to that one. So basically you're NOT encouraging the social distancing issue. We kept seeing the same people at rides until we decided to go for several rounds on one ride. There was also a family of white people who didn't have their masks on, and staff didn't try to enforce wearing masks until I had to say quite sternly that they should do so. Why are locals so afraid to confront ang mohs? Anyone who is in this country should abide by the rules of this country, regardless of your ethnicity. It's about basic courtesy. Anyway, I will not be visiting Universal again in the day time. This was my first and hopefully last day trip. The only time I will return will be for Halloween Horror Nights.

It's starting to look a little tired and could do with some TLC. When I went quite a few rides, shows and shops were closed, but of course the ticket price remains the same. Many of the rides are pretty average for today's standards, and EXTREMELY short, especially for how long you may have to wait. I still had fun but I think it needs some improvements to keep up with parks of a similar calibre.

4.review_text: Almost half of the attractions are closed and waiting time in all the good rides is more than an hour. Good place but perhaps better crowd management will make the experience better for everyone

There are quite a lot of tourists. Waiting in line for each ride is quite long. The place is not wide, can walk around. The restaurant is quite adequate but doesn't accept cash. Various shows There is a clearly visible sign showing the show times. But you can view it through the theme park's app.

Currently going through some renovations, so some sections were closed off. Waterworld is closed, Madagascar too. Crowd count is still going strong, queue was 120 mins for the transformers ride and 45 mins to buy food at Goldilocks, plus an additional 30 mins to find an empty table. I'd advise to bring own food instead. Happy that some shows/meet&greet are slowly coming back. Can't wait for it to get back to how it was pre-covid. A friendly advice: Buy tickets online, it's 13 more per ticket if you buy it on-site hope this helps!
Queues were too long Passes including express costed too much and most of the rides were closed Majority Food outlets also not operating

Good experience. Loved the rides. Transformers have been nice. I loved the sound studio demonstration. Never knew how it's done in the real world. It was cool should not miss it apart from the rides. Food outlets have been bit of a back step. They have offers which are way too complex and takes time to decide at the counter. Food is not very good either. The options I had I mean. They got some restaurant options that should be better. Pls be mindful of this. One development point for Universal to try and get it fixed. After all ppl need some reasonably good food as they enjoy the rides.

5.review_text: I booked the entrance ticket in advanced (but you also can buy the ticket there via Kiosk). Price's quite similar. I went there on friday. It's a little bit crowded, so I bought the express pass. The attraction waiting time about 5-10 mins (20 mins for some attraction) Food&berverage quite expensive

Great theme park for Morning session and for weekday experiance (non peak) becoz last time i was here during peak season and waste so much time for waiting and i suggest to get the express ticket if you guys are lazy to waiting but if non peak season it should be fine for waiting. But i kinda dissapointed for the night halloween session, too crowd and cant experiance the horror feel as the people are overwelming the NPC and you wont ever feel scare but the decoration and the Cosplayer still very malverous.

Awesome place. Check weather forecast and bring along an umbrella. It's a long wait even on a weekday. 60mins on average and longer when it's raining. Staff are doing above and beyond. Kudos to them. . Some attractions have only one staff manning. Generally nice place. Even has a surau next to Mummy locker

amazingggg experience.. especially the mummy ride.. kept repeating this ride everytime i come here.. sam experience like 10, 6, 3 years ago haha.. went on sunday, not many people, no need to queue long time except for transformers ride.. tips: donwload the uss app, it will help to check how long you need to queue for each ride, suggesting you guys to pls start with left ride first, only then slowly move towards the most queued ride..if you start with right side, you will spend lots of time queueing, and in the end not able to enjoy the whole park..
went there during F1 period and it was crowded. However the crowd management is good, there was a short show to entertain the guest while waiting to enter USS

1.review_text: Very poor price/quality ratio as 4 main attractions were closed without any notification. Express tickets were not valid for 2 other attractions so we still had to wait a long time. For a family a 5 this was a very expensive disappointing day. After filing this as a complaint, the response from the service desk was far below our expectations as no effort was done to cheer us up.

Seriously ? Jurassic park closed, waterworld closed, Madagascar closed. Went into the galactic and it was written 15 mn wait. We waited 1h30 mn. Not because there was a long queue but bchasse those with express pass were constantly passing over. This is crazy!!!! At the end the locker wanted us to pay 8. The management should seriously review the express pass numbers and quotas per day and how to insert them in the queue. This is not acceptable and at the end I still paid my ticket didnt I Dont go there it has become a huge mess.

Earlier visited USS eight years back and had a terrific experience but sadly had a pathetic experience this time. ( Kindly note no prior information was given to us about all the things mentioned below) 1) The Madagascar ride on the left entrance is under renovation.. 2) The Universal parade is not being held. 3) Most of the rides in the park ( especially Jurasic World) under renovation). The entire grandeur of the place has been degraded rapidly over the past eight years. Was really looking forward to visiting USS after eight years. Kindly look into it to avoid loss of customer trust. Thank You. Regards, Vaibhav Aggarwal.

It sucks! ! ! The ticket office took half an hour to deal with a group of people getting stuck! Let everyone enter at 1:30! The park closes at 6:00! Ive been to Universal Studios and Disney all over the world and Ive never had this problem before! Never encountered such service!

Used to love this place, come at Halloween event but there's no event at all, the queue is VERY LONG, Express pass is A MUST here, waiting for 2 and half hours for a transformer ride. And its on weekdays

2.review_text: 1/3 of park (Madagascar) was under construction!! The most popular part of park. Rides kept stopping due to technical faults! This causes very long waiting time, even cancelled! Food was terrible! I could not finish my burgers! This park is very old! With these incidents Im concern about the safety of rides as well. To sum up, its a waste!
I did not enjoy my stay here, many attractions are not open/under maintenance. I would like to go back and try more attractions. They open @11AM, and close @6PM.

Its awesome adventure park , you will love the ride , Tickets are very high 80 dollar something Veg food you will not get But lot of food options Worst part is when the rains come it becomes horrible, they dont have shades It was miserable they unable to manage Also rides got closed and we paid 80 dollar for day tickets it was completely wasted They are taking so mucg money and no profit for customers They are making just money. Hell worst They should cover entire place in case of rain Facilities should not stop or ticket should refundable.

We went before covid and it was fabulous. Went last week and it wasn't good. Lots not working. Getting refurbished. wasn't worth what we pay to get it. Run down. No shows. Food isn't amazing,you can use your ticket to go out and get food and go back in.

There are 3 advantages 1.Suitable for a family 2.There are free lockers near the amusement facilities (45 minutes free) 3.The staff at the playground have a good attitude There are 3 disadvantages 1.The playground is really too small 2.The play time is from 11:00 am to 6:00 pm.
