If you like to keep playing the amusement facilities, you will feel that the time is too short 3.The biggest problem is that the ticket is 81 . However, any rides may be temporarily suspended upon admission or at any time. And without any notice. *Really ask me. If you really don't have time to go, don't regret it. Because I'm only staying for two hours myself

3.review_text: Paid 9 for 3 onion rings. My order was colossal onion rings (containing 3 onion rings), 1 slushie and 1 water and total was 20. Main Jurassic park water ride is under maintenance as well as a couple others. Express cut pass only lets you cut each ride ONCE and also EXLUDES certain rides (I think there were 4 rides that werent included) so what am I paying for then? Big wait times, no where nice to sit (lots of people forced to sit on the floor) Gift shop needs improvement, food needs improvement.
Several famous facilities was not operated, such as Jurassic world, perhaps due to pandemic. I don't like the toilets (mostly in Singapore), they smells, maybe needs more staff to clean them up
Many attractions were closed, so even more crowded. Lavatories in very bad conditions. Needed too long wait. Dirt in Far away 4D movie. Disappointing and expensive.
An rather disappointing experiences since several rides and shows were closed. The food is of very mediocre quality and is hugely overpriced

I enjoyed a day here but I have few things I did not like. First thing is locker system. To get on a ride, we had to keep our belongings inside the locker. The price of locker is expensive and I did not find any meanings of putting things inside. In total we spent aound 5 just for locker. This is hidden cost of Universal Studios Singapore. I have been to Universal Studio Japan, it was not like this. The price of water is extremely expensive. Over all, they are slow. It took time to change from the guests finished the ride to new coming guests. I liked the ride Mummy. I did not reget to came here but they need some improvements. I prefer Universal Studio Japan in terms of service, ride, and price. You have to keep in your mind that their operation hour is quite short from 12 to 7.

4.review_text: The express ticket is a must to avoid queues that seemed to average 50 minutes per ride. We arrived soon after opening and learnt to do the furthest rides from the entrance and work back thereby avoiding most of the queues. The Transformers ride was stunning both from a thrill and technical viewpoint. Disappointing that some rides were closed for maintenance and because a number of food outlets were closed the queues were quite long, again go for the food places nearer the entrance for shorter queues.
Amazing place long queues for rides in the weekend. Reccomend buying the queue skip ticket or you can be in queues up to 90 minutes long

Around 3 rides were closed. Not too crowded on a Thursday. On Nov 3, it was open until 6pm. Their express pass also was very expensive. 80sgd 70sgd base price. Best to just come at 11am on a weekday and you won't need an express pass. Regular lines were at most 40mins waiting time. We bought tickets via klook

Best place in Singapore for adventure and animation lovers. Good place to explore with friends. 1 star less because we bought express pass but 4 of the rides were closed and the rate was same . They should reduce the rate if few rides are not available

Fun place and a must see attraction when in Singapore. Sadly this year there were a couple of rides unavailable, and the ones that did work, have reduced the "wow effect" compared to the experience i had back in 2015 when i also visited the Universal Studios Singapore. One concrete example is the "mist pits" of the Battlestar Galactica - Cyborg ride. This year there was no mist/water in the pits, and also the two rides (Human and Cyborg) did not start concomitantly, as they used to... so you do not feel the same excitementand and don't get the feeling of being in a battle. This is what i mean with the "wow effect". All this besides, it is still a must do activity when in Singapore but i reccomend to invest in the skip the line extra option, because otherwise you will spend all day in long queues, which for some rides can get up to 80 min of waiting time...

5.review_text: I loved my trip to Universal Studios Singapore. The best rides were the Battlestar Galactica roller coasters, Transformers ride and the Mummy ride. There was a wait time at these rides but those were almost noon existent in the last hour of the park being open. The only downside was that a few rides were still not open. Though even if they were in not sure if I'd be able to go on them all as the wait times at quite a few rides, even with an express pass, was long. All in all this was an experience I will not forget.

222 Christmas at Universal Studio Singapore Is the most Wonderful time of the Year Upon entering, you parade thru the walk of fame for the Christmas shows on stage. I felt like a NewYorker when I saw subway station entrance like the ones I been to on the streets of NewYork Followed by SciFi zone greeted by Transformers, the Mummys at Ancient Eygpt, dinosaur of Lost world and as I brave the strong afternoon sun to reach the far far far away fairytale land Waiting time for rides are average 30min on weekday early noon when I visited. Restaurants were pack during lunch time (I tried the butter chicken Briyani at Oasis resturant SGD 16 on average, small portion thus I ended up snacking on 6 corndog and 7 coconut drinks from the pushcart) Gift shop was so attractive that I bought some items thou Im a local Size of theme park is not big compared to Usa Australia Korea Japan themepark that I been to However, the performance was great and most importantly good experience. Highly recommended when you visit Sentosa Island. 22 Halloween at Universal Studio Many great rides n fun place for the family Insta ju.rine
Buy ticket at vivo city was a little bit cheaper. But even go there at weekdays, the Q for every rides was also almost 1hr.

Monday and Tuesday are closed. So here on Wednesday. And still busy. Some games still have a long queue. Those who are disappointed with Transformer. Wasting time queuing but the game was delayed maybe because of maintenance, so queuing for almost 2 hours was a waste of time. Luckily it's fun.

Great tourist attraction. The lines are very long so its worth getting the fast pass so you can get more fun out of your day. Staff were very welcoming to tourists and the park offered lots of fun for the whole family. The gift shops and food were a bit pricey, but it is expected for a tourist destination like this

1.review_text: My family of five and I were bitterly disappointed with the overall experience. Far too many people and the minimum queue time was 60mins, with the key rides at least 90-120min. The express ticket also created a two tier system and if without you will be waiting a very long time. Dont understand why USS cant create a booking system with allocated time slots for everyone to enjoy and not the privileged express ticket holders taking repeat rides. Would certainly not be recommending a visit, unless you are willing to fork out for the express ticket or purely there for the shops and sightseeing.

Too much waiting time (Min 2 to 3 hours) for each and every ride. They did not set limit for entry tickets. They just try to dump as much as crowd as possible. Avoid traveling during season time. Especially if you are having kids AVOID this place during season, weekends, public holidays. Overall a very very bad experience.

The express card system at Universal Studios Singapore make people who can hardly afford a ticket to enter universal studio and their young kids waiting in line for several hours, while 15 years old whose rich parents could afford express ticket just pass by and get to go 10 times while the majority of the people is waiting. The express system also makes the estimated "waiting line" unpredictable. 40 minutes can easily become 2 hours, as almost nobody is allowed in besides the express card holders. You get the poor children crying and sleeping tired into their parents arms, while the 15 year old rich laugh about the poor mass waiting, and stating that these poor people in the waiting line are crazy (and they are right...). Fortunately Universal Studios in Singapore is almost the only entertainment park with such a horrible discriminating system. It is better to go somewhere else, so everybody can enjoy their time, and not only the "rich".

Really disappointed. After visiting Disneyland in Japan a couple of years ago we were looking forward to Universal Singapore. It was a huge disappointment. Too many people let in - even the fast pass was slow. 2 hour waits at all rides. The food line was ridiculous and the food revolting!!

Queque everywhere. Long waiting periods and express passes are sold out. Disney properties are much better managed during peak times and crowd controlled. Better dont waste your money especially on holiday season. Limited restaurants and everywhere more than an hour queue for ordering

2.review_text: This is an over rated place! There is at least a 45-50 minutes queue time even with an express pass for popular roller coaster rides. If you do not manage your time well, even restaurant queues can be frustrating. They sell way more tickets than what they can efficiently manage inside the premises. BTW- if you are here only for the vibes and camera clicks then you will have a good time My advise to the management is to implement some capacity management solution to avoid over crowding and better experience for the guests

Its great place to spend a day. However, amusement becomes punishment pretty soon. The management is clearly allowing way more people than it can actually handle. Resulting into an inaccurate app/ride wait time. (00:30 mins 01:45 plus) A Great place thats very badly mismanaged & handled.
Overcrowded. Even buying express cost of 120 SGD will land you queue over 40 minutes for rides. I went on Monday.

I dont understand why you need to line up to buy a fast pass - seems to defeat the purpose of those willing to pay a premium not to wait. Clearly understaffed too, as on one of the busiest days of the year (26 Dec), at least half the food options were closed, leading to long queues for food

Visiting on Boxing Day , busy as expected , services slow , even Starbucks seems to be at crawling pace .rides are average and you have to wait a while , seems like we spent more time waiting then enjoying . A fantasy theme park for the deluded .

3.review_text: We rushed to get to the park, ran to ride after ride after ride to find out rides only start at 12pm. 11am opening 11am start all operation yo! Boos! Also difficult to DL the app due to poor recep in areas. Boos! Long long queues as well. Boos! Some cart stalls also closed early instead of the 7.30pm as promised and we couldn't get what we wanted even tho there was stock! On one of the rides, staff kept letting in express queue only and the normal queue was stagnant, like really stagnant. Boos! Rides are a tad too short for the effort of queueing and there aren't much good rides at all in totality

Mummy ride, twin roller coasters and Shrek, great rides, bit let down today, food loads of food places closed. We qued for 1 HR for food which I can honestly say teriyaki hotdog was horrendous.had fish skin on it. Staff very nice, American dinner at end of day ran out of ice-cream and no coffe

I've been visiting USS a few times. Today is the 1st time I revisit USS since 2019. Quite sad to see a few attractions and restaurants are closing. Property are not well maintained. The drinking water station inside The Transformer is leaking. The stairs are dusty. Restrooms are dirty. Technically, some of the attractions such as Transformer is not as good as before. The projection is not sharp, and I personally think that USS now is really overpriced. Quite disappointing this time, hopefully RWS Management will pay more attention in improving their entertainment as well as their services quality.

Good place if you are NOT A SENIOR CITIZEN. Waiting time is much much more than the action on rides etc. Look at the wait time display before you enter each ride. Rating is done from a Senior perspective only.

It was very crowded. Rides took AT LEAST an hour of queueing before you can ride them and they are just short 2-3 min rides. The cost of the food is VERY VERY Unreasonable. A whole pizza costs 50? With one slice being 10. I recommend coming to have fun and spend quality time but should prepare food before hand so you don't have to pay so much :) Abit disappointing... You should buy tickets AND EXPRESS PASS before hand! :)

4.review_text: we went there on Thursday. yet its crowded. queues are long for the rides especially for the transformers. Shrek area was closed for maintenance. 4D movie from Far far away is never changed since about 10 years ago, and it looks no maintenance at all that water spray and spider simulation are not working. its our second time and i find its not as fun as first time.
Themes changing not very often. queue for the rides are always long.

Service by Tour Guide Joyce is excellent. Attractions and Rides exciting. Thumbs down for service at Ice cream shop. Long queues to order then 20mins wait for collection. Not standard expected form hi tech Singapre.

Visit during this period is sort of disappointing as they are in the midst of changing certain rides and theme in the park. Some of the restaurants in the park are also closed. We enjoyed the meet and greet the most and the staffs are friendly to assist. They are also good to take photos for us even when there is a photographer there. Attached are some of the meet and greet timings so look out for them and just queue for photos to be taken. The wait wasn't long to my surprise! Rides wait time are surprising short at around 5.20pm.

Its pretty small, the older/senior staffs are very nice esp in Steven Spielberg Theater and the entrance and exit line. This girl SHERYL that works in Human Coaster is so RUDE and MEAN, tourist came to Universal to have fun not to see unfriendly faces, if I am the owner and see this Ill fire her, mood killer

5.review_text: Beautiful place to visit however too much of crowd ....waited for 1 -1.5 hrs for rides.must visit in Singapore.
Nice place for kids,,,, the queue is really trouble, pls solve this
Great roller coaster theme park. It's really worth the wait for an hour queue. Definitely coming back. You need to consider using queue pass so you can have more attractions in one day.

Christmas parade - nothing surprising though nevertheless being a nice show Number of visitors - seems reaching the max for the whole last week of 2022. Number of tourists seem to have increased quite significantly Most rides have relatively short queue from 4pm onwards. Really no point rush there early so to be in a 2 hours queue when you can do the same ride with 20 mins queue at 6pm
All theme park are same, waiting time for each play is around nearly 2 hour especially roller coaster, or pay extra for express lane that would cost you like paying 2 ticket for your self..

1.review_text: I probably just came here on a bad day because I left pretty disappointed. I came to Singapore Universal Studios a lot of times in the past but I can tell their standard has dropped quite a lot. Firstly, the transformers ride broke down not once, but twice! The first time I was in the roller coaster itself when it suddenly stopped working. We had to wait in our seats for a pretty long time (20 minutes)I did not queue too long for the ride because I went for the single rider line but I still waited for about 30 minutes before boarding the ride. There were people beside me that waited up to 100 minutes just for the ride to break down! Luckily the staff gave everyone a one time express ticket that could be used for other rides but honestly, I just wished that the ride was working. The second time happened when we were queuing. We decided to return to give the transformers ride another chance by queuing again. We queued for another 30 mins and right before we could board the ride, an announcement came informing us that the ride broke down AGAIN. We had to leave again disappointed as the transformers ride was one of my favourites. The food choices in USS was also pretty bad. The food tastes mediocre and extremely expensive! I recommend all of you to leave USS and eat at other restaurants that Sentosa has and return after you finished eating. Would not recommend eating in USS itself. Also the Madagascar ride and Waterworld is unavailable as the Madagascar ride is being changed into a minion ride. Waterworld used to be one of my favourite shows in USS but for some reason, they closed it Overall, I am extremely disappointed in USS, which used to be my favourite theme park.

Even if the park is nice, not worth the visit. You are literally forced to buy the express upgrade if you want to enjoy some attraction and not to wait for an hour. And 1/3 of the park is not operative because of different works, but it does not reflect on tickets price. Not to repeat; not to recommend!
Roller coaster delay, jurassic Park delay. Expensive drink and food. Long Q. Not recommended. Not worth at all.

Queues for attractions range from 20 to 90 minutes. This is tough. Pay a considerable amount and stand in queues for half a day. If we had known in advance, we would not have gone. Express passage for an additional fee is faster, but also a long wait

Most awful place I ever been. Small park that can't handle all people. You are in line for 1 to 2 hrs and can't make more than 4 rides on a whole day because of the que. Almost no restaurant and the one there is sell garbage to high place. I nearly vomit on a Cafe that sell food because it's so bad and overpriced. I don't recommend to spend time here except you want to waste time.

2.review_text: I went to USS ON 4th Jan 2023 with a 7year old. Waiting time was around 60mins for each ride on average. Rides conclude at 6pm even though the rides open at 11am/12pm depending on the ride. With at least Waterworld closed, I was still not able to enjoy all the rides I wished to get onto due to the lengthy waiting times. 60mins easily feel like 3hours when you're with an impatient and grumpy 7year old. I missed out on the "big" ones( high speed roller coaster etc) which I really wanted to get onto due to their long waiting times of at least 90mins each. The day I went was not a public holiday/Christmas day/New Year's day. Food queues are lengthy as well. With that said, rides/attractions were mostly enjoyable once you get onto them (with a few exceptions). Will I go there soon? No. Did I enjoy myself? Neutral. The takesaway for me is to go there after the "post COVID release" novelty wears off if I were to do it again.

Dividing guests into class especially when those guests are your main clientele. 82 for and adult vs 300 for an adult to basically jump the line! No express line should exist for rides especially when those in that line are stuck up snobs with no manners. 1 hour waits for rides, no thanks.

When I get in there , operational just only until 6 pm , for our team who buy ordinary ticket we have to queue each attraction so its dissappointed for us because we from another country we have a flight to get there

Really disappointed with our family excursion to USS. Paid 349 AUD to enter. Spent over 3 hrs in queues to see 3 attractions. Transformers attraction was quite good, but not worth a 90 min wait at 11.15 am. Waited 65 min for Jurassic Park water ride which still way too long for that type of attraction. Waited 50 min for another Jurassic park ride that lasted maybe 20 seconds. Then we spent over 50 AUD on 4 tiny boxes of fries, 1 single ice cream and 3 coke floats. By 4pm I could not wait another 60 min to go on the large roller coaster. Too jaded by then. I've been to better amusement parks and Waited less time. I wasn't prepared to spend over 700 AUD to have express passes, where even some of those wait times were up to 40 min at some points during the day. There is no embellishments I'm my review, just exactly how we perceived our day at USS.

There are a lot of people there on Mondays. You have to wait for about 80 minutes for some rides, and you have to queue to death. The roller coaster you want to ride after 4 pm is said to be closed. Another Egyptian roller coaster is said to be repaired due to technical problems. It is a pain to pay for it. You cant play what you want. Not to mention that Madagascar is still under renovation and has not opened. It is recommended to come once and save lunch.

3.review_text: Ques were not aligned with posted durations, (all were / 25% from posted times). Minimal food vending sitrs, available ones were overwhelmed by number of guests Food quality was low, based on Singapore high standards Rides quality was low compared to other parks (US & EU) Personnel was burdened by amount of guests' relative to available support Be patient and try to enjoy yourselves, skip it and enjoy other atractions in Singapore instead.

I don't want to sound mean but there are some things I have to say. The experience of visiting Universal Studios Singapore in 2022 was somewhat poor. I must tell the truth. The main problems are as follows: 1. It is obvious that USSG laid off too many staff at the beginning of the epidemic, and currently the playground is facing a serious staff shortage. The staff lacks training and there is a serious shortage of labor. Although every staff member works hard, their fatigue can be clearly felt. There is no staff to manage the team, and some rides (The Mummy, Galactica, etc.) must be stored, but no one informed them in advance. Staff can only perform management at the project entrance, and there will be no extra staff to maintain order during this period. 2. There are insufficient restaurants, insufficient mobile vendors, insufficient vending machines, and insufficient direct drinking water points. There are too few staff at the catering sales points to serve the large number of tourists, and the speed is very slow, resulting in long queues. 3. The park area is too small and there are too many maintenance projects. Some projects, such as the jeep-riding parent-child project, can be completely stopped. 4. Transformers The Ride: The Ultimate 3D Battle, a projector was damaged during New Years Day! ! ! ! ! Resulting in dark and heavy shadows in the image. This is a serious performance accident, and it is an irresponsible behavior for the project to continue operating despite such problems! ! ! ! ! ! ! 5. Due to its lack of operational capabilities, Battlestar Galactica completely failed to reflect its design intentions, and it was also an irresponsible behavior towards tourists. One of the selling points of the Battlestar Galactica project is that the two roller coasters stagger forward and backward, which requires the two trains to cooperate in the departure time, but currently due to lack of manpower, this has not been reflected at all. 6. The useless Fast Pass. The official website states that the pass is only valid for 2 hours after the start of operation, but there is no time limit on actual sale and use, and unclear information can cause many problems. At the same time, not all Fast Pass locations can be used, and the sales quantity is not controlled. At certain times, there may be more Fast Pass players than normal queue players. 7. The attitude of the restaurant staff is extremely bad. There is no one to manage the queue. The staff who pre-registered the order made a driving gesture to us for no reason, intending to make us go to another queue. This is extremely insulting and reflects the extremely low level of park management, because I believe the staffs intention is not to insult tourists but they are obviously not trained. 8. The store SKU is too old and all IPs are not competitive. If the selling point of usj Japan is Harry Potter, then ussg has no idea. 9. The maintenance time of Water World is too long, and it has not been repaired for how long. It took such a long time to repair a project in such a large area in such a small park. 10. Entry into the park was also quite chaotic. Tourists queued up spontaneously at first without any guidance from staff, but in the end, the number of queues became more than a dozen, and no one guided the queue in advance. US SG's evaluation should be benchmarked against amusement parks. If usj's overall evaluation is 5 points, then ussg can only score 3 points, which is too much. If Tokyo Disney has an overall score of 5, then ussg can only give 2 points. Tourists and staff are full of fatigue. The operational level of ussg is not comparable to that of Happy Valley. I think it is a pity. For the Chinese, most of the first batch of Chinese people to learn modern management knowledge came through the window of Singapore, but I dont know why the current management is like this.

Poor management of opening hours makes this park congested and frustrating to visit. I don't understand why, although the park opens at 11am, some attractions inside are only active from 2pm. This obviously has repercussions on the fact that thousands of people flock together into the only open activities, creating queues of no less than 60-70 minutes. In 5 hours we only managed to do 4 attractions lasting a few minutes. If it is true that time is money, it is absolutely worth taking the express pass together with the entrance ticket to skip (part of) the queues.
Top much waiting time. Administration should either speed up the whole system or sell limited tickets. Otherwise, there is no use to visit this park
Some rides closed. Water world attraction closed. Many shops and food places closed. Q for food was ridiculously long. Wasn't as great as when it first opened.

4.review_text: Nice park. Not 5 stars because it lacks numbers of more thrilling attractions, and shows/performances. Also because it lacks proper food. Only 3 thrilling attractions: 1) Cylon 8/10 thrill 2) Human 7/10 thrill 3) Mummy 5/10 thrill Food very expensive and poor quality, as expected. Since they charge so much, at least they should offer good food. Express pass very expensive and not required during my visit (20.01.23). Pro tip- use single person queuing if you don't have the express pass, it saved me a lot of queuing time.
Very crowded and lines everywhere. The express pass is another rip off. Shortens the queue a bit. Best attraction was transformers. Rest were just meh. So much commercialisation.
Bad attitude customer services around this park 5 years ago everything was better

It's January, maybe it's the rainy season, but it's raining a lot. Because there are so few people, I think the express is not worth the money. There are also some attractions and restaurants that are not in operation. Among the rides, HUMAN, CYLON, TRANSFORMER, and Pharaoh's Wrath are worth riding. Most restaurants offer hamburgers, pizza, sausages, etc., but there is a place that sells fried rice and fried shrimp, which I recommend. But I can't remember the name. I'm just before going on a Cylon ride haha.

I arrived at the 11 o'clock entrance, but there were a lot of people waiting. Transformers was a really good attraction, and Shrek 4D was okay, but the other attractions weren't as good. I was especially disappointed with Mummy. When there are a lot of people, it's really a continuous wait. At Disneyland, there are a lot of people, so there are a lot of fun things to do even if you wait or don't have to ride the attractions, but Universal Studios O seems to be a bit weak in that aspect. Still, Transformers was so much fun. So much so that I want to visit again to ride this.

5.review_text: The theme park was awesome with some of thrilling ride experience. Though I felt on a weekends the timing of the park should be increased so that each of the attractions can be enjoyed within the time. Starting time was 11 am-7 pm (some rides start at 12). But the queues where large within a waiting time of more than 1 hour for most of the rides. Non-working day would be enough though.
Having a great time here, better buy tickets online to avoid long queue. Also download Universal SG app by sentosa to know how long queue at each rides, so we can plan accordingly.

Most of the rides are good but last time I went the queue was very long. I waited for an hour in the queue. The longest rides for me are the transformer and the roller coaster. If you don't want to wait you must buy an express pass. Express pass makes you just have to wait for the ride rounds. If you buy the normal one you must not forget to go to the toilet before getting into the queue.

Even on a weekday, it was still full of people! Some rides were close during our visit due to maintenance, but we still managed to enjoy our visit. There are restrooms and food booth all over the park. Tip so you'll have short waiting time: start with the rides at the back of the park! Once lunch time starts, kids will get tired and a few people will be at the rides that are in the front part.

Must visit place with many attractions. Since visited in weekend and peak year-end wait time was more for all rides. Only one problem is that we don't have any veg food options here except for corn and watermelon. It would be great if they introduce some veg options for food here.

1.review_text: Website tickets purchase is not working. Machines self service not working properly. Super long ques to customer service counter. Experience ruined even before we entered the park. In total, trying online multiple times, lining to costumer service spent maybe 2 hours to pay them 263. And even no simple sorry. Probably they need to hire new IT and customer service directors.

Most employees entertain consumers/tourists with an attitude of not wanting to go to work, making consumers feel like they are rushing to get off work. When we arrived on the day, the facilities were damaged on the way. Customers who bought express tickets just took them with them, while those who didn't buy express tickets were given free express tickets for the day. It is strongly not recommended to buy unlimited express because it is too small. Very disappointed with this journey

I encountered rude staff in USS , black face , no manners! I visited in 2022 encountered once,but i choose to peace and didn't argue back, this time2023, again! Buying food i paying by 100cash note , the staff told me that,she can refuse to sell , black face blaming me because i paying 100dollars note , Rws Uss are u sure this kind of bad attitude can bring happiness or your staff just want to passed the stress around?

I will rate is as negative star if I can. Did you even mention some areas are closed and some shows are having technical issues before we buy the tickets? You are still charging us for 100% ticket price...only a few rides are opening, of course it will be a long long queue. It is not worth to go at all...
Toilets unclean and mouldy. At least half of the food areas were closed when I attended. Many areas of the park not open or construction works were taking place.

2.review_text: Used to be great. Currently in Feb 2023, so many rides are closed. The restaurants are all terrible and overpriced with horrible service. Whenever it rains, out comes a lighting warning which closes all outdoor rides - i.e. most of the fun ones - and mamagement will keep these closed even if the rain stops and no lightning at all. This completely ruins the experience and is probably being lazy / an excuse, and not caring about the customer experience. Very poor vs any other comparables globally. Do not bother visiting until they fix the above issues - the rating is completely misleading.
Most of rides were closed due to maintenance... They should inform us on website n counter which rides not available n also should give discount in cost of tickets..

Very run down theme park. Lack of maintenance during covid has definitely taken its toll. Some of the attractions weren't running on the day and the food was terrible. Not ideal for young children as there is very little to entertain or stimulate them. Save the money and take them to 1 of the various great beaches on Sentosa instead.

The fairly small park simply offers far too little for entry including a simple express pass, which currently costs around 100 per adult. You walk past many closed attractions. Construction noise right in front of the main entrance. Waiting times are just bearable with an Express Pass. Organizing lockers is just messy and time-consuming. Here you are deliberately ripped off again and asked to pay. Drinks and food are just outrageously expensive. Overall, it is one of the less worth seeing attractions in Singapore.

What a disappointment! On a Monday... about 60% of the park was closed / under renovation or under construction. Both restaurants and attractions. I mainly saw "CLOSED" on the doors, or sails over the buildings or there are walls on entire parts of the park for renovations (which, by the way, have been dormant for a long time). What did work looked only moderately to poorly maintained. High time that the park was thoroughly renovated and updated. Worst Universal Studios park I ever visited. I have been going to Orlando for several years, but Singapore is not worthy of the name. It feels chaotic (you have no idea where you are and/or where to go) and it lacks a soul. The park is CURRENTLY not recommended at all. Tickets are expensive for what you get (as are the food and drinks). You are better off doing all the other attractions on all of Sentosa Island for the same rate, but at least you get value for your money.

3.review_text: Typical theme park experience. Some really fun attractions tempered by long waits and dumb rules. With limited operating hours of only 11:00-18:00 outside of peak season, you're at a steep disadvantage in terms of being able to enjoy very many attractions unless you buy the express pass. You cannot conceivably ride even half of the rides without the express pass. I also felt that some aspects of our visit were purposefully stacked against us. Despite a short queue, there was a bizarrely long wait at the concession stand in Jurassic Park - over a half hour to filter through maybe ten people placing orders. After that long wait, the attendant at the entrance to the neighbouring Canopy Flyer was refusing to allow people to bring drinks into the queue, despite the 60-minute wait for that ride and two trash cans full of drink cups at the midpoint and end of that queue - which means either people were sneaking drinks into queue or this woman was just being particularly cruel. It would have been nice to enjoy my drink for at least some of that wait instead of wasting time outside. It was also very hard to buy tickets in advance as a non-local. The official website refused every Visa, MasterCard, and Amex we have, they unbelievably have no phone contact centre, and their online support asks you to send credit card information through email! We eventually found tickets on the Singapore site of Trip dot com - and for cheaper, too. It was fun to come once, but likely won't come again.

Seems like whole park and the equipment requires a refurbishment as it looks very tired and worn out. Most of the attractions were out of order due to maintenance or broken down. No need to pay extra for express ticket as it only gives you limited advantage due to not many rides or attractions covered by it. I had a feeling that we were overcharged and not well informed about how available all the rides and attractions were.
Tell those young people working and attending to the rides there...to be more friendlier.....do not shout at people dont make their ugly face when doing their job! Its really spoils my day.

Unfortunately, one of the good rollercoasters, Enchanted Airways, and the WaterWorld show were not available during my latest visit. The Cylon has had technical problems on both of my visits, and the delays hampered me from riding them more than once on both visits - these were in early 2021 & 2023. They have not implemented a long-term fix?! Some rides were kinda lame - the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase, and the accelerator (akin to Sunway Lagoons boots ride thing) did not allow me to control the cups rotation. Some food outlets were just unavailable (Discovery Food Court, Oasis Spice Caf) on my latest visit. The theme park is due for an upgrade... and more automation of montonous operational tasks.

Not so Satisfied! I've joined universal studios during weekend in a rainy Saturday of february. Most of the attractions were closed due to the low-season and others open on air were temporarily closed due to the rain of that day. There remained open just a few games with lots of queque to enter. The most funny attractions were Advengers, Egyptian, which I suggest for large audience: teenager as well as family with child above middle age, And also rollercoasters. I've bought ticket before my arrival, enter were fast. I've opted for the skip-the-line additional ticket which is mandatory to test several attractions without using an eternity.

4.review_text: Enjoyed my time at Universal Studio Singapore, despite long queues and high prices. USS was a mixed experience. While the CYLON and HUMAN roller-coasters were great. The HUMAN roller-coaster was only open for half a day during my visit, and then queue was very long. Unfortunately, we didn't have a chance to ride it. Some attractions required lockers, which were either limited or costly. I recommend planning what to bring beforehand as one day is not enough to explore everything.

Great day out, but the park is definitely showing its age. I came here about 9 years ago and the facilities appear to be pretty worn out. A portion of the park (Madagascar) was closed for upgrades and a lot of the attractions and services were closed. Don't make the mistake of getting on rides in long queues at the start of the day like we did. Transformers ride was a 100 min wait. By lunchtime they all drop to 20mins or less for the afternoon.

My wife and I visited Universal Studios Singapore for the first time. Despite the crowds, we were able to have a great time enjoying several rides. However, the long lines for each ride were a bit of a disappointment and limited the number of rides we were able to complete. Fortunately, the weather was on our side that day, which is not always the case in Singapore. While there were food options available, they were rather pricey.

Went there on a Sunday in February. Doors open 10:55 am. Presented the codes and ran into the park. The park is not that big, very clean. Although there was a lot of people, waiting time for rides was never more than 5 minutes. Glad I didn't buy the express pass. Recommend the Battlestar Galactica , & the mummy rides. One of the Jurassic park rides closed right before we got there because of maintenance. The whole Madagascar section was closed. Had lots of fun but I wish there was more to see.

Visited 3 times before, and it was still great. The queues for famous rides were still long as usual. Would recommend getting an express pass if you can afford it. If you have good patience, it was OK. The queue went by quite fast as the staffs were quite good in their job. However, this time, there were much fewer costumes walking around. The only one that we saw was the Cat during the opening of the gate. Food choices were also fewer than few years ago.

5.review_text: Every time I go to Singapore, I stop by, and everyone should buy a pass on Klook to avoid queuing. The hot thrill rides always have long queues, and it takes a lot of time, especially if you go on the weekend.

If you come here again after the epidemic, it is recommended that you consider buying a fast pass during the holidays. The queue time for popular facilities ranges from about 30 to 90 minutes. Except for Jurassic Park, the facilities in the park all have their own characteristics. It is recommended that you dont miss this spot when you come to Singapore. Its worth spending a day here. PS. Pre-booking tickets through Klook will be cheaper than on-site/its better to eat before entering the park

I arrived 30 minutes early and waited. I felt like it went quickly. You can shorten the waiting time by riding the two roller coasters on the right first, then the Transformer ride, and then riding the rest. Its an amusement park that you cant experience in Korea.

Amazing! Good mix of rides and we went on a Friday so the lines weren't so bad. Maybe a ten minute wait per ride? The park opens at 11 but the rides don't open till 12 which was annoying, but that's sleepy Singapore! The jurassic park ride is 10/10! The food is either very touristy/American or very expensive (40 steaks etc) but theres a hawkers market outside and the beach clubs nearby for good food.

Plan ahead it got plenty of themes and ride to explore which won't be able to cover in single day. So go for express ticket or they have waiting time displayed/announced on every ride...so you can plan accordingly. This place is worth visiting

1.review_text: Was very dissepointed of universal singapore mostly becouse of 4 different rides being out for maintainance. Whitout any information on it when we purchased the tickets. Was told this when we picked up our universal fast track wristbands. Also the whole waterworld were closed down, again no information. We do understand that it happens, but it should be told when purchasing tickets or at least have some commendation for our loss. I should say, fast track works splendid and would highly recommend it. But wont be visiting singapore universal again for sure
Always at last queue they shut down the ride. And closing time like working in an office. Aiyoooo jialat lah And always raining hahaha dont go to USS Singapore anymore guys

When I queue for picture with characters, staff always said that the queue stop already. Even though the line is not long, and I line up very fast. The ticket is expensive while all the restaurants inside close. Madagascar still maintenance. Worst experience this time.

Visited in March 2023! negative impression! There are only four attractions for adults in the entire park! Terribly long lines, I had to wait 20-40 minutes in line! an advertised place that actually doesnt even qualify for economy class in the province!

extremely long quene, extremely long waiting time for all games, poor signage for waiting time. always trap you into the long quene for games, and no exit in the middle of quene even u want to leave the game. Ruining my day in Santosa.

2.review_text: Very bad park planning. First the queue to get in. There is line, but ppls cut queue left and right. Then there is priority queue, which also didn't work out very well. Rides are extremely long wait. the show on the street are nice, but that's about it. If only they do limited the number of rider every day would be great. Rather than just stuff every living soul into park. If you like stand and queue in line, this is for you.

Very small park with only a few rides. Left after two hours. Waiting times aren't too bad if you come at 11am. No need to get the express pass if you go early or are a single rider. Corndog was terrible. Not worth coming here tbh.
not much exciting...only few attractions

3.review_text: Some rides were closed and werent properly taken cared of. Place was a bit untidy and unclean especially the snack houses. We were looking forward to ride the Jurassic park ride but it was under renovation. Long lines to all rides too. Too many people and you will waste most of your time waiting in lines.

Not many activities for family with kids to explore. Rides waiting up to 90 minutes on queue on Monday normal day. Expected big place or similar to universal USA. You visited one that enough to see everything within 3 hours and the place not really make you want to come back the second, third so on. For me the place not really value for money if I have know.

Place was not bad, but weather is too crazy to actually enjoy the rides Everyone is just hot and sweaty, and smells once u start queuing. (especially the indoor rides) Some rides definitely needs maintanence as the power just shuts off suddenly.

Really enjoyed the atmosphere. We had an issue which that we were not informed about a fast track ticket when we bought the normal tickets. It was not clear when you buy online or at the machine. Better to buy the ticket from the reception because you can ask them and make sure to find your right tickets. Other problem is that they clause at 18 which is quite early as you will not find enough time to enjoy the rides. Also that they close the restaurants too early which I find it very rude. At least open the restaurants for couple of hours after closing the place.
All ok etc but they really need to adjust pricing when half the park is closed and one of the main shows isnt playing , no notification and the food prices are insane !!!!

4.review_text: The most interesting place in singapore, not so many rides, 2 rides had problem, one ride (Jurassic park ride) causing the waiting line stuck longer, and another one (4D transformers ride) which is my favorite ride,close temporary due technical problem while we were waiting in line. You will need to queue for each ride for about 40-60 mins. Buy the ticket directly from the ticket machine on the spot, price just the same as online(even cheaper), no queue at all

back here again after 10 plus years. expect a long queue for some rides if you dont have the express pass. however the waiting times of some rides are not representing the actual. the dino soarin was claimed to be 20 minutes, when the actual was more than 40. meanwhile the canopy flier was claimed to be 50 minutes, when the actual was only about 25. also it would be nice to introduce a Virtual Queue function on the app (similar to the one used in Skyworlds Genting).

The Madagascar section is currently under construction. Human and Cyclone don't have single riders, so I used the Express Pass. Operating hours are too short. Restaurants have too few tables and seats. There is no place to sit and rest.

Nice place however the operating time is limited from 11am to 6pmas of this time. Some renovation going on so less ride. We went on a thursday so it was not crowded. Express pass is still convenient to avoid the ling queue. Turkey leg was not available on the day of my visit
Nice theme parks enjoyed a lot. But some theme parks long queue on week end so need to wait more than a hour for one attraction

5.review_text: I am a theme park person, so the thrilling rides in Universal Studio Singapore made me excited, especially the Galaxy, Mummy and Transformer rides, just need to bear with the long waiting time, or alternatively you may consider the express pass to skip the queue. I purposely chose a weekday to avoid the crowd too. Loving this place and plan to visit again during Halloween Night.
It is an unreal park!!! There are not many people in lines of no more than 20 minutes super!! It is a small park and the Madgascar attraction is about to open!!

Much like any other amusement park, it's a pleasant location to visit with children. The tickets are not expensive, but they will most likely require additional employees to handle the crowd. Few rides were not working, but We enjoyed ourselves, but we could have done better. You should get at least one time VIP tickets to experience the full excitement of the amusement park because it cuts down on a lot of the waiting time. After you have experienced all the rides to determine your favourite, simply continue queuing.

Because of some bad reviews we almost didn't go to the park - luckily we decided to go. We had a very nice, entertaining day. Even though we were in the park on a Sunday, the waiting time without an express ticket was absolutely limited: mostly 0-20 minutes, max. 50 minutes - and that can be avoided with good planning. The park is lovingly designed and offers primarily moderately fast to fast-paced roller coasters. Don't expect the park to be the same as any other park (e.g. Europapark, that shouldn't be the expectation, that's what the great film themes are for here) and you'll have a lot of fun. Tips: - Check waiting times in the app. - Be there and run at least 30 minutes before the park opens. Then you can ride several trains directly without waiting in line. - You can refill your drinking water for free in the park. We were also allowed to bring food with us. - The lockers in the park are rented under different conditions. Some cost directly, others are free for the first 45 minutes and 90 minutes in the afternoon. Just try it out. We never had to pay for our lockers.

It's good, u can't really explore all of it within a day tho. The queue take too long, express ticket is the only way if u want to save some time. Must try restaurant the mel drive in. It just right ahead after the gate, u can get some meal here like 16 and some drink at 5. so expect 21 per person. Note that if u foreigner and purchase the online ticket through travel apps, u need to go to guest service first. U cannot enter directly. About ride, Transformed ride is the most worthed attraction, but the queue take 1 hours mostly. U can get quick snack throughout the park, the got small stall. Every stall have the same menu. Coke, canned drinks for 4 and corn dog for 6.

1.review_text: I strongly recommend not to go. After waiting two queues for more than 60 minutes, the personnel announced the attraction is out of order. If you plan to visit singapore, definitely do not waste your time to go here.
Short Opening hours. Number of facilities shutdown. Long q for most of rides.

Only come here if you have younger kids (8 and below) or have the patience to wait in line for 80 minutes for most rides. We went on a Friday thinking that queues would not be too bad but was not prepared for the 60-80 min wait times. They are only open from 11-5pm so do the math - you can really only ride a couple of times if you factor in meal time (food is overpriced). Many parts of the park were closed and it was the same with the food shops, so choices are limited. With an 82SGD entry ticket for adults and SGD61 for kids, consider carefully if that us where you want to spend your tourist money. I should have read the reddit reviews - they are all there. Don't make the mistake, even the locals do not think it is value for money.

Worst experience. There is no limit to the entry crowd. What a rip off. They just want to dump people inside. Not worth the money. Few rides are closed. The wait time for each ride is 60 to 90 mins. You can only enjoy like 2 to 3 rides if you have kids. After a wait time of nearly 1.30 hrs the rides(Battlestar Galactica) was closed due to technical issues. And another ride was stopped due to rain after a wait of 40mins.

The best way to experience the Singaporean Queue. Come by if you dont mind standing under the scorching hot sun in an overtly crowded and cramped space. Queue for each ride is at least 60 mins wait but fret not, pay for the express lane and that will line you up for 30 mins wait. Opening hours is only from 11am to 6pm so do your math and you know how many rides you will be on. And dont forget the long queues at the restaurants. Also be prepared to queue up for meet and greets which can be cancelled at the last minute. Some rides are also closed without any notice in advance. Enjoy all!

2.review_text: Had the chance to only join for 4 rides only due to large ques on a friday 14/04/23. Had to spend hours on ques which was totally embarrasing. I recommend to buy express passes to cover all rides & also watchout for waiting time on rides otherwise time will run out as park closes at 6pm. Cant be satisfied with this when compared with universal located at hollywood which Myself & my family had a totally amazing experience in 2008. I expected more in 2023 in singapore but bit dissapointed in the end.

They sell way too many V.I.P passes, so wihout one you have to wait over an hour for all cool rides. Sometimes probably closer to two hours. I went last Friday and it was so crowded, even with V.I.P passes we had to wait over 1 hour for one rollercoaster. The waiting area also didn't have an AC. I find singapore too hot to do amusement parks, in the future I'll stick to water parks. Upside were the live shows and entertainment they had.

It could be a really nice place to visit but you are spending most of your time waiting in line. For some of the nicest roller coasters you can't have anything in your pockets. You first need to go to the lockers which are free for a certain time. Then you need to go to the correct waiting line. I really dislike their system with the Universal Express tickets. Not only because you make people willing/able to spend more money more important, it also slows down the whole process as the staff first need to check those tickets, mark them, count the people they let in first before allowing the normal people waiting in line... it annoyed me more and more during the day. I know I can complain but there are a lot of people with enough money, seeing the number of people using it, so they never going to change this system We didn't see a lot of the rest of the park because there was no time for it. So spend your time wisely. We really liked the Battlestar Galactica, the Mummy and the Shrek movie.

This is the fourth time Ive visited USS. However I felt disappointed in this recent visit on 26Feb23. I bought the ticket via Klook in advance with USD 61/adult & USD 45/child. But can you imagine that I & my daughter sister could play only 2 Rides due to temporarily closed others??? Universal Studio Singapore has temporarily closed many Rides thought its Sunday (a crowded day of visiting) such as Water World show, Treasure Hunters, Enchanted Airways, Madagascar, Magic Potion Spin. Therefore, may I ask 61/adult that I paid just for 2 RIDES? Do you all think its worth? If you closed many rides like that you should change/discount the ticket price instead. SAME AS MY VISITING OF UNIVERSAL STUDIO HOLLYWOOD (on Oct22) Finally, this was my last time to visit the Universal Studio Singapore and do not recommend to my friends for sure.

Not recomending to visit this attraction, most of the time we're spended in line in a hot weather condition which is 1h to 2 hour waiting time for the sake of 2 min ride. It shouldn't be just a poor copy of Disney land, it should be organized properly! The food court is overpriced, the meals is disgusting. Be careful they have lockers, that they're trying to make money while you waiting in line.

3.review_text: I find this very frustrating experience. Manny rides was not working. Also many attractions are not in the working condition. We stand in line for almost 56 hours in a single day. Still was not able to finish all the rides. I think they are intentionally keeping people waiting just to sell express pass. It was a very frustrating experience when we ask for some concessions for the closed rights, they simply reject other request and told us there is nothing they can do. I shared the same experience from many people. They faced the same issue. So I think they are doing this intentionally to save some money.

Not sure am I just not lucky or it was the service . All the rides have extremely long que even though we came on monday (1-3 hours). We wanted to buy the fast pass but the quota of the day ran off so we couldn't. There was quite the discrimination between the pass holder and the 'peasants' especially at the transformer ride. The staff is very rude and allowing all the fast pass riders to ride EVERY TIME. I que at the single riders and she won't even allow me enter the ride even though there was 2 empty seats several times. She insisted to allow the fast pass or the group que to fill in the seat. Then what is the point of the single riders?? Glad that the other ride staff are not like the transformer. The fast pass also has a que even though is very little. BUT gives the 'peasants' chances too. If you enjoy rides BUY THE FAST PASS. The price is 100USD but worth it. Who has time to wait 2 hours for a single ride right? And on the shrek movie. From 200 people, why must it be our chair that is not moving , it only move the first time but it stopped. It's not even the stationary chair . It used to be very fun going here The que system had to be improved or not it will be hell for non fast pass riders. I don't think my last visit worth the money. I could only enjoy 3 attraction despite going there from 11 am to 6 pm because of the long que (shrek, transformer, human). Definitely regret not buying the fast pass online.

Place was awesome, rides, 4D, dance show, amazing. There was 1 bad memory, ride name was rapid adventure ar jurassic Park, after waiting for 1 hour heard announcement of single rider can skip line and join another line, after joining that waited for 30 mons but no luck, then wanted to resume original line but guy support staff was so very much rude, he told to join line since beginning, is the way you treat tourist? We pay premium not for this type of behavior and rudeness

As SG has limited theme park options, it became one of the top here. Rides are okay, with options catered for adults and kids. F&B are below expectations. Staff hospitality quite inconsistent. Need for more cooling fans around the premises on hot days. Wish the operating hours to be longer, with more entertainment other than the rides (which are limited and long wait time). Just refer to your global competitors pls. I also personally think that US Jpn has more value for money compared to USS.

A little chaotic, many people were cutting in line, and there's no one from the park near to avoid that. We were on the line for jurassic Park attraction and after 40 minutes in it the announced closing of it due to weather conditions in the vicinity, which it's something you can announce before or close it before too many people goes inside and waste time in the line. The cost of entry is ridiculous (81) and if you want the express pass it's 61 more ... not worth it at all....

4.review_text: Rides were fun but queues were incredibly long for anything other than the kiddy rides. Luckily someone leaving gave us their express pass which made it much better. Disappointed that there is very little cover for when it rains, and most rides shutdown in the rain. Luckily we managed to do almost everything we planned to do even if we finished the day drenched from head to toe.
Too many people even on a Monday. Waiting times in rides were inaccurate. Add another 20-30 min

Overall not bad. With express pas everything is fast and without a queue. Without them, you stand in line for 30-40 minutes. Many attractions were closed for reconstruction. There are only about 5-6 attractions for adults, the rest are for children.

Some exciting rides, but not enough operating for the demand. At least 7 were closed. Express pass kiosks and salespeople are everywhere because the park operators know you cant do the entire park without it. Recommendations: Go on a day its raining weekday for lowest crowds Mummy and Transformers are some of the most unique rides, Id prioritize those. Bring some snacks; our bag wasnt searched and any loss of snack is worth the inflated food cost Bring a water bottle; theres a fountain by a lot of the rides
It's for youth and young person, for 47 years old just few attractions can be enjoyed... the food is rare, moreover the attractions are full.. Buy premium ticket must be a good idea for fast track...

5.review_text: Cool park, BUT(!) Huge queues even with the express train, 2 out of 5 zones are closed, one roller coaster is closed. And they take the same money, guys, no matter how dishonestly

Had an amazing experience here, it beyond my expectation. We purchased priority access and admission tickets via klook. Priority access is totally worth it I suggest you get one, we never fall in line. The Revenge of the Mummy is the best ride for me. I also enjoyed the Jurassic ride, though we got wet at the end of ride. The theme park overall is great and well comeback if I visit Singapore again

It was an enjoyable place to spend time with a friend. We didn't purchase express tickets as we didn't expect to queue for too long as it was Tuesday. However, we ended up waiting in a long queue, but we were able to ride most of the rides. It's a lovely park with a lovely view.

This place is huge and very busy even on a weekdays, buying the tickets inside is very easy they use machines. The atmosphere was great. We spent 8 hrs here and did not manage to ride on all the rides as you had to queue up to 2 hrs per ride. There are plenty of food and drink stalls, but again, these can be expensive.

Its fun place I personally visit there Over five times really enjoy alot,on my opinion 1 day is not enough for Finish every attraction and every corner of USS Try to visit in weekdays. try to check whether before Book Tickets i want to Recommend USS Team thet on weekend Try to Limities Pepole entry accordingly your convenient and attractions waiting time

1.review_text: Worst place in the world to visit. Pay 80 dollar to be in the queue for many hours. 3 hours queue for a ride ????? Dont have any other things to do in singapore ???.

Extremely disappointed out if all activities at Singapore. Universal Studio is poor organized in managing guest after paying for all the rides each ride took 2. 30 hrs waiting time(3/5/2023)and on their own discreet they stop rides stating bad weather conditions when there is no rain, and only with a light cloud. We pre booked tickets week ago and yet we had to wait in queue for more than 2 hrs for each ride and out of which due to call off human roller coaster we have to leave and re do the same process after 40 mins including which made 3.5 hrs waiting time for one ride. This should be investigated by principal universal Studio, they should not accommodate crowds which they can't handle and make tourist locals wait on their pre planned trips, went twice to the place one after another couldn't complete all rides and it's very shame to see when looking at how the singapore is very well organized as a country and all other activities outside sathosa. Never recommended to go on weekends or weekdays.

The amusement facilities were out of order and the queues took a long time. The only announcement was to advise tourists to experience other facilities first. Please follow the instructions of the staff when going to the exit. As a result, the staff were hiding inside and could not guide the exit route. If you wanted to go out, you had to push forward and ask how to get out. I had no idea how long it would take, and I wasted all my time waiting in line. It was such a bad experience. I couldnt understand how an advanced country could have such a bad crisis management model.

I'm seriously not recommending this place, this has just become a business. First of all no matter which pass you buy, You will not enjoy, because almost every ride has a waiting of nearly 1 to 2 hours minimum. Secondly if it rains which is very common in Singapore, the money you spent is a total waste. As they shut all the rides. They have locker system, which they give for 40 mins free, but since every ride has a waiting of nearly 2 hours. You end up paying the fees after 40 mins. Which makes no sense. Rides aren't that great. The one's that are mostly shut all time. If the park is flooded like this, none can enjoy. A sheer waste of money. There are barely any cafes serving veg options.

Ordered my tickets via online but somewhat messed up the vouchers code as duplication, wasted 1 hour calling the customer care centre to resolve the issue. Upon entering found, about 40% of the attractions are closed for renovation & upgrades. Coupled with tourist visiting, put the attractions queue waiting time exceeding 45 minutes in most rides and some 60-minute waiting time. The team park closing by 6pm.

2.review_text: This place has seriously gone downhills in recent times. With an entire section under renovation for the next year, the size of the park is equivalent to Malaysias legoland. Perhaps even smaller. A lot of the shows arent even available. The ticket price is not justified. Most of the park staff seem pretty rude and makes me feel like they do not want to even be working there. Perhaps the park is not paying them enough. I do feel like theres a lot of cost cutting everywhere. I recommend spending your time and money at other parts of Sentosa. Universal Studio Singapore is not worth it. A real shame.

It opens at 11:00am, but the stands are still open then. Very difficult. The food tastes good, but is totally overpriced. The fast lane system is not always fair and it is therefore difficult to make any progress in the normal queue. A large part of the entire park was closed due to construction work. I wouldn't go again.

Very bad experience! I travelled from overseas to have experience in USS Singapore but they are irresponsible with their rides by making inaccurate assumptions about the weather and suspended all outdoor rides. We waited for 1 and half hour in the queue and they suspended it just like that and after 2 hours they opened all the outdoor rides back and there WASN'T A DROP OF RAIN! Such a waste of time! They did not even announced that they have already opened the outdoor rides and the queue for indoor attractions was very full. Please be responsible and have empathy for foreigners and everyone who came here, we paid for this not to waste our day with just 3 attractions.

Very long queues (120 min, sometimes 160 min). The express pass was sold out. Some of the zones were not available from the beginning. Most of the coasters were shot down due to the bad weather alert.
Went on a Monday. 1.30 hour plus wait for popular rides. Seems over-selling tickets and then offering exhortationist fast-track tickets is their modus operandi. Spent most of our time in lines.

3.review_text: A good day, staff are friendly and helpful. However, half of the attractions and food places were closed and the park was at capacity, so anywhere you go to get food is completely full so there is nowhere to sit, we purchased express tickets so our wait times weren't so bad but if you buy normal tickets, expect to wait up to 2 hours per ride. A very expensive and frustrating day out, overall an average experience.
many rides were closed, and long queue time for each available ride. not quite worth the value

I have been here so many times and after so many years been back last Mar. I'm just disappointed that some attractions are now closed like the Waterworld and Madagascar. Huge queues so be patient. Bring lots of water. SG has 2 weathers in 1 day.

Very long ques. Unable to enjoy all the rides due long que on week day. Mummy ride was not operational due to technical issues, but people like us can't see that for a whole life as well are from India. Need to find ways to avoid disappointment to travellers

This is a great place for an awesome family fun day, but there is scope for improvement in everything. When we went the entire waterworld section was closed, which was a huge disappointment for the kids. The rides are great but have extremely long waiting lines on most days exceeding 120 minutes which is impractical and frustrating for a 2 minute ride. Some of the shows like Shrek 4D and Steven Spielberg Presents have a 10-15 minute intro before the actual show without any seating. The most important issue I saw was that all the eateries close along with the park timings, which is extremely frustrating because after an entire day at the rides you are very hungry and there's nowhere to eat after the rides close. The photos clicked by the automatic cameras on the rides are not great and not positioned at a good angle.

4.review_text: The rides are fun and you could easily google in advance to find out which are suitable for you. The tickets are not cheap and with long queues for each ride, there was little time to try all rides, do some shopping, enjoy food, take photos. The queue time estimated was rather long , but in actual fact the time is shorter. I hope USS can have earlier open hours and close later. At 6-plus pm, we were " chased out" by Park staff.

Good selection of rides. A couple of rides were closed and a section of the park but there was plenty still to do. Decent food selection to choose from, friendly staff through out. Many rides had a single rider queue. Longest queue was 60 minutes through out the day.

Must visit place in Singapore. We need full day to cover maximum attractions. Well maintained. King queues are boring but worth waiting. Food options are less once we moved inside near Disney land area. Egyptian ride is too hyped. It could have been beeter designed. Transformer ride will make any human being excited even if they have not watched this flim series. But we had to wait for 90 minutes in a queue. Similarly long queues for roller coaster will eat you time. So one has to move to the last attractions quickly and come back to main attractions in the evening. A dance show was so great It is ok for kids. We did not have time to visit Jurassic park. The food court outside the Universal studio is pocket friendly and have lot of options. We wanted to cendol, the dessert but disappointed.

Come at 11.30 because operating hours are only from 11.00 to 18.00. 30 minutes late because the queue to enter the train was very long. There you can only ride 4 rides because you have to queue for 1.5-2 hours per ride. Better don't go there on a public holiday. Not worth it.

We reached the park after it had opened and had almost no queue to enter the park. But each major attraction/ride had wait time of 60 minutes. In many cases it looked like AC was off even in indoor waiting queue. Water fountains were not working, so drink up before you queue. All rides were fun and everyone thoroughly enjoyed. Jurrassic park ride really can drench you, and in my case even our shoes were soaked.

5.review_text: Fun rides. The wait for the Transformers ride is painful, 45mins of waiting in the poorly ventilated indoor maze, probably making it worthwhile to get express pass

overall a fun and exciting amusement park highly recommended to not go during june and november-december due to it being the school holidays however they do close later at about 9pm during the holidays, during normal days waiting time isnt as long however the park would close at 6pm
All trips have to be queued for a long time, and the food in the park is really expensive! ! ! ! !

USS is a theme park located in Sentosa Island with many rides, shows and attractions. USS is visited by most tourists who come to Singapore. There are many rides, amongst it Transformers ride, Revenge of Mummy, Battlestar Galactica rides are good and exciting. Weekends rush is more and the wait time for rides is more. Average wait time for above rides is 80-120 mins during the morning time and reduces by evening. If you want to cut the queues, purchase express pass for the rides. There are various restaurants within the USS and many options for both Vegetarians and Non veg.

Since Madagascar is under construction, there isn't much to ride, so I feel like it's a bit of a waste of money considering the price, but it's a bit awkward not to come all the way to Singapore... I arrived at 12 o'clock on Friday and entered after only purchasing tickets on site. After checking the time on the app, I boarded most of the rides and there was no wait for more than 30 minutes.

1.review_text: Many of the staff here are unfriendly Also, you are forced to use paid lockers when playing the rides in the Jurassic area (for Chinese and Indians). Foreigners do not have to use it. The experience is very poor. I still prefer Disney

This is a terrible place. It used to be better. Now its dilapidated. A lot of rides are closed, the few open ones have queues as long as 2 hours. The hours are 11-6 which gives you barely enough time to go on 3 rides. Dont waste time, give it a miss.

This is insane. You need to wait for 1.5 hours to get transformers attractions. This was in the middle of the week. You don't see how much time to spend there before entrance. These greedy managers made working time for 7 hours per day, from which you will wait for 4-5 for waiting. Make a limit of tickets per day! I would advise a person who wants to come here - to come only in very bad weather conditions, otherwise this is the queue to the doctor, but not the fun at all.
Some attractions are deceiving, the wait before the attractions can be more than an hour. Not recommended for small children and the elderly. Think before entering.
Long waiting queue. Few rides were under construction. Most the events are closed. Still the price is high. Based on price it's not worth.

2.review_text: I visited Universal Studios Singapore today, and unfortunately, my experience was disappointing. The park is quite small, and the entrance fee is quite expensive, especially considering the limited number of attractions. Even on a Monday outside of the school holidays, the wait times for all the rides were long, ranging from 50 to 120 minutes. One major issue I noticed was the poor maintenance of the park. The exterior paintwork was faded, and many attractions had broken elements, from minor things like malfunctioning TV screens in the queues to more significant issues like the broken robot dinosaurs in the Jurassic Park ride. Furthermore, all the attractions in this park felt like inferior versions of similar rides in other parks worldwide. It seemed like little effort was made to provide something unique. Additionally, the toilets were unclean, and the food was expensive. The staff seemed to put minimal effort into ensuring efficient queue management. Platforms were overcrowded, and the staff was unfriendly on multiple occasions. It felt like they were simply going through the motions. One aspect that added to the frustration was the necessity to purchase an express pass. The regular queue lines moved at an excruciatingly slow pace, making it feel almost mandatory to buy an express pass to avoid spending the entire day waiting in line. Overall, I got the impression that little attention was given to visitor experience. Hopefully, the park can make improvements in the future to meet visitor expectations and enhance the overall quality of attractions and service. Please feel free to make any further adjustments to the text if desired.

Unfortunately, my experience at Universal Studios Singapore was disappointing. The park is small, and the entrance fee is quite expensive considering the number of attractions. With only 16 attractions, half of which are aimed at young children, the diversity was limited. Even on a Monday outside of school holidays, the waiting times were surprisingly long, ranging from 50 to 120 minutes for all attractions, including the smallest kiddie roller coasters. The park maintenance left much to be desired. The exterior paintwork was weathered and in dire need of a makeover. Additionally, there were many broken elements throughout the attractions, from minor defects like broken TV screens in the queues to larger issues like malfunctioning robot dinosaurs in the Jurassic Park ride. Unfortunately, all the attractions felt like inferior versions of similar rides in other parks around the world. Revenge of the Mummy seemed like a cheap copy of Indiana Jones, and Battlestar was a disappointing imitation of Space Mountain, with a weak storyline that ended before the roller coaster even left the platform. Furthermore, the toilets were dirty, the food was expensive, and the staff seemed to make little effort in efficiently managing the queues. Platforms were chaotic, and the staff was unfriendly on multiple occasions. It appeared that little attention was given to improving the overall experience. In summary, I had hoped for an enjoyable visit to Universal Studios Singapore, but unfortunately, the feeling of insufficient care and attention to the park prevailed. Hopefully, future improvements will be implemented to enhance the visitors' experience. EN below: Unfortunately, my experience at Universal Studios Singapore was disappointing. The park is small and the entrance is quite expensive in relation to the number of attractions. With only 16 attractions, half of which are aimed at small children, diversity was limited. Even on a Monday outside the school holidays, waiting times were discouragingly long, ranging from 50 to 120 minutes for all rides, even the smallest children's roller coasters. The maintenance of the park left much to be desired. The paintwork outside was weathered and was in desperate need of a makeover. In addition, there were many broken elements on the attractions, from small defects such as TV screens in the queues to larger problems, such as defective robot dinosaurs on the Jurassic Park attraction. Unfortunately, all the attractions felt like inferior versions of similar attractions in other parks worldwide. Revenge of the Mummy felt like a cheap copy of Indiana Jones, and Battlestar was a disappointing imitation of Space Mountain, with the story being weak and ending before the roller coaster left the platform. In addition, the toilets were dirty, the food was expensive and the staff seemed to make little effort to deal with queues efficiently. Platforms were chaotic and staff were unfriendly several times. It seemed like little attention was paid to improving the overall experience. In short, I had hoped for an enjoyable visit to Universal Studios Singapore, but unfortunately the feeling prevails that not enough care and attention is paid to the park. Hopefully improvements will be made in the future to improve the visitor experience.

Currently at 1h 40 mins waiting in line for transformers. We will probably manage 2 rides today in total. There is literally NO warning what the waiting time is for each ride. You keep thinking the next corner is the last but they have just hidden the queue in lots of different rooms. If you only have a day or two to enjoy Singapore, dont spend it in line here.

Extremely overcrowded. Each attraction had a minimum waiting time of 45 minutes, some an hour or more. The Express Pass lane was equally busy for most of the larger rides. Not worth the price, especially when you come with a small child (ours is 2)

Poor row management Officials neglected to allow Chinese tours to overtake the queue. And then I couldn't handle it. Let the people in the correct line fight over it. Once inside, the place is a bit small. Running the queue on some machines is fast. Some machines are slow. Mummy is very fun. Must try.

3.review_text: Showing clear signs of ware and tear esp in Singapore's tropical climate. No real rides unique to the park and zero local influence aside from food. Crowded but staff maintain order, some rides with single queues. Didn't love and left within 2 hrs as a solo traveller had done it all. Easy to get to and it is a bit of a walk from the MRT if you factor that into your day.

Compared to few years ago, the list of attractions and ride is now smaller, waterworld was not on, but somehow the queues were quite ridiculously long plus now with the mere 7 hours of opening, there's no way to finish the park.
