If it comes to a point that to enjoy the park entirely, you must buy the express pass which is literally paying the equivalent of another full price ticket just to finish all the rides, then in the first place what is the meaning of getting normal tickets at all? Say For a normal family of 4 who wants to enjoy the park fully, they will have to spend close to say SGD720 (including express passes) for a 7 hour session........?! This is assuming that they don't even take time for meals at all. The app wasn't accurate as well - we went to queue for a ride that said 20 min wait, but halfway into the queue, the physical signboard was changed to say 50 min while the app still said 20 min. Mel drive in burger only was 16 bucks but some Mcdonald gourmet burgers are bigger, juicier and better. And there were only 4 selection of burgers, a terribly limited menu. The pizza place was selling a large pizza at 50 bucks!!! I get that food in there is expensive, but it has gone ridiculously off the chart. Did we enjoy it? My girl who leveraged on the single rider lanes whenever they were opened went a few times on certain rides. But it wasn't possible to be able to experience everything. She was happy, but to me who's seen the park during the hey days with more rides yet somehow more time to cover most attractions, and food that were already expensive but still had some standards back then... nah, I think there are better places to spend the money. This was on a Thursday, school holiday yes but surprisingly, more tourists than locals. But I guess it would still be a magical experience for first timers or kids who are still relatively new to theme parks.

Rides are thrilling and fun but major problem is the operating time which is very short 11am to 6pm,so its best to have express pass otherwise you cannot ride more than 3-4 rides due to hot climate and time constraint. I went there on weekdays, and most of the eating places were closed, and the queues were very long with waiting times of 30-120 min, which is so much frustrating for a maximum of 2-3 min ride...

It was ok. Queuing to get in was not great. If youre staying on Sentosa Island then I guess its worth it for something to do but I wouldnt travel from Singapore for it. Park tickets werent too bad but expect to pay a fortune for food & drinks (it was expected as its a theme park). Was surprised that after a certain period (20 minutes I think) you then need to start paying for lockers which Ive never experienced before and obviously as you will be queuing for rides then it will cost you extra. On the whole an ok day but wouldnt rush back.

I'm spoiled as I've been to Orlando Florida many times. This park is tiny and is spoiled by queue jumping by large groups who hold the line at each ride and allow their group to push towards the front, the staff don't stop them. If you've been to California or Florida then you will be disappointed with this park, but if this is your first Universal trip and you happen to already be in Singapore then it's worth a visit.

4.review_text: Overall, it's quite cheerful. Some of the service staff look tired and world-weary. 3-4 of the rides are super exciting and fun. The food in the restaurant is OK. The service staff is short-staffed and it's hard, so the tables are a bit dirty and you have to use wet wipes. Organize your desktop. There are few things in the souvenir area.

Pricey tickets with rather long queue. Meals are overpriced and need improvement in food quality. I brought a friend and she queue for 45min and had to pay 4 for locker. Pls consider 60min free locker and avoid charging visitors 4. Another 3 kids paid for ice cream 10 each, and discarded saying the taste was bad. Its that yellow color flavour with black cone.

Studio is good but seen same rides at Imagica. Worst experience was with rides waiting time and lockers. Every time you need to deposit your things at locker either keep one of family members out and give them all your bags. Transformer ride waiting time was 120 minutes, all of energy drained out while waiting. You cannot enjoy whole park then unless you are having express entry for which you need to cough out 10000 extra per person apart from entry tickets . Next time if I will be going to Singapore, it will be a big No

I really enjoyed this place but I was extremely devastated by the waiting time of the transformers ride. I waited about 2 hours and there was still a long path ahead. I think I saw more people come out than go in for the ride. It felt very unprofessional and what about the elderly? This place is good but their prices are exorbitant and they charge more for express rides to get to rides faster but that queue is also pretty long. Waiting a long time for rides that are 5 to 10 minutes or even less is very time consuming. Now coming to the parts I did enjoy, the mummy ride was incredible. It was an indoor roller coaster ride. I liked the details put into the ride from the mummy movies. It would have been 5 stars if the queue was significantly shorter. Recommended if you want to experience this place and you can buy the express tickets. If not, it is pretty much impossible to explore most of the rides. If we wait too long for one ride, we can't explore the others.
Queue too long for rides

5.review_text: Went here during peak season (school holiday in Singapore) so the park was really packed. We have to wait almost half an hour just to enter the park itself, and queueing for at least 1 hour for each attraction. But the park & attraction are reallg nice. Many food options, and the facilities are great.

Hot and busy - as expected during the school holidays but the weather held up which is most important! **Note to management** I've been to USS numerous times over the years but noticed recently that the queue cutting at the rides is becoming more frequent. Unfortunately each time it appears to be from the same group of visitors that flagrantly cut the Q. Perhaps this can be addressed somehow to make it more enjoyable for everyone. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

i've been to USS before and the queues were extremely long but i went a day ago and i really was surprised. the longest waiting time was for jurassic world which was 30 minutes while every other ride was 5 minutes and some didn't even have queues. sadly the cafes closed at 5:30 but still had the best time!! highly recommended

Its a fun place to be, suggest to buy express pass to avoid ling queues and waiting time, make sure to check weather before buying tickets as if it rains all outdoor rides are closed and it creates rush on all indoor rides too....
Loved the place, those who love the thrilling rides are must go. I bought an express ticket which helped in less waiting time and short queues due to which I enjoyed more rides in less time.

1.review_text: Without a doubt, of all the parks I have visited, this has been the worst in its classification as an experience. Negatives: -Up to more than 2 hours to get on an attraction. -Few bathrooms. You can pee waiting to get on an attraction. -The shows are poor and a bit boring. -Junk food and very expensive. Nor do they offer hardly any healthy food. -The park is not too big. -The park gets boring every time you have to wait. -Tremendous sounds from the expanding minions construction. -The operation of the lockers in some attraction creates a queue instead of making it simple and speeding up the process. -It closes too early and even if you go very early you will have a lot of waiting to get on the attractions. Even the simplest. -Too many people. The amount of people inside the park is overwhelming. -Bad organization by the park management. -Little variety of attractions and a bit old. -The que on after close park to take train its so long. Positive aspects: -The park is decently well-kept and there is no trash on the ground. -It is very easy to navigate. -If you like photography, it offers beautiful views with all the props and decorations. -The design of the park is beautiful. -The pets for kids. -Variety stores. In summary: I do not recommend visiting this park for the price of admission at the moment. It' boring cuz you have to wait a lot and everything is very slow. The shows are not good enough. Recommendations: -They should give a wake-up call to the entire management responsible for the park. It has many things to improve. -Its a bit scam to pay and not be able to enjoy. You can feel a bit frustrated or angry. -The number of people per day must be less so that the waiting lists at the attractions are not so long, although that means having to reserve the ticket time before. -The express pass is too expensive, 88 normal prize express (more than 100) so its around 200 each. Better separate the normal prize and the express. -Lower the price of food and improve the quality of food. -This park should add Singapour part that represent the culture and history of the country with nice rides and shows about country. I don't recommend waste your money in this park if you have in your priority list. July 2023.

I recently visited Universal Studios in Singapore with my family and close family members with high hopes of an unforgettable day filled with excitement and adventure. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by one glaring issue: the absurdly long queues. It's disheartening to say that my overall impression of Universal Studios was one of frustration and disappointment. Upon arrival, it was immediately evident that the park was overcrowded. The lines for popular attractions stretched endlessly, resembling a never-ending labyrinth of waiting. It felt like the park management had completely overlooked the importance of efficient crowd control and guest satisfaction. Even with a carefully planned itinerary, I found myself spending the majority of my time (more than one or 2 hours)standing in lines rather than enjoying the attractions. It was disheartening to see families and children growing increasingly tired and restless while waiting for their turn, dampening the excitement that should have been synonymous with a theme park visit. To make matters worse, the queuing experience was poorly managed, resulting in excessive wait times that far exceeded any reasonable expectation. I understand that popular attractions will naturally attract larger crowds, but the sheer lack of organization and inefficiency at Universal Studios was astounding. As a paying customer, I expected a more seamless experience. I had eagerly anticipated immersing myself in the magical world of Universal Studios, but instead, I spent most of my time standing in line, growing increasingly disillusioned by the minute. I sincerely hope that Universal Studios addresses this significant issue and takes steps to improve their crowd management system. The park's reputation and the satisfaction of its visitors are at stake. Until then, I cannot recommend Universal Studios to anyone seeking a hassle-free and enjoyable theme park experience. In conclusion, my visit to Universal Studios was marred by interminable queues, overcrowding, and a lack of organization. The park failed to deliver on its promise of a thrilling and magical adventure, leaving me and my family with a sense of regret and frustration. Unless significant improvements are made, I would caution others against wasting their time and money at Universal Studios.

I had the worst experience at Universal studios Singapore ! It was over crowded to the extent that every other ride had a wait time of 1.5-2.5 hours ! The arrangements for the wait areas were pathetic, if they expect these many people they should atleast make the whole waiting area air conditioned ! It was hot & humid in the queuing areas with a very few fans and people were literally dying of heat ! The park should limit the number of people allowed so everyone can enjoy who has paid this much amount to get a ticket. The people with express ticket obv had an edge at the expense of people with regular tickets, but the express ticket prices are ridiculous ! We were only able to get on 2-3 rides in the whole day and kids were exhausted and bored due to long queues. Many food courts were closed and the ones that were available had average food, out of stock and priced at a level of fine dine ! It was supposed to be a fun day but turned out to be a torture !

First World Country, third world service .monday when with my family . Was shocked to see so many tourists . When in and found out so many ride have so call technical issues , and out . Therefore all visitor rush to the remaining 4 ride . We queue for 2:30hrs for the transformer ride. After that, go to lunch, too crowded too. When to other rides, was told the same reason. Since USS already know the ride got problem .why you didn't announce b4 hand. And still sell your ticket at full price . This is cheating your customer . The CEO OF USS. You should resign ok. I already send feedback to USS and demand a full refund. Omg this think cannot happen and yet it does.

Worst experience ever.. So so long queue for a single activity. You end up with standing in queue for two to three hours for a single ride. Like transformer, 4D. Jurassic world. Don't like the arrangement and management for crowd control... Poor very poor..

2.review_text: Normally a great place to visit, but was frustrating this time. The park was full (express tickets sold out), and with only 11-6 opening hours and 100minute ride queues, it was impossible to enjoy even half of the rides. The single rider queue was used by families and groups, and despite reminders from the staff, they still were allowed to do this. Prices for food and drinks from the carts were just extortionate too.

One of the worst experience I had so far. It was poorly managed and taken care of since almost every rides I queued up were somehow had technical problem. I lined up for the Revenge of Mummy for almost two hours, and when it was my turn, it was closed due to some issues and we had no choice other than give up and wasted my two hours. However, some rides were fun but it still did not compensate for the negative feelings I had. So, if you plan to visit here, don't expect too much from it. And I would say you don't have to waste a whole day like me since you can enjoy most of the attractions with less than 30 minutes wait time when the park is about to close (I got to get on three rides in a role around 5PM) Friendly reminder: You are required to keep your bags in a provided locker for most of the rides.

Planning for a five-day trip in Singapore, we had to squeeze Universal Studios in our schedule. We managed to go on a Saturday morning arriving shortly after 11 am, which is the opening time. The first attraction we went to was Transformers: The Ride. By the one-hour mark we noticed that the closer we got, the further we actually were. By the two-hour mark we noticed the people ahead of us were leaving, and we followed since there was still a long line ahead. I saw kids sitting on the floor waiting in the queue. Some were napping in their parents arms. For a "family-friendly" you would expect a better arrangement for children. When we left we saw that most rides had a long queue of one hour. We finally found a short rollercoaster ride with a waiting time of 20 minutes. It is such a disappointment that an 80 SGD ticket got us on one ride, and an express ticket would be an additional 100 or so. By the time we wanted an express ticket, they were sold out. So by 4 pm, we only managed one ride. Universal studios is a beautiful space. If you want to just walk around, then this is the place for you. If you want to hop on rides, splurge on an express ticket.

The park is still under construction and I didnt like how staff insisted on people using lockers and waiting in a que in the heat without any water for long periods of time, even metal detecting on one ride and they were quite rude about having to empty pockets ect. When there were boxes for things the other side when entering the ride and seeing people get on rides with their backpacks- surely its up to the consumer whether we use the locker facilities or use the boxes at the side of the ride so we can keep our water and food with us. Found this unusual for a theme park and quite rude. Let your customers decide!!! Otherwise a good day out, lots of ques.

spent 95% of our time queuing at rides, and still only managed go take 4 rides. no shows watched as time wasnt enough. it opens at 11 am, we were there by 12. Average waiting times for the rides we took were between 1 hr to 2 hrs. probably better to go there on a weekday, or buy express pass in advance (express passes may get sold out fast on weekends) ive been here many times, and i must say, this time it felt like they just want to maximize their profits. its just too overcrowded everywhere you go you smell body sweat or peoples breath from being too close with everyone else. food prices overly priced e.g. a 0.90 ice cream at fairprice costs 5 here (solero), can of soda for 5. my legs hurt from hours and hours of standing in queue, whilst the rides only took a few minutes.

3.review_text: Rides are awesome but long queues and unfortunately few good rides were cancelled because of technical difficulties. I think they should take limited slots/people only on any day so that everyone who is entering the studios can happily enjoy rides rather than waiting long and cursing for expensive entry ticket. Technical difficulties must be compensated with extended ride hours with lost/delayed hours or through refunds to be fair to customers. Some staffs were racists to some community rides who were taking a ride(disappointed) and they made them wait.

11:00-18:00 is not enough time when you have to queue 100-120 minutes on some rides. Youll get lucky when a few rides dip to 15-30 minutes. The park used to be open for a longer duration. That also meant you could wait til later in the evening when the wait times were drastically reduced. We came here 5 years ago and today I dont think we saw a single big new ride. The Transformers ride is super outdated. I know theyve got Minions and Mario in the works so definitely better to wait until theyre available before visiting again. Was disappointed Water World was still unavailable. Overall, disappointing and expensive. Will save up for a trip to US Japan instead. On a positive note, staff were friendly, happy and helpful.

Very small, many people, attractions with hour-long queues in which only 10 people enter at each turn... Poorly designed for large crowds. Well-designed attractions keep wait times minimal, but there is only one like this in the park: the mummy attraction in the Egypt section. (Many "cars" and many people per "car" but without affecting the sensations, out of 10). The food is expensive (to be expected) but they serve it incredibly quickly and it's not bad (not Michelin star, but edible). If you are considering going, ask for the Universal Express ticket or die of despair in endless lines...

Visited today and due to heavy rain, all outdoor rides were closed for a long period in the morning. Queues to rides were mostly 80 minutes, but up to 180 minutes for the best roller coaster. Frequent technical problems closed/emptied the Mummy ride several times during the day. Too many people and too long queues everywhere. The park has a very short opening time, 11-18. Also dont recommend the diner, no beef burgers, fries were not good. Stressful environment with loud buzzes when orders were ready. I would not book a visit to the park in advance, you need to check the weather forecast before deciding to go.

Universal studios Singapore is a must visit if it's your first time to any such type of theme parks. Otherwise can SKIP. * Does not have anything new to explore. The same old rides and shows. *The wait time is very exhausting. Imagine waiting 120 minutes to sit in a ride of 60 seconds! *The express tickets are not worth it at all. *If you are with the kids, the height issues will not allow you to enjoy all rides. * Food is over rated and too heavy on the pocket. *Struggle to find route to the universal studio if you are not taking Sentosa express, as there are no sign boards to help you through. * As Singapore is very hot especially in summers, they could arrange some system to provide relief from the heat when they have shows in an enclosure, like in the Shrek show. *What is the purpose of a few rides like treasure hunt is a mystery. Utter waste of time.

4.review_text: The rides were awesome even though there is a lot of people. But the problem that some people had overcome was that some people that is queueing seems to not pay attention. What I mean by that is that these people did not follow the queue properly and froze like a statue where there is a big gap between these people and the queue in front on of them. Whereas there some kids that get some people on nerves as they left the queue but they went in back and go to their previous position of the queue. I mean they are cut queueing!

I have very mixed feelings about this place. On the one hand, it is a well-made amusement park where you can spend a nice day. On the other hand, you must remember that to use a given rollercoaster you have to stand in the scorching sun for at least an hour. When it's our turn, the person is so drenched in sweat that there is no pleasure in the ride. In my opinion, it's worth coming here, but don't expect a crazy day in queues.

Decent sized newish looking universal with some fun rides and decore. The queues on a Tuesday were herendous. Picked up express single use passes in morning and there was surge pricing at 90 a ticket. (Was 70 a few days earlier). Went on about 7 rides, and altho we did manage to save a lot of time in queues, wasn't sure is it's worth that kind of premium. I think maybe 50 is more reasonable for the single use express and maybe double that foe the unlimited as I don't see how they police it from being shared around groups of friends. Didn't see a single character all day. And it bucketed down in rain 3 times for extended periods. We got soaking wet. Even after buying an umbrella there. There is some cute merchandise at the shops. The meals we had there is at least double the cost of normal restaurants outside and not very tasty. Was it fun yes. But it is an expensive day out. It is also super hot. Well singapore is in general. Guess the rain was good for cooling it down. The metro line to get out of sentosa was super long as well if u leave around park close.
The queque is to long so we only enjoyed few attraction in there. We enter -around 10:00 singapore time until closed only got 3 rides
Visited during new year, & it was super crowded. Even after taking express pass had to wait for 15-20 mins for each ride.

5.review_text: Visited on last Friday, it was my third time to be there, thought it will be very packed due to previously faced crowds, queuing at the entrance is long but queue move very fast, waiting hour shown at the app is not accurate, encourage to check it physically at the station, luckily not bought express ticket; Minion theme will be opened in 2024, replacing Madagascar theme

Universal studios is one of the most attractive and expensive place in Singapore.this is my 2nd visit at universal studios.I would like to advise, if anyone go there in weekend try to buy express tickets to avoid long queues.otherwise not enough time to explore all the rides due to long & long queues. I wasted my five hours plus time for following queue (I didnt buy express tickets )in future i will buy express ticket and some dry food for save money. Thanks.

note - weekends queue is high If you are in singapore, Sentosa is a must. if you visit sentosa, universal studio is a must Would suggest to go earlier around 11. Better to have lunch on the way since inside USS, food is pricey. We went around 11.45 and covered these. 1. Transformers - just wow (1 hour queue time) 2. Outside Roller Coaster - Scary but must try (30 min queue time) 3. Roller coaster inside Pyramid - Outside roller coaster experience darkness (20 min queue time) 4. Jurasic Park water boat journey- don't miss that 5. 5D (as I remeber) movie in the far far away land - nice way to finish your USS journey For the pyramid and outside roller coasters you have to keep all the loose items in one of the lockers outside. better to keep the phones also for those two
Fun. It is definitely the worst to visit at least once. If you plan to visit more attractions - buy express enter tickets. Queues are really long
This is a must-visit place in Singapore. But always remember, there is a long queue every day. They told us there is a waiting of 30 minutes but it took us 2 hours in the queue.

1.review_text: Worst experience.. long queues . Rides breakdown after long long waiting . Bad management .. wastage of money ...
a lot of people, queues to each attraction after 40-60 minutes. piston. some attractions were closed. not many attractions. profit over customer satisfaction. I do not recommend.

Worst place in Singapore. Need to wait 2 hrs for each attraction. No sitting places, mismanagement, no good facilities and exorbitant prices of everything. More than 5 hrs into the park and managed only 2 rides. Total waste of money and time.

Rating: I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore with high hopes for an exciting and memorable day. However, my experience left much to be desired. Despite purchasing express tickets to expedite entry, the reality was far from what I expected. My visit began at 11:30 AM, right after the park's opening at 11:00 AM. With a limited operating window of 7 hours (11:00 AM to 6:00 PM), I anticipated being able to enjoy a significant number of attractions. Unfortunately, this was not the case. The express tickets, which I paid an additional 90 Singaporean dollars for, were meant to reduce wait times. Regrettably, they did little to alleviate the problem. The queues for express ticketholders were disappointingly long, often resulting in wait times that rivaled those of the regular lines. This defeated the purpose of investing in express tickets and left me feeling frustrated. Out of the 15-18 attractions available, I was able to experience only 4-5 due to the time constraints and the extensive wait times. Spending over an hour in line for just one attraction felt like a waste of both time and money. With only 7 hours to explore the park, it's clear that Universal Studios Singapore needs to prioritize queue management and optimize the use of express tickets to ensure that visitors can make the most of their time. While the park's ambiance and themed areas were impressive, the overall experience was marred by the operational issues. It's evident that the current approach to managing crowds and queue times needs a major overhaul. I hope that Universal Studios Singapore takes this feedback seriously and takes steps to improve the visitor experience, especially for those who have invested in express tickets. In conclusion, my visit to Universal Studios Singapore fell far short of expectations. The limited operating hours, inadequate queue management, and ineffective use of express tickets resulted in a day that was more frustrating than enjoyable. As a visitor who paid extra for a seamless experience, I can't help but feel disappointed by how things turned out.

Money making industry that exploits customers to the max. Repeat last minute cancellations of rides after long waits. Long waits which are exhausting for children most rides had an hour to 3 hour wait time and this was at no particular peak time. No forewarning regarding cancellation or wait times. Do not waste your moneys theres plenty more to do in Singapore go to the zoo, water parks, temples, restaurants, shopping malls that have epic parks. The biggest waste of money and can barely an experience.

2.review_text: Visited on a weekday, arrived before 11 - but still couldnt do more than a few rides because of the insanely long wait times. Theyre only open 11-6, and with an upto 2 hour wait time for a 2-5 minute ride - you can do 4-5 rides at max. They really need to extend their times at the prices they charge. To deal with the insane wait times, they expect you to buy an Express pass which costs more than the ticket itself. -Prepare to wait upto 2 hours for each ride -If you get your ticket from Sentosa, youll have to wait in other line and redeem them before you get in -Food is rather expensive -The transformers ride was quite nice, and the Shrek show was good too. Overall, I wouldnt recommend USS to anyone visiting - its just too exhausting having to wait hours for a quick ride

I don't imagine that my review will have much effect but hey. We were there on Sunday and you should perhaps calculate what you will see. The waiting time per ride is around 45-60 minutes for the more exciting roller coasters. People with priority tickets ruin the waiting time even more. This means that you might get 4-5 trips for your money and for the most part you just wait. The food in the restaurants is bad and expensive. The connection to public transport is pretty mediocre. Even for this you have to wait in line for an endless amount of time.

It is very disappointing to note that having brought tickets online that we still have to get a paper ticket and waiting for almost 90minutes in a queue this is very unfair and we also couldnt get express add-on as we were in the queue for so long. Having spend on tickets at SGD 82 each I felt they should have managed this differently.

This is my 2nd time to come here after at least 10 years. I think there were fewer people this time, yet the queueing seemed longer. And this was on a Monday, btw. They opened at 11am. We were there a few minutes past 11 and immediately went to the cyclon and human rides. Both were being tested and no assurance was given of being able to ride either. We went to transformers, it was closed. We then lined up for the Mummy and had to wait 100 minutes to get our ride. The ride itself was nice and exhilarating. The lonnnnnggggg wait was not. Cyclon and human were open by the time we finished the mummy but the waiting time was 2 hours! Single riders was not entertained either. No way! We were able to get to a jurassic ride, lights show, and then water world. Obviously, we wanted to experience more but the queueing time is such a downer. Had lunch in between. The hot weather does not help with the mood. They used to have water sprays back then. On our way out, we saw Panda mascot needing to be washed. For the price paid, the Universal Studio experience itself was a huge disappointment. It even failed to excite me to shop. Testing of rides should have been done before opening. Unavailable rides are also upsetting. Sadly, I'm most likely not coming back; nor am I likely to recommend this place. Does not seem to be value for money for me, and the "fun" aspect of being a theme park simply was not sufficient.

Queued to get in having already bought tickets online (good thing too as there was a big queue for those). Queued to get a wheelchair and our express unlimited bands. 1 hour gone already. Queued anyway in the express queues which for the amount we paid was a joke. There's a *serious* over capacity issue going on. For those without express tickets, the current waiting time for one ride is two and a half hours I kid you not. Might as well call it Universal Queue World. Won't be coming back.

3.review_text: They have tried to replicate the Disney land without being at all considerate about customers happiness. Reached the last ride 10 seconds over 6 minutes. The entry staff, Izdihar did not let us in. My parents are 55 and I requested him that they came running for this ride, please let them in. He did not. No other staff nearby to help you. After some argument, he passed on racial slurs on us and misbehaved with my mother when she requested him kindly. A day well spent, ruined at the last moment. I really loved how disciplined Singaporeans are, but they are certainly not kind people. We spent more than 5 hours just in long queues, but they were not kind enough to allow us even 10 seconds delay. For shame Singapore!

We visited on Monday 24 July with family of 4 and we were touring Singapore for just 3 days It was way too crowded for Monday Each ride wait time was 1 hour There was a power breakdown for 2-3 hours and few rides got reduced due to that and wait time for others got increased to 90-120 minutes Its a great place to visit , but tickets are oversold and for that price , it didnt feel worth it, skip the line tickets were sold out and we had no choice but do just few rides I wouldnt go there again in Singapore If you are going and have enough time and said Get there when it opens and based on crowd buy tickets in kiosk
Too much waiting time even in off season. Issue with the rides maintainence. No proper management

Horrible 1 . There was only ONE train for HUMAN. We have to wait for loading and unloading people. Even there are not so many people in the queue , we had to wait more than 2 hr which was longer than they told at 50 mins. Horrible 2 The stuntman show was postponed from 1.30 to 2.00 and when the time arrived at 2pm. It was cancelled without prior notice and annoucement. So many people were standing at the sun light!! Horrible 3. One chinese family tried to skip out queue and took the shortcut at the entrance and there is no any staff to manage the queue or assist. Horrible 4. Tranformers closed Good things Even lots of people are queue for mummies , the waiting time is shorter than expected and the line keeps moving not like HUMAN (20 mins for 5 metres)

Good but overcrowded with many attractions having around 80 min of waiting time. Food isn't that great, except for the fried chicken. The infrastructure for transports are great. However, peak hours for eating is the worst, there's not enough tables for all the customers! So you'll find yourself hunting for a table literally! I don't understand why they didn't think this through... so if you're not careful you can find yourself with your food, but without a table!

4.review_text: It was a school holiday. We arrived 30mins before the opening time and oh my there were extremely long queues waiting to proceed in. No bag checks were made this day. We only managed to play 6 rides from the start to the end of the day. The whole time we were queueing for 30mins to 2hrs and the ride of cos lasted for just a handful of mins. Rides were good. Weather was hot. Food was extremely expensive. 16 dollar for a bowl of noodles and the teriyaki fried rice at spacebot was disgusting. It tasted like burnt vege and it soaked through the bottom of the rice like puke. Even the kids did not like it. Overall, i would have loved to come and play all the rides without having to queue but guess thats just possible during a normal school day.

I shall say it is the place which attracts all visiting Singapore, but slightly overrated now. The crowd management is poor, although the rides and fun is good. Food choices should be more catering to the vast tourist population. One can't complete visiting all rides and places because the offer Express entry on paying extra (so preferential treatment to the affordable). They distinguish tourists into different classes which I personally don't appreciate. Some rides are dangerous so personal discretion is advised. The Shrek was a waste and needs to be replaced with something more attractive. More than 50 percent of the crowd wanted to be out in less than a minute and opened the emergency exits to get out. No one bothered to stay.

There were many visitors at the amusement park. We didn't get to enjoy all the attractions because of the long queue. If you're planning to go there, I suggest you buy a ticket in advance and purchase the express ticket. all in all it's been a wonderful experience

Good for first time visitors. But need to improve some new rides. Must buy Express pass to avoid queue each and every ride waiting period Minimum 90 mins during weekdays. Disappointed with transformer ride under maintenance.

Good theme park. It's busy, but that is to be expected. It would be better if the lineup estimate in the app was more accurate. It's not even close at times which makes it difficult to plan meeting up with the rest of your group.

5.review_text: Excellent marvelous but long queue and full tired after two rides waiting..very disappointed in the ticket counter system...we already purchased tickets but we wait for 2.5 hrs in the queue ...you can allow direct entry those who tickets already..please consider these points

Nice place for family holiday, but reconstruction of some attractions causes big queues on others. Cyclon roller coaster is the best one, but Transformers attraction is main star of the park. Shrek attractions is quite good for a kids, my nieces love that ones. Didn't ride on Mummy attraction, because my relatives saying that its quite scary, and i'm not really fan of horror and screamers. For better experience buy Express tickets, you can avoid quite big queues for expensive price, but on my opinion - that's for the best. Express tickets could be bought online only one day before visit.
Lovely place to visit always. Huge queues for rides though and half the attraction was closed or renovating which were the only two let downs.

super! We were on a super busy day, even on a Saturday. Apart from the first queue of more than 100 minutes (where the discouragement had now reached us) all the others were quite smooth. Too bad it's closing so soon! But it is precisely at the last minute that one must take advantage of it because many people already leave after 4pm. If you want to avoid queuing too much, definitely get tickets in advance, but also go there just before it opens.

The park is clean and spacious. Wish they could add more attractions. Restrooms are clean. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. (Book your ticket with Klook ahead of time to avoid long lines and for an extra 5%discount). I really enjoyed the Mummy and Transformers attractions.

1.review_text: We went there on a weekday and any of rides we wanted to try (e.g. Transformers, Jurassic Park, Mumies) required a minium of 1h wait. We managed to enjoy 4 different rides from 11am to 5pm. What is worse, the wait times displayed in the app are often completly wrong. E.g. When we joined the queue for Transformes the app displayed 20 minute wait time which turned out to be 80 minute wait time. There are no toilets availabe when you wait in the queue so 80 minute wait time might be a challange for some kids. Also, it was hard to find a table for lunch. The park feelt over capacity. The rides were enjoyable but if I had my time again I would skip this park. Not being able to enojy even half of the rides in one day is not acceptable.

Obviously oversold on the day we went there. We were there for 5 hours and only got to take 2 rides, the rest of the time was spent waiting in a queue. Ride wait times were nearly 3 times what was shown at the entrance, even express pass holders were waiting for an extended period of time. Food was expensive and poor quality. I have visited previously last year and 2017 and didn't face this issue but this visit to Universal Studios was a total waste of money and I wouldn't recommend the park to anyone until the overselling of tickets issue is resolved.

It's become bad now. Why open 11 to 6 ? When there is no way anyone can finish all the rides in the given time. This is my 2nd time and will not go anymore. The average wait time for mian rides were 60 to 90 mins. They should incense the operating hours

Park closes at 5pm youre lucky to get on 3 rides due to que times. There is an express ticket but sell out fast. Really not worth the visit unless you enjoy standing in a Que for over an hour in 32 deg sun with young kids for every ride. Its absolutely not worth the ticket price. Much better things to experience in Singapore.
Bad experience i only rode for once cause there was a long queue and it took us 3 hrs to get in a ride. And it only opens at 11am-6pm ? It's not worth it.

2.review_text: This place doesn't have enough attractions for the amount of visitors it gets. Most attractions are at least 1-1.5hr long queues and there's about 10 of them? We were stuck waiting in one because the ride was down. Close to the beginning of the queue and we just left after 30mins of further waiting. They did give us the option of waiting or leaving but we should have gotten an express pass to another ride imo Whole ticketing thing was stupid too. We bought tickets at the train station going to sentosa island. Got lined up at the gates, 1hr goes by and we're told these aren't tickets to enter, they're tickets to get entry tickets so we had to line up at a different place again for about 1hr. Frustrating to say the least. If you want to actually enjoy this place then an express pass is a must. It's actually funny that a taxi driver we had a couple of days later told us Sentosa Island sucks. He and all the other drivers had an acronym for Sentosa

Hmm, its a tricky review to write as I was really looking forward to visiting universal studios at sentosa island. However, I felt a bit underwhelmed by the experience for what is quite a small park. Ive visited many attractions like Thorpe park, Alton towers, Chessington in the UK, but Universal just felt super crowded with very little to offer. I was fine with the idea of spending a whole day at the park, but the queues for the rides were just unrealistic. 150 minutes for Cylon, 120 minutes for transformers, 100 minutes for revenge of the mummy and 60 minutes for both canopy flyer and rapids adventure. The express pass is an ABSOLUTE MUST to get anywhere near doing these rides in one day especially as the park is only open from 11-6. Food was good which was a plus point although drinks were on the tad expensive, generally a very expensive resort which I felt was not value for money.

Too expensive for what it is. Only 2 interesting attractions, interior decor that leaves something to be desired, poor queue management, mandatory lockers that become payable after a certain period of time (except for the rapids where you have to pay immediately), 20 for a hot dog, small park... Only positive points: good animation with characters and the fact that the park becomes deserted from 3 p.m.
The whole day was spent waiting in line. It's way too crowded and most of the rides are really short. It's really not worth it. You wait even with the fast pass

Apparently, Universal Studios have a quota for the number of people entering. When we got to the ticketing office, they had a sign there saying quota has been reached and they will not be admitting any more people. This was around 10-11am.

3.review_text: They admit too many people inside causing queues so long that you would find it worthless to ride anything. The lowest waiting times for normal tickets are about 120 minutes for each ride, and you have to stand in congested queues which form in a snake-like pattern

Meh. Ive been to both U.S. parks. This has some unique rides that were fun. Battlestar Galactica (cylon side), Jurassic Park (way better version than U.S. parks), and Puss N Boots. This park would get a higher mark, except they are TERRIBLY inefficient at ride loading. Battlestar Galactica was a painful wait (even with the express pass) because they only used one train. Even with an express pass, while the standby line was at 70 minutes, it still took 30 minutes. Its baffling to have one train on a popular coaster. I feel like this is done on purpose to upsell people on the express pass. Its made worse by lack of staff and a good 6-8 minutes between groups. At 16 people per ride, thats quite a large chunk of time to get through a queue that typically has 30 people queued in each line as they alternate filling a train from each line. Meanwhile, the Mummy with a 5 minute wait, had many more ride staff. They really ought to shift more resources from less popular rides to the more popular. You cant depend on the displayed wait times. They are NOT reliable. A ride with 30 minutes displayed was walk on. Another ride with 25 minutes displayed took 40. A ride with 5 minutes displayed took 15. Another ride with 25 minutes displayed was walk-on. Obviously Im not made at surprise walk on rides, but for people trying to plan their day and pack in as much as they can, reliable advertised wait times is the only way to do that. The food in the park is better than any food Ive seen at ANY theme park, except maybe DisneySea/Land in Tokyo. The park was also only open for 7 hours. Soon to be just 6 hours. Thats bizarre for a theme park and really makes you have to plan carefully if you want to fit it all in.

You spend more time queuing than playing but I guess that is normal for amusement parks. Tickets are expensive, limited and expensive food. Merchandise are expensive too. Most underwhelming thing would be the size of USS, it's minuscule. Since it is the only amusement park in Singapore, I guess I have to rate it at least 3/5 stars.

I had a great expectation while visiting Universal studio Singapore, but I got a little disappointed. Some of the attractions were out of service, like transformers. The only plus point I felt was the way it was built. I visited the area in a weekday, and in spite of that I was not able to enter into the attractions. The queue was very long in all the stations. The studio was built long back to accommodate less tourists. Now the tourism has developed and the crowd I enormous. I was not able to get the special pass too. So finally I got little disappointed.

If we didn't purchase the express line tickets, we would have only been able to ride a few rides in the limited time we had, however having the tickets we managed to ride most of the attractions. I visited here 7 years ago and very little has changed, no new rides so felt it was a waste of money, felt like there was unnecessary queuing for the amount of people in the park, some rides could have extra trains running to better manage the ride wait times, one ride was 3 hour wait time with very slow on and off boarding and 1 train running.

4.review_text: For large rides, locker rental is mandatory for bags (to be added to your budget) Food on site very expensive. Otherwise mascots, site for photos, several themes

I liked this theme park...well I'm quite disappointed as one of the important ride( Transformer) was closed for maintenance...In my opinion if you are taking money full then we should be able to attend all or we should get discount informing that its closed on open days.

The park, compared to those in Orlando, Florida, is small with fewer attractions. But that doesn't mean it's bad, quite the opposite, it's very immersive and is located on Sentosa Island, which is a spectacle in itself. The park's opening hours are a bit restricted (11am - 6pm) and since it sometimes rains and there are lines, I recommend buying the express ticket so you can skip the lines for the rides. I did this and I don't regret paying a little more. Otherwise, if you're in Singapore, it's worth going!

Be sure to use express. Since there aren't many attractions, there was usually a wait of about 50 minutes for popular attractions. I'm so tired of waiting but it's so much fun Water World was also good.

Excellent place and a visit for those who come to Singapore. Vibrant place but loaded with crowd for each ride. Need to plan better or sacrifice a few. Also the dry pads were not working which is essential to be in operative state when you are done with Jurrasic Park ride. Be ready to get soaked if not.

5.review_text: Great, it doesn't have too many people, like other parks of this type in other countries, if you want to take advantage of the day, buy the fast pass on the website, along with your ticket, you will save the huge queue at the entrance. The minion game was under construction, but all the stores sell a lot of merch at reasonable prices. The food inside the park is not very good, but it is worth spending a day at this place.

My visit to Universal Studios in Singapore was an exhilarating experience filled with thrills and excitement. The park offers a wide array of attractions that cater to various tastes and age groups. One standout attraction was the phenomenal Transformer ride, an absolute must-try for any visitor. The attention to detail and immersive experience truly brought the Transformers world to life. On the positive side, the park's themed zones were brilliantly designed, immersing visitors in different universes, from Hollywood to Sci-Fi City. The entertainment shows and live performances were engaging, adding to the overall festive atmosphere. Additionally, the convenience of booking tickets online and utilizing the express counter significantly reduced waiting times, ensuring more time to enjoy the attractions. However, the only downside was the occasional long queues, which is quite common for popular attractions. To make the most of your visit, I highly recommend booking tickets online in advance and opting for the express counter to bypass long queues. This allows you to maximize your time and enjoy a seamless experience at Universal Studios. Overall, a thrilling adventure that's perfect for fans of movies and theme park enthusiasts alike!

You should buy tickets in Thailand if you go to buy them at an event where there is a long line. There are a lot of play equipment. During festivals, some rides have long lines. There are many exciting and fun rides. But Singapore rains a lot.

I went there on a Sunday and there was a lot of people. I barely am able to play all the games I wanted even if I arrived at 11am. A few tips to all the people who are going there: 1. If you are going to play the Transformers Galactica roller coaster, go line up at once. I had to line up for 90 minutes even if I went there first. 2. Check if the rides require you to store your bag into the lockers. You have to requeue if you have to put your bags in the locker. 3. The queue for Revenge of the Mummy is very quick in later hours as there are multiple cars. 4. For all the lone wolves going to the USS alone, check if there's a single-rider line. As I went there alone, I saved a lot of time queuing. 5. Download the USS app. It is very helpful as it has a map and all the wait time. 6. Eating lunch in the Malaysian food court is quite cheap, so if you want to save money, consider going there. I was a bit disappointed as the Transformer 3D ride had an error and was closed when I went there. I wasn't able to play that. But overall my experience in there is quite good, and the staff are helpful and enthusiastic.

Must visit place in Singapore. The day we visited witnessed 3 shows and few rides because of crowd, if you're planning for Universal Studio all rides get express pass or it would take nearly half an hour for a ride.

1.review_text: It was the worst amusement park i have been to so far. We visited on a weekday in Oct 2023 when the park was hosting Halloween night in the evening. As such, they had changed It's timing to 10am - 5 pm so that it could sell separate tickets for Halloween of the same park from 6 pm. There are only about 15 rides including children's rides as such queue for each ride was huge. The average waiting time for each ride was nearly 60 minutes for general tickets (costing about 5,000/- INR) and 20 minutes for express pass (about 10k INR). The ride time was between 40 seconds to 2 minutes max. So we had to wait for an hour for a minute long ride. By 5:30 pm the staff started forcing people who didn't have Halloween tickets out of the park. Their entire focus was only on money unlike rest of singapore. Would never visit again.

Long queues are expected at theme parks but constant breakdowns adding more than 30mins to wait time, each breakdown are not acceptable, especially when the park only opened for 7 hours a day. There are no updates as to when the repairs will be done. This is just plain cheating customers of their hard earned money.

The way they estimated the waiting time for rides is horrendous. Hard to trust them when they wrote there 30 min which turned out to be more than an hour wait. Compared to the past where the left side of the park had Madagascar etc, now that entire part of the theme park is closed for development of Minion land. Easily 1/3 of the park closed up? And many shows were available like twice a day only and if u miss those timings then too bad for u. So end up u miss many shows and miss the 1/3 of the park, and I dont see the ticket prices being reduced by 1/3 the usual. Note last time Covid they closed the Shrek 4D show. Now its still closed. Used to go a restaurant just opposite Jurassic land. Food was quite good. I think discovery something. It was closed too! And as u walk everywhere in the theme park, many wagons/stalls were closed too. And sgp weather is scorching hot, every queue is minimally 30 min long on a Friday. PLEASE DONT WASTE MONEY BUYING ICE CREAM THERE. Within 5 seconds of buying your ice-cream, its already 1/4 melted and dripping down your hands. Within half min, I can say its a terribly messy sight and mood dampener. Buy ice cream if you want to spoil your day and stain your clothes. Walking around u can see frowns on everyones faces due to the heat and many staff wore frowns on their foreheads plus giving a rude and cold attitude. Oh please. How do u expect guests to enjoy if most of your staff look so grumpy.... I dont mean all staff though. Some were nice and friendly but really only a few in numbers. Overall, I wont go back unless there is 1/3 price reduction until the minion land opens and all the attractions/shows and stalls/restaurants open. Then I think its justifiable. P.S. standards of toilets are a far cry from what you can see in Tokyo Disneyland although Tokyo Disneyland is much older than USS.

We came on Wednesdays afternoon and at the first attraction there was a sign with 30minute waiting time. But we were waiting more than 1 hour with yelling and anoying kids. They stinked and were touching us all the time. Attraction sucked. Everything sucked. I DO NOT RECCOMEND U TO COME THERE!

Highest-grade Tourist Trap Going on a Friday, Saturday or Sunday is an absolute no-no. Wait times are 60 to 90 minutes for every ride and every ride is maybe a couple of minutes long? Ripoffs abound in all food and beverage as always. When we visited, some of the rides were closed for maintenance but nope you still gotta pay full price. Standing in the queues in Singapore's heat is probably nobody's idea of fun, especially not an overcrowded and poorly managed place like this. Do yourselves a favor and skip this garbage, visit the beach instead - much better - Singapore Luge is a masterclass in efficient crowd management.

2.review_text: Honestly the staff needs some training. Extremely rude staff. One guy from water world and a guy name Iran from jurassic Park. Seriously we are paying alot of money to have fun and last thing we need is attitude. To the moron at water world who said shut the umbrella.. idiot was there a sign no umbrella.. would gave him a earful but could not find him ... there is no need to be rude... BTW I'm 4th generation singaporean.. and this suck

Some areas of the park are under renovation. You probably only enjoyed 3/4 of the park. Unlike the USS in US or Japan, Singapore USS needs to improve alot. I have visited USS in Japan and US, they have the characters mascot seen everywhere and children enjoyed seeing and taking photographs. Singapore USS is so boring where I finished the whole park within 2 hours. I feel they should reduced the price since some attractions are under maintenance and some areas undergoing renovation. Very disappointing.

Very disappointed. I used to have a membership before COVID, it was my first visit after 3years, paid about 500 for 3 with the unlimited express pass. I was so disappointed to see so many shops and attractions closed or not in used: - all Madagascar segment in upgrade to host Minions - Lights, Camera, action was closed - Sesame Street was down for 1-2hrs due to technical issues - 3 rides cannot go with Express (including canopy flyer, Ferris wheel, Egypt) - lot of restaurant closed like food court around Jurassic world - many souvenirs shop closed like in Mummys ride or Jurassic World...

Wow. Super shocked by the overall attitude from the staff. Rude, not smiley, arrogant. This is a shame. Especially at the Dino Soarin. The staff was so rude and unfriendly that 2 arguments with guests happened (23 Oct morning). That's the last time we will come here, the Universal Studio at Osaka was wayyyy better.

If you compare it to Univa in Osaka, it's pretty boring... The park is only open from 10am to 5pm, and you can't ride the roller coaster rides unless you leave your luggage (not even a 10 bill) in a locker, and the staff member's attitude when pointing this out to me was terrible, which didn't make me feel very good. I guess I won't go anymore

3.review_text: In general was fun, but honestly not very efficient park in regards to queues - very slow big queues even when the park is not at peak. Staff very annoyed and unfriendly. A park you go once sand thats it - in comparison with thr parks i have been yet around the world i would rate it the worst.

Visited on a Tuesday/Wednesday as a non-resident. Pros: -No queue while buying admission tickets at the self-service kiosks with card payment (during my time of visit). -USS was very empty when I visited. No queues for any of the rides (during my time of visit). -Rides are maintained. Shrek 4-D was under regular maintenance during my visit. Downsides: -Very expensive for the same rides since I visited many years ago. SGD 82 per adult (online purchase or at the kiosks). -It's small.. there aren't too many rides and it didn't take long to finish walking around the venue.
They are a well set out park however the lines for most things can be 1 to 2 hours long. They also need better crowd management

Nice place but I'm disappointed. I waited in line for an attraction for an hour and they closed it right in front of me without giving me a specific reason. During this time, I saw that many carousels were not working. For this kind of money, this shouldn't happen. The whole arrangement is great, but I thought it would be bigger. Many attractions are closed, the castle is covered with a cloth... queues everywhere, food very expensive. I wouldn't go a second time.

The WOW factor was long gone, yet RWS still existed and persisted in clinging to the popular US Hollywood-themed aging rides to bring in the hoardes. If you think you wanted to give your parents a treat with a trip to USS, think again. Many of the rides involved hard twists and abrupt stops. The Mummy and Transformers are examples. Anyone with the slightest neck, backbone, problems, or vertigo. The youngsters may find the rides exhilarating. But anyone with the slightest neck, backbone, or vertigo should think twice, better off staying away. I am saying this at risk of incurring the wrath of SDC and flag waving locals. Clearly, I am not of the targeted customers' profiles. But SDC and RWS and Gentings should take note that Singapore is into a super aged era.

4.review_text: Had a great experience. Need to stop charging for locker when they are already charging so much for the tickets and express passes. Need to work on extending their closing time and if possible the opening time. It gets really hot in Singapore, starting off early would be more conducive.

A place for a fun filled day with family or friends! Pros: - Numerous activities & attractions - Rides are well maintained - Spacious for a number of tourist - Events around the clock around the park - Sufficient facilities - Good locker space - Surau available on site Cons: - Expensive food with so-so food quality - Long waiting time for those without fast pass (1-2 hours wait time) - Entrance can be quite crowded even early morning - Not a lot of benches to sit down

Its fun and has many various attractions though with short opening hours and having to wait say one attraction for say one hour so you do not have sufficient time to play most of the attractions. I think we queued at Transformers for over 1.5hours alone. I personally feel this place is not quite suitable for senior citizens due to the need to walk a lot and limited seating options with the crowd (we went around 11am on a Monday in October btw) as well as the long standing needed in queues.

Nice place to spend time, but even at off peak days plan your routes, as waiting times can be high to priority express tickets. We queued 2h 30 mins for transformers (exp. Queue time at entrance said 50 mins). No toilet in queues so my girlfriend almost exploded, some kids graduated school and I witnessed seveveral childbirths while waiting. The rides make up for it, though. The cylon ride is super fun!

I had the pleasure of visiting Universal Studios Singapore last week, and my overall experience was quite positive. One of the main demerit is in studios half of the potions are closed for under renovation Here's a breakdown of my review: 1. **Rides and Attractions (4/5):** The park boasts a wide variety of rides and attractions that cater to all age groups. I particularly enjoyed the thrilling roller coasters and immersive 3D experiences. However, some rides had long wait times, which can be a bit frustrating. 2. **Entertainment (4/5):** The live shows and performances were a highlight of my visit. The Waterworld show was especially impressive, with its stunts and special effects. The only downside was that show timings could be a bit inflexible. 3. **Theming and Atmosphere (4/5):** Universal Studios Singapore excels in creating a vibrant and engaging atmosphere. The attention to detail in the park's design is commendable, making you feel like you've stepped into another world. However, at times, it felt overcrowded, especially in popular areas. 4. **Food and Dining (3/5):** While there are numerous dining options, I found the food to be relatively expensive for the quality. It would be great to see more affordable and diverse food choices. 5. **Staff (5/5):** The staff at Universal Studios Singapore were incredibly friendly and helpful. They added to the overall positive experience and were always ready to assist with any questions or concerns. 6. **Value for Money (4/5):** Considering the entertainment and attractions offered, the ticket price is reasonable. However, additional costs for food and merchandise can add up quickly. In summary, my visit to Universal Studios Singapore was enjoyable, with thrilling rides, great entertainment, and friendly staff. While there is room for improvement in terms of dining options and crowd management, it's a fantastic destination for families and thrill-seekers alike. I'd give it a solid 4 stars out of 5.

5.review_text: A beautiful day. It was our third day in Singapore and we had already made the most suitable visits. The park is not large but is very well organised. We were on a cloudy weekend and this certainly helped to avoid having so many queues. I imagine that on holidays the waits can be exaggerated, given that there aren't that many rides. To take into consideration.

On my second visit to Universal Studios Singapore, I finally had the chance to fully enjoy the various rides and attractions within the park. Although the theme park isn't very large, some of the rides and performances were truly spectacular, leaving me wanting more. The most impressive experience was the Waterworld show, with its captivating atmosphere and remarkable sound effects. Of course, the 4D movies were also quite exciting. However, the only downside was the disappointing attitude of some of the park's staff. In a place filled with joy and laughter, it was strange to encounter staff members who appeared expressionless, lacking any smiles, and maintaining a stern demeanor. In fact, the behavior of some of the employees made visitors feel uncomfortable, which was truly regrettable.
Lovely place but hourly long queues for every ride. Make sure u buy express pass if u want to enjoy all the rides otherwise max u can do 5 rides in whole day...

I visited without a reservation according to the admission time, and fortunately, I was able to purchase admission tickets and express tickets on site. It was unfortunate that it wasn't very large and that there was construction going on in a few places, but thanks to the express ticket, I was able to enjoy various attractions without having to wait more than 10 minutes. Normally, the staff checks the express ticket once you use it, but if you enter at 10 o'clock, they don't do a separate check, so you were lucky to get on it. It is clear that it is a very well-made theme park.

I highly recommend buying an express ticket. I came on weekdays and the queue was amazing, especially for Transformers with a queue time of 1 hour . For operational hours 11.00 - 17.00 I think it's a shame that the time is up for waiting. If you want to buy an express ticket, buy it in advance, because when I wanted to buy it on the spot, the express ticket had already run out But it wasn't bad, I got 5 rides (Sesame Street, Transformer, Human, Cylon, and Mummy) and 1 show (Water World)

1.review_text: This is absolutely over hyped place and for SG82 is not worth at all. This is extremely so small and long queues for each and every ride. For most of the rides we have to wait for 60 to 90 minutes and for some rides wait time is 120 minutes. And the timings for this is 11am to 6pm. Most of the time will go on waiting in queues. If we need to avoid the queues, They sell express entry tickets which we have to purchase additionally which is another SG60 to SG90 which is not worth at all.

Today my second time to USS . And Today 13 november 2023 . Around 11am in dinosaur show , there is 2 girl staff is really really worst 1 girl wear braces , another one indian . Sorry i dont know their name . Waaaah really seems like they dont get attitude briefing ! Super super rude they are ignore me with their thumbs down ! . . I only i begging to take photo in last minute with my baby . I carry my baby they give change last change to another people not priority one . Hahaha Thats so bad experience . I come here for my birthday with my baby ! I swear i will never come back again to universal studio singapore ! I promise . !
Huge queues, no limit on the number of visitors, attractions break down
not fun at all and not worth money. you have to queue at least 40 mins. Nothing upgrade since my last visit 10 years ago

I was really looking forward to it and was very disappointed in the end. Not every amusement park is just for children. In my opinion, Universal Studios in Singapore does. The park is very small and the attractions only appeal to children. As an adult you can really save yourself the visit. For children, however, it is certainly a unique experience.

2.review_text: Awful experience. 1/4 - 1/3 of the park is closed Probably due to the new Minion attraction which would only be completed in 2024. Yet we are being charged full price for only 2/3 of the service. And speaking of service, Terrible customer service!! i'm ashamed to find out the attitude of the staff is so bad. I would assume the staff being Singaporean would have been be better educated. it really shames me being a Singaporean. what happens to "Excuse me Sir/Mdm"? the 1 ride that really piss me, was at Sesame street, apparently there's a booster seat on 1 of the back row seat of the cart, i try to remove it, unaware that i wasn't suppose to do so . no staff usher me to the cart nor advised me not to do so. then 1 of the attending staff, tall, lanky and bespectacled , actually told me off in a stern and rude manner" don't remove it!, don't touch that, move to the front row". i'm old enough to be his dad, where's the basic courtesy? Management of Universal Studio, you seriously have to relook at the coaching of the staff. On a general note, I observed that 70% of the staff displayed poor customer service. They portrayed a aura of being disgruntled and have no sense of belonging to Universal Studio. I feel really bad as a Singaporean as this isn't the Singapore experience that I would like our foreign visitors to witness. Genting RWS, I understand that you are expanding but before that, pehaps relook to the education of the staff and more walking of the gound by management. 2 stars for the remaining staff which didn't makes it a total disappointment for my family and me.

visited Universal Studios Singapore today and I have to admit, I was left more disappointed than content. The themes and activities were very well planned, and as parents, my partner I were impressed with everything there was to see and do for us and our 3-year-old. However, the relentless humidity and heat made waiting in the long queues quite unpleasant. On a positive note, the staff were excellent and very helpful; we didn't encounter any unhelpful staff throughout the park. Our biggest disappointment came when we tried to grab some food. Unfortunately, all the food outlets had a technical issue and couldn't accept card payments. We didn't have any cash on hand, and without food, both our toddler and we couldn't fully enjoy all the rides and attractions. It's disheartening to know that a massive establishment like Universal Studios couldn't resolve a technical issue or organize an alternative for its visitors. At this point, I'm not sure if we'll be returning. It's frustrating that such an issue could significantly impact our experience. I hope that Universal Studios Singapore takes steps to address these kinds of technical glitches in the future to provide a more seamless and enjoyable experience for its visitors.
Honestly, never ever come to this Place without Express Pass. I come when Non Peak Season on Tuesday, still wait for more than 45 minutes on every Rides. Very bad experience
Unfortunately, many attractions were out of service and the staff were impolite.

I expected more from Universal Singapore. Universal could have at least tried to compete with Disneyland, otherwise it would be a disgrace. Park was upset because she wasted time and money on it. For me, the Dutch Efteling is currently the leader among the parks I have seen, where the guys did their best both in terms of emotions and scenery.

3.review_text: I was left with mixed feelings. Park is generally fun, attractions are good and were pretty surprising in a positive way. Zones are well designed and don't look fake. Staff is professional as well. Queues were not long, so we were able to visit almost everything (some of attractions multiple times). What was disappointing is the food - relatively expensive, poor choice, bad quality. Soft ice cream was crunchy because it's over frozen. Overall eating here felt like rip off. Another big issue (might be local specifics, since we met similar problem at the hotel) are visitors. Around 60% of them belong to specific group that probably got to the park on a donkey straight from their remote village. Meaning they do not understand personal space, queues and personal hygiene. I personally get annoyed being around such type of people, but might be my personal view. So probably overall if you approach it smart - eat a lot before, take some snacks and go to attractions early or before closure, it could be a great experience. Otherwise you will be half exited half annoyed.

Just ok, nothing special.. ticket about 900 sgd.. i come on saturday.. open until 5 p.m only.. so sad! By the way if you exit on 5.p.m the queque of the train back is really long.. hahaha.. so sad too.. so many renovation while i come visit universal studios on 4th of november 2023

The theme park is super well decorated like all of the group's. The problem is that it was summer and the number of people was horrible. More than 1 hour per attraction. It's a shame we couldn't make the most of our day. At the last minute, people drop out a lot and we were able to ride more or less 2 attractions with a 15-minute queue. The food is very expensive, much more than in other universal

I went to Sentosa Island on Saturday and Monday. It's crowded on Saturday because it's the weekend and there are too many people. I visited again on Monday and entered Universal and tried the rides, but I was a little disappointed. The ride time felt short and it was less thrilling than the ones in Korea....

On weekend will be full and need to buy express ticket for additional sgd 90. The good things only transformer, dinosaurus, and some ride. Another show is.... Just meh. Not much fasility for eldery person (u can rent 50 for motor vehicle which are very limited).

4.review_text: Amazing park! All attractions are top quality and merchandise are good too. They loose a star purely due to the attitude of the staff. For a place that attracts many children, they are absolutely rude and short with us whenever we asked basic questions. We are only asking questions because your app didn't work, curtly telling us to read the app does not help anybody, not to mention their sour expressions the entire time. Not all staff were like this, for example the performers and some people on the rides were absolutely fantastic, however majority were very rude and ruined the mood for us.

I went to the park on a Tuesday, they opened at 11 am. Bought the ticket at the park entry and asked if it will be busy today. The lady at the cash desk told me that there is no waiting time as the park just opened so decided not to get the additional fast pass ticket which was a good idea. There was no waiting time in the morning for the rides and if its busy the fast pass ticket can be bought afterwards in the park (which I didnt as I left at around 3 pm when it became crowded). Stayed 4 hours and did several rides, the mummy ride is the best in my opinion. The park is clean and I liked the food there. The park can not be compared to the one in the US but its definitely worth a visit.

When in Singapore and you are a tourist with kids then this place has to be on the top list to visit. Came here on a Monday so it was not as packed. The lines for the attractions and rides wait was only 15 minutes in the beginning but went to 50 mins at its peak then by the afternoon went down to 10 mins. Got soaked on the Jurassic Park ride. The roller coasters were the best. But managed to ride about 10 rides from 11am to 5pm. Its smaller on the smaller side for Universal studios but well worth the price for the thrills. Went here 10 years ago and it still doesnt fill run down.

Small park but we had fun seeing all the shows and riding the rides. What I didn't like was having to check things in a locker before going on certain rides. One ride broke down so we didn't get out in time and had to pay for the locker. The lockers should be free of charge since you pay a high entry fee.

This is a nice theme park. It's quite small compared to Universal Studios Orlando but still nice. A big chunk of the park is currently closed as they're converting the area to Minionland. My family loves the Minions and is really looking forward to seeing it when I opens. Most of the park is well maintained, but some of it looks a little run down....especially the Shrek area (Far Far Away). There are a few really good rides here. I especially like the Revenge of the Mummy and the Human/Cylon rollercoasters. You need to empty your pockets for those rides and there are nearby lockers that are free for 90 minutes. Overall, I like Universal Studios Singapore, but mostly go here because of a lack of options in the area. This park is nicer than Legoland Malaysia, but also quite a bit more expensive. Our annual passes for Legoland expired recently, but at some point we're going to sign up again and probably won't visit Universal Studios until those passes expire again. Hopefully Minionland will be open by our next visit.

5.review_text: Amazing Rides. Can be a bit irritating if rides are shutdown due to inclement weather conditions. Need to prioritise more for disabled and wheelchair users. Please note wheelchair or disabled or special needs are not going in for rides and as a major theme park the least you could do is provide a free entry ticket to every special needs visitors. Management pls. Take note on the same.

Wonderful experience. However there arr long queues in every activity. Better come early as soon as it opens. Install there app and check the waiting time in each activity. If you have kids, start from the kids section first to avoid intial rush at transformer show or roller coster. A must watch is transformer sgow, revenge of the mummies, Shrek 4D show, Dinosaur lost world ride. If you can spare SGD 90 more per person besides the entry ticket, take it to avoid the long queues so that you can cover everything in a single day.

Bought the ticket in advance & went there on Friday. Need to queue for all rides on morning (install USS apps. They show u the waiting time there). But after 3.30pm, waiting time was super short. Some rides no need to queue at all.

We went there on Friday and we arrived at 11:30 PM, it was crowded but we took the advice of the travelers to start from the last part of the park (called Far away side - sth like this) and move towards the entrance, as almost all people will use the rides near the entrance door. This tip helped as so much and we did not have to wait long, Only in 1 game and I managed to play all the games (except 1 and for the kids) without express ticket. I also advice whoever want to go there to download their app to check the waiting time for each ride to avoid the lines.

Wonderful themed and amusement park. Wait-time is too much for almost every ride, which is disappointing.. If you don't want to wait, then you need go for an express ticket, which is like double the entry fees. If you really want to experience all rides, then go for it. Otherwise, normal ticket should be fine. Overall, it is a nice place to have fun with family and kids.

1.review_text: Visited the park on a Tuesday with family. We knew it was rainy season and came well prepared as we know there are no refunds offered for bad weather. But we were disappointed that almost all the meet & greets were cancelled due to the rain. If we as guests are supposed to continue around the park, why cant the park live up to the same? We do not expect a refund, but paying for entry plus express tickets doesnt seem worth if we dont get to experience the parks attractions in its entirety. Furthermore, we paid 70 for unlimited soft copies of our pictures taken around the park. We were encouraged to pay earlier for ease of collection at the end of the day. To our horror, half of the pictures we took around the park was not given to us! The kids were so disappointed as their pictures with the transformer robots are missing! To add to it all, the customer service is horrible. First your staff was rude to us, and dared to use the excuse that this is how Singaporeans talk. We are Singaporean ourselves and we completely disagree with such a statement. Emails go unanswered and theres no contact number for us to request for our pictures which we have PAID for. Utterly disappointed.

I went to this park about 2 weeks ago, super excited because I had already been to Universal in Orlando, and it was simply enchanting.
