To my disappointment, the visit to the park was horrible, the first ride I queued for almost 2 hours, when I got close, I saw that the instructors weren't filling the carts, letting it go empty, without 2 or 3 people... Total negligence with whoever was in line... When leaving I thought about buying the fast-pass, when I went to buy it it started raining, and the park was closed for a whole 3 hours, no rides were working anymore. After 1 hour with nothing to do, a waterworld show was about to start and we decided to watch it, to our surprise, right at the beginning of the show, an employee had an accident and the show was canceled and they told us to leave the place... As if that wasn't enough, I went to try to buy an ice cream, I was the first in line, and I only went close to the counter to the side to look at the flavors, to get started and the attendant was super rude to me saying that I was missing the line, I I tried to explain what happened to him, he didn't even want to listen to me, super ignorant. I was so upset with everything about the park, service, attractions, lack of preparation of the staff... Anyway, I didn't like it and I don't recommend it...

Tickets can be bought on the spot, waiting in line takes about 5 minutes. Inside, however, 30-50 minutes everywhere!!! Horrible!! They shower you in several places and you can dry yourself for money?!! Does the park close if it rains??! The staff is just there, unmotivated. There are many people, it is not organized. This could be done better. Expensive so not fun rather disappointing!
What's worse is that there isn't enough human resources....the queue takes an hour per game....to buy food the queue is also bad...the place is hot...don't come here

No rides will work Poor maintenance if the rain comes. Waited for 3 hours for the Zurrasic park ride but later they will convey sorry technical issues Waited for 2 hours to the transformer ride, later they'll say technical issues, apologize, etc Useless and waste if times !

2.review_text: Good theme park. But prices are ridiculously expensive during holiday season. Food quality is bad. Avoid during holiday seasons.

This is just an amusement park, Much of a hype created, We have similar or better in INDIA, must visit Imagica mumbai for better experience. In Universla studio it is long queues and basic rides. Everything un-necessary chargeable, be it lockers etc etc. Only ride which is worth is transformers. Not recommended place, waste of time and money.

Its small and can be hot ao dress light. the rides are nice but they should really try to be more efficient at peak periods e.g. weekends and have more than 1 staff manging a ride so that things can run smoother/ faster

3.review_text: It's a total rip off, the waiting time is so long on some rides, like the Transformers, that it makes you wonder, what's the point getting into the theme park without express pass. But then, on some rides I have seen there was no point getting express pass either, as the queues were too long for both, normal and express pass, and people with normal tickets were seen cheating to enter through the express queue (or encouraged to get in by the staff as they need one or two personnel to start the ride). 3 stars are for helpful staff, facilities (toilets, water fountains, etc) at strategic locations and cleanliness at the venue. Restaurant like Mel's Dine In is tricking customers with pricing, esp. with refill of drinks!

During holiday periods it is not advisable to visit Universal studio. 1. Entrance fee too expensive 2.The queues for mist rides are at least 2 hours . 3.The prices in foodcourt and eating places are atrocious.

If you have been to other Universal parks, this wont appear as fun or with great rides. It opens at 10 am, but dont expect for the food stands to be open. I would say that by 2 pm everything was open. Visit if you have spare time in Singapore.
Honestly, this place was great. But, I queue for about 2 hours inside the 3D Transformer Ride. I queue between 3:00 until 5:00.

The most lame theme park I've ever visited. Boring old rides, half of which were closed when rain started. Few times asked personal about the way to the next ride and as it appeared most of them know nothing about the place they work at.

4.review_text: As in the USA. The difference is that there were no large queues and several attractions were also not open. The park should be renovated, some attractions are destroyed. Overall I recommend :-)

Rides are good, waiting times during peak periods can be up to about an hour ish, the waiting time timers are not accurate, also be mindful that people don't seem to look at where they are going. Most of them are on their phones and expect people to move out of their way.

Excellent accessibility to Vivo City and the Studios. Universal Studios Singapore is huge with lots of games and shows. I enjoyed a couple of shows like Trolls, n Shrek. I'd gone on a Wednesday so there was a huge crowd therefore long queues for each game hence I couldn't sit for any ride or watch the Hollywood horror show. Later around 1.30pm it rained so all rides were closed. Vegetarian food is not available easily, there's one place with potato wedges n the like near the Ancient Egypt section...but no proper food. That was an issue coz it's far from the games section. I walked around to Jurassic park, Water World etc, and started walking towards the exit. My shoes n socks got wet. I couldn't sit anywhere coz of the rains and my legs were paining at the end of the day having done 10k steps in the studios. Suggestions - - Give Senior citizens ticket concessions as they can't use rides but the studios is worth watching. - Veg restaurants should be marked on the studio app for accessibility. - Provisions for selling umbrellas, caps, shoe covers/rubber flip flops should be available in more parts of the studios.

Extremely crowded during holiday season(even during weekdays). Try to check the wait time before joining queue for a ride. Transformers ride was nice. I recommend Legoland compared to universal studio.

Must one time watchable place!! First timers ll have fun for sure. We took tickets from a kiosk machine. There was crowd for every attraction inside it. For Transformers I waited 1:30mins. No wait time for Mummy Revenge. For jurasic theme waited for an hr

5.review_text: Once again, only there for work; seems like I only visit nice places to work rather than to enjoy myself. We had working passes so we breezed through the turnstiles. Visitors should attempt to get tickets ahead of time and also check USS website to see whether certain attractions were closed or if USS was hosting any special events.

Happy happy happy park day with friends!! Tried out roller coaster for the first time and they were actually pretty fun and not scary. HUMANs drop made me feel a bit uncomfortable but CYLON was pretty smooth, even though it looks a lot scarier (hanging seats, 360 rotation etc). Would recommend! CYLON had almost no queue so we got in real fast. Some other attractions had slightly longer queues but mostly within 20mins

Since it was my first theme park, I was mismerised. Most of the shows were open when I went, some rides likes canopy flyer and treasure hunt were really boring, but others like the rollercoasters and revenge of the mummy were great. Food is nice too and the characters roaming around gave many memories.

I went with my 5-year-old child during the peak season at the end of the year. When we arrived 15 minutes before opening, entry had already begun. Immediately after the park opened, there were almost no people lining up for the attractions, so I was able to ride Jurassic Park twice in a row with zero waiting time. It was busiest around noon and the wait for the Transformers was about 2 hours. After 6pm, it became empty and the wait for the Transformer was about 40 minutes, and after 7pm, the wait was about 10 minutes, so I rode it twice in a row. For food, the Malaysian food court on the right after exiting the USS may be a little cheaper and better. There is also a manned counter on the right side as you enter, so you can pay with cash. Also, I was able to buy the tickets a little cheaper because I paid with a coupon or PayPal, which is recommended for advance purchase. PayPal payments can only be used in Japan, so if you have a fixed schedule, I think it's a good idea to buy in advance.

You need one complete day for this. Take 4 monorail ticket to Sentosa - first stop (Resorts station) Reach at 10 when the gates open, immediately rush to Transformers, Spielberg show and Shrek (wait time will go up from 10 30) Queue time will again increase from 12pm. From 12 try to follow the reverse order of rides and shows. For waterworld ensure you've chosen the center of gallery. You can go out for lunch and re-enter, food inside is costly, so just step out and a hawker center is available just outside the gate.

1.review_text: The cost is very high for such attractions. The queue is over an hour even on weekdays. There are queues even in cafes. I do not recommend visiting.

We went on a weekday on 1/24, thinking there would be less people, but it turned out there were still a lot of people. When we lined up for the rafting facilities, we had been queuing for almost an hour and finally it was our turn. It turned out that there was something wrong with the equipment and it was over. There was no compensation plan at all. , the child was so disappointed that he burst into tears on the spot. It was really bad. My friend also encountered the same problem when he went to queue for Transformers, and there was no compensation. The company can issue priority passes to those of us who have worked hard to queue for a long time! Just for this facility, wouldnt such a simple treatment be enough? There are no staff to manage the queuing area. There are a lot of people jumping in line. Are the people who line up obediently all idiots? What a bunch of substandard adults. I will never go there again, nor will I recommend it to my friends. It was an expensive and unpalatable lunch!

The almost 5 stars here are definitely not justified. We were there on a Monday in mid-January and the waiting times were still forever. The queues are led confusingly around 1000 corners so that you can't see how long they are. This isn't a fun park, it's a waiting park. At least 2 attractions had breaks due to maintenance work. If you want to come for just under 60, take a few photos of the scenery and spend several hours in queues, you should go.

Singapore was rainy season, so outdoor attractions were suspended whenever it rained. The notice of the suspension occurred three times, so I was only able to ride one attraction during my visit. I understand universal studios' safety guidelines, but I'll never visit again because staffs just said sorry and didn't compensate. They didn't value the customer's time to wait meaninglessly. Also, I don't think it's reasonable to pay the same fee as other customers who visited when the weather was nice because we used less than half of the service compared to them. Does it make sense to stay for six hours and ride a single attraction?

The worst of all the Universals I have ever been to. Every now and then there are breaks due to broken attractions. No one knows anything, there could be a 5-minute break or it could be 2 hours. There wasn't a single attraction that didn't break down several times a day. Compared to LA and Orlando, this is definitely the only park that makes you tired and not happy.

2.review_text: Don't come here without an express ticket , people with general ticket are no better than cattle , long queues , gross mismanagement , a pitiful sight for a operarion of that scale in singapore.
Its ok but very small. 2 attraction excellent transformers and revenge of the mummy, other 2 good, rest really average. More expected from Universal Studios name

3.review_text: Good attractions, some exclusive to Singapore like the Sesame Street ride, the Puss in Boots rollercoaster, or the Battlestar Galactica coasters. But the service is quite bad. We were there on a very slow day, with most of the park empty, and the Battlestar Galactica coasters were operating with only one train - which brought waiting time to 30, 40 minutes when the other attractions had a maximum waiting time of 10. Felt like they were slowing down operations to sell more Express Passes. Service is very slow in restaurants as well, and most photo stands for the attractions were not working. Theres also no nighttime show, neither a lot of street entertainment. The major show in the park - Waterworld - happens once a day only. Its the smallest Universal park in the world, and it couldve been so much better if operations were good, and if there was more entertainment and showtimes.

Nothing exceptional, park is old , food is hugely overpriced and unworthy mostly . Transformers ride was good and May be the roller coaster but thats it . Funnily enough there were queues in the express side as well.

Mixed Experience at Universal Studios Singapore I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore, and while the overall experience was enjoyable, there were a few drawbacks that need attention. I would recommend everyone to get the tickets via their website as it offers 1 hour early access. The park offers a thrilling array of rides and attractions, creating a captivating atmosphere for visitors. However, my excitement took an unexpected turn when we got stuck on one of the rides (the Transformers). The staff kept us updated and we were given an express pass as compensation. This hiccup slightly dampened the experience, highlighting a need for better maintenance and operational efficiency. Another ride went again into maintenance after we reached the front of the queue after waiting half n hour, another disappointment (The chase of the mummy) On the culinary front, the variety of food options was commendable, but I couldn't ignore the steep prices. The expensive food choices were a drawback, making it less budget-friendly for visitors. It would be beneficial for the park management to reconsider pricing strategies to enhance the overall value for guests. Additionally, while most staff members were helpful, I encountered instances where a bit more politeness could have made a difference. Improving staff interactions would undoubtedly contribute to a more positive and memorable visitor experience. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fantastic time with its attractions, but addressing issues like ride maintenance, food pricing, and staff politeness would elevate the overall guest satisfaction.

Beautiful park, great rides (specially cylon and jurassic park). Service is not too good (which is kind of weird for Singapore). Some of the signature snacks were not available, staff was completely lost on how to sell the ride pictures.

We went for an impromptu visit to Universal Studios Singapore and had already expected a high crowd as it was a day before Christmas. The overall experience at Universal Studios Singapore was a mix of excitement and frustration. Despite the thrilling rides and attractions, - ticket prices were jaw-breaking expensive, costing almost 200 for 2 adults and 1 child - dining experience was hectic with long queues and limited seats especially over at Mel's Drive. This made it challenging for us to enjoy a relaxed meal with our kids. Restaurants could have offered food with various texture suitable for all ages (e.g. porridge) to enhance its family-friendly atmosphere. Food and drinks are also outrageously pricey (which is expected). - push carts could have offered a wider range of halal food options to accommodate a more diverse visitor base with various dietary preferences. - there were significant wait times for the rides/ shows. Additionally, lack of child-friendly activities, limiting options for families with younger children. - outcome of the photo-taking at "Sci-Fi City" with "Optimus Prime" was a disappointment as the image turned out to be dark. The low visibility at night hindered the clarity of the photo and this was captured using both our phone and even with their camera. - restrooms appeared to be inadequately maintained, with dirty toilet cubicles and lack of toilet paper. - drying pod can be too warm for tall people (could have indicate a sign outside to warn users of the heat they might expect upon use). Nonetheless, it was still a memorable experience for us as we did not hold any expectations on experiencing the rides and shows with the high crowd (which finally settled down late afternoon). We were impressed that: - there was a prayer space provided for Muslims, - almost every attraction has a water cooler, - the performances were energetic and lively, - there was good crowd control for character meet-and-greet. We hope this feedback can contribute to improvements in the overall experience at Universal Studios Singapore and we also hope to see a more variety of shows and activities suitable for various age groups.

4.review_text: The park is good enough to spend the whole day seeing all the attractions and enjoying the fun rides. Wait Times at adventurous rides is more than an hour even during weekdays and the staff managing at rides is one of the worst experience. People with Express pass have a huge advantage as the get VVIP treatment at the queues. Whereas the Regular entry is served as "delay pass". Also, there is lack of proper ventilation(Fans/ACs in the waiting Queues that one could faint of suffocation because of high humidity & crowd. Park Management seriously needs to take actions to improve this or keep only EXPRESS ENTRY for everyone! Because the ones who aren't paying for express are paying there by frustration and inconvenience!

Went there in Dec. Open time 10am to 9pm. Waiting too long for favourite rides. We went for transformer, battlestar galactica and spagetthi chase at night so no waiting time. We didnt ride canopy flyer because long waiting time and revenge of the mummy as it was high speed and not suitable for my son. Madagascar section was closed and will be replaced with minion. Bought tickets thru klook with food combo and retail voucher. Very expensive locker rental at SGD30 for big locker.

Embarking on a full-day adventure at Universal Studios Singapore proved to be an exhilarating experience, offering a perfect blend of shows, rides, and cinematic wonder. Securing the one-hour early entry ticket (9 AM) was a game-changer, allowing me to explore at least five attractions before the crowds descendeda practical and cost-effective choice compared to the pricier express ticket. While most of the rides boasted minimal wait times, a brief snarl at Battlestar Galactica added an unexpected twist. A croc slipper mishap caused a 30-minute delay, turning a 10-minute wait into 40 minutes. However, this hiccup aside, the majority of attractions featured wait times ranging from 5 to 40 minutes, depending on the time of day. The WaterWorld show, a captivating spectacle, became a highlight of the day with two performances, and catching the 1:30 PM show proved to be a rewarding choice. The Jurassic Park area offered a culinary respite, though prices were steepa common theme in amusement parks. Despite the cost, the food was delectable, living up to the "amusement park pricing" standard. In retrospect, my early entry strategy, coupled with the occasional waits and memorable shows, made the day at Universal Studios Singapore an unforgettable experiencea journey through cinematic magic and thrills.

It's an expensive experience, you should only bother every 10 years or so. In SG, it's hot, humid, food choices are limited and expensive. 4 stars only because the staff are polite, the park feels safe and it's clean.

It was a Fun filled day with enjoyment for the entire family, the right mix of entertainment and experiences to please every age group in the family. It was worth spending the money, and value is given back at the venue in many forms of rides and experiences. I recommend purchasing tickets in advance. the ticketing system onsite is horrible because of long queue and automatic machines that do not work at any given time.

5.review_text: Suggestion to visit : weekday. We visited USS while Singapore rain all day long so the visitor was not busy enough. Queueing line wasn't long, about max. 20 minutes
I pay in advanced the ticket not to do queues. It was a very good decision! Universal studios Singapore was an awesome plan to do with my partner in our 30s.

This is the famous amusement park in Sentosa Island. Many rides with various categories here. It is almost impossible to try all of the rides without fast-track ticket. For example, to be able to ride the roller coaster with reguler ticket will cost almost 2 hours queuing. So I think it is better to spend more money than to waste time.
Visited USS a few weeks ago. It was good, not too crowded so the queue for each attraction was quite fast.

Jan 2024 Pre purchased tickets and got there at the opening. Managed to do both Battlestar roller coasters, mummy and 2 Jurassic park rides in hour and a half. Then took our time to attend shows and other experiences. Did transformers on way out, time at entrance said 60 minute wait. We were in and out in 20. Great day out.

1.review_text: Universal studios India The service standard in singapore is terrible
Some stalls only accept small banknotes and do not accept credit cards. I was told that I couldn't pay for 50 SGD. I couldn't pay after queuing up. It was a very bad experience.
Particularly in Singapore there is no issue of service, but in this place there is not even education, very bad experience. All the game boys very rude!!!

I am tourist. For two adults when I bought the tickets at the Kiosk outside the entrance my forex card got charged twice (2 ticket payments of S176 each) with a receipt for only obe payment of S176. When I checked with the customer care inside the studio they say only one payment is received. I checked with my bank and they say they did not get any response yet for the details of the second payment charged to the card with a receipt nor a refund. They asked me to wait for 30 days to know the final status and am still waiting for the 30 day period to elapse which is around end of this month. My recommendation is not to use those Kiosks.

Absolutely underground. If you are used to German amusement parks, then it is best to stay away from this amusement park. An overpriced entrance fee combined with bad shows and long waiting times will make you sick. And I mean it seriously, in this heat you'll get sick waiting (of course there's nothing the park can do about that). It's a shame about the one star I had to give.

2.review_text: 440sg or 330 for a family, 3 entries and 2 single express passes (pass valid for 16 attractions only once). you pay for an express pack but 6 attractions are excluded from the express pack. so 30 to 45 min queue for these attractions. jurassic park which last 4 minutes with a quick finale otherwise the other attractions last 30sec to 45sec so wait even in express pack for 45 seconds, meh Frankly disappointed by the park, robotland in goseong in korea is smaller, fewer attractions but there are more attractions for similar sensations restaurant opposite shrek 3 counters out of 4 closed. given the price we pay we could have a more efficient service. Same for the price they could give us a paper map instead of having to download an apps. stop greenwashing. given the energy that the park consumes to operate 22 attractions to do only once for 30 minutes of sensation and 4 hours of waiting. 22 attractions and as many shops and other restaurants. overpriced industrial food not enough attractions for young children aged 6 7 8, the big 8s too scary for young children. no attraction for babies from one to 2 years old. type water and light games I will never go back to this park again rather disappointed

As someone who has visited many theme parks around the world and most of the Universal sites worldwide Universal Singapore operates like no other theme park and not in a good way. The biggest issue here is how the rides operate with regards to lockers. In order to ride some of the rides they do not allow you to have anything in your pockets at all. This is very different to every other theme park I've been to where they understandably don't allow bags or backpacks so you have to use the lockers but items in your pockets are allowed everywhere else but here. The first problem is they do not make this clear when you are queuing so when you get to the front of the queue and are scanned by a metal detector wand it detects your phone / wallet etc. and you are told by the miserable staff member that you need to put this in a locker despite having already queued and dropped your bag off at the locker before joining the ride queue. They do allow you to return to the front of the queue but this could be avoided by having someone inform the visitors while they queue. So once you have placed everything you carry into a locker you then queue for the ride. Sounds ok, right? Wrong. The lockers are only free for a set amount of time (45 mins) which if you are a theme park regular you will know is nowhere near enough time to queue for a ride so you then get charged a rate of 2 for every 10 mins past the free 45 mins. A complete scam. For context Universal Florida give you a few hours free. If you aren't already annoyed at your experience so far once you get off the ride to collect you items you then discover that you do not have your bank cards to pay for the locker as they are locked away so you now have to find an employee who can unlock your items for you and then you have to pay them in cash which not everyone will have so you then need to go find some cash. It's infuriating and such a colossal waste of valuable time in the park. After 1 ride I'm so angry at the entire situation and genuinely don't want to be there anymore. Ride staff are miserable and extremely unhelpful throughout the day. For contrast the staff in the retail stores are very friendly and helpful. Maybe this is better training, maybe it's working environment (air con) staff in restaurants were a mixed bag. Some were friendly, some were just rude. Food in the park was actually pretty good and unlike other theme parks wasn't ridiculously expensive. We bought tickets that included a Chinese New Year promo meal which meant each area of the park offered a different option for this so it's worth shopping around to find the best looking meal. We opted for duck wraps from the Shrek themed area and they were very large and delicious. Had we known portion size we would have used one voucher here and bought something else from another area. Not all the food was good though. In Mel's Diner from back to the future I ordered a sundae that was a half filled cup of semi melted ice cream and not the swirled ice cream with strawberry sauce as pictured (see pics). When we complained about this to staff in both English and Chinese (my wife is Malaysian Chinese) they just laughed and walked away. Wait times for rides were posted incorrectly. E.g. 15 mins for The Mummy when we queued for over an hour. Other issues encountered include Staff allowing groups of tourists to join the single rider queues when it was very clear they were all together and just attempting to queue jump, 3D glasses for transformers ran out so had to wait for staff to replace. no one stopping use of phones, queue management was awful. Filling up rows 1 person at a time instead of 4. The park is very small compared to other theme parks so there is no excuse for the multitude of errors we saw when visiting. In fact this should be the best operated Universal Location due to the size but it's by far the worst we've been to. Would I return here? Absolutely not. I would recommend it though for a single visit as long as you know what to expect. hopefully reviews like this will enable others to have a better trip
The staff of attractions, too much unkind and rude.. even they didnt answer simple question. may they need to hire educated ppl.

Very limited number of attractions and rides for the number of people allowed to get into the park resulting in super long queues for a three minute ride. Our worst one was about 2 hours for the Jurassic park rapids. All about money here. Even purchasing VIP ticket is useless as a lot of people have VIP tickets as well and you will still have to line up. Plan your vacation well.

We came here with great anticipation and were looking forward to an exciting and eventful day. What we got was a total of hours of waiting in confusing rooms at the individual attractions and ultimately a cancellation on our part because we simply couldn't stand anymore. You're not a young 30-year-old who can stand the endless waiting and standing. At Transformers, at Battlestar Galaktika and in the Temple of the Mummy we queued for well over 3 hours and ultimately saw nothing!!! With such a hefty entrance fee, this was the most expensive wait and the biggest disappointment we have ever experienced. What I found particularly bad was that there was no indication of waiting times in the morning hours. Only when we left the studios in the afternoon, deeply disappointed and pissed off, did we see waiting times (45-80 minutes). I also have to mention that you can and probably should buy express entry (extra entry with shortened waiting times) for 100 SGD per person if you want to experience anything at all in this park and dont want to spend almost the entire time of your stay waiting. Two people 246 SGD for Cable Car and Universal Studios entrance 200 SGD Express 446 SGD Too Much!!!

3.review_text: Hello to every who's gonna read my review. i will share a very brief details on my experience i had during the public holiday. Of course compare to where I came from, the rides at USS were exceptional, amazing and wonderful. I especially love the ride "Revenge of Mummy" and the huge rollercoaster "Battlestar Galactica: Human". It was extremely enjoyable that my siblings and I could not stop moving trying to queue up on our next rides. Something to be aware of: 1. For muslims, the food outlets inside the theme park mostly consist with the selling of beers and non-halal food/drinks but there's one halal stall at the Far Far Away Land area called the "Goldilocks (something)" so.. for foreigners, you might as well have breakfast at home and bring some snacks along with you. 2. Be aware that the queue is a no joke thing, it can be extremely long especially "Revenge of Mummy", "Battlestar Galactica: Cylon", "Puss In Boots' Giant Journey" and all of the Jurrasic Park rides. To be frank, the queue might take up to 1-2 hours especially during peak time 11-2pm. So it's a matter of you willing to wait or not. 3. Be aware of people (especially foreigners who's Indians). Sadly, from my experience, they tried to cheat on us and cut our queue to access the ride faster and be ahead of us Not only that, they pushed one of my family members during the queue multiple times to the point we have to speak up. Totally not a pleasant experience. 4. You can access the link of USS by scanning the bar code posted right before going into USS as this will provide you with a map of the theme park, the rides available on that day and its estimated waiting time. 5. Lastly, my other main reason as to why I had to rate USS 3-4/5 was because of some rude behaviours of the workers. Yes it's understandable that you have been working a whole day taking care of the rides under the hot sun and dealing with customers/visitors but that does not justify the rudeness and incompetency that you had show towards these people who not only bought tickets to have a good time playing rides in the theme park but also are the ones who enabled you to have the paycheck you're receiving. For the Sesame Street Ride lady waiting in front of the door, I am here to write to you on how rude you were and that your statement, tone and how you shouted at customers are totally NOT professional and a disgusting behaviour. If you cannot cope with working there to the point you had to push and shout at customers just because the rides were closed then you should have just resign. In other words lady in blue shirt with glasses working at Sesame Street ride at 7.55pm on 10th February 2024, you could have provide us visitors with better approach instead of what you've done, not only that it had also caused us to have a tainted image of this "good and friendly neighbourhood of Singapore", it had also stained our excitement by the end of the day at USS. Suggestions: 1. Better maintanence on the rides as by the end of the day some rides closed down due to maintanence and it take quite long compared to during lunch time (about 5mins). 2. More Halal food stalls for the muslim, easy access to Prayer rooms and please clean the toilet, it's quite stinky, dirty and the rubbish was too full that it falls out to the floor. 3. Improvements of customer service (eg. don't be rude and be friendly) 4. To reduce waiting time, every available seats per ride should be completely filled. I think that's all, thank you for reading and hope you get some knowledge and enjoyed it!
Very mediocre park, half of it is closed. Prepare to spend more money on raincoats and then drying shoes and storing phones. In Singapore, you expect more than that.

Lots of places to visit. Visitors must determine which game they want to play or which location they want to visit first. Because the queue is quite long, it takes a long time to get your turn. Cool queuing area, with free drinking water dispensers.

It was very crowded during Chinese New Year. The heat in Singapore is not as hot as in Japan, but the sun is so strong that I got burnt. The wait for Transformers was 90 minutes, which was tough. The ride was only 5 minutes, Shrek had a seat, and the wait was only 40 minutes. On the way home, I had to wait in line for both trains and taxis, so I was tired.

My recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore left me with mixed feelings. Having previously visited the Orlando location, I couldn't help but compare the two. While Universal Studios Singapore offers some enjoyable rides, many felt mediocre compared to Orlando's offerings. For first-time visitors, it's worth a try, especially if you're excited about a new experience. Wait times are generally short (10-15 mins), but consider an express pass on weekends. Overall, it's a decent outing, but not quite on par with Orlando.

4.review_text: I went during the Lunar New Year holiday on February 11th and there were too many people. I had to wait for almost an hour for the rides I could ride, but the weather helped and it was cloudy most of the time, so I made it through. If the sun was hot, it would have been difficult to endure. Although the overall scale is smaller than Universal Studios Japan, the rides were much more fun and scary than those in Japan. Personally, I think Japan competes with screens that feature flashy characters and rides that aren't scary. In Singapore, the fear was much greater as I didn't know what would come out of the darkness. I finally got a seat after waiting for the restaurant. It was next to the waffle shop past Jurassic Park, and the chicken was bigger than the original one, so I couldn't eat it all. The food was salty. They only gave me a cup because the drinks had unlimited refills. I wasn't able to see the water show because the timing wasn't right, but as I was passing by the entrance to the water show, I saw a show (?) where a baby dinosaur hatches from an egg, and it was quite realistic and fun. I couldn't ride much even after walking over 20,000 steps due to a failure in the game of wits, but next time I go, I'm going to try riding some equipment I haven't been able to ride.
This was ok. Honestly enjoyed this much less than the theme parks in South Korea and Dubai. Maybe we went on a very crowded national holiday. Hence was much less fun vs other days

Firstly, get there early! Like, before it opens early! We got the ticket that allows early access and it was so worth it! Plan out the rides you desperately want to do and tick them off first... the difference is waiting 15min in line to 60-80min waits. Each ride has a sign out front telling you the wait time. By midday the wait times for most adult rides are 60 mins. Was annoyed to see rides taking off with half full carriages just because ride operators didnt want to force or allocate singles to go with groups of 3 etc. just blows out the wait times for everyone. Pack your own food and drink! Our ticket included a 20 meal voucher each - it didnt go far and the food was average. Toilets were very clean, park was clean, gardens well maintained. All in all was a good day but we left after the water show that started at 1.30 as we didnt want to wait an hour to go on a ride.
Park hours are too short. There is not enough time to cover all the major attractions with hours of waiting, except paying 50 extra for express entries.

Visited during weekday still lots of people here. Place rather small comparing to Japans. Queueing time on average 90 to 100 minutes per facility, which made us decide to purchase the Universal Express, costlier than the admission tickets. Well time is money, if we hadnt purchased UE we might have ended up spending like 6 hours in the queue for around 10 to 15 minutes play at the end of the day. But this happens around the world not only here.

5.review_text: It's a whole new level of experience coming here. I'm referring to the rides of course but not the level of service. The crew as much as possible are juggling a lot. So their level of services are not that great as expected for an international brand of theme park. Nonetheless it wasn't horrible (far from it in fact) but maybe as guests we are expecting a friendlier service.

I went 3 times and got to tried few of the rides. Every rides needs to queue quite long but still happy as i got to spending my time together with my family. 2 times went there some rides i unable to rides because of the weather. Raining Heavily. My suggestion before buy a ticket please see the forecast for that day.

The rides are awesome, few are scary too.. I went there just before covid outbreak and pandemic lockdown so there wasnt much crowd but as I know and have heard that the queue takes more than 20-30 mins per ride.

Visited the place on a Wednesday expecting a smaller footfall. Went early. Found it as busy as it probably can be, with long lines at main attractions (wait times upto 75 mins). Although things eased up a bit by late afternoon. Not sure how the weekend would be like. A better crowd management at certain attractions (like at Far Far Away) & along certain segments, shall certainly be helpful. Place has everything to cater to all ages & tastes, so, a pre-visit 'homework' is recommended. Ideally, the place is a whole day's visit.

Universal Studios Singapore! ! When I went there during the summer vacation, the queue to get in was super long! ! But once you get into the park, its fine (because the crowds dispersed), and you must queue up for a fast pass before playing the rides! After getting the fast pass, you will have to wait for about 1 to 2 hours depending on the situation. You can go play other things, take photos, or visit souvenir shops first. The roller coaster was super super fun. I thought I would have to queue for a long time but it only took 30 minutes. We rode the one where our feet were in the air (the other one had a floor to step on, but we didnt get to ride that). It was really fun and you must queue up for it! ! The most exciting roller coaster I've ever ridden!

1.review_text: UPDATE: When the toy gun that was a present did not work I decided to complain. Received a non-personal response asking for day of visit, time of visit, location of complaint, original receipt, picture and video of toy guy. I have hardly seen any worse attempt to service recovery. Enough wasted time on this timesink. A third of the park closed for remodelling. Food is worse than in the US. You'll spend hours of waiting in line to the attractions because management fills up the park with too many people. And the neon toy bubble gun bought in the souvenir shop is not work. The pump seems to be broken.

Every facilities is nice but Very bad experience in USS with impatient ,being to arrogant and very rude and not even a basic respect to tourism. The workers there like treat people like there pets just call us here and there. Please focus more on staff training. It ruin my whole day !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

messed up system. Got here and did the single line queue which is usually faster moving in the US as it does alternate and fills in vacant seats. However USS system sucks! they dont let any single riders get in at all so you could be waiting for 2hrs until all the other group made it. What a messed up system.

not worth going here. not worth it if you want to spend 5 hours here, you have to remember that 4 hours and 30 minutes are spent waiting, 30 minutes for the ride. places like this should be boycotted to the fullest extent.

everything are closed and broken, waiting lane is crazy. if you want to ride need to pay locker 4, what happened to me, I paid for the locker and waiting for about 2 hours and suddenly they said its out of service so funny. never going back again I guess.

2.review_text: I hope management realize the happiness and well-being of the staffs, they seem so rude and not happy.. not sure they are over-worked or under-paid.. looks like they are working for a torture camp, not for a theme park lol So many sinister looking and frowned faces and rude when directing the visitors

Went one one ride which had a sign up saying 20 minute wait. Ended up taking 1 hour 20 , and nothing is worth queuing this long. Unfortunately you don't realise that there are different chambers of the que, so keep hoping you are near the front only to find out you're not. It ruined the day. If you are going here and want to do rides, you should really pay for the express pass - or don't go.

A bit disappointed by the Universal Studio in Singapore, after doing both in the US. The organization is a bit messy, having to lock your backpack in a locker beforehand, with the penalty of an extra 4 if you're late doesn't help you enjoy the hour wait for the ride for the galaxy. We finished the day with 2 ride malfunctions, after a 45 minutes wait, so not ideal to finish a long day. Expensive 19 hot dog for a quick lunch break. Just a big plus for the Waterworld show, the same as in the US, but still very nice for special effects and choreography.

Warning for parents, whether it's a weekend or a weekday, this place will be packed no matter what time you go. The line at transformers literally took 1hr 30mins on a Monday at 11am (got to ride at 12.30pm). Queues are ridiculously long and some rides are definitely not worth it. Best advice is to save up and spend on the express pass, if possible. Otherwise, don't bother. You may be able to squeeze in 2 rides every 2-3hours....plus its hot and humid to add to the experience...
Minion is still not ready. And btw, when you are waiting in line for Puss in Boots, do not place your arms on the queue rail, its rusty and will leave nasty dirty marks on your sleeve.

3.review_text: The park is quite underwhelming really. There are very long queues for almost every ride or attraction even on a mid week day out of holiday season. Most rides etc have minimum 1 hour queues. Of course if you want to pay double the price you can walk on to anything. Personally I won't go here again

We were there on a Thursday. It was extremely busy and without the express tickets we would have had to queue for at least an hour for each ride. The express tickets cost 120SGD per person, without which it would have been unthinkable for us. The park is not particularly big and the rides are mediocre. All in all, the park is just too small for what it costs. We also noticed that after around 2 p.m. the waiting times at the rides go down significantly. Maybe come a little later and save yourself the express tickets!!!

Universal Studios Singapore falls short in comparison to USJ, Disney parks Tokyo, or Hong Kong when it comes to creating a lively atmosphere. The staff appeared discontent and lacked smiles, diminishing the overall experience. Moreover, extensive renovation work limited the available attractions, making the already small park feel even smaller. Nevertheless, it's crucial for the park to undergo upgrades, including improvements to staff demeanor, to enhance its appeal and attract more visitors.

Its still remain the same since my first came on 2016, not much changes in these years. The queue is long and waited more than an hour, some attractions dont really crowd with people like talks and the performance, quite boring. If dont wanted to waste time to queue up, I would recommend you to get an express pass.
Premium pass is must. Its too crowded. And Dubai rides are better, to be honest.

4.review_text: Tickets were purchased at the electronic ticket office. There was no queue to enter. The queue for the rides is 30-40 minutes. Universal itself was not impressive, there are not many attractions. More than one day. Many areas were closed. The scenery itself, and some of the attractions, dont look very good.

One of must visit place in Singapore. We went on weekday Monday which was crowded. Better to go at 9 am with free early pass where you can cover rides and shows. Carry the empty bottle as there are places for free drinking water. Best ride was mummy ride, transformer and cyclon. Only irritating part was waiting time which went Upto 100 mins and there is no place to sit anywhere. You can take the busy rides during the afternoon when many people will go for lunch. One of the best show was water world and be ready to get drenched . We felt soft toys are less costlier when l compared to outside place. Do wear good shoes and there is no place to change the dress . There is dry zone place where we need to pay. We can meet and greet the cartoon / animation characters in where there is specific timings. We can take photo with them . Do install uss app where we can see the waiting time and route . There is free wifi and my suggestion was they could have given hard copy of map.
Check weather as they stop service on some rides when raining. Great experience.

There are lots of team parks in and out, but the surrounding weather is very hot, especially in summer.... My suggestion is to think more about greening, so that tourists are interested in coming and playing in this place...
A whole section of the park was closed while we were there with no warning... would have been nice to know upon entering, or even beforehand.

5.review_text: 1. If you go on weekdays, you still have to wait in a small queue. Popular facilities must be visited within 30-60 minutes If you are worried about waiting in line for too long, remember to buy a quick pass Otherwise, the queue will be much less crowded after 5 o'clock. 2. Singapore often has strong sunshine in the morning and heavy rain in the afternoon. Remember to bring an umbrella or a light raincoat (they sell one at Jurassic Park for SGD 6) 3. It is recommended to buy souvenirs last, otherwise they will be heavy to carry around. 4. There is a row of food trucks and a Malay food court outside the park. If you dont like the food in the park, you can stamp your name and eat outside before coming back to play.

The best experience in Singapore. Extremely good and thrilling rides like Cyclone, Human,etc. In one of the rides they turn you upside down 5 times and your fear will go away. Also the rides are very safe and kids (7 years ) are allowed in almost every ride where they consider the height. The transformers ride and Jurassic world is amazing. Tickets should be booked in advance. In the rides the maximum waiting time on a weekend was 25-30 minutes even though they say 40 minutes. Many shops were there for buying candies, Starbucks, Souvenir store which were very overpriced just because Universal Studio was written in them. The souvenir shop will lead you to the road of poverty. The staff was friendly. You will need to spend at least 7-8 hours to explore it fully. Some restaurants are also there inside including an Indian restaurant. The palace in the beginning is good for taking pictures. Also the mummy ride was very good. All rides were open except the Water World Show. Overall a good experience for all ages.

Firstly, MUST BUY EXPRESS PASS!!! The theme park is very fun and a lot of activities to do, such as the meet & greet, the shows, the rides, and the beautiful environment. When I first came here I didn't buy the express pass, this caused me to wait in line for roughly 1 hours in line for the Galactic Cyclone ride. It was unbearable for waiting so long, and I also went to queue in the mummy ride for nearly 45 minutes just for a minute ride. Anyway, I got the express pass about 1pm and I have a great experience afterwards, like shorten queue and faster access. This is a very family friendly place where it's okay to let families member wait in the family room in each ride in case the family members aren't fit for the ride.

USS is a must to visit place when you are in Singapore. Its a theme park operated by Universal studio. It is located at Santosa island. Its operated from 10 AM to 7 PM in weekdays and upto 8 PM at weekend (Sunday). Ticket can be purchased from different online sites or at USS. Bying from online can save time from long queue on the spot. To avoid queue at entry and rides additional Universal Express pass can be purchased. Usually there is long queue in the morning at opening. But with time rush is less than usual. The park is divided in diffrent zone according to diffrent movie theme. This place is very attractive, rides are fantastic but some are restricted for child. Lots of fun and shows are there. One can download Universal Studio Singapore app on mobile and can have live update of the shows while in the park. It will take around 4 to 6 hours depending on how many rides you are enjoing, crowd and your schedule. Foods and drink are quite expensive there. Don't forget to bring cap, sunglass, umbrella. Happy travelling.

The Transformer attractions are lit. The queue for the water raft adventure was annoyingly long during my visit, and one can get really wet, so gotta take the get wet warnings seriously. The Egyptian theme is amazing, incredible giant statues. Galactica roller coaster was quick but exhilarating enough. It looked safe and well maintained. Enough places to dine. Not a lot of unique drinks. Coconut juices werent very great imo. Locker system can be paid with credit card! https://fb.watch/qBzqqLJ12i/?mibextidv7YzmG

1.review_text: Be v careful when you plan a visit to this place esp if u have infants, children or senior citizens 1. The long que at transformers ride was around 90minutes and u don't realise it at all until mid way. There is no staff around to guide u for emergency. Its Absolutely unorganized 2. There is no or less seating across the area or even for attractions with long distance making it worst and painful 3. Most of the staff are rude with you esp if you belong to different community or are a tourist and not a localite. They shout at u for no reason. 4. The parade is only done on Sundays and most characters are not available on weekdays. We met the puss cat who was equally rude with us in behavior. Why even act like a character if u cnt handle your role humbly? 5. After the entire days hectic walk when we left, the train que was again huge, trains run v v slow with bad cooling and suffocates you as it's so packed. Taxi stop is v far so making it difficult. As usual no place to sit so u have to kill yourself. 6. It was so tiring that my 5yrs old slept and we had to carry her in our arms waiting in this exit que to get the express train. The escalators to climb up to board the train were not functional so we had to take huge staircase with her and our bags with other child. There was no priority given to us despite having a child in arms. All in all, worst experience for huge amount with no facilities to make you comfortable as a guest. They only need your money to make business but give a damn to you or your comfort.

We were really looking forward to visiting USS and unfortunately it was hugely disappointing and we ended up leaving early. Feels like weve wasted a precious day from our trip to Singapore on being hot tired sweaty frustrated and hugely out of pocket. Even though we went early and on a Monday there were such long lines, far longer than the stated time, the ride operators were so slow at each round of the ride they fill it up with like 70% of the people with fast track tickets so felt really unfair. The fast track ticket was nearly as expensive as the main ticket and you have to buy it at the same time as the main ticket. We had a one year old baby and it was very frustrating to just have to carry him in a 40 minute plus queue, we ended up leaving most queues. Even the free shows, you have to get to them in advance otherwise you just miss them and have to wait another two hours for the next show. The meet and greet was so boring, unlike other theme parks where you can interact with the characters, here they just stand behind a rope and people queue up in the heat to take a quick photo and leave. The food again was also majorly disappointing, the cheapest thing you could get was water for 4 and soda for 5 everything else is double restaurant price too and not many great options, mainly just junk food and only 3 are halal. On a positive note the decor in the park was really nice but unfortunately just nothing interactive that you can enjoy without having to queue up for. At the very least they should make all queuing areas air conditioned and properly shaded, not just some far away fans and plastic canopy. There arent even benches to just sit outside to have a rest people just sit in the pavement or have to sit in a restaurant and pay for food. Just overall really not worth the price, came home so deflated unfortunately and wanting a refund as we did not enjoy it. I wouldnt recommend or return - particularly to people with young families.

Most commercialized place in Singapore. Very crowded even for express pass. Hardly any rides for kid. Avoid it if you have 2 to 5 years of kid. Avoid it if you don't like to wait for more than half an hour for simple and useless ride. Had worst experience here

More than 1 hour wait time at almost every ride. Not worth the effort of standing in queue for so long. Management should only allow the right number of visitors that they can manage. Absolutely pathetic experience. I would not recommend this place even if tickets are offered for free.
Eygptian character is really turn off as you stood 10 cm from one kids face. Many attractions are having technical issue. If the ticket is cheap is okay, the fare is expensive

2.review_text: Here for the third time - no improvement in terms of rides and maintenance of the place compared with my first time here 10 years ago. Mummy ride was closed during my visit but finally got to try the coupon and human rides. Crowded even during weekdays. Probably last time here.
Entry experience is HORRENDOUS. None of the ticket scanners recognise tickets purchased in advance. 100's of people walking around in heat not knowing how to get in. Staff overwhelmed

If you are visiting USS, make sure you buy Universal Express Pass as there is huge disparity between general ticket holders and express pass holders. The waiting time for most of the rides today was 60-90 minutes for general ticket holders. I could complete only 7 rides between 10:30 to 7pm. The Human and Cylon Battlestar rides are no good in comparison with Dubai adventure park rides.
Don't go, kids, to Universal parks. At the end of the line you'll grow old
The resort is extremely small, and the restaurant staff is very irritating with their bad attitude.

3.review_text: Great ride and attractions but unless u have express pass which is expensive the queue time is 40 to 1hour for a 5 mins ride or less. It's like 90% walking and waiting and 10% ride. What you really pay here is waiting not the ride. There are less attractions also for kids under 90cm which is kinda disappointing since we came here hoping kids will enjoy
Couldn't enjoy all the rides because of long queues.

Not meeting the expectations. Rides are very mediocre and apt for kids. Not a big park but full of people for rides not worthy of. Try to book from official site to get 1 hour early access for a couple of rides (Transformer is really good). If you can then save your time.

Overall, I had a positive impression of the visit. Pros: Available cafes After 16:00 there are fewer queues You can walk everywhere with a stroller Cons: A rather expensive ticket for such a park Many attractions are under reconstruction Long lines during the day Didn't give me a park map Its not clear what time and where the show is, so we missed a lot Crowds of Indians will not let you take a photo

I came here because the tickets were bought faster online. I can compare it because I was once in a similar park in Bilund, Denmark. Despite the middle of the week and early hours, there were a lot of people and few attractions. Big queues for the roller skates, the water roller skater, the one with mummies and the biggest one, it takes almost an hour to stand there the fun is probably only really for children aged 3-15 I was a bit disappointed because the photos seem to show big attractions but that's not really the case.

4.review_text: I went last monday. The park was full, some queues was at 80min during afternoon (for the roller coaster for e.g.). I recommend to come early to skip the queue. Even with the crowd I did several attractions twice so, one day is enough to fully enjoy. A little bit disappointed, because the return of the mummy was close for renovation. Good point for the differents animations inside the park.

The roller coaster was fun. The decoration is cute and all, good vibes. However, the weather was hot, some indoor queuing had poor ventilation, and it was hard to breathe. The sweat smell, ew, please shower people

(Experience, visited long time ago) It's about the same since my last visit more than a decade before. Although the standard about the same, which means good job for maintaining it. But I certainly hope USS can be more innovative and improve the facilities instead. Really hope to see new park or perhaps new games in the same park. (Tips) Recommended to enter as early as possible so that you can enjoy all the rides as some rides queue time might vary, 5min to average 30min, or sometimes to 120min per ride. Express addon is more than double than normal ticket, but if you want to fully enjoy all rides, consider it. Locker is free to use (with certain quota limit like first 40min is free) and available everywhere. Bring tumbler or water bottle as you can refill it at almost all restrooms area where there's drinking water machine. Food is slightly more expensive, given it's tourist spot, but quality is there. Fair. Download apps, check the special showtime and plan your tour so that you can catch the best show. Bring light raincoat if you want to play water games and avoid purchase expensive raincoat on the spot. Staffs most of them are friendly and helpful. Just remember to smile and ask them nicely. They been repeatedly doing the same thing over and over might get bored sometimes.
Nice theme park but not too large. The queue is very crowded .You should buy an express pass if you don't want to wait too long. The ticket price is expensive

The staff at the rides were particularly helpful, as my husband had injured his foot and was using crutches. Its a shame the park is currently being redeveloped (Madagascar section closed) plus some other activities were closed eg climbing wall in Jurassic Park section.

5.review_text: Visited on Thursday, the day after Singapore public holiday. Did not purchase Express. Because I didn't buy the ticket from the official website, I couldn't enter after 9 o'clock, so I just leisurely entered around 11 o'clock. Transformer upon entering (the app says to wait for 40 minutes, but the wait is for about an hour) Cyclone (30 minutes waiting on the app, 30 minutes actually waiting - it goes away faster than you think) *Really scary. The speed is no joke, but every moment is fast from the start... My feet are floating. It keeps spinning. I almost went crazy. When I come down, my legs are shaking and I feel dizzy. Human (wait for 30 minutes on the app, actually wait for about 20 minutes - it goes away quickly like a cyclone) *I was relieved because there was a footrest, but somehow... when I sit on the chair, my body sinks in and my feet float. Unless you are an adult male over 170cm tall, you cannot touch it. Fortunately, it is slower than a cyclone. Still, I just ran from the starting section up. I almost went crazy with this too. Mummy (Originally, it is a ride with a crazy wait, but it is occasionally closed for maintenance reasons and reopens. If you aim for that time, there is a 5-minute wait, but when you actually get on the human, you start re-entering and get in quickly. But as people come out to get on the ride, the wait becomes 80 minutes) * The interior is cool! Shaking a lot.. Shaking back and forth and left and right. Jurassic (30 minutes on the app - about 20 minutes in reality? It goes away quickly. Unless there is an accident in front) *Every boat is different, but if it doesn't get wet, it doesn't get wet, and if it gets wet, everything gets wet. Depends on who is on the boat with you. For your information, everyone on the boat I was on got very wet. Fortunately, the sunlight is strong so it dries quickly. When you come out of Jurassic, there is a clothes drying tub for a fee. It's smaller than the US or Japan, so it's possible to take the representative train without express. If I buy Express, I can ride it multiple times? The food was pretty good too. If you go to the Jurassic food court, there is a lot of food.

We were here on a weekday. We bought our tickets online and we were an hour early. I really enjoyed the attraction. In the morning we did not wait in lines at all. We caught a lot of the attractions several times. In the afternoon the lines were already 20 minutes long but it's good to take a break if you still ride roller coasters . I really enjoyed the day and haven't had such a good time in a long time. The shops and restaurants are very overpriced in the park. I had a burger at Mel's. You get a really low quality burger for a high price. So be careful.
Great amusement park with digital attractions. The thing is. .you have to wait for the long line but you can purchase their easy access ticket for a smooth queue experience.

It's wonderful experience. Enjoy every moment. Few rides have a waiting period of more than 1 hours. There is a provision of express pass, and I don't know how much it costs. I think it's good to stay in sensota island to have better time management.

Universal Studios is really a place which you shouldnt miss when youre in Singapore. literally I thought this was for kids before going there, This place is really amazing and gives you thrilling experience. Rides which you will definitely enjoy are as below, Transformer Rides Cynon rollercoaster ride and Human rollercoaster ride Mummy revenge Water show (twice a day) And many more If you are a solo traveller then for every ride you need to wait max for 1-2 mins (youre a VIP without express pass) If in group you need to wait 30 mins to 1 hour for each.

1.review_text: Had to wait 2.5h for a roller coaster. Other rides with at least 70 minutes wait. I'm sure the park is great but the queues are brutal and ruined the experience

Alot of ride in renovation and maintenance, only 70% of rides and restaurant are in business. Paid full price for it, what a deal breaker. All visitors become packed to available restaurant / ride that are open. Was raining heavily half day, not enough accommodation for shelter, and most of the ride become offline due to rain. Tough luck, but bad management, shouldnt charge full price for 70% operational theme park. To us, this is the worst univ. std weve ever been to. Never going back. Better spend your money elsewhere.

We went there and bought the general admission ticket for 8085 per person. Then, when we went inside, it was overcrowded. When we went for a ride, it was a 100-minute waityes, over 1 hour just for 1 ride out of 16 attractions. So, to overcome this, the park offers you an express ticket for 100 per person. The ticket counter will sell you a ticket, but most of the attractions are not suitable for kids under 122 cm. So it was a waste of money for us. Altogether, we spent 600 plus 100 for the cable car. By spending 100 on express tickets you will feel like VIP (Very Important Person) as normal crowd is waiting for hours an hours while you can come in and out very quickly. I should have left my feeling at home in Australia that everyone is equal as the park doesn't treat you like that. My question is when they can accommodate large express ticket crowd why not others or make 1 price ticket and only let limited crowd in and out like in Night Safari where you have to pre book. Or else increase the staff or attractions facility. Surely if the business is making money then investing in impoverment won't be a issue. It lacks simple management solutions even though it Universal Studios. The park is overcrowded with Indians tourist mainly. Please mind I am an Indian Australian too. Not against any race, but the park staff was not able to control the crowd. My family and I were pushed 3-4 times while waiting for the attractions. I was elbowed twice. My wife and kid was pushed back by a man so he could break the queue and come to the front of the queue. Also, by the way, most of the time, no one was following the queue. The park will keep selling tickets to make more money; it's like quantity but not quality. I would not recommend it to families with young children or infants and toddlers as it's a waste of time and money. It will probably be okay with children over 6 -7 years plus, not for 3-4 years or below. If you have never being to Universal Studios then go for it. After the experience from Universal Studios we decided to cancel all other plan to water world and rest of the sentosa as I rather have relax holiday in the hotel pool relax and enjoy with kids rather then get pushed around, elbowed or rush around. Probably I would choose Thailand as it got everything to offer to everyone and the management on venue's is way better.

Visited the place on May 6th. 1/4th of the park is under renovation. Most of the kid friendly rides are unavailable. One of the other two major attractions Dinosaur rides is under maintenance. Absolutely useless time to visit the place. Moreover, they have atrocious price for express pass and now they have limited it to one visit per ride. Absolute rip off.

The last time I went pretty much all the adult rides were either under maintenance or not built. I went to service counter to ask for a refund at least on the express pass and was greeted with attitude and a Sorry. Just not good enough. They should tell you prior to purchase whats working. Im an adult and dont do kiddie rides. Im back in September so Ill be checking and I hope anyone reading this also checks before wasting their money or entry into this place.

2.review_text: We travelled to Singapore with two kids, I must say the rides were thrilling and kids really had good fun, it was great experience specially the transformer ride, however I found the staff of few rides to be extremely rude and impolite towards people. There were few who were old and could not understand the directions and staff was literally shouting at them.. this really left a very bad taste in mouth. Hospitality really needs to be worked on ..... After people coming to this place come all the way to Singapore to visit universal studio.

Long time repeat visitor. Recent return visit post Covid was poor. No shelter, expensive lockers, poor queue lines and several rides were being rebuilt (despite same entrance price). The express pass was more expensive than the ticket, why cant they align to Disneys genie pass and pre-booking system that works great and cost half as much.

Went on a Thursday and managed to get the early entry ticket so the crowd was not too crazy yet. I managed to enjoy the rides on sesame street and Transformers. Afterwards i went to Battlestar Galactica. i was already waiting my turn at the gate but everyone was suddenly asked to return to the queue. As all of us were waiting, there wasnt any information or explanation given. We waited for a good 10-15 mins before an announcement was made that there were technical difficulties and the rides are delayed. Waited for 10 mins and no updates were given how long. Slowly everyone started leaving. A man asked the staff what is happening and the staff only said we have technical difficulties and unfortunately we dont exactly know what is causing it. You can stay but we dont know how long it will take or you can leave. I waited for about 15 mins and they still said they did not know what the issue was. There wont be much they would do for service recovery either. So i feel like the early entry ticket was wasted or useless as i didnt get to ride at all afterwards. The ride was only working about 30 mins after i left which is about the same time that more crowds were forming. When i wanted to ride, the wait time was more than 2 hours. Not only did i not get to ride it, when i waited for the transformer photo taking, it also delayed for 10-15 mins. Now i understand as it might be difficult to wear the costume but it was kinda frustrating as the queue was under the hot sun. We were not allowed to wait under the shelter either as it is considered to be entering the staffs zone. USS used to be fun and enjoyable, now just seems to be full of delays and issues without any service recovery. If you were to complain, they wont do anything much either and probably wont do anything when i write this review too. So just take note of this if you plan on going USS.

Went there on 20.05.2024. Disappointed that maracasar was shut down. The jurrasic water ride was down for servicing. Yet all this information was not made available to us online before we bought the tickets. The costs of tickets remain the same even . Thus the queue to the remaining rides was longer than usual.
too crowded, staff cant control the queue

3.review_text: Long queue times even on weekdays. Some attractions will be closed, Especially when it rains, it pours in Singapore lots of renovations and expansion ongoing hopefully itll be better in the next 3 years. I queued for Transformer ride only to be informed the ride is malfunctioning. Great staff though

I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore and had an overall great time, but my experience was somewhat mixed. The rides were fantastic, with my favorites being the Transformers ride, Battlestar Galactica, and The Mummy. These rides were thrilling and well worth the visit. However, I encountered a significant issue with the line management. There were often no staff present to guide the lines or monitor the crowd, which led to many people cutting in line. A specific group (and race) was particularly disrespectful, blatantly cutting lines and even applauding themselves for doing so. They were in large groups, which made the situation even more frustrating and disrupted the overall experience. Additionally, in such a closed environment, the lack of proper ventilation became quite apparent, making it uncomfortable with the poor smell lingering around. Sadly, the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure was closed during my visit, which was disappointing as I was looking forward to it. Despite these issues, I would still recommend visiting Universal Studios Singapore. The rides and attractions are top-notch, but I would advise against going on weekends to avoid the large crowds. Also, be vigilant for line cutters to ensure a more enjoyable experience.

Has significantly went down the drain since I last visited. The park looked to be understaff, and alot of the staff where not pleasant and generally looked to be angry they were there working. The park was subpar compared to the parks in LA or Orlando or Osaka.

I have been to this place 7-8 times and can feel everytime it's a degraded rather than upgraded version of USS. No new attractions came up and some of the existing attractions are closed now forever. Many a time some of the rides are not working, I can really feel the change in USS and it's not for a good reason

As I am a theme park lover and have been to various parks in America and Europe, I have to say that I was disappointed... The park is quite small and there are far too many visitors for that! The attractions are sometimes great and sometimes ok. We didn't do all of them at all, even though the park is small, but at some point we just didn't feel like queuing for 40-60 minutes anymore. The queues are long and sometimes things were not accessible. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed with the overall package considering the price-performance ratio, but there are also some cool attractions. The Minion area is scheduled to open this year, perhaps. Is it better then?

4.review_text: Good experience but not as good as other universals like LA. Rides and attractions are lesser in Singapore as compared to other universals. Queue was terrible and at some places wait was as high as 80 mins. Their VIP price is too high. some rides were really good.

Admission ticket is not cheap.A bit small compare to other USS..waiting for minionland to open.Some rides are exciting and really worth queuing Eg Revenge of The Mummy.a bit rundown need some revamp..

Great theme park, having the AC in the shops was a true saver with the constant hot days. Easy to get to via the MRT or Grabb plus catch the light rail from Vivo city. Don't buy your ticket on the day cos they will have already sold out! We made that mistake and had to go back the next day. There is a few places to eat in universal ..certainly expensive though. Tbh universal did lack atmosphere compared to Numerous other theme parks l have been to which was disappointing. Not the best for young families are there are limited rides for young children.

If this is your first experience with theme parks, it's great, but for us (we've been to Orlando in the US, Disneyland in Paris, etc.) it wasn't crazy. The whole thing took us about 5/6 hours (compared to other parks it is rather small) and we didn't like any of the attractions enough to go a second time. Very nice WaterWorld show, a nice time, but we wouldn't go again. We were there on May 5, the queues were not long, about 25 minutes to the attraction, the price was SGD 84.
Amazing place but too much waiting time for each of the rides ie more than 30 minutes

5.review_text: Nice place but long wait(queue) for entering each ride. If you can afford express tickets then you can avoid long queue
Lovely theme park, lots of ride but it is crowded every day and any day. Express pass additional 100 is recommended. Otherwise mostly crowd recedes after 5pm or so.

After Disneyland paris...second theme park...loved it...would rate Disneyland paris a little ahead then USS... Queues were too long for some ride like transformers ride where we had to wait for more than 90 mins... Coming from an Indian, there should be strict watch kept on other Indians as they try to break queues to go ahead..all in all...a lovely place where we enjoyed to the fullest with our kids...loved ( a) Steven Spielbergs sound room where they simulated a storm(b) transformers ride ( c) dance with king julien ( d) Shrek 4d movie... Lot of eating options and loved the meals..

Please try for early entry so that everything will be covered. The waiting times are higher for some of the events .So plan accordingly. Mummy , Transformer, Water world are the more attractive shows .
Bit disappointed with few rides under maintenance but over all great experience Especially Transformers Ride And roller coaster

1.review_text: Terrible experience with my family. For the amount we paid for tickets, Id at least expect all the rides to be functioning but at least 2 were down. Every ride was manned by only 1 person. These lone rangers were clearly overwhelmed and stopped scanning express passes so pretty much everyone was cutting the line. Queue times were at a ridiculous 60-80 mins on average. There were actual employees walking around with expresses passes for sale here signs to entice people to pay a ridiculous 100 more for the ability to stand in a line. USS is a tourist trap and for suckers who cant entertain their children any other way.
If you sell more tickets than your capacity, you will make people wait for 1 hour for each activity. A business that does not respect people. Don't come here if possible.

Although its a quite famous place, but the service and equipment need to get improved. Can not imagine that the park just let people stand under super strong sunshine for an hour never come unless it improves the service.

Super over-crowded. Per ride Q time avg 40min to 150min. 100 for express Q with only 1 ride each. What a rip-off. Even restaurants Q times 1 hour avg. Only taken 2 rides during 6 hours in the park. Won't visit again in future.

This place is small. During our visit. Several rides were out intermittently. The fact that they do not allow you to go out and come back in on a day pass is ridiculous. I think if we have bought a legit day pass to enjoy the rides, we should be held hostage in the theme park to feast on their hyper inflated food and beverages options.

2.review_text: I am a local SG. My expectation was high for SG USS after visiting Japan USS. SG USS lost out in terms of the lack of energy level and customer service attitude of the theme park staff. One of the USS staff ignored me when I asked him some questions, yet when a Caucasian guy asked him, the same staff smiled politely and entertained him. This is unfair treatment and racism in SG from our local staff.

The good: Very clean and well laid out. Rides were very fun, but some are aging. Waterworld show was the highlight of the day. The bad: Food prices are a bit high for what you get, but the quality was decent. The ugly: The wait time for rides was incredibly long. We would not return based on this criteria. The park/staff are very slow on turn around times for rides (60-110mins for each).

Service staff didn't help in crowd control during meet and greet with Minions. The staff who helped in photo taking for visitors with our handphone also did not help to ensure photos are clear. Just hurried everyone off. The people dresses up as Characters are also not friendly towards the kids. Need more training. Very little entertainment for kids below 6yo. Timing of Trolls show on Friday was changed from 12noon to 2pm at short notice. The park was hot, with limited dining options or resting place for young kids. There is also no re entry allowed.
