We left at 12.30pm 2 hrs after entry, very disappointed and waste of time. Not recommended for families with children less than 6 years old.

I really recommend to buy the tickets online before going to the Universal Studios. Regarding the experience, it was bad mostly because it is really crowded and queues waiting time varies from 20 to 120 minutes, depending on how many people want to see that specific attraction. Also, the AC system is not available that much when you wait to enter at most of the attractions. Overall, it is really crowded so they get much money and they can invest in better AC system. I am not a big fan of this kind of and this is a bias, but the overall client experience may be improved for sure. If you want to save time and not wait 1 hour per attraction at the queue, you should buy the express line unlimited experience.

This is my first time in such a place. I thought it would be incredible, but I was wrong! For adults only a roller coaster, transformers and everything! The lines for the rides are about an hour. I grew a beard in them that day. Even those who bought a ticket for VIP skip-the-line access stood in VIP queues! At the end of one, right in front of us, after standing for more than an hour, they closed for unknown reasons!!! In general, so-so! It will do for the first experience! But it wasn't worth that kind of money!!!

3.review_text: It is recommended to consider purchasing an express pass on weekends due to the significant crowds encountered during our visit. This resulted in an inability to experience any rides due to the extensive wait times. Additionally, the management of the wait lines appeared inadequate. It was observed that the standard pass did not provide any discernible priority, which is concerning and requires immediate attention. While the park itself is remarkable and worthy of visitation, it is regrettable that additional expenditure on an express pass is seemingly necessary to access the rides. It is imperative that the management devise a strategy to effectively manage the crowds and reduce wait times, thereby ensuring a seamless experience for all visitors.

We visited Universal Studios Singapore on a working day, hoping it would be less crowded. However, since it was June, a holiday season, the park was quite busy. The wait times for rides were long, ranging from 30 to 90 minutes. The food is overpriced, but the meal sizes are decent. One major disappointment was that an entire section of Minions was closed, and there was no information about this when we purchased our tickets. Overall, it was an okay experience, but the crowds and lack of upfront information about ride closures were frustrating
Queue too long. Not worth the wait. No queue at start of opening hours

Universal Studios Singapore gets a thumbs up for thrilling rides and exciting shows based on popular movies and cartoons. Visitors consistently mention rides like Transformers and Revenge of the Mummy as highlights. However, there are some downsides to consider. On the negative side, we observed long wait times for rides, Food and drinks inside the park can also be expensive. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore seems like a fun theme park experience, especially for families with young children or fans of the featured movies. But be prepared for crowds and potentially long lines, and factor in the cost of food when budgeting for your trip. Secret tips: High demand rides like cylon and human have low demand after 5pm Jurassic park rapid will make your shoes wet so you can avoid

It was fun, but a quarter of the rides was closed-down, and we had to wait almost an hour for the transformer but it was worth it. You might think it is a short queue based on the queue outside but there was an even longer queue inside and the board showing how long it would take you to get into it outside was just a total lie . Ignore it as it will take you a lot longer if you went at around 12-3.30 oclock. It was fun but I am kind of disappointed. We had trouble finding a place to eat because the restaurants are mostly closed though the ones that are open had wonderful food. If you want to straight away go into the park,buy tickets online as it is a lot faster.

4.review_text: Ive been here 11 years ago and I can tell that the crowd doubled including during weekdays. Nothing change with the rides specially the transformers still the same. Queueing or waiting time is ride dependable Shrek - 30 minutes Transformers - 1hr and so The Mummy - 30 minutes Roller coaster Human - 15 minutes Cyclone - 10 minutes Etc

Quite a nice theme park to visit. The queues can be really long though, with rides averaging nearly 1h of waiting time during peak periods. The food is generally of average quality, and can be really expensive for the quality and portions offered.

Dated rides with Minion rides still not available with no line of sight to when it will open. Food is expensive but more importantly average at best. The "Lights Camera Action" was meant to showcase how special effects are made, but it was easily 20 years ago so it looks more like a museum than a showcase of their special effect technology.

Went there twice weekend once and weekday once, both time it was packed. All highlight rides waiting time is 1 hr to 1 and half hr, wasted more time there. Went to discovery food court and walked around the court with our food tray for 10mins cos most people book the table by putting their bags before even buying their food. Thankfully one of the staff name YARA went around and ask few tables if they are done eating as theyre many people waiting for table. Grateful for her kind help. Otherwise the games and management is good, heart pumping and enjoyable rides..

There are a bit few amusement facilities. You have to queue up when you first enter the park in the morning. The crowds begin to decrease in the evening, so there is relatively little time to queue up for the amusement facilities.

5.review_text: They should manage the queue more efficiently. It's not right for letting children to queue for an hour for a ride

Very atmospheric and beautiful park! One of the best places we visited in Singapore. There are not many attractions, the queues are quite long, you can stand for about 40 minutes. Its just great for a walk, if you want to ride, its better to take a more expensive ticket so as not to stand in long queues

Overall good experience despite 3rd time visiting! Last visit was almost 10years ago, proving their excellent maintenance! Probably because of long weekends, the queue for some of the rides were pretty long. Still, most of the rides were very enjoyable and exhilarating (even though I have slight fear of heights but I really enjoyed the thrill of roller coaster)

Nice place for family activities. Kids and adults like it. Most of the thrill activities are the one has less queues. Kids like to go again and again in the main 2 thrill rides... If any rides waiting time is more like 50 mins, you may skip firbtime being and come again after you done other rides, the waiting time will change based on the crowd. Snacks and drinks sold there are very extand not so taste nice.

It is the June holidays and we went on a weekday. The place was super crowded and it started from the Sentosa Express trip. Therefore, I decide to go for an express pass paying 100 each for Universal Express queue. It is the same price for children also. According to the queue time for Battlestar Galactica, it will be a 2hrs wait, after waiting in line with an express pass of 30 minutes, it was closed due to wet weather. We went on other rides. I think age has caught up with me and I found Mummy ride to be scary also, especially when I went backwards. Food at the Discovery Food Centre was expensive, with an average of 16/main. Nonetheless, it was pretty expected and fortunately, there was a discount for Passion Card members. For WaterWorld, the staff really take pails and pails of water and one will be drenched if you are seated in the splash zone. Do sit in the area if you are alright getting wet. Fortunately, there are drying pods outside the area.

1.review_text: First their staff behaviour was damn worst Simply they treat u like goats .. Next they keep wait time 60-200 min almost 3h.20 min y ? without planning taking too much admission just earn money right?! until 7 pm suddenly they reduced the wait time.. no where u find a chair to sit even u sit some place their staff scold u get away as if they are landlords .. exactly 8 pm they close & they keep open all the sales counters alone y ? To make money ? next food Water bottle(200 ml )-4 Singapore dollar Baby food - 14 Singapore dollars which is worst Food minimum 16 Singapore dollars which is so expensive..! I prefer dont waste ur time money & dignity In between they stop entry ride dont know y? Shows at specific time only so u need to go there

Universal Studios Singapore is a super scam! Even if I bought a quick pass to get in, I still had to queue for more than 40 minutes. The point is, 3 or 4 of the fun ones said they were not open for maintenance!

Not a great experience for us. We waited over 2hrs to get on 1 ride only to be told it had broken down and that we should leave the queue and find another ride to go on. We walked around the park looking at more rides but the wait times were all 1.5-2.5hrs long. There are too many people jammed in one space, that you feel as though you are constantly bumping into people. We left without going on a single ride, with strict instruction that a refund was not possible. Overall very disappointing.
Pathetic experience..long queue..technical issues in most of the rides

Lines are long, they are greedy and upgrade visitors to vip that can afford it to cut the lines which slows down the general line even more. In the park for 4 hours today and will only have time for 2 rides, after paying 400 for the family to get in. Over priced and not worth it.

2.review_text: Whats the deal with people running the Puss n Boots ride? They have to constantly stop the ride because the attendants havent queued enough people, the attendants just chitchat with one another while the ride is stopped waiting for riders, they take 75% from the express pass line sometimes 100% from the express pass line while letting cars stop and go unfilled. Its ludicrous. The ticket portal does not work for foreign credit cards and theres no way to buy with Apple/Google Pay. This was a problem 1yr ago and its still there. You have to shop 3rd party vendors for advanced ticket purchase but still have to wait in a long queue at customer service to get your park ticket. Thats bonkers. The app didnt work for half the day. Kept giving bad gateway errors despite being on Resort World Sentosas WiFi. Its an otherwise great park but their ride management needs work along with their customer service and systems.

The scores are very high for a park that is so infunctional: - the technical problems continue, considerably lengthening the already interminable waiting time (the time to complete 5 attractions in the day) - certain attractions like Acceleration are very poorly optimized. The operators take their time to evacuate the attraction but especially to install it. The wagons are not even filled and instructions are recalled at the start of each turn even though we have heard them 150 times before. Longer transition times than attraction times... - very time-consuming mandatory locker system (waiting at terminals, touch screen bug). Why not use the same system as the other parks? - the density of people is much too high. They have to determine maximum quotas, the park is small. In short, an amateur category compared to Disneyland Paris, Europapark or even Universal Los Angeles

Went on Thursday, 25 July with my family. When we reached, there were a lot of people outside! Lots of tour groups too. And there was a bit of queue to enter the park too. Was very disappointed that the first ride we went to, had a malfunction. And we had spent 40mins waiting to go for the ride. Only to have it stop just as it had started. There were instructions to stay in our seats and that the ride would resume soon. We waited for another 20mins. We had thought the ride would resume. But we were brought to the end of the ride. After spending more than an hour in the the attraction. The staff there gave the affected guests a free fast pass for one ride. But still, time had been wasted. But most of the day, we just spent waiting to get on rides as the timing would be 30 to 60mins for each ride. I guess because the park was blocked and they were making another attraction. But it was also super crowded! And not only that, but it was also hard to get around. And while queing up, some guests kept pushing and going into our space. Overall not a good experience today. But the rides were great as usual. Maybe next time, there could be a limit as to how much guests should be allowed into the park. As it really was too crowded. Thank you

Place is not enjoyable without express pass. Each ride is 40-70mins wait time. We regret to pre order for a cheaper price as the price to upgrade inside is way more expensive vs booking it months before. Imagine we visited on weekdays and still got crazy crowds.

Nice park, that's for sure. Entrance on the large side, also very busy, you will have to wait in line for an hour or much longer. You get the feeling that you are mainly part of a commercial plan to milk yourself as much as possible, once but not again.

3.review_text: Didn't have great experience for both times I was here a while back. I booked the ticket through the website and while the payment was in progress, there was some kind of errors/hang. When it was responsive again, I didn't realize the date had been refreshed to that day's date (I was booking for the day after). Because of this error, we lost half a day because we needed to rush there since I couldn't change the ticket, wasting a lot of money and time. For both times, the Jurrasic Park ride was closed. There were long queue for almost all the rides and we didn't get to enjoy much although I had a full day on one of my visits. The theming are good, some rides are enjoyable, but I don't think it's worth the money. The same thing can be said for almost all popular theme parks, however, the odd of getting the same ride broke down for two different visits shouldn't be that high.

Some rides were not working the reason was maintenance given by staff... Long ques and not proper management. In the transformer ride we were stuck in a ride due to a mechanical issue for 10 min. Do not visit sea world waste of time and money. All plastic... Rest all have fun... Time pass

The queues were horrible even in the morning of a weekday, so I recommend buying the express pass. The park itself has not that many rides and I would say not suitable for older children. The drinks and food were expensive as expected. Overall, would not choose to go there again unless you are a diehard fan of Universal studios or has kids who really want to go there.
Overhyped Overrated Reasons : stand in queue for 1- 2 hr for max 5 mins of ride

Weve visited this universal studios many times over the past decade. Unfortunately its taken turn for the worse until the upgrades are done. The entire Madagascar sections have gone while they replace with Minions. So basically there are fewer attractions now. Vary little offering of photos like before. I think it would be fair to say wait until upgrades are completed or universal studios should discount the tickets

4.review_text: I came here on Monday, thought it wouldn't be crowded, but it was unbelievably crowded! Every game requires you to wait in line for 45-90 minutes, so if you try hard all day, you can play 3 games (and you'll be tired from having to queue a lot). While you have to wait in line for your turn, people who buy additional priority cards (Universal Express) take turns passing you to play first, turning you into a 2nd class citizen in this area! Besides the roller coaster game called Cyclone which is unique, the other games are also normal, especially the 4D cinema (in the Far Far Away area) is very ordinary. Outdoor shows like Minion and Mega are boring as hell (and last about 5-10 minutes). There is not much shade in the park, and especially there is almost no place to sit and rest, so walking all afternoon in the sun in this area is a torture. In short, if you want to play games comfortably here, in addition to the entrance ticket (83 SGD), you must also buy a priority card (120 SGD). Otherwise, just come here to walk and take pictures.

Visited through grab and dropped off in front of casino; satisfied as we could get in there before opening. For ticketing from the webpage, you can buy 1hr early entrance. Waiting time was less during opening time period and after 5pm. Even though we had to wait 60-70min during day time, after than 5pm, there was only 5-15min. I thought whether to buy express ticket, on the day we visited, even it was LNY peak period, riding attractions was enough to enjoy without the express ticket. ** revisited in July, and it was crowded and queue were still long until the late evening. So we used single rider to avoid longer waiting time for our 2nd round of ride. My sons loved there so much. Not that big we could look around within a day, which is good thing for us. For attractions, Transformer 4D, mummy, shrek 4D were great. Strongly recommend Water world show- they are perform twice a day at 1:30pm and 4:30pm. Human, cylon, and the water ride in Jurassic park were good for me but seems some people dislike these ones due to the height or getting wet. The Water ride is definitely wet. Youd better preparing raincoat seriously. treasure hunter, troll show, puss in boots were just okay for us. There was lots of photo spot and characters so check the time first. Dragon and kungfu panda is at 7:30pm. For lunch, we had hotdog in jurassic park. Almost 20 per person.

**Universal Studios Singapore: A Thrilling Experience with a Few Hiccups** As an avid theme park enthusiast, I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore. While the overall experience was exhilarating, there were a couple of issues that prevented me from giving it a perfect 5-star rating. **What I Loved:** 1. **Rides and Attractions:** The rides are top-notch, especially Battlestar Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy. The attention to detail in each themed area is commendable. 2. **Immersive Worlds:** Walking through Hollywood, Ancient Egypt, and Far Far Away felt like stepping into beloved movies. The ambiance is captivating. 3. **Shows and Performances:** The WaterWorld show and the street performances added an extra layer of entertainment. Kudos to the talented performers! **Areas for Improvement:** 1. **Queue Times:** You hit the nail on the head here. The queue times displayed often didn't match the actual wait. Waiting for 20 minutes turned into a 2-hour ordeal. 2. **Seating:** Agreed! Some queue lines lacked seating areas. Standing for hours can be exhausting, especially in the tropical heat. **Tips for Fellow Visitors:** - **Early Bird Advantage:** Arrive early to beat the crowds and enjoy shorter wait times. - **Hydrate and Rest:** Bring water and take short breaks. Your feet will thank you! - **Patience Is Key:** Remember, everyone's there for the same reasonto have a blast! Despite the glitches, Universal Studios Singapore remains a must-visit for thrill-seekers and movie buffs alike. Just be prepared for a few twists and turns beyond the rides!

A nicely themed and clean theme park. Fun attractions, shows and entertainment. Queue times range anywhere from as low as 10 minutes all the way up to 100 minutes with usual waiting times around 20-50 minutes. The park is not as big as the American parks but the attractions are fun, well designed and of high quality. The staff members are kind and helpful. Many dining options throughout the park ranging from typical western restaurants to a wide selection of local food. One day is enough to experience all the larger attractions in the park. Buying tickets in advance isnt necessary, I found the ticket prices at the ticket booth to be slightly cheaper than what is offered online.
This is transformers attraction. Using very low ticket, it will cost your time to queue.

5.review_text: Admission to the park on Tuesday 07/09 (stay 0830-1530) is always crowded Suggestions: 1. Buy early entry to the park and take photos and have breakfast. 2. Buy express passes (I dont know if its related to the summer vacation. Its only one-time and there is no unlimited express passes). 3. Go to the queue at 10.00 for those who cannot use express passes. 2 items 4. The most terrifying mecha roller coaster. There is no need to queue until around 1500, but the seats are very smelly of sweat. For your reference Ps When I left the kindergarten, I saw a lot of Chinese childrens camp groups. Everyone had big and small bags of souvenirs and toys. Its not like I left the kindergarten empty-handed. Haha.

Amazing theme park in Southeast Asia. Love the design, atmosphere, and many attractions to enjoy. Like almost everything else in Singapore, the operations are very efficient and HighTech. The waiting at the opening gate was usually crowded, especially during the Holidays or weekend on peak season, but rest assured that the lines are moving very quickly and to save more time, I suggest you buy the ticket online (I used Klook). The line to any attractions is quite long though, so if you want to save some times, you can buy the Universal Express Pass. The attractions, went through almost every one of them and enjoy it so much. The staffs are also very courteous, saw a few people trying to cut the line but the staffs handled it very professionally so kudos to them. Love everything here and would be a great place to enjoy your day with your partner or love ones. With many attractions are currently on the way, I hope to visit there again one day.
I love the rollercoasters there. It is a thrilling experience. However, wait times can go up to 150 mins. Even the express queue was quite long. OVERAL: it was great place!!!!

Entry tickets are expensive and queues are long. Buying express tickets is not much different from the normal queue because there are also a lot of people buying express tickets. Fun games but set aside time all day just to play here. Food in the area is expensive.

Bring umbrella or hat. It is HOT. Only few places that have a cover, rest directly under the sun bright. Queue for one attraction can be more that 60 minutes. We didnt manage to get in any attraction :( But it is worth to visit.

1.review_text: On August 1st of 2024 my family and I went to universal studio Singapore, we got the express pass but no priority was felt. We waited for more than 30 minutes per ride on average, with one ride (Jurassic Park) that exceeded an hour of wait. The roller coasters were 40 mins more on average, it was truly a horrible experience. In the shrek theater, one woman yelled at all of us for trying to enter when she opened the door with no clear instructions with what we should do. One person who was in charge of the bumblebee ride (turning cups) was incredibly rude to an Indian woman as he wrongly miscalculated the number of tickets that was given to him. The overall experience was terrible and avoid this amusement park at all costs. If it wasnt for the google system, Id give this place a -100 stars for being overcrowded, bad service attitude, and horrible ride experiences. This park is not worth visiting and should reflect on their operation and service. They should also consider making the fast pass actually fast as opposed to us throwing worthless money into a pass that made us wait for 60 mins with the worst service possible.

Even on a weekday, queues were ridiculously long, with average waiting time of more than an hour. The number of visitors that could be allowed to enter the place should be better managed. The whole place seemed old and dirty. The rides were boring, except the Transformers ride which was more fun & thrilling.

The queues were unbelievable, the longest I've ever had in a theme park. And they were all like that, not just the bigger rides. The rides didn't last very long compared to other theme parks. Everything was very expensive. This is the worst theme park I've been to and not worth the money. I tried to upgrade to an express pass to beat the queues but was refused a third mortgage so couldn't pay for it. The kids couldn't stand more waiting so we left early afternoon rather than spend any more time here.

I went from Australia to Universal Studios Singapore to spend my birthday with great expectations. I put birthday stickers on my clothes, but no staff said hello to me. Universal Studios Singapore is the worst park I have ever experienced. The staff is unenthusiastic. Popular games are said to have technical issues and cannot be played. The queue for one item lasts for more than three hours. The waiting line does not indicate how long the wait is. It is really a very bad birthday experience at Universal Studios Singapore.
The worst theme park ever : at least 1h of queue for any attraction, everything is ridiculously pricy, attractions feel like a 2015 thing I would not recommend

2.review_text: Universal Studios is small but suitable for us with children to enjoy easily. However, most of the staff have poor service attitude. They are not required to greet you with a smile, and there is no need to look askance. I dont know how staff training is done, but I feel that most locals are like this. Maybe this is their normal life. reflect. Also, the toilets are too dirty and messy, and the passenger flow is not large. I dont know why the toilets are so dirty, messy and poor. The quality of Singaporean people can only be reflected outside?

I love Singapore. Civilised, and it is based around people. Universal just is not. Forget it unless you have paid extra for express tickets. I saw exhausted and pissed off faces all around me. Roo few rides open, and too many people in the park.

Never try to come on Friday Saturday and Sunday. Everyone qued 3 hours for 1 ride. Manage to play 3 rides out 20 rides, despite going at 11am (opening 10am) to 7pm (closing time). 8 hours in there. Play 3 rides (each rides 3 to 5 mins play). Que 7 hours 45 mins. Ridiculous. Express pass is exorbitant at 140 SGD / pax, to be paid on top of the standard ticket (83 sgd) Highly don't recommend. Not sure about weekdays. Design and environment is ok

It's a terrible experience. I chose to go on a weekday because i thought it would be crowded on weekends. But how wrong i was. If you're okay with 100 minute wait for any ride, then go for it - but that's not okay for me. Crowd control is lacking, and those persons who have been deployed for crowd control are overworked so they're rude. Even rude coffeeshop aunties are better than the crowd control staff. It's not worth 83 for this nonsense. I went to nagashima in japan and the coasters there trounce USS coasters by a huge margin. My 83 was a donation to Sentosa. It was just a scam.

Its definitely cool that Singapore has its very own Universal Studios but was disappointed in our last visit. It seems that there is no limit in number or timing for Express tickets so be prepared for ridiculously long lines in the heat even if you buy this expensive extra. If you dont, Im afraid you and your family are going to need to get used to queuing for hours because thats what your day will be. Honestly, with much else to do in Singapore, Id recommend giving this a miss (maybe even skip Sentosa entirely).

3.review_text: Queues at the attractions are long

And as Fantozzi would say: a crazy Ka!!! If you come to Singapore you will save money and precious time.. a small park with few attractions and endless queues to do the few attractions.. in practice they force you to buy the fast track ticket.. a bit the same story as all these parks now.. Without considering that the most important part, that of the minions, is still under construction.. NOT RECOMMENDED!!! The island on which it stands, called SENTOSA, is beautiful

On 11 Aug 24 at about 1830h, my friend and I were entering the "Human" roller coaster ride (Battlestar Galactica) after depositing our bags in the lockers. The young man on duty checking us with a security device (did not see his name on his name tag), shouted at my friend saying "hey! where are you going?!) when he mistakenly walked to the wrong lane to enter the ride. This young man was very rude to have shouted in a condescending tone to a visitor of the attraction. Moreover, my friend did not misbehave and he merely walked on a wrong lane thinking it was the right path to enter the ride. This young man on duty at the HUMAN ride on 11 Aug 24 at around 1830H needs to be polite and humble since he is in the service line. His tone was like an instructor in a SAF Camp and we were like recruits in the olden days. Gosh. Can the management find out who was this young man and signal him appropriately? He will invite more negative comments to US.
Queues per ride are crazy long. I recommend going on rides only on two conditions: you are one of the first people who entered the park (short queue lines) or you purchased an express pass.

Good part first: Amazing attractions and few rides are unique. For example transformers were amazing. Talking about trilling rides there are only 4 rides. Those are amazing and unique. Rest and below average. Now cons: 1. There is long queue on all rides, you can expect average 90 mins and upto 2.5 hours in each ride. Practically its impossible to cover all rides on standard pass. I think it management should limit admissions in a day so that queue can be reduced. Right now its totally not worth it just because of queue. With 2 hours of waiting you will cover only 4 rides. Each ride will last for 5-10 mins and you will be in queue for 8 hours. This not at all good. 2. If you are looking for trilling rides and experience, this might not be right place gor you as they have very limited trilling rides, only 4. And waiting time on rides make it worst. Conclusion: Because of queue, its not value for money if you purchase standard pass. If you purchase express pass, its still not value for money because of high ticket cost and less number of attractions. However if you do not mind paying for express pass, go ahead and try once. Its good.

4.review_text: The size of the park is much smaller than that of Japan. The amusement facilities are the same as when we came here 15 years ago. The gift shop in the park also makes people not want to buy it. I only recommend it to friends who come to Singapore for the first time to experience it.

I'm deducting 1 star (which is very small compared to what I experienced) from the management of this place. On 07/28/24, my friends and I were in line to enter the Transformers ride. Sat 3 hours and ended up not playing. You don't even say The ride breaks or there's a problem. You leave nearly 100 customers waiting in line inside this area, all of whom have no idea what's going on outside. Finally, when walking to the player Only your staff stood handing out tickets to return to the ride by 31/07/24 (but I came today to play today) and upon exiting the ride. There are many customers wanting answers about what happened. But you only replied "I don't know and can't give you an answer." We who are waiting to ride this attraction. No one has played at all. And I wasted 3 hours. I planned to stay here all day to play your famous attractions. But my friends and I feel sorry and regret coming to this place. I would like to suggest that you have a better way to communicate issues to customers about damaged or unplayable players. I believe everyone is here to have fun and spend money. (which is quite a bit) to have a good experience at your place So please take my advice as a customer and improve your management in the future :)

The Theme park has to get organized for the crowd they Invitee. EXPRESS LANE is an expensive part however we have to keep waiting for long time for every ride. Normal pass more than an hour waiting for every ride Hardly 5-6 rides people can consider to take after waiting Long day.
Small park. Too many technical problems. Too much waiting time. Difficult to move around

I visited on a Saturday, and the wait was very long because I failed to guess. Come in with a regular ticket and get a fast pass while waiting? I also saw families buying it. Jurassic Park? I went there after waiting for 40 minutes, but due to the huge crowd and sudden heavy rain, all outdoor rides were stopped, so it seemed like I only waited for 2 hours... haha Then, it rained heavily for a while, so I took advantage of the time when many people left to ride one more popular ride (I think I waited for about 30 minutes?) and looked at the goods before leaving. I left a little after 4 o'clock, and there were people entering at that time.

5.review_text: The best time in singapore. Everything was just perfect. Fantastic rides, Long queues, well organised, if you got money to spare express pass helps to shorten the line of wait. Main rides are usually 60 to 90 minutes of wait time. Overall a pleasant experience with family and friends.

Been here 3 times. Best amusement park for me. I love the transformers ride and roller coaster. Had to buy the express pass to skip queue so that I can play over and over many times. Or else will have to wait 3-4 hours long for one ride.

This is still one of the top visitors attraction in Singapore. Ever-changing, some of the themes have been renovated, like this month is about minions, it is after 6 months since my last visit, the exhibits are constantly changing and it make it fun. There are early entry tickets for sales , and you can enter the theme park from 8 am instead of the usual 10am so that you can enjoy the breakfast and tour some of the venue before the crowds stream in.

My purpose for visiting Singapore is to go to Universal Studios, and compared to its size with Universal Studios Los Angeles, it is considered small. The Harry Potter castle is not located in the Singapore branch, but we enjoyed the games available, whether 3D or 4D games or outdoor games, and I took express entry tickets and it saved me a lot of time because waiting in some Games take an hour, while express entry takes less than five minutes in most of them.
Had so much fun while visiting this place. Fun rides but long waiting time (even on weekdays), as expected from a theme park. But, you must come here if you plan to go to Singapore.

1.review_text: Having been to Florida a few times I was excited to visit Universal Singapore however that initial excitement quickly disappeared when I saw the queue for the first ride Cyclon (battlestar galactic rollercoaster) which was 90 minutes. First off they are militant about not having your phone or any bag on you and check prior to entering the queue meaning you can't even try and plan your day whilst waiting. And also basically no ride set up and amusement when waiting in line makes for a rather long and boring wait. Even the 1st class citizens who pay more than the price of the park ticket again to get the 'priority pass' had to wait about 30 minutes for the ride. Absolutely detest this scummy system parks seem to use but it seems to be standard and not normally too much of an issue if regular queue times are reasonable and rides have single rides options (of which I only seen this option for the transformer 4d coaster at Singapore universal) Eventually we managed to get on the coaster and it was pretty mid, the hulk or velocicoaster from Florida this is not. Anyway this set the scene for the rest of the day. Huge lines for pretty much all rides / shows and pretty average when you actually got to experience it. Also this was a Monday so I don't know if that makes a difference but I wouldn't want to see this park on a busy weekend. The water world show was ok. Probably the best thing there... And actually managed to see it without a massive wait which was a bonus. Overall I would avoid this park, it would make for an ok day out if they let about half of the people in on a daily basis but that would not line their coffers I guess....

It is not as worthwhile as its hype. They need to work a lot on their management and staff. The staff is quite rude. Bought a universal pass, but not all rides have a queue for universal pass entry, so we have to wait in the regular pass queue. Friday but still roller coaster were closed. And aahhh the heat . They only let some people to take pictures with characters. We can't touch the transformer and can only take photos with family, no single ones. Again, the staff was rude and immature. I think the people of Sentosa are quite rude compared to other areas of singapore. Never gonna visit again Will go for disney land and florida studio. Expensive but not worth it.

The attraction was great, but I had a very unpleasant experience waiting outside for "Meet the Transformers" with my Transformer child. We were waiting outside the established control line when an employee asked us to move in a different direction, so we moved to the location she requested. An employee wearing a nametag named Hafiz came back angrily and asked me to go somewhere else. I didn't think it was my fault because I followed the location requested by the staff when I initially requested a move. And since I followed the staff's instructions and stayed outside the clearly established control line, if my location was an issue, the control line was wrong or it was the staff's fault who asked me to move first, not mine. So, if necessary, I think it is something to kindly explain and provide guidance to, and not something to get angry at and throw a tantrum at my 8-year-old child and me. I hope your company reflects on whether holding an event that makes visitors angry is in line with your vision and mission statement. Thanks to Hafiz, my child and I were in a very good mood after coming here to freshen up. Thank you for giving me the worst experience(?)

Known for some amazing rides like roller coasters, movie theme rides, kids pleasure cinema, souvenir shops and snack shops, this place is a museum of entertainment. We purposely went on a weekday as weekends are very crowded. I was surprised to see the kind of rush here. The entry time for normal ticket was 10AM but I myself entered around 9.45AM as the gates were open. It was mind boggling to see that they have just provided tickets without any sense of whats happening inside. Sadly, the wait time for every ride for a Normal Ticket was 120 mins, even the people who had taken VIP tickets which has line free access to swings were waiting 35-45 mins for their turn. It was a low-key experience to see such kind of management at a place like this. Overall my experience was pretty bad just because of the Ticket price & kind of wait time they had given for every ride that just lasted fraction of seconds. They should really improve the management to understand headcount vs wait time/ride.
If you like standing in line all day waiting to get on a ride then this place is amazing. Otherwise give it a miss. Personally I find watching paint dry a lot more entertaining

3.review_text: Expected queueing for more less 1 hour for less than a minute rides

Universal Studios Singapore is one of the top attractions on Sentosa Island, offering a fun-filled day of thrilling rides, entertaining shows, and a dose of Hollywood magic. I visited Universal Studios in September, and while the experience was enjoyable overall, there were a few downsides that made the day less smooth than expected. The first thing to note is that it was *extremely hot* when we visited. Singapores tropical climate is hot and humid year-round, and being out in the sun all day can take a toll. I would highly recommend bringing a hat, plenty of sunscreen, and staying hydrated, as there is limited shade in some areas of the park. Despite the heat, the excitement of the park and the energy of the visitors kept the mood upbeat. One of the biggest drawbacks of our visit was the *long queues*. Universal Studios Singapore is a very popular destination, especially on weekends and holidays, which means waiting times for rides can easily exceed 45 minutes to an hour. The popular attractions like *Transformers: The Ride* and *Revenge of the Mummy* had some of the longest lines, and waiting under the sun only added to the discomfort. If youre not a fan of waiting or dont want to spend the majority of your day standing in line, I highly recommend upgrading to a *VIP pass or Express membership*. These passes allow you to skip the regular queues, saving you a lot of time and ensuring you can experience more rides without the frustration of long waits. Its definitely a splurge, but I found it to be worth it if you want to maximize your time and avoid the heat. As for the rides themselves, Universal Studios offers a variety of experiences, but if youre a thrill-seeker, you may find some of them underwhelming compared to other parks like *Ferrari World* in Abu Dhabi. For example, while the *Battlestar Galactica* roller coasters are exciting, they don't compare to the intense thrills of Ferrari Worlds *Formula Rossa*the fastest roller coaster in the world. Universal Studios rides are more family-friendly and are designed to cater to all age groups, which means the thrill level is a bit toned down compared to parks focused on extreme rides. That said, there are still a few standout attractions that are well worth trying. *Transformers: The Ride* is an amazing 3D experience that fully immerses you in the world of the Autobots and Decepticons. The visual effects and motion simulation are incredibly well done, and it was one of the highlights of my visit. *Revenge of the Mummy* is another great ride, blending dark indoor roller coaster elements with special effects and surprises. These rides offer unique experiences that you won't find in many other parks, making them worth the wait, even if the queues are long. In addition to the rides, Universal Studios Singapore offers plenty of entertainment with live shows and character meet-and-greets. However, the shows also tend to attract large crowds, so it's best to plan your day carefully to catch them without missing out on too many rides. **Conclusion:** Universal Studios Singapore is a fun park with a good mix of rides, shows, and Hollywood-themed attractions, but there are a few things to keep in mind before visiting. The heat can be intense, so come prepared, and the long queues can be frustrating. If you want to make the most of your day, I highly recommend opting for a VIP pass or Express membership to skip the lines. While the rides here are more family-friendly and not as intense as those in Ferrari World, they still offer a unique and enjoyable experience. Just be ready for a full day of fun, excitement, and a little bit of waiting.
You could not buy VIP.tickets . long ques . Wait times not accurate. Universal studios in other countries are better.
Super long queue even on a Tuesday. Very expensive place. Rather go to another Universal if I were u

Highly crowded, if you have visited huge theme parks before, you will not find this place very special . It is a muat go If you have kids with you. Will have to wait in the queue for 1 to 2 hrs to go for a one minute ride or show.

4.review_text: Many attractions were closed, there were only around ten available. The waiting time indicated on each attraction is not the real time it is in fact much longer.

Went during the covid period where USS was operating at a reduced capacity. Fun rides, minimal crowds and wait times, super awesome character cast who were dedicated to bringing a smile to our faces! Exorbitant F&B prices though and Battlestar wasn't open (again) when we visited. Visited again after 4 months during the Christmas period with new Christmas-themed elements! For a more detailed review with photos, check out my blog by searching for "Daniaexperiences Singapore".

It was fun but very tiring. We did have fun with the rides but some of them specially the popular ones have extremely long wait time. From what we experienced, i highly recommend going there between Mon-Thursday. Friday-Sunday is extremely busy which greatly affects wait time. 1. Visit the place after lunch. This is once place where the early bird failed to catch the worm. If you visit as soon as the park opens you will be competing with other customers waiting in line. 2. It is best to visit after lunch where most of the que is drastically lower and we still manage to enjoy all the rides. Disclaimer: this might work during weekdays. It might be busier during the weekend. 3. download the USS app so you have an idea the current wait time on each ride and plan which rid to take first. 4. Don't bring your kids to the Steven Spielberger (lights, camera, action) ride. In fact don't go here specially during long ques. There's nothing interesting in this ride really unless you're into movie special effects. That said, the effect shown in the ride is not even half of what is actually done on actual movies. 5.Give the gift shop a chance. You might find cheap souvenirs there. I bought my Toothless cap for 10 SGD and the ears move! 6. keep an eye on billboards with schedules written on them. You might find interesting surprise event like meeting Blue the raptor from Jurassic park. Word of caution though he might take a nibble. Last but not the least enjoy your time in USS!

We had a great experience, a great visit if you like any of the worlds they recreate. I recommend transformers and the mummy roller coaster is great! As a point to improve, we would like to mention that certain main attractions such as the Battlestar Galactica roller coaster or the world of the minions were not open and we were not informed.

It is said that you can go around in 3 hours, but is it too much to go around everything? It's a hot country. (It didn't make much sense, but I used Express Pass) Lockers in the Jurassic Park area cost money, so you can save money by using the free lockers in the adjacent area. Please don't compare it to USJ. Both have their advantages and disadvantages. Let's find the good.

5.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore offers a truly immersive experience with its attention to detail across all themed areas. The cleanliness of the park deserves special mention, as it significantly enhances the experience for visitors of all ages. The variety of rides caters well to both kids and adults, ensuring that every family member has something to enjoy. However, the waiting times for attractions are generally acceptable, though peak times can see longer waits, which is typical for a popular theme park. One area for improvement would be the addition of more resting areas, particularly for the elderly and young children. Incorporating more shaded or indoor rest spots could make the park even more accommodating for all age groups, reinforcing its status as a family-friendly destination.

Very crowded on a weekend. The rides like transformers have a long que with waiting time of 4 hrs for a 4 min show.4 hrs of standing is tiring for kids, teens, adults, young and old alike. Either reduce the wait time or provide seating

Amazing experience here. Worth spending the whole day here. Kids will really have a blast. Actually the place is suitable for people of all ages. Just have to come prepared for a day of walking and putting up with the swealtering heat. The rides are well maintained. On most occasions there are waiting times unless your take a VIP pass. I think the clue is to go for finish to end. The more popular rides like the transformers and mummy and roller coasters are at the start. I noticed that post lunch, ie around 2 pm those rides didnt have that much of a wait time. Hope that helps.

Wow nice place than Disney land. Parents who has boy kids, must choose this studio than Disney land. Must try for kids above 90cm, Transformers average 1hr waiting time Shrek show 15min wt Canopy flyer 1hr wt Enchanted Airways 15min wt Dino event

1.review_text: Horribly hot weather in Singapore and the park does not have much shade or misting fans to help with that. 2 rides had technical issues and people were stuck queuing for an extra 15 minutes. Horrible experience coz of the weather and wait time. The weather made every visitor sweaty and queuing with the body odour of everyone made the wait even more like a nightmare. Like most theme parks in the world, everything in the park is overpriced. So that isn't new. Wouldn't visit the USS again unless it snows in Singapore or they can aircondition at least 70% of the park

Had visited Universal studios today 07.10.24 at Singapore and was stuck nearly for an hour in Transformers due to technical issue which was informed after an hour only about technical issue and couldn't say how long it will get ready, so we had return without going in for the ride, further all rides were closed at 4.45pm and we were sent out at 5 pm, is this fair from universal studio? They could have compensated by giving extra time so we could have completed all the rides, it was over crowded today and so the waiting time for each rides were approximately 40 mins minimum, everywhere they had a display for express tickets which when obtained outside its 120 Sgd against 83 Sgd for normal ticket per person but after getting regular ticket if bought inside its 100 SGd extra per person for a group of 5 its 500 Sgd extra Is it fair? I felt a very bitter experience. A small suggestion to universal studio may need to cap the limit of entry on particular day

I have been to the universal studios in Hollywood, orlando and singapore and found the one in singapore to be really messy. It was the worst experience. It's really not worth going to this place on a holiday. Do not go here without an express pass. Else It's a waste of time.

Went with my family today 4/10/24. Waiting time was 60-70min per ride. Was very busy and also a lot of people pushing. It was totally over crowded. Truth be said.. we did have fun.. managing only to go on 3 rides. However I am giving a 1 star.. reason being ..for 1 young very rude security worker.. verbally pushing me and my kids to exit the site without my wife. Even though I had mentioned it to him .. (my kids and I , had just exited the toilet and was waiting for my wife to exit the toilets). He was totally rude and ruined the whole day. We paid over 400 and at the end we got chased and pushed out by the security .. because they had some halloween event after 5pm.

The rides were okay. However, the long wait times were highly abundant. Making the experience tiring and honestly stressful. Visited only 2 Rides, the Battlestar Galatica (Human), which the wait was extremely long (3 hours), and the ancient Egyptian ride located in the pyramid, which was decently quick but don't be fooled as you think you might've reached the end of the line, No. There's an even bigger line stairs.

2.review_text: We went on a Friday (no bank Holiday or school holidays). It was still so full that the queues we're 30-60min on every ride (and including the food stalls...). And the rides are super short. Fast track pass is pretty expensive imo but if you want a good experience without having to stand in line everywhere you're almost pressured to buy it. That might have even been the reason the queues were so long, cause people with a fast track pass kept being let through. It's very pay to win. However the park is pretty but very small. Not a lot of rides (but therefore an awful lot of people, even on a weekday). For us this was the most overpriced and most easy to skip experience when visiting singapore and probably the amusement park we enjoyed the least so far. The "universal" globe is outside the park, so if you just want to take a picture of that and skip actually buying a ticket and going in you're not missing out on too much imo.

Highly disappointed. In 7 hour of operation with over 15 options with average waiting time of around 20-50 minutes; we land up doing only 4-5 attractions. At S83, it is a rip off. To ride 10 attractions, you need to buy an express pass at an additional S90. My suggestion is to either restrict the number of visitors per day or increase the park timing from 10-5pm to 9-7pm or introduce a 2 day pass at discounted pricing. Let every penny spent can be enjoyed.

Naah! Not well organized. Very few staffs to manage the rides which increases the queue time unnecessarily. One can hardly ride 5-6 rides as the park closes at 5 and unbelievable wait time at each ride. Definitely not worth the price. My personal bad experience in comparison to other Asian theme parks.

Half the place is under renovation and timings have been curtailed to accommodate halloween night (separate ticket.for same...looks like trying to make more money at expense of people)...even with express pass, it was difficult to complete ..have been here more than 3-4 times in last 10 years but this time it was really disappointing...

Updated (2024) - reduced from 3 star to 2 star Visited in Oct on weekday of 1st week. Very very crowded and closed early beacause if the Halloween evening. Such long lines. We managed 5 rides only on a full day. I have been in many universal and Disney around the world. I Will not recommend to a friend to come here. Original (2019) Very busy and long lines although We were there mid week, on a school day, in an of peak time in February, not near Chinese new year Some rides were working under capacity so lines remain long Lines started to reduce at about 4pm. Most of what we did was between 4 and 7pm when the park closed All in all, high tkt price with low option to do "all" rides in one day

3.review_text: We had a fun time at Universal, but this is clearly the weakest park in their line up. The park felt very crowded and congested in certain areas. Once the Minion area opens, I guess guestflows will be better. It rubbed me the wrong way that they heavily advertise their Express pass service. Every 100 or so meters there was an employee waiving around with a banner about this. The River Adventure ride was closed for maintenance, which wasn't advertised during booking, on the app or on the website. A huge let down, because the amount of big rides is already quite limited. We arrived at 10 sharp and managed to complete the big 7 rides by 11. When we walked back towards the entrance the queues really started to built up there. So; arrive early. Start at Transformers, then work your way towards the Shrek area. At certain times the music/entertainment was blasting out very loudly. In combination with the high amount of guests, sometimea very narrow paths that were obstructes by themeing, this created a rather unpleasant and chaotic environment. 60 Eur admission seemed fair to us. We will not be going back anytime soon. If they added a few more areas, we would consider it.

Really overrated. Rides were good, the place was good and clean, but overall very few rides. I find some of the rides I went in India was more thrilling. I mean in number. Maybe if it's named as a Mini Universal studio I would have given it a 5. Wheel chair lines , restroom facility, drinking water, service provided , shade lines were all top notch. Overall infrastructure was great but that's the entire Singapore.

It is an old and neglected park. Without a doubt the worst I have visited. That's why it's the cheapest, but I still didn't think it was worth it. If you don't like roller coasters this park doesn't have much to offer. The waterworld show that is its main attraction on the day we visited only had two shows that we did not coincide with. Its streets and in general feel old, neglected and lack of maintenance. I don't recommend it at all

Went today, quite disappointed with how small the park is. We paid for a express pass each but you can only use it once at each ride and some rides you can't use the express pass. Really only 3 scary rides for adults. Start at the back of the park first. No one was there, by 12pm the park was packed.

It was ok. It was clean and well ventilated. We were lucky to have a good weather. It was small compared to other Universal Studios. Wait time for transformers 80mins. The mummy 15mins. Lights camera 40 mins. Shrek 4d 20mins. We were able to do all rides we wanted even without express pass. A lot of water fountain even available while in line. Food and drinks were really expensive but acceptable. Sandwich 16usd. Slushy 8sgd. Rootbeer in can 4sgd. Just wear comfy shoes because youll be on your feet for hours. Staff very polite and kind. Some of the visitors really smell and not following rules but not the parks fault. Ok to go once and able to finish in a day. We did the shrek 4d twice. Its my favorite attraction.

4.review_text: Having visited Universal Studios Singapore several times before, I recently returned after a long hiatus, eager to see how it had evolved. Unfortunately, my recent experience wasn't ideal. Despite purchasing tickets weeks in advance, the park was extremely crowded. While I expected lines for the rides, the wait times were excessive. We queued for the Cyclone roller coaster for over two and a half hours, only to be met with an announcement of an indefinite delay. This, coupled with the intense heat, led us to abandon the queue, a decision shared by many others. We did manage to experience two other rides, but each came with a wait time of at least an hour. The congestion was pervasive, impacting even the express lines. It felt as though the park had overreached its capacity, diminishing the overall experience. Perhaps implementing a queuing limit or a reservation system for popular rides would alleviate this issue. Compared to other Universal Studios parks, such as those in Japan or Orlando, Singapore's offering feels smaller and less engaging. While it may be a suitable option for those with budget constraints or limited travel opportunities, especially within Southeast Asia, I would recommend exploring other Universal Studios parks for a more fulfilling experience. It's worth noting that I visited during peak season (Indonesia's holiday, causing influx of visits in Singapore) which undoubtedly contributed to the extensive wait times. A friend who visited recently during the off-season reported significantly shorter queues. While longer waits are expected during peak periods, the park should consider implementing measures to improve the queuing system and overall guest experience during these busy times.

Transformers n revenge of the mummy n jurassic park n Shrek rides were good but the worst ride was treasure hunters which was waste of time , spaghetti space chase is for kids but not entertaining though n v missed minion ride n King Kong 3d rides which were in Los Angeles USA but not in Singapore n even the studio tour where they show psycho character which was missing here in Singapore but the waiting time was lot less compared to Los Angeles

Waiting times are longer at every ride. Hot and humid. They close by sharp 5pm. They start chasing you out and don't let use their washrooms. I suggest they start early by 8am so that people can enjoy with milder weather. Worth the money for the shows present. Mummy ride and Transformers ride are the best. Canopy flyer and River adventure at Jurassic world were good too.
Good experience, pls expect waiting on weekends, try to reach by 10 AM, TRY THE RIDE CYCLONE WITH EXTREME CAUTION, It'll be very hot so carry a bottle of water. The food inside will be very expensive

The rides are great, but I wouldn't bother coming if you can't afford to buy the epress pass, as the wait times can be out of control. If you're waiting for up to an hour for each ride and the park closes at 5pm, you don't have a lot of time to relax! We bought express tickets at the park after waiting an hour for the first ride. In that time the prices went up so just accept the inevitable and buy them straight up! Great day out for the children, but like all theme parks - you need to be patient!

5.review_text: Went there with 5 teenage kids. We went to Disney sea in Tokyo the week before and Universal Studios in Singapore was another level better. Great rides and actually wasnt too busy. Maybe this helped on how we enjoyed. We decided not to get express pass. Best decision ever. Longest wait was probably 15min but most times we got straight on rides or rides had to go empty as not enough people. Kids loved it, so many good rides
Amazing place in SG...bought ticket in Agoda less expensive .We have rides and it was amazing.. however we were not able to explore much as they closed early on Sunday till 5 pm pnly

It needs a full day to visit all the places and rides there ..better take the express ticket around 6500/ rupees ,can save half day . Usual ticket will have to wait around 40-80 minutes per ride or show which is frustrating . All rides are good and fun

A compact theme park that you're quite able to go around in one day. The waiting times were reasonable during my visit.. ranging from 20 to 40 mins. Some of the ques were deceptively short from the outside because there is quite an extended queuing line inside the building. Transformers, the Mummy, Jurassic park, Shrek 4D cinema were worth the wait. The rides whilst thrilling were too short especially considering the que times. Food as expected was overpriced. Tip 1 : get your souvenirs at the main shop near the entrance as they have the full range so you can enjoy them throughout your visit. Tip 2 : be aware that the park may close early on some days. Tip 3 : your day will suck as outdoor rides will not operate if it rains heavily. Tip 4 : Ask the operator if the ride shakes you about to check suitability for those who may not like it. Overall (if weather gods are kind).. enjoyable day out.

The visit was great, we had a lot of fun. The possibility that you can queue up in a single-ride line if you are traveling alone saves a lot of waiting time Unfortunately, part of the park was still under construction but the rest of the park was great and very clean! We'll be back ;-)

1.review_text: Service sucks. NONE of the staffs are smiling and talked like we owe them money. Then closed at 5pm. Is ok. But the staffs scolded and rushed tourists to go out like they are dogs. Worst experience ever.
I found this really disappointing. Park is very loud, seems very dated, rides poor, and long queues everywhere. Food outlets of poor quality. Adults and kids; we were all happy to leave.

Unfortunately not the greatest experience. This is the only theme park in the world where it seems the staff go out of their way to be rude and arrogant. All customer service goes out the window upon entry. Also don't buy the express passes as it was the biggest rip off, only allowing to use once per ride without stating this in the terms and conditions of the express pass. They hide this term and condition because u wouldn't buy it if they made it clear in the terms and conditions. We were there on a busy wet day most of the rides close if raining so steer clear of rainy days there's not much to do. This is my first ever bad review of any business because I prefer to try to highlight the positives out there. However the experience was too bad to ignore and hopefully I can't help others with their expectations of Universal Studios Singapore.

We had an extremely disappointing and horrifying experience at USS Halloween Horror Nights. Unfortunately, I booked our tickets through a sponsored link on Headout, unaware of the complexities involved. The ticketing process was confusing; in the past, there used to be one entrance ticket for the whole day entry, but now there are separate day and night passes. Misled by Headout's website, we unknowingly purchased day passes instead of night passes, spending 366 with express passes included for 2 persons only. When we arrived at the entrance, we hoped the staff would be understanding and allow us to switch to night passes with a willingness to pay the difference. However, we were denied entry with no flexibility shown. It felt unnecessarily harsh, especially since we had already paid for entry and the company had profited from it. The refusal to accommodate or show empathy was deeply disappointing. We were told to buy new tickets if we wanted to enterwe were reluctant to spend a total of 600-800 for just a few hours at a small and overcrowded theme park. In the end, we left and spent the money at VivoCity on some nice shoes instead. This experience taught us a hard lesson, spending 366 to return home upon arrival was really an upsetting experience and we doubt we will be returning to USS anytime soon.

Visited park 13/11. Due to thunderstorms almost all attractions were closed, other attractions (Mummy) closed due to technical issues leaving the park with just 3 available operating attractions only. Universal built a park in a tropical climate subject to frequent thunderstorms with attractions that cant operate in such circumstances! No announcements, no updates on whether attractions would reopen. Notifications received through app. The Park is also looking tired, worn and rather faded needs investment and freshening up in many areas. A Large attraction area (20% of park) closed until 2025 for new Minions Land but no discounted admission fee to reflect this, same price, less experience. Food quality in restaurants poor and overpriced. Check weather before attending and avoid the restaurants.

2.review_text: It was the worst experience the rides got closed for the Halloween night and it was not at all mentioned on the tickets tht d rides will closed by 5pm....and moreover the transformer ride was closed for some issues for 1hr and v wasted all our money...my guests who visited us from USA were disappointed by dis experience

My visit to USS today 1/11/2024 required me & my family to wait a very very long que which unacceptable..it almost 2 hour for Battlestar Galactica..even others ride also average waiting time is 40 minutes..the park is closed at 5pm???

Worst theme park I have visited. We purchased the Universal Express, which is absolutely necessary by the way, as wait times are extremely long and difficult in the heat and humidity. Everything is overpriced, which we all naturally expect but here it is exorbitant. The park is in need of an update, rides are quite lame and uninspired - the only exception being the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. Give it a miss.

The staff is very rude. There's no food for vegetarians. They don't allow outside food. The only way we were allowed to bring vegetarian food was to tell them we had a medical condition. They rip you off on everything here. The Universal Studios in Hollywood, California is way, way, way, way better. I cannot stress enough how bad the staff is, how un-vegetarian friendly food they have. I am shocked since there are a lot of Indians here and they hardly had anything to return. Even the pizza had egg in the dough.

Some employees seemed uninterested in working and appeared undertrained, particularly one assisting with photo sessions of Princess Fiona in Far Far Away. Overall, the experience fell far short compared to Universal Studios Japan.

3.review_text: I love this place and my feel good place in Singapore, however half the park was closed due to renovations and the Mummy ride closed due to maintenance, yet we are still paying the same ticket price but with less rides and more people waiting on those rides that are actually open. Really disappointed in this but still love the park. The Transformer ride will always be my favourite.

Timing was not good on our part b/c of weather (rain and lightning). Couple nearby lightning strikes put a real damper (literally and figuratively) as all the outside rides shutdown for safety. The indoor rides are dated, and overall look of the place needs upgrading. Staff and operators were friendly and helpful, but the place needs a face lift. Disney needn't worry...
Unfortunately, three attractions were closed due to technical problems. A bit too much for this price of admission.

Some staff rush you with the picture taking sessions (Minions) even though we paid to experience that in Universal studios and waited just like everyone else in the long queue under the heat. Some others are not even good at taking the photos (Transformers). If you won't let someone else in our group take our photos, be at least a better photographer. The rides were good because there were little to none waiting times, but they closed early today because of a bit of rain, so be wary of that because then it won't be worth it otherwise. The shows are okay. Best thing about the park is probably the use of 3D because they were really good quality and the buildings for picture taking.

You must visit this place when in Singapore. However, it is impossible to get around the whole thing without an additionally paid express pass. We were there out of season and didn't have time to see everything. In the season without an express pass, you will see maybe 2/3 of the main attractions, and you will spend well over half of your time in queues (90 minutes for one attraction). Personally, we wasted about 2 hours standing in queues, which we had to leave due to the failure of two queues.

4.review_text: I had a magical experience in Universal Studios Singapore. The food was overpriced, spent 58 on the food that is seen in this review. I bought an express pass, however a lot of the rides did not have Universal Express lanes so I ended up queuing even though I spent RM313 on the express pass which is double of the admission ticket. Disappointing. The Madagascar & Egypt attractions were closed, very disappointing. Battlestar Galactica was a walk in a park, not even slightly exciting. Disappointing. The toilets did not have any bidet, only tissue paper. First world country? Weird, even a third world country has a bidet. Overall, I would say my experience was still magical regardless of the shortcomings by Universal Studios Singapore.

Visited november 13 (off peak season) and found the queues to be manageable! We mainly queued for 0-20min and only queued for more than 30min twice. (Skipped the queue for the Jurassic ride which had a 1h wait time) Would recommend visiting in Nov/Oct if you can, barring the bad weather which closes down most outdoor rides (in this case, we planned to visit the indoor rides instead). The rides here are definitely really tame and not what I would go for if I were looking for any actual thrill rollercoaster wise - though their indoor rides like the Mummy are good. Be prepared if you want to sit on the jurassic ride as you will almost certainly get wet - socks, shoes, etc. Nearly all the staff were visibly dry and unwelcoming to the point we noticed and discussed it. Very aloof, easily annoyed etc. Staff on waterworld on the other hand were really interactive and brilliant choices for their roles. I was unsure about watching a live show but it was incredibly gripping and engaging. Definitely recommend to plan your visit around the show timings if you're going.
Great theme park!! Apart from the crowd every thing is fine. Push yourself for the rides as the queue for each gets worst..

Transformer ride was fantastic. Cyclone and Mummy ride was also quite good. Not many options for young children aged 6 or below. Some rides were closed and some got cancelled after entering the hall. Overall good experience

I had an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! The parks themed zones, thrilling rides, and live shows make it a truly magical experience. Unfortunately, some rides were closed due to rain, but the staff handled it well and kept us informed. Despite the weather, there was still so much to enjoy. Id definitely recommend visiting, rain or shineUniversal Studios Singapore is a must for anyone looking for a day filled with fun and excitement!

5.review_text: Nice theme park and PLEASE GET EXPRESS PASS IF YOU VISIT WITH FAMILY AND ON WEEKEND OR HOLIDAY. THE QUEUES ARE INSANE. The theme park food is so expensive but expected lah. I will explain some rides rating below. PLEASE BRING UMBRELLA SG WEATHER UNPREDICTABLE. and bring ur own water becoz got water station,Water 4 sgd leh. Many giftshops around so many souvenirs available. Please don't bring young kids onto rollercoaster rides like transformers or mummy they keep crying summore its a literal drop rollercoaster. I recommend kt grill and goldilocks for food. Some ride need to pay for locker, pls use locker or else mafan need to put belongings somewhere when on a ride. 1. Revenge of the mummy. The queues are long. My entire family was flabbergasted and almost vomited. Vigorous spinning, dropping and speeding up. Do not recommend for young kids and weak people, older kids maybe can lah based on if they are ok with it 2. Transformers 4d movie. It was also rollercoaster with spinning and speeding up, its kinda nice but queue is long 3. Seasame street spaghetti space chase. Great for seniors and younger children but no thrill at all it's so slow 4. Raptor rapids. My favourite ride so far. Guy at entrance was funny. The ride itself was exciting and there was a drop at the end. Others clothes were all soaked but only my converse was drenched. I thought the trex would spray water at us 5. Trolls hug time jubilee. Relaxing and fun for young families with bubbles and confetti. 6. Waterworld show. It was quite funny and exciting but not rlly for young kids becoz got gunfire, fireworks, fire and explosions. Don't sit at blue seats because you WILL get wet. The show itself 20 minutes long.

Nice place to spend a whole day. MRT harbourfront and thenbus wr8 to reach the park from everwhere in the city for less than 3. Buy the ticket trough agoda or trip. Com to save on the entrance fee. On weekdays the queue isnt bad

I arrived around 10:30 on Monday, and the line didn't last longer than 30 minutes, no matter how long it was. I was thinking of buying Express, but it would have been a waste to buy it. I think I had to wait 30 minutes before lunch for Transformers, but since it was afternoon, I got on right away without waiting. The amusement park wasn't that big, so it was easy to get around!

Great experience we had in this theme parks. It's advisable to reach the place earlier and plan your activities properly to avoid the waiting time. There are multiple lockers at the respective areas which are free for the first 45 minutes too except for the Jurassic Park Lost World's locker which is required payment. Overall it is highly suggestible place to visit if you are in Singapore.

Rides from my favorite to least: Cylon-the 2 tunnel drop very nice, most intense ride Human-nice 2 drops Mummy-nice drops, there were heat effects too Enchanted-very quick ride, OK coaster Canopy-OK quick ride with nice view Rapids-bring your poncho to avoid wet, nice dark ride Transformers-much better than Skyworld's Apes ride Steven spielberg-20 minutes intervals, there is heat and water Puss in boots-boring slow dark ride Space chase-boring slow dark ride Water world-boring live show with water and stunt man Shrek 4D-really long boring movie with good 3D effects Others matters: Fireworks at Friday 8pm-really small and short duration of 5 minutes Lockers-The free time dynamically adjusts based on the current wait time for the rides near Battle Star and Mummy. For other rides, they let you put stuff on shelve before riding. Bottle-I think 300ml is enough, there are many places to refill all over the park Queue-Came at Friday 9.30am. Almost no queue in the morning. Experience 9 rides in first the 2.5 hours. Queued for Cylon 40 minutes because it only opened in the afternoon that day.

1.review_text: Don't go to Universal Studios Singapore on holidays if you don't want to be miserable. Each ride has to wait more than 1 hour. The waiting time displayed on the information board is not accurate. The toilets are not clean because there are no cleaning staff on duty to guard against the influx of visitors. If the waiting time is so long and the queue is so long, it would be better for USS to improve by providing attractions in the queue or thinking about how to provide entertainment for waiting visitors. Very bad and unpleasant experience.

One of the most poorly run places in Singapore. If the idea of standing in line all day counts as a holiday, this is the place to go. Also, many of the rides are not functioning due to technical reasons.

Worst managed theme park. Have been to universal LA, Disneyland Paris, as well as universal Orlando so I do have good benchmark. They need to put cap on per day crowd and ticket sale. In a queue for one of the less popular rides since 1.5 hrs , cant even muster courage to get in for the popular ones ! And Im here on a Monday ! Not a weekend !

The worst experience of my life. The place is so crowded with visitors that you can't even walk here. Ticket 85 dollars and express pass 140 dollars. Queue 3 hours for 1 attraction and with express pass it is only 1 hour! Queues for food and drink minimum 30 minutes and maximum 3 hours. I don't recommend anyone to go here. It's a money factory for the park owners and people come last here. There is nowhere to sit. People are sitting on the street and on the steps. People are stupid sheep.

Bad experience at Universal Studios on 27 Dec. Staff remarked that attraction was at nearly 3 times over capacity but this was not made known at the point of booking. Such information would allow guests to make more informed choices. Did not enjoy the rides due to long wait times. Staff tried to upsell express queue tickets but this was not useful in view of long queue of 60 to 90 min wait times. No attempt to service recover by Universal Studios

2.review_text: Long queue (approximately 45 mins or more) for each ride. Seeing people giving up queuing for the ride. Experience technical issue with the transformer ride. Food is expensive and limited. Not worth with the price. Too small of a park to cater to such a large crowd. Not sure if the management have any limitation on the number of people visiting the park each day with space, rides and safety taking into consideration.Or if there is any measure on the waiting time for each ride.

Way too many people and queues even with express were crazy... on a Monday! Then rides closed due to weather. Would not recommend this park to anyone visiting Singapore unless you go on a day when everyone is at work or they at least cap the numbers in the park to a level where you can move around.

Universal Studios Singapore: Where dreams go to die in a queue. If you enjoy standing in line for hours only to be disappointed by sub-par rides, this is your paradise! Every ride feels like a lottery winif you manage to survive the epic 90-minute wait times. Honestly, I spent more time staring at the back of strangers heads than at the attractions. The staff? Lets just say their smiles clocked out long before they did. A simple question was met with a look like Id just insulted their ancestors. And the prices? Oh, they charge you as if youre getting a VIP tour of heaven. A bottle of water costs more than my dignity after a whole day here. Save your time, money, and sanity. Just watch a YouTube walkthrough insteadits faster, cheaper, and the workers wont roll their eyes at you.
