Avoid going during rainy seasons. We were here for Christmas vacation but disappointed by the frequent suspensions of the games due to weather conditions. We were in the middle of the queues for a couple of games but had to quit due to the announcement of suspension. This was highly frustrating as we wasted so much time on the queues. Waiting time was 30-90 mins. Nothing to blame the park as it is out of their control, but I would suggest to those planning for a trip here not to come during winter.

Avoid visiting this amusement park during rainy season, as the park is mainly built for fair or sunny weather. Come wet weather, be prepared to get wet, as there are no sheltered walkways to shield you from the elements. Even some parts of the meandering queues to indoor rides like the Accelerator, are outside the shelter. And if thunder roars, be prepared to kiss your outdoor rides goodbye, as these would be suspended for your safety. Also, avoid visiting the park during peak period, eg the school holidays and festive seasons. It is so overcrowded that it would take you almost a full day (or about 8 hours) just to enjoy 4 (or if you are lucky, 5) rides, with each ride lasting for less than 5 mins on average. Because most of the time would be spent on queuing and waiting for these rides. The same applies to dining at USS and taking the Sentosa Express. Yet, there are not enough seats or benches to rest tired feet. You would either be standing most of the time, or sitting on the sidewalks. Moreoever, there's little crowd control. It's crazy! To be honest, this park does not have the capacity to handle huge crowds. Yet, it tends to bite off more than it can chew. Even if you are paying festive package price, considering all the above, it is not as worth it as it is touted to be. Still, it is an experience worth learning from.

3.review_text: Generally enjoy the rides and facilities. Suggest more care to monitor long queue situation where there are inconsiderate visitors who get one person to queue for family members/friends (the case we encountered was 14 members, no handicapped, he claimed and insisted that he has someone who was on the queue behind the 20 visitors...) ... eventually the additional members just cut queue in front of 20 visitors. The "one" who was supposed to queue... joined the group who cut queue in front. This is very unfair to other visitors especially the queue is more than 60min.

Dear Universal Studios Singapore Team, Thank you for the memorable experience. My children had an amazing time! However, I noticed several issues: Guests jumping queues by climbing under barriers from the regular line to the Express Lane. People cutting queues shamelessly in the Single Rider line. Multiple instances of queue jumping at food store at Ancient Egypts to reach the cashier. Hope you can make some improvement to nsure a fair experience for all visitors. Thank you

Probably the only theme park that I dont have the desire to visit again. Singapores weather is just not good for a theme park. Its super hot and inconvenient when lining up outside. Ride selection is also very limited compared to USJ. Staff are ok but can be more cheerful (they look so sad for a theme park staff but I understand it could be because also of exhaustion due to heat). Shrek 4D is highly recommeded. P.S. be careful of rude Chinese visitors who cut of the line without excuse nor apology

Had a great day here to be honest. But have marked it down due to exorbitant costs of food. One example is that a plain hot dog (sausage and bun) and a coke was over 20. And to make it worse, the service was horrible. The guy serving couldn't have been more miserable if he tried. Rides were pretty good. I was glad I had the express pass so skipped lines where I could. It was a pretty quiet day thankfully for everyone in the park. Lines overall weren't that long. But I was still glad to have paid the extra money. For those who don't pay the extra money on a busy day, that would be unbearable. You would be standing in line all day. Very annoying that there are some rides that you can't slip the line on too. Also unfortunate that minion world was still be worked on, so couldnt visit that large part of the park. It really impacts the flow of the park. Overall, we enjoyed our day, but it cost a fortune, and the food prices (particularly the hot dog and coke deal) are beyond a joke.

What had happened to the ticketing and express pass system? Price increased double (express pass is now 140 onsite per pax) compared to previously where one has the option to decide on day itself if opt for it. And again, the monopolizing impact of USS in each city. We did the VIP experience today for birthday gal and few friends, they were all thrilled and enjoyed to fullest under the best care of VIP team guide Shah, who was so patient and entertaining to kids! In the end the kids stayed till almost to closing and wanted to go on for more. Thank you Shah for a most memorable bday at USS! Crowds were at high this week, but so glad the VIP lanyard gave the kids priority in almost every ride and food queue. Wanted to hold the party in Enchanted Castle function room, but it was pretty outdated in decor. We are at good ease to choose this in the end for a quality celebration. Only bummed is for more new and bigger restaurants in USS to serve full capacity visitors. About time to start revamp and enhancements to match with post covid times. Pre covid was great with many rides to go for, esp for kids. For past 2 years, quite a number of rides and street performances are affected but USS still manages to keep all spirits hyped by constantly having new events and activities with measures in place. Bummer for the restos and cafes and kiosks as many are shut. Would have to give thumbs up to Megatron who never failed to amuse audience for each and every session. Its as if he was real talking to audience with lots of spontaniety and humor. Always happy to see the mascots on streets even though no contact.

4.review_text: Hardly any people during the week in the low season and very short waiting times. Unfortunately, not all attractions were open (broken or closed). You have to understand the locker system first, then it is very simple. It doesn't have that many rides, the park can be visited in half a day.
Great time with family. Great staff and fun rides. Food is expensive as expected. Long wait times

This is really good place to explore, but guys as per price you might not cover more than 3 rides. In weekdays the waiting time is more than 1hr . To explore all the attraction u need to come 3 times. Food is very limited. All locker are paid system, some buffer time is there but due to waiting time it will surpass.
Went on Wednesday. The queue time per ride is 5-15mins, very nice. Overall very good experience for my kids. Only missing 1 section of the park which is The Minions opening in 2025. Good weather too.

Universal Studios Singapore is an exhilarating destination that promises fun and adventure for visitors of all ages. From thrilling rides to immersive attractions, its a must-visit spot for anyone traveling to Sentosa Island. The park is well-organized, and the themed zoneslike Ancient Egypt, Jurassic World, and Hollywood Boulevardtransport you into different worlds with their detailed designs and exciting attractions. Some of the standout rides include Battlestar Galactica, a high-adrenaline roller coaster, and Transformers: The Ride, which offers an incredible 4D experience. Families will enjoy the interactive shows and gentler rides, ensuring theres something for everyone. However, during my visit, I was disappointed to find that the Minion Land attraction was temporarily closed for maintenance. While this was unfortunate, the rest of the park had so much to offer that it didnt take away from the overall experience. Id recommend checking the official website for updates before planning your visit. The park staff were friendly and efficient, and the food and beverage options were diverse, catering to all tastes. Pro tip: purchasing an express pass is worth it to skip the long queues during peak hours. Universal Studios Singapore is a thrilling escape that guarantees unforgettable memories, even with minor closures. I cant wait to return!

5.review_text: Great place for vacation and go with ur families! The queue is a little bit long but u can see the timing expectation from the app and other stuff from the app! Can improve for the queue line and area for more shady parts to sit and relax a bit.

The place is such a beauty but kindly plan accordingly in terms of prioritising the rides. Theres a huge crowd irrespective of which day. So prioritise the rides yall wanna do and finish those up as its gonna test your patience in the queues. If budget is high get the express way ticket to skip the queue.

visited with my friends on Friday. the queue during noon was crazy long. i waited almost 3hrs for dino ride which always give me dehydration because its so hot. waiting for the rides in ac area was fine. we bought the tix online with voucher 5 on food & 5 on merch, worth it. used the fnb voucher on the bread. bread & ice cream was super good. got % off for credit card user so we were able to save some money. food was nice. thank you for the free water filter. i really love all the extreme rides but my favourite probably the mummy ride (?) and transformers. i queued 3 times for mummy because it was so fun. sitting on front, middle & last row definitely gave different experience. really enjoy it. entered transformers around closing time, no need to queue. really loveeeee the experience. what i can say is i really enjoyed my experience here. the rides were fun that the queue is bearable. i took more rides after 3pm than the time before since the queue time became shorter than noon love it. the USS application really helpful on showing the waiting time so i can focus on shorter queue time for better experience. will come again in future, really fun!!

It is the smallest park I have visited, but the cheapest. We hardly queued at any game, most of the visitors are from Asia, Australia. It is not worth buying the universal express, you can travel through the park perfectly in 6-7 hours. The park is inside an island Sentosa

Its so much better to go during weekdays since there were barely any lines for the rides and attractions. The longest we had to wait was for the Transformers one but it was only for about 20mins. As for the rest, we just go straight in and into the ride. We were able to get into almost all the rides in just one day

1.review_text: Universal Studios in the world is the worst in Singapore. We had to wait in line for a long time. When we complained about technical issues, the rides were stopped without any compensation at all. If consumers are fools, the Genting Group will be delisted sooner or later. garbage company

Worst theme park I have been to out of 5. 2 hour queues for rides. Spent 160SPD for 2 normal tickets to ride two rides. Looked at express which was another 160SPD. They are letting far too many people in for the number of rides. Basically a classic Singaporean money making endeavour. 4SPD for a mandatory locker for the rides then charges you again on return due to the queues being so long. AVOID THIS PLACE!

Horrible and torturous experience. High wait time on all rides. Expect upto 120mins delay on all major rides. Even on weekdays. Some rides will go under maintenance right before your turn comes. That means additional delay or go and get in another que for other ride for 120mins. They need to restrict the no. of people at one time in the park to make it enjoyable for all.

Three (3!) attractions had technical problems. 2 stopped for 15 minutes, delaying an already long (90mins) queue; while the third was trolls musical and it was cancelled abruptly 10 minutes in. The show just stopped with rude safety guards asking us to leave the auditorium. It was so sudden and surreal that most people did not follow instructions at first, thinking it was a joke. No explanation was given afterwards. The park seems to need proper maintenance but, profit above all, they will never close it and give it the attention it deserves. Closing on a positive note, prise to the actors of water world who put on a terrific show!

1 Star in general. Way too crowded even when it rained half a day. The only good thing at Universal Studios Singapore is Waterworld. I'm not a fan of fast rollercoasters in general. Kiddie rides took 20-40 minutes. Other wait times were 60 minutes for regular tickets. When it was 10 minutes till closure, a lot of rides became 5 minutes wait. It's not worth the price.

2.review_text: From The Pricing you need to spend for the entrance fee is not equal with the service and facilities. Food stall services averagely rude, each show outlets just average. Compare with Disney Hongkong services very far, like sky and earth. If i have given to spend to be here again, NO WAY ! I understand raining but some still the schedule on their website or apps never been able to close to certainity , not sure how they manage the service culture there but I guess almost nothing.

I waited for over an hour to get on the rollercoaster. It was my turn and the rollercoaster broke down. I had to go back. I paid 6 for the locker for nothing. I decided to buy an express ticket. I went to Jurassic Park first. I quickly passed without waiting. We sat down and fastened our seat belts and guess what happened. They let us off again because of technical problem and after waiting for a while the problem was fixed. I wanted to get on The Mummy but the staff at the door refused me because they said there was a technical problem again. It is not nice to have so many technical problems in such an expensive place.

Extremely disappointed, and especially after experiencing Universal Studios Florida. The key issue I have is their express pass system, again, especially compared to USF/IoA. To me, express pass means paying a premium and being able to ride eligible rides over and over again. ESPECIALLY when there are only so few "thrill" rides at USS (Battlestar Galactica and Mummy from my perspective). However, the express pass is only eligible ONCE per attraction. If that couldn't get any worse, it's also only available on SELECT attractions. That's insane, given how small the park already is. In my opinion, the worst part about this park is the staffing. For example, in the Accelerator (teacup ride), there was ONE staff overseeing everything, including line management, scanning express passes, checking safety belts (!!), operating the attractions and announcements. The same issue was prevalent with other attractions too, which meant longer wait times, let alone risk to safety. Poor staff too, overworked with so many responsibilities that should be split. Genting Singapore, do better. Once Minion Land opens, I think this is an OK park for first-time Universal goers. However, I don't recommend going to USS at ALL for anyone who has experienced other Universal parks, especially the parks in Florida. That said, the food was generally good for a theme park. The chicken wings and biryani at Oasis Spice Cafe (next to Mummy) was really good. The Discovery Food Court (Jurassic Park) was OK, but overshadowed by such an inefficient checkout process.

The park is small, but beautiful, the problem is that if you don't pay for the express pass you have to wait in lines for at least more than an hour, with luck you can go on about 6 attractions in the day... There are also lockers where you must leave your things to enter some attractions and they charge you to use them... Obviously everything you want to eat or drink inside the park is very expensive. Another problem is that they close the attractions when there is a lot of demand and they also close the rider-only option. Lastly, the two most attractive roller coasters were closed for the first 4 hours of our visit. In short, I would not return to this park, the ticket is cheap, but the express pass is worth twice the basic ticket.
Waiting times are totally not accurate. Expect to wait twice as long. Furthermore there are not many rides compared to Orlando.

3.review_text: Need more rides and better queue management. It's worth a visit but the 30 min queues get old real fast

Hot and crowded as expected. Definitely an experience. Really mediocre at best as an amusement park, and expensive (typically Singapore). Foot traffic was a nightmare since there are people from all over the world, and drive on different sides of the road. Throw in some aimless wandering, confused people, the elderly and very young and... I borderline get anxiety just think about it. Not much seating in general. So good luck finding a spot to rest your feet. Amenities in general don't seem adequate for the crowd size.

Disneyland Singapore was a bit disappointing as many major rides were shut during my visit. However, the shows were still enjoyable and offered some magic. Id recommend checking in advance to ensure the rides youre excited about are operational to make the most of your visit.

A few very good roller coasters (Mummys Revenge, Battlestar Galactica) and a few good ones for people who arent into the big rides. However you *must* factor in the cost of an Express Pass (we bought ours after entering) when coming here, otherwise you will be standing in lines for an hour or so for each ride (and this was on a not particular busy day). Some simple rides would have gone much faster if theyd had more than one employee running the entire thing. Its a reasonably small park and not that many rides, its a good day but not great from a value perspective.

The standard ticket, costing S83, was practically useless on an average Friday afternoon, as the waiting time for most attractions exceeded 1 hour. In reality, only the S193 express ticket holds real value, as it allows access through the express queue. However, even with the express ticket, a 10-15 minute wait had already formed for several attractions by around 4 PM on Friday afternoon. For those arriving at regular hours and unwilling to stand in line for hours just for a few minutes of entertainment, it is advisable to purchase the express ticket. That said, for a family of four, this represents a significant financial burden, and in my opinion, the park is not worth that much.

4.review_text: The park is more for small children than for adults. 1.5 more or less normal attractions. Queues without fast track for half an hour

Thrilling rides. Long queues in the afternoon. Food is bland and expensive. Better to go early and during off-season. Use Klook to get some discounts. Avoid the rainy season otherwise you'll get soaked.

The park is good. Transformers is the best out of all the attractions. The staff maintaining the express pass queue could be deceptive. On couple of rides, they told me it will take 50 mins while it took just 5. They just deceive the crowd somehow.

It's called the Lunar New Year, but why is Singapore so excited? Maybe it's because there are a lot of Chinese people in Malaysia, Singapore, and people of Chinese descent, so it seems like everyone is in a holiday festival mood... Perhaps because of that, there were breaks in the restaurant and there were many changes to the schedule. From the monorail waiting line to Sentosa Island... How long.. ah.. it was really hard. Visiting Universal Studios after several years.. Before that, I went to Japan, and this time to Singapore... It's okay to go to Singapore without an express ticket. I saw the post, there were so many people... The attraction with the shortest waiting time is 30 minutes. I thought there would be no answer if I waited like this. Express purchase available for one ride per attraction. 140 Singapore dollars per person.. 150,000 Korean Won.. Time is bought with money.... This was my first experience purchasing an express ticket. Since the waiting time for popular attractions is 80 to 100 minutes, I couldn't find an answer. There were places where I had to wait 30 minutes for the express line, and anyway, I rode everything I could. Legal cutting in line...Express... I came this far to get on one, but I was so mad at waiting for an hour or two... In the end, I think I did well anyway... Because it's less difficult for my family... Above all, a child who likes to ride amusement rides Proving once again that laughter is worth the money. It was a bit disappointing that the Minions area was closed for maintenance, and Singapore Universal was definitely smaller... There wasn't as much to see as I thought... Anyway, I think I did everything without regrets. I don't think I need to come back again.... Above all, Singapore is so expensive that it is easy to It seems like a difficult tourist attraction to come by.

While Universal Studios Singapore offers a variety of attractions, its maintenance and aesthetic presentation fall short compared to other major theme parks. Visitors have reported frequent ride closures due to maintenance issues, which can significantly impact the overall experience. Express pass is a nice to have but not a must (at least at NY eve during the day)

5.review_text: When I came here for the first time, it happened that there were so many visitors that it took a long time to queue to enter the ride. Almost all the rides are full of visitors

The facilities are great. There are many attractions to enjoy. The queue is depending on the time and the weather. I bought the ice cream near the Cyclon and transformer attraction. The cashier is nice and so helpful patiently. The restaurang inside, they provide a good food with reasonable price.

The good thing is, it is less tourist now and you can enjoy all ride without any Express Pass. Most of ride only queue for less than 5 minutes, only Jurassic Park need to queue for about 30 minutes. A lot of tourist is here by travel tour and many of them do not put on the mask properly even when queuing in indoor.
Try to go on weekdays and the crowd is comparatively less. I have managed to go on all rides without express pass. The best was transformers ride.

Good rides although I feel that it's more male targeted. Transformers ride and Mummy ride was a long wait, but otherwise it was pretty fast waiting in my opinion compared to other theme parks e.g disneyland or other universals. LOTS of rollercoasters in this park, if youre looking for a more easy one then I recommend the Shrek 4D adventure.

1.review_text: Queues lasting 40-90 minutes for attractions that are no longer relevant, such as 3D cartoons or roundabouts. I don't recommend it.

Just back from USJ(Osaka) and wanna enjoy again so went to USS on 17 Feb 2025(Monday). USS here is super popular with Indian tourists, I think they make up 70% of today's crowd ba. This is my 3rd time here already. My 2nd time was during at later stage of COVID with my whole family but as told by the staffs there because of COVID, there were no showtimes, and because of raining, no rides. So in the end we all forfeited ten tickets without entering. 1st time was 2012-2013, only had 2 rides due to crowd. The Shrek show 4D is very good and the only best experience we had thru out. We at minionland and approached a staff on the pathway to ask him where to redeem the gift. He told us to go entrance's shop to redeem. The the staff at the shop say not his shop, need go minionland shop. Sighhhhhhhh ok, went back the minionland shop, redeemed 4pc of minion stickers each, gave it to some random kid. _ Waterworld is closed, disappointed but they did put up a notice on the website. But the staff guarding the entry was kinda rude to other tourists. The donkey live staff during the queue will shout at you if you bring in drinks, but funny, the entry staff never say anything. Why must shout leh? We just beside the staff only when he walked passed, maybe only 1 man in between us. Jurassic Park, the ride with the water slide thing, forget it, don't bother to queue anymore if it's drizzling. Came up alot of problems like Flooding? Technical issue? Undergoing inspection? Funny thing is, early in the day time, we were "forced" by the older female staff with short hair to lock our 1 sling bag in the locker before queuing. We locked our bag in the locker at the Mummy ride there since it's free. When they allow queuing after the rain,suddenly everyone can just dash in without locking anything in the lockers. The staffs were so rude if I were to compare to USJ, totally no feels at all. Kept shouting and shouting, like "GO TO ANOTHER RIDE, THERE OPEN" "DONT CROWD HERE" "NOT OPEN" "CLOSED". Even until exiting the USS, staff just yell "JUST GO" if you don't walk fast to exit. Before that, his "thank you" so soft that I think I hallucinating that he was speaking Japanese. All staffs dont smile at all, maybe only the auntie who is cleaning the tables at the eating area beside the fried chicken shop, only she smile and tell us kindly to chop out seat, and also the uncle in the mummy ride locker who assisted us to unlock our locker AFTER GETTING STUCKED FOR NOTHING over an hour at the Jurassic park water ride there. He never smile but at least he's kind and not shouting at us. In summary, ruined mood.

On February 24, 2025, at 12:45 PM, we experienced poor customer service from a staff member at the Mummy ride. Unfortunately, the staff member, Shafini, was extremely rude. I would like to request that the management review the CCTV footage at the gate where the incident occurred, if available. Please look into it. We paid for the tickets and we expect kind service. Thank you

Great place if you want to stand in line for an hour and ride an attraction for 1.5 minutes. The queues were too long, I didnt experience any pleasure. For the most popular attractions, queues last for an hour and a half.

Cannot compare with universal studio or even Disneyland at Japan. Restaurant crew are rude, may be there too many people queue for food. Games keep broken down and line keep open for fast ticket only. 8 out 10 persons all is for fast ticket only. So be mindful that you are paying to be torture by their staff.

2.review_text: First 2 rides were a waste of time! 1st ride queued for half an hour, then there was a technical issue. They simply gave u a choice to continue waiting INDEFINITELY or leave the queue. There was no service recovery at all. They should give visitors, at least the 1st 20 or so in the queue a food or express voucher. 2nd ride, the same thing happened AGAIN. This time, my group were supposed to be the next batch but there were technical difficulties too. While we were thankful that we weren't left hanging in the air like the batch before us, it was definitely very unpleasant. Again, there was no initiative for service recovery at all! I had to request for express tickets while explaining my situation of having about 2 hrs wasted in between these 2 rides. It's difficult to get the staff attention too. They avoided eye contact, walked away from me. They ALL were deemed bz 'helping' with the situation. Even though 1 or 2 was just looking 'bz'. An art which was frustrating to witness. There was another ride that was slightly delayed with technical issues again, but thankful, it was simply just a short 10min delay. Surprisingly, it wasn't crowded on a CNY Sunday afternoon. Not much tourists. I guessed for local visitors, not many will visit again if they have the same experience like me. Don't think I will visit for the next 5 years.

The wait is very long. I recommend that you DO NOT GO ON THE WEEKENDS OR PUPLIC HOLIDAY. The lines for the popular rides like the Cylon and Human were up at 180 minutes, but when we linked up it took nearly 4.5 h just for a minute ride. Also check to see if its going to rain, if it does please do not go, there will only be a few rides with super long lines, even with vip the lines will take at least an hour or two. And the vip tickets from experience is NOT WORTH IT.

It's hard for me not to give the park a positive review. The entire park itself needs 10 years of updates. Transformers still looks just as bad as if new technologies had not appeared. The mummy is fine and the best ones are the mountains from Battlestar Galactica which must be a million years old. The rest of the attractions could be criticized by a child under 12 years old because I don't know if it's worth waiting to get on. The entrance seemed expensive for what it could offer.
didn't go inside Taken from the front I have to tell you that this place looks a bit old. It doesn't look very lively. Quite a few people come to visit. Should be improved better than this.
Too crowded with many tourists waiting to enter Universal Studios.

3.review_text: It remained bad after Tokyo Disneyland. Some events constantly malfunction. Due to malfunctions, we were only able to enter 2 events in the first 3 hours. The queues are very long and the waiting times are very long. Our favorites in order 1) Waterworld - It was a very entertaining show, like a live movie. A must see. It will be more fun if you wear a raincoat and sit in the front rows. If you don't want to get wet, choose the back. It takes around 30 minutes. 2) Transformers - It was a nice experience to feel the action in the movie. 3) Light Camera Action - 4) Roller coasters are available at many events. The latter are below par. 5) Shrek - 3D cinema more suitable for children 6) Sesame Street - more suitable for children 7) Mummy - we can say that the tunnel of horror is a fast roller coaster. 8) Puss in boots - Kid-friendly roller coaster. 9) Dinosaur adventure - A boat trip where you're likely to get wet. Your shoes may get wet, take precautions if you are going to ride. The organization and employee behavior were not good, we did not like it. It's annoying when events keep crashing. Events that are overcrowded in the early morning hours become empty in the evening. Don't waste your time waiting for events that have a waiting time of more than 30 minutes. Or save your money and buy a priority pass. You will complete all activities in 3-4 hours.

Been to USS a few times when it first open and decided to bring my kids this year, Lets say the experience is quite underwhelming. I did not go for a lot of the rides, so I will only comment on the ones I went on. Battlestar Glactica: Human vs. Cylon: it is a must ride however USS needs to do some maintenance work to ensure that the ride remains hygienic after every ride. As the handle smells of a lot of sweat. Suggest to put a BIG sign to not bring phones or bags, otherwise the poor person at the front have to keep repeating himself or herself before scanning everyone with the handheld metal detector. Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure: the ride itself is interesting and fun for my kid but the handles need maintenance work as well, it was sticky and slimy Shrek 4-D adventure: the show was good but i feel like more can be done to ensure that there is order. Lots of foreigns squeezing and pushing their way through to their desire seats even though we were queuing to enter the row already. Maybe ensure that there are lines on the floor for people to queue so that they go to the row that they are lining up for. We went for some other shows, which are generally good but overall as a local, I dont think i will not bring my kids or even think about going to USS again. As the rides need maintenance, the toilets are not exactly designed with young children with strollers. The crowd there are mostly non-local and little more rowdy.

Nicely done. Still far too long queues for moderately good attractions. In addition, there are not that many attractions/the park is very small for the entrance fee. If you come from Europe or the USA, you should have a nice day at the theme parks there (which offer more and better attractions for the same price)!

The feeling of deprivation when you can't use it for the Minion Land attraction even though you bought the 100,000 won Express ticket... You had to buy the 175,000 won Express Plus ticket to be able to enter the Minion Land attraction without waiting in line. There was one employee who was unfriendly, but I don't want to say it in detail, but other than that person, the employees were generally friendly. If the weather is bad, you cannot ride the Rapids Adventure. I don't know anything else. As with all places like this, everything inside was expensive... and I was upset because I couldn't find many of the souvenirs I had booked in advance. I went to buy souvenirs... but it was a weekday on the day I went. If I was going to enter when it opened and leave when it closed, I wonder if I really needed the express. It's not that wide and there are separate attractions for kids and adults, so there's no need to ride all of them. And if you get the timing right, you can quickly enter popular attractions. I waited 50 minutes for Minion Mayhem, but I felt really bad when I saw the waiting time was 20 minutes later.

Minion land was super cute but I feel like Universal Studios Tokyo had a lot more attractions plus their Harry Potter section was actually attached I couldnt find the Harry Potter section easily here sadly. But regardless, we had a great time and had so much fun on some of the rides! But tickets in advance as we had to line up though there are machines if youre paying by card. Enjoy!

4.review_text: Food was fine.Portions were huge, and apparently costly compared to local food outside USS. Rides were fun, we went during cloudy day, which was good to avoid crowds. There were still long queues, but managed to cover most of the areas. Went out of the USS around 6ish. Disney is much bigger in comparison.
It's a pity to visit on a rainy day. You have to queue for about 0.5 to 1 hour for many facilities. Looking forward to the opening of the new park!

The park is moderate and you wont be too tired from playing Its just that there are too many facilities to watch movies or performances, and there are no seats, only standing tickets Ice cream 8, Minion soda 28 I couldnt re-enter the park anymore and I was so hungry that I couldnt bear to go to the Malaysian food court outside the door. The renovation started on 2/17? Unknown date in February Hurry up and take the Sentosa MRT. Fortunately, there is a food court on the left as soon as you exit the station.

The place is nice, the children will be delighted. On weekdays, queues are no more than 20 minutes. Its a pity that they havent added new attractions in 13 years, only a 4D cinema (Shrek), thats it. Adults will enjoy 2 large slides, a mummy and transformers; the rest of the time you can not waste in queues, but walk and enjoy the atmosphere

Express tickets are worth it if you want to skip the queues. The park is tidy and well-maintained, with a great selection of rides. I visit every so often and always enjoy the experience. However, taking the monorail in or out of the park can be a very long wait.

5.review_text: It is recommended to enter early, otherwise the queue will be longer. The maintenance of the equipment is for the safety of tourists. Perhaps it cannot be criticized for being too casual, but turning it on and off is very troublesome. Sometimes it waits for "half a day" (meaning a long time), and then it is turned off! (miserable)
The park is super crowded, coming here mainly involves queuing. If I come back again I will buy priority tickets to get in quickly

The last time I went to USS was in 2019, and for some reason, I remembered it being much bigger. Turns out, its actually pretty compact. This time, I went on a public holiday, whichbig mistakethe crowd was insane. Lines were already crazy long the moment I arrived at 11 AM. I thought I could handle the wait, so I lined up for Accelerator (the spinning yellow ride). After 30 minutes of barely moving in line, I gave up and got the Express Pass for SGD 140which, by the way, you can buy on the spot. It definitely helped, cutting down wait times significantly. Most rides took around 10 minutes max with Express Pass, while the regular queue was easily 3045 minutes at best, and for some rides, even up to 2 hours. Puss in Boots with an Express Pass? Still took an hour, so yeah, be prepared. That being said, USS is still a fun experience. My top recommendations? Revenge of the Mummy (a great indoor coaster with cool effects), Transformers (always a solid choice), Human vs. Cyclon (for thrill-seekers), and Lights, Camera, Action! (surprisingly entertaining). If you like Jurassic Park, definitely check out Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure (prepare to get soaked) and Canopy Flyer (a fun suspended coaster with a great view of the park). With the Express Pass, I managed to finish all the must-ride attractions by 3 PM, which made it feel worth it. If youre visiting on a peak day, just be prepared for long queues or consider getting an Express Passthough it doesnt always mean instant access. If you prefer a more relaxed experience, going on a weekday might be the way to go.

I really love this Theme Park! Ive been there twice every year and always enjoyed it a lot! Although I would recommend only going with an Expresstickets as the Lines for every attraction are very long. The Food is at a medium price! Love it there
Its better to come for the whole day to have time to visit everything. And definitely before the opening, as there are long queues during the day.

1.review_text: I visited Universal Studios Singapore today and had a disappointing experience. Upon arrival, several rides were experiencing technical issues. I waited 30 minutes for the Minions ride only to be told it was down. I then lined up for the Sesame Street ride for 15 minutes, and it was also under technical problems. The waiting times for some rides were incredibly long, yet the actual ride durations were less than a minute. Most of the attractions felt boring and didnt live up to the excitement I expected, especially when compared to Universal Studios in LA. While I understand the park is smaller, Ive had much more enjoyable experiences at smaller parks like Hong Kong Disneyland, where the rides are far more entertaining. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return.

The park seems big, with beautiful scenery. But there is a huge BUT. The queues are huge everywhere, and the rides themselves take 2 minutes. You stand in line for 40-60 minutes, 1.5-2 minutes of pleasure. Yes, and this pleasure is dubious. For adults, the attractions are very simple, but for families with children it will be torture - try standing for 40 minutes at each attraction with your child. It's complicated. We stood for 40 minutes on one attraction, and it closed right in front of us! For inexplicable reasons. The other attraction had almost the same thing, but they still opened it. Overall the impression is very bad, especially for the money. The food is tasteless, everything is not budget, the attractions are boring and not extreme (except for one). Terrible, don't recommend!

General maintenance on rides lacking, they can't be bothered to fix minor faults, Examples.. smoke machines, lights, wind machines, under chair SFX, heat machines, water canons, moving SFX. I wonder what the maintenance is like for Health and Safety if they can't fix the smaller faults. dirty 3D glasses Edit: after writing this review the roller coaster kept breaking down.

We going there on rainy days about a week ago. The tickets that we bought online cannot be refund, but almost all the attractions are cancelled . There are some indoor attractions still available, but its also broken. there is an error on minions attraction, while we wait for around 30 minutes for the attraction. Universal studio should change their policy, especially on bad weather. Or please make all the place covered do we dont get wet while walking around there. Such a bad experience

We were excited to visit Universal Studios Singapore last October, but it turned out to be a huge disappointment. The park was overcrowded, and the overall experience felt underwhelming. There was nothing particularly special about it, and it lacked the magic and excitement we expected from a major theme park. To make things worse, the park closes around 7 PM, with no night shows or special eventsjust a dull and abrupt ending to the day. The heat was also unbearable, reaching at least 40C, and there was no air conditioning in indoor areas. Instead of offering a break from the extreme temperatures, the enclosed spaces felt suffocating. Navigating through the packed crowds in these conditions made the visit exhausting rather than enjoyable. Compared to Disneylandwhich weve visited three times and loved every timeUSS doesnt even come close. The lack of proper facilities, entertainment, and overall mediocre experience make it completely overrated and not worth the visit.

2.review_text: Overpriced. Long Wait times (45 - 60 Mins) as inadequate staff on rides, one staff is handling queue, exit, entrance, operation hence turnaround time is low. Very Limited options for Vegetarian or Indian Food.

The park is very diverse and beautifully landscaped. The attractions of the park are for all ages. An essential and negative aspect is represented by the waiting time in queues. Regardless of the objective, wait in line for 40-60 minutes. In this case, there is not enough time to enjoy the park, not even from its opening to its closing.

It would have been a really nice experience if we hadn't spent the whole day standing in lines. We stayed from morning until evening and only got to enjoy half of the tourist attractions. Yes, the park is beautiful and created in a fun way, but the queues of over 40 minutes at each attraction make me not recommend this place.

It is an old park that has been in operation for many years, or Universal itself is not as fun as Disney. But Singapore Global is exceptionally boring. Two major projects are out of service for maintenance.

I'm in Universal Park right now and I'm pretty disillusioned and disappointed. First of all, I'm used to German theme parks. The roller coasters are poorly organized, the route is ridiculous and, with the exception of one, simply not worth the time. Maybe I'm just not the target group. The entire park organization is also deficient in many areas. On a rainy day, the air conditioning runs so cold that it becomes uncomfortable to go indoors in wet clothes. The milkshakes are so cold that you're more likely to chew ice crystals. In terms of price/performance: The food is simply not worth the money. Especially for Singapore conditions. This was the worst meal of my entire trip so far. So, onto the good things: The decoration is really well done. The facades in the streets are lovingly and detailed. The best ride in my opinion was Revenge of the Mummy. Good storytelling. I can completely advise against Puss in Boots. This is an absolute stop and go ride with no flow. The park has real potential that it is wasting in so many places, so it's a real shame. I'm leaving again after about 3 hours. I was really looking, I was really looking forward to the park but all in all it's more of a 3 classic park with a name

3.review_text: The waiting time for entertainment items is generally very long, and some are exposed to the sun, which makes people uncomfortable. If you don't buy VIP tickets, the entertainment experience is not proportional to the waiting time. All in all, it was a relatively satisfactory experience.

Went on a Thursday, was medium crowded. 83 for a normal ticket . Waited upto 30-40 minutes on some rides but some ride it was just 5 minutes. Sadly the waterworld is closed for maintenance, which they could've mentioned in their website. Beer is 13 inside, so plan your food & beverages budget accordingly. Was so hot climate, would suggest a cap and glass . Some rides you can keep the loose items in locker for 1 hour for free. Mummy and Cyclone rollercoaster was good. Jurassic park ride you may get slightly wet but not much. You don't have to carry extra cloth for that.

Its a very compact Universal Studios - small but well-designed, and you can easily cover everything in less than a day. However, unlike the ones in Orlando or Beijing, I cant give the Singapore Universal Studios a positive review. The sheer number of Indian visitors is astonishing, and unfortunately, their behavior is often appalling. Queue - jumping is rampant - parents send their kids ahead in line and then keep pushing forward themselves. Or worse, while youre waiting, someone behind you keeps pressing their belly against your back or your bag with every step you take. Its incredibly frustrating. Typically, they move in large family groups - five, seven, or even a dozen people together - and the smell can be overwhelming.

Visited the USS during school holiday. The crowd wasn't too bad but the waiting time for most of the rides were more than 30 minutes. If you are bringing toddlers, entering the park without express pass is not going to worth your time as you will spend 30-45 mins for literally 10 mins ride.

Pretty small, not that many cool rides. The quality of decorations wasnt very good either. After visiting Universal Studio in Osaka this one was disappointing. I wanted to see the Far Far away the most, but one of the main rides was under construction. I came around 9.45, got in around 10. There were not many people inside. I guess because it was Wednesday morning and rainy. Even though it was raining, all the rides were working fine. And thankfully there were no lines. So I was done with everything by 2pm. What I didnt like is that several rides required you to leave your belongings in a locker but some of them werent free. So I just went to the locker room of another ride and left my stuff there for free for 45mins. They also made you take off the rain coat for the ride, so needles to say everyone was soaking wet.

4.review_text: Pros: The park has a low visitor volume, making it a great experience for tourists. Even on weekends, most attractionsexcept for the roller coastersdont require long wait times. Its also easy to take photos without waiting for a good spot. The newly opened Minion Land is a nice addition; though small, its well-designed and adds some freshness to USS. Cons: A large portion of the park is occupied by outdated attractions that are no longer as popular, taking up space and resources. Additionally, some attractions, like WaterWorld, remain closed indefinitelyIve visited multiple times and never seen it open. This space could be used for newer, more appealing attractions. The merchandise selection is uninspired, with inconsistent quality.

New attraction is more minion , you can see many people holding the toy that make them happy . In Singapore weather, it will be nice if they open at night, it is like the F1 Singaporean version . In fact, since majority of the popular attraction is indoors, it is easy to accommodate for the night version, and with the lighting, this can be the first night amusement park in the world # do not buy tickets from Klook, please go google reviews, you will find out how horrible the experience you will get if you need help

We visited on 30 th March 2025. The weather warnings played spoil sport most rides were not functional for half day. The rides especially cylon and human and mummy are good to look forward to. The human and mummy had 30 minutes plus wait time on Sunday. Transformers ride is a good experience and we enjoyed the shrek 4d movie.

If you want to ride a single piece of equipment, there is no separate ticket. You buy a ticket for entry. We just wanted to ride the Roller Coaster, but this was not possible. You need to go there in good time for it to be worth the price you pay.

If you're here by 10am, the wait isn't long for the rides. The queues build up around midday and the wait can take upto 60 minutes if the ride is popular. If you are happy to join the singles queue, you can get in quicker. A wonderful, fun way to spend the day and a must visit while in Singapore.

5.review_text: One of the reasons we came to Singapore! Huge day out, but was the best and my children had a fantastic time. Got to go on some rides quick, average ride was an hour waited 3 hours for the Jurassic ride as it kept malfunctioning. A little annoying with the VIPs who pushes us non VIPs back for longer waiting times. More seating areas in the food areas would be a bonus. Spent the whole day till closing with the fire works finishing off the night. Tip - get in ASAP, and run to your first choice ride to avoid the line up. Be prepared that loose items and bags will need to be put into a locker before the rides. Hat and water bottle is a must.

Very good park and attractions. The attraction staff were a little unmotivated and were not very efficient with distributing people correctly. There were empty seats on attractions where there were 60 minute delays. In any case, going early and with good organization you do not need a fast pass. I want to highlight the good attitude of an older man who works in the transformers game... the only one who smiled and shared good energy with people.

Visited on a Thursday, maximum 20 minutes wait at attractions, smooth traffic. Very beautiful park, ticket taken the old one on Pelago at an advantageous price. In my opinion, this park is really worth it during a stay in Singapore (even for a 3/4 day stay like I did).

I had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore! The rides and attractions were fun, and the park had a great atmosphere. The only downside was that some rides and WaterWorld were closed during my visit, which was a bit disappointing. Still, I enjoyed the experience and will definitely come back!

Few things if you are visiting for the first time like I did. Don't worry about buying tickets in advance. There are ticketing kiosks. Download the park map from the website for planning your schedule and priorities. Wait times can be long as most reviews would say. But be smart. Not all rides are worth the wait. The treasure hunt was the least worth it for us. Rides in SciFi, Sesame Street, Egypt, and Shrek 4D were our favourites. Watch out for character meet and greets. They just come and go for a very short duration, but could elevate your whole experience. We kept missing them most of the day until we caught Puss in the boots.

1.review_text: The first mistake is to divide the audience into two. It is also wrong to treat Express customers as first class and treat other customers as if they were "whatever". And everywhere is crowded. Keeping that much time for each ride is absolutely wrong. An artificial waiting queue appears to have been created. And everything is expensive. Tourists should definitely avoid this place.
Disappointing park! Too many technical problems... we're queuing for nothing! Management doesn't work! It's horrible.. thank you goodbye never again

poor management of ride and arrangement, overworked staff with bad attitude. Especially poor is their locker arrangement which causes confusion by the staff. You need to get allocated a locker from their control screen, then put the things in the locker and close it, for the next person to use it. However, when putting things in the locker, other people may try to change your screen. Even worse, the staff come and cancel the screen, so the original person can't close their locker and need to queue again. Total chaos and nightmare, with bad staff attitude (kept yelling at people to put what sized bags into the locker first). Please note that a lot of the rides need to use lockers as they don't allow bags. Not interested in trying all the rides.

Very few attraction with 80-120 mins waiting time! The entire park is focusing on to spend more and more money in the shopes and restaurants which is 80% of the entire park. Not recommended to go there especially on weekends or public holidays.

If you been to any other theme park before avoid this one. All childish ride and you have to wait very long for every ride or long queue for buying food. Totally over crowded, And weather is worse. Customer service is not up to mark. Overall this theme park nothing special.

2.review_text: The 2 stars are for the place. Its very over priced and u have to be ready to stand in queues for most of the day. Some queues are upto 1.5 to 2 hours long and then u have the Singaporean weather which melts u down. Also the weather can suddenly suspend the rides. Try to go for the single rider queue wherever available.

Disappointment. A lot of attractions are just rollercoasters, with quite long waiting lines and requirement to leave your belongings in a lockers paid extra. Besides you can hang out and spend more money on food and candy. Not much themed hang out park spaces really. Youll spend most of the time just waiting in a line. Low quality to price ratio.

Dear Universal Studios Team, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to share our recent experience during our visit to Universal Studios on Monday, April 14, 2025, which, unfortunately, turned out to be quite disappointing due to repeated technical issues across multiple attractions. Our day began with a long waitover an hour and a halffor the Transformers ride. Just as we finally boarded the ride vehicle, we were asked to disembark due to a technical issue. We waited an additional 30 minutes in hopes of resolution, but another issue occurred, and the experience had to be paused again. Next, we visited the Shrek Fairy Tale Castle attraction. After a considerable wait and a 2025 minute pre-show briefing, we were again told that a technical issue had occurred and the experience could not continue. Later, at the Jurassic Park splash ride, we waited over an hour in line. Unfortunately, as we reached the boarding area, we were once more informed of technical difficulties, which caused another lengthy delay before the ride was operational. In total, we were only able to experience three rides and one show during the entire day. Given that the park closed at 7 PM, it left us with very limited time to enjoy what we had planned. We understand that occasional technical issues are inevitable, but experiencing this level of disruption throughout the day was genuinely disheartening, especially considering the cost and effort involved in planning the visit.

BEWARE OF THIS INFORMATION BEFORE YOU GO: 1. If you're buying a ticket online, purchase it only from the official RWSentosa website. If you buy through third-party resellers, you wont receive any assistance if you encounter problems with your tickets at the park. 2. We visited the park on a Thursday in April. The waiting time for the most popular or new attractions was 5060 minutes. Be prepared to spend money on an Express Pass, otherwise, youll spend half the day just waiting in line. 3. However, the Express Pass doesnt work for some of the most popular rides or the newest zones (currently, its the Minions area). 4. Many rides are not allowed for kids shorter than 122125 cm. Overall, our son enjoyed everything, but as parents, we werent really happy with the organization. For a family of three, we spent 600 SGD for one dayit didnt feel like good value for money.
Many rides were cancelled sighting technical problems and that was a bummer for visitors like us who flew all the way from India to this park. The one in Florida was much better.

3.review_text: Went there on weekday. 3 rides were stopped due to technical issues, waited for each for about 20 minutes before they said not working. Food and beverages are expensive, soft cone 8, beer is for 13. No water fountains in this blistering heat so you end up buying 500ml of water for 5. Wait times do come down around 4 pm. Don't recommend. Better to see the zoo and do the night safari. Don't do the aquarium.

To reach Universal Studios, alight at HarbourFront MRT Station. Take Exit E to VivoCity and proceed to level 3 to board the Sentosa Express. Alight 1 stop later at Resorts World Station. Walk straight till you see Twelve Cupcakes on your right. Turn right and head towards the Universal Studios Globe. Avoid weekends, its gets crazy-crowded. Operating Hours keep changing so check their website, and so does their rides for maintenance.. Totally avoidable, the shows and the rides, for the most part, have not changed since 15 years. Most of them were there when I last went 15 years back. Illuminations Minion Land is probably the only new addition. The show "WaterWorld" which was something I was really looking forward to watch again was temporarily shut down. Costs SGD 85.00 per person. No Indian restaurants.

The rides are very fun. However, make it a habit to not go on public holidays or weekend as queues make take up to 2 hours. Moreover, beverages and food prices are very high so you can buy food from Harbourfront and then eat it in Sentosa. To combat the long queues you can buy the express pass which is very worth it.
Everytlme we went one unit is always closed. And new minion two times delayed.. morning we arrived.. we went to minion .. after long q , unit is closed Evening time is delayed again

There is a charge of 4S to use the lockers at Jurassic Park even for a short time. I don't want to have to pay change each time, but I would like to have about an hour's worth included in the admission fee. The person in charge at the entrance will leave your luggage for you! Even though I said so, when I went in and lined up, there were a lot of people who had their own bags. Although the estimated waiting time is a guideline, it is completely unreliable. There were a lot of other things I was concerned about, and it was a day where I was more disappointed in the quality of the service than the fun.

4.review_text: Still a double feeling. We arrived at 10 am on a weekday. There are queues. We paid on Agoda - which turned out to be more profitable and faster, because we automatically have the tickets in our phone. We stood in line and went in. I advise you to download an application where attractions, waiting times, and show times are recorded. Very convenient. Universal. And you can even make a plan in advance. What you will do and what you wont. But whats inconvenient is standing in line. Sometimes it takes a long time. We had 2 cases - we were standing, but as a result the attraction was broken. Perhaps in the morning it is better to go to the rides that are in the middle - because everyone will break down either on the first or last rides. In general, look at the queues. At lunchtime everyone usually goes out to eat. You can come at this time too. Take some water with you and something to snack on (especially for a child). Caps, glasses, spf. It's fun to walk around, but this ill-conceived waiting system is depressing. Too many people are launching. Well, at least there are different airflows almost everywhere while waiting You can buy a fast track ticket - then your waiting time will decrease I dont recommend watching the show with Puss and Boots. Better spend this time on something else. The child is happy. I would like more. Not all rides were ridden. Because there were queues and it was scary somewhere. Very tasty and interesting waffles with Shrek - I recommend it!!!

We really enjoyed our day at USS, its a clean & fun park. Whilst not huge, there were plenty of rides to keep our kids (& adults) entertained. A couple of issues we had that I thought are worth mentioning, in case it helps someone else! * No re-entry is allowed. This was disappointing for us as a HUGE storm came across & closed down every ride, for quite some time (over an hour by the time we left & not looking like easing anytime soon). When all you can do is take shelter inside a shop or restaurant (however most of these are largely outdoor seating areas), it would have been great to able to get the Sentosa Express back to HarbourFront & get dry/fed & be able to go back once the weather cleared. Instead, we just left & didnt go back. * Waterworld was closed when we were there, this happens, I get it. The Minions ride broke down as my kids were queuing for it, with no re-opening time available. Given the cost of tickets (its not a cheap day out!) & putting up with things like this, I really think a re-entry option for weather, as stated above, would be a great gesture of goodwill. * Ride operators arent really behaving in the spirit of the place. One girl working the Transformers ride made our children completely exit the queue area because they had accidentally used the express lane without an express pass... only thing is, they were the only people in both the express & the ordinary lane. Doesnt set a great tone to the day when staff cant show any kindness to a group of children who arent inconveniencing anyone else.

First time in Singapore and decided to go to universal studios. Food was good and drinks however some of the staff wasnt so nice. I mean dont get me wrong they are happy but one guy was so rude it was like he didnt even want to be there. All in all it was okay however they should hire their staff more if they have interests

They should make some roller coasters indoors like IMG and WB have done in the UAE, rather than having visitors told that outdoor closed because of the "weather", also wetsuits should be provided if not then rented/sold outside rides and attractions which could get you wet. Other than that one of the best theme parks in Asia, everything up to its reputation. Good 3d effects, Spielberg sound stage was fantastic. Beautifully built.

Visited on a Wednesday, outside of school holidays therefore off peak, and arrived 45mins before the opening. We purchased our ticket the day before while visiting Sentosa. Make sure the date mentioned is correct though, the staff made a mistake in our tickets by putting the day to the same day we bought them and the only reason we could still get the date fixed the day after is because we could prove that we purchased the tickets the day before late in the afternoon. Tip1: We were right in not purchasing the express pass (which saved us a lot of money!): the trick is to arrive early and go straight away to the most popular attractions that usually get busy very quickly. Between 10am and 11:30am, we were able to do everything we wanted with a maximum wait of 15mins. After that, the waiting time reached 100mins in some attractions, so we could take our time having lunch and wandering until we could go back to the popular attractions that got less crowded from 3pm onwards. FYI: you can always pay for an express pass on the spot but note the cheaper pass only allows you to use it ONCE per attraction and NOT all attractions! Tip 2: go light as the lockers youll have to rent for some attractions are rather small. Tip3: dont listen to the staff who pushes you to pay for a locker for the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure because youd get 80% wet . It wasnt true, we got barely wet and ended up paying for nothing. Tip4 (its 100% personal): as a parent of a 7 yo and a toddler, I was glad I didnt bring my youngest because she wouldnt have enjoyed it as much. My eldest however had such a blast and it was really fun and thrilling for his age. There were many families with very young children (below 6) and I found the choice for the latter quite limited and not as interesting because they would have had as much fun with all the free parks and such already available in Singapore. That really is up to everyone of course. Tip5: dont forget your physical passport for the tax refund which is right before you exit the park. All in all: we had a blast, the kiddo had fun, we could enjoy the attractions early in the morning before the crowd and we left with a lot of merch in our shopping bags. :)

5.review_text: This place was great one of the best theme parks I have ever been. Waiting times are long, especially during the day so express ticket is a must. From 10:30am to 5:30pm queuing time for decent attractions are more than an hour.

although i went on a weekday, there was still quite alot of people tourists mostly. however the rides i rode mostly had a queue time of 10-30mins with the mummy ride as an exception of 1hr. however, it is understandable as it is one of the most popular rides. a lot of people started leaving around evening time so the queues got reasonably shorter which was good. food wise, i tried the cafe beside the transformers ride. bought the ramen. it was quite expensive 16. but its universal studios so cant really complain. the food was not bad though. comparable to japanese chain restaurants.
enjoyed our day here. Most queues were short, especially in the morning, the park got busier later in the day. Compared to other major theme parks

Been here 2 times already, this time i didnt come on holiday season so it wasnt too busy. The wait time was pretty good. My favorite attractions was the movie simulation and transformer. Its very fun and i had a great time with my gf overall. However there were so many people from india, pretty much 50% if the tourist there is from india. I dont have a problem with that, but a lot of them have really terrible body odor, so maybe it would be great to install some fragrance and air con during in the attraction line area. Its can be very unpleasant to smell during the wait

Have fun. Download their APP to view the waiting time at each ride in real time. It is really accurate. The queues are considerably smaller by the last hour of the day. It could be a good idea to try the rides again in the end. I found most of the open shows were not worth it. Could be relevant for the kids.

1.review_text: Worst experience !! Over hyped and long queue will be around 3 hrs minimum for one ride . This is not the way to handle crowd or worst experience in singapore .Waste of money.. Actually for worst customer service I would have complain it to court to return my money back !! Never bring children , They will be exhausted . We have been stuck in transformers for more than 3-4 hrs queue and we were unable to take other rides. Even express tickets were been on long queue. Even on weekdays. Worst experience for children. Waste of money. You will waste your valuable time and money in singapore if you enter here .if u have big crowd you must be able to manage to crowd . Other wise dont welcome all of the people just to get their money !!! Please put some sort of sign!!

Waiting time was too much for each attraction hence wasted my time and energy standing in long queues. Wish management had handled the crowd properly so that people can get chance to see atleast main attractions. wasted 2 hours standing in queue for a 10-15 mins event... Hardly managed to see 3 events :(. Also, food service was slow and long queues here too. There was not much space to sit and relax while the weather was hot and humid... Not many places to get water even. Also, shopped so much but didn't even get my gst refund as biller didn't enter my passport number, which I was not aware at that time. Overall it didn't meet the expectations.

We visited USS as a family including 3 year old. We came here on a friday and reached the place around 10:15am. First of all there were long queue in front of us and we werent sure which Q we are supposed to wait. There should have been proper Q ribbons extending all the way to manage the Q and provide proper labeling for each Q. This would help for newcomers as we do not want to end up in the wrong queue and waste a lot of time. Even we were a family, we were provided three separate QR codes each in a separate e ticket file. We ended up spending lot of time opening the unique qr code and gaining entry. Our child was in a stroller and they made individual persons to walk across the entry gate one by one which I have never seen in any other place. While doing that my childs stroller got stuck in between the gates and I had to forcefully pull it out. This could have been avoided easily. Little did we know this was beginning of our disappointments in the so called popular over hyped amusement park. Once we downloaded their mobile app, we got to know the dreaded wait times. Some rides had 150 minutes (2.5 hours) !!!! Really ?? There is no point in reaching early or trying rides during lunch hours. The number of visitors are so huge, it doesnt make any sense. Do you want us to spend the whole day just for one ride? You need to be really crazy to wait hours for just one ride. There must be some rides dedicated for kids. Here in minion park, adults were doing merry go round. Though wait time was shown as 30mins we waited for more than 1 hour for a ride of hardly 60 seconds. Also USS should take example from river wonders in Mandai and provide proper shades as it is really difficult to roam around in scorching heat. Except for the Revenge of the Mummy and Transformers rides, I didnt find other rides any different from the ones we see in usual parks. Also USS doesnt understand capacity. They are just allowing infinite number of visitors to this place which isnt large enough to hold all of them or entertain them. You have queues even to get food or drinks or snacks or anything. Coming to the shows, they are all sub standard. We have witnessed much better shows in universities or malls. To top it all, water world show was closed due to maintenance. My final advice to everyone looking forward to visiting USS, if you have already been to any amusement park in your country/city, this place is not worth your time and money. You can make better use of this whole day by visiting some other place. This whole place is just over rated and I would never recommend anyone to visit this place.
Terrible queues. Some attractions are not included in the ticket price. Very bad experience

I visited USS on 18 May and, despite the heavy rain, had an overall enjoyable experienceuntil the end (5.15pm), when my girlfriend and I were heading for the Cyclon ride. We had an unpleasant encounter with a staff member named "Cedric" (as shown on his name tag). He scanned us with a handheld metal detector and directed me toward the right side of the queue. My girlfriend, who came after, was unsure of where to queue due to the lack of clear signage and accidentally entered the express queue. We looked back at him and he corrected us. However, we then heard a remark right after (either directed at us or him speaking to his colleague) that had an extremely sarcastic and rude tone, that went along the line of "Already say queue that side right?" which was so uncalled for and made us feel disrespected. We hope this feedback can be used constructively, perhaps as a reminder to ensure all guests are treated with basic courtesy.

2.review_text: Don't do it if you don't want to wait in line for 90 minutes for one of the few promotions! We were there at the beginning of May, shortly after it opened, and it was already hopelessly overcrowded. We quickly went to the back of the park so we could go rafting and ride the not-so-rewarding Jurasicpark roller coaster. Otherwise, we only had enough for a whopping two screenings, as the waiting times shot up to 2.5 hours! There is only an overpriced Fast Pass and no virtual waiting lines, as we know from Europa Park, for example. We also noticed negatively the employees who, in a very unsympathetic way, made room for the "Raptor" appearance in the Jurasic Park area. In general, the way you can use photos to show characters like Shrek and Co is also not nice. You stand in line for ages and are pushed through by the employees in a rude tone. We've been to Universal Studios in Hollywood before. In contrast, the Singapore branch is an absolute joke. The 2nd star is only given for the Steven Spielberg special effects show. All in all, unfortunately by far the worst amusement park I've ever been to.

Mummy ride was great but cost way too much for express pass and food around the park. Transformers ride was completely closed and waterwork show, battlestar galactica was a nuisance to get on as your not allowed to have anything in your pockets but then have to sit in a 90 minute queue then come out to the locker and have no way of paying. Not even a slimline bumbag holding only a credit card was allowed. They dont have many ways to combat the heat around the park so express pass is the only way unless you wanna sweat all the way through hours of queueing and not enough thrill rides, cyclon was just a bit janky and made me feel sick and human was too slow and boring for such a long queue. I wouldnt recommend.

45 to get in , rides are busy over an hour wait for rapids ride ( maybe 10 mins on ride).the rest at least 40 mins. Very hot and limited shade available. Beer small bottle 11 dollars . Rides are old and waterworld and transformers closed. You can happly skip this in the 2 days suggested for expensive singapore.

Too many people took the 150 dollar fast pass to wait at all the attractions for 20 to 40 minutes Why sell so many fast passes? In the end it makes no sense, for what they offer I prefer Disney. I wanted to see Shrek at all the times indicated, it had never been released, no one knows why

Not a patch on Universal in Florida but the price reflects this. Not many rides - the 2 roller coasters are worth a visit. Disappointed that with so few rides compared to Florida, Transformers and Waterworld were both closed on the day we went. They cant afford to have rides closed with not many there!

3.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore has some truly enjoyable attractions, and I did have fun thanks to the Express Pass I purchased. But its difficult to overlook the lack of organization and indifference shown by staff during our visit, especially at the very start of the day. Upon arriving at the park entrance, I witnessed a frustrating incident in the Express lane: a few individuals were standing in line without tickets, claiming their friends were buying them. Staff allowed them to hold a place, and soon after, a large groupmore than ten people cut the line to join them. Only a few individuals were initially holding the spot, and none of them had even purchased entry tickets when they started queuing. When the rest of the group arrived, a staff member briefly told them to go to the back of the line, but then stood by and allowed them to stay once they pushed their way in. To make matters worse, I was asked to move aside to make room for them, even though I had followed all the rules and had a valid Express Pass. The handling was unfair, inconsistent, and felt like the louder you were, the more you got away with. I later sent a formal complaint via email, only to receive a generic and dismissive response that read more like a script than a genuine reply. The tone was cold and impersonal, showing no willingness to acknowledge the staffs mishandling or take any meaningful responsibility. It felt less like an effort to resolve a guest concern, and more like a gesture to defend their staff while avoiding accountability. I want to be fair: I did enjoy many parts of the park and appreciated the efficiency of the Express system itself. But much of the experience was tainted by what felt like an unwelcoming, mechanical attitude among staff. Id estimate that at least 60% of the employees I encountered looked visibly unhappy or disengaged with their work. The park has potential to deliver a great experience, but they seriously need to address crowd control, staff morale, and basic guest fairness. Without the Express Pass, this wouldve been a very different and likely much more frustrating day.

Nice attractions, BUT the queues were just enormous. Almost all attractions were in between 60 and 150 minutes waiting. There are queues for the food, for drinks, for the train... in the end i was more exhausted of the waiting and the heat/humidity rather than the pleasure of the attractions. Also, for example Gardaland in Italy better- better attractions and better organisation If you come from Europe, I would suggest not to go for it. Go to gardaland instead

Cool place, but completely inadequate queues. We arrived at the opening and there were a lot of people there right away, we managed to ride 1 attraction and after that the queue for all the attractions was 100-120 minutes, it sounds like crazy. We were there on May 2, Friday, I didnt expect such a large crowd of people, it was not comfortable. We only went on 4 rides the whole day.

Not my thing. We couldnt get to any rights. The shortest wait time was 15 min and in reality it was 45. Very humid day as almost every day in Singapore. There are almost no shades. All you can do is to go to the aircon shops and spend more money youve already spent to be able to go for fun rides which are unacessible because of the wait time
Way too long a wait time for rides Expect rude staffs too

4.review_text: My experience was on 17 May 2025 (Saturday) Some Issues I Faced: -The roller coaster seat smelled like sweat and it honestly made me feel like throwing up. I was one of the earliest people to get on too. -The ticket price was still full price even though some major attractions like Transformers: The Ride and Waterworld were closed. No discounts offered. -Waiting time not accurate. -Some rides, like Canopy Flyer, suddenly broke down and we had to wait ages for them to fix it. The staff didnt take the initiative to explain things. -The park closed early at 7PM. The lights had just turned on and everything looked so nice for photos, but we had to leave. No light show, water show, or fireworks either. -The Q system was ok la.. but there were no chairs. Standing for so long was exhausting! -The restaurant was too crowded and the food was just ok. Tips if Youre Planning to Go: -Get there before 8.30AM to avoid the crowds and long queues. -Bring your own water bottlethere are refill stations. -Check the Sentosa website for maintenance updates, opening hours and etc. -Hit the popular rides first, and then pick ones with shorter waiting time as you go. -Always check the weather forecast beforehand, even if its not 100% accurate. -Do some research and read reviews or other peoples experiences before buying tickets and planning your day. -Go on weekdays and avoid peak months and public holidays. Overall: This is my first theme park, but I think it might be average compared to others. Thankfully, I didnt run into any really serious problems like some others did. Despite the issues, I still managed to enjoy myself but i'm still sad that Transformers: The Ride was closed that day (i can't changed my fixed date ticket) y

Nice rides. But it was very crowded being a weekday. Approx. 16000 guests visited that day and wait time for express too was 30/45 mins. Insane queue at food courts with 1.45hr wait just to place order. Also it was super sunny n hot, humid. There is Minions section newly opened but the express ticket doesn't work there. Its better to buy ticket online but we purchased tickets at vivocity mall which came to same price as on klook. Better deal is with express n admission together which comes cheaper than actual. The train from vivocity to sentosa too was very crowded and took us almost 45 mins in queue.
2-3 rides closed but nice food was not very tasty and limited options

Even during the week there are a lot of people. I recommend buying an express ticket so you don't have to wait in lines. Compared to universal studios in Los Angeles, Singapore is much worse. However, if someone is there for the first time, they will have fun :)
