A great day out. The park itself isn't massive, so it is an easy day out. The queues on the day I went were around 20 minutes max. I went on the big rides 4 times each. The food was OK, service was pretty quick. I left around 4 and had done all I wanted. Great place for kids

5.review_text: I am a postgraduate student in Singapore. On Sunday, May 4th, 2025, I visited Universal Studios Singapore for the second time. I bought the ticket in advance on Ctrip in China. I came alone and didn't need to queue to enter the park. Many attractions also have express lanes for single people. The queuing time for each attraction is much shorter compared to Universal Studios in other countries. The longest queuing time is forty minutes, but only for individual projects. Moreover, there is a limited park - Hello Kitty that is not available in other countries. The Sanrio characters in it are particularly cute and good-looking. I bought a lot of goods, and if there are any unsatisfactory quality issues, you can return or exchange them at any time with the receipt. Especially, an intern clerk named "Joycelyn"mylamerilyn has a particularly good service attitude. She is serious in her work and has a good attitude. She is willing to run around to help customers find flawless goods. Because of her, I saw the service attitude of this chain amusement park, a big brand and a big company, towards customers. I am particularly satisfied. Next time, I will bring my family or classmates to Universal Studios Singapore again!

We went on a Monday and even though there weren't many people, the queue at the attractions lasted from 20 minutes to an hour. Despite this, the attention to detail in the park, even in the queue areas for the rides, makes the wait go by quicker. Park really well looked after and very well done. I will gladly return and above all I recommend downloading the Universal Studios Singapore app to always have a real-time update of the waiting time on the various rides to decide which one to go to first.

Went on a sunday Mothers Day! There wasnt so many people if i were to compare it with Disneyland but going home during closing time is a different story, the line to the sentosa express can be very long and takes a while, i suggest going around other areas in Sentosa thats walkable if you still have the energy for that. The overall theme park experience is honestly nice and its easy to go around, can be very hot in the afternoon. Also have a number of restaurants you can chill out to when youre too tired midday. The latest addition minion land is my favorite part as a minions fan :) love all the meet and greet, download their app to keep yourself updated during your visit. All worth it :)

Universal Studios Singapore provides a fun and engaging experience for many visitors, with a good balance of thrilling rides, family-friendly attractions, and immersive themed zones. However, potential visitors should be aware of the potential for long wait times and the relatively high ticket prices. Consider purchasing tickets in advance and planning your visit strategically to maximize your enjoyment.

Much more smaller than USJ that it can be explored it a day.. The crowd is moderate, we're able to ride most of the attractions, including the roller coasters (we skipped the ones for tiny kids) despite arriving 1pm. Food: we did not eat.. priorty is to ride em all. Usual wait time is 15 mins.. If the line for roller coasters are long, suggest to put it off till almost closing time (630pm), the line was 10 mins each for Human and cyclone.

4.review_text: Beware of personal stroller theft

5.review_text: Amazing place. I came here with my nephews and they really enjoyed the time here. Staffs are so nice and friendly to kids. Highly recommended for parents living in Asia. Location: you can take MRT to Harbour Front station and then take Sentosa Gateway to Universal Studio gate (Google Map, as the time I wrote this review, is not really accurate for the route from downtown) Environment: all facilities are tailored to serve kids well so nothing to worry about Price: a ticket for an adult 76 SGD, a pack of popcorn 9 SGD, a cup of smoothie 6 SGD, not cheap but still ok during summer time. The ticket price is arbitrary depending on seasons. Service: Service and user experience are all impressive. The only problem is you need to line up for more than 1-2 hours for each attraction unless you buy Universal Express. Best practice for new comers( me have visited in California, Osaka and Singapore) 1. Sandals, shorts, and t-shirts are best dress code for enjoying universal studio. Singapore is hot in most of time so the dress code will help. (And sandals will keep your feet dry after playing Jurassic World boat) 2. Buy tickets online to save your time from hours line-up. For example, klook. 3. Go hot attractions first when getting in. They will take most of your time. Googling some suggestions from internet beforehand will help - my suggestion is Transformer - Jurassic World - Water World (fixed schedule) - and the rest. 4. During summer time, even weekdays are full of people. However, its still better than coming here in weekends. This place is awesome and sincerely hope everyone have a good time here!
Cool.... Always miss playing around here. Bring your wife and children, everyone is happy. Children playing, wife shopping.
It's not boring..it makes the kids feel at home..but because it's too wide the kids get tired quickly..bringing a stoller for each child is really important today..
If you go to a favorite place and popular items in the afternoon, you basically dont have to queue. children like
Must visit ride - mumy revenge and transformers. Tips - complete kid area first, visit on weekdays

3.review_text: Good for youngsters & ride crazy persons
It's small and ends quickly. Adults can enjoy it, but infants and toddlers can hardly ride on it, and there is no place for them to play.
Not very good. It's small and the same as it was 6 years ago. People are falling apart... The facilities don't seem to be doing much repair work. Still, I go there because of my child.

4.review_text: Nice option if you have an extra day at Singapore. The park is clean (like everywhere in the city) and it should provide enough fun for kids and adults. I was a bit disappointed with the Battlestar Galactica roller coaster. I enjoyed all the sesame street and Madagascar rides even though I'm 31.

Some rides dont let Children due to their height or age. And theres always the land of magic and fairy tales where you can get lost! You can also watch movies with effects. The queue might seem longer but it moves fast. Take a day or two to cover everything! They have amazing stalls for food as well. Must visit with your families. I recommend wearing comfortable clothing and shoes since you would be walking all day. Located at Resort World Sentosa, Universal Studios Singapore hosts 24 rides, plenty of entertaining shows, and seven different thematic zones. There are also character meet-up schedules when you can take photos with your lovable characters. The Hollywood Dreams Parade is a must-see when at the park. You'll also find a variety of dining options within the park from snacks, to local delicacies, as well as international cuisines. Birthday parties can be organized at the park, as well as wedding photography. The park offers fun for the entire family, whether young or elderly.

Exciting and thrilling rides. Good to bring kids as there are various rides ranging from the slow to the thrilling ones. However, food inside the theme park is too pricey. I would recommend walking to Resorts World Sentosa.

A great place to roam about easpecially for kids . A must go and have fun together. One needs to have a lot of energy to cover all of the attractions in day. Need to reach early else have the express pass to take advantage of all the attractions

Had a very nice day in the park with my two kids (5 and 8 years old). We visited on a Wednesday, at the queues were not as bad as they could be - bus still had to wait 20-45 min. for the bigger attractions. Park is nice and clean, but not really very big. We made it through all attractions in one day with no problems. Well worth a visit.

5.review_text: It's amazing when i still child. With family 14 people go to singapore. We not get to inside Universal but we took around sentosa island. It's great place 4 days in singapore and i'm really happy. Bad for me because i just get some photo in there. But for recreation family is very good. I never forget that.

This nice place for family holiday in Singapore, lots of attraction. You get tickets at various places in Singapore and even online you can get good deal. It's full day enjoyment even sometimes we feel that one day is not enough. Must visit while in Singapore. Food is also good. Cable car is one of best arraction.

went to uss with my family on express pass. everything was so fun and the queues were alright with express. my kids enjoyed the fireworks at the end a lot. it was really the perfect end to a fun day. with kids around, it's best to go for all the shows and parade as they will enjoy that a lot

It's a great place. Plan your trip to avoid weekends. However the park is open up to 10 o clock on weekends which is great; because the wait time gets as low as 10 mins after 6 pm. However I noticed a lot of eateries closing down at 6. We were able to do a second round of all the roller coasters after 6 , since we didn't have to wait for more than 10 mins in the lines. ..had a great times. Most roller coaster require kids to be of certain height... So bear in mind that your child must be around 8 years old at least to be able to enjoy all the rides. Halal food available too inside .

Good place to hangoutwith your family. Variety of triling ride. Do take note. Food and drinks are very much marked up. Do not bring bulky bag to go around this area. Do not wear skirt. Get USS express ticket to get most fun out of the park. Best get it especially during holiday or weekend.

3.review_text: It is smaller than Universal in Japan. It's not that crowded so it might not be stressful! Transformers is a must.
A bit small compared to Disneyland, suitable for children under elementary school
Was a cool place to visit but don't expect much unless you're under the age of 10.

4.review_text: Good outing for family and children
Good for children and family

Quite small, rides are alright. The Sesame Street spaghetti monster ride is the happiest ride in the world though! I went off peak, weekday and it was so empty that we hardly had to queue for any rides. There's lots of places to walk around - back alley, etc that is quite beautiful so do that too. The decor isn't there for no reason, lots of references to movies so that's fun! For food, eat outside USS or just bring some food in and have a picnic! Lots of nice places to sit and eat, especially in the NY area.

Expensive but a superb experience for the family. There is something for everyone. But it is mainly targeted for all over about 125 cms. The queue skipping tickets are really pricey but also necessary on busy days.

Well designed and maintained theme park. There is something for every age-group. Exciting rides, Street Shows and Theme build structures. Advisable to wear comfortable clothes as quite a good walking is needed to cover all theme Zones.

5.review_text: Good entrainment for children's when at singapore

I would prefer Universal Studio Singapore than in HK. Unlike Disney Park is very much attractive kids, USS is more for adult with the Holywood concept based. A place must go when you travel to Singapore

A nice place to spend specially for children. Better to visit on week days as tickets are slightly cheaper and less crowded so no much waiting time for rides. But recommended to visit alone also. Visiting alone has an advantage as separate queue for singles which is quick. Lot of variety of rides: water rides, animation rides n movies, roller coasters and much more.

Best place to visit in Singapore with family Amazing rides, awesome collection of souvenirs The place is very lively and kids will surely enjoy Lot of options to eat as well If you happen to visit then doing miss transformers and the mummy ride

Superb! Definitely we will come back again!!! As you can see on the photos we're so happy and excited like a child. My mom said, when i was a kid... she promised me that she will bring me to a big theme park in other countries, but it never happened! When i grow old, and got a good job! I told her, mom... we're going to Singapore and Hong Kong...

3.review_text: Really is just for kids. Food is sub Singapore standard and rides are disappointing and queues long (even though I was off peak). Even for me as a fifty year old the rides were tame.

More needed for children below 6 years. There are no signboards inside to guide to individual rides in each zone. All the shows were amazing and worth the price. However unfortunately due to bad weather half of the rides were temporarily discontinued and the outdoor shows were cancelles. One good thing was that abundant drinking water was available everywhere and lot of food options to choose from. All in all we had an average experience with a 4 year old.
The theme park, but attrative. The transformer and mummy activities are recommended.
Good.for children

4.review_text: Good place to be with childrens, senior citizens may feel tired. But surely a must see during your Singapore visit. Children's will enjoy it thoroughly.

Exiting place. Well kept. Good management. Most of the rides are not suitable for senior citizens and kids below 9. Wish the characters will stay longer for photo sessions or there should be system whereby 4/5 characters appear at all time because this is one main reason for kids to visit this place.
Shouldn't miss. For every age category from 2 yes onwards can enjoy rides, shows, 4D, personal meeting to characters, shopping, veg and non veg briyani, Snacks etc.

If you have been to the Studios in US, this would be a let down for the Adults as there are only 2-3 thrill seeker rides. Kids and Aged family members definitely make the most of it. Themes change every 2 months and that brings some shows into picture which is what I look for all the time with Annual passes( much preferred if you plan to visit multiple times). Character meet ups are the best part my kids enjoy.Avoidends as the crowds make you wait for min 40 mins for each ride. Not great Options for food but yeah that's the same with all theme parks.

You have to visit only once in a life time. The rides get over very quick. It would be fun if you come with your family than coming alone. Some rides are very funny and fit only for children. However the entire park is well maintained with proper sanitation facilities and security lockers for certain rides.

5.review_text: Exciting Scary monster Roller Coasters, Various activities and shows. Carry your own stroller for infants n kids as it's around 15 Dollars and majority shows u are not allowed to scary Strollers in.

There are a lot of play equipment. The kids have fun all day. Their favorite is probably the Tranformer. The recommended toy that you can't miss is Mummy. There are toys for everyone from small children to older adults. very high priced restaurant But the quantity is large. The rounds I went there were premium items. It's a lunch box from Universal that is given to children for free.

Must visit if you are in Singapore. Lot of rides and shows. Even kids with 2 to 4 yrs have lot of options. It will take whole day and still you will miss few rides and shows. Take express pass to avoid rush. Roller coaster is real thrilling.

Must visit if you are in Singapore. Good rides and plenty of food and beverage choices. This place is a good place for children as well as adults. There are multiple rides and differrent shows going around continously. The atmosphere is exhilarating. Once you reach there, get the map first so will know what are the places you can visit inside the US.

The most stunning place to visit in Singapore, without which your trip is never complete. Our family consisted of senior citizen and kids under 5 alongwith adults, but, thankfully, Universal had something in store for every age group. The most amazing and daring ride was Battlestar Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy. It requires whole day to complete the fun, but, its worth it.

2.review_text: Advisable. Good public accessibility and free. It is very good to spend a day with family and children. But if you like the experience strong for my taste you need stronger attractions, we expected something more.
Not as big as USJ, and I think it's very expensive compared to USJ. Perfect for children with parents or group

3.review_text: Gets boring after a few rides for an adult. Water World was extraordinary. Transformers 4D and Mummy 4D too good. Jurassic World immensely enjoyable. Choice of food limited.
For each person...
Japan is more fun. Mummy is the coolest, the line is fast and it's fun.

4.review_text: I give 4 start because I think the one in gold coast much more fun and bigger than in singapore. If you came early you better heading to popular ride as the waiting time is almost 1 hour. Me and my son wait 1 hour on the line (the dinosaur ride) but just to found out that it was broken. You can rent a stroller for 20 All day. Need more indoor food court as Singapore was really hot and humid. There is plenty tap water in the area.
Clean and suitable for family holidays
Destinations that must be visited after the Merlion... children will definitely like it... you must be prepared to walk up and down, there are escalators...

Well the rides are great but seems too few for adults. Make sure you get an express ticket to avoid painful wait times on the popular ones. The one I liked the most was Mummy/Egyptian one - it was too much fun, followed by Transformers. When you are here get ready to walk a lot and if it's cloudy and hot like it was when I went, it's gonna tire you a lot - make sure to carry tissues and napkins and if possible a additional t-shirt especially if you hate humidity and sweating. Best thing I would say is to research well in advance on the best rides and how to navigate your way - you'll be glad you did. Stay hydrated and take ample breaks, then your journey through here won't be as painful and tiring as mine felt.

A really fun theme park that has many varieties of rollar coasters. It's also really child friendly and food can be found along the roads in case you are hungry. The staff there are all really friendly too! However I feel that it can be quite costly, from the price of tickets to the food found there.

5.review_text: If you come with the whole family and have small children I recommend renting a baby stroller. There are both single and double strollers (double stroller rental price is 20 SD). Because you have to walk a lot, before the baby reaches its full anniversary, the child gets tired and starts to cry. It makes the fun of traveling less. Because there are many points of interest.

The last time I was there was November 5 2018. But I didn't enter the USS, because the kiddos were still small. It seems like you're satisfied with bringing your child but he's still afraid to go on the rides. I've been on it before...the ride is really cool.

Must visit like Hongkong Disneyland. Both kids and adults would enjoy this. Rides like transformers, revenge of the mummy and the world's first dual rollercoaster not to be missed. Children must be 112 cms minimum to be accompanied by adults, in thriller rides. They can enjoy it alone if They are taller than 122cms. Shops are themed according to the different zones. Public can participate in road shows like drumming, dancing and singing. Look out for the time schedule of the above programmes - ask for a map and a leaflet which contains details on the same. Indian restaurants serve both veg and non veg. Outside food is not allowed, and the bags are frisked on entering. Was surprised to see many Indian families eating loads and loads of packets of savouries brought from outside.
Great place to go with family and spend time on chilling family day. Beside USS, Singapore is convenience, full of delicious food and wonderful tourist attractions! I love visiting Singapore!
Go weekdays and you can go on your favourite ride multiple times. My kids went to transformers ride twice within the span of half hour.

1.review_text: It's nice place to visit if you have younger children. Having said that, your children may miss out on some rides because of their body height. This leaves them only a few rides to enjoy. On the other hand, if the children are tall enough for all rides, they may find more than half of the rides are not exciting for them. The staff did not look too excited with what they doing. They usually use their hands to indicate their intentions with little smile and verbalization.

3.review_text: Amusement park. Best for kids. Please be prepared to spend the whole day. Great entertainment. But like any other amusement park. The Santosa Island is a beauty. If you take the cable car, it will be an experience. The park has self service Singapore-Malaysian restaurant area with more than 50 speciality shops serving very good food at excellent affordable price.

Definitely take a small towel with you, as you'd be sweating after walking in, and throughout all rides. Rides aren't intense, so easier for the children. Things are very expensive, as you'd expect at a theme park of this calibre, so be prepared to spend
Having our family day
I love this place go there with children
Main tourist attraction for all age visitors to have fun & enjoyment.

4.review_text: Be sure to go with your kids.
Family and kids are delite universal studio Singapore

As a family with teenager kids, we enjoyed the theme park vastly. Most importantly you don't feel ripped off (like the D'land where your bags had to be searched to make sure you had to buy expensive food there). Will want to go again. Queuing in a humid environment was the price to pay, but not too bad.

It was really fun for our family. My 8 year old daughter was happy that she is tall enough for all rides. The only thing that was annoying was that at some of the bigger rides .. you are expected to rent a locker to store you stuff. It quite unusual since in north America we are able to bring all our belonging and store next to the ride.

Lots of fun adventure thrill rides and shows of many themes Universal Studios. Good for picture taking for family friends loved ones. When its really crowded it will take you a whole day there. There are souvenier shops and eateries. Only thing prices are on the high side. Try not to plan your trip with school holidays or it will be very crowded and take a long time to get on a ride.

5.review_text: I really like going here, the place is very INSTAGRAMable.. The kids are really happy, especially the parents.. haha it's really a kid's heaven.. I bought the entrance ticket at Traveloka, so when I got there I just showed the e-ticket to the gate officer, no need to print it, so it's more practical and no need to queue. Transportation in Singapore is very smooth, it's not difficult to go anywhere. If you want to go to Sentosa, just take the MRT to Sentosa station. A vacation here is recommended.. Oh yeah, if you're still bringing toddlers, don't forget to bring their stroller, otherwise the parents will get a headache.. hehe

A very pleasant place to visit in Singapore. Apart from theme parks, there are actually other options to visit, including aquariums and museums, which can be an option for parents who bring children aged 7 years and under.

An interesting place to visit with family or friends. Each vehicle must be entered because it has its own "story" and uniqueness. Recommendations are mummy, sesame street, madagascar etc. Don't worry, there is plenty of tap water to drink for those who want to refill.
Must visit place with children.
Family friendly

3.review_text: It's small. It's hard to walk around for more than 15 minutes due to the Singapore weather. Make sure to drink plenty of water. There are Transformers, The Mummy, and Jurassic Park. Kids love it. You have to pay to take pictures with Transformers Bumblebee. Be careful. When you have time, there are American men singing and Southeast Asian youth dancing. This is also fun. I recommend the water show.
Good one but it is smaller than expected.. Also less rides when compared to studios in other countries

4.review_text: Universal studios is must visit if in Singapore with kids. Visited it thrice, wish they had more Halal option restaurants. The rides were great, especially the transformers Ride.

Nice place to spend an entire day with family. Has tons of theme based adventure sports fit for all ages. Grey coloured roller coaster is the scariest of all (but could've been scarier). The Mummy ride and Avengers ride are the best. They are roller coaster based, but not the same all around. It has story in between. Park has loads of shopping and eating outlets.

Fun rides, suitable for all ages. Best ride there IMO is The Mummy, exciting indoor coaster with a great theme. Try to get to the park early to maximise your time there but do take note of the Singapore heat and remember to hydrate. Many water coolers around the park and in the queues.

The park is quite small and is very suitable for playing with children. It does not place a heavy physical load on parents and children. If you go to play during the week, there are not many people, and there is almost no need to queue after four o'clock. If you are a group of young people, Universal Studios Osaka would be a better choice.

A must visit for anyone visiting Singapore. Perfect for kids of all ages. Be prepared to queue for the rides and take a poncho or similar in case of a rain shower. Plenty of places to eat, drink and buy souvenirs.

5.review_text: Must visit with kids 4 years and above so that they can enjoy along with u.. Pram is a must as the place is huge n iys very difficult fr kids to walk that long.. Awsome and best place so far visited in Singapore.. Carry umbrella as it gets very hot and something to fan the kids whn in line as u can get really sweaty

USS was a fun. It's one of the great theme parks after Disneyland. A perfect place for kids to be. They will surely have a hell lot of fun. And Please don't miss transformers ride and the human roller coaster. If you are in Singapore spend a whole day USS and buy a priority pass so that u skip the hours queue on some rides.
Must visit place in Singapore! A lot of enjoyable attractions and shows you can explore with your kids. Top lists: Transformers, Mummy, Jurassic Park!
Good place for family and kids, suitable for kids from 1 years old. Wide range of attractions
Nice place to spend with your family. A must go if you are bringing your kids to Singapore.

4.review_text: Small and manageable for a good day trip out in Singapore, if you have kids and you're visiting then it's the perfect stopover for a day out. Surprisingly good food in the park as well.

Wonderful place to visit at singapore.. adults can enjoy, but it doesn't have much activities for toddlers. If u want to try all the rides u have to go early.. and express pass holders need not to wait for rides.. other May have to wait for 30 to 60 mins for rides..

Good for families and couples. If you are going in weekend or holiday, it is better to buy express ticket to skip queues or it would take hours for you to be able to play a few attractions. Otherwise great place to spend time with your family.

Summer vacation is a good time. The temperature is lower than in most cities, there are not many people, and some popular items only require queuing. We purchased the VIP tour. The service was very good and saved a lot of time. The children were happy and the adults were not tired.

5.review_text: A theme park with exciting activities. A good place for adventure lovers and offers much enthusiasm!! How ever, there are enough and more places for such people to sit and have a good meal and even walk around and spend time..

If you have come to Singapore for holidays than this place is must. You should spare one full day for universal studio. You will find lots of rides and rides for every age group. This is a perfect place for family holiday. You have to plan days of your visit as this place is very very crowdy especially on weekends. I will suggest from Tuesday to Thursday as there are less crowds on these days. They do not allow any outside foods so be careful. Please purchase ticket online or from travel agent as it will save time in waiting lines. Make sure you are there on gate open time. Make sure to pick map of universal studio as it will help you in finding rides. Lots of meal options are also available though prices are on higher side. But it is fun place. Enjoy

It's a place that anyone who comes to Singapore must stop by. No matter how many times you go, you won't get bored. The place is very wide. There are a lot of fun toys. If you go on a weekday it will be great. Because there are not as many people as on Saturday and Sunday. But if you really can't go on a weekday It's best to buy express tickets because the lines are very long, making it difficult to ride the attractions.

4.review_text: Enjoyed a lot...first experience in any theme park with kids aged 7 & 4. They enjoyed to the fullest and my family made memories for life. Lots to do and enjoy for all ages. Value for money. Queues can be longer and wait can get tiring, also dress according to weather, Singapore usually have humid weather.
Must visit destination in Singapore. Rides are good. Great place for kids.
Perfect place for your kids adventure. Great food choices and has a world class amenities. If you are at Singapore, this place is a must visit for the young and young at heart

Great place for visiting with family. Had a very good time. Takes minimum full day but can extend it to 2-3days. Take the express tickets if you are big on rides. And hire strollers if you have toddlers. Good eating options inside.

we went on a week day which made it less crowded.. the adventure rides ( Mummy, Transformers etc) were great and the children rides were really for all ages.. Let me double mention Transformers.. dont miss this ride... Staff are friendly and food are served on every corner.. Toilets are also situated very close to each rides.

5.review_text: For anyone staying in Singapore with children it is simply a must to go there, as an adult I was there without children and I enjoyed it very much so I'm sure children will really fall in love with the place.

fun here. lots of games. the children are very happy. Apart from that, there are also lots of Instagrammable photo spots around USS friends. Want to bring children?
Best place to visit with children. Do not forget to carry enough drinking water, it is humid/hot climate. Outside food not allowed. Drinking water is very costly, better to carry.

3.review_text: Most of the rides are meant for kids and they'd love it.. But very few options available for adults. If you come here alone, then for sure, you will get bored and cannot enjoy much. Another thing noticed was, the single entry queue was moving much slower as compared to the other queues meant for families or couples.. May be USS can work around on it.. Thanks..

Good place for kids. However during holiday season there is very long queue for each ride. The wait time could go up to 3 hours for single ride. If you wish to take all of them make sure that you get Express Tickets. Regular tickets are not worth buying otherwise. I only liked the transformers ride and the roller-coaster rides. Rest of them were just boat rides with show of moving statues of the charecters from various movies.

Rides are good ,but vegetarian food options is very limited.i wish a few more options would help

4.review_text: Family friendly. Fun attractions. However, the rides need an update especially with newer and hit franchises. Minions should have a ride of their own (not just gift shops)! A reason of its own to visit Singapore.
Rides are good for young generation. They can also use express card it is worth buying. You need Full day to enjoy

Good hang around place with family. Multiple breathe taking rides will make children happy. There are few thrilling rides for adults. Multiple food courts are present inside the campus, one can choose varieties to eat. Overall great place to have fun and a memorable moment.

This area is smaller than Hollywood. Good games for families with babies like Elmo, Madagascar (little baby). If your child is 9 years old or older and can play a little adventurous games, play Dinosaur, Bussy boot, watch 4D shrek movie. Adults can play Egypt. You will spend a whole day here, so if you want to play outside in Sentosa, you should divide it into another day.
Can enjoy the rides with the families. Been there 4 times.

5.review_text: Best theme park in Singapore. Family friendly and also suitable for adults who are looking for exciment! Check out the height requirment for your children near the entrance with chart board. Restaurants/food centre and Starbucks are found within USS.

A must go place of you are in Singapore, superb experience. The rides are all great and few are not for faint hearted especially the Battlestar Galactica having a dual roller coaster. It's fun for kids and adults both. I would also recommend to take photo packages wherein you can get yourself clicked at every location and can collect them online, so you don't need to carry a camera. Be free and relaxed and enjoy full day of being a kid again.

I travelled here alone with my 2yr old and 5yr old and brought the 10yr old nephew with me. Getting there is simple and as long as you have credit on your MRT card your fine We started the day off late almost a teenager was hard to get up and to go to bed early the night before. The rides had some queues but not enough to put me off. Food was great. Drinks were refillable and jn special Universal studio cups Loved the 50th anniversary links to sesame Street

A great place to hang out with the kids. A well maintained place with sufficient variety of food choices within the campus. Do not miss the transformers 3D ride. Totally worth the wait in line. The kids have a wide variety of rides. A must visit for anyone visiting Singapore with family

Universal studios is the main attraction of Singapore and it not only entertains the kids but the adults also enjoy the rides and the theme park equally. Entire Singapore is well connected by MRT and other mode of public vehicles. So if you want to visit Universal Studios in a pocket-friendly way, then opt for MRT and bus. Cabs are bit expensive in Singapore. You can buy the entry tickets online or can buy it from from local tour operator shops to avoid the huge que at Universal Studios. Even most of the times online tickets are cheaper than onsite tickets due to various promotions. Ticket cost for adult is S 79 and the child between 4-12 years will have to buy S59 ticket for 1 day trip. Try to reach there at the earliest to enjoy all the shows and rides. Monday to thursday it remains open from 10am to 7pm. The timings for Friday and Saturday are 10am to 10pm when Sunday it closes little early at 8pm. You should follow the map to explore all the places. Due to time constraint, I couldn't go to Sentosa. However if you have time then I would advice you to explore all the places at the same time. For going to Sentosa you can opt for cable car or Monorail (Sentosa Exppress). There are various shopping outlets and restaurants inside the campus. I bought a big transformer water bottle and they gave me the coupon to fill my 2 ltr. bottle with cold drinks from any of the restaurant. I did my breakfast near Transformer and had my lunch opposite to Jurassic Park and I found the food of the second one is tastier than the first one. Although everybody describes the roller coaster as the most dangerous ride of Universal Studios, however I found the ride at Revenge of the Mummy more scary. You should try to wrap up everything as early as possible otherwise you will not be able to cover each and everything. Time flies here very quickly. It has wheel-chair accessibility in most of the places and the staffs are very helpful and ready to assist you wherever it requires.

3.review_text: Nice for families with small kids. I think its better to go there after 16:00, then alout of people left, and the line its quickly.

It's a place where you need to spend a good part of the day to cover all the attractions. There is something for all ages. Starting early, as soon as the gates open is a good way to begin.The crowd at night is less though. A map of the park, is a necessity, to plan out your trip. The three best rides are the cylon, mummy and transformer rides, which attract the longest queues. Some of the rides need you to be empty handed and with empty pockets. Locker facilities are available at various point, in case you don't have someone waiting outside. During my last visit, frequent failures of rides occurred, some where people had to wait in the rides to be retrieved..... Probably a one off. Nothing new added over the years. Good for one visit, nothing to come back to except the cylon rides. Good idea to take an express pass to reduce the wait time in queues. The express passes are available at most shops within Universal studios, but a few attractions are excluded from the express pass. Photographs are available at each ride and cost about 20SGD a piece. The restaurants are crowded at meal times, so it's a good idea to eat a little early if you want to avoid a long wait to order and get seating. The small food and beverage stalls don't accept cards but only cash. It can get dehydrating during the day, especially in summer, so these are usually the stalls where you can top up. The parades are entertaining for young children and those young at heart, so you can time your rides and visit based on the parade timings.
Fun place for kids. Can become boring after a while. Need to add new rides to prevent monotony.

It might be awesome if you could actually do some of the stuff that is there. Choose when you go we came in the morning and the entire day was useless (and super hot) until the evening. At around 7 people go home and it is actually really cool. (We went on a Friday, maybe there are less busy days)

4.review_text: Every time I go to Singapore, my kids definitely come to Universal Studio. The rides are complete. If you want to go there, it's best not to go there on weekends or during holidays. Because the queue is very long and long.

many small rides great for kids but no so much for adults. lockers are provided for free for certain rides. food is expensive so have lunch before coming and bring a water bottle with you. get express tickets during school holiday season/weekends.

This is kind of show stopper of Singapore. You can find entire theme park enjoyable especially for children. Not much big like Disney land, but big enough to spend your entire day with your friends and family

Great place to have the family time.. well maintained.. Lot of rides.. simple Medagasker to Sci-fi roller coaster..Lots of enjoyment.. Amazing Transformers Ride.. All kinds of food is available.. Amenities are good.. Must visit place in Singapore

Comparatively best entertaining house in Asia. Best for kids under 20 but few rides can be an excitement for adults as well. Such as the Transformers ride, cyclon roller-coaster ride and the mummy ride. I personally enjoyed the Wall climbing activity.

5.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore is one of the best places for family trip on Holidays or weekend. Off-peak season is during Monday to Thursday while on-peak season is during Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, Public Holidays and June and December. USS is definitely fun for the whole family and thrill-seekers. This theme park is built for all ages. The little kids will be fascinated and delighted to see alot of famous movie characters. They have alot of shows for kids and rides for them. Adults can try doing the roller coaster Battlestar Gallactica, indoor coaster Revenge of the Mummy, Jurassic Park Ride on the boat and Transformer 3D Ride. Restrooms, coffeeshops, food shops and resort's staffs are everywhere. This is a must visit resort in Singapore. Come hurry and enjoy the show and ride. To top all of these, the resort is actually clean! That is what Singapore is known for right? Cleanliness. Entrance fee - 75SGD if you buy here at USS. But dont forget to check Klook for lower prices and discounts. When entering Sentosa, dont buy tickets first because you can use your EZ link card. Thats my mistake. So dont be like me. Haha. per Meal budgets should be 10Sgd above. Dont forget to bring coins. They also offer single ride options if you dont mind riding solo or separated from your group. This is actually works fine for me because the queue here is alot shorter than the regular or group one. If you dont want queueing for an hour or two, you can check express tickets online, maybe 60Sgd. Im not sure about this but you can check online.
Fun... Exciting ride with amazing technology. Many rides are safe for children and children can enjoy them. Visiting on a weekday the queue is not too long
Must visit in Singapore with kids
Suitable for family leasure

The attractions catered to all age groups and each and everyone had an exciting theme to it. Universal Studios Singapore never fails to excite as it comes up with new attractions every time I go there. I highly recommend spending time with your family and friends there as it is worth every penny you spend. I would however reccomend bringing alot of money there as proces there are high.

3.review_text: Good rides ,definetlty not on the scale of the u.s ,good starter for first timers or young kids.the heat and humidity is full on and most rides are 1hr waits so a express past is a must .check operating times and weather prior.

4.review_text: It is an amusement park that is smaller than Universal Studios in Japan and is not suitable for adults. I would like to discourage you from purchasing an express ticket here. Basically, I don't know much about Transformers and its name, but if you ride a roller coaster and then ride a Mummy, I think most adults will enjoy it. If you are traveling with children, there are quite a few rides that children will enjoy, so I think it is not a bad idea to purchase an express ticket only if you are traveling with children. If you have belongings or bags, you can leave them in the lockers for the roller coaster and Mummy and use the attractions. It is free for about 2 hours at a time and you have to pay after that, so if you are visiting with a group of people, you can keep using the lockers for free if you take turns using them, so make good use of them. Uniquely, in the case of Singapore Universal, you can only leave and re-enter once, so if you need to eat, we recommend going out to Vivo City, eating there, and then coming back. The food at Universal was truly terrible. It's not that wide, so even if you move around a lot, you can enjoy it in half a day. One thing that was disappointing was that there were a few times when we had to wait to ride the attractions, but many people from India would cut in line with people of all ages, so it was very frowned upon.
Suitable for traveling with young children. Rides are so so. It's not very spacious so I looked around 3 times. the weather is too humid
Nice place to spend the time with kids but I recommend that u take express pass as the minimum wait per ride can take more than 60 min.

Don't bring your child if under 6 years old, waste of money. most of the rides contain heights, dark rooms, jump scare, 4 & 5 D cinema. if you want those kind of excitements, it's very very very entertaining.
With children for fun &rides.

5.review_text: Good travel with small and big kids. There are zone for teenagers and younger kids.Most importantly, they have few cozy places for adults to spend their free times with friends.eg casio and cinema and more cafe too

Good place and must visit in Singapore. Spend whole day here as much as possible. It is great for kids.

2.review_text: Of course it's an exciting place but they ought to place the disclaimer that it includes being soaked in sweat from the heat, sore limbs from standing for a minimum of 1 hour for each ride, and ending up with cranky kids or physically exhausted elderly people! Little kids (two 4 year olds) have very few rides and no preferences are given for them. Hence they could enjoy only one ride. We went twice.. once with parents and the second time with the kids. The second time we took extra precautions to avoid the holiday season in Singapore and really hoped to enjoy but had to endure the same thing as last time.
More adults than children on toddler rides so the young ones have to wait too long. Not enough staff to keep things moving; it is pedestrian.

If you want to explore different kind of swings this is good but not recommended for senior citizens and very small kids also for people who don't enjoy swings.

It's not crowded, but adults may not be able to enjoy the rides. It's my personal opinion

4.review_text: Well maintained theme park in Sentosa island in Singapore. Rides are generally fun and well kept. Staff are ok. Major issue is the extremely hot weather in Singapore. Rides are more suitable for older kids (7 years old above) who are more than 122cm. Not much rides for younger kids especially those who are afraid of loud sounds and heights.

Kids loved this place. Lots of fun and rides. We enjoyed the shows a lot. Its best to avoid weekends as it gets busy and when you go to the shows and rides go early and queue early. Avoid when schools are out and public holidays as it gets over crowded. Few food options and quiet pricey.

One of the best place for a weekend checkout and what else is required to njoy other than this with the family and friends. Weekend will be too crowdy and will take lit of time for the rides. But weekdays are good enough if you ar travelling.
Small children are not suitable

Not for the theme park enthusiast . However a reasonably good day for children or older kids. Food is expensive around 15 for a meal and they don't allow food from outside. There is a prayer room and plenty of wash rooms

5.review_text: I went during a Private Event. MND Family Day 2019 14 September. Crowded with people after 10am when it opens to the public. The staff are always friendly and nice. Food and drinks are overpriced like crazy. Recommended to sneak Drinks and bread in. I tried out the Mummy ride for the first time...and I regret taking it after I almost passed out. If you are not a thrill seeker. This ride is not for you. stay in your comfort zone people!
Lovely place for fun rides with the family! Do note that not all rides are suitable for kids below 4.
Rides are great for kids. Absolutely loved it. Crazy long queues. Express pass is a bit pricey but well worth it to beat the queues.
The best place to go with the kids! Best visit Monday-Thursday and not much wait for the ride.

I took the kids with me on a weekday (Wednesday) without stopping for the express. Maybe because it was a weekday, it definitely wasn't very crowded. I was originally planning to go on a Sunday, but I really wouldn't have been able to ride anything if I had gone on a Sunday. I went in around 12 o'clock on a weekday and stayed until closing and rode most of the rides. If you have time, I recommend going on a weekday.

3.review_text: We went there with toddlers and it's not recommended. They only have like 5 activities that you can do with kids. Also, you have to wait for 40 mins or more for a 3-minute activity. The length of waiting is fine. It's the activity's duration that is not. It's better that all activities will at least be 10 minutes.
There are some rides that I don't think suit young children, I think they should add more age appropriate rides for younger children
Don't go with kids under 10 otherwise would be great
Good but too time consuming if you are willing to go in all ride.. queues are super long and waits can take as long as 2-3hrs. Can get very tiring especially if you with under 5yr old kids.

4.review_text: Travel with family to Singapore

Worth a visit when in Singapore. Ofcourse a day will be required to finish off all attractions. There is something for all kids or adult. Transformers rides, Egypt pyramids are thrilling. Don't miss it. Kids will have plenty of attractions.
Amusement parks for children in Singapore

I've been here several times while I've lived in Singapore and I have to say, it's just as enjoyable each time around! It's not a massive theme park so it's possible to visit almost all the sections and rides in one day. So I'd recommend those here on a short trip to block out one day to visit Universal rather than spanning it out a few days!! The various sections within the park cater mostly to the youger ones but honestly, it's just as fun no matter what age you are. And for the thrill-seekers, there are a few rapid, heartstopping rollercoasters - most of which I'm too afraid to try! There are many tame rides and entertaining shows with certain timings around if you're not one to seek out the thrilling sort of rides so definitely look out for those! Overall, I'd say this theme park, although not as big as I'd like it to be, is truly a fun, enjoyable experience - especially with a group of friends or family!

Very good day out with young family. The theme park is smallish, meaning you could do it in 8 hours. Despite the hot and humid weather, there were a fair bit of covered area which was a relief in the queue. Not a fan of the purchased express pass, hence the 4 stars. Will definitely come back when we visit Singapore again.

5.review_text: Take the family to travel.

Can't miss this place if you visit Singapore. A day is less for this amazing place. Don't visit if you have kids below 10 years as you will not be able to enjoy. Don't visit during summers as it gets quite hot.

A happy place for me and my family. A family friendly recreational park, you can easily move around carrying stroller. It might be a little bit too hot for some of you but no need to worry because tap water are everywhere so it will be easy for you to stay hydrated. Don't forget to use sunscreen, and comfortable shoes& clothes
It is worth traveling with the whole family, one word "like"
This is a place that gave the Yuri family happy memories. If you are traveling to Singapore with children, I recommend Universal Studios!!

3.review_text: The alternate attraction for family in the Asia. Lack of halal food compare to previous year.
I like Everland much better. Also the amusement facilities. he But Mummy is a different flavor. It is a fun ride. Highly recommended.
Had a good time however its more for kids. Also nothing compared to Orlando universal studios.
It was ok we have been to Florida so it's no comparison. The only really good ride was cylon. We all thoroughly enjoyed that.

4.review_text: A theme park that really pampers children, with complete facilities and amenities that really make children and teenagers feel at home. Modern level games, especially Transformers rides, make the trip exciting. For culinary, for Muslims there is also halal food available, so you don't need to worry, there is also a prayer place available. They don't feel like they've been here all day, I hope Indonesia has tourism as modern as this.

Be mindful of public holidays when visiting as the ride wait times get cruelly long. I wouldn't recommend buying express passes as they aren't value for money. Take a weekday off with your kids and you'll truly discover the charm of this place
Surely a place for the whole family... Great rides for young and adults. A personally enjoy the Mummy ride..
Good Place for Adult , Elder and Children

The rides there are so fun even though the waiting time for the rides might be very long depending on when you go there. For the food, i recommend the fish soup sold in the Jurassic Park food court if you want something light and for the kids, i recommend the kids meal as it has cute dinosaur potato chips. If you are not that hungry, there are some snacks sold at the shops like corn dogs, slushies or churros.

5.review_text: Great place. If you are visiting Singapore with or without family you should keep one whole day for this place. Every one in your group will get things of their interest from kids to old. Rides, movi making, games, best locations to take picture, food, dance, shows and fun.Awsome.
Very good for family travel recommendations

Fun and enjoyable. Try avoiding visiting on weekends, public holidays and specifically school holidays because crowded and need to queue up for every ride. Overall great place and kids will love it. If you need to see all the stuffs inside, whole day is not enough. Plan well - kids are not eligible for some rides that based on the age and height. Check for yearly pass if you are residents. Good new that Getting is heavily investing to have more upgraded rides.
The best place to take your kids and yourself in Singapore.

Great theme park for kids and adults alike. Singapore Slings very reasonably priced near the entrance. Fantastic at Christmas and even better if you can get an express pass so you don't have to queue!

1.review_text: If you are with children, then yes it will be fun, but not cheap. My wife and I got here for 18,000 rubles with express lines, we went through all the attractions, more or less Egypt, and the awesome Cylon. Water World did not work, many do not have an express line, only a general queue. We didn't like it. This park is not worth the money. But if you go with regular tickets, you wont have enough time to do everything, and youll have nerves.

3.review_text: Having visited other Universal studios globally the Singaporean studios is pretty small and not as exciting. Theres probably 3 rides worth a mention and thats the two roller coasters and the Transfomers ride. I guess smaller children would also like some of the themed children rides like Shrek and Jurassic Park. I suggest booking your tickets online as the ticket purchasing at site is pretty slow. We went both times early morning and in the evening. All the rides were working from 7pm onwards and surprisingly not as crowded compared to the morning openings. If youre finding Singapore a little boring as we did then give this place some consideration.
Good place for children but not for senior citizen
Isn't as fun as other Universal Studios. The things to do are very limited and are quite boring in fact. But if you / your child loves minions, Sesame Street, and Shrek, it just might be worth it.
Quite a few rides are outdated. A few good Rollercoasters and great if you haven't been to any other theme parks or with young kids but otherwise hmmm...

4.review_text: Epic epic wonderful. Doesnt matter if you are a kid or an adult. This park has literally something for everyone. Go there on a weekday and reach at the earliest because it closes early and you might miss some of the rides. This is the place to be at Singapore if thrill is your game. Start early, plan your visits, and if your wallet permits, take an Express Pass.

We have been going here for many years now, the kids still love it. Top tips, get an annual pass if you live in SG, otherwise make sure to spend theblittle extra and get a express otherwise you are gonna seriously reduce your time to see everything.

A guide on how to enjoy USS with kids below 4 years old . First, kids below 4 get free entry. There are a few rides and places you must visit. 1) Start with Madagascar. Everything here is suited for kids above 80cm. 2)Take the Crate adventure ride, it is a relaxing and fun ride to warm the kids up to the place. Next, hop on to King Julien's Beach Party go round with is a simple carousel ride that parents can accompany. Most stuff at Madagascar are weather proof so even if it rains, u can go for these. 3) Next, go forth to to visit Far Far away cos that is where shrek lives haha. Up the challenge by taking the kids on the Enchanted Airways. Kids need to be 92 cm to take this gentle (not really for some, our girl hated this ride) roller coaster ride. It is exciting and SHORT. Less than 2 mins and it is over. Some boys may love this. So worth a try. 4) Go watch shrek 4D adventure. long queue but moves fast and for the time you queue, u get to spend at least 15mins seated down in a cool and comfy environment. Whn you exit, u will end up at the Fair God Mother potion factory, there is a tiny ferris ride here which u can q for. Tons of stuff to buy and u can have food at friars cafe opposite. Do remember to check out timings for meet and greet. 5)Next visit The lost world. Not all rides are suited for your toddlers and preschoolers. Just queue for the Dino soaring another very gentle ride which all will love. 6)hop over to canopy flyer to up the excitement again. Minimum ht here is 92cm. 7)Shop at Jurassic store if your boy or man love dinosaurs. Ask for promotion. In Dec 2019, get 10 percent off when u pay with MasterCard. 8)End the day with a visit to Elmo at New York which is near to the entrance/exit. Plenty of areas for toilet breaks and you can rent prams if u need. Have fun!
Good place to bring your kids.. But this theme park should have a brochure with timing for all the shows, so that we can plan ahead... So much time spend on queueing for the rides..
Best place to spend time with family,friends and childrens. There are attractions, shows and rides in diffrent theme zone.

5.review_text: Lifetime experience. Good for family vacation specially for children's.

For kids this is probably the high point of a Singapore visit. The Transformers is a must do and worth the wait. For thrill seekers there is the human v/s cylon ride. They can watch their favorite characters come to life and enjoy some thrilling rides. The downside is the long wait for each ride. Make sure you start early fortified by a heavy breakfast. Also make sure you mobile phone is fully charged and use the Universal Studio app to find out which ride has the shortest wait time. Limited food options for adults who are not into junk food. If you are three or more persons best to take a taxi.
Children's favorite place when on holiday in Singapore. Hopefully the rides will continue to increase and replace the ones that are obsolete.

It's better to plan properly before visiting. Utilize the whole day only for Universal studios so that you can go for every ride. If you can't wait in long queues better get express entry. Kids below 102 cms are not allowed for most of rides.
Perfect place for children. Good rides. Must go place for children. Express pass is worth it. Book before travel to avoid long queues.

3.review_text: Quite fun! Its just that for children, there are too many entertainment facilities that are excluded, which is very disappointing There is obviously a charge (the age should be raised to 6 years old before charging, because the facilities inside are restricted to children with a height of 4 to 5 years old) Its hard to meet the standard) _
Very much weighed to kids under 15 years old. Wait times too great.

4.review_text: Its an amazing place, dont miss the mummy & transformers ride. Children below 4 years will not be charged They have strollers available for rent. Every ride will have an approx 30 to 45 minutes waiting period so opt for express enty pass if needed at an additional cost of 120 S per head. Over all its an experience & worth it.

Not only for children but all ages. Need at least two days if you want to enjoy all the rides. Nice restaurants and clean rest rooms are present in every section. Though the rides are kind a repetation but dont miss the Ezyptian one...

It's fun to go to Universal Studios because there are lots of extreme and thrilling rides. Don't forget to bring a mini bottle because there are lots of free drinking water fills. Don't miss the Transformer rides, even though the queue is long, it's worth it. The Mummy ride is very stressful for parents and children as it is not suitable because the roller coaster is indoor, dark and very fast.
Lots of rides for kids and adults alike. Food could be better

It is a small theme park, so children will not be too tired from shopping. The prices of meals are about the market price, which is much more reasonable than the prices of meals in Hong Kong theme parks.

5.review_text: Best for activities with the family
Indoor and outdoor theme park...many rides for adult or kids...nice place to visit when in singapore..Holiday Springbed Comfort sleep for smart People..
Universal Studios in Singapore is also very suitable for children in lower grades. My two children are 6 and a half years old and have a lot of fun playing many games!
For a holiday for children and parents, it's okay...

Beautiful place. Definitely one of the places in Singapore to put on your bucket list. Perfect for kids and kids at heart. My top three rides are Galactica, Revenge of the mummy and Transformers. However, they may have a very long queue. So, be patient or you may purchase an express pass if you like.

1.review_text: I didn't pick the right date, so I bought Unlimit Express at a very expensive price, but my child didn't like it, so we left early... It's a waste of money. My child, but I also didn't find it very exciting or fun. I think Legoland or Disney are better.

3.review_text: The nice thing about Al Hadaqa is that there is a prayer room, five halal restaurants, and some fun games. The bad thing is that there is very annoying noise and the most boring games are only suitable for children!
Very suitable for children, not too exciting facilities
Nothing great for adults. Probably best for kids
Small park with family oriented fun. Food are expensive better to go out to eat and come back in again.
There are a lot of people and children will like it.

4.review_text: Beautiful theme park in Sentosa, Singapore with lots of family-friendly attractions. Universal Studios Singapore is a nice day trip in Singapore, with lots of rides and activities to do for everyone. In my opinion, USS is aimed more for visitors with younger children since most rides were mild and available for kids. Older kids or adults may not have as much fun with the limited rides aimed for them (Battlestar Galactica: Human v Cylon, Egyptian Mummy, Transformers 4D Ride etc.) However, the overall experience will be fun for everyone. Food stalls and Food Courts had limited food options, which may not be appropriate for some people. Also, food is reasonably priced, so you should eat in restaurants outside the theme park but in Sentosa. As always, decorations and designs of the streets were beautiful and well made. Stores for merchandise are nice, though the same goods have been selling for a while. Overall, you should definitely take kids to this scenic theme park. It is packed with a variety of attractions and will be a satisfying day trip to sentosa.

Many exciting play areas. Exciting for those who are young at heart and like high adrenaline. Not suitable for parents Walking around the game arena all day is really tiring. It is recommended to use the e-bike provided. In East Java there are playgrounds that are no less good. East Java Park 1, 2 and 3.
Good theme park, not very busy with some generally fun rides for adults and older kids. Could do with more undercover areas and hawker food type not bland generic and overpriced affair.
Entertainment and holidays with family
Great for kids mostly. Also pretty safe.

5.review_text: Awesome place specially for kids. Good to take an express pass when you want to complete all the rides and shows in one day. Otherwise go for a multiple entry ticket. Children will love this place. Food options are less specially if you are a vegetarian.

Universal studios Singapore is an ultimate package of fun, thrill, enjoyment and some quality time with both family and your loved ones...A well packed day one can experience there from the morning till the end of the day... Surely visit this to experience all...
Nice place to visit. Specially for kids...no. of exciting rides. Whole day is not enough to experience everything especially on crowded weekends
I recommend visiting with children under 14 years old, we have already been twice

An excellent place for relaxation and entertainment with children aged 7 and older. Lots of themed rides and breathtaking rides. If you go on the weekend and before lunch, invest in an Express pass, otherwise you will stand in tiresome queues. In the late afternoon around 5 p.m., the majority of people are already leaving the park, and there are practically no queues; you can manage to see all the attractions in a couple of hours.

2.review_text: A step backwards in terms of ecology. I was pleased to read a small sign in Universal's restaurant that states that the restaurant does not provide straws in order to better preserve marine life; it's very good. However, I don't understand why the restaurant, rather than serving drinks in cardboard glasses (like in most fast food restaurants), serves them in large plastic glasses with integrated straws (shaker style). At a time when we are talking about ecology, it is shocking. If the idea is to provide a "reusable" cup, it should be reconsidered given the number of cups thrown away after the first and only use.

3.review_text: For families and teenagers, it's a must do, but can be very crowded with long waiting between rides.For tourists try Monday to Friday as weekends the locals add to the numbers and this limits the ability to access the number of adventures you can physically get into. For the oldies like us 60 plus it's a commercial enterprise aiming at extracting every possible dollar on movie based souvenirs that children and grandchildren crave.

4.review_text: Good place to brings kids and loved ones..

Good place to go with children. My child enjoyed there a lot. Although it's tiring. Make sure to take your stroller with you or you can also take it on rent there. Watched donkey show which was not liked by my 3 year old son. Shows done by cartoon characters are much more fun. Street shows were eye candy.
It's good to bring the family here to have fun

Compared to other Universal Studios attractions, this one is very small. Nevertheless, the attractions are good, and you can easily fill the time from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. I would recommend getting there early. I had the feeling it only really got busy around lunchtime. The studio was easily accessible via Grab. In addition to the ticket for the studios, there was also one for a museum next door. You can do that, but you don't have to.

5.review_text: We were lucky; we arrived early for the opening and enjoyed the most extreme rides. If I had to stand on these rides for 30 minutes or more, I would be very disappointed, they seem to be rather weak, they are very far from the American ones. With kids 2-3 years old it will not be boring, there are quite a lot of attractions available, but it is better to check the height restrictions in advance, even before purchasing tickets. Getting to the city from the island is very easy.
If you go to Singapore with children, you must come to Universal Studios. Guaranteed to leave a deep impression and memory on children.
A place you can't miss while in Singapore An absolute delight for kids with amazing rides. Though you won't find a variety of vegetarian food options at the eateries here.

I went during Tet, and the longest line was 50 minutes. (Single rider) It's generally less crowded than USJ in Japan, so if you're considering staying all day, why not buy an early pass? I think so. Many of the meals include curry, but it's spicy so be careful with children. If your child is less than 80cm tall, you won't be able to ride many of the rides, but there are some attractions that have no height restrictions, so it's okay. I highly recommend the Elmo show.
A place for children and adults. I recommend Sentosa

4.review_text: Great place for kids, family & friends. Rides for all age people from kids to senior citizens. Most of rides are outdoor. Climate is sunny and sometimes raining also. Avoid visits during weekend or public holiday. You can get fast pass to avoid queue. My favourite rides are 1. Transformer (Ride) 2. Water world ( Show) 3. Jurrasic park ( Wear pauncho chances of getting wet) 4. Shrek 5. Mummy ( On your risk as ride come backward also) Many more uploaded map also for better guidance. Whole day you can enjoy. Food is not that great taste compared to Universal studios US.

5.review_text: It is suitable for families and children to travel together. Buying pp coupons can travel smoothly. It is worth exchanging money for time.
A great place to spend a day with children - the attractions are mainly designed for children.
I had a memorable time with my family here. Many thing to enjoy, must-visit place
A truly magnificent place for children to play on Sentosa Island

4.review_text: A good theme park, especially if you like movies like Transformers or Jurassic Park. Though in my opinion, there should be more attractions.

5.review_text: Best experience ever! With or without kids, this is true singapore experience

Best in Singapore to enjoy a day outing with friends, family and kids. It's designed for all :) During weekends rush will be unbelievable and queues for every damn ride will be super long. So, if you are single rider you can take advantage of going in a separate queue. I was a single rider so I could make use of this facility so well and ended up doing many rides repeatedly. :) Ticket isn't very expensive or it is maybe. Price is about 75 for a day which includes rides :)
It is a very nice place to visit with friends and family. There are many rides for younger people. All the rides are very enjoyable. I loved it.
Enjoy the weekend.Suitable for family, kids, and friends
tmp good recreation for families

4.review_text: Must go. My 6 year old daughter enjoyed every bit of it. On average, wait time for ride was 40 mins. Rent a stroller as soon as you enter the park and Get the express ticket if you can afford it.

5.review_text: My kids enjoyed the full day in this themed park. A lots of rides, restaurants and shops to choose from.
OMG, one of the kids' favourite place

4.review_text: Really good place for specially kids. Lots of fun activities. For me the best rides were Transformers, 2 Roller coasters & Egypt one. With the Express pass it was pretty easy to cover all the activities. Otherwise the queue was quite long & you have to wait long time. The only negative thing is there were no good food for vegetarians. The price of foods in Discovery food court expensive but not value for the money at all.
Fun times. Even if social distancing is enforced, the rides are smooth and the wait times are bearable.

5.review_text: Nice park......As far as kids are concerned kids under 122cms cannot sit on 3 rides... others all are family rides...Super queues for Cyclone and mummy ride but they are worth it...could manage to sit in all rides only once...wish could repeat a few
If it makes my kids happy then any money is good money spent. So is it worth the annual pass with express. Yes. Will it make sense? Yes if your kids are between 4to12 years old.

Would recommend the Battlestar Galactica, Cyclone and Human. The Mummy ride, Transformers ride, Jurassic Park water adventure and canopy. A good place to spend a fun and memorable day. Tourist attraction tho so prices are Abit on the high side.
Good offers considering not all attractions and F&B outlets are open. Very clean, very safe. Rides are cleaned down after every ride. The rapids were great!
Only theme park in Singapore, USS makes clever use of its space to deliver entertainment and fun to Singaporean families and tourists. Definitely worth a visit.

4.review_text: Overall, more family friendly than thrill seeking. Some rides are a little worn out, requiring maintenance. Most of the shows / food joints are closed, likely due to Covid. Still a great experience!

Another great place to bring kids to have some fun since we can't travel. They took care of the hygiene quite well. Before every rides the staff will sanitize the seat and handles. And has to make booking before you go so the crowd is a lot better compare to before. Each rides didn't take long to queue as well, but I will suggest to put on hat and bring a small fan.

5.review_text: Best outing with family with kids

Fun place to play. Visit with the office group. Unfortunately, the only time I spent with my family was taking photos in front of the gate. Hopefully you will be given the opportunity to come here again with the children
Tried most of the rides with lil kiddos. Enjoyed the new Shrek ride!

A DAY FULL OF ADVENTURE. Universal studio has so much to offer all through the day. I would suggest guyz reach early to the place around 10am. Check in for the Transformers ride amazing and then immediately next switch too BattleStar Galactica, as these attract maximum people across all age group. After these have lunch at your favourite theme park restaurant . After these go for smaller rides in Jurassic world/ Madagascar and catch the Hollywood action packed sequence . At the end there's a parade from group of amazing dancer circling the whole studious and taking crowd along with it for fun times. Wait till the sunset and Universal studious gets alive in its own magical colours. Visit it to feel it.

An Awesome Experience For All Ages! Each zone has a age suitable ride for everyone! I recommend riding The Transformers The 4D Ride and Jurrasic Park Rapids Adventure. Enjoy! Recommended For 5 and above.

4.review_text: Great place for children. Free snacks for visitors due to Halloween celebration
Foods n shoppings are also our iternaries ....

5.review_text: The universal studios park is a MUST on your Singapore stay :-) We have been plenty of times with the kids. The rides are full of excitement- the battlestar rollercoasters are the fast favorites, mummy is the story and environment favorite- Transfomers have been a "one-time-only", because the story is told quite fast. Because of the weather conditions you should definitely plan to get wet and soaked on the water attractions! We usually shifted frequently to these to get " cooled down". The stunt shows are worth to visit as well- if you liked the storyboard of waterworld :-) The experience with the team have been all positive - you really feel welcomed everywhere in the park! The foodoffer is nothing for foodies, better to take advantage of the variousness of the city instead.
It was my first time traveling with my family way back in 2018 and its with Singapore. Very nice placr to have a short vacation.

I'm from the USA and have visited many entertainment parks like Carowinds, Six Flags, Disney, Universal Studios and Bush Gardens. Universal Studios Singapore was just as good as the USA parks. Thw rides are fantastic.We're very interested in a family season pass now. We will definitely be back.
Don't get bored coming here many times... the best recreational vehicle in Southeast Asia. Suitable for children and families..

It's a place where the whole family can enjoy! It's fun because there are attractions that are not found in Japan, ranging from thrill rides to children's attractions. As in Japan, Fastpass is recommended.

4.review_text: This is a fun place to go for rides and amusement. Like any such place, you can spend a lot more than just for the tickets. One caution: they don't really label the rides that well if they might be scary, so take care with younger kids (the Transformers ride freaked out our 4-year-old). And lines can be long. But it's definitely fun, with Sesame Street characters and a New York City scene etc.
Is a waste that there are not many rides for the small kids. If they can add in a few stations for the kids that will be lovely. I love the shows like minions, Elmo etc dancing.
Many attractions for all age, good entertainment venue for family
Is good and nice place

5.review_text: Make moments with kiddos at RWS
Good place to bring ur kids to enjoy aft their exam over..
Less crowds on weekday... Good and safe experience during pandemic period...

2nd time at USS and still as awesome. The last time I visited was in 2010 and some of the rides have been updated. Battlestar Galactica is still the must take ride. Other highly recommended rides are The Mummy and Jurassic Park River Rapids ride. Food in the park is expensive though, so it would be better to have your meals at Vivocity before entering.
Nice place for relax and enjoying times with family and friends. I always bring my kids there.

3.review_text: I think it's an okay place with a few interesting rides. More suitable for children of age 5-18. Long waiting times are extremely boring and tiring. Interesting architecture and designs though. If you have nothing better to do on a holiday, you can do it. For tourists, it can be a one timer.

4.review_text: Same rides, but of course one usually goes once in a long while, hence the place doesn't feel that boring. Try to bring your own snacks to not make too big a hole in your wallet.

Like a magical place, especially for children who love disney...there are cartoon characters like minion, hello kitty, dinosaurs, shrek...lots of fun..not forgetting castle and lots of fun rides...roller coaster, merry go rounds....
Today weather was very nice. Cool and windy and no sun . Child liked the place so much.

5.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore is the nice place to visit with family.
Lots of fun for a family day. I would recommend the Express ticket if you don't want to wait long queues. A bit expensive but worth it.
a fun place to be to bond with your kids and kids at heart.. unfortunately with long que all the time
Nice place for Kid rides. Must go early if going on Weekend.
Its fun place to bring children and adults during the school holidays. I enjoy it myself. Its kinda hard to find halal food here in uss. But still a good place to hang out with friends.

4.review_text: Good places to spent with family..esoecially those with kids. The ride is magnificent. Staff is frenly.
Qs are mostly 10 to 15 mins. Lots of personal spaces.

5.review_text: A place that will not fail to make everyone happy, a place with rides with extraordinary experiences, If you bring children, bring a stroller because it will be very helpful, even though USS provides strollers, it's better to bring your own. Thank you USS

The Universal Studios Singapore is a great place to spend your entire day. The rides are great but the waiting times can be from 20 minutes to three hours! It can get really long, so if you're particular of getting to the most rides, it may be worth buying the express pass which lets you go thru a different queue, which most often has zero to few people waiting. Most rides has a height eligibility, so if you're going with kids, research on which rides will be allowed. I like the live performances and the setup... The tickets are expensive, so will visit, but after a while. Oh, avoid days with possibility of rain as that really messes up things and wouldn't allow you to get to all the rides.
