Wentvto USS on Boxing Day. Still a great place to bring the kids. The express passes had helped a lot as the park was at full-capacity due to the holiday.
It's always at USS. However the queue is always long, so need lots of patience & time. Those with young kids or teenagers they enjoy the most. It's always crowded.

Universal Stuido was awesome place for childrens as well as adult there are so many play station to have a lot fun and you not complete it by in one day. That many game will find in Singapore universal studio. I my self take a ride of roll costa of transformer, mummy & shriek etc. good place to visit.

4.review_text: Decent variety of fun rides, and it's compact enough for you to navigate around easily. Highly recommend going during off-peak, otherwise you'd be spending 90% of your time just queueing.

5.review_text: Excellent Place for outing & controlled, safe Adventure

3.review_text: Universal Studio in Singapore is kinda boring if is only rides but no shows for kids. Because of covid19 many restaurants is not open.

4.review_text: Enjoyed the rides with family. Smaller crowds and the app really helps in planning where to go next.
a great family day out! lots of things to see and do

5.review_text: Unless you or your kids are a fan of Micky Mouse, it's definitely better than Disneyland. First there are only 4 Universal Studios in the whole world so it's a pretty special place. And second it's less crowded and also less childish with slightly mature attractions like Jurassic Park, Waterworld, The Mummy, Shrek etc. Theme of this theme park is of course based on the movies they have produced. Apart from the rides, they have different zones of famous movie sets, Hollywood, New York, Madagascar etc. And like any other amusement park, there's so much to see and do so just one fun filled day is not gonna cut it.
Suitable for children. There is no admission fee for children under three years old. Admission is required for those aged four years old. Children can walk around.

Safe distancing measure is in place. I feel clean and safe here. No more shows, only meet and greet, but my children enjoyed it still. Queue up to 1hour, was a rainy day.. we will come back again, hoping everything will resume soon.
Singapore's iconic world famous theme parks. Great for the very young and young at heart...a must visit
Very g Good for Family's outing.
Good place for kids and adults. Really love it. Due to covid there were safe distancing measure. But still great overall
Great place to spend the day with your family even for local Singaporeans. Not just tourists, locals also get to enjoy all the themed rides as well.
Excellent place to go wif families...

Awesome.. we visited on Easter Sunday and it was the first time we were able to take all the rides with less than 15 minutes queuing.. waterworld show and 4D show was closed..likely due to the covid restrictions. Rest of the rides are on. Had a great time with kids. For families going with younger kids, some rides have height restrictions. so if you can go in bigger group, there is chance of taking turns for the rides while one group take care of kids. We did that and so we didn't have to miss any ride

I loved the fact that I could spend time with my family and enjoy ourselves. I was only concerned with the safety of plump people like me. During the mummy ride and the transformers ride I was afraid if being thrown out because I could not push down the safety bar all the way down due to the tummy's hindrance. Though it may be just my imagination or fear but it seemed so real during the ride. Otherwise I had a great time with my family. Thank you USS.

4.review_text: Very enjoyable trip, with some rides being so dated (Jurassic Park) they work, but others (when was the last time anyone watched Battlestar Galactica?!) too dated. However, the rides are very good. Their Covid measures are very useful too - limited park numbers, no reduction of capacity on the main rides. Now with the rule of twos I'd encourage you to get a ticket as no families will be there. Do get the Universal Express pass - best 40 you will spend, as you reduce your queue time from 30-60 sweaty minutes to about 60 seconds. You can buy these all over the park. Don't go on the Transformers ride last, it will really turn your stomach something rotten...
Great place for family with Covid19 restriction.

5.review_text: It's really good park! All attractions were working. My daughter 10 y.o. and I mostly love Nest and Galactic. There are almost restaurants were cloused cause of covid-19 regulations

Fun and free thanks to the rediscover vouchers! Entry is smooth, show the barcode in the pdf file attached in the email sent to you. Re-entry is allowed, so you can head to the 7-11 outside to get refreshments that are much cheaper. Lots of families will flock to the transformers ride at the start which made it a 1.5hr wait, so avoid that and instead go to the other rides (mummy, human, cylon) in the beginning which have almost no wait times. It gets really hot so bring a fan or something.
It is a fun place for youngsters to hang out. Too much might end up giving you a headache but I guess that would be for an older age group of 40's
COVID review. Come on a week day, the lines are so short you can ride each ride multiple times!

4.review_text: Great place to visit in Singapore, for those who know Universal in other countries it is a small copy, but it is the best in Singapore, it is worth taking the children.
Good theme park for family trip but a little small if compared to other Universal Studios
Fun-fulled. Thrilling! Good activities for all from young to young at heart.

5.review_text: The first time was fun but our second time in Universal Studios Singapore is the most memorable and more fun because now we're with our kids. We meet lots of character like Shrek, Minions , etc., we also enjoy the rides. Hoping for the third visit.
Friendly and helpful staff!

There are a lot of roller coaster here and me and my friends had a great time here. It has also many activities that are suitable for family and children. It is a great place to go to for family activities. It is wise to set a whole day aside as the queue can be quite long. Overall a good experience here.

Was at the Universal Studios of Singapore Today 3rd July 2021-4:30pm. We had a wonderful family time, enjoying the rides and taking pictures... One thing we missed is seeing Elmo... My Sweetheart Clara and my Children were sad because we missed the time to see the Sesame's Street Character last Appearance at 5.30pm. It was a stress relief outing, we were all shut at home for too long, sometimes we need to get out there to pamper ourselves but within our means... In this case, we only paid 12 for all of us under the KLOOK app, as we fully use our SRV 1003300 We book the Adult and Child package prices at 114.00. -SRV 100 -10 Discount for Child and paid only 4.00 for each package. We booked 3 package under my Wife and my Daughter and me, well... do the mathWe only paid 4312.00. That is a ultimate saverThank you Jesus, All Glory to you Lord. Amen Amen Amen. Overall, we enjoyed each others company and thank our Father God, Jesus and His Holy Spirit for being there with us and Protecting us from all Dangers. Amen Amen Amen
Spent the whole day there. Fun filled rides for the whole family. Ur kid has to be at least 92cm to get on most of the kids rides.
Lovely place to spend the whole day.. kids really loved this place .. so much to do... the rides are excellent For adrenaline rush try the Mummy and Human and Cylone...
The place is really fun and suitable for kids, teens, and adults. The staff there are also very friendly. They offer to help you.

4.review_text: It's nice to travel to many places to eat. A pleasant place to spend time.

5.review_text: If you go to Singapore you must and must go to USS. The place is clean, comfortable, lots of rides to try. Very pleasant.
Me my kids & mom loved it, wife never liked as she scared from high rides etc overall anytime any day I would go whenever pass through Singapore from or to Melbourne

A fun place to spend with your loved ones! Especially kids! This is their paradise. It is also a paradise for roller coaster lover! If you're just looking for a place to getaway with friends, here is also perfect for you! The attractions are fun and exciting! My favorite ride is definitely Revenge Of The Mummy. 100% recommend!!!

Recommended viewing of the water show between 1:30 and 4:45 p.m. The front seat is a VVIP. It's a good place to get children's character toys. It's hot but it's fun. It's the best playground for children. A place where children sit in the front and get hit by water. After the performance, a photo party with the actors
Really clean and fun! There are less shows because its covid times but also less people so the wait times ok! Definitely worth it to go if youre in SG.

3.review_text: All the indoor shows are closed due to covid. That's practically almost half the activities unavailable. So its kinda boring if you have kids that can take limited rides without all the shows..

4.review_text: Small theme park but with a good variety of rides. Great place to take kids (if I had any)
Is a good experience for kids .. just don't have a lot shelter for sun and raining day.

5.review_text: Best for family outing.

Had a blast! We went during the week & the lines for rides were taking 5minutes so it was great. The kids just kept going back onto the rides over & over again. All staff throughout the park were great. Street characters were fun & engaging. We would recommend an annual pass for locals.
Went there last weekend and the experience was sooo great ! Kiddos would absolutely love this place!
1 of the best day for my kids during thier school holiday except rollercoaster was down sadly
Place for both young and old, never short of fun.

4.review_text: Great rides. There are student discounts on souvenirs, f&b and tickets available. Definitely check out the Transformers and The Mummy rides.

5.review_text: Family bonding time
Uss singapore is one of the best attractions in Singapore. Friendly staff, a wide variety of rides for adults and kids
Nice night outing at universal studio sentosa with some of the rides operating n people donning Halloween outfits. There should be options of snacks redeemable. Good night out for children.
The best experience with my son... will definitely go back to that place as soon as lockdown ceases. The rides, the shows, the programmes are all worth it...

3.review_text: Fun with family members during school holidays.

5.review_text: My kids have lovely time here, i just wish i got the express ticket because the queue kinda long. If you with kids i advice to get the express one, safe much time.
It is just awesome place for family tour. Full on entertainment pack for kids as well as teenagers. Loved it!

A fun place for all age groups to spend the day. If rides don't excite you one has lot of other things. We have been there several times and love it every time. This time we went for the Halloween Horror nights and just loved the whole experience.
Enjoy the Madagascar boat ride n sesame street space ride. The Transformers ride is very thrilling .
Fun rides and good food

4.review_text: Needs no introduction, as singaporeans wouldve visited this theme park. Good way to spend the holidays, with rides for all ages. Highlights include Cylon, Mummys Adventure and Jurassic Park. However, food options are not the cheapest, you might consider settling your meal at Vivo before heading over. It gets really warm from 12-2pm so best to put on sunblock.

Today we had our family outing to USS with our 6 and 7yo boys. It was the first time they explored USS, they definitely had great fun; left with a big satisfaction smile. Some tips 1- unfortunately its a rainy day.. pls do urself a favor to check weather forecast; bring ur own rain coat; inside sells 5/each and only on adult size. 2- go download the USS apps, and plan ya route, check child height constrains; this really save our legs :) 3- bring some snacks and water, so u don hv to waste time to Q and buy snacks. 4-eat before u arrive the park, so don hv to q for the restaurants, especially with all the safe distancing in place.. Hope its useful )
Its just that many of them are not suitable for three-year-olds!
Waiting time is too long, but still good for kids

5.review_text: It's well worth 9 hours of fun, opens at noon rides close at 8pm, theme park closes at 9pm (as of late 2021). We brought our own water, pair of sunglasses and hats for the heat, as you will need to stay hydrated fairly regularly, shouldn't have brought the cameras as most rides don't allow loose bags and accessories and you have to check them in lockers. If you have express lane privileges think carefully where to use them. Highly recommended rides are the BSG cylon human rides, then Mummy, then Jurassic, then Transformer (Waterworld ride is closed), in that order. Long queues are expected EVERYWHERE. You might get stuck in the normal queues whilst Sentosa privileged expat kids whose parents have gotten them annual passes including express privilege pass you by. So do use that wait time to envy them and philosophically think about why you can't afford to do so. Also think about strategy, there're only 9 hours of opening hours, 2 hours to queue to buy and consume food, that leaves 7 hours for 5 major rides and other smaller ones, each ride lasts no more than 2 to 5 mins, can you afford 30 to 60 mins to queue for each ride... The rest are for younger kids so don't get stuck with parents with kids in the queue absolutely not worth it. Food wise, go for burgers or hot dogs, most eateries are closed so expect to pay premium. Always get a souvenir like a t-shirt or something to remember your visit by.
Family day out, lesser crowd compare to our previous visit. Manage to go on more rides, we skipped a few fides. But overall, good day & clear skies. The kids enjoyed the day.
Great for family outing with kids
Our family went for a full day enjoyment of rides! It was definitely a place for kids and adults
One of the best places to have fun with your family. Although some events are closed due to covid19, still can enjoy the happiest time.
Looking foreward for a lovley familyday at Universal studios Sentosa, Singapore
Suitable for taking children from primary and secondary schools to play

The best place for youngsters as well as adventure lovers. It has all theme related rides. From roller coasters to dinasaurs to mummies you will see all rides as well as different region foods and products. The best ride over there are transformers, mummy ride , pirate show and roller coasters. Do try dinasaur ride too . But the above mentioned rides are must. And tip for money savers is that eat food outside the universal studios as the food inside is expensive as well as doesn't tastes that good
Family fun @USS.

3.review_text: Weekdays n non peek period it's a dead place.. so go on holidays weekends.. maybe excitement welcomes you

4.review_text: There are many kids attractions and things to play. It is recommended to go early to explore the place and enjoy yourselves. Will be better to cater more drinks and healthy snacks inside the attractions. Thank you.

5.review_text: This place is superb for a family visit. Awesome rides and really enjoyable place for all the age groups. A must visit place in Singapore
Nice place to go but for my age is cant have Finn like young people but I like to going too Sentosa universal studio Singapore
Great experience especially going with loved one
Super enjoyed this day as I managed to go to my fav rides. Love it. Organize and friendly staffs will welcome you.

4.review_text: Fun place to visit in Singapore for kids of all ages. Surprisingly good value, with food and souvenirs not too over priced. Starting to show its age, with the ride themes dating from the 2000s, franchises that are no longer current.
Good place to spend your day out with family or friends. Recommend to try the Transformer and Mummy rollercoaster.

5.review_text: Many of the rides at Universal Studios Singapore are suitable for little ones, and adults also have a great time.

Ooon ho ... What a lovely world it is. Forgot about my kids .. i guess my wife and I enjoyed even more than anybody. Universal Studio is for them, who likes Universal Characters like... Madagascar, Minions, Jurassic park...etc. Best 3 things ..don't dare to miss... 1. Take selfie or pic infront of the Universal Globe. 2. Attend maximum meet and greet by these Universal Characters. 3. Go ride...almost all rides are fun and memorable one. I have never seen these kind of rides in my entire life .

In Singapore and then to Universal Studio? Yes! Definitely, don't miss it. Super well done and there is something for every age group :) The waiting times were reasonable, the staff were very friendly and it's best to buy a "fast ticket" if possible. It was totally worth it!

1.review_text: Not worth the money for young kids. I took my 5 year old and there was hardly anything suitable, also, why does everything have to be so loud. More suitable for older kids, teenagers and above. Singapore zoo was a lot more value for money and time spent without the queues.

4.review_text: Great place with kids and family. I always loved this place!! Been there millions of time. Only update now is that some of the rides are open at certain times. Just check before you buy your ticket. Madagascar Old side was closed and was only open part was the king Julians Goround. Before you take the Express ticket think twice. Because we could do only few ride and of course due to weather safety and the time restrictions its very hard to run around. Just dont waste the money until they fully open to have fun. But other than that always a great place for kids to adults and families to spend their time. Enjoy!
it is not too big but enough! can enjoy, nice food, extream play spot, so very interesting places in sg. and u also can enjoy sentosa island.

5.review_text: It's good . It's fun for kids but most of the attractions is closed due to covid restrictions and they are opening slowly and gradually. Good luck Singapore loving it. Wow.
Universal Studio is one of the best iconic tourists location in Singapore. Bring your kids. They will really enjoy it.

Coming here during the pandemic is a mix of emotions. Seeing a few closed stores, you can't dismiss the effects Covid has made to everyone. But at the same time, seeing the kids finally be kids, it was heartwarming!
Ultimate place for kids. Loved it. Few water dispensers around the places will be highly appreciated.
Wonderful place to bring your kids and your kid mind too

1.review_text: Drinking water is not available in the entire USS. Only have to buy (that too water is very cold). With small kids, it is very difficult to manage in such big parks without water. Administration team of Universal Studios Singapore, please consider reopening those water points.

3.review_text: It's a good for kids. Not many rides for adults and very few options for vegetarian.

Many rides are closed due to covid..transformees is 3 min experience with one hr long line. If you are a couple with a kid..then there might be a problem...kids below 4 feet are not allowed in some of the adventrous rides. Otherwise good atmosphere..nice outing overall.

4.review_text: Great place for kids and family. I always loved this place! Only update now is that some of the rides are open at certain times. Just check before you buy your ticket. Before you take the Express ticket think twice. Because we could do only few ride and of course due to weather safety and the time restrictions its very hard to run around. Just dont waste the money until they fully open to have fun. But other than that always a great place for kids to adults and families to spend their time.

This place is an entire day activity, lot of outdoor walking involved so check the weather before you book tickets. Some of the rides are closed currently and the food options are also limited. But excellent for a kids day out. Carry a raincoat from 7/11 if you're planning to do the water ride in jurrasic park section as it leaves you drenched.
Nice Park but not for under 3 years children or under 122 cm tall
Quite a few shows and rides still suspended post covid, but makes for a fun day out with the kids
It's not too big, so it's perfect for bringing the kids along. There were scenes where the rain caused by squalls made me drenched more than I expected

5.review_text: amazing place for all types of age groups. everyone will get lots of fun here. if u going with little one than you have to ready for heavy CC bill. after Covid 19 so many rides and restaurants and shops still yet not opened. i like transformers and dino rides very much. my little one tried all rides whenever he applicable. some of ride requires certain height of child. most dangerous part of it is Lego toy stop on staring. really great place for fun with ur family and friends. u will definitely get tied after leaving studio. before entering u should check ur phone memory bcoz it may be full and u will be nervous. after leaving it u should go candilious shop for all types of candy and chocolate for ur dear ones.
Universal studios is magical for all ages. Entertaining from the start to finish it is a must visit in Singapore. Paradise for kids

Universal Studio Singapore... always busy... a refreshing place with the family, it's hot, you have to bring a hat/umbrella. If you have funds, it's best to buy express tickets, especially holiday tickets.

It's a nice amusement park, and most of the games there are for adults, but there are museums and 3D movies suitable for children, and restaurants and cafes. It's a very beautiful place. I recommend visiting it.
Come at 10am! The kidds had such a wonderful time. Avoid carrying too many things as well.

4.review_text: Best for all ages. Must go is big rides and mummy ride. Transformer is best ride. Only Negative thing is lot of restaurants closed and big queues on most of restaurants. Free coupon in grovey summer ticket is waste. You can spend them as no popcorn counter was open and line for food was endless.
Awesome rides for minors as well as adults, Transformers, Sesame Street, Ancient Egypt and Shrek attractions are a must if you visit.
All rides open today . Fun rides for children aged 7 and over although some in need of refurbishment and clean up .

5.review_text: It was an amazing experience with family there. One of the best places to be visited in Singapore. The minimum age for kids to ride is 4 but few rides allow them based on their height too. Kids above 4 years are chargeable so make sure you take a ticket for them. And have FUN.

It is one of best places to vist in Singapore, both for adults and kids. I went in May 22, when there was not too much crowd here ( probably due to covid restrictions), so I did not took an express pass and still had to wait for uptob30 mins in few rides. You get the feel of universal the moment you enter the arena. 360roller coaster was best one there closely followed by Egypt themed roller coaster ( not 360 though ). Not too many activities for kids below 3 feet though. If you have small kids, I suggest you rent a stroller available there with (15 to 30 sgd rent). Do take you hats and glasses and do not carry too much loose articles/items with you as many rides not allow you to carry them with you.
Good place for kids. Too big to cover in one day. Transformers ride was the best one. Carry sunscreen with you. It gets really hot.

For all kids and kid at heart! Great experience. Awesome rides and very friendly, happy atmosphere. Bring umbrella as it is hot. Queuing time depends on foot traffic, longer waiting time weekends. There are a lot of food selections in every corner, themed with the ride attraction. Lockers available at the entrance and in some rides. Prepare for loose change to avail. Going to and from is very accessible. You can take the Sentosa Express from Vivo City Mall. Hotels are within walking distance.

Universal Studios is a very small area, but it has many beautiful scenic spots and exciting games. It is very suitable for the whole family to play. You must come here when traveling to Singapore. You cant miss it...

3.review_text: A wonderful lifetime experience no doubt.. it was a lil tough on us though having our 7 year old kid with us and being vegetarians... Not allowing food from out is fine as long as there are sufficient options for all kinds of food inside. We were shocked to see that we would have to survive on fries and ice cream all day and it was really tiring and annoying by the end of the day. Wake Up Universal Studios Singapore.. It's about time you serve some delicious veggie food as most of the world has started to..
Very hot for the long ques. Not much to do with very young children. I wouldnt rush back but was ok day out.

Okay-ish Universal Studios out of all. Compared to Orlando one, this one doesnt have Harry Potter theme park (and rides) and overall it is smaller in size as well. You can easily cover the whole park within the given park timings of 12pm to 7pm.

4.review_text: The rides are ok. The weather is very hot so it would be good to prepare a hat or umbrella as well.

5.review_text: Good place to enjoy with Family. Note Express pass is a must, else be prepared for long queues. Loads of rides and fun activities to do specially for kids.
One of the must go places in Singapore. Full of fun experiences. A family friendly place.
Great place for kids and with friends. We bought tickets from klook. Its cheaper. Would recommend ride but queue is long. Should try single rider

As a fan of transformers , minions , fast and furious and other movie that's why I had visited these place .Each zone features its own themed rides, shows, shops, restaurants and street entertainment. We have visited the Singapore Universal Studios several times and the whole family has had an absolute blast every time. There is a lot of fun to be had here, and you are pretty much guaranteed to have a great family day out.
Forchilden or famaly good shop eat sighting

3.review_text: Big wait times on rides and not a massive range of "adult" rides. Be great for kids
This is place consists of Rides..not recommended for older and kids..the people who doesnt go for rides like roller coaster type rides are not recommended to take up this

4.review_text: Its a wonderful Theme park for ages 5 and above. Well organized, friendly helpful staff. We met few characters which was wonderful and fun for the kids. Not much rides for younger toddlers though. We went on the weekend so it was crowded but expected. There were lots of restaurants/cafe/booths that are closed, for e.g. the cookie monster was a nice stall if it was open also an indian halal restaurant. For Halal options with most of the restaurants closed was a bit difficult to find. There were also no water fountains to refill our bottles, so we had to buy water everytime. And also those stalls didn't sell any halal food other than fruits. Overall it was good theme park for a one time visit only.

We had a great time as a family, but the park is relatively small (compared to Euro Disney). The thrill rides are quite few in number and we were able to do them all in the day. It's a shame that we're not really transported into the world of the park, especially in the queues: there aren't really any settings or scenarios before the attractions.

Ideal for children aged 4 to 10. The attractions are great for small children, for adults I think it must be quite limited, apart from the 3 big ones. Fair value for money, too bad the park is not open longer during the day from 12 p.m. to 7 p.m. Be careful the times change depending on the day, check before going there, the time indicated on min ticket (get your guide) and on the site was not the same. Fortunately we had seen it before. The park is small but for a day it's good!
Must visit destination, good trip for family, young people, wonderful time.
Price is little on the higher side and limited shows. Good for teens , not worth it for elderly or parents. Indian food options are not there so would recommend to pack something for lunch.

5.review_text: Great place to have fun. There's not a lot of rides if you are going with a toddler/kids under 4 years old for obvious safety reasons. So if you have a toddler then go with someone who can watch them while you go for rides or just skip it for a couple of years till they grow up. Gets a bit crowded on weekends and had to wait a long time -so try their unlimited universal express pass to skip long queues or come by late afternoon.
Must visit place. A keen advice if visiting with children age group should be 12yrs plus.

Honestly, I know I'm too old to enjoy theme parks, but this one is really grand. Went with the family and our youngest is 12 years old. There's something to enjoy for everyone of all ages. The Transformers and The Mummy rides were our highlights, but some rides take very long to wait. Be wary though, food inside is a bit expensive, so I suggest to load up on carbs in Vivo City's food court before talking an entire day of walking. Transpo from Vivo City to and from Sentosa is free. I was tired, but all the fun was worth it.

Had a great time with family,rides are safe and good.mummy ride was really good.overall it was Fun and had good experience there.restrooms are clean, also they have locker rooms so that you can keep your belongings inside before going for a ride... universal studios is closed on Monday and Tuesday, open from Wednesday to Sunday,time 12.00 to 7.00 pm
Fun place... Your kids will be crazy... The best one is the transformer ride, mummy ride, lost world and move set spacial effect one

3.review_text: It's nice, but the waiting is disgusting and very exhausting, even with an express ticket. The waiting is long. It is good for adults... Young children have limited options, and one day is not enough. Children aged 4 years and under are better off.

If it's your first time visiting or you don't have kids, there's a lot to enjoy, but as someone who's been there dozens of times... I went with my kids, but there were no shows, no parades, and Madagascar was under construction. I went there after 3 years due to Corona, but the prices seem to have gone up even more and there is nothing to see or do, so I was completely disappointed. There is nothing to do with children under 5 years old. I was satisfied with just watching the Sesimi show, but it was completely gone. I don't think I'll ever go again unless I get an annual membership again.

4.review_text: Rides are suitable for adults but for the children under age 14 this place is a no go.People having trouble with High BP and back injuries barred from most of the rides, before buying tickets check for the promotions.

There are many corners to take photos. Various types of play equipment There are both suitable for children and suitable for adults. But the area is quite dirty. The walkway inside the building leading to the play equipment has trash, glasses, and water bottles left behind. Including a lot of dirt.
A place everyone can enjoy, young and adults. Amazing rides and shows.

5.review_text: Some rides are still closed but 80% things are now open. If you have small kid you may not be able to do many rides due to height limit but otherwise it never bores. Mummy ride is my personal fav!
Highly recommend it for family with children or just young adult that wants to have fun. It's still crowded, but not as crowded as before. Expect the queue time to be short.

Awesome experience for kids. My 8 year old was able to go on all rides, 4 year old couldn't due to height restrictions but there were a lot of options available for him too. Our family favourite was the transformers ride.
Best place for family & kids. Lots of activities available here. Although the queue for the rides can be 2hrs long for regular access.
One of the best place to go to with family or even a friends! Cant wait to be back here really soon.. from Surabaya to Singapore!

3.review_text: Ques were way to long and we went on a school day post holidays. Rides were good but we only went on 2 rides, 3rd being lights camera action. The transformer ride was really good but wasted over an hour of our day. By the time we finished that it was lunch time and then all the ques were over 45 minutes. If you have smaller kids go to legoland

Kids would love the rides. Just that many rides are no longer available (post covid) and there are only a handful left. They make you wait for hours for every ride and that way you wouldnt notice that you arent doing as many rides as you could have on a single day.

4.review_text: Nice place for visiting mostly kid 10 for many ride experience. Security are not at per incident with me purchased Baby Stroller & kept to designated stroller parking place but stolen as usual by an Indian (hindi speaking). Anticipated the person but struggling to get security guard help to catch red handed. Though provided a new stroller. By felt very shame being Indian
Worth to visit with kids but long Q that's very sad
Thematic rides, ideal for teens & young adults
Visited the Minion Exhibition. Good place to bring kids for interaction.
Nice for kids, some attractions are getting busy.

5.review_text: Go straight to Sentosa Island and enjoy a day inside Universal Studios if you have limited vacation time in Singapore. A very well spent day for families with kids and kids-at-heart. Food is amazing and lots of benches under trees to relax the day away. The rides are super fun and exciting, the characters walking around are so nice and friendly. It's a wonderful experience to have and make happy memories from.
Universal Park in Singapore is beautiful. Can't get enough of going back with the whole family.

Superb place to visit with family. Some tips to follow Wear light clothes Carry water and easy to carry food Carry pram for small kids Reach as early as possible, even 1 day is not enough for this amazing place Check weather forecast, no rain, as it may play spoilsport Avoid weekend And if going on weekends then buy express tickets.

Wonderful place to spend for a day, so wear comfortable clothes and shoes. so many attractions to play, many good spot photos. Must do : MUMMY, Transformers, Human. Go to the restaurant before lunch time to avoid peak hours. Buy tickets in advance, so you only scan the code.

Perfect place to spend your full day of fun activities. I love the transformer most and many other attractions. It's way smaller compared to Disneyland but still consists lots of fun. Recommended for everyone above 5 yr. Btw your phone will not work properly while you're there so probably you should have backup plan should you take different route with your friends.

3.review_text: A fun studio for the kids to happily peek around and have a snack, like a weekend trip bt. That's it. Nothing special.

4.review_text: Fantastic place to go with family and friends! Theme park activities are great but most of them are same (rollercoasters) and just the stories are different.

Amazing place and breathtaking place for families and friends. 1 day ticket can enjoy everything inside there. Please keep in mind weekdays are more crowded.. I enjoyed Cylon, Transformers in 3D, Mummy that was fantastic.
Came here for the universal studio vibes, the sesame street show was super cute, they really brightened up the atmosphere, do not order milkshakes its too sweet...
It's a nice place for families more than only adults, and its crowded in weekdays as well as the weekend, I waited one hour four each attraction .

5.review_text: Suitable for families, many interesting attractions for children and adults. Long queues on weekends, quite tiring.
A family friendly place to spend time together with family, friends, or any loved ones! Highly recommend
Fun loving activities, good for all ages.. Kids have lot of gaming to play and lot of attractions
child's happiness
Perfect place to enjoy with family. They should have open until 9 to 10 PM

1.review_text: Overall a good place for family. Rides are dated. However, avoid KT'S Grill. All the staff their were Grumpy and Moody. Especially the indian girl in front with a rude attitude. The place was empty but for some unknown reason was told only permitted to sit at the booths. Family felt uncomfortable with the situation and left. Ironically, all the other cafes was full except here. It's probably because of the great welcoming attitude shown.

3.review_text: People under age of 30 could enjoy more.

4.review_text: Avoid going on weekend and especially during school holiday. The queue is insane and waiting time is like 100mins for a ride.....anyway, kids enjoy it a lot. Worth every penny I paid

From Vivo city, take the free tram to Sentosa island (only 1 stop). In my opinion, this park is not suitable for babies under 5 years old. They cant play any ride. And the waiting time during peak, can reach 1.5 hours! Of course with some extra money, you can buy the express ticket. Toilets need more often cleaning during peak time.

It's a great place for kids and families, a great amusement park, with different rides and shows, you can ride their different roller coaster rides if you're into speed and action. There are also shows good for family and kids that they can enjoy like Shrek 4D experience. They also have great restaurants inside with different cuisines. Restrooms are also clean.
Great place to visit with family. Few Closed rides for maintemence were the only disappointment.

5.review_text: It's great to spend a day here with family and friends, great rides, photogenic! But tiring for elders,must have more seating places! Toilet system is great in Singapore! Every where you have them,neat n clean and many!

Its been a wonderful experience at Universal Studios today.. its a very good go-to place with kids as its stroller friendly throughout the place. Waiting time for some of the famous rides like Transformers, Sesame Street, Mummy, Dino park etc are little high and express tickets may help in these cases. Overall a great experience for the family
A family place. Kids and parents will have time of their life.

So much fun!! Feeling like a child again. Bring your kids and have fun filled day with your family..There are so many rides surely you must..It brings so much laughter and happiness. Off course don't forget your souvenirs

The place is nice and worth a visit, there are certain hacks one can do to have a more comfortable visit If you are foreigner, buying an express pass could accelerate your ability to explore and ride more substantially, if you want to remain frugal go for individual rider line (ride alone) which is mostly 50 percent faster. Recommended rides ( From my experience) 1. Mummy (Animated roller coaster) 2. Jurassic park ( Canopy Flyer) 3. Transformer ( Soft and Simple yet fun) 4. Cylone and Human ( Hardest ones) Dont go for mummy safari its slow and mostly for toddlers There are many more but you need a lot of time, for maximum enjoyment visit during non rush season like January or April

3.review_text: This place is cool to look at. But bringing young kids isn't ideal. The queues cab get long. Age group more suitable would probably be 6 and older. It's a waste of money for taking younger kids because 1 adult adult can only accompany 1 child if they were smaller.

Not that great...Just couple of exciting land games. Kids will love it but not an exciting place for teens and adults. Please go on weekends. If not, it will be more boring. Not worth the ticket price. Fast track entry is just a means of money waste. Over-all a good place to spend 5 hours and decent 5 restuarants with different cuisines.

4.review_text: Good for kids but do check the minimum height requirements for the rides to be sure. Check the USS site but a 120cm tall kid should be able to ride a lot of the rides, just depends how game they are. If they've never ridden a roller coaster before, the Jurassic Park's Canopy Flyer is a good introduction. My 6yo at the time of writing, who was excited to try "roller coasters", told me that's scary enough. Worth buying the express tickets too especially if you arrive some time after it opens. Note there are rides that you can't use it on, so do check the USS website. When we went, the Canopy Flyer was one of them, but we got in at the start of the day so there was no queue. Photos with the movie characters were ok but disappointed when they didn't turn up when it was raining. The photo taking place was under cover.... Food was meh and expensive, but expected of a theme park I guess.

I bet it's smaller but just nice for a trip day. Must try: Mummy ride, Transformer ride, Jurassic canopy and Jurassic splash. Can't recall the actual name.. but you'll know when you visit. Of course, human n cyclone if you are game. For citizen, buy online it's cheaper. I bought using phone just before going in.
Great place to have fun with kids and family but its very crowded nowadays! Better to buy express entry tickets instead of normal tickets.
Great place for kids, be prepared for long queues

A disappointment if you go with kid younger than 10. Most place is closed. Not much to do with younger kid. Works on main heat hours. We arrver at 11 and finished everything till 14. Not recommended especially it cost a lot money and not worth it

5.review_text: One of the must visit place when you come to Singapore... Theme play ground for all age with complete game rides, not only the adrenaline rushing game but also a game that family friendly. Since many tourist come to here, so the long queues aren't avoided but you can buy the express ticket to cut the waiting time.

Distinctive, beautiful and fun to spend a perfect day, but I recommend going on weekdays due to the extreme crowding on the weekends. Tickets for adults are 82 Singapore dollars and children are 70 Singapore dollars, but I strongly recommend that you purchase an Express Pass to avoid a long wait for the rides.
Good place to visit with Family, kids will enjoy the theme parks, rides are ok.

What a great family outing, but it isn't cheap. This was our second visit to Universal Studios, the first was in Florida in 1999 and we enjoyed it every bit as much. But there are a few suggestions to help you: 1. Take a water bottle with you. There are plenty of places to refill it and it is important to drink a lot with the heat and humidity in Singapore. 2. Pay the extra money and get an Express Pass for each family member. The park is only open from 11.00 until 18.00. With wait times of up to 1.5 hours for some of the more popular rides, you will not be able to do all the rides in a day. The Express Pass will allow you to skip the queues and significantly decrease your wait times. If you want to enjoy all the rides in a day, this is vital. 3. If you only want to do a few rides, it is much quieter in the afternoon. Arrive after lunch and your wait times drop from 80 minutes down to 15, or even less. But choose which rides you want and plan ahead - they close entry to the rides at 18.00. 4. Things are expensive in the park. You will pay a lot for food and souvenirs. Don't be surprised, be prepared - take enough money to enjoy yourself. At least you will save a bit if you follow point number 1.
Family trip in Singapore at Universal Studios.

4.review_text: So much fun I visited this place before I had a kid. A few years later when I brought my son, he was veeery bored while waiting in line for some of the popular games. I think it's better to buy express tickets for those who bring children rather they won't get bored waiting

Fairly fun. All the theme were v beautiful designed, the rides were exciting and fun too. Went on a weekday so it is not crowded and manage to take all the rides before closing. Strongly recommended for teens and adults because most of the rides are thrilling. Children might not be suitable. Most of the rides are indoor so no need to afraid of wet weather.
Great place for a family trip. I recommend purchasing fast line tickets, otherwise it is not possible to visit all the attractions

This place is simply one of the best places for site seeing, tourist attraction and a good place for family hang outs. Please be careful though of rougue entities waiting probably there to inflict quarrels among ur family. Rest it's a good place.

Arrived at gate at 1030am ready for 11am open. Gates opened at 1050am. Lots of water fountains around for drinks as its quite humid. Travelled with toddler almost 3 years old. Plenty of fun and safe activities and rides to do with him. Pre booking with klook was a good saving for us.

5.review_text: Very fun. Recommend traveling with family. Or friends will have more fun. But I recommend that you read the warnings on the equipment a little before playing. Because some rides look like they don't have much from the outside. But actually it's quite scary. You could have a heart attack. Haha. I came on a Sunday. Surprisingly there weren't many people. It was just the right amount of time, not overwhelming, but not too crowded. Overall, I recommend it if you come to Singapore. You have to come here.
A moderately sized park, its a lot of fun to bring children! It won't be too tiring either. Downloading the Global App in advance can arrange the order of attractions more efficiently.
The iconic singapore universal studios! Several attractions inside.. nice and good for family holidays!
Kids have grown up. Different experience to bring them back. Still crowded, still hot and magical. Rides and shows might be experiencing some wear and tear but still fun. Memories.

This is the second Universal Park we have visited. The first one was in Orlando. It was interesting to compare! Yes, this park is certainly interesting, but we liked Orlando better. We purposefully brought the children here; of course, they were delighted. Goal achieved We easily walked around it in a few hours, which cant be said about the park in Orlando; to get around that one, you need to spend at least a couple of days) Certainly recommend a visit if you come to Singapore!!

4.review_text: Recommended for 10 yrs old til 25 yrs old and kids at heart. It's my 3rd time at USS and theres really a big difference in experience maybe because I am a mom of 2 kids now (3 and 1 yrs old). We only tried the madagascar caruosell and Shrek 4D. Stroll a bit coz it's also raining. Recommended to get tickets online as it has discou t for SG residents incuding those holding work pass cause on the kiosk there is no discount. Kids 4 yrs old below is free. Some facilities are not availble and in renovation. Few street performer unlike in 2017 when I first enter USS. But there's still a lot to enjoyed there.

Unfortunately, with the current renovation project, we couldn't enjoy all of the rides. But overall, it is an enjoyable place to be with your kids. Don't forget to try the turkey legs, the corn dog was a bit different than what I'm expecting

Enjoyed our family visit to USS alot. It is truly a place which brings a smile to everybody. Some rides are not suitable for children who are too young as there is minimum height limit - do check before making a beeline queue! Food is expensive but decent. Will be back again.

Enjoyed the place, quite small but has enough for young kids and older people. Please try the transformers cyclone ride, absolutely amazing ! Food is quite pricey there and you cannot bring in your own food so eat well before heading in

Smaller than Hong Kong Disneyland. It's not big, so there's no problem getting on the ride with a basic admission ticket, but if you don't want to wait in line in a hot and crowded place, you can buy a fast pass. For lunch, it's better to get your arm painted and go out to eat it.

5.review_text: Great family bonding! Rides are all fun and worth the wait. Tho the prices of the restaurants inside are pricey.. there are still stores which you can buy food from outside. Better to eat first your lunch before going inside.

A fun fill place to spend time with your love ones. A different set of rides that can be enjoyed by both young and old. There's also a variety of shop's selling knick knacks, chocolates and souvenir shops. At the end of the day you leave with a wonderful feelings and memories.
Nice place for holiday with family or friends.. Success Universal Studio Singapore
Must visit places, especially the kids will enjoy a lot, seeing the transformers, Jurassic park, etc. Seasonal times are crowded, especially when you ride the metro.
Love the place as it's family friendly with lots of options rides for all ages. Best to go during non-peak period to save queuing time for any rides.

2.review_text: Strickly for kids.

3.review_text: Not many activities (less than or equal to 5) for kids less than 5 yrs. Could have been more. Very less personnel to assist or provide information. No vegetarian in most of the hotels in Universal studios. Making it 3 star primarily due to the shrek 4 d show, sesame show, Egypt ride...

very limited activities for todlers. Many kids were unable to participate because of the hight issue. Some taff members are acting very rude (specially indied the shows, if your toldler scared and you want to go out you will face this.)
Good for youths
Ok, but it does feel a bit tired in places. Not a lot of rides, youd expect more. Good food options.

4.review_text: USS is a fantastic place for the entire family! My kids love everything about this place. Its good to note that many of the rides have a height requirement so my kids couldnt ride most of them. Be sure to check out the show timings & schedule.
Good for kids..much smaller..but enough to spend a good outing..usually crowded..start from the end to avoid queues..

This theme park hosts many thrilling rides, shows and attractions based on popular films and shows. Dont know where to bring your kids during holiday? This place will be fun where they get to meet their favourite show characters and interact with them!

Super fun but crazy busy (as most theme parks are). Recommend doing the "single riders" option as much as possible otherwise you spend most of the time queuing (even with a fast pass). There are water fountains dotted throughout the park, so take an empty drink bottle if you don't mind carrying a bag. If I could change anything, I'd want the park to stay open until 8pm to allow for families with older children and adults to enjoy the park for longer.
Very good for bringing children, given 4 stars, because when we arrived there was a lot of renovation going on. It only costs 900 thousand

5.review_text: I always go here with the family when Im in Singapore got some tips for you to go on weekdays. And I heard if your first in line before the park opens they give you a free ticket for you and your family.

My main reason was Universal Studio to visit Singapore. You will enjoy a lot here. Many adventures and 3D(real 3D like you are in the middle of scene) rides. Also, a lot of activities for the children too. To skip the long queues you can get express pass.

If youre planning to visit to Singapore, then you must visit place is to the universal studios. Whether you are a kid or not it doesnt matter. I will love the shoes the animated cartoons and that thrills at the roller coasters was something which one need to experience in their lifetime

I went with my 1 year old child. There are few rides that you can ride with small children, The atmosphere was different from Japan, and the people were very lively! It's very hot, so don't forget to stay hydrated!
It is a very suitable attraction for families, children and couples to travel together.

4.review_text: The park was a good timepass. Unfortunately, you spend more time in the queues than for the rides. The express pass almost doubles the cost. Nonetheless I would highly recommend it if you are visiting Singapore with a 11 kid. USS is not as big as the LA one, still big enough for 1 day. It was crowded on a weekday, even though Singapore school vacation had not started. So plan your visit accordingly.
Only 3-4 major rides are good rest are for kids. Cyclone, mummy, transformers, jurrasic park. Can skip express pass. Que waiting time is general less in the evening. Plan accordingly.

Definitely a place that is worthwhile to go if you are travelling to Singapore for sightseeing, or if you want to spend the day with friends and family for an enjoyable time. I would recommend spending an entire day here to fully enjoy the USS experience. The main highlights of the theme park are the roller coaster rides, such as the Mummy, Cylon and Enchanted Airways. The other rides are also enjoyable and friendly for those who have a fear of roller coasters like me, such as the Transformers Ride, the Sci Fi accelerator Adventure, as well as the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure.

Definitely a highlight of the city with lots of exciting attractions. Especially the Transformer ride is awesome. However long waiting cues in combination with the heat are a test for kids patience limit.
It is ok for half day spend for kids.

5.review_text: One of the must visit spot in Singapore Its suitable for both children and adults Waiting time for adult rides - 20 mins - 2hrs For kids ride - 20 to 30mins If you are planning to visit on weekends I suggest you to opt for express entry Carry extra water bottles
Nice place for kids,must include in Singapore itinerary. Its in sentosa Iceland.
Great place to enjoy SG with young children! Express pass were really helpful!

Great place for both kids and adults. The park was quite big and very clean, the attractions were great, loved the transformers. We came on a holiday term and rainy day, so either long queue or temporary closed attractions, but after rain the queue was actually ok and we managed to see most of them. Definitely will visit again one day we visit Singapore.

I took my son (9yo) and niece (12yo) and we had a ball. Recommend getting the express pass to avoid the lines. The Mummy ride was definitely the highlight for us. Make sure you take a hand fan as it can be very hot while lining up.

1.review_text: My family of 4 (with a girl 8yo and boy 5yo) went to USS ytd (29Jun2023) over the Public Holiday. As both my kids were first time riders of the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, both my wife and I assured them that we will sit with them separately on the ride and they can sit in the middle for added safety since they are dinosaurs fan, just not rides, but we thought we let them try and hopefully like it. For context, 2 yrs ago my girl was 6yo and she would freak out even taking the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase! She literally cried out loud during and after the ride! Nevertheless, we indicate to the staff at the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure that we are of 2pax each (My wife with my daughter, and myself with my son) so that both kids can sit in the middle. We were assigned a ride which already has a family of 3, so both my kids took the remaining middle seats and both my wife and I sat by their side. However there's an adult couple whom came over and told us that they are of 2pax and would like to sit together as two. Despite explaining to the staff our situation, eventually my daughter was made to sit at the other side of my son's, while I'm at the other end. And my wife had to extend herself to reach over to hold my girl's hand to calm her even before the ride began. I in the end tried to hold both my son's and daughter's hand throughout. Regardless of our best effort, both of my kids screamed and cried throughout the entire boat ride! No thanks to the staff's arrangement! Don't understand why we have to make such arrangement even though my family had already agreed and indicated to split up. They could have assigned single rider to sit on each of the other remaining sides. In any case, my kids decided not to come to USS anymore in future, no thanks to you USS! Lest to say, that was our last ride of the day, as we didn't take any further rides and cut short our day and left shortly after.

Revenge of the Mummy ride seat size is not for Western adults - they're made for short people. I'm 5 feet 10 and my legs felt uncomfortable in the narrow gap between seat and safety bar so I got out. This ride should be upgraded if overseas tourists will go.

I am worried why this is rated 5 star. One of the worst experiences of my life. This is a total commercial thing, with no attention to families with kids. Stay away from here, else you'll definitely be irritated. Unnecessarily hyped up thing.

2.review_text: Not Friendly for Disabled Wheelchair bound people / who can't walk. There's No lift from Car drop area to ground level. If you carry your own wheelchair then it's ok but shifting to Rides not easy. On rental manual wheelchair available Such an advance Country but No motorised wheelchair surprisingly

3.review_text: Not much for small kids.. its mainly for rides

4.review_text: We had a good time in Universal in June 2023. However, some rides were not operating due to Cyclone prediction (in Jurassic Park), Jurassic Park Rapids, but a must try are- Battlestar Galactica (go only if u love adventure and if you are not scared of height), Revenge of the Mummy, Transformers-SD, Shrek show if you are Shrek lover like us:). Things to keep in mind- better to fix a meeting spot and time with your family, as you are not allowed to carry phone and other items with you, so, tracking becomes an issue. Take a locker, keep your belongings there, fix a meeting time & spot, so, that you all can meet after a few rides....full day is needed, so, better to start early, carry a water bottle as you need to walk alot, so, staying hydrated is must. Wear sneakers or comfortable shoes, in which you can walk more and more....wear a cap and sunglasses, wear lot of sunscreen, as it is sunny most of the time and everyone in the family, keep some cash, so, that, even if you are away from other members, you can enjoy the yum food in Universal. A must in your Singapore trip, though we had been to Ferrari world- Dubai, but this surely was fun. *Tips- You can take an express pass, if you do not like to wait much and ready to pay double the price, Express que is separate, but relatively less waiting. We took the normal ticket and had to wait for 30-45min per ride.

There are a lot of activities to do and see for both adults and for kids. Good facilities along all the park, well designed and good entertainment. The kids are all excited trying all the different rides but my favourites are always the Mummy Roller Coaster Ride. Beautiful to see all the light when is darker in the evening. All the staff was friendly. However, it can get too hot during the day in this weather.
Nice theme park for the family, more suitable for adults and teenagers. Fun and exhilarating rides! Be prepared for queues!
A gd place for family

Just leave your backpacks at home. On Galactica you are not even allowed to take your cell phone with you, no wallet or anything. Everything must be included. The lockers are free for 40 minutes only. Afterwards you have to pay a fine of four Singapore dollars. A little further away, when the mummy returns, the lockers are free for 60 minutes and later even for 90 minutes. You can even take your cell phone with you on the roller coaster. But neither are backpacks. When the mummy returns there is a single line. But if it is too full it will also be closed. I was there when the park opened and managed to ride Galactica seven times and the Mummy six times. After that the park became so full that queuing was no longer fun. I also really liked the 4D animation Shrek... all in all a very nicely laid out park but quite small. No comparison to Euro Disney Europapark or Parque Aventura in Spain... If you decide early, you can get cheaper tickets from some providers. You can also book at the park on the day itself

5.review_text: The universal studios is one of the most popular and unique place in Singapore. Children loved a lot. They are loving to often that place, bze of so many rides. I love that bze I want to see my daughter's smiling face , want hear loudly Lough while riding. All much go every year..
Vacation spots are full of Roller Costers. Be careful if you bring children under 5 years old, they won't necessarily be suitable for the rides.

Brought my little one to Universal Studios Singapore on a weekend and we managed to take amazing photos. I am thankful that USS Is child friendly and I could push her pram through the whole park. Will revisit again.
Best place for your kids, please note that the kid must be at least 5 years old. Otherwise, your kid won't enjoy the attraction.

A very awesome place for young kids and adults. There are many rides in this theme park. This theme park has four sections: 1. Rides 2. Shopping 3. Sea aquarium 4.Sentosa Resort There are many good rides in this place. But you might not want to go on that big roller coaster because many people will get dizzy. It is so dangerous for small kids to ride this. If you want to know about all the rides. You can directly go to sentosa world resorts website. Sea aquarium was very good and clean maintained. As there were many species to see. You might have to spend your time so short on one thing.

4.review_text: Rides are great and free. Must go for roller coasters and Egyptian tour. Be ready for a lot of walking. Not a pram friendly place.
Worth a visit especially for teenage kids, please take ticket in advance as they close the gate if the capacity is reached. One can take express pass on reaching the resort if there is a long lime
Worth the visit especially when with kids they will enjoy it. They had some rides to do since they couldn't ride the scarier roller coaster rides. Was great to see 4d shrek movie
Spent a great half-day there. Was super fun but the rides are rather for kids. Organization and food supply was good.

You can enjoy the adventure with your family. We strongly recommend making an express reservation online in advance. Jurassic Adventure can be covered in water - it is a more intense adventure than in Korea.

5.review_text: Make a holiday with children okay

Holidays with my children who are excited to try the rides available at Universal Studios Singapore, but because of the school holiday season the queues for tickets and entry to each ride are incredibly long, almost 1 hour more to queue. I suggest bringing an umbrella or raincoat because not all queues have a roof, and the season in Singapore is unpredictable, the hot heat can turn into heavy rain, there are several rides you should use waterproof footwear, or you will go back to the hotel with soaked shoes and socks
Fun place to spend time with kids. Better buy tickets online and in advance. Express lane tickets are also worth to buy if you dont want to waste time in the long waiting line.

Children under 4 years old should not go yet. Because it's large - hot and quite tiring. Some 8/10 games are limited to the child's height. You should research carefully before buying tickets. Tickets are also reasonable for the money spent. However, the best time to go is 14pm - 6pm. Going early is very crowded, queuing is tiring and drains a lot of energy. You should bring drinking water with you, because it will be more economical and delicious and cleaner, so you won't have to travel to buy water If the area is a bit live, just come back and play later, don't try to queue for a while. In the first part, I waited in line for 70 minutes - after 2 hours, I just went in to play. Very very fast!! In general, next time I will go again because I have money Love Singapore
Excellent rides for thrill seekers. Folks with very young kids (less than 6 year olds) should avoid it.

1.review_text: If your wanting too go on the bigger rides, I wouldn't go today as they pretty much all closed hahah waste of money I guess unless you have younger kids

2.review_text: Well, too small for so many people. Complicated to handle... just take a look at Phantasialand in Cologne... that's how it works with the backpacks. Sorry... nice job but not good enough...

3.review_text: I was super excited take my 3 kids to Universal studios in Singapore but I felt it was not worth the excitement. There weren't that many excting rides to go on just average rides with long waiting times. There are beautiful surroundings for pictures and shops to buy things but overall my experience was just average. I would recommend to buy tickets in advance and plan your trip in advance to avoid disspointment at the entrance. We experienced that on a Saturday. I think it is pretty crowded on weekends. So it's good if you can avoid a weekend.
Hot, long queues for everything possible, relatively expensive food. But the kids had fun

4.review_text: If you want to take your children to play at last minute, it is recommended to buy tickets on travel platforms such as klook or kkday. The price difference is not big, but you may get meal vouchers when you buy tickets online. I have been to Universal Studios in Japan and the United States, and Singapore is really much smaller! If you are just taking your children and dont want to play any exciting rides, you dont necessarily need to buy a quick pass. Ps. The summer weather in Singapore is very hot all year round. You should drink more water and pay attention to the physical condition of yourself and your companions.

Went on a Sunday. I'm glad the park is open to all again. Might want to think of cooling spots for Parents to rest with kids. Restaurants Far far away Restaurants have far too few seats for the crowd that you would receive at an amusement park. Food is so so and expensive for what it is. Lol. Rides Are ok, if u have Vip access. Otherwise a 40 min queue for a 5 min-ride is, to me, not worth it. But that's just my opinion. Pls dont grill me for it..lol. Safety checks are excellent. Variety is good for all ages. Location Easily accessible and plenty of spots for picture taking, especially by the docks..(Hollywood Area) good spots to chill with Waterview. Notes for travellers: Bring a mini fan(one that can be attached to phones or powerbanks). Be in nice-looking clothes that are light. It is Singapore, humid. A little towel, a pair of sunnies or a hat. Parents- bring water bottles with ice for kids. Enjoy!!
A great place to spend time with the family. The place has many different rides and attractions. It also has a number of restaurants and eateries.
Great place for the family.. its fun and there are interesting rides. its quite busy during the weekday as well.. make sure you purchase the express ticket
Nothing much changed, rides and attractions barely changed. Still fun nonetheless, very accommodating to seniors and pwds. Easy transportation to and from Food options need more diversity though

5.review_text: Good place to visit with kidz. Nice to have express pass if you want to cover all rides

Best for family travel! Came on Friday so I was satisfied playing here with the kids. Almost all the rides were tested, except for the outdoor ones, some failed to ride because it suddenly rained. Even though I've been dreaming of flying on the Battlestar Galactica. I can only walk when I'm tired, around 6am when I'm about to close. Next trip! The strategy remains, go from the furthest first and focus indoors first.

Universal Studios Singapore is really small, and the crowds inside are not as crowded as in Japan. It is very comfortable to play. If you play hard, you can finish playing in the entire area and go to the show in a short time. It is really a park suitable for the whole family to play together. Outside the park, there are food trucks, shops, and restaurants, which are great for family travel. Because I have been to Universal Studios many times and they are all the same, so I didnt bother to take pictures at Universal Studios Sentosa this time and concentrated on playing

The place is beautiful and family-friendly. I advise everyone to buy Fast Pass tickets, because once we were separated without them, I expect you will wait more than an hour for each game. Most games are forbidden for pregnant women to play in. If a pregnant woman does not buy a Fast Pass, she will not benefit. As for children of a certain height, some games as well. I heard there were sites that sell tickets at a lower price, but I did not try them. I bought them at the gate and there was no waiting because it was self-service.
Good facilities for family Huge place and area But some places not active!

3.review_text: Avoid weekend and public holiday, manage to only go on 3 rides and if you have kids below 4 ensure to bring a stroller and carrier, Lastly do ensure to purchase the express pass in advance it was sold out on the day we went.
Its nice but quite expensive and small. If you avoid the weekend the waiting time is fine. You can do everything in a day. Food wise you can go outside, its a little cheaper
Nice to spend a different day It has only 4 "adult attraction" Too costly for what it offers but if you want to do something different,it is not that bad

4.review_text: For normal entry at-least we have to wait 1hr to enter each ride. Better enter through single ride. Too hot. If u r planning to go with baby then it is a bad idea.

Out of all universal parks in the world, this is not the best but still fun and what you make it We went knowing that after watching videos and reviews. I would give it a 6.5/10 for a day park. It's not a must do but great if you need to do something for the day in the Singapore area. Please note it is limited on attractions if it rains. I don't mean a sprinkle but downpour that an umbrella can't save you. (We loved it) The big rollar coaster takes forever to board compared to any roller coaster in the world and wins the worst smell on the b.o que. The mummy attraction is the best and a must do. Transformers was the popular attraction with a 50 min wait in September. The food was good and fresh for a theme park. (Keywords theme park) The cookie monster desserts were good. Other rides it was 10 to 30 min wait so not bad at all. Alot of cute photo ops. If you have kids, there is plenty to do. However, remember to plan around in case a surprise rain shower happens. Rain can be unpredictable in this climate and we knew that going in. Ladies, bring pads especially if you are late or think you skipped. They do not have anywhere or near the park. You will only be able to use toilet paper.
Good day out..but a lot under construction which they don't tell you about Great if you have young children.
Back here 3rd time, somehow the places show some aging especially the building. Anyway, still had lots of funs especially the children!
Very fun, tourist attraction, suitable for the whole family

5.review_text: Kids paradise, a must visit place in Singapore. Just be mindful of bringing water bottles for kids. Avoid long queues and go for rides towards end first. You can take umbrella to avoid sunburn and rain.

Universal studios Singapore is really good for families. Its not really big so is easy to ride all the atttactions. The best part is that most of the attraction wont have more than 20-30 minutes waiting time.

Beautiful Place in Singapore, Specially good for kids above 6 years, There is lot of walk while visiting universal studio, Lot of rides big & small, Beautiful live Street shows, Amazing 5D theatre, Great Animation, must visit place
Suitable for a family holiday, don't forget to bring lots of snacks

This place was just amazing!! I went there with my 2 kids (7 and 18) and they both had so much fun! There are lots of rides and stuff to do. The Queues are so short ( maximum 30 minutes). Both my kids loved the rollercoasters and were very sad to go home. There is a large variety of rides from slowly and small to extreme and fast which were perfect for kids any age. The food is so cheap and very tasty and we had lots of fun buying some souvenirs at the many shops. I hundred percent recommend this place and if you just read all of this: DO NOT GO THERE AND SAVE YOUR MONEY IT WAS THE WORST EXPERIENCE IVE EVER HAD!

3.review_text: The theme zoning is reasonable, but the circulation lines are very unclear. It takes a long walk to find that you have taken the wrong path or run to the exit of the facility. The toilets and smoking areas are clearly marked, which is more friendly to families traveling with children.
Very long waits, some are traumatizing rides for kids, most are boring, but very fun indeed! Go here pls if ur a teen or adult! (I recommend dont go here with kids to the mummy ride)

I think the name alone, the world-famous Universal Studios, is reason enough to visit, but since this was my second time, I didn't have great expectations. I think it would be a good idea to visit if you have children.

4.review_text: Good place to bring kids to for amusements and beach when in Singapore.

Universal Studios is a hot attraction and by hot, I mean popular but also HOT! There isnt a lot of shady spots and if you know Singapore, the heat is a scorcher. That said, Universal is still great for thrill seekers and those that are 6 and above. Young kids will still enjoy the sights, meet n greets and the shows but there wont be as many rides for them. Ride lines can be long too, so if you dont have some patience, youll be in for a hell of a ride. If you have been to Japan and visited Universal Studios, Im led to believe this is a lot smaller, a bit more outdated and not as fun, so manage your expectations. Its also definitely no Disneyland but once again, manage those expectations and youll have fun!
Overall it was a fun day with family.Very less rides for kids . Need to wait in queue for long which is a boring thing over here.

Superb place for family outing for people from all ages. Excellent rides and shows. Easy accessibility for all kind of individual. Wide range of food options. However park closes at 5pm which is too early in my opinion.

Nice place to spend the day. Couldn't go on many of the rides since my 5yr old daughter is too small for them.lots of areas being renovated. Gift shop and food is expensive inside,went a couple of rides with less wait time.

5.review_text: No visit to Singapore is complete without a visit to Universal Studios Singapore / USS. One of the most visited family tourist destinations, the games are fun, but there are some games that are not allowed for children under 100 cm tall. Transportation to USS is easy. It is recommended to buy entrance tickets online.

Great Place for enjoyment n rides... But don't bring kids under 4 years. Tickets are free for under 4 years but you can't bring on rides with you due to height requirement for them. unless you all go with friends and big family to takecare your kids while you go for rides...
suitable for young people
The atmosphere is good... suitable for families

It's the most happening place in Asia, I will recommend it you everyone , always pre-book tickets ...one day is not enough to cover everything , jurassic Park raide , mummy ride is awesome...ofcourse mummy ride not recommended for kids , stroller is needed for roaming with kids , it is advisable to bring drinking water bottle , we can refill, it's neat and clean everywhere, express pass tickets may be recommend in busy season

4.review_text: Very expensive Rides are good Children above 122 cm are eligible Indian restaurant ,Oasis spice food is very bad.. An insult to all Indians..very bad food and very expensive also..

Lovely place! In the heart of Sentosa, the rides are all of good quality and has a good balance of children friendly and adult friendly rides! Overall, the staff are also effective and efficient! Great experience!

Really enjoyed the day here at universal from rollercoasters to rapids. If you do intend to go on the water rides they do offer ponchos and air blowers which was so very handy. Loads of options on food and gift shops have many trinkets to remember the day.

5.review_text: USS is a must visit place in Singapore. Many fun and adventure activities to do. Kids love this place . Good place for family to enjoy and relax too as many shops are available after a long tiring day. Ticket are around S80 . Advisable to book in advance as the place might be too crowded and the ticket will sold out immediately.

Weekend getaway spot for singaporean is sentosa island. Universal studios in sentosa is perfect place to spend quality time with family especially kids. I would recommend you to purchase ticket in advance through pelago ( by singapore airlines) or klook etc. You have food trucks inside and malaysian hawker center as well. Dont miss rides such as mummy, transformers etc.

My son is amost 2 years, although he could not play the attraction but he really enjoyed the place, decoration and meet and greet with character. This place is kids friendly and has small shops inside for each theme. When he sleep, parents can switch to play attraction with Single rider

This was an awesome experience for not just my kid but also for us. Be prepared to walk. Also if you are thinking about not getting the Universal Express pass, then my suggestion is to get it. We took the normal tickets and had to wait for 60 mins for some attractions in a weekday. With the pass, you'd have a different queue with little to no wait time. Do visit as early as you can do that you can enjoy all the shows as well as the different meet and greet. If you are visiting Singapore, then Universal Studios is a must visit attraction.
An amusement park that is a landmark of Singapore, with rides that are both fun for children and thrilling. But if you go to Singapore, you shouldn't miss it.

3.review_text: A nice park to spend the day with children, if you like strong attractions I can tell you that there are only 2 in the park, the rest is for small children. If you have children it is ideal. The food inside the park is very expensive, a pizza with a drink 80.

Universal Studios Sentosa, while smaller than its counterparts, offers a pleasant theme park experience. With fewer rides, lines were manageable even on a weekday, peaking at around 40 minutes and dwindling later in the afternoon. I highly recommend buying tickets online in advance, because it is slightly cheaper to do so and you can buy a combo ticket package with other nearby attractions. We didn't find a need to buy the Express pass to skip lines, but it may be very useful during the holiday season and weekends. Despite a brief interruption due to rain and lightning, the adjacent aquarium provided a convenient and enjoyable diversion. Food and drinks are on the pricier side, but stumbling upon an unadvertised happy hour for drinks was a pleasant surprise. The policy of free lockers for an hour, with reasonable charges afterward, adds a practical perk. The park's cleanliness and organized lines contribute to a positive overall atmosphere. The staff's friendliness and helpfulness, combined with the variety of kid-friendly attractions, make Universal Studios Sentosa a great destination for families.
Beautiful sets but not much for adults to do. Great for kids though. Really nice immersive experience if you love Jurassic Park, Shrek, Sesame Street etc but its a bit small for 50 per adult ticket
