4.review_text: I went with my 3 years old child which i was not expecting a lots of activities for her to play. However, there were a lots that she could play and attended. Great time there!! However, there should be sign mentioned food allergens on the menu.

Encourage to buy tickets prior, and if upgrade is necessary, we could do it in the counter. Went on a weekday and decided to risk it by not upgrading, but luckily, it wasn't crowded, so it didn't make a difference between all day, express, or vip tickets. Went in as early as 10 am. The map gained through scanning the qr code was a little help to plan to meet and greets, rides, and shows. Advised to bring ponchos or raincoats and a change so it saves cos not to buy a poncho and queue up for dryer. Sunscreen cream, if needed and water bottles, will be good. Kids below 122cm should always be accompanied by parents otherwise you can leave your little ones to have a little adventure. Enjoyed the rides especially the sci fi was my favourite and fortunate to go twice. Toilets were ample.and clean, ample.finger food though pricey and minion ride will be an added adventure in 2024 as its under construction.

Okay, what I recommend is that you bring raincoats or umbrellas cause it rains sometimes. The timings are 10am to 9pm! it seems it went from 6pm to 9pm. Me and especially my family were aware that there were 24 rides ( might be more in the future ) so we got up early and arrived at 10:40 which was a very bad decision since the wait time at mornings are WAY more then in evenings. so I recommend going in afternoons or evenings since there's too much crowd in the mornings. The ride WORTH going is the transformers ride! It's very good and even me and my family went to ride it TWICE! don't worry about the height requirements of your child's cause even if they are short they just need to be accompanied by a Parent/Guardian. We finished most of the rides that we wanted to try by 7pm! Recommended rides : Transformers ride Mummy ride Accelilator ( it's not dizzy at all and you just need to keep your neck towards the seat so you have no pain! )
A suitable recreation place for children

The neat Universal Studio in the world with several theme parks inside. 1 day tour is enough for kids and parents, enjoying the facilities with the imagination you have from comics or movies. The weather is hot most of time, water refilling station is close to toilets or some designated locations. Some facilities are old with the renovation and some are brand new. Kids love transformers, minions and dinosaurs for sure. Queueing takes time for those pop and hot parks always. Be patient since some people do not enter the studio after 2 to 3pm. Just come and have 1 day tour for fun. Enjoy.

5.review_text: Beautiful place, worth a whole day with kids Most of the games for adults and children are 92 cm long, and the train and dangerous games are over 125 cm. In many restaurants I recommend downloading the application to get times for shows, games, and everything something Advice: Buy the express and save your head from the crowds There are two types, each game once, 100 Singapore dollars The multiple is 130 Singapore dollars

What a momrizing experience it was. Make sure to arrive early at 10 a.m to avoid long queue for rides. Not all rides are good for kids , make sure to choose which rides they can play by trying it first by yourself.

We went there on a Christmas Day, rainy but full of blessings.. Booked online as part of package (klook)... plenty of people in the afternoon but lesser towards closing time so were able to avail more rides during that time... safe to leave strollers and not so important things when going for rides/attractions.. plenty of eating, shopping and attration options... shows have time schedules so mark those you want to watch.. overall an excellent experience...
Nice to come and visit. Lots of activities for families with children. You should buy tickets quickly to avoid waiting.
I visited universal studio singapore with my kids and husband.. it was fun... need tO be there early morning so wE can stay allday and try all the rides..

1.review_text: It is not recommended for children under 6 years old to play. In addition to height restrictions, many amusement facilities are not suitable for stimulation.

4.review_text: Kid-Friendly Magic at Universal Studios Singapore Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic playground for kids. The colorful and immersive environment, filled with beloved movie characters, kept my little ones wide-eyed with wonder. The variety of rides and attractions were well-suited for different age groups, providing endless excitement. From meeting favorite characters to thrilling rides, the park offers a delightful mix of entertainment. While some queues were inevitable, the overall experience was seamless, and the staff's friendliness added to the positive atmosphere. Family-friendly dining options made it easy to refuel between adventures. Universal Studios Singapore is undeniably a great place for kids, offering a magical day out that balances thrills with enchanting moments. A solid four-star experience for family fun!

Visiting Universal Studios Singapore was a great experience all the fun and sometimes thrilling rides. This theme park is more suited for families. Most rides are not very thrilling but are fun. The only really thrilling ride was Battlestar galactica. This ride was a hit with two rides intertwining, one being a normal roller coaster and the other being a hanging roller coaster. The shows were quite impressive and entertaining especially the water world show which had amazing stunts and sounds. Overall this theme park is great for family fun but if you love thriller rollercoasters more then this theme park may not really for you.

Universal is great - exactly what you expect. I normally don't go on rides when I'm at parks like this with my kids, but I went on almost everything, and had a great time! The transformers ride was a hit with my boys, we went on at least 5 times - don't miss this one! Something for everyone.

We enjoyed universal studios. Was great being in off season as it resulted in us going on all rides we wanted and some twice. Gift shops we felt were lacking in interesting choices for but our young son was very happy with the stuffed toys! Adult things lacking. Ie options of shirts etc as memorabilia. Not as much as universal in America and mostly rides based but we did enjoy.

Great place for kids. The rides are amazing. You can easily spend a day here and lot of nice places to eat. Be prepared for sudden rains, would definitely recommend an umbrella or a raincoat from one of the stores. The places to eat were pretty good. The best rides were Cyclone and Jurassic park. Far far away is a lot of fun for kids. Dont miss the water world show, its awesome. Overall a great place but would highly recommend getting an express pass as the wait can get quite frustrating.

5.review_text: It is an entertainment mecca. From blockbuster, thrill rides to shows that light up the night, there's something for everyone, and I would recommend going. Just make sure to do some research and plan your trip, especially if it's a packed one. Take into consideration, Even with their parents, infants are not permitted on any of the rides. Children under five are also not given much appreciation.
Vacation with kids

A super awesome place in Sentosa. Plenty of rides and shows. I highly recommend the place. Aware of the height restrictions if you are traveling with your child. And free entry for kids below 4 years old.

OK so I'm a 50 mum of two strapping boys, thought I'd be a bag-minder for the day BUT NO I went on quite a few of the rides and loved every minute! It's a fantastic day out, would recommend it to anyone. So well organised, clean, efficient and friendly - everything we know the Singaporeans do so very well! It's a quality theme park. Just go. Get the express pass and enjoy. It's really worth it.

We enjoyed all the theme parks and rides though the long queue takes a lot of our time. What I like the most is the THE MUMMY ride. I'm amazed by the effects, it's soo artistic. And the roller coaster rides. Im more shocked at the fact that there are kids who can ride it and seem unfazed after. I think i cussed and shouted a lot during my ride. I will never forget that ride. There's a lot of free rides so if you're gonna visit its better to check them all. Try the spaghetti rides for a warm up then the transformer(fyi, you can take your glasses off if you're too afraid of the effects, just dont drop them). We enjoyed our visit and the weather that day was great.

1.review_text: There are too many facilities that children cannot play in. It is not recommended to bring children under elementary school. Some facilities that can be played inside may frighten children. Can I ride a small roller coaster that is 92 centimeters long? And no explanation of what a roller coaster is? (Is this a mainland term? Not all Chinese-speaking countries know the term), and there is no reference video? Universal Studios certification standards are so weird The child was so frightened that his entire trip abroad was disrupted. He woke up crying every day from nightmares and was so scared that he lost his mind... I was frightened twice when I returned to Taiwan...I was scared to death. I can only say dont go there again, and you cant play anything. Its a waste of money.
For children under 10 years old

3.review_text: It was okay, not too wow as only a few rides for adult thats exciting, the other half was mainly for kids. Now however, Starbucks experience was very bad!! We ordered ice americano but had to wait 30mins because they prioritised online app order.

4.review_text: Superb to take kids along .. it's a amusement park .. Rides for kids, adults and both. Walking is too much there so need to carry sports shoes compulsory and food along.

Universal Studios Singapore offers an exhilarating experience for visitors of all ages, boasting a diverse array of attractions that cater to both kids and adults alike. From thrilling rides to beloved character encounters, there's something for everyone to enjoy. For adrenaline-seeking adults, attractions like the Transformers Ride, The Mummy roller coaster, The Lost World and the sci-fi roller coaster provide heart-pounding excitement and immersive experiences. These rides offer a perfect blend of thrills and entertainment, leaving guests craving for more. Meanwhile, for the younger ones, Universal Studios Singapore offers an enchanting world filled with their favorite characters. From the whimsical world of Shrek to the mischievous antics of the Minions, kids are treated to memorable encounters and interactive experiences that ignite their imagination and spark joy. Among the standout attractions for kids are the Trolls, Shrek, and Minions experiences, which are not only entertaining but also educational and interactive. These attractions provide a perfect balance of fun and learning, ensuring that children have a truly magical and unforgettable time at Universal Studios Singapore. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore stands out as a must-visit destination for families, offering a thrilling and immersive experience that will create cherished memories for years to come. Whether you're a thrill-seeker or a young adventurer, there's no shortage of excitement and wonder to be found within its gates.

Worth every penny paid. All unique rides and experiences. Take your kids if they are at least 5 years old. Always check yours kid's height before deciding whether its worth for you to take them there. Height restrictions are given for each ride on Universal website and app.
A great place for families and children to enjoy. A good time as long as you avoid the time.

An essential thing to visit in Singapore if you go with children. It is a not very large theme park located on the island of Sentosa. It has good metro access to the walkway that crosses the island, which is shaded and about 15 or 20 minutes walk from the access to the park. They are attractions from the Universal studio, among which Jurassic Park, Shrek, Transformers stand out... We had a great day and gave our son a great surprise with the visit.

5.review_text: We literally spent the entire day on this fun place. I like this better than Disneyland. Lots of fun ridea appropriate for age. Universal Studios Singapore has great organization, safety and really shows they care about the customer's welfare. Line could be long but have notice before getting in line. Food and beverage stalls are ubiquitous. Restaurants are great. Attractions are fun and good for families. Very friendly staff.
What can i say, it's a paradise for children and adults alike. Only recommendation is to buy express pass single entry (not multiple) to all rides, only then you can enjoy everything.

I was a great outing for the whole family. It was a weekday, therefore less crowded. I would recommend to come in early so that you can try all the 'must-try' rides..as when it's approaching midday it can be scorching hot. The were a lot of food options, from I fian,Asian to the good old burger. Taste wise..it was okay. Overall it was an awesome day.
It is very fun and suitable for bringing children. If the children dare to play, they can ride on the roller coaster.
We have privilege of enjoying VIP experience, much recommended, the tour guide was excellent! Experiences and shows were great! Its a must visit specially if you have kids!

3.review_text: It was mix experience,good and bad both.less happening for under 4 years old kids.expected more.not much to see and do under 4 years old kids.Even for the adults roller costers only for fun.

4.review_text: Playgrounds are suitable for children and adults
Good place to visit with family. Lots to do!
Visiting among these days is a good choice,as visitors dont need to wait for a long time experiencing almost all rides!
Nice and clean park. Fine rollercosters. Some of the themes/movie universes a bit old. Not too many people.

5.review_text: One of the best place to bring the kids when in singapore, just make sure to check their height before hand so to know if they can do the numerous rides.
A good place to travel with your significant other or children
Good for kids and even for Adults, the rides are safe, exciting. Lot to walk.
It's a place where kids will find a lot of happiness. Many kinds of activities can be explored. Transformers 4D, Flying Dinosaur are some to mention.
Universal Studios Singapore..a place with various kinds of toys..fun..beautiful..interesting..very excited..

3.review_text: I have a mixed opinion. Of course kids will enjoy Jurassik Park or Far far away areas. But the park is very small with not a lot of rides for small children (5 and under). A lot of queues, or you have to purchase the fast past ticket. But in that case, the price is twice !!! And I did not accept that the Park advertises on Minions and Naruto whereas there is no ride at all for these characters. I put 3 stars and not less only for the Waterworld show which is really amazing
Great place to spend a day quality time with family, unfortunately for vegetarian foods is tasted awful for something at 16 IMO.

4.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore has very nice rides for small kids. There is a ride I personally like which is a 3D transformers experience. It give you a very nice experience of what it feels like to be in that moment, the seat moves around like youre flying across the room. The tickets are about 90 Singaporean Dollars per person with very overpriced food which I personally think is kind of highway robbery. Overall experience I give is an incredible 4 stars.

Good place..lots to walk.good footwear & umbrella is a must unless u r thickskin literally. Every ride has a more than 1 hour wait.& 2 rides wer cancelled by the time our turn came due to technical fault in the ride.Dats dangerous cant take a chance. Basically go look around take pics Eat/ drink if u can.For rides..wait whole day 1 after the otherQ. One visit is fine.Dont bring parents if old & difficulty walking.Small kids can b managed in a pram/ trolley.

I remember it being difficult because there were so many people and it was so hot;; Although it is small, it seems like a worthwhile place. If you go diligently, you can try many different rides. The rides are definitely very fun, and the shows are of very high quality. If you work hard, you won't waste money I don't know if the kids are older, but it seems a bit difficult for younger kids. I think it's good that they put the express service in first
Universal studios Singapore is alright, though I felt like it is very small as compared with Universal studios LA. Nice place to spend a day with family.
Children under 7 years old have nothing to do. Rent strollers

5.review_text: A MUST VISIT WHEN YOU GO TO SINGAPORE. Universal studios has a wide range of rides including roller coasters & other shows that are fun to watch. There are rides and shows for every age group, right from the 5 year old to 85 years old. For kids under the age of 5, it may not be a great place to visit if rides is the purpose of visit. Most of the rides require a minimum height which mostly comes after the age of 5. Universal studios itself is a great place to check out if you have small kids and/or you are not so keen for rides. Do carry your caps and a water bottle (If you do not want to buy water after every ride LOL) to protect yourself from all the heat and to keep the body hydrated.

I had so much fun visiting with my family. It is super busy on the weekend so I would suggest you getting the express lane pass. My son loved meeting the team from Seseme Street and getting a photo with them. The Grover Space ride was super fun and visiting Shrek in his castle was a highlight. I enjoyed the roller coasts too. Highly recommend visiting when you visit Sentosa Island during your stay in Singapore.
A wonderful place for visiting with families and special for kids .... Love universal studio Singapore
A must see/do attraction in Singapore. A fun filled day for our family and the place is extremely clean. And the staff are so happy and helpful.
A must visit place during holiday in Singapore Here we can enjoy full day activity with all family

3.review_text: Kids can enjoy some rides and mostly adult can only enjoy and can ride, but the waiting time for rides ll make u think do u really need to go ahhhhhh but I have to tell these rides are worth the visit some shows were there which can be seen according to the timing but ya can be enjoyed by all, and the less stars for the works and upgradation going inside some areas in the USS.

If you are willing to travel out of your country with your children a must visit place for young tiny tots. From Jurassic Park to Egyptian to many more Disney characters related them park and restaurants and lots of places to dine and shop till you drop plus lots of swing and rides to choose from... You will not feel bored here just make sure to reach here as early as possible if you don't wanna skip any place....

4.review_text: Lot of walking around.wear a good shoe.rides are good. Veg food options are less.carry ur own food for kids.u need 5 to 6 hours in the place.carry an empty bottle to fill drinking water or in shop its 4 sgd

Excited place if your kids are between 4 to 11 yrs. One would enjoy more if the weather is pleasant, otherwise waiting in the queues could be a torture. Food, beverages and souvenirs are very very expensive.
Good and nice place for kids
Good options for rides and 3d shows. Smaller as compared to Disney in Hongkong. Transformers 7d show was best.
Recommended. More for children aged 6 and over.

5.review_text: Best place to explore in Singapore for Kids and Youngsters. Weekend use Express pass for least waiting
Of course, Kids loves Universal Studios. For elderly parents, some walking is required and they are many shows to watch and relax. For Veg, you have veg briyani option near Mummy zone.
Extremely good especially with kids...take express entry on weekends...weekdays normal tickets are fine

Life is short. Go have fun. We have to do what we want to do, enjoy life to the fullest. No regrets coming to Universal Studios Singapore. It was fun and magical, for all the kids, young and old. Thanks for the memories.

Universal Studios Singapore offers an immersive and thrilling experience with its diverse themed zones and exciting rides, making it a hit for families and thrill-seekers alike. Visitors appreciate the park's cleanliness, helpful staff, and variety of attractions, despite occasional long wait times.

3.review_text: Jitna hype kiya hai utna khas nahi hai. Less rides .for small kids no rides.roller coaster ke alwa kuch achha nahi hai. Costly too
Too many people. More for kids

4.review_text: Carry their online map, easy to navigate...great place to spend a while day if ur into adventure and thrilling rides...kids aged below 5 have very few rides ...
Most of the rides inside are free. If u have done universal studios in USA or some other place u can skip !! Lots of restaurants .. stuff for kids to purchase ...!!

Totally loved it, was able to catch up on 4-5 rides. My husband and I took turns to ride as we had a baby of 2.5 years. Most rides get free after 4 pm and the weather also gets pleasant. During 11 to 2 the sun was hot as hell. Had bought the tickets directly at the kiosks outside the entrance.
A good one to enjoy with all aged family members

5.review_text: We had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore I have 4 and 2 years old we were really happy most of the rides have height restrictions of 92cm and above so we all enjoyed and got on the rides more than 3 times as it wasnt busy on a Tuesday. My kids felt sad as we left the country but definitely we will be back.

Universal Studio Singapore is a wonderful place to visit along with your kids and family. Fun place to be. You will require a minimum of two days to completely visit all the places/rides/activities. However, if you are carrying Premium/Express pass, then you can cover maximum numbers of rides in a single day and that is more convenient also. I also suggest that, one should plan out the things, much in advance by downloading the Universal Studio Singapore app. One should refer to the map and plan the visit to various rides accordingly. It will save much more time. Enjoy your trip...!!!
Great experience with family especially with young and teenagers.

I was there on a weekday, and it was crowded! The admission line was pretty fast though, the staff were very helpful and attentive. The park was not that big, a single day admission is enough to try out everything. The food was expensive as expected but we were so hungry that we did not mind. We had lunch at the diner near the entrance, and it was pretty good. Navigating the park can be really challenging with a toddler especially how hot it was. Make sure to use a sunblock, bring portable fan and an insulated tumbler!
I definitely recommend it to families with children. There is so much to see and it is great for making precious memories with family. Recommended for November, December, January, February

3.review_text: The relatively small Universal World has five major themed areas. I recommend the Transformers and Egyptian roller coasters, and the Jurassic classic float boat. They are also fun but not very exciting. Universal Studios Singapore was the best experience we've ever had. We visited with our 2-year-old child, and from the entrance to the end, we had an incredible time. The theme park offers a variety of attractions and entertainment suitable for all ages, making it a perfect destination for families. We went on a Sunday, and while it was a bit crowded, the overall excitement and fun overshadowed the wait times, which sometimes reached up to 90 minutes. The park's design and attention to detail are impressive, creating an immersive experience that keeps you entertained throughout the day. Despite the crowds, the experience was well worth it. The staff were friendly and helpful, adding to the positive atmosphere. For anyone considering a visit, we highly recommend Universal Studios Singapore. Just be prepared for possible long lines, especially on weekends.

Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination for all ages, offering thrilling rides, entertaining shows, and immersive attractions based on popular movies and TV shows. The park is well-maintained, with friendly staff and diverse dining options. A must-visit for a fun-filled day in Singapore!
Fun times - family times . Shows and rides all come together to bring an exhilarating time to all - young and old . The parade by the characters at the end of the evening was just super !

Universal Studios Singapore is hugely better than the Disney franchises that I have been to. Yes you are bombarded with every movie character, but at least there is choice and variety and not just a mouse with black ears! This theme park is incredibly clean and well run. I visited outside of the school holidays which definitely made the trip that much more pleasant and easy to navigate. Getting there via MRT was awesome. Another credit to the the super-efficient Singaporean government. And once you were in the Universal Studios park area, it seemed spacious, clean and lots to look at and do. There are so many rides (for all ages) and I have to say, I had a blast with my wife and seven year old son. One tip: pay for the premium ticket. Lines are long and it is worth every cent to not hang around and spend your time doing things. I ate at the Hawker's Market which was really inexpensive and actually pretty good. A great family day with so many good memories. Do it!

My strong advise is to buy Express pass to avoid really really really long queues which may go from 60 mins upto 120 minutes in a intense humid day. Most rides are prioritised for Express pass holder which is really frustrating to wait and see them passing quickly and standard ticket holders being neglected and delayed almost in some rides. Pls be mindful that most of the big attractions are not for children below 4 years (height wise) so I dont recommend really to go with kids of that age as apart from gift shops, there is nothing really for them. Transformer Ride 4. Waterworld Hollywood Live show 5. Light Camera & Action Show

Universal Studios is a magical experience, offering a perfect blend of excitement, adventure, and immersive entertainment. It is filled with filmy entertainment, rides that give you adrenaline rush, truly fun activities for kids. Perfect for a day having fun with family and friends, this theme park has something special for everyone. The park is divided into various themed zones, each transporting you into a different cinematic universe. From the glitzy streets of Hollywood to the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City, the attention to detail is impeccable. Walking through these zones feels like stepping into the movies themselves. The vibrant colors, iconic landmarks, and thematic music all contribute to an immersive atmosphere that captivates visitors from the moment they step in. It offers a wide variety of rides that cater to different age groups and thrill levels. The twists, turns, and inversions deliver an adrenaline rush that is hard to match. The Transformers: The Ride is an absolute highlight. This 3D dark ride combines cutting-edge technology with immersive storytelling to create an exhilarating experience that leaves you on the edge of your seat. For families with younger children, the Madagascar: A Crate Adventure boat ride and Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase offer fun and excitement without being too intense. These rides are beautifully designed with vibrant characters and engaging storylines, making them enjoyable for both kids and adults. The live shows at Universal Studios Singapore are not to be missed. The WaterWorld show, in particular, is a spectacular performance filled with high-octane stunts, pyrotechnics, and special effects. The cast is incredibly talented, and the show is packed with action from start to finish. Its a thrilling experience that keeps you on the edge of your seat. In addition to the shows, the character meet-and-greets are a big hit, especially with the younger visitors. Meeting iconic characters like Shrek, the Minions, and the cast of Madagascar adds an extra layer of magic to the day. The food options within the park are diverse, catering to various tastes and dietary preferences. Whether youre in the mood for a quick snack or a sit-down meal, theres something for everyone. The themed restaurants, not only serve delicious food but also add to the overall immersive experience. Prices are what youd expect in a theme park, but the quality and variety make it worth it. The staff at Universal Studios Singapore are friendly, helpful, and go out of their way to ensure that visitors have a smooth and enjoyable experience. Even on busy days, they manage the crowds efficiently, and the queues for rides move at a reasonable pace. Tips: Get there early to utilise full day and enjoy all attractions. The Express Pass can be a good investment on busier days, helping you skip the lines and enjoy more attractions. Dont forget to bring sunscreen, as much of the park is outdoors. Also, bring a pair of fresh clothes if youre planning on enjoying all water rides or buy ponchos from nearby stores in the park to protect yourself from getting wet. Most likely you will which is another kind of fun. A fresh pair of clothes will come in handy in these situations or if it rains.
Place for kids and adults

Waiting times for popular rides such as Battlestar Galactica and Transformers can be as long as an hour, especially if you have a standard ticket. Despite the crowds, the shows at Universal Studios Singapore are always spectacular and worth watching. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fun-filled day for the whole family. From heart-pounding rides to entertaining shows, there is something for everyone to enjoy. So grab your friends and family and head to Universal Studios Singapore for a day of fun and adventure.

If youre accustomed to theme parks in the USA, particularly the ones in Orlando, this park may feel quite small in comparison. As an adult, I wouldnt necessarily say its worth the visit unless youre here with children. For kids, however, its a different story. The park is very child-friendly, and all the rides, including the roller coasters, are designed specifically with younger visitors in mind. You wont find anything too extreme or thrilling, but the attractions are still engaging and fun for the little ones. What I did enjoy was the ambiance and how beautifully the park is built. The architecture and layout are thoughtfully designed, creating a charming and immersive atmosphere. The surrounding scenery adds to the overall experience, making it pleasant for a stroll even if you dont go on the rides. The pathways, landscaping, and themed areas really make the park feel magical, especially when taking your time to explore. In short, its definitely worth a visit if youre traveling with kids wholl appreciate the rides and attractions. As an adult, while the rides may not be the highlight, the overall setting and walkability of the park can still make it an enjoyable outing.

A great experience with varied rides, ideal for alternating between thrills and calmer attractions. A little disappointed by the merch which does not offer many things for older children, there are not enough clothes sold or diversity in the products. Additionally, there could be more food stalls (like ice cream vendors, waffles, etc.) and places to sit (especially in case of rain). Apart from all that, I had a great day in this park which is really magnificent. The Waterworld show is really worth it, the mummy attraction is really great, however I strongly recommend that you take the express pass otherwise you will wait 1h-1h30 for each attraction.

Universal Studios Singapore is a thrilling and immersive theme park experience that caters to all ages. The park boasts an impressive array of rides, shows, and attractions inspired by popular Hollywood movies and television shows. One of the highlights is the immersive experience offered by the themed zones. From the adrenaline-pumping thrills of Transformers: The Ride to the charming world of Madagascar, each zone transports visitors into their favorite fictional universes. The attention to detail is remarkable, with meticulously crafted sets, vibrant costumes, and engaging characters that bring the worlds to life. While the park is known for its thrilling rides, there's also a good balance of attractions for those who prefer a more relaxed experience. The WaterWorld show is a spectacular display of stunts and pyrotechnics, while the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase offers a gentler ride for younger visitors. The park also offers a variety of dining options, from casual eateries to themed restaurants, ensuring that everyone can find something to satisfy their taste buds. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination for a day of fun and excitement. With its wide range of attractions, engaging shows, and immersive themed zones, it's a truly unforgettable experience for the whole family.

It saves you from the long queues, ensuring you get the most out of your visit. Without it, the wait times can be quite long, especially on weekends and holidays. Overall, it was a fantastic and memorable experience! **Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun-filled day in Singapore!

4.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore: Fun for Kids, But Expect Some Hiccups Universal Studios Singapore definitely offers a vibrant and exciting day out, particularly if you have kids in tow. The park is beautifully themed, and seeing characters like the Minions and Optimus Prime in real life brings a genuine sense of wonder to young faces. My children were absolutely thrilled by the Madagascar: A Crate Adventure boat ride and the Puss in Boots' Giant Journey suspended coaster when they were actually running. Unfortunately, our visit was significantly impacted by ride closures. The tropical climate of Singapore meant that several outdoor rides were temporarily shut down due to rain, which is understandable. However, we were also disappointed to find a noticeable number of attractions undergoing maintenance, further limiting our options. This was a real shame, especially for my kids who had been eagerly anticipating certain experiences. Despite the reduced ride availability, there was still enough to keep us occupied for a good portion of the day. The shows were entertaining, and the various themed zones offered plenty of photo opportunities and character meet-and-greets. The Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, even with the potential for getting soaked, was a definite highlight for the whole family. Food and beverage options within the park are plentiful, albeit on the pricier side, which is to be expected in a theme park. The staff were generally friendly and helpful, doing their best to manage the crowds and provide information about ride statuses. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a good experience, especially if your primary focus is entertaining younger children. The park has a unique charm and some genuinely fun attractions. However, the high likelihood of rain-related closures and the potential for maintenance disruptions mean it's not a guaranteed seamless experience. Would I say it's a must-visit in Singapore? Probably not. While we had a good time, the ride closures dampened the overall value proposition. If you have limited time in Singapore and prioritize must-see attractions, there might be other experiences that offer a more reliable and complete experience. However, if you have a few days, are traveling with kids who are big fans of the Universal franchises, and are prepared to be flexible with your itinerary due to potential ride disruptions, then Universal Studios Singapore can be a worthwhile one-time visit. Just be sure to check the park's website for any scheduled maintenance beforehand and be prepared to embrace the possibility of rain delays.

Certainly not a bad Universal park, but it's very small and on a quiet day (like when we visited) you can do almost everything in 2 or 3 hours. I guess that's not bad as it allows you to get back to your time in Singapore, but it's a quick visit.

Universal Studios Singapore is not a big place. We finished our breakfast lazily in the morning and entered the park at 11 o'clock. By 2 o'clock, we had already played everything we wanted to do. We definitely have time to play it again. Bags will not be checked at the entrance of the park, so you can bring drinks and food into the park to save time eating at the restaurant. If you have time, you can look at the program schedule and find the performance you want to see. This time, I happened to encounter the parade of the mini corps after playing the mobile game. I can dance with them and take pictures. It is also very surprising and fun. The only pity is that the show at Future Water World is closed that day, and one of the roller coasters is also undergoing repairs, so it cannot be played.

Nice park with quite some rides and activities. Every once in a while there are also performances, music, dancing and the minions walking around. Huge gift shops but few and a Bit pricey places to eat. The minions orange sorbet - vanilla ice cream is awesome!! Try it!! Overall, recommended.
Excellent for adults and kids but needs planning and prioritization to cover in a day especially without express pass. Pizza place serves good veg pizza. Misses the studio ride from California

5.review_text: A magical experience at Universal Studios Singapore! We had an unforgettable day, especially with our 4-year-old son. From the moment we entered, we were immersed in the world of beloved movies and characters. The park is incredibly well maintained, and the staff were friendly and welcoming, making our experience smooth and enjoyable. The rides were suitable for all ages, and my son had an absolute blast. He loved the Sesame Street characters, especially meeting Elmo and Big Bird, which was a dream come true for him. We also enjoyed the interactive play areas that were perfect for his age. The Jurassic Park area was another highlight, with exciting attractions that were thrilling for both adults and children. Although some of the larger rides might have been a bit too intense for younger kids, there were plenty of milder attractions like the Madagascar ride, which was a great fit for our little one. What really stood out was how family-friendly the park is. There are many child-friendly facilities, including spacious baby changing rooms and stroller rentals, which made it so convenient for us as parents. The food options were diverse, catering to all tastes and dietary preferences. The highlight of the day was the parades and shows, which kept my son entertained with vibrant costumes, music, and performances. Even if youre not a huge theme park fan, Universal Studios Singapore offers a full day of fun for the whole family.

Universal Studios Singapore truly lives up to its reputation as an exceptional theme park. From heart-pounding rides to captivating shows, it offers an unforgettable experience for all ages. Rides: The rides are simply awesome! I was particularly blown away by the Transformer ride a truly immersive and thrilling experience. The Minion and Shrek rides were also fantastic, providing a perfect blend of fun and entertainment. It's important to note that most rides require a minimum height of 102cm, so keep that in mind if you're traveling with young children. Shows: The shows are a major highlight! The outdoor dances, meet-and-greets, and other performances are incredibly engaging and well-executed. The Dinosaurs show is so realistic, it felt like we were witnessing actual prehistoric creatures! For children under 102cm, there are still plenty of opportunities to enjoy the shows from comfortable, stationary seating. Kid-Friendly Fun: My child absolutely adored the Minions and the meet-and-greet sessions. While the rides have height restrictions, the park offers a variety of shows and attractions suitable for younger children. Management and Amenities: The management of Universal Studios Singapore is truly commendable. Parking is well-organized, food options are diverse and delicious, and the park is impeccably clean. The overall organization and attention to detail are top-notch, making the entire experience seamless and enjoyable. The charges are fair for the level of entertainment provided. Overall: Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination. The combination of thrilling rides, captivating shows, and excellent management makes it an unforgettable experience for everyone. I highly recommend it to families, couples, and anyone looking for a day of pure fun and excitement.

Universal Studio Singapore has amazing theme rides and fund activities.It is smaller than I expected but we had a great time here.It is better to visit here during weekdays around 10 am because it is getting crowded later on.The rides are safe and highly recommended for family and couple bonding.There are lots of drinkable water fountains in most entrances of every ride.They also offer 45 minutes to 90 minutes free storage depending on the rides, like Human, Cyclone, the Mummy Returns. I highly recommend the Mummy Returns and the Transformers ride.
Happy experience, kid friendly.
Best and best place to visit with kids , friends and family highly recommended

3.review_text: Made a mistake by visiting here with my 2 year old child.. most of the rides are for adults
Not as big as expected, like Disneyland, with limited rides. Definitely try the Jurassic Park ride and Human vs. Cyclones ride. The shows were not good, even for children.

4.review_text: A fantastic place. All of the younger staff are very accommodating to wheelchair users, going above and beyond with their kindness. The rides all have accessible lanes, there's ample seating, locker rooms are provided to store your things for free for the first 45 minutes if you need to get on a ride that requires it. Lines are unbearable for popular rides, even on a weekday, makes sense because of the popularity and the fun factor. Not too big of a park, but just enough to get your fill of family fun time. Naturally there's gift shops, moderately priced for their quality.

Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic place with so many rides and attractions to enjoy. The park is spacious, and there are plenty of staff members around to welcome and guide visitors. There are also small shows and performances, especially great for young kids. However, because the park is very large, it can get quite hot when walking around. Resting areas are available, but unfortunately, most of them dont have cooling systems, which makes it a bit uncomfortable during hot days. Overall, its a fun experience, but be prepared for the heat!

Hmmm... nice place... But I don't know why I felt bore after an hour visiting this place.. Many rides and shows are there.. You will.need a whole day to explore this place. But other then 2or 3 Shows and 2 or 3 rides.. rest are for ages 3 to 9.. elders will easily get bored.
Excellent day out with the family, Be prepared for wait times on rides & use the app to monitor

A must visit for children and adults who are big fan of universal movies. It's well planned and organised. We were recommended to down load the map so that we know where to go next and we don't miss any rides. Will recommend to carry your umbrellas as a rain coat (for the rapid ride in the Jurassic park theme) and do the ride without the shoes or else you will need to walk the rest of the park either bare foot or with wet shoes. The only let down was the impolite behavior of the staff at some of the rides. Vegan and Vegetarian food options are very hard to find so do carry your own pack of food.

5.review_text: Come here on a weekday and get here early. We were able to go on the BSG rides 3 times with minimal crowds. Pick your go to rides and go there first without clicking around photos. We did the Mummy, Transformers and BSG rides and only then did we slow down. Best part of Singapore for the kids.

Our first visit to Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience, especially for our three kids aged 12, 11, and 6. Right from the entrance, the parks energy pulled them ineach one found something they loved. The younger one was enchanted by the Madagascar zone and the gentle Crate Adventure boat ride, while the older two were all about the thrillzooming straight for Transformers: The Ride and the Revenge of the Mummy coaster. Far Far Away was a family favorite, with the Shrek 4-D Adventure and the impressive castle making everyone feel like part of a fairy tale. What made the day truly special was how the park managed to cater to all their ages so seamlessly. While the older kids got their adrenaline fix on rides like Battlestar Galactica and Canopy Flyer, there were plenty of fun, age-appropriate attractions for our youngest toolike King Juliens Beach Party-Go-Round and Dino-Soarin. We also appreciated the clean, family-friendly spaces, quick service, and the kindness of the staff. The kids didnt stop smiling all day, and we left with tired feet, full hearts, and a promise to come back again.
Best attraction in singapore. We can enjoy with family. My daughter enjoy minion land. Their parade is also good.

Fantastic amusement park for the whole family. If possible, it's best to visit on a weekday to avoid long queues for attractions. The cost is quite high but it is definitely worth it. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Singapore with their family

Must visit place. Better visit in week days. Also take express tickets if you re going to visit with your children. Because some of the rides have waiting time about one hour for normal tickets. (Dont ask me about the rides...)

1.review_text: Are there people who come to reserve a queue for other people? Reserve a queue for a family of 5-6 Indians in front of them. They said that this is Singapore.

3.review_text: Perfect place for kids, not much for adults If you are seeking fun with no kids you better head to a different universal studio like Orlando or even Disneyland but so not worth in Singapore

If you're familiar with Universal Studios from the US, you'll be a bit disappointed, as the park is obviously much smaller. We weren't that impressed, except for two or three attractions. It's certainly great for children and teenagers, but not so much for adults without children. We had an express pass, which wasn't really necessary.

4.review_text: Its a diff experience if you go with young kids, teenagers, as a couple or solo. The park is huge and they have decent attractions that are updated periodically. Check on their website about which ones to go for. Many rides have age/height restrictions for kids, so do check before getting in the line. Its a commercial and expensive place, they have strategically placed toys and other things that kids would want you to buy. So be prepared. Ample eateries, water and toilets are available. Id highly recommend buying their VIP pass if you can afford it. Average waiting time for good rides is 30-60 mins. And standing in the queue tires you quickly in Singapore heat. Id recommend wearing good sandals or waterproof shoes for few rides. They have paid lockers available in some places. We enjoyed Transformers and shreks show.

Spacious place But the temperature is reasonably hot. There isn't much shelter from the sun. Most of the rides are simulators and are not suitable for children. Not suitable for walking and relaxing, suitable for serious play.
It is only a small park, great if you take kids. A couple of roller coaster rides are good, but the lines are long. Get the fast pass.
Very cool place to visit with your family and kids,the younger ones will surely enjoy the lively environment and the themes,the only drawback was the heat overall a good experience
Nice to visit for adults and kids

5.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore is one of the best entertainment destinations for families with children. The park offers many attractions inspired by popular films, and its various themed zones mean that everyone will find something for themselves. Attractions for children This place was created for the youngest! Many attractions are adapted for children, and meetings with cartoon characters add magic to the entire visit. However, it is worth checking whether a given attraction is suitable for your child before entering - the staff does not always pay attention to this, which can result in an unpleasant surprise. Queues and VIP tickets Some attractions are very popular, which means long queues. It is possible to buy a VIP ticket, which allows you to use priority entry, but in my opinion it is not worth overpaying for this privilege - it is better to plan your visit to avoid the largest crowds. Rollercoasters and thrills The park offers amazing rollercoasters that provide a solid dose of adrenaline. Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. is especially worth trying. CYLON, which is one of the most exciting rollercoasters in Asia. Planning your day and returning You can spend practically the whole day at Universal Studios Singapore, but it is worth leaving a little earlier to avoid long lines for the return train. The park is very dynamic - there are many shows and performances on the streets, so there is always something going on. To sum up, Universal Studios Singapore is a great place for a family trip, full of excitement and unforgettable attractions. However, it is worth planning your visit well to avoid long waits and unpleasant surprises. If you like fun and movie atmosphere, this place should definitely be on your list!

We went here for my daughter's first birthday celebration as a family. Not many rides for very small kids. But we all had a good time. The food inside is expensive. Rides have less wait time during weekdays. Try visiting on weekdays. They have an app that allows love wait times for rides and meet and greets.

Visit when the climate is favorable so you can really enjoy the walkathon Rides are super safe for kids. They have Variety for extreme and chill rides depends on your taste. Download the app. It really helps to navigate and plan where to next Water refilling stations are provided in every corner so no need to buy every now and then. Just bring your own flask/tumbler. Food: approx 30-50 SGD per person Toys for kids: Overall: WORTH IT

Great place for kids and adults to spend an entire day in Singapore. The Minion show is the silver lining among all the shows. There is a heavy rush at the Jurassic ride so opt for an express ticket if possible. The rides were amazing and definitely not for the weak hearted.
Not bad to play! However, kindergarten children are more afraid of some facilities. You can visit all the rides in half a day with a quick pass!

4.review_text: I have also been to the LA version of it, hence i find this comparatively smaller. The singapore version can be covered in a day easily unlike the LA one which takes couple of days to cover entirely (so huge). Nonetheless its a must visit place for all ages!

5.review_text: An amazing full day experience well worth going, best pre booking tickets though and check out on TripAdvisor best way to get there from Singapore

This place needs no introduction.. a must visit for tourists.. will surely fall short of time.. 7-8 rides at max u will be able to cover.. terminator a must ride there.. U will fall in love with everything it has to offer

USS is a very interesting place, there are so many rides. Suitable for family holidays. My experience of visiting was amazing. If you visit and want to enjoy a different sunset, try seeing Song Of The Sea. They show a combination of drama with lighting, lasers, fire and music which is very entertaining.. Set against the backdrop of the vast ocean by the beach.. Very interesting..

Southeast Asias first and only Universal Studios theme park, featuring 24 rides, shows and attractions in seven themed zones.Each zone is based on a blockbuster movie or a television show, featuring their own attractions, character appearances, dining and shopping areas.The park features the world's tallest pair of dueling roller coaster that are based on the popular television series, Battlestar Galactica; a castle from the world of Shrek and Monster Rock, a live musical show featuring the Universal Monster. Universal Studios Singapore has over 30 restaurants and food carts, together with 20 retail stores and carts located around the park. Attractions premiering are marked "Premiere" and dining outlets that are certified Halal are marked with "Halal".
Lovely enjoyable place of singapore, i passed my best time over here

4.review_text: A must visit if been to Singapore
I took a bus to Vivo Mall.. and i went inside the mall.. theres a LRT to go to Sentosa Island..

Enjoyed it very much. Great rides, well maintained. Lots of choices and shops. Restaurants, bars, all interesting with its own quirks. One downside, lots of tourists from China.. and they have no regards of other tourist, talking in yelling volume, etc. Tried to cut the line at shrek 4D, cut the line at burger diner, try to refill their drinks while theres big "no refill" sign. Other than that, very recommeded place to visit :)
The globe in Singapore, a selfie while watching a movie is... If you go to Singapore, you won't regret taking a selfie.
Good. Remember to plan your itinerary according to the time of the show first so that you dont miss it.

5.review_text: For Indonesian people: This is my first time coming here and the message is: 1. It's better to bring your own drink, because if you buy it there, 6.5 SGD IDR 70,000 can be refilled at each ride queue. 2. Muslims can eat inside. Lots of halal food here... you can search on Google... You can also eat at Food Republic which is also cheaper (roasted chicken, Hainanese, etc.) or better still bring food from the accommodation... 3. There is a prayer room behind the Galactica spacecraft... 4. There is a ride (Jurassic World) that can make wet clothes, if there are provided raincoats/ponchos, the price is only 5 SGD IDR 60,000... There is a body drying area and the price is 5 SGD too. It's better to bring your own poncho / you can do it buy there too... 5. Get used to printing your entry ticket and saving it on your cellphone because sometimes you can't scan it on paper/on your cellphone, so be careful as an alternative...
When in Singapore, must visit Universal Studios
One of the most and should place when visiting to Singapore

A must visit if you are at Singapore. Rides are awesome and thrilling. Stand in single queue than the group one if you want to cover all the rides in a day. Best of all, you and your friend could sit in side seats though not nearby in the rides this way. "Transformers" & "Stephen Spielberg" shows were the main highlights. Don't miss these.

The best international entertainment city in Singapore, an amusement park complete with all logistical services, bank withdrawal machines, a prayer room, first aid, baby stroller rental, restaurants, a drinks and snack canteen.....etc. They also have express service. Live shows are held continuously, depending on the region.

3.review_text: If you are not very interested in the theme of the scenic spots inside, it is not recommended to visit. The park is small and one day is enough to complete the tour.

4.review_text: We take a cable car to Sentosa. Good bird eyes' view of Sentosa World! We have lots of fun at there. We love Madame Tussauds and Mavel 4D Cinema( my mom loves them so much). Don't forget to use SG tourist savers app because it relly helps to save our money.

Very interesting considering that Universal Studios doesn't yet exist in Indonesia. So for us this is a special attraction when we want to visit USS. Very hot location in the USS area. The fairly expensive entrance ticket creates obstacles for backpackers who want to enter the USS
Always a must see in Singapore! Had a great time

Smaller than expected and most rides are quick to finished. However it's definitely worth a visit! Beautiful decorations all over. If you are into healthy food this is not the place. P.s. the transformers ride is beyond imagination and I would go here again only for that one! (It doesn't look like much from the outside)

5.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore is a must see for all tourists. Word of advice - single rider lines will save you a great deal of time on the queues. The Mummy ride, Battlestar Galactica (Human and Cylon) are highly recommend. If you dont want to skip anything, its probably better if you carry a map with you. This place is full of surprises and quality entertainment, but the food however wasnt satisfactory for me. There are lockers available - free for a certain period of time, but youll have to pay after that timeline.

One of the amusement rides tourist attractions in Singapore, specifically on Sentosa Island. Here you will be treated to several game rides. You must pay for tickets in advance to enjoy the rides provided. What are you waiting for, you can fill your free time/holiday here with your family. Excellent!!!

A must visit place when you visit singapore. amazing, thirrling rides. you'll not even realize when the whole day passes away. Each & every roller coaster ride gives you a different kind of experience. what i'll recommend is if you are visiting there then do try each & every roller coaster ride. it's a must try. Watching the water show was also fun. must see that show.

One of the tourist attractions worth visiting in Singapore. The place is nice and clean, very suitable for a holiday with family. It's better to buy an express ticket than to spend time queuing at just one place.
A must visit here when visiting Singapore.

3.review_text: Singapore Universal is really quite small, and some of the themes are older.

4.review_text: Although it is not as good as Universal Studios Japan, there is no other choice when going to Singapore! But be aware that there are so many tourists that even on a free day, you have to wait in line for many hours just to visit one attraction! It is recommended to play in the opposite direction, that is, to play along the left side, but you must pay attention to the opening hours of the attractions! Its best to buy your tickets online first, otherwise you may have to spend some time queuing!

If you have done prater amusement park in Vienna than rides here are just like kids work. Basically all are mini roller coaster rides but with different themes . Despite so many Indian visitor, no decent vegetarian food shop

The amusement park is not very large. But a lot of people come, especially during holidays. and weekend Ticket prices can be purchased through agents such as kkday, klook or the Sea Wheel store in Chinatown. It's almost 10 cheaper than buying at the park. After passing through the door The rides that are quite fun and have lots of queues are on the right side. Turn right. The left side is a comfortable zone, not scary. It is recommended to prepare a raincoat.

Very nice place to visit, but very stale after visiting too many times. If it is your first time visiting be sure to go for rides like the "Mummy" and "Cylon" as they are amazing roller coasters. Food is a bit too expensive but reasonable when you take into account that this is an amusement park.

It's really cute, it's small, in 1 day you can do all the games. Eating is expensive and there is a long line at most of the games. You can buy the ticket in Chinatown which costs a little less than buying it there. If it's a weekend, it's probably more practical to get the special ticket that is more expensive but you don't have to queue for any games.

5.review_text: A must visit place if you are coming to Singapore if you bring your children because it is a resort island that provides various activities for yourself or your family. Usually this place is filled with visitors from overseas and local tourists. You must book your tickets earlier online and come earlier to enter the theme park.
A must to go theme park in Singapore. Always plan to come to this place when you go for holiday in Singapore. Not so cheap, many people come here only for sightseeing.

Great amusement park, lots of rides and attractions, the food courts inside are extremely good. They have juice counters inside and you get pulpy juices of different flavours like grape,mango and strawberry...had great time here.....Singapore is a must visit country in the world. Go for a trip guys........

Very good. A mandatory destination when visiting Singapore. Within Sentosa Island and there are many tourist options close to Sentosa Island. You have to go in if you come here... it's really fun and fantastic

This is my favorite place. And I always bring friends to this place. You must to visit here if you come to Singapore as this is a resort island that provides a variety of activities for yourself or your family. This place a bit crowded with visitors from overseas and local tourists especially on weekends and school holiday. To get this place you can take LRT and get 4 ticket from Sentosa's Ticketing Counter at Level 3 Vivo City Mall L lobby or by bus or taxi.

3.review_text: Not sure if I would visit more than 2 times.
Plz skip this if u've already visited Orlando.

4.review_text: A must in Singapore! Good attractions and shows...sadly it was raining over part of my visit...but all of the attraction runs despute the weather! you wont get dehydrated throughout the visit as they provide a lot of water station around the park... Thoughtful touch from Resort World Sentosa! There's halal food served in certain restaurant (attached to pix)
A must see attraction in Singapore. Half a day is enough to cover all rides, if you going with an Express pass. Else one day won't be sufficient.
Landmark that is a must have for anyone who has been to sentosa island... it's like an introduction to the trip of a lifetime!

Very fun, must go for tourists. Recommend fast pass because queues are quite long during peak season, but rides are very fun. Food is quite expensive so bring your own packaged food (make sure it's factory produced and sealed).

Lots of interesting thing to do .. Many souvenir to buy, so prepare extra SG Dollar.. Transformer Ride & Shrek 4D movie is a must.. Twin Roller Coaster only for those who have braveheart.. Recommended..

5.review_text: The best place in Singapore. Do not leave singapore without visiting this wonderful place. Make sure you take Mummy Ride, Transformers, Jurassic Park and rollercoasters. Do not come alone, come with your family. Enjoy.
Once in a lifetime experience for other nationalities.. Rides at Transformers and Mummy were awesome.. A must pitstop when you are at Singapore..
Must visit when you're in Singapore
Must visit in case you are visiting Singapore. Cylone/human, transformers and revenge of mummy IMO are the best rides. Skip Shrek and the other kiddy rides. And don't forget to take the express pass.

Do not leave Singapore without visiting Universal Studio. Truly world class place with amazing rides, show, food and much more. if you are with kids first check the rides and then go as some of the rides are really scary. if you love adventure then you should try the roller coaster. food court is also good, rates are little bit higher but that you expect at such places. Don't miss the transformer's show which is a must watch. Please keep in mind that if you are visiting here on Sunday or holiday there will be lot of rush and you will not get all the rides and shows as waiting time will be very high. Better to go there in weekdays and reach there early. My top 5 attractions are 1. Transformers 2. Hollywood Studio 3. Madagascar show 4. The Roller coaster fast one and The Mummy 5. Dance show on road which starts around 5 pm. Also keep in mind to leave a little early from Universal Studios in the evening as waiting for taxies become very long and you have to stand in long queue for Taxi.

4.review_text: Good place to visit in singapore... But u r from India & u visit Ramoji Film City then it night be feel u same as Ramoji.... But there r some shoes which r differant than Ramoji

Best attraction to go in Sentosa. It was too crowded when I visited since it was on a weekend during Christmas. If you are a thrill seeker definitely try the Transformers and Battlestar Galactica rides.

Singapore's weather is hot and humid, so it is advisable to visit around 4 pm onwards unless you are willing to withstand the scorching heat of the sun. Ventillation is well provided so waiting in queues is tolerable. Check the crowd before deciding to buy Fast Pass.
It's a good photo spot, if you've been on holiday to Singapore, you haven't been here yet
It is very convenient to have food and accommodation in Sentosa. The island also has casinos, beaches, cable cars and the largest Merlion Tower.

5.review_text: I've been here twice, a place that is one of the destinations for foreign tourists when visiting Singapore
Singapore tourist attraction

The main tourist attraction in Singapore and highly recommended if you visit Singapore, there are a variety of tourist attractions ranging from beach tourism, marine aquariums, nice buildings, places to take photos.
Mandatory visit when in Singapore !

The best place in Singapore. With all kinds of rides, food places, shopping places and a lot of live performances. The best part was the staff here are extremely helpful because we took an express ticket for 2 days ( approx 50000 INR) and we misplaced it near the restaurant of mummy ride and my parents went back to the counter for help and as a bonus they gave us 55 tickets on express for all rides. A must visit for Singapore.

3.review_text: It cost about 3000 yen to store my luggage. Just checking in two items was about the same as the entrance fee, so I recommend checking it in without carrying any luggage. The taxi ride from Marina Bay Sands was just over 1000 yen, so I don't think I have to take the train when going to Universal! The inside is smaller than the one in Japan, so it's a little more empty, so you don't have to line up from the beginning of the morning. It also felt like they were improving upon attractions in Japan. When I went, the attraction broke down and I had to wait for about an hour, but that's still a good memory lol

4.review_text: It was a great experience to be here. One of the must visit place when you are in Singapore. Worth waiting long queue especially in Holidays, better took express tickets. Be earlier, so that can complete all the rides. Despite fun the chocolate, candy and ice-cream were marvelous. Sure will enjoy every moment with family and friends.

Theme Park is very famous in Singapore. With the globe being an icon where people always take photos in front of it. It takes a full day to play in it. It is highly recommended to come in the morning before the queue opens, especially during holidays. The ride that I always go to first is Transformer

An amazing experience, except the food options: Universal studios is a great place to visit with family or friends or anyone else. There are lots of worlds inside it, each belonging to a different movie from the studios. The worlds, the attractions and the attention to detail is just amazing. There can be a lot of waiting time during peak season, such as when we went during Christmas week, so it is better to shell out a few extra dollars and buy a Fastrack pass which lets you skip the queues. In this way you can experience much more rides in a single day. There are also souvenir shops with really good, high quality merchandise, albeit pretty expensive. Same goes for the food. There are many restaurants and food stalls, but the problem was that there was very little or no vegetarian food options. Only the Indian restaurant in the ancient Egypt world had veg food. Even though Singapore does not have many vegetarians, universal studios is an international destination and must cater to the needs of all types of people. Anyway, packing some food from home is advisable if you want to save money. Also, Singapore weather is hot and rainy, so dress appropriately for that. They do sell umbrellas and rain ponchos there. Overall, the experience was amazing. One can spend a whole day here. We liked the Battlestar Galactica roller coaster, the Transformers 4d ride and the Mummy roller coaster a lot. The Water World show was crazy.

The ticket price is a bit costly.. You can save 6 dollar by buying at Changi airport while you arrive. To reach this place you can either walk from the vivocity mall or take the sentosa monorail. Walking is cheaper as you can save 4 dollar per person. The rides are awesome. Need a full day for completing all the rides.. Should be avoided on a weekend as the rides would be very crowded and having long queue.

Such a wonderful place in sentosa...must visit for tourist ... Singapore citizens can apply for universal studios unlimited pass for 6 months which is worth it to enjoy such amazing rides I would recommend to buy tickets online or from vendors as they sell for 66 instead of buying der which is 78 u have free shuttle buses inside sentosa but can get inside via 3 ways 1-boardwalk(free) 2-rws bus(1). 3-sentosa express monorail (4) I would recommend u guys to carry power bank along and do carry water bottle and refil from filters available in every restroom as food inside sentosa is double dat of outside have fun guys n yea I would recommend u guys to join single rider queue to save time as I was able to enjoy that mummy ride thrice

5.review_text: Best attraction to visit more than once in a life time. Expecting some more food counters and indian food options in menu. Without Universal Studios your journey in Singapore is worthless. I prefer to start your way opposite to enjoy all rides.

The major thing that I love most about Singapore is its recreational spots. There are so many things that you can enjoy in Singapore. I have visited 3 times there but still my urge for visiting there never ends. Universal studios: What can I say about this place! It is clean, wide, gorgeous, colorful and safe place to visit. Here the rides are well maintained, different branded shops and food courts are well maintained. People can enjoy a perfect vacation here and meet new people, culture and charms! My advice is to keep two consequent days for visiting universal studios. Theres several hotel around it but they are bit costly. Rather you can stay in the city as you can easily get there within an hour. This is the beauty of Singapore! I have visited many countries but Singapore would always remain my first choice to enjoy my vacations. Hope to visit there soon again!
Must visit in Singapore. The rides are awesome. But dont plan on holidays. Try weekdays.

Great to experience in Singapore. You should spend a day to have fun here. It is so big and there are so many things to experience, you can play exciting thrill games although the price is a bit expensive for Vietnamese people but it is worth trying once. However, you should go on weekdays because it is very crowded on holidays, waiting is a bit tiring for your turn to play.

Awesome place in Sentosa. You atleast need two days time if you want to enjoy every part of it. But since the ticket is valid only for a day, from 10 am till the end of the day you should be there in the US Medagaskar, Transformers, Jurassic park, Mummy oh my God so many rides to climb and so many happenings around you. You cannot dare to miss them. Anytime when you plan, atleast take 10 days minimum for Singapore else you need to visit again as you feel half filled.

1.review_text: Why are the rides' safety notices only in Chinese and English? What about Tamil and Malay? Why is there the assumption that everyone's literate in Chinese and English?
Why are safety signs only in English and Chinese? What about Malay and Tamil?

2.review_text: I have applied for an annual pass at Universal Studios for 4 consecutive years. The last one expired in October last year. I applied for the annual pass at the travel agency on WeChat during the New Year of 2019. After entering the park, I applied for the annual pass. The staff said that tourist tickets can only be upgraded to the annual pass with a foreign passport. I am a Chinese citizen with permanent residence and can apply. My two Singaporean children are foreigners and cannot upgrade to annual passes. Let us buy new tickets. These tickets were also sold to travel agencies by Universal Studios. Why are foreigners not allowed to apply for annual passes? They all buy the same ticket to enter the park. How come foreigners can do it but locals cant. It doesn't matter where you buy the tickets, they are all issued by Resorts World. There should be no distinction between foreigners and locals

3.review_text: I stopped by while I was in Singapore, but I wasn't impressed enough that I personally wouldn't recommend coming to Singapore to enjoy Universal Studio.
Sentosais the very very good placed singapore.I like Singapore'.

An amusement park on Sentosa Island, south of the city of Singapore. Universal Studios welcomes you with its iconic globe, music, cotton candy and waving movie characters. Great facilities with beautiful decorations and all the fun you can imagine, both for children and adults. In the Sentosa Island complex, in addition to the Universal Studios park, you can enjoy many other attractions, such as the aquarium, the merlion, a wax museum, parachute flight, zip lines, restaurants, shops, even a beach and an old military fort.

4.review_text: Best place to visit when in singapore. Tiring but worth the pain. You can spend your whole day out here with your family or even if you are travelling alone. Carry a extra pair of clothes and wear your most comfortable shoe.

You can find different different adventurous ride here. You need to pay 61 SGD for a day ticket. Even you are not able to finish all rides there. You can enjoy 4-5 rides or you can take fast track ticket to not spend your time in queue.

It is clear that Singapore is a famous tourist destination... If you were expecting a Japanese or American universal, you're out of luck. Even though it is small, it is too small. Still, if you plan to go, you must buy an express ticket. Waiting in line in the heat is... very difficult.
Great entertainment in Singapore Dont forget take pic at the Universal Globe
Good theme park in SG

5.review_text: Must visit place once in life. Singapore visit is incomplete without it.
Must visit place when you go to Singapore.
Must visit. At sentosa island Singapore. Crazy rides, shopping is expensive.
Main attraction in Singapore
