3.review_text: It's not a must. The attractions are manageable. Possibly for children if they want to ride on many small trains. Otherwise too expensive.
Very nice attractions for what Asia could offer. But limited if compared to the parks of the USA. Of course, considering the size constraints of the area.

4.review_text: Excellent games, you cannot miss them if you go to Singapore, the entrance ticket is not that expensive and allows you to enter all the attractions as many times as you want. The food inside is mostly fast food, it is not very good but it is what the park offers you. I promise you that you will have fun like a child in each of the attractions and you will enjoy it, so don't miss it, going as a family I think it is more advisable, although if you bring your things you can always leave it in the lockers, you just have to pay a few coins, because in some games you can't take your belongings.

It is highly recommended that you first experience the facilities that are only available in Singapore, such as experiencing the special effects of natural disasters and man-made disasters, wearing 3D glasses Transformers, the mummy version of the roller coaster, and the Shrek 4D theater. After experiencing these unique facilities and special effects, go Its not too late to experience the roller coaster or the 360-degree rotating exciting facilities that are also available in Taiwan. When it comes to excitement, I think you can have a lot of fun in Taiwan. I hope all tourists can understand the choice. After all, there are many tourists in the movie theater, and it would be a waste of queuing time to do everything.

Brilliant day out in Singapore! Make sure you visit during the week as less busy, best rides were Transformers and Jurassic Park rapids (your feet will get soaking!) The shows were brilliant too - we booked online with a MasterCard and received 5 per person to use in any restaurant, very worthwhile as the food is expensive. You have to pay 4 each for a return monorail ticket.
What a great Theme Park. It is a 'Must Go Place' when you are in Singapore.

Universal Studios Singapore... It's quite exciting even though it's not as exciting as US Japan. I'm not arrogant, just an opinion. It's true... it's not bad USS, the heat is great too. (it's close to the beach)

5.review_text: Visiting Singapore, this place is a must, worth the cost and can have you engaged for whole day. Enter Early in the morning and return by evening, Saturdays are the best coz it is open till 10 pm. Food is costly there, but no option. Not all the shows are good but don't miss the water show . Roller coaster is very good. Transformers ride is the best, will go twice for it. Ney York will have the cinema shooting show, it is amazing. Kids, adults , aged people all of them something to enjoy here. Better to take food and snacks inside.
Best experience. Must visit when in Singapore.
Amazing attraction to attend at Singapore..One of the best tourist attraction there

If you've decided to go to Singapore for holidays, then visiting Universal Studios Singapore is a must. It took a day or maybe 2days to explore the whole USS, so make sure to be there on gate open time (by 10 am). There are a lot of fun rides such as the Transformers, Jurassic Park and the mummy is also fun (had on it 2times), stores and 4D shows. Won't get bored to have photos here as there are a lot of attractive spots to shoot. The food is a bit expensive. But still worth to try.
2nd priority if you are visit singapore after merlion park

4.review_text: I'm bringing my grandchildren with me...whenever I come to Singapore, I always come here.For that reason, I used to stay at a hotel in the marina area, but now I'm staying at the Hard Rock Hotel right next door (lol) It's fun for adults to stay all day.

A must visit when in Singapore. Kids will absolutely love it. But there are enough stuff for adults as well. Mummy ride, waterworld show and tranformers were my personal favourites. Apart from the rides the whole atmosphere is just out of the world with photogenic places, character meet and greets etc Not giving 5 star only because of the aggressive marketing. Also the food courts are very expensive with little quantity as well
Singapore is really neat and tidy. I stayed here for 4 days. I saw the police outside the airport. The day I left, there was no one on the street. The local security is really good.

It's worth going and spending time, but then there are many things worth seeing in Singapore, don't miss them, universal will take up an entire day and you need atleast 7 days to enjoy Singapore to the full. For Indian food go to Little India
One of the must palce to visit in singapore with lot of rides and entertianment with beautiful street veiws. But usually expect wait during weekends

5.review_text: A must go in Singapore, especially for the first visit. Facilities are suitable for people of all ages. Just remember to carefully plan your tour there when you are with children as there usually will be long queues for most of the activities. It can be exhausting yet worthwhile. The most impressive was the show in water world. The performers and the audiences were so interactive that everyone was having a lot of fun. When the plane popped out in front of the audiences, I suppose, everyone was astonished and shocked. Some staff could be a bit pushy. It didn't affect the overall experience.

One of the best places to visit at Singapore At peak season, for the main rides like transformers , mummy, roller coaster etc there are long que of more than an hour on holidays How to make it easier: 1. Take the express ticket (which costs around 50 SGD extra per person Or 2. Reach there at opening time and straight off head for transformers ride, mummy and roller coaster, in this case the que will be lesser and you can finish much faster
Must visit place if you visit Singapore and it's worth the price. Revenge of the Mummy and roller coaster are must rides.
I am not into theme parks at all but It is my first time in Singapore, so USS is a must see location. A lot of places to take photos for your IG! Lol
If you come to Singapore its a must visit theme park. Your trip is incomplete without it.

3.review_text: Do not start your Singapore trip with this attraction. This is an ok to skip attraction. Start your trip with Gradens by the Bay.
Wel known place in singapore.... every one should visit ....

4.review_text: Was an entertaining place. I have been to Universal Studious Japan as well each place has its own featured ride. But unlike in Japan only got to ride 2 rides for the whole day. In Singapore I got the express pass and was happy cause I get to ride all the rides that I wanted. The battlestar galatica roller coaster was 4/5 for me. In terms of thrill and speed. Great place for family and friends who wants to enjoy theier holiday and days off away from work and studies.

The park is small, not as big as Osaka, but the crowds are less than in Osaka. You dont need to buy a quick pass if you come on weekdays. The weather in Singapore is very hot, so remember to bring water.

Great place to spend the day with lot of fun and excitement. My recommendations. Buy tickets from an agent. It's saves you 7-10 SGD per person. Make sure to arrive at the Gates at 9pm so you could use the full time. Use the single rider ques as much as possible. You could save hours of waiting time. Take Food and water from outside. Inside Universal studios prices are very high ( Water bottle could cost 5 SGD) PS: Buy Mount faber cable car ticket to reach Senthosa island. It's an amazing ride above the sea. Transformers ride and Two rollercoaster rides are must try. Jurassic water ride is also good.

Universal Studios Singapore is a very great place. During your visit there, you will certainly enjoy the different rides, food, and attractions. You really need to try the Lost World Ride in the Jurassic Park area. But be prepared to get wet (or probably SOAKED!Make sure to also watch the WATER WORLD Show. I promise, you wont regret waiting for the show because of the amazing effects and acting. You would really feel like you are watching a movie! The food inside the theme park can be quite pricey, so if you are not a local, I would highly suggest eating at Mels Diner, located at the Hollywood area. Mels Diner offers a selection of Western food such as burgers and salad. Dont forget to visit the shops there!

That place is amazing. Just the sheer number of attractions that they have squeezed into that tiny 20 acres of land! The central roller coasters I think was one of Asia's tallest one, with a height of up to 14 stories! The food there is delicious as well, however they are quite expensive so I would recommend going outside to eat and then come back in ( remember to use the re-entry exit! ) My favourite ride was probably the Jurassic Park ride. Do try that out!

5.review_text: Going to Singapore isn't complete if you don't go to the US. Was here all day to wander around. Come when it opens, so you can enjoy all the rides. As much as possible, don't come on the weekend, the queue for each ride is long, it can be up to 70 minutes. There is a time reminder at each entrance, so you can guess whether you will enter or not. You can buy tickets online or at the ticket window. But it's more profitable online because it's cheap and there are lots of promotions. Stay at a hotel in the Sentosa area, so it's not far to come here. It only took me 5 minutes to get here with the hotel shuttle bus which is ready every 30 minutes, and then back to the hotel. There are lots of souvenir shops and restaurants as well as food courts that you can stop by at any time if you're tired of walking.
Recommended holiday destinations in Singapore...
Never experience the best holiday. Should come here if you're in Singapore.
Definitely must come if you are first time visiting Singapore! They have the most amazing Roller coaster rides.
One of Asia's wonderful theme parks in Singapore. A must go when visiting the country. Especially when you are traveling with your family and friends.

1.review_text: never go Everything the guide says is a lie

3.review_text: Too crowded but worth seeing while in Singapore
It is located on Sentosa Island, Singapore. I don't think it's as big as Japan.

4.review_text: It is a beautiful place to visit and most probably one of the best places in Singapore. It is not possible to cover the whole USS on weekends as there are many local people along with the tourists there. There are, I don't remember correctly, 19 attractions in the universal studios, Singapore. We visited on weekend and hence were not able to cover all the attractions. But you can enjoy all of them if you go on weekdays (I dont know exactly wheter it is possible to cover the whole USS in a single day). Some of the best rides were the Transformers, Shrek 4d adventure, jurassic park rapid adventures and the most the important Battlestar Galactica, Cylon which is the roller coaster.

Great park! Lots of attractions around Universal, friendly staff, very clean and good themed areas. The only drawback is the price-performance ratio, yes the park is in Singapore and yes on Sentosa Island but please 276SgD for two adults and two children (811). In terms of size and quantity, this is above European standards. That said, you also have to say that the park is really a lot of fun, awesome shows (best Waterworld! The stunt people do incredible things!) different areas and lots of nice sales shops, but here too the price-performance ratio is poor. Very good rides for children and adults who are young at heart, adrenaline and roller coaster junkies will find moderate rides here. Tip: Jurassic Park water ride, very good. And two hours before closing time is also great, as the waiting times are reduced by more than half compared to midday. Conclusion: a lot of money but also a lot of value for it. It's best to take a full day with you.

People sometimes go in the afternoon. Big mistake. Go in the morning and spend the day there. It's open till 10 PM, you pay a lot for the day pass so use it wisely. Getting there is either through cable car or the Sentosa express. You need to alight at the RWS station for Universal studios. Carry a cap and glasses with you, it's going to be hot. If you're not really into this, there's a VR theme park nearby, try it out. It's worth it.

If you have been to Universal Studios in the United States, you will find that the entertainment programs provided by Universal Studios in Singapore are basically the same as those in the United States, and even turkey legs are provided on the sidewalks (but the physical ones seem to be a little different); the only difference is that Singapore is limited by the geographical environment, and the tour bus tour around the major studios (this is an experience that takes you to the film site and re-experience the film content, highly recommended, it is a pity not to have it), other equipment and scenery (and the helplessness of waiting in line), It can completely make you linger and be very lively.
When traveling to Singapore, you should not miss this place

5.review_text: 1st timer in Singapore should include on their itenerary.

Exciting amusement park in Singapore. Try the Transformer and The Mummy rides. It's really fun and I want to keep going. Also try, if you dare, Battlestar Galactica. Try both blue and red. For children, there are also many rides that can be tried. Many interesting photo spots. Tickets are quite expensive for Indonesians. The food inside is a bit expensive. But you can come in and out if you want to look for food outside. Try the turkey thighs. Yummy and not available in Indonesia.

Famous-a Must Go Place-in Singapore. The Theme-park is never lost it touch, people from everywhere always and must come here when they visited Singapore. Not just saying , since they do have many-many cool rides and attraction which is fun for families , children, young and adults. Most favorites here is still the Transformers ride-that never vacant, but it's very worthed since these rides where very exciting!! but my favorite is still the Shrek-4D-Adventure which is hillarious!! _ we can also watch Light parade and see the Firework show is the near closing time. All the attractions here were well-planned for every customers happiness and excitements. so we would never get disappointed. You can also purchase many Universal-merchandise that is rare to find in any other places, like How-to-train-your-dragon merchandise which is soooo cool to collect. The only problem here is the heat, so very recommended to wear light shirt and comfortable shoes, or you might also bring fan and always carry a tumbler or you might get dehydrated. and on some season, weekends and public holiday do prepare to lining up for every ride. and i'm talking about a very-very long lines.. O

One if the best place at Singapore. One visit is not enough. This has so many rides, theater, water show, water games, dinasour world etc etc. You may require to stand in queues to enjoy rides. If you use rides without group, the queue size is small. This is recommended to know few shows time in advance like water show, media , theater etc so that u reach that place in time. There is only one time entry fee to universal studio and no further charge for any ride or show. We can say... Just amazing...

Must visit place. Spread a complete day in USS. Places to interest light adventures are transformers and mummy. Water show is great. Be prepared to be soaked by sitting in wet or soak zone. Do Try Singaporean noodles. Carry handheld fan to give u some good air in queue. To avoid queue use Express pass. Visit on Friday and Saturday to see the hollywood parade and amazing fire works

3.review_text: Not too many ride's. If you come from America or have been to the parks there, you can give this one a miss

4.review_text: Definitely worth a visit when in Singapore. If you buy the admission ticket, be sure to also get the Fast Lane ticket - otherwise you will sometimes have to wait an hour in front of an attraction before you get your turn. The fast lane map also sometimes offers the option of sitting right at the front. I think there were only two attractions where this card wasn't valid - for whatever reason. You should definitely take a day to try everything there.

Very cool place! A must-see in Singapore. There are places to eat and relax. If it rains, dont worry, as many pavilions are covered. On the downside: the queues are long, but that was to be expected. Lockers are super expensive. So you shouldn't take a lot of things with you. Towards the evening, I advise you to go to the attractions from which you can admire the illuminated park.

Its a great place n u need a full day to cover it fully. Rides, Theme based park n many other activities r there. Its uphill to cover it n a day. Still if u go by ur taste i think 1 day is enough. Water world is d best in there, so u mst experience it. Adrenaline rushing rides r there, but one issue is that there is a waiting time in almost all most sought after rides, etc. bt i reckon d wait is worth it.When u exit, try boardwalk frm Sentosa to Vivo City. Views r amazing.

A must-visit amusement park in Singapore, highly recommended! Its a pity that we didnt have enough time with the group to enjoy the Water World show. We sat in the wet area but it was already wet at the beginning. It is recommended that friends who are afraid of getting wet just sit in the non-wet area. The performance is wonderful and worth seeing!

Not usually always crowded with tourist, local people.. Many activities and attractions which you tend to enjoy Trick eye museum, VR games, food court, casino, candy shop, bay front, sentosa Merlin A day is not enough to spend You name it you"ll find it here..

5.review_text: Visiting Singapore? Trip is not completed without visiting this place.
Best thing to do in Singapore.. it's the heart of Singapore tourism...this is a must place to go to.best one

Large enough to be easily covered in one day I'll never eat chicken rice again It doesn't matter, but In the summer, there are a lot of Chinese and Indian people, so there are many people who don't stand in line. If you're careful, you'll get screwed It was wonderful

4.review_text: Good place Must visit place of Singapore tour

I didn't know it was a national holiday, so I went on a weekday. It was so hot and crowded that I thought I was going to die. I recommend going on a weekday, but if you go on the weekend, I definitely recommend purchasing an express ticket. But the express is also crowded.

Reach USS via Vivo City Level 3! You need to pay 4 SGD for roundtrip by Monorail to Sentosa Island. Alighted in the firsf station (Resort World Station) and walk 5 mins to most-iconic place! So crowded even on weekday!

It has many attractions. I suggest you come early and stay until late. They have many street attractions that you may encounter while walking around the area. Most attractions have around 60-90 minute wait time, so be prepared.

from the middle of town to here quite far, if you take the MRT get off at the end of the station then take the bus or taxi if you take the LRT pay 4 good place clean neat, no need to go into the universal studio alone is good for taking pictures I only came here to the universal studio globe, because there was already good and very crowded people taking pictures, if you want to come here I recommend bringing drinks because it's hot and the price of drinks here is quite expensive

5.review_text: must visited place ..if u r visiting Singapore..must visit here.. waiting time is more for rides..but that waiting time worth ...i will prefer express ticket

Located in Sentosa Island, this is one of the top places to visit in Singapore. Need whole day to cover the place, avoid going on weekends. Entry is paid and entry tickets are expensive. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes. Do not carry too many stuffs and gadgets as nothing is allowed on the rides although lockers are there to keep your belongings but they paid. Inside food and stuffs are expensive. I recommend this place to everyone.

I think I'll visit Singapore to go one more time. I also went to Universal in Osaka, and although it's smaller than there, there are a lot of rides, so even if you ride the free pass rides, it takes a lot of time. So I couldn't ride them all. If you're not visiting Singapore again, go early in the morning and try all the rides. It's really fun. Please note that the rides close at 19:00.
Terrible... We have to use the word terrible to properly describe this place... Universal Studios Singapore is a place worth visiting on your island adventure... Experience it...
Places you must visit when in Singapore

1.review_text: I was shocked when I went there today. The cinema is big and beautiful. Sure enough, the scenes inside are pretty good too. And the good and bad reviews on Google are all true. The only flaw is that Indian female security guard is very aggressive and checks Chinese tourists very strictly Talk loudly to the tourists. The Chinese girl came from afar. She didnt say she wanted to check her. She waited until people were about to pass and said loudly, Didnt you hear me tell you to queue up? Handsome guys and beauties with blond hair, blue eyes, all treat it as invisible and dont check. When they meet Indian compatriots, its just He gently inserted a small wooden stick into the bag and said you can go. Even a local teacher in Singapore who took primary school students to play was brutally investigated. It was like the airport. The Chinese female teacher was dumbfounded. Haha, by the way, the primary school students are all Chinese. The official website said you can bring snacks, but you got yelled at for bringing snacks. Maybe honey star is a staple food in the West, so she said no if you bring a small box hahaha The nice little snacks were generously given to the cinema staff. The Chinese female staff were dumbfounded and asked why they were so strict. They didnt even give it to them for the whole day. Their mood was affected. Second time, everyone, be careful. Chinese people should be careful. It is best to go empty-handed and leave this racist lunatic with nothing to say. Dont take it out on tourists. From the bottom of your heart, remind future tourists to take care of themselves and spend so much money. Is it really good to get such service?

2.review_text: Security is not 100% and the girl in the lost and found section is not accommodating. We lost a go pro cam inside the KTs Grill and just less than an hours we came back the items is not their already. We thought Singapore is very safe for Tourists and Residence but sad to say when we ask the resto to check on their CCTV they said that the camera cannot cover the whole receiving area and it only focus on the cash register. How come? It does mean that costumers is not safe in that place! And its impossible that the CCTV cannot see the in and out of the costumers! How come???

4.review_text: A must-visit place in Singapore

5.review_text: Came here twice and the experience was amazingly consistent. Crowd management was good especially at the ticket counters. Buy the Express Ticket if you want to optimise your visit especially when you have teenage children who love the rides. Various mode of payments are available. There are a few new attractions. There are a few halal food outlets, clearly marked in the location map. I always took a bus from Johor Bahru into Singapore. From there, we took the MRT right up to USS entrance. We walked for a bit on the board walk. Interesting route with a lot of things to see on the way. For first timers, need not worry because you can follow the directions to get there provided on USS web page.

Again part of Singapore tourism..and i have become a fan of it..because they have made it everything so nice, safe and amazing..you need a complete day to enjoy here to the fullest..it is a bit expensive if you go for express ticket but undoubtedly worth it..as it saves your time standing in the queue and let you enjoy more..must things to do to name a few..The Mummy Returns , Terminator , the big rides..its all bout exploring..amazing indeed.

Tickets can also be purchased from this page. Even if you take a taxi from Marina Bay Sands, it will cost you around S10 (including entrance fee). People start lining up 30 minutes early, but you can enjoy unlimited rides on popular attractions until around noon. Even if it's crowded, you can ride it in about 30 minutes, so it's a good idea to ride as many attractions as you like. CYRON is the most popular, so you will be satisfied after riding it about 3 times. Also, CYRON, HUMAN, and MUMMY need to leave all their luggage. Leave it in a locker with fingerprint authentication. (You don't have to worry because the staff speaks Japanese and there are staff. Please carry a few dollars or a credit card just in case.) Jurassic Park gets really wet, so raincoats are a must. Also, there is a charge for lockers, so it might be a good idea to leave them at MUMMY. You can ride the train on Sentosa Island for free. Once you get out, you can see the giant Merlion or go to the beach. Once you leave, just tell them your ticket and "Reenter" when you exit, and your arm will be treated with a black light, allowing you to re-enter. Texas chicken and Mac are available in places where rice is served, so it's cheap. It's good to be relatively close. Although the scale is not large, the USS is a place you can enjoy to the fullest.

This is a place that everyone will go to if they come to Singapore. The games that should be prioritized here are the transformer game, the super coaster in the Egypt area and the coaster in the Galaxy area. The shopping area is very beautifully decorated. You can buy super unique souvenirs.

Highly recommend hahaha, don't forget to bring a drinking bottle, you know the price of drinking water in Singapore is expensive and there are lots of drinking machines available universally, so if you bring a bottle you can save money Don't forget to try turkey leg too if you come here!

3.review_text: It's quite different from the universal studios Japan, this is just normal not special like japan there's a few things to do comparing to the universal studios osaka. But the only good thing is the universal studios Singapore is present in English

4.review_text: This is my first time coming here. How was it I have yet to try it out. But if I may say something, for those who haven't tried Universal Studio in America or Japan(Universal Studio is also there) , it all began in Singapore, Sentosa.
You've not seen Singapore unless you pay a visit to universal.....apart from the fact that you can't find good edible food inside....it's awesome

There are fewer attractions than in Japan, so I didn't have high expectations, but it was better than I expected. I feel like there is less waiting time for attractions than in Japan. The Shrek attraction was really fun. If you are buying a ticket on the day and want to take the monorail to Sentosa Island, we recommend buying the monorail and Universal tickets together.
Food varities can be improved based on the country's specificity. A guide or the roadmap on the road will make people easier to enjoy the whole time
The only themed park in SG

5.review_text: A must visit place if you have come to Singapore. Negative points may be that it require one whole day and it is costly (80 Singapore dollars) but its worth to spend time and money on it.

A must-visit place when you come to Singapore. There are usually fewer people on Tuesdays and Thursdays, so I recommend aiming for those days. There's a Korean who runs a hostel in Chinatown, and if you buy tickets there, it's much cheaper! I live in Singapore, but I purchase a season pass and go out whenever I can! Also, please note that during Halloween, you must purchase a Halloween admission ticket. Dont forget to take a picture in front of the globe!!
One of the tourist destinations in Singapore...
Tourist attractions and family entertainment that must be visited in Singapore
Best experience... This made me wanna add california to my bucket list... But I will always go back to singapore... Singapore has become an addiction now...

3.review_text: I have never been to Universal in other countries, but the overall size of the park is really small compared to other countries, and the theme is not special. There are also very few spots where you can take photos, but what I can see is progress is that every Halloween there are more and more horrors and decorations! !

4.review_text: Very good day to spend a day in Singapore. However, the rides become repeatative
Be considerate of tourists.
It's a good theme park in Singapore.
Nice place....amazing rides....wonderful shows......bring ur own raincoat

5.review_text: Must visit place if you are going to Singapore. One day will not be sufficient, plan to spend atleast two days
Worth visiting with ur family....must to do in Singapore

The most representative tourist attraction in Singapore, you should go there early. After entering the door, go to the right and ride the roller coaster first. You can take your time with other rides! Fun, fun, really fun!

Visited this place for the first time and I love it! worth the penny for you to be a kid again. Riding all those rides whether solo or in a group was the best, challenging and worthy activity I ever enjoyed. My only two negative things is that the park serves mediocre food at exorbitant prices. So bring your own water and food. And if you can buy the Universal Express pass ticket it will be much better to avoid the long and disappointed queues. This place is a must go for all singapore travellers.The place is crowded on weekends, prefer to make a visit on weekdays. Spending the time with your friends or family there makes your life more fun.

WHAT A MARVELOUS PLACE!!! Everything is arranged & arranged neatly. Vacations in Singapore, especially at Universal Studios Singapore, are very satisfying!! Unfortunately, there are minimal or even very few spots for Muslims to worship (confused about where to find a prayer room/mosque, or maybe there isn't one?! Hehehe).

3.review_text: Don't go to Sentosa Island yet if you haven't taken a photo at this icon...he3x

4.review_text: Superbly clean (of course it's singapore). Rides: Good combination of rides (from mild shaking chairs to high intensity roller coaster). They need to update the video quality and fix some of their old pieces. Food and merchandise: expensive, but if thats what you came for why not? Though you can easily get stamped and eat at Sentosa. USS is one of the go-to places if you are visiting Singapore. It is worth every penny that is spent. Though a comparatively smaller theme park it offers some of the best rides. I would recommend you to go here if you are with friends or relatively younger people because some of the rides might not be for elderly people. Best Rides and thrill 1*. Waterworld stunt show - DO NOT MISS THIS SHOW BY ANY MEANS. 1. Battle star gallectica cyclone 2. Transformers ride 3. Revenge of the mummy 4. Jurassic park water ride ( wear a poncho ) 5. Shrek 4-D Here are the things that would be of help : - The normal ticket is priced at 79 SGD for adults for a single day pass. You can book a ticket online or through the counter as well. If you are staying in Singapore for more than 1 month i would suggest you to buy an annual pass priced at 169 SGD. - You do not have to pay anything extra for rides inside USS. - If you have a bigger budget for the tour i would recommend you to buy an express pass which is around 199 SGD. This pass helps you to bypass the long queues and helps finish the rides faster. - If you are planning to take a normal ticket and also want to enjoy all the rides try to come as early as possible at around 9 in the morning. We reached USS at 9:45 and could complete all the rides. - The food inside USS is very expensive and not tasty at all. Try to bring your own meal from home. Outside food is allowed. Indians can find Indian food in "oasis spice garden" food court near the mummy ride. - Try packing light and do not bring huge bags. The lockers inside are too small. - If you want a good picture in front of the iconic USS globe at the entrance try to come as early as possible or you can exit the park sometime in the afternoon or evening. Do not forget to ask for stamp if you want to re-enter. - The souvenirs and toys inside are too expensive. You will find better things in chinaTown. Take your children inside the toy shops at your own risk. I hope this information helps !
Definitely a place to visit when you are in SG... in fact, not a bad idea to visit twice a year especially during festive seasons!!!

Personally, I think the water show is very authentic and worth seeing! I didn't really worry about attractions that said "be careful not to get wet", but I ended up getting very wet (lol). Are the regulars wearing raincoats? I was wearing. The food may be average or not what you would expect. Don't you need to clean up after eating? It seems OK to leave the dishes on the table as is. A famous amusement park with several branches around the world Its branches: Los Angeles - Orlando - Japan - Singapore . Singapore Branch: It is very beautiful and I recommend visiting it, but its only drawback is the high entry prices! Especially when purchasing express boarding tickets . Its location in Singapore: on Sentosa Island, specifically at Resorts World Sentosa . The amusement park is divided into seven parts (Hollywood, Ancient Egypt, New York, Madagascar, The Lost World, The Future, and Fantasy Movie Celebrities) . What are the activities at Universal? - It contains 15 games (if I am not disappointed) divided between children and adults. - It has live shows, the most beautiful of which is (The Water Show), which is a very beautiful live action comedy film through which you can see how action films are made - It has the Hollywood Walk of Fame - You can take pictures with characters such as (Shrek and Princess Fiona - Pussy in Boots - Madagascar characters - Minions - Sesame World - Transformers) - There are gift and souvenir shops - There are (halal) restaurants, and I repeat the word (halal) because before traveling I asked and they told me to take food with you, there are no halal restaurants!! I was surprised by three restaurants with the (Halal) logo, even though I was not careful to search and did not see the rest of the restaurants. Maybe they are all halal after all (The restaurants I saw were halal: one in the fantasy films section, one in the Madagascar section, and one in the ancient Egypt section) . Experienced advice when visiting Universal: - It is best to visit it on other weekends to avoid severe crowding - Attend at the beginning of the day so that all the games can be played - Buy an express boarding ticket in case there is crowding, because the wait at the games is very long, reaching from half an hour to a full hour sometimes. - Ask about show times when entering . Prices: Large: 74 Small: 54 Express Boarding: Add 30 to the ticket, whether large or small . Working hours 10am - 8pm . It's over For details of my trip to Singapore On my Instagram account asma116

In addition to taking photos in the park, you can also take the elevator directly to the Merlion's lion's mouth viewing platform, and have a bird's-eye view of the entire Sentosa and Singapore island from the mouth. Universal Studios Singapore is a theme park located within Resorts World Sentosa on Sentosa Island, Singapore. It features 28 rides, shows, and attractions in seven themed zones. [Non-Resident] Universal Studios Singapore One-Day Ticket Adult (Age 13-59) - SGD81 Child (Age 4-12) - SGD61 Senior (Age 60 and above) - SGD43 [Singapore Resident] Universal Studios Singapore One-Day Ticket Adult (Age 13-59) - SGD66 Child (Age 4-12) - SGD58 Senior (Age 60 and above) - SGD43 ID required for entry. Any day of the year is a good time to come. But if you want to avoid crowds, take note that the Park is busiest on the weekends and during the March, June, September and December school holidays. Seven Themed Zones...... HollywoodThemed after the real Hollywood Boulevard of the 1970s. Framed by "dynamic" architecture, palm trees and a replica of the Hollywood 'Walk of Fame'. New YorkThemed after post-modern New York City. Features replicas of New York landmarks. The area is enhanced by neon lights and flanked by street facades. Sci-Fi CityTMThemed after what cities and metropolis "may look like in the future", according to popular science fiction franchises. Ancient EgyptThemed after the Egyptian architecture and artifacts found during the "Golden Age of Egyptian Exploration in the 1930s". The Lost WorldTMThemed after two franchises, Jurassic Park and Waterworld, which each have separate areas within the zone. Far Far AwayThemed after The Kingdom of Far Far Away featured in DreamWorks Animation's Shrek. MadagascarThemed after DreamWorks Animation's Madagascar. The zone features a displaced cargo ship and river. In a word Universal Studios Singapore is a nice place.I request everyone pls visit this nice place .....

5.review_text: Universal studios is the dad of theme park. A must visit place in Singapore. I might say the first priority should be Universal studios. Few tips I would like to share which I knew earlier which helped me a lot. 1. Bring some food. I would say a lot . You would be a very very hungry during all the rides and the food inside is bit costly 2. Take a big bottle of water. Be hydrated all the time. There is dispenser and wash rooms all over the place 3. Check your locker timing. After 120 minutes it's chargeable. So what you can do is takeout your stuff and place again with different a locker 4. Go for rollercoaster first. It will remain busy until the end. So be sure you make it there within the first few. Then comeback and enjoy the rest 5. I will suggest you take an express pass. But I found it useless if you are travelling alone or you guys have the vibe of going to every rides alone then you can save around 60 to 70 SGD. There is a line for single riders which is pretty quicker than express pass. But keep in mind it will not work in rollercoaster. 6. I would suggest you allways take someone with you so that you have someone who can take pictures for you since there is a lot to click. Also take a selfie stick which cost hardly 3 SGD. This also gives you a good company. 7. If rank then my order would be rollercoaster, mummy ride, transformers ride, Jurassic park ride, pic with talking transformers, minions, etc, pics in hollywood, newyork, etc. All above are my personal views from my personal experience yours might differ. Verdict : A day full of fun

Such an amazing experience! The good points: 1) Its so easy to get there. Get to MRT station of Harbourfront and then a 5 minutes train directly to the park from Vivocity mall. 2) Price is just fair. 3) The park has a total of around 8 rides (some for kids and some for adults) in addition to some other activities (4D movies and etc.) 4) The park is convenient and quite small, so you can really have it covered in a full day. 5) The atmosphere and theme of the park are amazing. Everything is done really well and into the details. Some disadvantages: 1) Some of the rides might be closed randomly on days you come. You just have to find out(no worries though, the main ones are active) 2) I visited on a a moderately low day. In high season waiting can be over an hour and even longer for most rides. Honestly I dont think the most are worth waiting more than 45 minutes tops except for the top best rides. But thats a more personal thing. 3) The park is real fun, but having said point number 2, the best of the park really comes down to 3-4 rides (for those who love the adrenaline), which are always really busy and waiting is long. To sum up - Amazing experience, be prepared for some waiting on busy days. Dont miss it if you are in Singapore

I have been wanting to come for a long time, and I finally made the pilgrimage today The first time I came here, I saw a long queue and walked into a tsukemen specialty store by mistake. It is really rare to have tsukemen in Taiwan. The first time I tried it, I really thought it was great. I both liked it spicy and numb. I chose the incremental line and added a portion of meat, but the meat was a bit deducted. Their barbecued pork is the three-layer fat type, but about half of the meat I got was a whole piece of fat... This is It's really a little disappointing, but the meat is very fragrant and delicious overall. It's just that I haven't eaten something so greasy in a long time. The dipping sauce is also on the oily side, and the meat is actually full of fat... I really feel like my femoral vessels are getting clogged after eating it. It feels like staying here, but fortunately the fried bean sprouts in the store are really delicious and not greasy. Otherwise, people who dont usually eat greasy food will have to think about it. Overall, the taste is very good, so you can come here. A store to try.

Reaching Universal studios: Reach Harbour front station ( Which is in Vivo city mall) Take the sentosa monorail to Waterfront station. Tickets: Buy it at the Sentosa ticket counter on the top floor of Vivo city mall. ( There are usually discounts and not many people buy tickets here so there is less queue) Show the Coupon in the guest service which to the left of Universal globe , they will give you your entrance pass. ( If you buy tickets online, which is what 50% of the people do, you have to stand in a long queue to redeem the voucher and get an entry, same goes for buying tickets in the counter) When to go : If you are a tourist plan for this on Wednesday or Thursday. Never between Friday and Sunday. Food: The food here is pricey and not worth buying... Carry food with you , there is no checking done here. So no worries. ( But please don't litter) Water : Available everywhere, in the entrance of each attraction you have watertaps. Baggage: Two/ three rides require you to deposit even your phone and wallet in a locker which is free for upto 45 mins, which is near the ride itself. Make use of them. When you go on a weekday express pass is not needed. There are plenty of meet and greet in each part. Download Universal studios singapore app. It is very useful. DO NOT MISS VELOCIRAPTOR " BLUE" MEET AND GREET Pro tip: Take a body pain tablet before reaching Universal studios.

5.review_text: Universal Studios is a one of a kind experience in Singapore. It is on every traveller's list by default. Do not miss their special rides - Transformers, Ripples, The mummy ride and the 2 roller coasters. Book tickets in advance on Klook. Express entry tickets help you tour the entire park in a day's time, otherwise making it impossible to cover everything. If you're pressed for time, do opt for the express entry pass. Unless you're very keen on repeating rides, do not go for an unlimited ticket. Food options for vegetarians is very limited and equally expensive. We found an Afghani restaurant serving veg biriyani at SGD16 per plate! The number of restaurants inside the theme park seem to have significantly reduced over time, only adding to wait time and longer queues in the ones open. Keep some finger food handy for emergencies. Lots of options for souvenirs as well - every ride exit lands you into one! But the collection you find here is very unique and not available in the local markets of Singapore. So try to finish everything by 5 p.m and spend some quality time in these shops. Every ride, every shop and every eatery closes at 6 p.m sharp, so last minute hurry can be avoided with better planning. First time experiences at such places is always a good memory to cherish, enjoy yours while it lasts!
Must visit place for those who go to singapore. Especially for families. Really wonderful experience

The place need no description. It's one of the important and must visit attractions in Singapore. It has attractions for almost all age groups and interests. Especially thrilling with their roller coaster rides with theme of their characters or shows. There are lot of live activities by the characters themselves and allow you to click pics with them, with a good thing also being you can click using your own camera or phone as well apart from their official click. While their entrance ticket gives entry to pretty much all the attractions, a special pass called Express Pass will help you skip the long waiting lines of upto 40-60 mins on some of the attractions, especially the fast moving rides. You can buy the Express Pass over the counter which costs SGD 50 for one time use for applicable shows but can cost lesser sometimes if booked online. There are multiple food outlets too if different cuisines and named after some of their shows or themes. The park itself is divided into different zones basis their various shows. One would certainly need a whole day to explore the place fully.

Family Fun !! Located within resorts world sentosa at Sentosa. Features one of the best roller coaster rides! Cyclone and Human- not for the faint hearted. Universal Studios Singapore, the second largest Universal Studios in Asia and currently the smallest in the world (actually quite similar to Leofoo Village in Taiwan), is located in Resorts World Sentosa in Singapore. The newly built "Minion Park" is expected to be completed in phases by 2025. However, there are already many Minions in the park, but I personally feel that the characters from Sesame Street are still the main attraction. Universal Studios Singapore is divided into seven themed areas: Hollywood, New York, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, and Madagascar... Before the trip, I read on the Internet that there were relatively few people and queues on weekdays, but when I arrived at the venue, I found out, yes! Sure enough, the Internet cant completely believe itBut maybe everyone is comparing it to the standard of Universal Studios Japan after the lockdown is lifted. If so, I still agree... 3.review_text: The smallest Universal Studios in the world Don't forget that the park opens at 11. The admission arrangement is really chaotic. The traffic flow is not properly arranged, many people cut in line, which is disappointing There are many drinking water places in the park, but there is water everywhere. A fly in the ointment The food area inside is so expensive that you can understand that it is an amusement area after all. A vending machine with a large sales volume The park will not help to deal with the failure, it feels like a tiger eating dumplings Since it is located in the tropical zone, the park is not very big. Can't we do more sunshade or cooling? Not only is it inconsiderate, it also makes people feel like they are trying to rob you of your money. Universal Studios Singapore is the second Universal Studios in Asia, second only to Universal Studios Osaka. It is also the smallest Universal Studios in the world with the cheapest tickets. Universal Studios Singapore covers an area of 20 hectares and took three years to build. It is the only movie theme park in Southeast Asia. It is no exaggeration to say that it is a dream-come-true paradise for adults and children. Universal Studios Singapore is located in Resorts World Sentosa, which cost SGD 7 billion (approximately NT 168.7 billion) to build. Travelers can take the Singapore MRT and get off at Harbourfront Station. After arriving at Vivo City, 01. Transfer to Sentosa Express: The fare is SD4 (about NT. 93), which can be paid with an Ez-link card. You can take it unlimited times without leaving Sentosa. It takes about 5 to 10 minutes and the operating hours are 07:00 to 24:00. You can take the Sentosa MRT on the 3rd floor (Lobby L) of VivoCity, and to Universal Studios, just take the Waterfront MRT Station. PS. If you are staying in Sentosa, you can exchange your free island entry ticket by showing your hotel check-in certificate to the light rail ticket counter staff. Take your ticket to the manual ticket checker and you can enter the island for free. The hotel will also give you a free ticket to enter the island, which means you can leave the island once and then enter Sentosa for free!

4.review_text: Visited on Tuesday 4th of July. First of all, buying tickets beforehand does not give you any advantage. Your online tickets will have RFQ code but at the gate they cannot read it, they will ask you to issue tickets from the ticketing office with BAR code. That would take up to 60min on a weekday if you are lucky. 1-Try to be there before 11am to avoid any delays. 2-Download the Universal Studios Singapore app to track which attraction has how many minutes of waiting time. 3-The attractions are all close to each other, so, dont worry about losing any chance to ride any of your favorite attractions. 4-I highly recommend that you tour the attractions a day before on YouTube to check what you like and what you dont. 5-Start with the ride you like which has 40min or less waiting time. You will be able to get there faster than 40min. 6-I did not see it worth to buy the faster access which is S90.00 additional to your adult ticket (which is S82.00)!. 7-All attractions are accessible from outdoor so in any case have rain coats and be prepared for a rainy day. 8-We were able to ride 7 out of 9 rides we planned to ride. 9-It is worth visiting and you can still have some more time to spend your evening somewhere else inside Sentosa island or back to the city. Finally, prepare a list of what you wish to do there and you will enjoy the experience. Thank you for reading so far.

3.review_text: It is much different in scale from Universal Studios Japan and has few facilities. Universal Studios Singapore is the smallest Universal Studios in the world. The park is divided into 7 theme areas, namely: Hollywood, New York, Science Fiction City, Ancient Egypt, Lost World, Far Far Away and Madagascar. Today is already October 31st, and the weather is still so hot! Friends who come here must remember to wear sunscreen and bring a water bottle. There are water dispensers everywhere that can fill water As for the facilities, we highly recommend Transformers 3D Showdown and Shrek 4D Movie, and we have seen almost all of the show parts. The park is really not big, the souvenirs are not particularly impressive, and the desire for shopping is much weakened. It is recommended to come on weekdays, as there is no need to queue for a long time for the facilities, and you can have fun quickly!

4.review_text: Its been three times since I visited Universal, and this time I participated in the Halloween event! The fare on Kkdays is about NT2,000, and the express customs clearance is about NT2,000. The admission ticket and the express pass are purchased separately. The admission ticket also comes with an additional six yuan of Singapore dollars that can be used to purchase souvenirs or food and drinks in restaurants. It cannot be consumed at roadside stalls and specific areas. The Halloween event is from 7:30-00:30 in the evening, so you can arrive early to take photos. There was no queue for us to enter the park, we only had to queue to enter the facilities inside. In addition to five haunted houses, three horror experience areas, and two music performances at night, almost half of the amusement facilities are open for fun. The most exciting thing is the roller coaster. There are many kinds of roller coasters in the park with different ways to play. The difference between a haunted house and a horror experience area is the indoor haunted house and the outdoor haunted house. There are occasionally some staff dressed as ghosts or zombies on the roadside in the park, but they are very calm and will not chase them. The makeup is not particular, and they basically just wear masks and costumes. The style of haunted houses is much different from that of European and American haunted houses in the United States, Canada, etc. Maybe its because everyones physical and mental health needs to be taken into consideration? Although the event is not recommended for people under the age of 13, no children that young were seen participating. In short, this amusement park is suitable for first-time haunted house visitors.
Amazing studio with different theme and attractions. Nearby Sentosa island and beach a must to visit.

5.review_text: One of the must visit places at Singapore. People of all age groups will enjoy. Human and cyclone roller coaster, Mummy, Transformers ride are must visits.

Definitely smaller than Japan. It was convenient to purchase admission tickets in advance. You can go in and purchase an express ticket. It's small, but you can spend a lot of time just by using the express ticket. Worth going at least once when you come to Singapore.

Universal Studios Singapore, 29 September 2023 Hiii, this is my first time playing far away from Singapore exploring alone in someone else's country. Starting from the accommodation at 10.00 Dunloop Street, walk towards Little India to take the MRT to Vivo City. Arriving at Vivo City we go straight to the bus stop, there is a special stop for Sentosa - HarbourFront Stn, about 30 minutes with views of the city across the bridge until we arrive at USS yeaaaaaa.. Alone on the USS? yup, explore on your own, (noted: you have previously ordered USS tickets on OTA, guys) so when you arrive at USS, take a photo first in front of the Universal Studios Singapore icon. Erm, because I was alone, I was brave enough to ask another tourist to take a photo, hehehe... armed with it, Hi miss, can you help me to take a picture here? Luckily they want to, or sometimes take photos instead. Wait, if you go to USS, your provider doesn't have a signal, don't worry. Because at USS there is public wifi that can be used. It's a good idea if you go to USS to download the Universal SG app, why? because with this application you can know the location of rides and waiting times in line. Very useful for those of us who want to try all the rides. Because I'm alone, I can really queue at Single Rider, a queue that complements the regular queue where they usually want to ride at the same time as friends or family, honestly this saves a lot of time. Yes, although not all rides can do it. Every certain time there is a show like that, you can check the app for the schedule, so we can take photos with several icons, come here Minnion tunes, transformers etc. There are several rides where it's best not to bring luggage (for example hats, glasses, cellphones) you can store them in a locker first, it's free within a certain time limit. You can try all the rides, the most impressive one is of course the Sci-Fi City ride on the Human Battlestar Galatica, I wanted to try the Cylon one but the queue was 80 minutes at that time, it was really long, The second ride that is a must try is in Ancient Egypt, you have to enter through a long corridor with a very mummy atmosphere, you get a really scary feel, riding a train in the dark. At the end there will be a photo of us taken while riding the ride, you can also ask for a print, hello. The third ride is at Lost World, Canopy Flyer and again it is great for single riders. Really like the Far Far Away location, the location is really beautiful.
Iconic place of Singapore. Must visit

3.review_text: Universal Singapore is a shock. Frankly, I did not like it. I find it beautiful, but it is not comparable to America and Japan at all. There are very few sweet toys around it. We enjoyed the day, but it is forbidden for her for the amount, according to the singer. A big shock. Next to it is a place of luxurious hotels and restaurants and markets. A wonderful place for walking and watching. Transportation is free. Closed and open buses, locomotives, and even golf cars. We rode it for free for transportation. Free restrooms and cold water are available. Everywhere, even in the middle of the games, there are food and sweets stalls everywhere, halal and non-halal restaurants are available
