5.review_text: This place is located on Koh Sae Sa, you can come by car or walk. But on that day that I went to use it, I personally felt that it was quite serious. Inside, there were various rides that I personally felt were quite fun. There were also bar rides and rides that were a little scary, such as mummy. If anyone goes to Singapore and feels like they should come here as well, you can't miss it.

Universal Studios Singapore is located on Sentosa Island. This time I went alone. The park is large enough that you can walk around it in about 20 minutes without riding anything, so it was great that you didn't get tired of walking. Attractions can be navigated better using a single rider. There are no attractions to take photos of, so there were quite a few young people who were enjoying themselves as single riders, even if they came in groups. In addition, I thought the prices of goods in the park were well, this is what it is'', but the food is expensive. Even if the portion size is the same, I felt that the prices were different depending on the location, such as restaurants, cafes, and outdoor stalls, so I think it's a good idea to walk a little bit to find what you want to eat.

It's really nice to spend time here. It is recommended to go early so it is not too crowded. And bring a hat because it's a bit hot. Enter from Vivo station towards Sentosa Express to get cheaper costs
One of the must-visit destinations if we travel to Singapore
Without visiting this place the Trip is Incomplete.. its very important place to visit in Singapore

1.review_text: Don't waste your time and nerves here if you are in Singapore for just a couple of days. Especially around public holidays is very crowded.

I am really surprised that USS prides itself as a tourist attraction but it doesnt even have a charging station for handphone, or even allow guests to do charging. Even when i go to malaysia, japan, korea and even taiwan, charging of handphone can be found easily. But not in USS.

3.review_text: Very nice theme park in Singapore.

4.review_text: Beautiful place in singapore. We can visit... Most visited place in singapore..

This is one of the most enjoyable memories of my trip to Singapore. I always like amusement parks and have been to Universal Studios in other countries, but this one is small but mighty!? I got the feeling that although the place itself is not big, it had a lot of really impactful rides and it was worth the money just to be able to see shows like Water World. There were a lot of rides for younger children to ride and a lot of things to see. The ride itself was such a refreshing shock and fun. If I visit Singapore again, I think it will be because of this place. However, there were too many choices when purchasing tickets, so it was a bit annoying for someone like me. I'm wondering if it would be a good idea to narrow it down to just two or three.

5.review_text: Must visit if you planning to travel Singapore. Once in lifetime experience
Whoever visits Singapore must visit Universal studio as is once in a life experience. See, shows like transformer, Mummy, water world, Jurassic park to be part of its live thrills. Amazing.
Great place and Must try place while visit to SG. Ensure to not visit on PH and Weekend as crowded and long queues for rides
Great experience, truly a must-visit destination when going to Singapore. Recommend everyone
Best place to have fun with family and friends. The rides are amazing and all the show are entertaining there. Singapore

4.review_text: It's really small! You can quickly see it all in about 3 hours. The group I went with tried to buy express tickets, but they were already sold out. They say they were sold out within 2 hours of opening. I think it's because it's the end-of-year season. There was also a VIP ticket that included an express and private guided tour, but it was about 400 per person, so I thought about it but decided against it. In the end, it was a good thing I didnt buy it! Because it was a rainy day, there were times when people flocked to certain attractions. If you download the Universal Map app (required) and watch the real-time waiting times (make sure to bookmark things to ride, see, and eat in advance), you will be able to enjoy the experience efficiently. Since a lot of children come here, if you get the timing right, you can ride without having to wait, and if you're not afraid of rain, you can ride even more comfortably haha. Attraction Recommendations & Recommendations - Siron is more fun than Human - I didn't like Shrek 4D... - Transformers 3D front row seat recommended - Highly recommend the Water World show! - Mummy Recommendation - Jurassic Park Rapids recommendation (everything is wet. Everything is wet.) - Spaghetti is completely for babies haha. Recommended if you like cute things. -The Indian restaurant was delicious. - Most souvenirs are available at the universal shop at the entrance, so there is no need to stop by each shop. Additionally, Sentosa Island has ziplines and luges, so it would be nice to spend a day enjoying them all. After getting wet and raining, it got cold as the sun went down, so I bought a Shrek blanket and covered myself with it. I think it would be a good idea to bring a raincoat, towel, and blanket if you can. You never know when it will rain in Singapore.

Second time visiting Universal studios. Thrilling rides, amazing experience. Started with the Transformer ride, then the mummy ride and then went for Jurassic world. Was surprised, as we went for transformers we were told there was some technical snag and ride was cancelled indefinitely for the day. Just as we were about to leave they started allowing people back again. Mummy ride should not be missed. Around 1.15 pm just as we were strolling the park the water world show was about to start. Luckily we were just near. I enjoyed the show. It's amazing to see their clean choreographed act. In between this decided to do the spaghetti sesame street ride. The queue was big but the ride was not worth it. Because its for small kids :P next we saw the Light camera action show by Steven Spielberg. It shows how a movie scene is made. It shows a cyclone hitting a city. Look out for the character greet and meet. They have specific timings. We saw Gru from indespicable me, Maurice from Madagascar, Sesame street characters. There was one dance show around the corner but we missed it twice [sigh] At last the two rides which will make u feel ur money worth The Galactica Cyclone and the Human. Did both one after another. Its gets your adrenaline rush instantaneously. There are lockers all around the rides which are free for use upto 20-45 min. There are plenty of restaurant options u can try. Worth visiting if u r in Singapore.

5.review_text: I only visited the globe outside as I was actually visiting the water park and aquarium. Many people went in and came out looking happy and had enjoyed themselves. If I had more time in Singapore I would definitely of gone but it is something I can do next time.

Playground for roller coaster lovers. But if you don't want a roller coaster, there are still lots of rides you can enjoy. For 4D, it's really great. The water world show is also interesting to watch. Lots of lockers to store bags if you want to go on wet rides or roller coasters. If you don't want to get wet, bring a disposable raincoat. If you want to buy inside, you can, but the price is 6 . For food, lots of choices. The price is pretty good in rupiah. But delicious. Don't forget to bring a tumbler because there are lots of places to fill drinking water.

USS is what it is abbreviated to. The first impression was quite cool, as soon as we entered, all vehicles were directed to the bus parking which turned out to be in the basement. Go up the escalator, then you will meet the UNIVERSAL Globe Ball (everyone's favorite photo spot). Because we use a tour vendor, all USS ticket accommodation is facilitated, just check in at the gate. This is on a weekday, it's quite busy but comfortable enough for photos. The prices of food, snacks and other snacks here are quite expensive, in Singapore Dollars, prepare enough funds, master cards, QR payments, cash are also still accepted. There are lockers available to store luggage or other things if you want to enter the vehicle, provided that without any luggage, cellphones, coins, raincoats, shoe covers, even mountain shoes must be removed. If you don't want to queue, you can use an Express Card, there are several options for just 1 ride, or several rides but you can only play 1 time, or unlimited (the latter apparently can cost up to 200 Singapore Dollars). Don't forget for those who drink a lot, there are drinking water refill spots for tumblers or direct drinks. So all toilets, clean and comfortable. There are quite a lot of tables in the restaurant/cafe, there's still a chance of getting a table quickly, unless it's peak season, school holidays or something else. The price of food at the restaurant I went to was in the range of 20 - 40 Singapore Dollars, not including drinks. When I came in January, it rained all day starting at 1 pm, you had to prepare a rain coat, shoe cover and bag cover. It's comfortable going around the rides, and it turns out that what used to be a waiting list of 60-100 minutes in heavy rain conditions has become around 5 minutes!!! You should install the USS application in Playstore, so you can monitor updates on waiting times for each ride. Happy holiday.
Must-see attractions in Singapore One day is really not enough fun

One of the best attractions in Singapore. Had an amazing time in Universal Studios. Its mesmerising and you need a complete day to explore it. Never miss the Transformers ride and Waterworld stunt show.

4.review_text: Entrance ticket using the monorail is 4 SGD on the 2024 Chinese New Year holiday. The place is quite dirty because there are lots of foreign tourists :(( the queues are also long even though it's nice to have the monorail :( Maybe you can try it next time, if this is your first experience, it's 8/10 Take the ferry from Batam, pp. 700 and visa free. Cuss on holiday!!
Have been to universal studios in LA . It does have more rides and attractions as compared to Singapore However Been always a pleasure being at universal studios Loved it

Universal Studios Singapore is a theme park destination suitable for all ages looking for fun or maybe tourism.The place has many zones to explore such as the Hollywood zone filled with lush palm trees. Outstanding architecture first in order Of course, the name Hollywood must have the famous Walk of Fame located! You'll also find your favorite cute characters welcoming you at the entrance to the park, including Sesame Street, Turntables Lake Hollywood Spectacular, and you can even secretly meet the Minions here! The appearance time of various characters will be seen in the surrounding area. In this zone there will be a show called Monster Rock.Next will be the Madagascar zone. In this zone, there are Madagascar: A Create Adventure, King Julien's Beach Party-Go-Round and Madagascar Boogie! rides. Most of the time, they are rides that are designed more suitable for small children. Next will be the Far Far Away zone, which will be the location of Princess Fiona or Far Far Away Castle from Shrek! big green giant As mentioned, there are a lot and overwhelmingly interesting. If I said it all it would be very long, so the remaining zone is The Lost World. Ancient Egypt in this zone is my favorite zone because it has Revenge of the Mummy. It's an indoor roller coaster.As mentioned, this is not all of the amusement parks, but because there are so many of them, they attract many people to visit, which may cause a little bit of crowding.

Universal Studios Singapore: A Fun Experience, But Consider Universal Studios Japan for a Fuller Adventure Universal Studios Singapore offers a fun and enjoyable experience, but for those seeking a more extensive adventure, Universal Studios Japan might be the better choice. While Universal Studios Singapore is relatively smaller and offers fewer rides compared to its counterpart in Japan, it still provides a range of entertaining attractions and experiences. To make the most of your time at Universal Studios Singapore, consider purchasing express passes to minimize wait times for popular rides. This allows you to enjoy more attractions without spending too much time in queues. After a day of thrilling adventures, you can head back to Sentosa Island, where Universal Studios Singapore is located. Sentosa boasts a variety of dining options, allowing you to refuel and relax after a day of excitement.
One of main tourist attraction

5.review_text: A very busy place visited by domestic and foreign tourists, located on Sentosa Island, Singapore. If you want to go there you have to buy a return ticket for 4 Singapore per person. Place to buy tickets at Vivo City Mall, 3rd floor.

Great theme park really worth visiting if you are a tourist in singapore or even a permanent resident, roller coaster is great especially the human one, dinosaur glider was fun too. Personally my favourite was the jurassic world raft ride, food there is great, many tasty snacks, overall great tourist attraction
Great place. I recommend the Transformers attraction. A must-see place on the map when visiting Singapore

Great and compact amusement park in SEA. When buys souvenir, pay with Mastercard to get 10% off. Very helpful staffs like Francis, recommended us to get tax refund when purchased above 100 SGD. New zone, Minion Land is coming end of 2024.
One of the nicest and well maintained place in Singapore. Rides and attractions are very popular here. Definitely must try place.

4.review_text: Universal Singapore is a smaller version of Universal Orlando. Tickets are cheaper than Orlando's, which is justified by the smaller number of attractions. I found the park more geared toward children, but adults can also have fun. The outdoor areas are a very interesting experience and reflect the country's history well. When I was there in February 2024, there was a construction site for a new attraction. I faced a few lines, and in one of them there was a technical stoppage with no forecast for the ride to return. I found this frustrating, because they were encouraging people to give up. I was at the front, and if I gave up, I would have to wait in line when the rides started working again. The right thing to do would be to clear the line and close the ride. The best thing to do is to download the Universal app, where you can favorite the rides you want to go on, and in the app you can track the queue time. The problem is that you can't follow the route in sequence, and you go back and forth to places when the queue is shorter. The best time to avoid waiting in line is at the end of the day. Then the queues are much shorter. Just pay attention to the shows, which have limited times. As for food, there are some options that aren't so cheap, but I didn't think they were exorbitantly priced. I went there and came back using a ride-hailing app to save time, but on the way back the drivers don't accept rides, and it's more expensive than the outward journey. The island and the area near the park are also very beautiful attractions. If you have time on your trip and are traveling with young people and children, it's a good experience. We stayed there until the park closed.

There are many attractions. I wasn't able to ride Transformers Battlestar, but I was satisfied with Transformers The Ride. The downside is that the price is too expensive. A small key ring costs 10 Singapore dollars each, so if you need a lot of souvenirs, we recommend bringing at least 100 Singapore dollars. The most expensive thing I saw was a snow globe with the Universal Studios logo costing 68 Singaipol. Shrek has a small Ferris wheel inside the store. (For children) It's quite disappointing that it ends at 6 o'clock, so I really recommend coming early and having an open run. For reference, there are a lot of shows in between. Going to Jurassic Park on that boat feels like a combination of a Whoop Ride and the Amazon Express. If you think 'I'll only get a little wet', you'll be wrong. You'll need a raincoat, and Daiso sells something that costs 1,000 won for 5 Singapore dollars, so the price difference is at least 5 times more. So, if you are going to ride, I recommend buying a raincoat in Korea.

Fun activity to do in Singapore !! No doubt, it s a incomplet park if you compare with other universal studios around the world! Would recommend it if you have extra days in the city ! The best attraction for adults who arent scared is CYCLON !

After visit in 2019 I visited again in 2024. I went in at opening time at 10 a.m. and left around 3 p.m. I think I rode most of the rides. When it's hot, I think it would be a good idea to refer to the indoor show schedule and move accordingly.

5.review_text: It says don't go to Singapore if you don't go to this place.

It is an amusement park that can be visited alone. You can bring in a tripod as well. It makes taking pictures of yourself fun. Can be played on almost every device within half a day. without having to purchase an Express Pass. Disadvantages: Food and drinks are expensive. Because it is Singapore and the weather is quite hot. Makes it not as fun as in Japan But it's considered okay. The rides are fun. The locker system is very good. Give yourself 45 minutes. Come on a weekday. There won't be many people. There is a Single Rider for playing alone. The queue is 50% less.

The first time I came here with my husband, we came on a weekday and bought a Chinese New Year ticket package for 98 per person. Not bad because you can enter early, get a gift, food included, and shopping discount voucher. There are quite a lot of rides/attractions to choose from, even if you don't dare to go on an extreme ride like me, you can watch the attractions and ride the normal rides. Overall, it's really fun to come here all day, but the prices for the snacks are quite pricey, guys.
Great place to visit if you are in singapore ....better to avoid weekends to come here highly crowded and waiting for long time in ques..
Amazing experience must visit in Singapore. Express pass is recommended in weekends

4.review_text: A visit to universal studios is an absolute must if you are in singapore.It has great selection of entertainment and rides attractions it was an awesome experience everything is so well looked after. Book tickets is advance to avoid long queue.

This is a has to be a put it on your list kinda thing. We had just been at Hong Kong Disney 2 days prior, so it lacked atmosphere and magic by comparison, but was still pretty cool. There is a good range of coaster which we loved, some lesser easier rides. Food prices were ok, not rediculous. We did meet and greets with Bumble Bee and Megatron which was a lot of fun. We went over to Sentosa on the Monorail out of Vivo City Shopping Centre. That was cheap and so easy. It ain't no Disney, but it's still very cool and a must do.
If you have nowhere else to go, it's worth going at least once. However, since it is small and crowded, it would be better to go early or late if possible.

5.review_text: must visit place with family and friends when in singapore
One of the Iconic in Singapore. Must visit. Some rides have waiting which is worth for the rides.
Most tourists attraction place in Singapore.

Once in a lifetime experience, a must go destination if you are in Singapore. On weekends/public holiday there are too many people and big-big queues for any ride so my recommendation is going for express ticket else you wouldn't be able to have all the rides or see all the shows in 1 day. If you have normal ticket then it can take even 1 hour to be in queue and just cover 1 ride like transformer. Few rides might have shorter queue but again 30 min is minimum you have to wait for any ride. All the rides are worth going for and will provide you different experience. We could cover 3 rides and 2-3 shows overall in whole day and express ticket could have helped in covering all the rides. Though many rides are for adventurous people as they are either roller coaster or some other high speed rides and not everyone would love to do them so in that case normal tickets will be good enough. Transformer ride is a must go ride and will provide you a thrilling experience, it is a 3D ride and a unique experience, worth waiting for 1 hour in the queue for it. Stunt show was good and should be covered. Jurassic ride (Rapids Adventure I guess) is good but then at the end your clothes get wet so better to carry an additional pair or use rain coats (which is provided, might be at additional cost though). There are good food options inside though a bit costly but then you don't have any choice. You will get normal drinking water inside from taps. It was too hot so do carry sunglasses and caps. Overall a nice experience and recommended.

I have been to America and Singapore and they are all with the same level of organisation, entertainment and fun. This city is one of the first things on your list when you visit Singapore. You can go there by taxi, cable car or metro.

4.review_text: It's a good place to spend some time here. If you are traveling to Singapore for a vacation then my recommendation is to take the express pass and be done with USS by mid day, have a hearty meal at the gourmet food trucks and then head to Sentosa or plan for Harry Potter/s.e.a aquarium based on your interests

Feels magical to be in this place. I went there by sentosa express train from vivo city mall. You can buy the train ticket online or just tap with your visa card. The offline ticket offices closed at 6pm
Been there 4 times since 2013. So excited to see brand-new themed area - Minion Land is opening in late 2024. Definitely come back with my family and kids one more time

I really enjoyed our whole day walkathon here at USS. I'm just sad that the weather is kinda unpredictable in SG so we always have to pause in between fun stuffs. I still appreciate the whole USS, I haven't got to try all the rides because just the Revenge of the Mummy already traumatized me and made my tummy go upside down (I don't do rides that is why!). I'm glad we took a lot of photos though, I'd still want to know more and wander around USS again someday! Btw, as someone who did and studied theatre and film, the Lights, Camera, Action is my fave experience here, goosebumps!
It's best to bring an umbrella or hat when you come here because the location is quite hot. Purchasing tickets is cheaper via the application

5.review_text: If you are visiting singapore, this is a must place to visit. Similar to Disney world. Thrilled rides and lot of adventure exists. We Adults & Kids definetly love this, sometimes we think, we need to go the ride again & again. Best attractions which we shouldn't miss is Roller coster, Jurassic park rapid adventure, Canopy flyer, Avengers, Transformers, Revenge of Mummy etc., My badluck during visit is Revenge of Mummy is closed for maintenance. Every attractions is excellent. Better to start early in the day, make sure that we reach there by 9:30 am. Better to take MRT & bus to reach here. If we want to avoid waiting in queue, need to buy VIP pass, which costs more. For many attractions, the photography / video is not allowed. For some rides like jurassic park rapid adventure, bags are not allowed to take as there are high chances of getting wet. Few of them carry / purchase the rain covers to protect them from water. People who come early, first visit the attractions like Transformers, Avengers, Mummy etc., so there will be huge queue in front. If we want to avoid queue, better to come from last, so that we can avoid queues. Visit these attactions post the lunch, so that it will be empty. Food: - Food is costly here, we can carry some snacks / food to save money. Photo package: - People try to come and ask you to take photo package with unlimited photograph. If we take the package, sometimes the server will not work and finally we will end up of getting multiple tags. Consolidating photos from multiple tags will be tedious. Meet & Greet We can meet lot of characters like minions and few others and take photos. There are people who help to take photos with this characters using our phone. They take lot of photos too, so no worries. Though the ticket is costly, but it is worth to spend to enjoy. Make sure spending entire day till 5-6 pm, so that we dont miss any attractions.
Family & friends, Must visit in Singapore
Good theme park in Singapore.. must visit.. loved some rides overall good experience

This tourist park, which is a must visit when traveling in Singapore, contains various types of games, both adrenaline-fueled and relaxing and fun Tickets can be purchased on site or via third party websites or online applications. If you buy from a third party, you can simply scan the Barcode at the entrance without needing to print it to enter Access to this tourist park is very easy and simple because it is connected to the LRT Resorts World Sentosa Express Station, you just have to walk approximately 150 meters without worrying about being hit by rain or hot sun. If necessary, you can bring a folding umbrella or portable raincoat The facilities inside are very complete, toilets are available, there are many kinds of fast food restaurants selling snacks, drinks and even heavy meals. Small luggage lockers are available on some rides The instructions for each game ride are written very clearly for each rule, because some games require requirements such as height, not being sick, not being under medical care, etc. Some games can also involve getting wet, flashing lights (strobes), using fire, etc. So read first before boarding the game There are lots of tips and tricks for visiting Universal Studios Singapore on social media. My advice is to visit when it's not in the holiday season and don't come too late or early in the morning. Use sunscreen if necessary, bring your own portable raincoat if you want to save money

A Comprehensive Review of Universal Studios Singapore Prepare yourself for an extensive exploration into the wondrous world of Universal Studios Singapore, a realm where fantasy and reality converge to create an unparalleled experience of joy, excitement, and unbridled entertainment. Strap in, dear reader, for this journey promises to be as exhilarating as a ride on the most thrilling roller coaster. First and foremost, let us delve into the sheer magnitude of attractions that Universal Studios Singapore has to offer. From the moment you step foot into this fantastical realm, you are greeted by a cornucopia of wonders that cater to every age, interest, and inclination. Whether you find yourself wandering through the enchanting streets of Hollywood, traversing the jungles of Jurassic Park, or exploring the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City, there is no shortage of adventures to embark upon and memories to be made. But it is not just the quantity of attractions that sets Universal Studios Singapore apartit is the impeccable quality and attention to detail that truly elevate the experience to new heights. Each themed zone is meticulously crafted to transport visitors to far-flung realms and immerse them in the magic of their favorite films and franchises. From the lifelike animatronics of Transformers: The Ride to the pulse-pounding thrills of Revenge of the Mummy, every attraction is a testament to the artistry and ingenuity of its creators. And let us not forget the spectacular shows and entertainment offerings that grace the stages of Universal Studios Singapore. Whether you find yourself swept away by the dazzling spectacle of the Hollywood Dreams Parade, mesmerized by the death-defying stunts of WaterWorld, or laughing until your sides ache at the antics of the Sesame Street characters, there is no shortage of entertainment to captivate and delight audiences of all ages. But perhaps the true pice de rsistance of Universal Studios Singapore lies in its unparalleled commitment to guest satisfaction and comfort. From the immaculate cleanliness of the park grounds to the courteous and attentive service of the staff, every aspect of the visitor experience is carefully curated to ensure maximum enjoyment and relaxation. Whether you find yourself indulging in a delectable meal at one of the park's many dining establishments, cooling off with a refreshing beverage at a themed kiosk, or simply taking a moment to rest and recharge in one of the shaded seating areas, you can rest assured that you are in the capable hands of professionals who take pride in their work. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore stands as a shining beacon of excellence in the realm of theme park entertainment. With its vast array of attractions, impeccable attention to detail, and unwavering commitment to guest satisfaction, it is no wonder that visitors from around the globe flock to its gates in search of adventure and excitement. So come one, come all, and embark on a journey of discovery and delight that will leave you breathless with wonder and longing for more. Universal Studios Singapore awaits, ready to whisk you away on the adventure of a lifetime.

1.review_text: On June 15, 2024, we went to play the Transformers project. Before we took off our glasses and threw the bucket, we wanted to take a quick photo and leave. The result was that the Malay staff there called hafiq (bodoh sia) (simple English don understand) if you are right. You should be able to see his attitude clearly through the closed-circuit TV. He pulled his clothes and said his name to us, which fully reflected the work (professional) attitude of the staff.

4.review_text: Universal studios at Singapore is one of the must see places - well organised lot of of great rides and shows to enjoy and celebrate. The transformers, mummy, raft ride at the Jurassic world and the re-enacting movie stunt scenes are all excellent. Overall its worth to spend a whole day. One of the things noticed is a kind of discrimination in one of the rides by their attendants. We were waiting in the queue for long time and surprisingly found the attendant called his country men who were far away in the queue and surpassed us - never expected such an attitude.
It was hot and humid. But a must visit when in Singapore. Easier to go via cab rather than MRT. Food inside are quite expensive. Bring water!!!

Its one of the must-visit attractions, if you are coming to Singapore. The theme park contains a variety of thrilling indoor and outdoor rides, 2 types of roller coasters, a 4d show, a fairytale inspired castle, various meets and greets, etc. A must visit is the 'Transformers' 3D indoor ride and the " WaterWorld " show. In terms of dining and shopping, the theme park has a lot of options, which are pocket-friendly and well-maintained. The only downside is the amount of wait time some of the rides and attractions have, going up to or above an hour during peak, so recommended to visit the park during weekdays, or to purchase the Universal Express pass to reduce the wait time.

Visited second time but this time in the evening, so has to plan what rides to go. For meal, the ramen or fried rice at starbot cafe seems more worth, as compared some others. But expect queue and to get table.
An iconic place to take a picture in SG

5.review_text: A global destination for tourists. Must do activity while in Singapore. Try to book tickets prior with Express Pass facility to skip the queues. Worth spending some extra money for the pass since it will save a lot of time. Easier for small kids too. The whole Sentosa island is a tourist heaven. So many things to see and do. Universal Studios stand out as the top attraction for people of all ages. Keep in mind the height restrictions on some rides for small kids. Not to miss the Transformer rides.
A must visit during your singapore trip
You cant skip this when you visit Singapore.

It's impossible to cover the whole area within 1 day . We started our journey around 10 AM and left there at 7 PM but we could only covered upto 50-60% of the whole area . The ticket was 83 SGD and you can ride anything or go anywhere with this no extra charges needed. You can also ride multiple times in a single ride. It's really fascinating and enjoyable place to enjoy weekend holidays. You can also go for a date with your partner to enjoy the rides and you can also come with your family. Maximum rides are based on roller coaster . So, enjoy.

4.review_text: Universal Studios is a must visit place in Singapore for a great experience. It is a theme based park with full of attractions and activities that you will love and enjoy. It is better to enter the park at the opening time so you can experience almost all the rides there. Its better to take the tickets in advance and can avoid the long queue especially in the weekends. The fast track tickets are available, it will help to skip the long queue in rides. But we have to pay double the cost for normal, I think it worths. Otherwise it will take two or three days to complete experiencing all rides and activities. Never miss the roller coaster rides. In rainy weather they will stop most of the rides including roller coaster. Mobile phones are strictly not allowed in roller coaster. And they close at 6.00pm, its a very short time period for this mega adventure park. I strongly suggest to the management of Universal Studios to extend the time for closing to at least up to 07.30 pm. Anyway the time spend in this place is amazing, kids are really enjoying it. Be prepared with a raincoat if you don't want to get soaked, although they do provide drying machines. An umbrella is also a good idea. Tickets are available from vending machines and on weekdays, you can buy tickets right away with your credit card without having to wait in line. Go inside and there is a storage box near Egypt(?), but there are a lot of people, so let's leave it at the entrance. There aren't many places to buy souvenirs or drinks. Nice place for rides and Amusement Universal Studios Singapore is a premier theme park located on Sentosa Island, offering a variety of attractions and entertainment options. Heres a brief review: Highlights: 1. Themed Zones: The park features seven themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, and Sci-Fi City, each with unique rides, shows, and attractions that cater to different interests. 2. Thrilling Rides: Iconic attractions such as the Transformers Ride, Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, and Revenge of the Mummy provide thrilling experiences for adrenaline seekers. 3. Family-Friendly Options: There are plenty of rides and attractions suitable for younger children, such as the Madagascar: A Crate Adventure and the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase. 4. Live Shows: The park hosts entertaining live performances, including stunt shows and character meet-and-greets, adding to the immersive experience. 5. Dining and Shopping: A range of dining options, from quick snacks to sit-down meals, along with shops offering exclusive merchandise, enhances the overall experience. Considerations: Crowds: The park can get crowded, especially on weekends and holidays, so its advisable to arrive early or consider purchasing express passes to skip long lines. Ticket Prices: Entry tickets can be relatively pricey, so planning ahead for discounts or package deals is recommended. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination for thrill-seekers and families alike, providing a fun and immersive experience that brings beloved movies and characters to life.
First in Asia.

5.review_text: Universal Studios is a must-see if you are visiting Singapore. If you enjoy movie-themed rides, roller coasters, cartoon mascots, and all things silly and wonderful, this is the place for you! You cannot see everything in one day, so try to arrive as early as possible. However, here are a few tips: 1. Get an Express Pass or you will spend the majority of the day lining up for rides. Typical tickets require you to wait for 30-60 minutes or more, which is extremely frustrating! 2. I recommend bringing a personal fan and water with you. The humidity can make you tired quickly. Water is not cheap either! 3. Eat before you leave... So you have energy, and you will not have to spend as much money on food while you are there. Unless, of course, you are also there for the food.

We recently visited Universal Studios Singapore, and it was an exhilarating experience from start to finish! Nestled within the Resorts World Sentosa, this theme park offers an impressive array of attractions, shows, and dining options that cater to visitors of all ages. As soon as I entered the park, I was struck by the vibrant atmosphere and the detailed theming of each zone. From the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City to the enchanting streets of Far Far Away, every area is beautifully designed and immersive. The iconic Hollywood Boulevard sets the stage perfectly with its charming shops and street performances. One of the highlights of my visit was the rides. The **Transformers: The Ride** was a standout, combining cutting-edge technology with thrilling action that left me breathless. The **Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure** was another favorite, offering both excitement and a chance to cool off from the Singapore heat. For those seeking a more family-friendly experience, the **Shrek 4-D Adventure** was delightful, filled with humor and engaging visuals. The live shows were equally impressive. The **WaterWorld** stunt show was a thrilling spectacle with jaw-dropping stunts and pyrotechnics that captivated the audience. Its a must-see for anyone visiting the park! Dining options are plentiful, with various cuisines available. I enjoyed a delicious meal at Mel's Drive-In, which offered classic American fare in a retro setting. While the food was tasty, prices were a bit on the higher side, which is typical for theme parks. One thing to keep in mind is that the park can get quite crowded, especially on weekends and holidays. I recommend arriving early and considering an Express Pass to make the most of your day without long wait times. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination filled with fun, adventure, and unforgettable experiences. Whether youre a thrill-seeker or just looking to enjoy a day of entertainment, its a great choice. I left with wonderful memories and cant wait to return! Highly recommended for families and friends alike.

If youre in Singapore, visiting Universal Studios Singapore (USS) is a must! Its one of the top-rated theme parks in Asia, offering a mix of thrilling rides, amazing shows, and fun attractions for all ages. The park is divided into exciting zones like, Sci-Fi City, and Ancient Egypt, each with immersive themes. The highlight for me was the Transformers 3D Ride, and Minion Store. If youre a fan of adrenaline, dont miss Battlestar Galacticas dueling roller coasters theyre incredible! For families, theres plenty to enjoy, too. My group loved the Madagascar zone and the Shrek 4D Adventure. The parks food options were great as well, with plenty of choices for snacks and meals. Pro tips: Arrive early to beat the lines, grab an Express Pass if you can USS is definitely worth it for anyone looking for an unforgettable day of adventure and fun. Universal Studios Singapore is a world class theme park located on Sentosa Island Singapore, offering a thrilling mix of rides, attractions, and shows based on popular movies and TV shows. Its the first Universal Studios theme park in Southeast Asia and having seven themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, and Jurassic Park, each immersing visitors into the magic of cinema. When I visited about a year ago, I had an incredible time exploring the park. The highlight for me was definitely the extreme rides like the Battlestar Galactica rollercoaster and the Transformers 3D experience. The live shows, such as the Water world stunt show, were also fantastic, providing some great moments of excitement and humour. I really appreciated the immersive theming in each zone, and the parks attention to detail in food and merchandise added an extra layer of enjoyment. However, one downside I noticed was that the park can get quite crowded, especially during the weekend and the prices there for food and drinks is quite expensive, like a single water bottle there cost 4 Singaporean Dollar but the food was nice though like the churros i got. Wait times for some of the popular rides were longer than expected, and the park felt a bit cramped in certain areas. While the attractions are great, a few could use some updates or new features to keep things even more cool :). Despite these drawbacks, if you enjoy theme parks and can visit during weekday, I would definitely recommend Universal Studios Singapore. It offers a fun day out for families and friends, but be prepared for the weekend crowds if youre planning to go during at that time.

Universal Studios Singapore is an exhilarating destination that offers an unforgettable experience for visitors of all ages. Located on Sentosa Island, this world-class theme park features seven themed zones, each packed with exciting rides, shows, and attractions inspired by popular movies and TV series. From adrenaline-pumping roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica to immersive experiences like Transformers: The Ride, the park seamlessly blends cutting-edge technology with thrilling entertainment. The parks attention to detail creates a truly immersive environment, making guests feel like theyve stepped into the worlds of Jurassic Park, The Mummy, and Shrek. The live performances and character meet-and-greets add to the charm, ensuring fun for families and groups. Dining options and souvenir shops scattered throughout the park enhance the experience, providing opportunities to relax and take home memories. Whether you're seeking high-speed thrills or family-friendly attractions, Universal Studios Singapore delivers excitement at every turn. It's a must-visit attraction that showcases Singapore's ability to provide world-class entertainment.

A Thrilling Adventure at Universal Studios Singapore! Our recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience! We had an amazing time exploring the park and enjoying the rides. One of the highlights was the newly opened **Minion Land**it was incredibly fun, immersive, and perfect for all ages! From the adorable Minion-themed attractions to the vibrant atmosphere, it truly added a fresh and exciting experience to our visit. Although some outdoor rides were closed due to weather conditions for safety reasons, we still had a fantastic time enjoying the indoor attractions. The wait times were longer than usual, but the rides and experiences were absolutely worth it. The energy of the park, the friendly staff, and the well-designed themed areas made the day extra special. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore continues to be a must-visit destination. Rain or shine, there's always something exciting to do! Can't wait to visit again!

My first time going to the Universal Studios Singapore, and it was to check out the Minion Land. Very thrilling simulator ride for the Despicable Me Minion Mayhem. Very colourful Minion Village, and I enjoyed my Minion Land Raspberry Ice Cream. At Buddie Boogie, you can dance, play, and take photos with the lovable Minion characters. It's a fantastic spot for kids and adults alike to let loose, have fun, and create unforgettable memories. Visit the Minion Mart to shop for your favourite Plush toys, apparel, collectibles and etc. Good to book your ticket one day in advance on Resorts World website. Go early to avoid the crowd. Nearest MRT - Harbourfront, and take the Sentosa Express to Resorts World Station. Have fun.

4.review_text: Its a good place to visit but not as good as Disney world . Lesser attractions but a good visit in Singapore .
Dont skip this fav places as your destination in SG. Clean enough but very hot laaa Better you come in the morning.
There are a lot of people, most of them are tourists

It takes about 20 minutes by taxi from Orchard. (It was about 1,800 to 2,000 yen.) There was an entrance right after going up the escalator, and it took about 30 minutes to get inside. There are many tourists even on weekdays. It was open from 10am that day, but the hours change depending on the day, so it's best to check before going.

5.review_text: This is one place which draws tourism into Singapore, Must visit especially if you have kids or if child in you still alive and active. Express pass doldrums - if money is not constrain, buy a express pass to cover more events andake most of the day. Note.. if you don't buy pass, then download studios app nd shortlist your favourites and stick to that plan

Coming to Singapore for the second time But this time I really got to travel, came here, and really came to play. It was a lot of fun. It's not very big, but it was really fun. It took me half a day to play all over the place. But if you take it slowly, without hurrying, taking photos, playing and chilling, you might end the day without even realizing it. I really like it. The day I went was a weekday and it was raining lightly, but there were some stops. Some sunshine is considered very lucky. That's not hot at all. If it rains, choose to play in the shade. Or sit and watch a show When the sun came out, I took pictures of the beautiful light. Playing on outdoor playground equipment, very fun, very chill. You can bring food in. Because I was able to bring in snacks such as croissants, juice, fruit, and candy without being inspected much. As for water, if it feels heavy, you don't have to put it in. Because everywhere you go to play There will be free tap water to drink. There are lockers where you can leave your things for free for 45 minutes (some lockers are not free. You have to choose carefully) because some rides don't allow you to bring things in with you. Even the coins

Must visit while in Singapore trip an once a while . It will take complete 1day and keep some extra amount to visit nearby spots or shopping and entry fees aswell . You can come there by ropeway, but ropeway would be nice while evening mostly . Note - As general awareness, please use camera, mobile wisely and Don't show Indian psychology.

One of the well known travel destinations in Singapore that is located on Sentosa Island. It is popular for people of all ages. Need to buy a ticket to explore the inside here. Advance tickets are available online also as far i know. At least 3/4 hours is required to complete the full area. The place is included with a lot of adventure activities. Some activities carry the history of many places around the world and some activities are related to science fiction. All of these are made by artificial things, not from natural things. Inside here many food, coffee and ice cream shops are also presented. The prices are also similar to the outside.
Best theme park in Singapore. Constant updates of rides, so can visit every year.

1.review_text: For Malaysia, Indonesian, Philipino, other SEA ppl. Better dont go there. Singaporean are racist. Bad experience for me

3.review_text: If it's your first trip to Singapore, you should go to Universal! I was looking forward to it. Tickets were about 15,000 yen per person for the Univa and Night Safari pack from the Klook site. No matter how many times I tried, I couldn't get the QR code from the voucher, so I had a hard time, so I asked the hotel front desk to do it for me. It was quite troublesome. Use the MRT to get to UNIVA, and Singapore has a well-developed transportation network that is easy to understand, convenient, and fast. And you can go there safely and securely. And everyone is kind. After arriving at Univa, I was able to easily go around the attractions in about 2 hours and ride the attractions without waiting. Being in a subtropical region, I was physically exhausted from all the hard walking, so I decided to return home after about 3 hours. It's disappointing and expensive compared to Universal in Japan, but it was a great memory of my trip.

Yes its fun there but its hella expensive Entrance ticket already 80 and you still need to pay 5-10 for all the fun rides. The free ones are all those toddles rides. The food is so expensive!! I recommend just exploring sentosa in general and not come here unless u win lottery or something

You'll have an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! Minion Land is a must visit. Don't forget your Camera to capture all the fun moments The theming and decorations are incredible. The whole family will love it Get ready for a fun-filled day at Universal Studios Singapore. It's a dream come true for families and thrill-seekers alike

4.review_text: A fun holiday spot in Singapore, but very hot

A great theme park there is a separate Harry Potter experience too for which one has to purchase separately the tickets. The best rides are Cyclone (the best not for light-hearted) Human Mummy Shrek (4D) Transformer Jurassic Park Personally, i thought the Singapore Universal studio was smaller in size to Universal at LA- California

Today we went to Universal Studios Singapore. In contrast to Universal Studios Los Angeles, there is no Simpson here but Transformers. The amusement park is smaller and not comparable. This recreational facility is located on Sentosa Island. Here you can also visit Harry Potter and the underwater world and also the casino. Price for 2 adults and a child 230

5.review_text: Must visit place in Singapore. Any age you will enjoy it. to enjoy fully don't forget to but the ticket for skip the line that's my suggestion

Came here on March 20th. Because it's Wednesday, the queue isn't that long. I arrived at 2 pm and decided to go home at 7 pm. There aren't many rides that you can ride because it takes too long to take photos. Finding a spot is a bit tricky. So there were only about 10 rides to ride. But I've ridden all the best rides. Most like Battlestar Galactica! There are also cool ones like Transformers the Ride, Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure which gets wet, lights, camera, action are also really cool, there is a mummy rollercoaster too. And other rides that I haven't had the chance to ride yet. It is recommended to come from 10 am in the morning so you can enjoy all the rides! I won't regret coming here, even if I go to Singapore, I will go to USS again.

Had the chance to stop and cover here. In general, in terms of ride technology, what is here is 11-12 compared to that of Jatim Park 2 & 3 in the city of Batu, East Java. Only the thematic of the rides is different (because that is what is unique to each). For those who have big guts and are not afraid of sliding at high speed, it is recommended to try the Transformer, Roller Coaster and the Mummy. Shouting, screaming and crying of any kind is not prohibited. Suitable for those who have just broken up. There is also a Jurassic park. It's best to bring your own disposable raincoat. If you buy it here the price is 6 dollars. Lockers here are paid. Don't forget to bring an umbrella and hat. To get to Sentosa Island, you can take the tram (30 Sing Dollars) from Vivo station. You can also take the bus. If you can stand the heat, you can walk. There are also quite a lot of food sellers. The types of food sold are also varied with varying prices. If you want to buy souvenirs, there are lots of shops too. The price is 11-12 with prices in Indonesian tourist attractions. Don't forget to bring your own drinking water (because it's hot and very humid).

Since other places to visit in Singapore can easily be covered in half a day, I recommend spending a full day here. Since Disneyland and Universal Studio are located in certain countries, if you like theme parks, I think you should definitely visit them if they are available in the country you are visiting. I definitely recommend you come on weekdays and early in the morning. I arrived at 10 o'clock in the morning and first rode the Transformers ride, and although it was one of the most popular toys here, I did not wait in line at all, but after an hour, all the toys were full and the queues started to pile up. That's why I recommend you come as early as possible in the morning and ride the most popular rides before people get crowded. Also, the fast pass is just an added feature after purchasing the normal ticket. Do not buy it from the internet by mistake, otherwise you will have to buy an entry ticket again. I think if you are coming on a weekday, you do not need to buy a fast ticket, you can ride all of them with a little wait. There is no need to buy tickets online because the capacity of these parks is 50,000 people. I have never seen the tickets run out. You can buy them at the door with cash or card option. I recommend Transformers, Ancient Egypt, Human, and Jurassic Park, but ride knowing that in Jurassic Park you get quite wet, including your shoes. Water World was closed when I went, but it was among the must-visit places. The standard entrance ticket was 83 Singapore dollars, the price of adding the express pass was more expensive than the ticket. Also, if you follow the hours, Shrek and Minions characters greet each other and take photos. It is a very enjoyable and beautiful moment. I definitely recommend it. It is done many times a day.
The biggest theme park in Singapore. Various themes, minion, Jurassic Park, The Mummy, Transformer, The Trolls, etc. Need glasses and sunscreen when the weather is hot

4.review_text: Recommended for a first visit in SG. The no re-entry policy is garbage though. Be warned.
This is a must for your to-do list when visiting Singapore. Lots of fun experiences and rides for all ages. Worth the time

So much fun!! It's a bit hot. I went at 10 am and the entrance globe area was so hotttt!!!! The souvenirs are a bit pricey. Loved the sparkling road. Recommend to bring an umbrella and a hat. Try all the rides! My favourites are the sherk 3d one, and despicable me one. The Egypt one was so scary!! Love princess Fiona!!!
Fun experience! Can spend 2/3 - 1 day here! Quite small compared to other countries, but still enough rides and entertainment for a day.

5.review_text: If you go to Singapore you have to go to Universal Studio Singapore (USS), you can't go to Singapore if you don't come here...good...fun games...recommended to visit with friends

Universal Studios is definitely a one of the best attractions in Singapore as such. It is very neat and clean. It is well organized as well. If I remember correctly then it is smaller than the one that is there in Orlando but that is kind of expected. The attractions are nice. 1] There could be queues at some attractions, but they have an app which indicates the queue length at each attraction. 2] There are three huge roller coasters are one of the topmost attractions there. One larger than the other kinds. 3] There are rides like Transformers which are kind of virtual roller coaster rides and it is one of the top most attraction apart from roller coaster. 4] There are many rides like Puss in the boots which are for smaller kids 5] They also have 2-3 shows which are basically live and are arranged for only twice a day and run for 45 mins in each run. Please check the timings of the show as soon as you enter to enjoy them throughly. We had seen a show of Waterworld where they performed a lot of live stunts which was amazing to see. 6] Food options are relatively limited. If you are vegetarian they are only one or two options like Biryani inside. But it is not a big problem as such. 7] There are too many things to see so make sure that you reach there on time. 8] Please check that tickets are in order. I had booked a 3 day pass through Klook or similar site and it turnout that I had to mail them Universal first and then they send the tickets. This process wasted half an hour for me. So make sure you read the passes and conditions for entry.
One of the places you must visit when on holiday in Singapore

We had a fantastic day out here! We got here from Vivo City via the Sentosa Express train which is very convenient. The park is very well maintained and clean. We bought our tickets online so the entry to the park was no hassle. The energy inside the park is just awesome, everything was well organised from meet & greets to shows. There are plenty of food options too- from quick snacks and drinks to proper meals at theme styled restaurants. Overall it was a great experience from morning till evening with great memories to take home!

Worth visiting this tourist attraction at Singapore. There are lot of theme based activities, roller coster rides, 4D activities on various famous movies like Transformers, Jurassic park, Minions, Shrek, Mummy etc. Indian and Chinese eateries are also available within the theme park. Start by 10 AM to enjoy and complete all activities before the closing time of 7 PM. Human roller coster ride on Battlestar Galactica is the best and must life time activity for all. Ceylon roller coaster ride is for those who enjoy the human roller coster ride.

My fiancee enjoyed herself a great deal though.

One of the must visit places in Singapore. Has activities for everyone from adults to kids. Not much rides for toddlers. This consumes a whole day. Buy the express pass as you can bypass huge lines. If you buy it earlier you can get it for 30

2.review_text: Located in sweltering heat with queues that never seem to end. About 90 minutes of queuing for a 3 minute ride. Express passes cost 1.5x the price of an adult ticket. 120 for a single express entry per ride or 160 for unlimited express - per person. Special events require separate tickets - Hollyween about 70 per person for example. Overpriced food prices as well with small servings. Hard to enjoy except if you are willing to spend big and love hot, humid weather.

3 exciting roller coasters that you must play. Express tickets add SG6O/SG9O. You can enter via the express lane.
Its recommended to visit during weekdays to avoid long queues. Express pass available which saves a lot of time and is worth the extra cost.

Go on weekdays dont need the express pass. can cover all rides in about 4hours times. just couples or no one in front of ur queue! verg relax n no stress for queueing. Ride all you can besides weekend, check the date b4 book ticket. make sure its not Singaporean'sholiday.

But you need not to buy it at the time of planning, you can arrive at the place and check the length of queues and just upgrade to an express. In my view going anticlockwise in the premises would save your time and as much as early is the best.

Very good. Fast lane is good if you visit between 10 a.m and 1.30 If you fly Singapore airlines there is a discount on entrace ticket You can go on all rides etc for ticket price Meals reasonable Can reach there on hop on hop off bus , green line. Thanks to the management of univeesal studios.

4.review_text: Nice place with a lot of activities, if there is a lot of people it is better to get fast track option( Priority). If not much people don't pay extra. The transformers attraction is one of the best.you should try it.

We had a great experience at Universal studios, however this was only after purchasing a VIP pass for the rides. We made the mistake of going on a Saturday when it was very busy. We waited an 1hr 40mins in line for a ride without getting anywhere near getting on the ride before we gave up. The sign at the front said the wait was 30mins. This was disapointing. The vip pass for 50 got us straight on to the rides with little to no wait, ans thats when the fun started. The rides are fun, the different areas of the park are well done and good fun. Well worth a visit!

Its really not big, so you dont need to buy a Priority Pass if you come on weekdays! I didnt buy one today or Sunday, so I didnt wait long in line to play. Remember to bring your own water, it is very convenient to refill water everywhere!

Always love a day spent here. And always expect to want to spend the whole day out just to enjoy the different rides and shows that they have. I always prefer to have the Universal Express pass that allows me to "cut queues" and have shorter waiting times as compared to the main queue. It is usually better to purchase the pass beforehand (together with the ticket) as the price may go up during the day. I had also a chance to celebrate my birthday here while I was on the Annual pass so I was given some retail and food vouchers and also a magnet to say that it's my birthday. It was great to have the staff and cast members wish me "happy birthday" through out the visit.
Buy Express Pass!
Go with express pass

Get express ride tickets to beat the queue when you are going there with kids.. Especially during peak period.

5.review_text: Woo-hoo! If affordable will recommend buying express pass in peak season. One time pass recommend for the first time visit. (info: extra 90)

Reach here early.There is a limited entry express ticket and unlimited entry express ticket. About 3 rides were exempted in the limited entry ticket and you are allowed to ride only once in a ride with this ticket. We paid about 68 SGD for the entry ticket and another 70 SGD for the limited entry express ticket. Express ticket could be bought inside once you assess the waiting time. So don't buy it before entering the studios. There were about 15 rides as indicated in the limited entry express ride ticket. This was quick enough to let us complete all rides in about 2.5 hours in the park. We skipped 2 rides. Overall the rides were good and enjoyable. The Shrek and Transformers ride were very enjoyable for kids

Another awesome place in Singapore. Best place for kids But buy Universal Express passes or else waiting time is from 30 mint to 90 mint in busy days for normal passses.. Must take a rollercoaster ride (silver track ) Transformers ride. Waterfront rides. (Especially for adults)

Once in a life one should visit this place in life time. We have taken express pass so we could able to cover everything on time. But express pass is bit expensive which is 90 additional to day pass of 76. So many people gave me wrong information on upgrading, please be clear in it. Also my best suggestion is start your trip from right which have best rides. Also if you pay 60 you will get all photos soft copies to complete universal studios. Almost all the rides you cannot take pictures inside. So I guess that's best deal.

Many rides and shows. 1 day ticket available to enjoy. Foods bit expensive inside. But outside food also allowed. Some of the rides are with longer queues ,eating up your time. Express pass will help to fix this problem with some extra costs.

Are you planning on going on the play furniture? How many do you plan on taking? How many hours do you plan to play? There are so many differences depending on it. Popular rides require a wait of at least 3 hours. Be prepared and wait in line. However, if you have money and want to ride the rides without waiting, I recommend purchasing a VIP admission ticket. I remember when I went to Universal in LA, USA, I bought it and rode all the rides all day long.
Be sure to get the expensive, fast ticket.

4.review_text: Expensive ! Not worth for the weekend, avoid Saturday Sunday and Singapore public holidays or you will be in Que waiting for long in the scorching sun. Note !! There is something called express pass, better to buy so u can enjoy all the rides ahead of all those with normal tickets must for elderly

Was Spielberg also happy? Southeast Asia's first full-fledged theme park I visited the park at the end of the year, and it was crowded... Some attractions take longer than 60 minutes, so the Express Pass comes in handy at times like this For those over 60 years old, get a big discount with a senior ticket. You can get a 10% discount on all purchases within the park with your MasterCard, but be aware that some stores do not accept credit cards. My recommendation is the drink cup. If you carry it with you, you can get an additional drink for 3. It's a sturdy cup, so you can use it at home as wellIf you have an E-ticket, don't forget to print it out using the printer on the right side of the park entrance.

One of the must visit places in Singapore. An amazing art and construction done. Not to miss the human and cyclone rides. And next are the mummy and transformers. Look out for show timings. There are mostly only two of each in a day. The one in the water world is a good one. Express pass would be a good option, if you are a tourist here. It will save much of standing in the queues. The food might be a bit expensive. Lots of stores to shop from after each ride. They have a very good locker facility. Had a wonderful experience. Best to book online and sometimes even has offers.

Nice for the first timer, not worth coming back as the ride is still the same, go on low season or buy an express lane ticket, waiting for 2hrs / ride is not worth , better get an express pass rather than coming twice

Very beautiful park, but watch out for queue scams! 5min is often 40min in fact! Also plan a K-Way for Jurassik Park because it's 5 dollars per poncho.... And 4 dollars per locker for the bag at each attraction.... A little disappointed with that but hey... Plan 4 dollars per person also for the Santosa express train.

5.review_text: I love the theme park but the downside is the long queue. Avoid weekends and if you have some cash to spare, get the express or vip pass. Also, riders who are alone can get the same benefit with express pass. But if theres two of you dont expect you will be seated next to each other.
One Suggestion: BUY THE EXPRESS TICKETS

Themed rides from Shrek, Transformers, Jurassic Park, Madagascar, and Sesame Street. Really loved the 4D adventures. Theres a mix of bigger faster rides and roller coasters and smaller rides for people like me who dont like going on loopy roller coasters. Buying an express pass saved us so much time we were able to ride nearly everything in 4-5 hours. Otherwise queue times can be 40-60 minutes per ride.
Recommend purchasing additional passes
