express vs normal, not big difference

Fun, a bit small. Had the most utterly stupid system for the fast track passes. We bought the one where you could only do each ride once and skip the line. We didn't print the pass just had on our phone, which was a mistake because when we came into the park we saw no info on how to get wrist bands, and I am pretty sure they charge you extra for them. Our friends who printed the passes just had them ticked off on the paper ticket as they did the rides, you could always print multiple copies if you wanted to ride them again so stupid system. Ours were scanned and we got a stamp on our wrists, which sweated off right away... I think they need to rethink the fast passes.
If you ride in a clockwise direction after entering, the wait will be short.. Good tip!

5.review_text: One of the best experiences Ive ever had in my life was visiting Universal studios Singapore. We pre booked the tickets in advance to avoid any delays in the queue and we were glad we did. It saved us quite some time. As soon as we enter, the whole atmosphere changes. It is recommended to buy Universal express pass to avoid the hour long queues for each and every theme ride. There are 2 types of passes one is of 60 and another is of 90. The first pass allows a person take each ride only once but the later allows unlimited rides which I regret that I didnt take. Each and every ride is awesome and gives wonderful experience. Among those rides Transformers theme and Mummy theme rides will give you goosebumps. We have locker services provided before we get on few rides so we dont loose our stuff during the ride. Overall it was a wonderful experience to have.

Availed the tickets thru Klook. When we arrived by 1030H, we saw a ling queue and decided to buy the Express lane ticket on the spot. Tips: 1. advisable to buy the express ticket to avoid the long queues and dave time. 2. Bring extra shirts. 3. Outside Food and drinks allowed. (Not checked in the express lane) 4. Bring poncho or umbrella. Weather varies.
A weekend well spent. Fun! If you are visiting on a weekend, I would recommend to go for express pass as it is very crowded, and you dont want to spend time just waiting in line.

It was an amazing experience at Resorts World Sentosa. One complete day required (as we were travelling with our 2 years old baby) to see everything at Universal Studio itself. Better to purchase express entry tickets to skip the long queue. Some rides may take 1.5 hours wait and even 2 hours. You can get the express entry tickets online or buy from the kiosk at the place. 60 SGD. If you are a solo traveller or without kids then you may can cover SEA Aquarium as well. You must try both the roller coasters (Human and Cyclone), transformers, Egyptian roller coaster is another level. Must visit place.
express unlimited pass is very useful..

1.review_text: Didn't enjoy. Don't recommend. Not worth the price or the queueing despite an express pass.

3.review_text: Just okish. Not very Big. Wait times are high. Need Express pass for rides. Not recommended.

4.review_text: It was a good experience. There were many photogenic sites and a few really good rides (roller coasters). A bit sad that not all themes were open at the time we visited. But had fun. Express pass is required on weekends. On weekdays, one can manage with normal pass.
Wonderful experiance. Waiting period is so high. Better to buy express tickets.

Great place to spend an entire day (11am - 6pm). Buying express Tickets highly recommended to reduce waiting time. Else the average waiting time can be 30 mins - 1 hour. The normal express pass gives one time access to each ride, which is sufficient as that itself would need whole day. The unlimited express pass is double the cost, so super expensive.
We need the annual pass to be active again!

5.review_text: I bought ticket in advanced via KLOOK. Its very easy to enter, just show QR CODE in KLOOK application. Every times I visit Singapore, I always come here and never get bored!!!
Loved the place, but to ensure less waiting time, express pass is must

First do buy express pass to save your time waiting in que...Amazing place to spend your day... It will be a great fun if you come with a group of energetic friends or family.. Indian stay tension free you have Indian food outlet opp. To return of mummy..

Purchase the Unlimited Express Pass after setting aside some cash. Although the pass is very cheap, I was able to see the entire park, ride all the attractions, see all the performances, and attend every meet and greet! You should look around because some gifts may only be purchased at particular gift shops located within the park. When you use the lockers wisely, you can save a ton of money. But, the rides haven't altered much, if at all, during the previous ten years. I thoroughly loved my trip.
Nice but should book express tickets

1.review_text: A very small park with few games for adults, but rather recommended for families with children under 12 years of age approximately... the express pass is a terrible experience. The only thing you get is to be in a separate row and 1 car from the normal row passes by, 1 express car. so it has nothing compared to other parks... for what you pay for the famous express it is not worth it at all... besides seeing that the spaces in the attractions are not used, one sees empty seats and in other parks they ask For example by a person who is alone to take advantage of that unoccupied space A very little park few attractions most of all for kids under 12 years the express pass was a sad disappointment cause of express has nothing compare other parks I've been in universal orlando and the express pass works as clock here the only thing you receive is to be in a different line but at the end to the attraction goes 1 wagon from normal line then 1 wagon of express pass so basically ends up being a joke... besides you see empty seats and instead to ask for a single ride the seat gets lost

Nowhere near to the universal studios of los angeles. Very limited number of rides and if you visit on weekdays you cant cover all the rides if you dont have express pass because the studios open for only 7 hours. It is for the one who cant afford to go los angeles

3.review_text: Universal Studio Singapore is a bit disappointing in comparison to the parks in the USA. We took the day pass unlimited express. Unfortunately, few attractions were closed (Pussinboots, Waterworld, kids climbing, madagascar ... and other zones in construction). You book online, and they don't tell you about the closure ... I was really looking forward to doing the Waterworld show ... the daily pass shall be pro-rated or refundable in case of fewer attractions. Luckily, the park is very small so you can move quickly in it. I think it is not worth taking the Unlimited Express. Just the regular one will be ok as the parc is only open 11am to 6pm ... you won't have time to do more than 1 time each ride even with express ... The park a s bit aging. Maybe it is a post covid lack of maintenance. Staff is smiling but not super enthusiastic for the majority. Overall, it is ok, but I think it is not worth 550SGD day passes express unlimited (2 adults 1 child) for the day ... I'm giving it a 3 star, but a 2.5 would be more adequate as the experience was very average.
It was 80 singapore dollars and that gets you the basic pass. For another 80 you get a faster pass. On the basic we waited nearly 1 and half hours for a ride at the start of the day.

The wait for each attraction may be between 30 mins to 2 hours long. Taking a day pass may not be worth it. To avoid the queue it may be useful to buy the express tickets which allows you to go in a separate line. You then have priority over others. The express ticket costs 90 sing dollars over and above the entrance ticket which we paid 82 sing dollars. Lack of low intensity rides! The information about each attraction is lacking. Difficult to understand the intensity of the rides to make a choice.
Too many renovation cannot play minion and madagaskar and jurassic .. recommend to buy fast or express pass. Dont waste your time compare to the value of the money..

Less than my expectations. Overrated place very expensive. It costs 60 euros for ticket per person 50 euros per person for fast line. Low value with high price Do not buy fast line tickets , you can start backwards (the last world or even far far away) to avoid waiting, and the fast line ticket is useless after 03:00. another disadvantage it can be used only once for game. So if these games are suitable for your kids age and they want to play it again, you have to wait in line because the fast line can be used one time for each game.and this is not fair because there are many games not suitable for your kid age.

4.review_text: Good overall experience but I would recommend getting express lane tickets

Went during Songkran in Thailand. It was very hot, the sun was scorching, and there was no rain at all. The water inside is twice as expensive as the store in front of Universal. Lockers are 4 per hour. Popular rides, line up for 1.5 hours to play. I recommend playing mummy, transformer, human. If you don't want to wait, you should buy express from the klook app (thousand six) and you should download the app to check the location time in real time.
It is recommended to buy a one-time Express Pass to save a lot of time. There is no need to buy unlimited, which will not have enough time to play.
Express ticket s a must to explore the universal studios completely..we had been in April n had to wait a min of 90 mins to enjoy each ride n that was highly irritating

A "worth it" experience. Would be better as an express pass buyer as waiting times are very long (about 60-90mins or more). Suggest to be there on weekdays and as soon as it opens so you can enjoy the main rides (battlestar galactica, mummies, transformers and jurassic rapids)

5.review_text: Must visit place if you are in Singapore. It's worth to take "Express" as an add-on while booking ticket.
You need to buy express pass for smooth experience
Always buy express. It will be painful waiting 40-70 minutes each rides without express.
So buy priority pass, very very crowded... definitely a must do in Singapore
Pro tip: Get an express pass. It is definitely worth it. You'll save a minimum of 3 hrs otherwise spent waiting in long lines for rides.

1.review_text: If you want to come here, make sure to buy Express pass which costs 80 or 120 sgd, as the wait time for rides is around 90 minutes. Without express pass, you will spend your most of time waiting while with express pass, you pay at least 160 (ticket express pass). Had i known this, i would not come here! Not recommended!

2.review_text: Honestly not worth unless you buy an express pass. Waiting is too long . In few rides it's around 2 hrs. Ques take time. And it's frustrating. My kids only got to do 4 rides.

4.review_text: Visited Universal Studios Singapore yesterday (Monday 15/5/2023) and surprisingly the queue was long for most of the rides on a weekday. Recommend to get the Express Pass if youre planning to visit later in the afternoon as the queue can go more than 60 mins.

If you really wanna experience all the attractions definitely go for the premium VIP tickets it's totally worth it. Can be crowded during the holiday season. Attractions are well maintained. Plenty of restaurants and shops. Totally worth the money and sweat. Kids will definitely enjoy.

Do yourself a favour, choose a weekday (not school holidays) book a ticket/s and pick a hotel near a subway hub. Cost us massive to get a one way transfer to Sentosa............went home to our hotel via the free Sentosa train and the Harbour Front station line for about A4.00. Transfers are a total rip off!

While theres no waiting to enter universal studios, theres extremely long waiting time for individual attractions and rides. I strongly recommend to buy the express pass if its affordable to save unnecessary hours waiting in lines.

Excellent park, decent ticket price, the fast pass is quite high but the unlimited one allows you to really enjoy all the attractions Price of souvenirs in store correct, landscape and theme very well done To do

5.review_text: Express pass is must

Download the Universal Studios Singapore app for real time updates on waiting time. Every ride has a waiting of 20 mins so plan for the ones you want to do in advance. The express pass was almost the same price as the normal ticket (70) as of May'23. We didn't buy it. But the entire place was such a vibe! Rides in order of preference (& some research) - Battlestar galactia - Transformers - Mummy (couldn't make it as the wait time was too high) - Jurassic park (same) - Lights, camera action - Enchanted airways - Canopy flyover (couldn't make it)

Buy Santosa express unlimited ride pass . Circle in anti-clockwise direction to access adventure rides and show 1st . Pls do home work to understand rides and shows . Plan and than go to get most out of it . Avoid treasure hunt , it is time killer and utter waste , this ride should not be there . For u veggies . There is options for Samosa and Veg Biryani opposite Ancient Egypt . Two roller coaster are excellent and worth experience. Reach 30 mins before park opens up to be in que . Unlimited Express pass get your band before entering theme park .
Great Experience! Express Pass is better because queues is too long
Get the express pass

3.review_text: For better deals, purchase your tickets online well in advance. Consider getting an express pass, but be prepared for certain areas to be closed for maintenance or upgrades. Arriving early is recommended and avoid weekends & public holiday.

Enter only if you have an express pass. It does not make any sense if you just get the admission ticket and wait in hourly queues. Ticket prices are premium so even if taken from any sites like Klook etc would not make any difference. For Indians, ticket prices from Klook, with admission express, will be around 9,500 per person which as per Singapore standards is reasonable. Plan to buy tickets in advance. The queues at the spot are very long. Arrive 20 minutes before the starting time and skip long entry queues by showing your express pass at the entry counter. Try to complete either Jurassic ride or Mummy returns first. There will be no queue when the park opens. Later even the express queues get long and would be at least 30 mins of waiting. There are a few rides like Treasure Hunt (Ancient Egypt) and Jurassic Canopy rides that don't have express entrance but are in demand. If you are with a kid, you may want to spend some time during peak afternoon time at Far Far Away land and see some of the shows. Remember to carry Umbrellas and Sunglasses. By 4 30 pm, the queues we saw were less in Express and hence could visit Transformers ride almost with no queue in express. Overall, an okay experience. Nothing great if you have visited the LA Universal Studio. SG Universal Studio is a smaller, compact entertainment park. We didn't see any angry crew. In fact, all the staff were very friendly and helped in answering queries on directions. Tips 1. Do not visit without the Express Pass 2. Carry Sunglasses, umbrellas 3. Jurassic ride you will get wet. 4. Canopy rides in Jurassic, Puss n Boots, enhancement airways can be a bit scary for kids , but is okay for adults. 5. Mummy returns is a must scary ride 6. All rides are about 1 min max 7. Lights Action Camera, New York ride, Shrek 4D are okay for small kids too. 8. Staff are friendly. Ps: photo shows the rush for Mummy returns in the express lane. About 30 mins waiting at around 1 pm.

5.review_text: Went on weekend and got the unlimited express pass from the counter. It was totally worth it as the longest time I waited in queue was max around 15 mins only. Tips: - if express pass not available online on your preferred date, you can purchase from guest services at USS - bring your own water bottle and hand fan to stay hydrated and cool (singapore is hot all the time) - free time-limited locker at mummy ride (no bag allowed) and cylon/human ride(no bag and loose items in pockets allowed). other rides, there will be a place to put your stuff or you can carry it with you.

Be prepared to spend your time on the line for those rides. If you want a fast lane, you should try their VIP or Express ticket so that you won't spend most of the time on the line. You just have to pay some extra bucks for that privilege.

A very beautiful world for adults and children. It is often crowded. I strongly recommend taking an Express card (Fast Pass) because it will save you a long time in the waiting line. The waiting line ranges from 50 to 60 minutes for a regular ticket, but for the Express it is from 10 to 20 minutes, and this is on weekdays, not holidays. The price of the entry ticket is 82 Singapore dollars per person, and the price of the Express is 82 60 per person. There is There are two types of Express, one is a one-time Fast Pass for each game. The other is a Fast Pass more than once for one game and its price is 82 90 per person. I recommend regular express once Working hours are from 10 am to 6 pm
If you are a tourist in Singapore and planning to visit only once , then pl book express pass in advance Less time for queue and more rides can be enjoyed For normal tickets minimum 1 hr wait.

Universal Studios Singapore offers a thrilling and entertaining experience with its wide array of amazing rides and attractions. From heart-pounding roller coasters to immersive 3D shows, there's something for everyone. However, on regular admission, be prepared for potentially long wait times, which might limit your ability to enjoy all the attractions. To maximize your visit, consider investing in an express ticket, which allows you to bypass the queues and make the most of your day. The park's attention to detail in creating themed zones is commendable, offering visitors an immersive experience. Additionally, the staff are generally friendly and helpful, enhancing the overall experience. Dining options are varied and cater to different tastes, though they can be a bit pricey. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for fans of theme parks and movie enthusiasts, but be sure to plan ahead to make the most of your visit.

Mind blowing. Visit on a weekday (except tuesday) for a better experience. Check on singapore school holidays Be there by 10.30 am. Express pass will make you accessible for all rides/ experiences without any waiting time. Better not waste your time at seasame street que. Keep it for the last. You won't regret the time you be in the que for Transformers. Enjoyed every bit of it. Try the main ride first right after the transformers. You should keep your belongings in a locker before the ride. Locker will be provided free for the first 90 minutes. After that 20 minute rate slots will be applicable. Heart patients/ pregnant mothers should not access this ride. Believe me I thought I died during the ride Better you have food/ refreshments from outside if you are in a tight tour budget. There are different show times for each zone. You can meet the characters and take photographs at each zone. Mainly right infront of Minions store. They have provided photography service at each zone where you can get it printed in a frame (charges applicable). Minions park will be opened in 2024.

1.review_text: 1- Prices have become expensive compared to before, and there is also renovation work that may end in 2025. I bought a fast track bracelet for my family for all the games and I was surprised that there are games that do not include fast track. In one of the games I asked an employee on the fast track because the track board was not clear, unfortunately. He put me in a queue where I sat for an hour, and it turned out that the employee had racial fanaticism and deliberately put me in the wrong lane and did not put me in the express entry lane. There is poor regulation of express entry, meaning that There is a card that you buy to enter some games, fast entry, and this is the reason for its crowding and the lack of clarity about those who have the fast entry bracelet from the card. There is chaos, some of them enter the fast lane without having a card or bracelet, and they enter the game without any supervision from the organizers. 2- I also bought an express entry card for offers, although it was previously part of the express entry bracelet, but they separated it. Unfortunately, its price was very expensive, and entry was poorly organized because they were sorting people outside, but inside the hall the situation was chaotic. You would find everyone sitting in the express entry area, so I absolutely do not recommend buying it. Come ten minutes before the show and after you enter because there are no organizers inside, sit in the front where those who have... Express entry cards. 3- Previously, the studio opened at 10 p.m. and closed at 7 p.m., meaning (9 hours) and at an acceptable price, but now it opens at 11 a.m. and closes at 6 p.m., meaning (7 hours), at a high price, and a third of the studios games are closed. 4- It was a very bad experience and I was disappointed in Universal Studio due to the chaos, the negligence of the organizers inside, the restoration work, and the high prices. I do not advise anyone to visit it due to the presence of restoration work, as well as the presence of restoration work on Sentosa Island, and many of the events that were free on the island have become expensive and have become Concern is money, not tourist entertainment.

This was an overwhelming experience! Many WOW! moments. A few things to be aware of, which would have helped if we knew it before we went. Buy an Express ticket, it may be more expensive but it allows you to skip the very long queues. Some you need to stand in for two hours! The express ticket will cut that down to 15 minutes. So it will mean you will be able to experience more rides for your money. The resort is very big so be prepared to walk and stay hydrated in the heat. Toilets are paid.
Buy the fast pass if there is any chance of it being busy. It's pretty good overall but I feel like they need 2 more big rollercoasters as there is only 1 really scary one.

Fun experience but I would recommend getting the universal express passes as the waiting lines are long.

5.review_text: it is better to buy an express ticket so that you don't have to queue for a long time to get on the ride

This place is spectacular. Truly a place to get more lifelong memories. I recommend coming to this place. The entertainments vary from the highest adrenaline-seeking to your family-friendly comedy shows. Pictures! Pictures could be taken anywhere especially with the merchandises that you could buy there. Now, on to the critiques and advices. Of course, every place has its flaws and these reviews are here to help build it for the better First of all, the queues. The queues will take you 15-60 minutes for only about 5 minutes of entertainment. That's why I would HIGHLY recommend getting the express ticket. You could upgrade your regular ticket to an express in the ticket booth up front. It is pricy at first sight, but the amount of rides you could experience and the amount of time you save is worth it. But note that not all rides accept express in the way that you need to wait as of the others. I would recommend bringing a change of clothes as it would often get hot, you'd get wet while riding a ride. In my case, I forgot to bring an extra change, so I had to buy one _. Last but not least, bring your family, friends, wife or husband, relatives, and so on. They will make the trip even better. That is all. Enjoy uss

Many people wonder if they can enjoy all the rides without an Express Pass, and the answer is yes. Ensure you visit on a weekday, like Thursday and be right on time before the opening time, and the trick is to avoid entering the rides near the entrance first. Start with those in the back or the ones with high demand, such as the Transformers ride. In the evening, the rides near the entrance are always empty, so that's the perfect time to go there. Use the Universal Studios app to check wait times and navigate accordingly, rather than following a set order. Mark down the meet and greet times and spots to arrive right on time. The roller coasters are worth it, and lockers are free for a duration of around 30-40 minutes. We checked roller coaster wait times, selected lockers, finished the ride, switched lockers, and went to the next ride, so we didn't pay for lockers at all. If you still lack time you can skip the enchanted airways and magic potion spin which looks less exciting after riding the main roller coaster rides. Yes, the food and drinks are expensive, but having a big breakfast outside and the motivation to try all the rides meant we barely felt hungry, so we didn't dine there at all. You can take water inside, so no need to buy their overpriced water and drinks. All the rides and shows were excellent, providing a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Buy the tickets online in a site like Klook which is cheaper.

Amazing time with amazing tour guides! Beautiful park as well. My boyfriend and I purchased the VIP tour and it was sensational. Absolutely worth the price. We had a 1 on 1 experience with another group of tourists who were just as great. We were able to ride all the rides available with no queues and the rollercoasters as many times as we wanted. We also had great food from the free food vouchers! Thank you for your hospitality, USS!
Amazing experience...but when you visit universal. Pls buy VIP tickets for entry to visit each dome..its save your lots of time ...

Add it to the entry price of 82 60. If you would like a one-time FastPass type, you can choose it for games that have pressure, and for 4 games that do not have express. If you have Express, it is enough for 4 hours to play all the games. In games that require you to put your things inside the locker, it is free for 90 minutes or 40 depending on the game. There are water shows and others that do not have fees. You can find out the show times from their application Halal food is everywhere you know, from a sticker on the door or near the cashier, and dont forget to try the delicious Shrek waffle. Avoid the weekend crowds. You can take pictures of any cartoon character and the organizers will help you. Most train games are considered fun, except for one that is considered dangerous called Battlestar Galactica 1- Train: Transformers ride (suitable for children) 2-Train: The Mummy 3- Train: Jurassic park 4- Train: puss in boots (fun for children and adults) If you fear 1-3-4 or 2 is fun and fast, download the map and enjoy your day

Unforgettable Experience at Universal Studios Singapore! My recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore left me thoroughly impressed and exhilarated. The sheer magnitude of entertainment, thrilling rides, and immersive attractions make it an absolute must-visit destination in Singapore. For those seeking the ultimate experience, I highly recommend investing in the Express Ticket. This proved to be a game-changer, allowing me to bypass long queues and make the most of my time enjoying the rides and shows. The convenience and time savings with the Express Ticket ensured a stress-free and memorable adventure. Beyond the attractions, Universal Studios Singapore boasts a diverse range of food options. From delightful snacks to hearty meals, there's something to satisfy every palate. The variety and quality of culinary offerings add an extra layer of enjoyment to the overall experience. The attention to detail in each themed zone is truly commendable, transporting visitors to different worlds with every step. The well-executed shows and interactive experiences make it a joy for visitors of all ages. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute gem, offering an unparalleled blend of excitement, entertainment, and gastronomic delights. If you're planning a trip to Singapore, make sure to include Universal Studios in your itinerary, and consider upgrading to the Express Ticket for a truly exceptional and hassle-free adventure!

1.review_text: If you don't want to buy the Express Pass (80 online, 100 on site, in addition to regular admission) or the Unlimited Express Pass (over 100 more) don't do it!!!!! and do something else. Waiting times of 60 minutes are to be accepted for the smallest trains. It would actually be a great park, but the frustration for the children is greater than the fun. So if you want to buy express passes, be sure to buy them online beforehand, as they are more expensive on site (demolition). Singapore can do many things very well, but not at Universal Studios.

Don't arrive without buying *in advance* a full day express pass. they sell you 1 for 100 during the day which is an insulting price. some of the rides are 1 minute but over 40 minutes in wait... wouldn't recommend it without a full day express.

Sad. Disappointing. If you can't pay the express ticket you have to wait hours while others pass in front of you. This is how we teach the next generation that money is worth more than a person. The school of life takes steps backwards. Before it was first come, first served, now you are a piece of paper with numbers. We are (and nationality does not matter) a M..da society
