4.review_text: There is a machine at the door where you can buy tickets (you can purchase express passes). Each express pass can only be used once. If you want to sit again after that, you have to change to the general aisle (I'm not sure about the bracelet). The more interesting ones are Transformers, The Adventures of Puss in Shoes, Egypt Double Track, Shrek 4D... On weekdays, you dont have to wait to get through the levels quickly. It's open until 20:00 in the evening, and you can basically play all the key things if you go in in the afternoon.

Great. 4 stars because I would like to see more friendly staff and more interactive games for young and old. 50% of the stores are just for shopping or eating. You should buy an express pass if you want to experience everything.

5.review_text: Suggest buying express access in advance
Best worth money but buy express tickets to avoid wait time

Its recommended to buy an advance ticket trough any app. Recommended klook app. There are offer ticket with special discount and refreshment include as well. Be patient with the waiting time for popular roller coaster ride. Make sure you are keeping yourself hydrated. I suggest planning for which station/section of entertainment you wanna play. Since, a que timing will be drag your daytime and you will waste the chances to finish many entertainment section well. If going with children, always keeping up and stay with your children. Let them enjoy a 3D shrek, puss in boot. Jurassic park, waterworld, transformers and also sesame street. Overall, it is worth it every penny of your money if you are planning well and try everything the section they provided. The ticket entry SGD 80 per adult.
Express entry is a must..
Excellent place in some rides need to wait nearly 40min. Then express pass also available but costly.

3.review_text: Don't visit this place on the weekend, and it's better to buy the express tickets Trust me

4.review_text: If you have more time during the holiday, it is recommended to buy a three-day ticket, and if you have less time, buy a priority ticket.

5.review_text: A mist visit when in Singapore! We got express passes, but apparently, if you just come early enough, it is not needed. Make sure to experience Transformers the Ride and The Mummy. And around the afternoon, take note of the schedule for Waterworld. Everything else, you can experience without the need of Express Pass.
If you dont want to wait in queue then buy the express ticket

It was my first visit to the USS. There will be greetings from Minions, Shrek, etc., and the staff will take photos for you. I was also allowed to take a selfie. Although the scale is small, it was around the end of March and the temperature was around 33 degrees and humid, so it was quite hot and it was difficult to wait outside, so I bought an express pass after visiting. There are two types of Express Passes: one that allows you to ride a designated vehicle once and then ride a designated vehicle multiple times. Prices seem to vary depending on the day, but the day I visited was a weekday, and I bought it for 80 per person. We were able to get drinking water at various places, so we were able to spend the money on merchandise and restaurants without purchasing water inside the park.

Highly recommending buying the universal express pass so you won't have to wait for 30-40 mins in line for one ride! Overall it was a very nice trip, but the food and drinks sold there are a bit expensive. Recommended bringing sime light snacks and mineral water in advance. There are refillable water dispensers across the park

If you're looking for a full day of adventure, this place is a must-visit! They offer two types of tickets: regular and express. The express ticket is great if you want to save time and enjoy all the rides and activities without waiting long. However, the regular ticket is more budget-friendly, though you might have to wait up to 80 minutes for some attractions. They have dining options available for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. The Human and Cyclone rides provide thrilling experiences, while Transformers is a popular attraction loved by many. Don't miss the water showsthey're a must-see! Overall, this place offers an exciting and enjoyable experience for adventure lovers of all ages.

1.review_text: Each game the queue takes more than 45 minutes. So it forces visitors to buy the express one even though the price difference is large. So if you can play a maximum of 50% of the game, you are already very grateful. Even though the entrance ticket is already expensive... Not value for money and not worth it
For transformer ride use single rider queue .. its saves an hour in a queue.... Dont go in normal way its painful !!

3.review_text: Overhyped place. Wait times are too big and attractions are not much exciting. If you are going on group then get express pass for some people before visit. It is a waste of money to buy express pass for all. Express pass purchase from park will be at higher cost and price will increase as day progresses. There is an early entry pass,use it to experice rides without wait. At evening and certain time wait times will come down. Use the universal Singapore app to know it live. Use of this app is highly recommended. If you don't like Malay type food then do not plan to eat in discover food court. Use the one near revenge of mummy or Mel's diner. Your shoe and dress will get wet in rapids. Remove shoes. It can rain so carry umbrella or poncho

Mixed experience - was initially disappointed at not being able to buy unlimited express pass but it became unnecessary around 2.30 pm. Has only 2/3 rides that are "thrilling", my kids kept going back to Cylon. Tip (if you're a tourist and visiting the park on a weekday) - try going late (i.e., after noon) rather than early; I suspect many people (for instance, the ones with infants) leave the park by then so it becomes much less crowded.

Was nice, not the most amazing experience but nice. Buy a fast track so you don't have to queue. They weren't that bad when we went, but we were sorry we didn't have time to go on a ride more than once as it took an hour to get on most of them. The Cyclon is the best one!
Good but needs upgrades and different rides to match up with places in Dubai

4.review_text: Without the Express pass the wait times get quite long and express pass holders are given full prioritization. Also in comparison to other amusement parcs the price is quite high and the rides are not super special. It is nice, but I probably would probably invest my time somewhere else next time.
Buy express ticket if you dont want to wait or have very little time.. dubly expensive..

Select weekday for your visit, reach as early as possible if you are staying in sentosa siloso beach resort recommend & free route to USS - take siloso beach shuttle & reach beach station from there take mono rail and het down at resorts island(USS) I dont recommend express pass if its a weekday visit, waiting time for single riders will be less than 5mins in majority of the rides utilise that and save time. Travel light, I recommend not to carry DSLR camera carry water bottle and a poncho If you are travelling with a kid it is advised to bring a stroller Vegetarian food only available in oasis near the mummy returns ride. Umbrella or a poncho will be helpful if it rains ( most of the USS area has shelter)

Early entry 1 hour. Express ticket It was a wonderful time spent in Universal Studio Singapore. We went on Saturday. We purchased tickets from the official website because it was mentioned that you can do an early entry of 1 hour for which a couple of rides would be available. We had two rides available early including Transformer. We didn't even use our Express pass. No queue at 9 am. Then we went straight at Jurassic Park and Mummy rides without Express ticket. Don't miss Transformer Don't miss the stunt show - reach early Express Ticket is not required if you go on weekdays or non-festival weekend After 5 pm, there is no queue. Food expensive, we had ice-cream which was great. We took some food inside as well. Ride safety - A Thriller rides - Cyclon and Mummy and Transformer. Imagica and Magic mountain have more thrilling rides

Universal Studios Singapore in Sentosa is a world-class theme park that brings the excitement of Hollywood to life. Packed with thrilling rides, interactive shows, and themed zones featuring iconic movies and television series, it's a place where families and friends can create unforgettable memories. From battling dinosaurs in Jurassic Park to soaring through the skies on the Transformers ride, there's something for everyone. To maximize your experience and avoid long queues, especially during peak seasons, an Express Pass is highly recommended. It allows you to skip the regular lines for most attractions, ensuring you have more time to explore the park and soak in the beautiful atmosphere.

5.review_text: Coming here during the Christmas and New Year holidays, I recommend buying a VIP ticket, although it is a bit expensive, but in my opinion it is worth it. because there were so many visitors and the queue was snaking. If you are VIP, you don't need to queue, so you can enjoy lots of rides without queuing
Buy express ticket
No regrets purchasing the Express Pass. Saved a lot of time from most of the rides..

Small but good place , if you are going for the first time. If you can spend, definitely buy an express pass, which is 100 SGD more. (Normal ticket is 83 SGD) Or you can plan your trip after 2 pm. In the evening, the rush is less and you spend very little time , waiting for rides

A unique experience in all as the place is very aesthetic for photos but for rides ,better buy express pass if u want to complete all the rides. If you want to try 2 3 rides and enjoy the setting more ,You can do it with normal pass too.

2.review_text: every show you face lines if you have express ticket you will go fast.if you have normal ticket you have to wait too long and if any express ticket owned person come normal ticket owners wait and express ticket owners get priority. that thing hurt alot.

3.review_text: The rides are minimalist and there is almost no need to queue. It is not recommended to spend additional money to buy a quick pass, because it is almost useless!
Place is nice but price is little high and without express pass it is useless And don't go with small kids cause than you can't take rides overthere

4.review_text: Fun, we got the express pass since we got there late. There are only a few extreme rides so I will rate it with 4 stars only. Sentosa activities might be better. USJ is better

USS is already famous so let me just cut my review short with critical tips. 1. Use the express system, either at your most desirable ride or straight at the Revenge of Mummy. 2. Jurassic's water-ride is fun, you will definitely get splashed at, but not soaked. 3. The weather's super hot, wear light and stay hydrated. (Bring your water bottles or pay the theme-park rate.) Others, have fun and explore!

I follow my other friend to go at 12:15 but i arrived 5 minutes late.... sudennly i arrrived at penacony is this real? Welcome to my world renew your definition world so high let it show and hear my declaration

5.review_text: For Thai people who will come, I recommend you to buy VIP tickets, otherwise you will queue for a very long time to enter the attractions!! Please buy tickets in advance. You won't have to line up to get a ticket.

Every ride is fun. It's really fun. There weren't many people on the day we went, so the queue wasn't long. Some machines can be entered right away. Some machines require a 5-10 minute wait. There are shows from employees at various points throughout the day. But the day I went was Sunday. Meet the Indian tour There are a lot of people but I can still play. The food here is very expensive. Various souvenirs are also reasonably priced. But when it comes, I have to buy some. You'll regret it if you like it, haha. Tickets bought in advance from the app are a little cheaper. Personally, I don't buy express.

One of the best places to visit in Singapore. Attractions, roller coasters, characters, themed cafs, what more could you want? Would highly recommend going with family. Buy the express pass as well. It helps a lot with the waiting times.

-Must visit, BUT ideally you should go with people who will like to do the same rides as you. -If you are tourist who may not coming again, buying an Express pass (in advance) is worth it. Popular rides have long wait times (40min when I went on a weekday), so this is efficient -I absolutely enjoyed these (in order of liking) 1.Battlestar Cylon (very adventurous) 2.Revenge of the mummy (adventurous) 3.Transformer 4.Battlestar Human 5.Shrek 4d 6.lights camera action show (express pass gives you front row) 7.waterworld show Jurassic rapids was closed for maintenance when I went, else I have heard it's great
Don't buy express pass on weekdays.. enter the park at 10am .. do the most popular rides early on.

2.review_text: It has got boring now. They have not changed much in last 7 years. Also they have scrapped unlimited express ticket and making single ride express ticket so costly.

3.review_text: Weve bought the express pass which is almost 100 AUD extra per person however we felt its a disappointment as we found out at the door that its allowed to be used only once per ride, cant be used twice for any ride, such a scam. I think use the early entry pass, you ll be in around 45-60mins earlier than everyone and take the rides you like best first. The transformers ride was really an amazing experience however our friends got stuck for 20mins inside.

Rides are good.. But waiting time is to much... It's better to have express pass... Light, camera, action is waste of time..... Transformer, the mummy , water show is amazing, indian foodie oasis is good samosa, daal chawal, biryani, chai...available

Not that big (I thought it would be)...ride time is only 1 or 2 minutes but the queue wait time is minimum 1 hour for good rides and 30 minutes for others... Some rides like Rollercoaster, Shrek 4D adventure, Transformer ride, Spaghetti ride (for kids) are good... Express pass is just a way to get more money from people...but if you are a ride person then do take express pass...

4.review_text: Book tickets in advance, currently there is alot of construction going on if you have been to Universal I dont think its worth it now wait for the new areas to open. We always have a good time at Universal alot of Halal food options available shrek waffels are delicious.. there are many shows and meet and greet if you are planning with kids please make sure to start in the morning so you can cover everything. And if express pass is in budget I highly recommend if you have small kids with you. There are alot of nice shops around most of Universal studio is covered but I recommend you to bring umbrellas water bottles and fans as SG is very hot.
If you are into rides, go ahead and take the express pass. Lines can be really long specially on weekends.

Great experience. It's not a massive park but kids loved it ... Strongly recommend getting early bird entry and express passes ... We did what we could without waiting times for the first hour then used our express passes in the afternoon ...

Asia's smallest Universal Studios, the tour is over very quickly. There are a lot of people queuing up to play. A quick pass costs 100 SGD and can only be used once in each area. The peripheral products are very crude compared to those in Osaka.

An amusement park worth experiencing, especially for my daughter, who loves thrilling games. After 1 day of experience, I found the following tips and suggestions: 1. When you first enter the gate, you should go straight into the Egyptian area and play straight in. When you're done, go back to the gate and play back in so there won't be much of a queue. 2. Comment: I noticed that the game instructors had to introduce the game with a microphone over and over again throughout the day. In the last game, I saw that the player couldn't speak and his voice was hoarse. If these introductions were recorded, they could observe and help the players when needed. Wishing everyone a happy experience

5.review_text: As per singapore seasonaly whether issues. We try to finish rides as much as faster. Due to thunderstorm or lightning some rides was announced close probably. So we purchase express pass SGD 100 per person. This is not included park ticket . so nearly we spend SGD200 each . But it was worth. The day was weekday but its middle of June holiday in singapore so park was very cloudy. All the famous ride takes more than 30min for que. But with expresspass. All the rides we can start less than 5min. And as we expected bud weather at 4pm outdoor rides are all closed. We were lucky with express pass at this point. But around 6pm whether was getting hetter then rides open again. So I recommend to finish outdoor ride first if you see weather forcus says badly.
Remember to book express pass in advance.

RIDES R AWESOME if u ever go, get the express pass bc that helps so much honestly, like immediately go to ur fav ride and dont use the pass and tben u can go on it twice best day of my singapore trip, tho it started to rain so i couldnt do the last 2 rides but ITS OK THE REST WERE AWESOME!!

What an awesome experience this turned out to be. Definitely buy the VIP experience if you're able to as it's worth its weight in gold here. Without it the wait times are anywhere between 20 minutes to 2 hours per ride. With it you're able to skip right ahead of the queue. Our guide for the day (Giselle) was absolutely fabulous. She was very attentive and never missed an opportunity to capture the perfect moment. A thoroughly memorable experience and would highly recommend for everyone visiting Singapore to give the place a go.
Great experience, highly recommend buying the express pass

1.review_text: Express pass or no, you will wait for 60 mins on big rides (normal pass to wait for 120 min) Lower your expectations on weekdays.. Be ready that staff will close big rides for unknown reasons (it was sun and hot day when i went today 1st of July) They even delay the biggest shows for potential risks due to EXPECTED bad weather!! .. they must see things coming that we couldn't see in the clear sky above us :) Anyhow go with no expectations at all please. *I paid express for 120 and wish i didn't, i failed to notice the fast pass concept with sooo many people having express pass ! They have a lot to improve and they need to show "sold out" sign to control the huge crowd buying tickets per day.

Too bad. Too crowded! Waited 60 minutes and couldn't play any games. It feels very expensive. There are many ticket classes such as VIP, express, no need to queue, etc. In general, the way to pay is quite good
I bought the entry ticket first after transferred to other pass waited for very long,why they were not finish same time? Very disappointed ,second photo is ticket transfer to entry pass station

3.review_text: I thought it was so compact that I might not need it for the whole day. You can check the waiting time on the official app, but it doesn't match the current situation. On Mummy's Ride, it says that you have to put your personal belongings in a coin locker (if you wait 15 minutes, 45 minutes are free), but since the waiting time was much longer than the displayed wait time, we ended up having to pay. What do you do when your wallet is in the coin locker? ? ? It was very crowded and I had to call a staff member to open the paid lockers, which surprised me at how inefficient it was. The guidebook said it was cashless only, but there were some places that didn't accept Amex, so I ended up paying in cash. At restaurants, there are too many people occupying tables and taking breaks without eating, resulting in unnecessary waiting time. It was the worst dining experience because the cast members were unmotivated and didn't pay attention or consideration. If you don't have an express pass, you'll have to wait in line for the attractions, but I don't think it's necessary to buy a pass. For families with children, it can be quite tiring not to have easy rides where you can ride without waiting.

Perfect place to enjoy the day if you like Rollercoaster, not much to do for young kids. Please note that if you purchased an entrance ticket in advance and it has a QR code, it's only an voucher, that needs to be exchanged at Guest Services before proceeding to the entrance. This makes advance ticket purchases a little useless and time-consuming.
The express ticket can only be used once for each play with that price?

4.review_text: Its such a nice experience apart from the long waiting times in the more popular rides. Be ready to spend your whole day in there, to make the most out of the entrance fee. If youre pressed for time and want to experience at least half of all the rides before closing time, I highly recommend spending extra for the Express Pass, this way, you only spend 30mins max of waiting time per ride, not two hours.
Express pass was handy to get on rides quickly. Needs more fans and demisters installed around park and aircon to be blasted due to warm weather.

Good to experience different places within such as mummy , hydraulic water rides and transfomer. They have free as well as paid both lockers so find it first before making the final decision. The water show is next level for entertainment

Had fun at Universal Studios. The average wait time for most of the rides was 60 minutes so if you are wanting to go on lots of rides, would recommend the express pass. Most of the food options were also really busy at lunchtime, so prepare to be patient.
the place is wonderful, we visited on the weekday even though was crowded ,so express pass is highly recommended to enjoy your time specially in the hot weather.

5.review_text: My 4th time enjoying my time at Universal Studios Singapore. This time I bought a VIP Entrance Ticket. The VIP tickets to universal studios with the backlot access and guided 5 hour tours. Friendly, attentive tour guide (her name Huda). So you don't have to queue to enjoying every rides in Universal Studios Singapore

We did it with the VIP pass... a different way of going to an attraction parc... No queues, you just drop in and off you go. A personal guide is with you during the tour and day... when the tour is over or before you can enjoy the express queue... so you dont wait for attraction... a great way to visit an attraction parc... even if a bit expensive, but it was a wonderful day for the kids and the family...

I went as a weekday rider and didn't buy an express pass. I was able to collect all the rides I wanted to play. The queue didn't take long. I recommend downloading the Universal SG app to view the queue (or you can look at the ride page). And if you don't buy the express, choose to ride the rides that there will be a lot of people playing first, like Mummy and Transformer, so you don't have to wait in long queues. Dressing is casual. Sneakers/sandals as per convenience (Personally, I prefer sandals, Jurassic style, cool if wet). Food prices are quite high. There is free water available. You can carry a water bottle inside. Personally, I really like Universal's professionalism. The player has a PM and a clear warning label. Recommend and good service

Went on a Thursday, still long q every ride but by 4pm waiting time decrease. Should invest on the express pass next visit. Bought yhe tickets online (traveloka) with food vouchers. Easy access just scan hp. Bring water bottle as refill place is abundance. There's smoking area & a surau (next to Battlestar Galactica rollercoaster) . Halal eatery near Mummy attraction.

This is the must visit place with friends and family if you are in singapore. I highly recommend to go for express ticket, this is double the cost but it's worth it. You can save more than 30 mins per ride with the express. Don't Start with roller coaster. Keep it for last and before the lunch. Whole new world for kids.

2.review_text: Be aware of the Express pass conditions, they change the conditions and price without notice and proper communication. Paid S140 per person; Which was supposed to be unlimited based on RWS own hotel ORA table, but found that if bought directly at Universal, it would only be valid for a single ride. If I wanted to go in my kids favourite ride twice I would need to go to the regular queue... this is hardly a good value for the extra S560 I paid on top of the regular tickets... Otherwise is a nice theme park, with a few very good rides. But, will I return.... No!
Paid triple the price to have an express pass just to get told no express pass at half of the rides

4.review_text: Very clean and well run. ExpressPass is a great way to make the most of your day. Be aware it only gets used once per ride. Recommend hitting rides you want early without and then use expresspass after. Jurassic Park ride had long queue even for expresspass. Overall we had a great day.
Eat before you go our pack food, it isn't great. express is a def! Rides are awesome! Transformer ride is a must!
To many visitors. You must pay express

I think you have to be at an age where you know and like Universal-related movies. It seems pointless to pay extra money to buy Express. There are a lot of people and the waiting time is long, so you can't ride many things.
Fun for children . Buying Express tickets is suggested

5.review_text: Excellent place & must visit in Singapore however I strongly recommend to purchase Express Ticket instead of normal to enjoy 100% rides and show to avoid long Q (as Q kills your time by high waiting time say 40-60min per ride )
Buy an express pass, to skip 100mins/game. Express pass waiting time 5 mins

Highly recommend visiting USS. Though, I would go one more step and recommend buying an express pass beforehand in order to use the express lanes once per ride. Can save a lot of time waiting. I used Klook to buy my entry ticket and express pass (need both). My favourite ride would have to be 3D transformers in Sci-Fi City. You can easily spend all day here, so come early.
Make sure to buy express pass in order to avoid waiting . It is really amazing

Awesome rides.. Must try Transformers, Shrek, Mummy, Galatica rides.. Ok one tip for everyone - After entering just go straight to Far Far Away - Puss n Boots then complete shrek n enchanted. Then go for jurrasic world, Mummy and then move to transformers.. By this you can save waiting time and no need for express pass. Couple of activities also there like water world n others.

2.review_text: Premium prices without the premium experience. If you are a foreigner much better to go to a theme park in any other country. Far better rides. Express ticket is more useful. For some reason express ticket was not valid on 2 rides... Unsurprisingly both with a long que

3.review_text: Always enjoyed the rides and also the whole atmosphere in USS! Did not realise some changes until I am here. 1. From 1 June 2024, No re-entry after you exit. Usually when we visit USS, it is also a staycation in RWS, and so we will usually exit during lunch time, maybe go back to the room to rest and escape from the afternoon sun and come back again after 3pm. No re-entry means lunch was inside USS. As it is the school holidays, the place is quite crowded and due to the rain, everyone was indoors. As a gauge, a burger and fries set is 17 and a corn dog is 7, and a scope of ice cream is 7. 2. Universal express pass is limited. If you do not wish to wait in queue for rides (as a gauge, Rapid dash was 50 mins queue, transformer ride was 60 mins and Puss-in-boots ride was 40 mins wait), the express pass is an option. It cost about 90 for a person, but from the beginning of the year, they no longer offer unlimited express pass. The express pass can only be used once at every attraction. For example if you are not intending to use the pass for the enchanted airways ride, it cannot be used for a 2nd express ride for transformer ride. With minion land still under construction, Dino soarin also not available, there were less rides available, we were hoping that we can do a few more rounds with other rides. The forum area at RWS is under renovation and many food options closed due to new development in RWS, perhaps it will be better to come again when all the development is done.

4.review_text: Went with 3.5 year old baby.. had great time.. waiting time for maximum rides were around 5 mins fortunately.. me n my husband did rides in turns in which our kid was not allowed.. we covered 10 rides, saw few shows and some meet n greet.. express pass was not necessary for us.. download uss app which will guide regarding wait time of rides..

Fun places but not sure if it really worth it. Very small compared to other Universal in Japan, or Orlando. Other than that, please get express pass. No need to wait. Was able to do all the rides in the park in less than 3 hours.

We brought the ticket online. However, the On spot ticket was cheaper than the online one. Overall, it was a good experience for a person who has never done it before but may be less entertaining for those who have already been to others. Eat well before you enter because food inside is expensive Some of the activities might make you wet so prepare for it. Don't forget to download the Universal Studio app that made us able to beat the crowd, and we were able to attend entire events without missing any of them.
Line up to loong

5.review_text: Buy a fast track if a tourist. Very handy

Miss coming here again. Have come here more than 5 times but the last year was in 2017/18. Hope to be able to go to USS Singapore next year *Better going on weekdays, but if weekend get the express pass to play all the games
Best place for weekend. Please buy express tickets. Quite expensive but we can skip long queues.

The park opens at 10am but they allow entry even around 9:00am. It's good to be there before 10am and go straight to the rides so that you can avoid the long queues. There's no need for an Express Pass if you do this. I got my ticket from Klook in advance
Great place, Guaranteed adventurous and fun filled experience one will have. Buy express tickets to avoid long queues and wait time

1.review_text: Expensive. Little thing to play Supper long queue

3.review_text: Not so bad but Not so good. You could finish playing all the facilities within 3 hours. Cant really compare with Japan Universal Studios. No need to buy fast pass!!! (You wont need it!!! Trust me)

4.review_text: Highly recommended buying express pass in advance
Go on a weekday to avoid long waiting queues, buy express pass to save on waiting time. Rides were great but this will be outdated with time. Overall good place.

Visiting on weekdays and off-peak seasons basically means you don't need an express pass at all, especially if you travel alone, so save that money for something else in Sentosa. If you are visiting with kids i.e. extra time spent here and there, this would take one whole day, otherwise your trip should only take half day to complete. IP lineup is weak and facilities are pretty worn down. I visited on a rainy day which is common in SG, there were several rides temporarily closed due to the rain and one of them even stopped when there was riders on it. YMMV but if you are visiting Asia for Universial Studios, USJ in Osaka is a much better choice. Stuff are friendly and all of them can speak English fluently.
Buy vip, if not the line will be forever, ive waited 7 hours for 2 rides so please book vip

Bought ticket online for the Halloween night. Reach there around 7 plus pm.... Went in without a hitch.. Just a routine security check on the bag and that's it. The que for individual attractions (Halloween) takes quite awhile to get in, about on average 45 mins to 1 hr. Those popular ones will need longer time. So if u have spare money... Get the tickets with express lane.... No need to wait too long or immediately straight access.... The mummy ride is good.. Haven try other rides yet.... Next time.... I ll be there....

5.review_text: One of the best and must visit place in Singapore. Better to buy express pass for fast check in.

For those who want to come from Malaysia with their own car, these are tips for you. Apply vep and autopass. Can do two weeks before you enter. Cost 10 sgd. After getting a confirmation email. Can be picked up at two locations provided. We spent the night around danga bay the day before we entered singapore and the uss. Topap auto pass is ready. Myica filling is ready. Individually or in groups. Topap autopass using the Nets application. 50sgd is enough. When it arrives at uss. He parked in the B1 East area. Find one close to the escalator to get to uss. It's easier. For those with small children. Bring a stroller. The parking rate at uss is max at 13.10 sgd only. Boiled water standby. Umbrellas and fans. Payment close in uss easily using paywave/debit card. Activate is ready from Malaysia. So much.
If u r visiting , do buy express pass. U ll be able to do all rides otherwise forget it. Wait time is too long

It was worth the day trip, and you could go to enjoy the sentosa island afterwards. Watch out for the pricing since it is really expensive everywhere. P.s. buy the express pass included to save your time and having most of the experience
Excellent Experience. Good to visit at Universal studio. Recommend to take express ride pass to avoid any waiting for long que... Good Luck and Kind Regards Parminder singh

3.review_text: USS need some upgrades or maintenance..

4.review_text: Fun day for both the adults and kids in our group, age 6 to 70. Weekday didnt feel busy or crowded but still many rides with 30 to 45 minutes wait. While getting the express pass doubles the cost of entry, it is so worth it. With the express pass never waited more than a few minutes for any ride. Disappointed that there are several rides without an express line. Heavy storm came for an hour around 2pm, after 4pm most rides had only short wait without the pass. Plenty of food options spread around the park, also restrooms also close by wherever you are. Allow a whole day to explore, have fun and have second rides on your favourites. Plenty of automated machines to purchase tickets on the day.
FYI Singapore Tourist Pass cannot be used for monorail. Instead, you can pay using contactless payment methods such as Mastercard or Visa which are accepted for rides on the monorail.

5.review_text: I visited Singapore specifically to visit Universal Studios. I spent a whole day there and tried everything there. Do not miss the Waterworld offer, it is very beautiful. My advice is do not buy the express unless you enter and see the situation and make sure that it is crowded. Personally, I was satisfied with the ticket to enter without the express.

I visited Universal Studios Singapore on a Tuesday, and while the wait times for attractions ranged from 5 to 20 minutes, Im really glad I purchased the express pass tickets. With the scorching heat in SG, I wouldnt have wanted to stand in line for even 5 minutes. The express pass made the experience much more enjoyable, allowing me to skip the lines and make the most of my time at the park. There was intermittent thunder throughout the afternoon, and the outdoor rides were temporarily closed. However, they reopened as soon as the weather improved, so it didnt disrupt the experience for long

had an amazing day at Universal Studios and were there from open to close. We did initially get some incorrect Information from two workers who had us line up in the general admission line before opening despite having the premium express passes. We did realise these ourselves and correct it after a while though. The park wasnt that busy to start with and we were beginning to think the express passes werent worth it but by the end of the day when our kids were hopping off one ride and getting back on within a minute or two it was definitely worth it. The transformers ride was a favourite of ours and my children loved the Water World show. I didnt eat there besides and ice-cream for the kids but food wasnt too expensive.
Must see place in Singapore Priority pass will be helpful to go for rides without waiting time

Excellent must visit place in Singapore. Pros: Transformers ride is a must do. Rollercoaster rides are also very good. Jurassic Park water ride is a very good. Dampeners: Wait times for other activities can get long. Express pass is expensive. Photo service is not worth 50 SGD charge, unless you make the most of it.

1.review_text: Just money making business .they buy tkts from us and make us stand in queue .then get extra money as Express n send all of them while this queue increases continously .we bought tkts in advance

3.review_text: PROS: BUY EXPRESS PASS IN advance. It is worth it especially since you need few minutes for each ride. this is during new year eve. CONS: Would suggest for more security staff to be placed during 9pm fireworks show. It was unfortunate that we were faced with unruly guests who cut queues and wanted to pick fights over a fireworks show even when we were minding our own business. we were called derogatory names when we didn't fight back and decided to call for help. We had to report him to guest services for our own safety. Thankfully the guest services were helpful.

4.review_text: Long queue, express pass is a must. Most of the ride too thrills for me. I didn't noticed any warning in mummy ride express lane, nearly fainted after finish
Highly recommend the express pass!! The food overall was pretty bad and VERY expensive - we had lunch and dinner there, and do *not* recommend the lobster laksa or the v expensive hot dogs.

Solid experience. Great for something to do in Singapore. Definitely buy express pass! You do not want to wait 1.5 hrs per ride. Important side note: Careful of the limo taxi sharks waiting to charge you a set fee that is 5 times the normal rates to take you to a local spot due to long waiting times at the taxi rank. This should be investigated by Singaporean local government. They are praying on desperate tourists.
Best to visit on Weekdays. I highly suggest to buy the Express pass. Overall fun and entertaining. It'll be more fun to visit on non-holiday seasons
Good place but too much time to get the chance , shows were good but don't get without vip pass else you will lose good time 3 Rides were best for adult Good place

5.review_text: One of the best experience in my life. I recommend to buy express Pass during season time, otherwise it us not required.

If you go on a weekday, there seems to be almost no wait even if you don't buy express. We regretted buying it...all the lines were less than 10 minutes...it doesn't get crowded like in Osaka and there's no need to do an open run! (I'm not sure about weekends...) If you're going to buy the express, come and look carefully before buying it haha.

Must watch when you are in Singapore. Take the express pass which will save you lots of time and only since I took express pass, I was able to complete all the rides. The best ones were Transformers, revenge of the mummy, Shrek 4d adventure, roller coasters (senior citizens are not recommended for the roller coasters), Jurassic park , Lights Camera action etc. Also watch the water world show which is really awesome. The show happens twice a day. We chose the 5 pm . Also take the first 5 rows if want to get wet.

Who doesnt love universal studios helpful staff , everyone looked happy here Suggestions, including level of thrill , enjoy : 1. Level of Thrill out of 5 Sesame Street Spaghetti Chase : 1 Special effects show by Spielberg 2 Transformer : 5 Battlestar Galactica 5 Revenge of the mummy 5 (special themed ride for Singapore, locker available next to the ride) Jurassic Park ride : 4 & wet warning , dry machine available at the exit Dinosaur ride : 2 Water world show (performance): 2good show, front seats will get wet as part of the show Puss in boots : 4 Shrek 4D movie : 2 Donkey club (interactive, fun for kids) 1 (Reminder this is level of thrill, I love all activities) 2. Highly recommend to go with the express pass, thank me later for saving your time and no queueing under the Sun with the express pass, was able to go through majority activities 3. Download Universal Studio app to get map and latest update/ waiting time for each activity. 4. Look for a board for performance show time and plan accordingly to not miss them 5. Foodcourt outside Jurassic Park has really good food options ! 6. No waiting time for park entry, queue is needed for activities . Street performance was fun and gave good vibes. I can see a minion theme park is work in progress so def would love to come back for more
Wait time for rides could vary from 30 mins to 90 mins. Recommended to buy the express pass. This would give you express entry to each ride once

3.review_text: I would highly recommend express pass if your visit is on a public holiday as the waiting can be hopelessly long! Also for the restaurants, you should expect waiting not only for ordering food but also seating! The rides are great and maintenance is excellent too!

Queue times are good and park staff are friendly but compared to like 5 years ago, I am disappointed by the fact that the privilege of unlimited express pass have been changed to like I can use the fast pass on any ride for only one time so like example wise: if I want to ride attraction A for 10 times, the express pass only works once for attraction A unlike 5 years ago. Then, they removed some ride features; I remembered the Elmo spaghetti chase ride has like built in laser guns for you to shoot the puppets while on a slow ride but recently, they removed the guns so now it is just a slow rollercoaster with Elmo talking only .

The park is mediocre at most. We went during the holiday season and did not have an Express pass. I highly recommend getting an express pass despite the high price point if you want to enjoy all rides in 1 day.

4.review_text: Nice. It was expensive but nice. The queues are a long wait. So it's worth buying express tickets

The park is good and offers some attractions. We felt the Express Pass was necessary. This shortens the waiting time from sometimes 60 minutes to 2-3 minutes. However, the pass is only valid for one ride per attraction, which was perfect for us. The Waterworld Show is very action-packed and worth it.

A great day in the park, but get an express pass if you want to have time to do everything. The only downside is that if you have already visited the parks in the United States, don't expect to see as much merch as there and the same for drinks and food.
Try to use single rider ques

5.review_text: If you are good at guessing, you can ride a lot without the express. Transformers, Mummy, Human, Jurassic Boat, Water World, Shrek, etc. I rode a lot by looking at the waiting times for each ride on the app and moving accordingly. There are souvenirs in front of the exit, so you can look and buy them on your way out, but they are expensive.

Of all the places we went in Singapore during our 4 day visit to the city , Thes place was the best . It was a Weekday ( Dec 24 ) We did not opt for Express Pass , the waiting for normal ticket like 30 to 45 min for almost all the rides but post lunch the waiting time dropped to like 10 to 20 min and by 3 pm there was practically no wiating for even the best rides . If you want the best experiance please do take Express Pass otherwise if its week day i think plan to go late then you will be able to cover allmost all the good rides . Do not Miss 1) Cyclone 2) Mummy Returns

I had an amazing time here while on a layover. I booked the express pass while getting the tickets online and it helped a lot. I was able to do all the rides and then some within 5 hours at a leisurely pace.
Huge difference depending on whether express is present or not. This is my second visit, but express is a must.
Dreamland on earth. Buy express pass...worth it as u can see more and enjoy rides else u will waste time in que

1.review_text: There are two tickets, one for express to pass fast and one is normal, we bought the express ticket for 120 dollars and just before entering they told us that we must buy the normal one as well!! Is that even fair??? If someone bought the normal ticket he will stay in the normal path but if u took the express ticket u will be charged 120 80 dollars

3.review_text: A good day out- Avoid express pass scam. The park had a lot or themed areas and is in good shape for its age with enough food variety to choose from. The park puts a lot of focus on sesame Street, which i found very different, but in a good way. The park runs a wonderful scam called express pass. They really market the product well BUT out of the couple dozen rides at the park available to ride, the express pass provides redeamable express opportunity for approximately 6 or so rides and the price is disgustingly high. A little known fact is that universal singapore is the only universal franchise in the globe. The Singapore universal studios are owned by a private company called resorts world sentosa. This is reflected in the crazy bits and pieces you come across throughout your day - example:, no drink lids available for your drinks, no salt in the food outlets accessible to patrons, no paper copy express passes etc i could go on, however it just reflects and highlights the cost cutting going on, by the private company, at the expense of the customer experience. This in turn, has you worried about the maintenance that is occurring behind the scenes. To that end, as you go around the Jurassic park water ride you tend to see some broken dinosours that haven't been fixed or maybe haven't been noticed. In any case, this was another example of cost cutting at resorts world sentosa. Would I consider going with the family again......not anytime soon. With the exception of mi ions land, the rest of the park has been the same for almost 2 decades and is starting to feel it.
Buy a fast pass.

4.review_text: My advice, dont get the express pass. We didnt even have to use our express pass the entire time and we got on every ride. But if it does start to get busy then you can always buy the express passes once your in the park so its best to not buy it beforehand and just wait till lines get long then purchase if needed. The park overall was okay, we loved Shrek far far away land. And the waffle with ice cream scoop was so so good!! The only reason why the park didnt get 5 stars is because the water world show was canceled, the water tube ride had technical difficulties and closed and also the jeep ride we went on got stuck so we had to stop mid ride and be evacuated.

Good place to spend an entire day.. We saw many reviews that Express pass is needed, unfortunately we bought them (it's applicable only once for each ride) and found them to be not so bang for the buck !!! (Get it if you are on tight timeline and want to finish the USS in less than half a day with getting on rides only once. We could do Transformers ride 4 times, Revenge of the Mummy 2 times and many other rides throughout the day. (And we went there on a Saturday!!!) By early morning at 10 am and after 4 pm anyways waiting times are less than 20 minutes for most rides. (There are hardly many key rides there) IMO Express pass is not needed (not worth it), if you feel the need, you can still buy it inside the USS after entering the park. Book the tickets in advance from Klook or other platforms to get the good discounted rates.

Exhibits are getting old, we came just before the minion section release so might be different after Feb. Pretty expensive and 20-40 minutes wait for all the kids rides but not enough rides available for little kids to want to upgrade to the express tickets. Definitely worth upgrading if it was just me! Meet and greets with characters was well organised and easy to figure out. Would recommend downloading the app to plan your schedule before going if you want to see the shows etc. It was fun despite everything being the same as I last went 8 years ago haha.

Visited the highly anticipated Minion Land - therere a total of 3 new rides and a Minion-theme restaurant for highlights. My favourite would be the 4D ride although the enjoyment was a bit short. An entertaining hangout for families & friends!

Tickets are cheaper to buy from travel agencies than to buy them officially. Half a day is enough to play. The wait time is long in the morning, but the wait time is much shorter in the evening. You should definitely ride The Mummy!

5.review_text: Do take express pass on your visit. Without that you wont be able to experience the real fun. With normal ticket you will exhaust yourself standing in long ques for hour.
Very Pleasant experience. Be sure to purchase the express pass as the que can get quite long.

Been to Universal Studios countless times I didn't expect to encounter such a speechless thing today Of course, I arranged for a fast lane because I wanted to go quickly. But the female staff member kept letting people pass through the ordinary passage. They just dont let people in the express lane get on the bus. There are less than ten people in the express lane But we waited at least half an hour People in the regular lane have been on the bus for ten rounds, but she just wont let people in the fast lane get on the bus. Many people were pissed off What is the significance of fast track?

Was here a few weeks ago and did the VIP experience - 10/10 reccomend if it's in your budget. 25 off food and drink, express to the front of the lines and retail discounts! Big bonus on our tour guide Adam being so great - was a great experience.
Good for first timers. 3hrs wait for regular ticket holders and 1.5 for express. Pick an off day to cover everything. Else you will be bored soon

3.review_text: If you like waiting and queueing up then this is the place for you. Arrived when gates open at 10 so 30 minutes to get in. Walk to first ride 30 minutes wait. Second, third and fourth rides 40 to 50 minutes each. Last ride over and hour. Yes you can pay extra to get in early and yes you can pay extra for an express pass. Or you can save your money for a trip to universal America. You will still wait for rides but as there are more rides you can pick and choose with more options. Oh and Waterworld section was closed.

4.review_text: The park is filled with awesome rides so dont forget to visit Universal Studios in Singapore. I just want to say if you can afford please purchase express pass so that all the rides can be covered in time.

If you go on a weekday, you don't need fast track. I visited on February 27th. I think I got in around 9:50 after reserving tickets in advance for direct entry. After entering, go straight to the Transformer and board within 1-2 minutes. Afterwards, cyclon human Jurassic Park... . Since it's around 2pm, most people use it once more with almost no wait. Fun Transformers, Cyclones, etc. And before riding Jurassic Park, prepare a raincoat in case you get wet, but there is no need for that. Even if it's wet, it's only slightly wet, so just ride it. Maybe that's why you have to pay 4 per hour to use the locker here, but you can just bring it and use it. It's an expensive bag, so if you don't want it to get wet, you can put it in a supermarket plastic bag. For reference, it is very helpful to prepare a towel when leaving the hotel. And Jurassic Park isn't that great. Cyclon and Transformers are the most fun. I also recommend Shrek.

If you visit on a weekday, I don't think you need an express ticket. This is because the waiting time is not very long. Also, the number of attractions is not large, so if you go early in the morning, there will be less trouble around 2-3 PM.
You have to wait at least 30 minutes and an hour to get on one device. I recommend just buying express.
Superb! Enjoyed so much here and it's worth it! and it will cost atleast 1 day here to enjoy all rides.

5.review_text: Had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore, but if youre visiting on a weekend, I highly recommend getting the Express Pass to skip long queues. We went on a Friday, and while some rides had 30-minute or less waits, others exceeded 40 minutes, which made us skip a few.

Great place with kids and adult , take express pass specially on weekends or if you meet big corporate group Just an FYI after 5pm pass is not available but lines and quite less almost feel like with express pass you are enjoyiong all the rides Best one is roller coaster, mummy & transformer and jurassik park if can get wet Lockers are available on free rent for limited time
TRIED THE EXPRESS PASS! THE BEST!

Dont buy tickets on KKDAY. Its terrible. Just buy it on the spot. Theres not much difference in price. Admission is guaranteed. I like the Mummy Tour. Its super exciting. I regret not doing it again. You can play it a few more times with the little soldiers. The new facility, Shrek 4D Theater, is also good. Its very cute. The Czech Pea one looks very fun. Its a pity that I didnt go there. There are water dispensers everywhere, you can bring a small water bottle or just drink it by mouth. Its very hot and you need to drink more water. But Universals toilet cleaning is not good. Sometimes the floor is wet and dirty.

Our VIP tour at Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience, and that was all thanks to our guide, Angela. She had such a warm and encouraging presence that made a huge difference for me. Im not usually one for thrill rides, but she helped me feel at ease so I could enjoy them alongside my husband. She was attentive, thoughtful, and always one step ahead in making sure everything went smoothly! Even keeping an eye on our things while we had fun. The level of care and service she provided was beyond what we ever expected. If youre considering the VIP tour, I highly recommend it, especially if you get Angela!

1.review_text: I like Minions, so I probably wouldn't have gone if it weren't for Minion Land. Compared to the expensive tickets, the attractions are old and there are not many rides. What has changed since I came 9 years ago is that Minion Land has opened... Express is great!! Waste of money The Human and Cyclone that are worth riding have to be left in a locker because you can't have any luggage. It's free for 45 minutes, but if even 1 minute passes, you'll be charged 4. I paid the money after 4 minutes... ha... The safety device was covered in soggy sweat that I almost vomited. We stayed for 6 hours taking pictures and buying goods, but we completed all the rides in 2 hours

Fast past is a waste of money "Firdaus" at despicable me ride treated us very unfairly although we purchased fast past , he let the normal que first for 3 shows and only let us enter once we made a noise!

3.review_text: I purchased two VIP tour tickets for Universal Studios with no real idea of what was to be involved. On arrival my girlfriend and I tried to enter the main entrance but were directed to a 'VIP' lounge which was a pleasant surprise. Unfortunately my delight abruptly dissolved when we walked into the 'VIP lounge' as it resembled a kindergarten with screaming kids and stressed-looking parents everywhere. We were greeted by staff who looked like they were forcing a smile upon their faces and given a cold drink. I then had a 'terms and conditions' document thrust in front of me to sign, as the staff member used her finger to highlight and verbally describe that it was not a private tour and that we would be with 12 other people with no mention of children. As I looked around the chaotic child-filled room I instantly realised that I'd been had. I calmly pointed out that I did not spend over GBP500 to spend the day with screaming children and that their literature had not indicated such information. I then spent the next 15 minutes speaking to three different members of staff whose seniority went up when the last one failed to appease me. I ended up speaking to a female manager of some sort who essentially accused me of discriminating against children. For a manager or supervisor overseeing a VIP team I was quite shocked to hear the word 'discriminate' in the context of our conversation. It is a very provocative word and to use in these circumstances showed extremely poor judgement and an attitude which suggested that I had somehow committed an offence for expecting a VIP tour to be with adults. Clearly there is an ongoing issue with what the Universal Studios literature and advertising suggests in order to raise your expectations of how the tour will be conducted because if there was not, why are the staff at pains to only point out that you will be with 12 other 'participants' on the VIP tour but not highlight anything else? I think if Universal Studios (US) uses clear advertising to suggest that US is for adults as well as children, which it does, I think it is perfectly reasonable to make it clear that when you take a VIP tour, you are very likely to spend the day with up to 10 children and parents. However according to the VIP Team supervisor, this would be discrimination! I think perhaps Universal Studios should give their staff more training on communication skills and using non-provocative language if in fact the individual knows the true meaning of the word in the first place. After this distasteful experience, our VIP Tour guide for the day was absolutely fabulous and really knew how to salvage the day for us. In conclusion, I would not recommend the VIP tour unless you are happy to spend the day with children. Otherwise we had a good day.

express pack need to be take if you want make many attraction but too much attraction is not including in the express pack -transformer, ancient egypt , jurassic lost world funny -shrek 4d the presentation is too long and teach how to speak in the microphone don t put the microphone in the mouth but 15cm from mouth is better ( specially when you english accent is uncommun) -light camera action it s subtitle in chinese but not in english and the show duration 4 min not very interesting -sesame street for the child until 5 -minion part is open but the express pack is not available. -408 2 express pack and 3 adults but you can t do everything -90sg for 6 tenders 4 fries and 4 cola very expensive(chicken taste hasardous) -in the drive in restaurant, only 2 cashiers ice cream caramel oreo 9 and when you receive it's half quantity than the picture, it s a joke i spend 5 hours inside the park i have 70% of attraction
Too hot Definitely have to buy express pass prior entry, its the only way to avoid dissappointment

Price & waiting time is not worth it. It's an extra 100 on top of ticket pricing for the express Q. Even then, there is a wait. Some kids rides only have 1 staff at the ride. So it takes even longer to prep the ride. The app is useful. But don't rely on the wait timing for the app. It is not already accurate. Give n take 30mins... Minion land is awesomely done
Forget off-peak, there is no such thing like off-peak in this place. Express ticket add on is a must buy if you want to stand a chance to do all 8 noteworthy attractions in the park in a day.

4.review_text: My personal experience is coming here with my family. Buy tickets in advance on the Klook app. And buy a regular ticket, not an express one, because not all rides are available. My advice is that if you have entered, take the last ride first (rapid adventure) then you can move to other rides, such as transformer, cyclon rain, mummy, etc. Halal food is also available. Prayer rooms & toilets are also available.

They need to make it possible to buy express tickets AFTER buying the entrance tickets .Get the univ studio app to check on waiting time for rides, queue for popular rides can be very very long (60-70 min on weekdays), buy the express pass if you can afford it, can get dinner at the forum opposite the studios. Buy your gifts and merc in the universal studio shop after the entrance, has all the goods from the smaller shops spread through the park
Most rides are good, some needs upgradation.

After playing in the water at Sentosa Island beach, I went over and enjoyed it. Honestly, I don't feel like there are a lot of things to ride. The line moves quickly, so you don't need to buy a pass to get on board quickly.
It's recommended to buy an express pass, else only half the rides can be accessed.

5.review_text: What a fun day! Our family loved every minute of our day at Universal Studios Singapore. We went on every ride and show and met almost every character. We highly recommend the express passes - theyre expensive but theyre worth it to improve the overall experience of the visit so you dont spend all day standing in a queue. The passes also allowed us to take advantage of better seats for the shows.

Go for VIP if you are looking to cover all the rides, photos with favorite characters, without a queue. You may want to purchase VIP or express a few days in advance. Sadly, we tried 3-4 days ago and couldn't get it. Now, it's not the end of the world if you go without those special passes. Choose the top 4-5 rides, you definitely want to try. You can easily cover at least 3 within the first hour (i.e. 10-11 am). Just don't stop anywhere for a photo/washrooms/anything else. You will get enough time later. We managed to cover Battlestar human (found less thrilling), Mummy (must do, we did it 2 times) and transformers (next best to Mummy) by 11. We managed to do the Battlestar cylon (which was also ok type) without much wait later in the day as soon as it restarted after a technical glitch. Look for such opportunities. I saw other comments about locker charges. There are charges, but do note that first 45 min Or so (each time you rent, you will see on the display), it is free of cost. So don't worry too much about it if you can manage within that time window. I think I saw comments about the drinking water issue as well. It's not the case. There are drinking water facilities near the washrooms throughout the park. It is also available in the queue of some of the rides, like transformers. You don't have to purchase it by paying huge money. The food may not be very costly. We ate at a pizza place. A full pizza, cold drink, a desert cost 60-65 which was more than enough for the three of us. 20 on an average is not a bad deal. Right? Lastly, not every ride is worth it, so plan before you enter the park. Shrek, accelerator were among the ones we regretted going. The Spielberg one also took time, it was ok. You may skip it if short on time. Looking back, I am glad we missed purchasing express/VIP pass, it probably wasn't worth as we weren't that interested for picture with characters plus covered the main rides.
The best part is they allow you to carry your food with you. Better to buy express pass.

The only Universal Studios in Asia. Similar if not the same rides they have in Orlando but less. Highly recommend the express pass if you're planning on trying all the rides and dont want to wait on 1 hour queue line. One day is enough to do everything. Food is average as expected with moderate price, a little bit of everything for most people. You can request to get a stamp to return on the same day if you want to eat outside of the theme park.

A place worth visiting and considered better than Disneyland (Hong Kong) All thanks and appreciation to Captain/Adam, the VIP services attendant. He was extremely courteous and professional. I highly recommend him. It is recommended to purchase a VIP ticket in advance to avoid crowding

1.review_text: Buy express ticket but most of the express lane are not available... And also lots of technical issue closed... What a waste of money and time...

2.review_text: On holiday,I recommend buying an express ticket( queue skip ticket). If you are richer, you will have more fun.

3.review_text: mastercard exclusive gift: free stickers. wow.
It's a bit small, so you don't need to buy Express Pass (because it's very expensive and some facilities can't be used)

4.review_text: There are three types of Express Passes: 1. Express Pass One-time access to each ride (excludes Minion Land) 2. Express Plus Pass One-time access to each ride including Minion Land 3. VIP Experience Unlimited access, VIP line, and a guided tour (approx. 4x the cost of a regular ticket) Express Passes can cost up to SGD 1,000 more than standard tickets on peak daysbut help skip hours of waiting in queues Highly recommended to buy an Express Pass on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays due to heavy crowds and long wait times Ticket prices are also higher on weekends and public holidaysplan accordingly Accessibility support available: Manual wheelchair: SGD 20 deposit, fully refundable Electric wheelchair: SGD 50 deposit, SGD 5 usage fee (SGD 45 refunded) Many are unaware of this servicevery helpful for elderly or those with mobility issues

Take note if you want to make the most of your visit to Universal Studios Singapore: Go on a weekday, not during weekends or school/public holidays. Its way less crowded and much more enjoyable. Arrive when the park opens. We went on a weekday during a non-peak season , early in the day, wait times were about 1530 minutes, but later in the afternoon, most rides were only 5 minutes. We got to enjoy everything and even did some rides more than once! Avoid peak periods if possible. During busy times, youll end up waiting in long lines under the heat and humidity. Ticket prices for adults start from SGD 62 (depending on the website and promotions). Check the official Resorts World Sentosa website for the most accurate price. Express Pass info: Universal Express: Starts from SGD 90 per person. Lets you skip the queue once per ride. Universal Express Plus: Starts from SGD 120 per person. Lets you skip the queue as many times as you want on each ride. (Both are only valid on the day of your visit) My advice: If youre going on a weekday and outside of peak season, you probably dont need the Express Pass, the lines are short enough, and youll save money!
There are two roller coaster styles that didn't exist in LA. It's good. And don't save your money and get the express. I can really feel the taste of capitalism.
Oasis spice cafe have good vegetarian options Loved the bhalla chaat and the mango lassi Reasonably priced

5.review_text: Universal Studios in Singapore is recommended for those who don't want to queue to buy tickets. The Express Pass is a bit expensive but it's worth it.

Went mid week got express pass , the wait time without it was 40-50 minutes per ride so I think worth it , also got it discounted since purchased early online . The rides are fun the food is great and plenty of nice souvenirs around , overall a very fun. Super clean and organized with awesome rides
Wonderful experiance, would suggest to take express entry if u wish to enjoy all rides without waiting, only if there is rush. U can add after entering in park also, they have counter

as an avid fan of thriller ride, i definitely enjoy my time here at USS. The ticket price is even cheaper than Legoland :( I not managed to play everything here but we finished all of the rollercoaster in USS and that's what make the trips much better. we also watched the Shrek 4D and it was very entertaining. The downside is, i still think we need to purchase the express pass if you're kinda want to finish everything inside the park in one day as the queue of people duirng the time we went is extremely crazy and overwhelming.
Need try all game and recommend buy express

An eventful place for people of all ages. Universal Studio is place for fun-loving & adventurous people. It offers many amazing rides including thrilling rollercoaster. A must visit place if you are in Singapore.
Fun, fun and absolute fun. It takes a day or two to complete all the rides in Universal Studios, Singapore. You'll find your inner child in you once you start exploring it inside.
Fun place! Recommended rides but they are extreme, Galactica (Human and Cyclon) and Transformers!
No word to describe the place . Must watch rides are:- The mummy Light action camera Jurassic park
Best adventure park i have ever visited in my life. Must checkout the transformer and the mummy ride.

4.review_text: There are no extreme attractions, except for one roller coaster, which I wouldn't say is very "scary". It is intended for small children. Grab a ticket that gives you direct access to the attractions so you don't spend the day waiting in lines.

They even tell the instructions with 2 language (English and Chinese) and wrote some with Malay too. If you're the adrenaline's junkie, they got some attractions that you will definitely need to try. As for foods, they provide various menus. Snacks also available on every corner with okay prices. Atm lockers, baby strollers, souvenirs shops and toilets also available everywhere. Just make sure to come early so you can try all attractions and if you hate waiting just buy the express pass.

4.review_text: Well,what am I supposed to say about this place?We all know this place is one where dreams come true,not only for kids but for adults too.It consists of 6 themes each with amazing and exciting rides for both children and adults.The two breath-taking roller coasters at the sci-fi theme are a MUST ride for all visitors seeking an adrenaline rush.However if you have any medical complications,it's better if you avoid these.However I am giving them a 4 star rating due to the vast distance which you have to walk to explore everything which is very tiring and I believe they should arrange train rides so visitors can explore the place much more comfortably.Anyways Universal Studios is again one of the must visit places one should have on their to-visit list when in Singapore.

Actors and actresses are extremely good.. Set is mesmerizing.. One can connect to Free WI-FI in sentosa.. Carry a water bottle is a must.. It is humid and one needs water all around..

The multiple shows at different set of times gives you much more pleasure. The only thing that bothered me was the waiting line, both in rides and shows. However, a couple of rides had a separate line for single individuals like me. These people accomodate you you if a single seat is available in the ride and you get to enjoy the much much quickly. Although the photographs are chargable in the shows, you can quickly take a selfie (if you are quick enough) and avoid spendling money on photographs and standing in lomg queues.

Arrived around noon, brought the family, but found it raining. So I played a little bit at a time. The player is good. Go play Madakaka Just wait in line for a moment and then you can play. Next, we went into the Egyptian zone and waited for a very long time, over an hour. It was a roller coaster ride that ran in the dark. It was very exciting. There was going forward and down, turning curves, and going backwards, so thrilling that we screamed a lot. Some people may not be too thrilled. I took my mother to play and she felt fine. She didn't cry at all. Later, she came to play in the Transformers zone. It's a 3D player. That sways along with the story. It's very exciting. I took my mother to play this one too. It's very fun. Come and play in the Jurassic zone. The queue was long enough. This one is wet. Prepare a raincoat. So it's not very wet. Excited again I got to play around 7:00 p.m. My time here was fine. It was enough to use and it was worth the card. But unfortunately, when it rains and is dry, we can't go anywhere for more than an hour. Otherwise, I might be able to collect more than this.

5.review_text: The rides are not for the faint of heart!

Very suitable for people who like to test their adrenaline! There are lots of Roller Coaster rides there, both indoor and outdoor with various levels of height, speed and track length that are a shame to miss... Apart from that, there is also a 3D museum, an aquarium with various types of sea animals, places to eat, places to buy souvenirs, cafes, and several other games, as well as interesting photo spots for those of you who want selfies or wefies with friends and family. you guys.. Don't worry about your belongings while playing there, because there are several paid storage places in the form of self-service lockers provided, but they have a time limit, so when the time is up, the locker key will automatically open by itself, but you can still extend it by Pay again at the machine, or move to another locker closest to the game you want to try next! Don't forget to provide small money to pay at the locker machine! It's best if you want to visit and try all the rides there, you have to come from the moment they open and spend your time there all day until they close again, because to try just one ride, you still have to queue long according to the time and moment you are at. come there, unless you buy a USS express ticket, you still have to queue, but not as long as the regular queue... For food, it's a good idea to bring your own from outside!! Because there are many food places there that provide food that doesn't suit our taste buds and the prices are quite expensive!!! But again, it depends on individual tastes...Hehe And one more thing, if you are interested in trying all the rides there, it would be better if you bought tickets outside the area or at the travel agent where you come from, because of course, the price will be much cheaper...

5.review_text: Please don't leave Singapore without visiting Universal Studios! It's a huge place with rides that give you extreme adrenaline rushes. (Please don't go for them if you can't handle it .. the rides are safe but might not be enjoyable for everyone) Rides: 1. BattleStar Galactica (human,cylon): This is c.r.a.z.y. Youll get flipped in every possible direction and won't be able to figure out which is sky and which is ground. At some points you'll feel like you're gonna hurtle into the crowd below but be assured that the ride was pretty safe when we were on it. They'll just strap you on and you'll think that you'll get a couple of seconds to prepare yourself but no .. :D you'll start screaming three seconds into the ride and get out of your seats at the end with jelly legs. There are two variations, try the white roller coaster (cylon) if you want a scarier ride. 2. Transformers 3D ride: This concept is so cool. For anyone who is a Transformers fan, this is a treat. Not very scary, but it's like being in visual reality. I really recommend this one, and it's not scary at all. Really enjoyable, rather, in fact I wanted to go twice. 3. Jurassic Park rapids: Low key water ride. No adrenaline rushes, you can just chill and float the whole way in a tube car. 4. Revenge of the Mummy: It's in the Ancient Egypt theme park and not as crazy as the Battlestar Galactica but nevertheless good. There's a steep drop at the end which makes it enjoyable. Other attractions include a BumbleBee danceoff (which is really cute), the Water World show at Jurassic Park The Lost World (interactive - they will get the audience wet so front row viewers beware :D), a few other rides for kids at Far Far Away and Madagascar.
Awesome place for those who love rides. Mummy ride is surprisingly scarier than big roller coaster. But loved it.

5.review_text: Southeast Asia's first Hollywood movie-themed theme park, Universal Studios Singapore, boasts an exciting selection of attractions, rides and entertainment for families and thrill seekers. A total of 18 of the 24 film-themed rides were designed specifically for the Singapore park. There are seven zones themed around favorite films, each uniquely designed. You will find the famous Hollywood Walk of Fame in the Hollywood zone. As you walk the streets of New York, the landscape around you will be a stunning city skyscraper, complete with a mock subway station entrance. Here, you can step onto a film set and experience the destructive power of a hurricane with special effects produced by Steven Spielberg. Rides that make the heart beat Sci-Fi City boasts the famous TRANSFORMERS ride: On the Ultimate 3D Battle ride, you can battle the forces of evil with heart-pounding 3D battles. Step into Ancient Egypt and face mummies and scarab beetles on an indoor roller coaster in total darknessall guaranteed to trigger your fears. And, in Madagascar, get ready to get wet on the boat rides. Fun water rides The performances at Universal Studios Singapore are no less impressive. Children will have fun with Shrek 4-D Adventure at Far Far Away, a cinematic experience that brings visitors to experience firsthand the excitement of the film. Set in the Lost World zone, The Waterworld staginginspired by the blockbuster filmis packed with death-defying action and thrilling explosions. Once you're tired of having fun, recharge your batteries between attractions and visit the restaurants across the park. If you're visiting on a Friday, Saturday or certain national holidays, you'll be able to join in the park's excitement after dark with Universal After Hours, a series of fun-filled nighttime activities that last until 10 p.m. Dance to the rhythm of the Rhythm Truck, enjoy an array of street snacks, and be amazed by the stars of the Hollywood Dreams Light Up Parade.

4.review_text: Universal Studios Singapore is comparatively smaller than most of the others located across the world but don't let it fool you! The park boasts a number of distinct zones from some of their most popular franchises and offer some really great experiences even just walking around. If you're an adrenaline junkie, you might be slightly disappointed by the number of rides catering more towards kids and families but these are still genuinely fun experiences. The highlight is definitely the twin looping coasters based on the Battlestar Galactica franchise with its high-speed launches and turns, this is one ride you'll definitely want to try at least once. Be prepared to queue for up to 2 hours during peak periods of the year unless you're willing to fork out the unlimited express pass (90) which will get you to the rides in as fast a third of the time.

5.review_text: First, as a Thai person who doesn't like to wait in long lines. I recommend purchasing an Express ticket, as it helps a lot. If you don't purchase an Express ticket, you may have to wait in line for 2-3 hours on some rides. If you're only going to be able to ride a few stations, boredom will replace the fun. And that day will be the day you are not impressed. The most impressive player Egypt looks like a museum at first glance. But once you enter, it becomes an extremely thrilling roller coaster. Adding to the fear of darkness It's a plaything that isn't child friendly at all. Please prepare yourself for the thrill and fear first. Transformers the ride is a simulator that projects 3D images as if we were actually in the vehicle. It is very fun and realistic. Human vs. Cylon, this one is the most brutal, a rollercoaster. Human rides on a train, while Cylon hangs his legs and plays with his hands completely numb. The greatest thrill has to be these two. The three types above are my favorites, but there are many others that I'm also impressed by. But if you don't want to lose your temper and waste all day waiting in line. Don't forget to buy Express tickets before entering. Have a fun trip.
